room_title: Escape room "The Lost Antidote" by The Escape Little Rock in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dinner Party" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: Our group of cousins gets together every once in a while to have some fun. This was by far the most fun-filled day ever! There were six of us in the group and they recommended the Dinner Mystery room for us. It was so much fun that the time flew by. We can't wait to go back and try out another room. The owners are so personably and friendly. We can't say enough about them or the experience. We highly recommend for everyone to try this.

room_title: Escape room "Dinner Party" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: I went here the other day with some friends. We really had a blast. This is the nicest escape room I've ever been to. We did the Dinner Party room, had a little spooky touch. Even under pressure we really couldn't stop laughing. We had such a good time. The owner and staff are so down to earth, super welcoming, funny, and so nice. I'm already planning my next trip. Do yourself a favor and go, you won't regret it.

room_title: Escape room "Dinner Party" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: We had a blast! Celebrated a friend's birthday in the Dinner Party Room. It was so unique and well put together! I will definitely be back to try all! Staff was very helpful too!! Can't wait to see our group photo!

room_title: Escape room "Dinner Party" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: I have been wanting to try an escape room for some time now and when my friend asked if I wanted to do one, I jumped on it! I was super excited and also kind of nervous. We had 3 girls in our group and made it out with about 5 minutes to spare! We did the Dinner Party room and I thought it was very well put together. It was so much fun! The clues were unique and helpful. I definitely want to come back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Dinner Party" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: This was the most fun I've had in years!!! The interaction with the hosts was hilarious. I was super impressed with the decor in the rooms, you really felt transported to the scene. The puzzles were interesting and really got your brain cranking to the utmost degree. The clues were super helpful and we got out just in time. The Dinner Party was our room and we can't wait to try all the rooms. Perfect for pre-dinner, post dinner, birthdays, team building, friends or ANY occasion. Love love love this place!

room_title: Escape room "Last Will & Testament" by House of Hints in San Marcos (CA)
review: Best room so far.  You really feel as though you've walked into a lawyer's office.  Great puzzles, great clues and the room master always gave the perfect hint...and we escaped!

room_title: Escape room "Burlesque" by Escape Tactics in Fort Myers
review: We had a GREAT time tonight! First time going and it was awesome the burlesque room was fun. We will be coming back to do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Burlesque" by Escape Tactics in Fort Myers
review: Three of us went for our friend's birthday. It was all of our first escape room and it was absolutely amazing! I love the theme and that the employees dressed up, it was so awesome going back in time to a speakeasy. The ladies working were so nice and even though we didn't finish (soooo close!!) the ladies kept telling us how great we did and boosted us up that we didn't feel super bummed we didn't finish. Thank you!! We will definitely come back!

room_title: Escape room "Burlesque" by Escape Tactics in Fort Myers
review: Such a fun experience! Their rooms are so well decorated to make you really feel like you're in the 20's. Challenging but solvable!

room_title: Escape room "Burlesque" by Escape Tactics in Fort Myers
review: So much fun! A very in-depth story, we did the Burlesque showroom. Ms. M was a doll and really made things that much more exciting with her storytelling and hints! Definitely going back for the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Burlesque" by Escape Tactics in Fort Myers
review: Our group were the first people to try the burlesque room! It was awesome and one of the coolest experiences! If you love the burlesque era and like solving puzzles as a group under pressure then this is for you!! Marianna helped us through it and was seriously a doll!!! Definitely will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: This was our first experience at Breakout Games in Jacksonville. Our group of 4 did The Hostage room as part of a Christmas gift.  It was nice that the rooms are private and we could experience it on our own. The whole experience was much more immersive than I would have thought.  We will definitely be returning to try out other rooms. A shout out to Isabelle for her help from start to finish with our escape room experience.

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: We had a team building experience here with our bosses and had a blast. Half of our group did the hostage room where you go in blind folded and are handcuffed to a bench. I won't ruin the rest but that's the one I did and LOVED. Catilyn was our behind the scenes angel that watched us from another room and would would give us a clue if we were stuck but let us use our own brains and didn't give it away. SHE WAS GREAT! The other team did the island something. Sorry I forgot the name but they really enjoyed themselves as well and Daid Josh, their behind the scenes guy was really awesome. I can't believe how much I enjoyed it and can't wait to do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Just did the Hostage Room and it was so much fun! Would definitely recommend Breakout to anyone and everyone.

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Came here for a team building experience with my coworkers! Was definitely really fun! The hostage room is great! Can't wait to try the others!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Took my work family here for team building and we had a great time! The staff was amazing and the hostage room was so much fun! We'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "221B Baker Street" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Took my boyfriend for our anniversary and this was our first time doing an escape room. We chose the Sherlock Holmes theme. We were greeted by the manager, who was super cool. Overall our whole experience was so much fun. Definitely will be back and bringing along some friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "221B Baker Street" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Did the Sherlock room and it was amazing. Fun time trying to solve all the puzzles. Super tough room with fun twists throughout. This is my 3rd Escape the room and these puzzles were harder than the other 3. The staff was very friendly and patient with us. That's even with us coming at 10am in the morning.

room_title: Escape room "221B Baker Street" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Although we didn't solve the mystery of who had Sherlock and where he was, the four of us had a great time. We will definitely be back. It was so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "221B Baker Street" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Awesome bonding experience with my family. Had no idea what to expect but we worked well together and we beat it!

room_title: Escape room "221B Baker Street" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: My friends and I decided on a whim to do an escape room one night. When we called to book a room, the staff was very friendly & accommodating. The ambience & decor were great, and the puzzles were creative yet challenging. We did the 221B room and enjoyed the twist (solving a crime instead of actually escaping the room) I would highly recommend coming here!

room_title: Escape room "Bad Medicine" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: This was my first experience with an escape room. We attempted the Bad Medicine room. We only got about 60% through before the clock ran out. We had lots of fun trying to figure out all of the clues. This room is very challenging!

room_title: Escape room "Bad Medicine" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: Every time I come to Tucson, which is often, I do a room (or two!) at Ace of Escape, they are by far my favorite in Tucson. They have a wide variety of rooms, if you catch their Christmas room during the season, it's the best Christmas themed room out there. Very well thought out, not just another room with Christmas decorations. By far my favorite is Bad Medicine, super hard, but I love a challenge! They just opened a new two person room that I can't wait to check out - I've never done a room specifically made for two people. I have a feeling it's harder than it sounds.

room_title: Escape room "Bad Medicine" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: We had a lot of fun figuring out all of the puzzles and were ecstatic to have escaped the Bad Medicine room!! We can't wait to come back and escape again

room_title: Escape room "Bad Medicine" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: My friends and I decided to try the challenging "Bad Medicine" as our first time. We had so much fun and got so close that we booked "The Illusionist" right after going back to back. We managed to escape that room! We had a blast! Definitely will be back

room_title: Escape room "In a Galaxy Far Away" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: We did the Star Wars room and had a fantastic time. Thanks to Ralph for helping us with the clues. We will definitely come back to try the other rooms. I highly recommend coming here. Great Escape = Great Fun!

room_title: Escape room "In a Galaxy Far Away" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: We had fun In a Galaxy Far Away. We nearly escaped!

room_title: Escape room "In a Galaxy Far Away" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: Had a great time with the family today in the Star Wars room!

room_title: Escape room "In a Galaxy Far Away" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: We made it out with one minute to spare! Did the Galaxy Far Far Away room! Sherry our room monitor was awesome! Great place, clean, friendly staff! Can't wait to do the Zombie experience!!!! Thanks!

room_title: Escape room "In a Galaxy Far Away" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: We took my son and three of his friends today for his 8th birthday celebration and of course did the Star Wars room. Knowing how difficult the rooms can be, we warned the boys that we probably wouldn't solve the puzzle in time. But our game master Joey was amazing! They adjusted the room for the kids and he gave us an insane amount of clues anytime the boys asked or he could see we were stuck. We all know there is no way that we would have unlocked the door without all of his help. Needless to say, I have a very happy birthday boy who cannot wait to go back and try another room! Thank you Joey for an amazing adventure! We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Innocence" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: Had an amazing time last night tackling the Innocence room! Great challenge! The staff was super friendly, too! Will definitely be back to try their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Innocence" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: That was the best hour ever! We opted not to prove our innocence and escape as fugitives.

room_title: Escape room "Innocence" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: We did the Innocence room as part of our sisterhood retreat and it was fantastic!! It was so fun and well-thought out. The room was challenging but still solvable and we had a great time doing it! Even when we were waiting to go, the employees had us playing games that were hilarious and time flew by! So creative and would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Innocence" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: I've been here twice and both times it was a lot of fun! I did Innocence with one other person and Dorm Room Daze with a group and both times were great. I would recommend it to anyone! The rooms are very complex and we were all impressed with the amount of detail put into them. The owner/ employees were very nice as well!

room_title: Escape room "Innocence" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: We did the Innocence room as a date night activity, and we were blown away by how awesome this experience was! We have done about a dozen other escape rooms, and this one is one of the best if not the best we've ever done.The puzzles were challenging enough to flex your creative problem solving and logical thinking skills, without being overly difficult. They've really succeeded in creating a fun atmosphere and story that you can jump into for an hour.We stayed to chat with the owner, AJ, for a while after we finished the room, and he was super friendly.This is absolutely worth every penny and we will be back soon to do their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "“Ghost of Tituba”, the first Salem Witch" by Code To Escape in Daytona Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by TrapZone Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This is a challenging but enjoyable room. I took my son and a bunch of his friends for his 13th birthday, which happened to be on Friday the 13th. It was just the right amount of spooky and strange to go with the theme of the day. The clues are very challenging but extremely creative and with just a tad bit more time, we probably would have solved it. I'd highly recommend it if you're looking for a challenging, fun, group experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by TrapZone Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was the first escape room I've ever attempted but it was so fun! It is a little difficult to find but there is lots of parking. The asylum theme brought the whole room to life. (I got scared not going to lie). And the puzzles were challenging and very well thought out. I had a great experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by TrapZone Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had a great time at TrapZone. There were lots of good puzzles and they weren't repetitive. Most of the puzzles worked well for a group so everyone got involved. Overall a very well designed room.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by TrapZone Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: It was super challenging and fun. A great interactive set up! Better to go with 4-5 people than with a large group if you really want to escape.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by TrapZone Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Our whole dental team escaped the asylum with just minutes to spare! We had so much fun and enjoyed the group challenge. Lots of laughs, a few scares, and a lot of brain-busting clues to solve! Can't wait to come back again. Highly recommended for fun and for groups!

room_title: Escape room "Are We Dead? VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This is awesome! Like nothing we have ever done or tried before!

room_title: Escape room "Are We Dead? VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Just played the new Are We Dead game at Virtual Room. It was great! I've played all 3 games at this company and its newest game has polished the interface and introduced a cheeky sense of humor and a cute game mechanic. Our game hosts were fantastic as well, providing appropriate hints to keep the pace of the game fun. We had a wonderful time, thanks!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz: The Breakout" by Merlin Entertainments in San Francisco
review: My first escape room and it was an amazing time! Fun and challenging! it took us 59 minutes to escape Alcatraz! I recommend this escape room to all locals and travelers!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz: The Breakout" by Merlin Entertainments in San Francisco
review: This was the best escape room I've done!  It's pretty challenging but solvable.  We learned at the end that there are a few ways to solve some of the puzzles which was really cool.  I did this escape room with a group of friends and we had a blast and really enjoyed our night.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz: The Breakout" by Merlin Entertainments in San Francisco
review: Without giving too much away, this was a very fun escape room with a great theme, but my group left a little disappointed because the last puzzle was too difficult, and required us to get several hints. We had quickly figured out WHAT we had to do, but it was so difficult, I almost believed that it wasn't the right thing to do. I've done many escape rooms, and usually the difficult part is figuring out WHAT the puzzle is, not solving the puzzle. But in general, I really liked many of the puzzles, and especially the theme.

room_title: Escape room "Attic" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Great way to celebrate,  any occasion!Can't wait for the next girls night out!Have a creepy fun time trying to escape from THE ATTIC!

room_title: Escape room "Attic" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: I had never done an escape room before this one, and I must say it was an excellent first experience. Two other friends and I tackled the Attic room and made it out alive just in the nick of time. One of my friends has done multiple escape rooms before so it was definitely a benefit to have someone on the team with their head in the game. The room was super creepy and dark (very on theme) and the clues were challenging but rewarding to solve. The room was extremely well decorated and believable, I felt like a part of the story and that our mission was real, but it was quite small. I think our group of three was the perfect size. We'd bump into each other sometimes with the limited space, but there were enough puzzles that all of us were working on something different at the same time. The staff were also super friendly and helpful, commending us for finishing such a challenging room. I highly recommend this place and I'm looking forward to going back to finish them all!

room_title: Escape room "Attic" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Came here for a friend's birthday and did The Attic, so fun! We were a group of 4 and did not escape. I would recommend this for a group of friends looking to do somthing a little different. Will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: Had an absolute blast! We were soooo close to escaping "Asylum" but didn't quite make it. One of the most fun things I've ever done!! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: My friends and I adventured through The Asylum! It was creepy, challenging, and probably one of the coolest team building exercises a person could go through. Samuel was very humorous and helpful on getting us started, his personality definitely kept us in better spirits on finishing the room! I will certainly be coming back to challenge another room soon!!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: Was our first night to go last night. Didn't pass the Asylum escape room but had tons of fun trying. The guy at the front was absolutely funny and made our visit the best! Can't wait to try the others as well!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Deja Vu" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Dynamic Escape Rooms has come up with a great game idea. An escape room with varying degrees of challenges. You can chose medium, hard, or extreme depending on how experienced or brave you are! And apparently even if you chose one style one time, when you come back to do another style, you don't play it the same way, so it's almost like a completely different room. We chose the medium Deja Vu and it was just right for us. You don't have to be a Doctor Who fan to do this room. It just adds to the fun and the geekiness if you are. You don't even have to be a sci-fi fan to enjoy this room. The decor is great and It was a very fun experience. Our gamemasters were Ignacio and Adam. Ignacio knew exactly when to give nudges and hints, making him one of the best gamemasters we have ever had. (Thx, Ignacio!) Also, Adam is one of the best front lobby people. He is also available on the website for a chat if you have questions. (Thx, Adam!) If you want to play a private room, you don't need to "buy out" the rest of the spots. You only pay $30 extra to make it yours alone! The lobby and restrooms were clean and uncluttered. This room would appeal to all ages, sci-fi fans, Doctor Who fans, puzzle fans, game fans. In other words, if you like escape games, we recommend this business to anybody and everybody, travelers and locals alike!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Deja Vu" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This was my first ‘escape room’ experience and the team at Dynamic Escape Rooms have set the bar very high. Initially I wasn’t thrilled with the idea of being locked in a room and forced to escape, but was immediately comforted by the amazing staff that assured me that this wasn’t the typical escape room. I could leave and take a break as needed, the door wasn’t locked, and to think of it as an interactive experience instead. And it was just that. I was amazed at the complexity and range of the puzzles in the room and the imaginative story line that linked the entire experience together. I first played at the medium level of the Time Machine Game, my team and I barely completed it on time, but felt we could definitely complete the hard level now that we were familiar with the layout. We couldn’t have been more wrong. I was amazed at how much more complex and different the puzzles had become with a change in levels, needles to say we did not complete the level on time. I will definitely be back and will be recommending Dynamic Escape Rooms to all of my friends. Great Job Dynamic!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Deja Vu" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: WOW! What an amazing experience! I have been waiting for so long for a great escape room experience. I have been to escape rooms in Las Vegas, Palm Springs and Phoenix, none compared to Dynamic. The staff is professional, courteous and helpful. The room can be set at different levels, I can't wait to go back and try a harder level! I definitely recommend checking out Dynamic Escape Rooms to all looking for a fun and immersive challenge! Great job Dynamic Escape Rooms staff and creators can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Operator" by Panic Haus in Jonesboro
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Temple Ruins" by Exithis Pensacola in Pensacola
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dungeon VII" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: I had my first experience with an escape room yesterday and had way more fun than I expected. We did the Dungeon which was the most difficult but so much fun! I am recommending all my friends to them and hope to get a group together soon to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Dungeon VII" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: I have to say, Legends Escape Rooms must be one of my favorite yet. My friend and I were able to try out the Dungeon VII room, and it was an absolute blast! The decorations in the room were splendid and the room itself was definitely a fun challenge. The puzzles and challenges really put our group to the test, and although we did not escape, we had a great time. Well worth the price, cannot wait to come back and try again!

room_title: Escape room "Dungeon VII" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: I can not say enough great things about this escape room company. When we walked in, we felt warm, and welcome -and we had a toddler with us (which personally, I do not recommend for your first time) and was immediately welcomed with opened arms. Very family friendly. We were able to escape the dungeon - the puzzles were challenging, and the detail was amazing. We were blown away. We have done over 90 rooms and that room was one of the top. We are very excited to go back and complete the others. Thanks for a great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Mansion Murder" by Escapology Denver in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Special Inquiry" by That Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Our group did the "Special Inquiry" of 6 people. It was a surprise. The room is actually really hard for someone like us who never played escape room before. We do have to think differently in here compare to the real world. Also alert to all of you. This room is hell scary!!! Nothing jump out. I think the guy who built this room was genius.

room_title: Escape room "Special Inquiry" by That Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Came here on a whim. Never did an escape room before. This place was a little tricky to find. It's upstairs of the building so head inside.Before we go into the room, we watch a screen with rules and the backstory of the escape room. Then we get a walker talkie in case they need to talk us or if we want to ask for a hint. There are cameras in the rooms for them to watch to make sure you follow the rules. We might have been reminded about some rules....We did the special inquiry escape room. Since it was the first I've ever been to it took a little bit to figure out what needed to be done in there. It was pretty fun and it did get a little creepy. We didn't make it out... but it has inspired us to try another escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 2 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This is an awesome game! Time flies in there, now I can better understand my son and his “game addiction”;) Will be back soon

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 2 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: We had a really great time at the Virtual Room on Hollywood Blvd. We had so much fun we went back for the second challenge. The staff was amazing, the concept is great, and the 3 of us had a blast. Great for all ages!

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 2 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Great visual effects, helpful staff. Fun experience had by all! Would highly recommend!!

room_title: Escape room "Dark Seas Hideout" by Secret Spot Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Trevor is the BEST! Made this escape room experience so enjoyable! Super fun activity!

room_title: Escape room "Dark Seas Hideout" by Secret Spot Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: This was a very fun room! It was very immersive and we loved how much detail went into the room. The puzzles were challenging, but very doable. Our host was awesome :) He made sure that the room was comfortable for us and gave perfect hints. We had a great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Dark Seas Hideout" by Secret Spot Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: So much fun!Don’t be scared! Great for beginners and even those with experience.The younger guy running it 2/15 did an incredible job!

room_title: Escape room "R.E.S.C.U.E" by Puzzle Effect Boise in Boise
review: Such an awesome alternative for date night. Definitely money well spent instead of paying for popcorn and movie.

room_title: Escape room "R.E.S.C.U.E" by Puzzle Effect Boise in Boise
review: This was a great experience. I will definitely return for another room! Staff were very professional and friendly!

room_title: Escape room "R.E.S.C.U.E" by Puzzle Effect Boise in Boise
review: Great family fun. Second time at Boise Escape. One of our favorite Escape Rooms. Mason our guide was awesome!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Virus" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: I got this for my birthday from my daughters and it was our first escape room ever. Staff is very friendly and the clues were very helpful. The room itself was a real challenge and we had to come a second time (with a huge discount!!)to solve the riddle finally. Too much for a first escape room for my team while it was very exciting!! I highly recommend Hawaii exchange challenge!! We are hooked! We just did our second one and we can’t wait to do the third one next month!!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Virus" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: We ended up choosing The Virus challenge as our first escape room. The challenge had an appropriate level of difficulty and the puzzles were challenging and fun. Our group's age ranged from 10-33. My ten-year-old daughter was actually a big help and she really enjoyed coming with our group that evening.Our gamemaster was awesome from entrance to exit. He was very interactive, patient and a lot of fun "behind the scenes."We definitely look forward to another family night out. We would definitely try the Virus again until we successfully escape the room. Our next choice would be The Cellar after hearing more information about this particular room/challenge.

room_title: Escape room "The Virus" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: It was so much Fun!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: What a fun time we had as a family in this place! Loved the Crimson Rose! Not too difficult for these escape room first-timers, but still kept you thinking. Sebastian was great and very accommodating to our family. We want to go back again!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: So much fun! Challenging and creative. We escaped the Crimson Storm and can't wait to try another room soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: Loved the Crimson Storm Room! This was an amazing experience. Even with different individuals all locked in with one another, having no acquaintance, we worked surprisingly well together. All of our different talents came together to solve the room. I wish we hadn't run out of time. I look forward to doing this again soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: Went with friends for my husband's birthday. We picked the Crimson Storm and loved it! The right amount of challenge, it definitely came down to the wire when we beat the room. We'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Forbidden Temple" by Clever Fox in Temecula
review: This place is great for everyone! We did the temple room and it was awsome. The puzzels are very high quality. The room was very immersive with great design and set. The rooms have something for everyone along with puzzels that appeal to adults and kids. And the staff is kind and welcoming. I highly recomend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Forbidden Temple" by Clever Fox in Temecula
review: Great experience at Clever Fox! We've done over 40 escape rooms, and we were pleasantly surprised with the variety and complexity of the clues in the Forbidden Temple.  The set was great, and the immersion was top notch!  We'll be back for Outbreak in a few weeks. Can't wait!

room_title: Escape room "Forbidden Temple" by Clever Fox in Temecula
review: Absolutely the best around!Very creative-wonderful to play-loved it there!!!The temple room was incredible and we want more more more!!

room_title: Escape room "Art Heist" by Great Room Escape San Diego in San Diego
review: So much fun! We loved every second of it. Definitely recommended

room_title: Escape room "Art Heist" by Great Room Escape San Diego in San Diego
review: Although my team failed the challenge and did not solve the puzzle it was fun and I Would definitely do another one

room_title: Escape room "Art Heist" by Great Room Escape San Diego in San Diego
review: I've been to a few escape rooms and this place is one of my favorites! Can't wait to see what new rooms they come out with I

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: We had an amazing experience with the Pirate Ship! We will be back again next year!!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: If u love escape rooms or want to try a escape room, definitely go to this one. This is a fantastic, fun place. I definitely would go back. Me and a couple others went for our first time and had a blast but we owe it all to a employee named Marcus. Marcus was a wonderful help and very nice . We did the pirate ship room and finished it, it was amazing. Thank u Marcus, next time we're in town, we will definitely come back.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: Super fun! These are 45 minute puzzles with different themes: zombie apocalypse, pirate ship, and alien uprising. My group did the pirate ship and we got out just under the wire. From what I heard of other groups, the alien room is very difficult and neither got out. I found the pirate ship to be good for all ages as it's all on one level, the puzzles are challenging but not too much, and there isn't a ton of chemical fog. There is low light so if you have any vision problems, that could be an issue. It's appointment only, so make sure you call to reserve your room!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Already played 3 games and loved every game so far! We played Museum Heist tonight and our game master Brady was awesome!! Thank you for making this a great birthday and we can't wait to come play Mystery Mansion!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: We took part in the Museum Heist game. 2 adults and 2 15 yr old boys. This was the most fun we've had in a while. You are locked in a room with clues that you have to figure out in an hour in order to escape the room and get the picture to prove you got out in time. The clues are some common sense, some general math and problem-solving. We visited 2 other game rooms with other companies and this one is by far the best. I am so glad they opened up in Montgomery. They are also located in a great side of town!!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: I went here with my family. We were a group of 8 ranging from ages 7 to 66 (grandchildren, children, and parents) and everyone had a great time. We did the museum heist room and we barely got out in time. This place is clean, the staff is friendly, and one hour goes by really fast. Everyone is our group was able to participate and were genuinely excited and happy when we left.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: We played the museum heist on Saturday 5-21, had an absolute BLAST!!! We've been to other gaming places similar to Breakout Montgomery and I must say this one is the best by far!!! Thanks to the owners & staff for making it awesome.

room_title: Escape room "Startup Escape" by Startup Escape in San Francisco
review: Fyi to set expectations, my friends and I have done several dozen escape rooms. Not sure experts but not new to the scene either. We loved the puzzles. They were refreshing compared to some of the overused ones we've seen. They did an EXCELLENT job with the startup tech theme. Lots of jokes that techies are sure to love. But if you're not from the startup world, you'll still be able to enjoy the puzzles and story without feeling lost. Great for group sizes 5-8. The first few puzzles are a little linear to get everyone warmed up, but the following ones can be parallelized so everyone's working on something and not feeling bottlenecked. Definitely would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Startup Escape" by Startup Escape in San Francisco
review: Silicon Valley's Startup Escape room is a love letter to the Product Hunt generation

room_title: Escape room "Startup Escape" by Startup Escape in San Francisco
review: With such a market saturation of Escape Rooms, it was really refreshing to find one that cultivates such innovation. The concept of launching your startup and a set amount of money is such a nice change of pace from the generic murder or end of world scenarios that seem to dominate the landscape. Thought this balanced difficulty and entertainment extremely well, and look forward to seeing more from the creator down the road!

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Circus" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: My boyfriend and I are escape room enthusiasts and North Valley Escape Room continues to surpass our expectations with every new room they open! We have done all of their rooms, most recently doing their Big Top Circus. Their circus room is amazing! Seriously, I cannot say enough good things about this room. It is now in my top five favorite rooms (we've done 121 total so far to give you a comparison). It is very aesthetically-pleasing and the puzzles are very clever, well-themed and challenging. All of their other rooms are very well done, too. One thing that sets North Valley apart from some other local escape room places is their employees. They are personable, fun, helpful and have a genuine passion for escape rooms and talking to others that do as well. Their clue system is very fluent and doesn't lead you in the wrong direction and they are quick to deliver them when needed. We love North Valley and can't wait for their next room to open because they never disappoint. There is a lot of heart that goes into their rooms and it definitely shows. Keep up the great work and keep wowing us with whatever comes next.

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Circus" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We did ZZ's Big Top Circus but failed and probably needed a few more minutes. It was really thought out and well done and lots of riddles, puzzles and locks, but it was linear so we couldn't work on different puzzles/riddles individually. We had to ask for quite a few clues since some of them were a bit difficult. There were multiple rooms and it was fun seeing each themed room. I can't wait to try The Great Outdoors next time!

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Circus" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This place is absolutely top-notch when it comes to escape rooms. We've done and made it out of three of the rooms (Big Top Circus, The Great Outdoors, and Alcatraz). We even did two in one day because we couldn't get enough! I've been through a few other rooms, and NVER really knows how to serve up an immersive, detailed experience for all involved. We'll definitely be returning to try all of the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by The House of Clues in Santa Barbara
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Code Blue" by Coral Springs Escape Rooms in Miami
review: This was my first escape room and I absolutely love it. It was challenging and fun and great for teamwork

room_title: Escape room "Code Blue" by Coral Springs Escape Rooms in Miami
review: Had a great time with my family here! We saved the patient too!

room_title: Escape room "Code Blue" by Coral Springs Escape Rooms in Miami
review: We had so much fun, it was a really challenging creative and interesting one. And it felt really good to save the poor man that got bit by the snake in the Everglades with our antidote!

room_title: Escape room "Code Blue" by Coral Springs Escape Rooms in Miami
review: This was such fun. You really need to look everywhere and at everything. Exercises the brain! Our group was in the Emergency Room trying to get antivenin for a snake bite victim. Unfortunately, the victim didn’t get his meds. None of us are doctors or detectives, and the victim is fake, so, it really didn’t matter! But it sure was fun!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: The most creative way to spend an hour with family and friends! Its an absolute must do in Los Angeles!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Great place and great people.....very intense and intriguing game.U gonna love it just need to try it....great story play!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Fun, strategic and masterfully designed! This place offers both a mentally stimulating challenge as well as provides a fantastic group experience! Excellent team building game if you're looking for that!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun although the world was destroy lol. I love it definite coming back maybe with a bigger groups so I don't get frustrated hahaha they forgot to send my pictures !

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Incredibly addictive! Great family/friends activity! Pure puzzle solving and intuitiveness to solve the mission at hand. Tell everyone and anyone! Can you escape?

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Amazing Experience! Loved it. I went with 2 friends and we had a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: RoomEscape is the industry standard of what escape rooms should aspire to be. Very clean cut puzzles with great implementations of technology. I have done all 4 of their rooms and each has a well thought out combination of puzzles to make their games interesting for a variety of group sizes. Their themes are excellent choices and provide a new experience with each room. Would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Gentleman's Den" by Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by West Palm Beach Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: Great place! Looking forward to our next adventure there!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by West Palm Beach Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: It was so much fun. My family and I loved the idea of working together to solve the mystery!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by West Palm Beach Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: Great room themes, and very friendly staff (Paul was great!). Would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Project Iceworm" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: It was my boyfriend's and my first times doing an escape room and we had a great time. We did the Project Iceworm room which I would highly recommend. The room is dimly lit and you have to search around with flashlights for clues. We thought the puzzles were really creative and challenging. Since it was just the two of us and both of our first times we didn't make it out in time but we still had so much fun. The couple running the place are also super nice and create the rooms themselves, which is super neat. Can't wait to go again!

room_title: Escape room "Project Iceworm" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: I'd never been to an escape room before and wasn't sure what to expect but we were blown away by 21 Keys. I expected something cheesy (think like murder mystery dinners) but this was so well thought out and executed that I'm still thinking about it 3 days later.I booked the Project Iceworm room for me, my mom, and my sister and we ended up having the room to ourselves (probably not peak hours for this type of activity). This was the most difficult room, which I knew and we were warned about again before entering, but we're puzzle/game people so we wanted something challenging. The room allows a max of 6 players and I was worried about not having enough people for it since we only had 3 but unless we had someone experienced with escape rooms I don't think additional bodies/brains would have made it any better. The story was not only entertaining but so well translated into a game and the time (and money) that they had to put into the design and technology of the room is evident and impressive.We ended up asking for three clues and were impressed with how they were delivered. I expected to just get direction via an intercom or even to have someone walk in and guide us but the clues were integrated into the design of the room and were gently guidance, not just "do this next" which made having to get a clue less disappointing.We didn't solve the room but were told we made it about 75% of the way through. Honestly, solving it would have been nice but the hour of entertainment (which FLEW by) was worth what we paid and more. If we weren't so hungry I would have asked if we could stay and do the Speakeasy room which looked very cool, too.btw, there are lockers for your jackets, purses, etc so you don't have to deal with those while you're in the room which was a nice touch.

room_title: Escape room "Project Iceworm" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: This place is incredible. It is fairly new and the woman who runs the place is so nice and you can tell she really cares about what she's made here. We did the Project Iceworm room which was technologically incredible and honestly so well put together it was astounding...by far the best escape room experience myself and my group have collectively ever had. We were so into this room that we followed it up immediately after with another room called The Speakeasy. Though less challenging overall, still very well thought out and definitely would be a great first introduction to escape rooms. Please consider coming here, I promise you will not regret it. A+

room_title: Escape room "House of Fear VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: I strongly reccomend VR Tech Loung. Me and my husband stopped by for a date night. We had such an amazing time. We got a date night package that included a dinner. Everything about our experience was perfect. The staff was great and amazing. We will defiantly be stopping by more often.

room_title: Escape room "House of Fear VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: I have had two experience with VR Tech Lounge and they both have been great. This is so much fun for a date night or just wanting to try something different. Sasa and his team and very knowledgeable and do a great job making sure you are comfortable and having fun!

room_title: Escape room "House of Fear VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: loved everything about it! Really fun place! Staff was amazing!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Evil Genie" by Locksmith Escape Games in Orlando
review: This was mine and my boyfriends first escape room and we chose “Break free from inside the genies lamp”. Our experience was nothing short of thrilling, entertaining and just pure fun!! The rooms are super detailed and make you feel like you are in a different place. The staff(game masters) were super knowledgeable, welcoming and sweet! They explained everything thoroughly and made it the best experience possible! They even have a trial puzzle in the lobby area for you to try before you go into your escape room that was really fun and helpful if you’ve never done one before! Overall our experience was a 10/10, and we will definitely be going back!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Evil Genie" by Locksmith Escape Games in Orlando
review: We played Curse of the Evil Genie and it was so much fun. My young daughter was also with us and she was able to participate and had a blast! The staff went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. Will definitely come back to play the other games. Thank you for such a great time!!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Evil Genie" by Locksmith Escape Games in Orlando
review: We did the Curse of the Evil Genie and we were able to escape with 20 seconds left! We have been waiting for this place to open for a few months and couldn’t wait to try it out. When we got in the room, it was theme really well. Everything seems to go together. The puzzles were pretty fun and interesting. This is their hardest room right now, I would recommend doing it with four people to not get down to the very last seconds. It was only two of us and barely escaped. Staff was friendly and definitely helpful! Can’t wait to come back to try their other rooms.

room_title: World of Escapes
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Expedition" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: We tried the game titled "The Lost Expedition" which was rated medium-hard as far as it's level of difficulty. Without giving anything away, we'll say that it's a lot different than what you're used to, and has a lot of parts to solving which will make your team think outside the box, communicate well, but this particular Escape Room had a particularly good "flow" as you progress through the room. We will say that the actual room used for the puzzle, are well thought out, Jason was a great host, and we all agree that this Escape Room is one of our Top 5 favorites we've ever tried. Not because we solved it, but because it was VERY fun to do! Have you ever done an Escape Room where it's a lock defeating puzzle and all you managed to do was open 15+ locks? Well, this Escape Room is far from that, and was really really interesting. Give Steal and Escape a try! We think you'll like their games A LOT! Steal and Escape's experiences cost $32/person, but we also think it was time very well spent in our humble opinion.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Expedition" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: So I actually ran The Lost Expedition as my first escape room ever on December 19, and while I thought I had done a bunch of research ahead of time on how escape rooms work and what to expect, this room subverted my expectations and set up a tough standard for future rooms I would do.Everything in the room is user-activated (really heavy arduino use), and one of the mechanics of the room actually gives the players more agency in their experience. There are no traditional padlocks or number pads. There is a critical path for the players to follow, but non-linear encounters line that path. Certain players have roles defined in the context of the game that provide a natural kick to encourage participation and communication, and I feel like that's really clever and probably doesn't get enough credit.Jason is a great game master and clearly has the experience to know when and how to nudge versus hint, and crafted an experience for our group that felt appropriately challenging, but never frustrating. My first experience with an escape room just happened to be this one, and it was so great that I was motivated to visit a different facility on the same night. The only bummer here is that so much heart and soul has to go into the creation of each room that I don't want to come back too soon, because once I play Mysterious Stranger I'm going to have to wait until the next room is released.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Expedition" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: My group and I completed The Lost Expedition and HIGHLY recommend this company and room! For my birthday my group and I decided to do an escape room crawl in San Diego and this was our first stop. Not only is this room very immersive, the staff is also extremely nice.We originally were supposed to have four people playing this room, but plans changed and could only do it with three. Instead of turning us away and saying that we couldn't do the room, the two gentlemen working just came in at one point to help us with the one puzzle that required four people. Without giving too much away, the room begins with everyone being assigned a role that will help you in completing the room. I really liked this idea because it ensures that everyone gets to be involved in the room, instead of just have a few players steamroll everyone else. The team elements that are required to escape really add to the experience in my opinion.The other major difference with this room is that it isn't your traditional 60 minute room. It's all dependent on the choices you make throughout the game how long it will last. Your time could end in 20 minutes, or it can end in two hours. We will definitely be back next time we're in San Diego to do their other room, and can't wait to see what this company has in store for the future!

room_title: Escape room "Disarm" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: Extremely interactive. Fascinating, complicated puzzle in real time. Had a group of six who worked well together. Very well done. Seems impossible to be disappointed. We ALL loved every minute. Escaped with 8 minutes to go!Thanks Zach and Josh! xx

room_title: Escape room "Disarm" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: DISARM is an intensive and intricate escape room.  Had a group of 5 at varying levels of experience and it was very exciting.  I highly recommend this event for everyone, but mental maturity is needed to successfully escape.

room_title: Escape room "Disarm" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: Enjoyable for family friendly environment. Medium difficulty and pretty good plan. Had a few unsolicited assists. But our semi-experienced group did escape. There were a few tough hangups. But we escaped.

room_title: Escape room "Disarm" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: This was my first escape room and it was INCREDIBLE!!!! The guys put a lot of thought, effort, and passion into the rooms they make and it shows!!! After this room my wife and I have tries several others in the area and nothing comes close to this one!!! These guys truly love what they do and it makes for a spectacular experience!! The amount of creativity put into DISARM was amazing!! We can't wait to try their other rooms!!!

room_title: Escape room "Disarm" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: I've been to escape rooms all around the country -- a lot of them -- and this is the undisputed best them all. There's a danger in giving too much away in describing an escape room, so I'll just say that everything about Outerlife Studios is top notch and innovative. My friends and I were talking about it for days after. The owners were very friendly and deservedly proud of their business. After we were done, they generously showed us the behind the scenes and it was also a ton of fun. We can't wait until they open their next room!

room_title: Escape room "Disarm" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: So much fun! Teamwork, challenging hints, very well orchestrated! The theme was very suspenseful! The hosts were nice. Looking forward to the next room they create!

room_title: Escape room "Disarm" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: What a blast (literally!). I came here with my family and it was so interesting to see how we all came together to (almost) disarm a bomb. I've done a lot of escape rooms before, and Outerlife Studios definitely was up there in regards to the riddles and excitement and how much fun we had. Would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Disarm" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: A must do! Highly recommend! Very challenging. Also, just something different and special to do with a group of people.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard Escape" by Unity Escape Rooms in Redlands
review: My son celebrated his thirteenth birthday here with seven friends in the Wizard Room. They had a blast. The steam coming out of the dragon's nose on the door was awesome! The ladies that work there are good with tweens and teens. Would definitely come again.

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: It's always a good time when you can do team building activities with your closes friends. Glad to see owners that do actually care about their business and customers.

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: Awesome time with good friends! Great experience to bond, laugh, and work together.

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: Soooo much fun! We will definitely be back asap. Thank you Danielle for an awesome adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: It was an amazing time, really racked up my teams brain, got real far considering we only had 4 people, would definitely recommend to anyone and will try again soon

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: We had such an amazing time doing Pandemic!!! The staff, especially Albert, were wonderful and really made it fun! Will certainly be back!!!

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: A must. Real life puzzle. We came to FL for the sunshine and it rained. We searched for things to do and came across this. It challenged your problem solving skills to the max. Will do again when we return to FL.Our room, Pandemic. 7 players, 1 minute remaining and we solve.

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: We didn't get to escape pandemic. But this was the best experience! Thank you!!!! We weren't expecting shirts either.. That was the best surprise! Thank you thank you so much! Much love... Brian from Utah!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology Augusta in Augusta
review: None

room_title: Escape room "CIA Task Force" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: My husband, niece, daughter and I escaped the CIA Task Force - The Gamer room! Puzzles were very creative and well done. We got the harder ones without hints, but had to get a couple of hints on the easier ones - overthinking it a bit! Henry and Darren were helpful and friendly! We will play another room soon.

room_title: Escape room "CIA Task Force" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: Did CIA with my wife and 2 boys, 10 & 7. So awesome to work together as a family and the boys both solved puzzles on their own. Shaina helped us when needed and we made it out with a little time to spare. Will be back for Timeline!

room_title: Escape room "CIA Task Force" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: Did the CIA room with my daughter. As a first-timer this was a lot of fun! Staff are great and the puzzles too! Would recommend this to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "CIA Task Force" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: I did the CIA escape room with a couple of friends and I would highly recommend this room to anyone looking for a good way to spend an hour with friends. I have done 6 escape rooms around town and this room had some of the coolest tech "gadgets" involved in the clues. The room was well thought out. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the room. Highly recommend Lockbox Escape Room to all of my friends.

room_title: Escape room "CIA Task Force" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: Great customer service and great experience! CIA Taskforce was well above and beyond the expectations of even my skeptical team mates. The puzzle was clever and I was impressed by the technology used. We laughed, we cheered, we high-fived and hugged. Of course, we made it out with 10 minutes to spare but, even so, wonderful experience. Shoutout to Charlie who was very patient as we shifted things around because of a potential hurricane. He also coordinated catering for us. Awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Submerged" by The One 2 Escape Room in Miami
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: Such a fun experience! It was our first time trying an escape room and we had such a good time at the Crime Scene room. The staff was helpful and the game challenging, but doable. Would definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: Had an amazing time with a group of friends. We did the Heist and the Crime Scene. Both teams finished with 5minutes to spare. Very challenging and a lot of fun! Already talking about going back!

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: I went with 4 of my family and friends. It was our first time doing one of these and we were really really excited and expected amazing! We were not disappointed, this was such an unforgettable and amazing experience!! The staff was so sweet and made the experience fun as well! Can't wait to come back and do another one!

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: We had such a good time at this place. Very professional!!! Very detailed. Amazing fun! Will be back for more.... best escape room ever!

room_title: Escape room "The Forbidden Tomb" by Royal Escape Rooms in Panama City
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by Escape Thrill in Tampa
review: We had such a good time! And the owner is such a nice guy. We are on our honeymoon and he helped us know restaurants to go to in the next city. We did the diamond heist room it was very well put together.

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by Escape Thrill in Tampa
review: The Diamond Heist room was so much fun! We were paired with another super fun, smart couple and it made it even more enjoyable! What a great team building activity and lots of laughs. Thanks to Mike at Escape Thrill- a great host!!Can't wait to come back and try the other rooms!! A+++

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by Escape Thrill in Tampa
review: Our family tried out Escape Thrill for the first time with the Diamond Heist room for my daughter's 16th Birthday and we ALL (ages 11 to 47) loved it! The clues are difficult enough to make you think, but not drive you crazy, and there are hints available if you're stuck. It was overall a great experience and we will definitely be back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "7 Deadly Sins" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Fun, exciting, and challenging rooms with a great variety of adventures to choose from, AND friendly, helpful, and witty game masters. I'm terrible with names, but I remember our gamemaster Matt was fantastic! Scott, Sierra, Dave, and everyone else whose name I forgot (sorry), were also awesome and made our experience that much better! I really wish we didn't live so far away, because there's still more rooms to do. We'll be back for sure! Thanks, everyone!

room_title: Escape room "7 Deadly Sins" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Had an amazing experience tonight in the Seven Deadly Sins room! Staff was super friendly and helpful and we appreciated (needed, lol) the hints and tips during our game! Definitely recommend for an entertaining evening!

room_title: Escape room "7 Deadly Sins" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Defiently one of the better escape rooms I've been to. Super friendly and even let us book over the phone and pay when we arrived. Checking in was easy and there's plenty of games to keep you busy while you wait. Game master was also super friendly and super helpful.Me and 3 other friends did the seven deadly sins room and it was very well done. Theme and decorations were great and the storyline continues throughout the entire room. We weren't able to finish the room in time but the game master was nice enough to take us through the rest of the room. Also if you're easily scared you should be fine to do the room, I'm a chicken and I found the only thing that really scared me was the smoke machine turning on.Just keep in mind that if you decide to do this room it's fairly difficult, 3/4 people in our group have done escape rooms in the past and we needed a lot of help. Also the rooms are fairly tiny, so I recommend keeping your group to about 4 or less people.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Asylum" by All Saints Lunatic Asylum in Hesperia
review: We had an awesome time. The staff were extremely friendly. puzzles very well put together. We can't wait to go back. A must do in Apple Valley.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Asylum" by All Saints Lunatic Asylum in Hesperia
review: This one was awesome. If you're in for a scary escape room this is definitely the one to go to. Can't wait to go for the IT themed weekend!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Secret" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Great set design! Host was funny and cool.

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Secret" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This is Inferno Escape Room's best set design! Really cool features that give it a steampunk feel. Show up in costume for even more fun!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Secret" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Played inventors secret and loved the look of this room! The puzzles were awesome and well planned. I dont want to give away too much, but there are some fun and surprising effects and the ending was a highlight!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Secret" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: A great room with unique puzzles! Love the theme and atmosphere. I have played all the rooms at inferno and they all are fun and challenging!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Secret" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Great new place. Friendly owners. The Inventor's Secret had some fun, unique puzzles. Looking forward to trying their other room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Alice's Dream" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Just had a great time escaping the Alice in Wonderland room. By far the best escape room I've done so far. The owner was super nice and friendly. We trusted other reviews for this specific place and it was fun. The decor was excellent and all the features worked, nothing was broken or not working as it should. We were able to really get lost in the game and dice into it. Definitely recommend this place and the Alice room

room_title: Escape room "Alice's Dream" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: We booked our Escape Room experience this afternoon; we chose Alice's Dream. We had so much fun! I love the setup in each room - super cute! Totally Alice in Wonderland theme. We find the puzzles & riddles challenging. You don't have to know anything about Alice in Wonderland to solve the puzzles. Christina was super nice & friendly;she gave us clues to help us move along & not get stuck.  She said she does not penalize us if we ask for help; what matters is we have fun. We would come back here again & try out other escape rooms. And their restrooms are super clean which is important to me & what I always like in a business.

room_title: Escape room "Alice's Dream" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: I brought my family here for my parents' and little sister's first time doing an escape room and we all had an incredible time! I was always worried my parents might get frustrated or not really understand what's going on but Alice's Dream is really family friendly and great for all levels. Barry and his wife did such an amazing job into the production of the escape room - it really felt like we were in Alice's dream from Alice in Wonderland! I will say that nothing is actually frightening but I did scream multiple times when things would open up but that's just me being me LOL I would 100% recommend this place to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "Encore" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: My husband and I visited Escape Effect while on vacation to Orlando and played the Encore room. We have played around 20 escape rooms now and this was by far the best lock-and-key style room we have ever played (& probably my 2nd favorite game we've ever played!). We are typically more attracted to rooms with more technology and effects but the puzzles, decor, and INCREDIBLE ATTENTION TO DETAIL made for an incredible experience. The decor and props made for a fantastic, immersive experience! We were bummed that we didn't have time to play the other rooms, but when we're in town again we will be sure to return!

room_title: Escape room "Encore" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: Great escape experience! We did the Encore room and it was absolutely beautiful. The details were impressive and the clues hard enough to be just the right amount of effort. The owner was there and SUPER nice too. We'll go back.

room_title: Escape room "Encore" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: The Escape Effect was an excellent escape room experience and this is a recommendation coming from my family and I who are enthusiasts that have completed over 30 escape rooms. The theme and decor of the room we did (Encore) was well-designed and the puzzles were a lot of fun. The establishment is clean and the staff are kind. It is a locally owned mom and pop shop and the quality shows.The Escape Effect can adjust the challenge level of your room if so desired and they offer unlimited hints or none at all...basically they'll do whatever you want/need to ensure you have a great time. We will absolutely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Library - Destination London" by ALL IN Adventures Lawrenceville in Atlanta
review: We didn't have an appointment but they were able to accommodate our walk-in on a Monday afternoon. They have both mystery and escspe rooms. We did the Sherlock mystery room. It was 45m and a "level 3." We just barely finished in time. We used a clue too... If you're going to do this one... don't overthink!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Library - Destination London" by ALL IN Adventures Lawrenceville in Atlanta
review: Just did the Sherlock room at Mystery Rooms. It was a really fun and unique experience. I have never done anything quite like this. You choose a room (each one has a theme) and you have 45 minutes to solve the puzzle inside. There are various clues hidden through out the room and you and your other detectives work together to solve the case. As a mystery nerd, I absolutely loved this, but I think your average Joe would too! The owner was incredibly nice & attentive. If you find yourself at Discover Mills, definitely stop by. It's an affordable, fun, and unique way to pas some time with your friends. The only complaint I have is that the room was really hot. It could have been the fact that you are in a small room with a few other people with the door closed, but other than that, this place was great!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Library - Destination London" by ALL IN Adventures Lawrenceville in Atlanta
review: You gave to try this!  A perfect and fun thing to do when you want something more original than a movie.  We loved the sherlock room and the royals room.  Clues can be tricky...on your first room you might want a clue if you are stuck.   But put on your thinking caps and give it a try.    Good luck!

room_title: Escape room "Ancestors" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Ex Machina" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: I've played Ex Machina and their new game The Society. Both were fun! Game master Theo was friendly and explained rules and game story thoroughly. Game themselves had good design, non-standard puzzles and solid support throughout the game. Lobby has some board games so you won't get bored while waiting.Nice place! Will come back for more :)

room_title: Escape room "Ex Machina" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: This place is awesome! I played 2 of their 4 games, Ex Machina and their newest game the society. Both had super immersive set design, creative stories and cool techy puzzles. There aren't a lot of escape room options in the east bay, so I'm super glad this place opened!

room_title: Escape room "Ex Machina" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: Fantastic fun and more to come! We will return as soon as possible to do the other rooms.Room: Ex MachinaOverall: Wonderful, friendly, and open customer service, Intriguing premise and unique "in world" tech and appropriately "authentic" props for immersion. Not too linear but becomes more linear as you near the finale. Enjoyable, relatively non-complicated tech and puzzles. The puzzles are strong and logical but certainly not too easy. No tedious task "puzzles" that can waste time. Outcome: We didn't make it but came close by being in the home stretch of the last set of challengesTime: Visited during soft opening several weeks ago; owner was extremely open and honest with us about the additional challenges that this may entail but it did not take away from the wonderful experience in the least. Should only get even better and better.Team: 4 - 2 adults and 2 teens - we've done 6 escapes rooms previouslyDifficulty: This was a challenging room for us but not impossible; This would be very challenging to first timers.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Game Iron Gate" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Shaken, Not Stirred" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: Great experience! Did the Shaken not Stirred room. Ralph even took requests for background music and found a bunch of Bond songs for us :) Plus the added humor on the screen from him was hilarious! Clues were challenging and we barely finished with just under 5 minutes to spare! Super fun time with the family!!

room_title: Escape room "Shaken, Not Stirred" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: Had a great time in the Shaken not stirred room. The staff was great, they had us laughing giving the clues. Glad we did the standard for our first visit. Would do again!

room_title: Escape room "Shaken, Not Stirred" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: We had a great time! Our did "shaken, not stirred" room and successfully made it out with time to spare and clues remaining. Would definitely recommend and we're looking forward to trying another room.

room_title: Escape room "Shaken, Not Stirred" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: I went with Team Empower, (that's really our name) from work. We did the shaken not stirred room. We had a blast. Unfortunately we failed the mission and we blew up. Lol. I loved the staff and I am sure they had a great laugh at watching us.

room_title: Escape room "Shaken, Not Stirred" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: Went with some friends to do "shaken, not stirred". Was our first time doing something like this. Although we did not escape (we feel dumber than a box of rocks, lol), we had a great night and would definite try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Space Escape" by Wolff Escapes in Putnam
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Quarantine" by The One 2 Escape Room in Miami
review: Awesome experience in the Quarantine rooms 2 for one. Our team leader helped us to be successful. Definitely going back to do more rooms

room_title: Escape room "Quarantine" by The One 2 Escape Room in Miami
review: Did quarantine with some friends and had a blast escaping! We just made it! Theres really nice staff too

room_title: Escape room "Quarantine" by The One 2 Escape Room in Miami
review: This is the best escape room we've experienced. The owner is very organized and the room was ready to go, as many others make you wait. Very clean and spacious rooms. The props for Quarantine were perfect, and the clues followed the storyline perfectly as well. An adventurous outing with friends during rain and humidity. For our next gathering, we'll try the Heist.

room_title: Escape room "The Maze: Dragon Quest" by Escape Woods in Atlanta
review: We had a great time doing the Amazing Dragon maze escape. It was cold and rainy but they still let us do it. It was a lot of fun. We will come back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Maze: Dragon Quest" by Escape Woods in Atlanta
review: Such a fun, creative experience! We did the dragon quest maze. It was really challenging, even for us escape room veterans! Its just so different being outside and having so much more stuff to work with. We had a couple issues, like there was something above us we had to grab that we couldnt reach, but the woman in charge was really helpful. We didn't quite manage to win but we came really close! We had such a blast!!

room_title: Escape room "The Maze: Dragon Quest" by Escape Woods in Atlanta
review: Fun experience.  Did the maze and made it out. The staff is helpful and the whole grounds are unique. Would recommend to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Room 213" by Escape Room Herndon in Washington, D.C.
review: Absolutely loved it. Not your same old combination leads to combination. Seeing my buddies jump scare reaction to one of the items made the night. Looking forward to coming back.

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Room 213" by Escape Room Herndon in Washington, D.C.
review: Just did Room 213 and loved it! This was my fourth escape room. We made it out with 20 seconds left and I was so sweaty. Lol. The pressure! Challenging, yet linear which I loved. Just enough help - the employees were very welcoming and professional. We loved the clues and tech elements. The little buttons at the end were a sweet memory. Can't wait to come back!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Kingdom: Distorted Truth" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: We tackled the Lost Kingdom room- the room had some good challenging puzzles, and some unique ones as well.On the downside, the website and automatic emails are plagued with spelling and grammatical errors, which doesn't instill much faith from the outside. Similarly, a number of the items in the room are in disrepair, misspellings are crossed out and corrected- which kind of takes you out of the moment, one of the UV lights we were given was basically useless because of how dim the light was...In summary, a well designed, challenging room, but not as professional of a company as say Omescape.

room_title: Escape room "Lost Kingdom: Distorted Truth" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: This was so much fun. First time experiencing an escape room and loved every second of it. Will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Kingdom: Distorted Truth" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Absolutely fantastic! The owners are absolutely wonderful, and clearly love what they do. The room itself was fantastic, and the puzzles were the perfect level of challenging! I'll definitely be returning soon.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: Did Antidote today and had a great time, we had Oscar as our host and he was very friendly. We also got to meet Josh who was our game master. He knew exactly when to send us a hint when we needed it. Would highly recommend. Will be back to do the other two rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: That was tons of fun! We did the "easy" Antidote room and barely made it out with 5 minutes but we had to ask for help a lot! Great game masters and fun experience! Will definately be back!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: This was my first escape room and it was awesome. We made it in and out in 21 minutes and only used the free clues. I'll admit it was a little challenging with all the clues spread out between the rooms but it was worth the brain power. I hope I can come back again and try the other ones.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: We had so much fun we went back for a second one. Augustus was an awesome host.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: Had an awesome playing with my co-workers. First time trying an escape room and we will be back. Facility was easy to get to, made us use our brains and work together. Glad we picked one that doesn't rely on scary stuff to make it challenging. Thank you Escapology for a fun team building activity.

room_title: Escape room "Time Machine" by Not Another Escape Room in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Strike it Rich!" by Golden Puzzle Room in Denver
