review: Beautifully themed rooms and well-thought out, complex puzzles. We’ve done many escape rooms in Denver and know that whenever we come to the Golden Puzzle Room it’s going to be a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Strike it Rich!" by Golden Puzzle Room in Denver
review: Great staff, challenging puzzle, fun time! We went in Golden, good time!

room_title: Escape room "Strike it Rich!" by Golden Puzzle Room in Denver
review: What a great experience!  Our group of 5 did the Strike It Rich room and had an wonderful time.  The room was furnished wonderfully and I would highly recommend it for any work group or family event.  OR just for fun!

room_title: Escape room "Curse of Davy Jones VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: Wow. Brought kids here for a 12year old birthday party. The staff was super helpful and friendly. The kids were suited up and enjoyed every second of the Curse of Davy Jones experience. Special bonus was we were given videos of the experience to watch back the fun later. Great addition to the mall - we will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Curse of Davy Jones VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: The gameplay was so much more realistic than I expected, and the game was a lot of fun! We did the Curse of Davy Jones, and highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Curse of Davy Jones VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: Awesome! Great for a group of friends. The Davy Jones Curse was really fun! Would definitely go back again!

room_title: Escape room "Depths of Osiris VR" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "51" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Amber Sky 2088 VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: We had my 10 year old nephews birthday, booking two sessions of Amber Sky and it was a blast!  Adults and kids all had fun, including grandma and grandpa!  Its pretty much a sci fi first person shooter, with team play... Two players are equipped with power shields that can block attacks and also be thrown like a boomerang, and laser pistols. The other 4 players carry laser rifles that also have a flamethrower... Theme is alien invasion... If your teammate gets damaged too much they shut down and you have to tap their shoulder to heal them and they can rejoin the battle.  If alien eggs are allowed to spawn they may jump on you and start biting your chest and your teammate needs to shoot them to get them off, but you can kick the eggs to break them or hit them with the flame throwers... A fun team tactic: give the kids the shield to block, and adult stands behind them with a rifle to shoot overtop of the shield! :)

room_title: Escape room "Amber Sky 2088 VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: I played the Amber Sky today with my husband & the kids. We had an amazing time!!! The green screen room becomes so realistic once the game starts. And the staff is so friendly and helpful! I can't wait to go back. Plus they give you highlight videos!!

room_title: Escape room "Amber Sky 2088 VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: I brought my 9 year old and his friends for my son's birthday. He had a great time. We did Amber Sky and my son loved the experience. I would say this is bit pricy. I could have taken kids to Great America all day for the same price. This was a 30 minute long game so I hope they would lower the price to attract more people.

room_title: Escape room "Secret Agent" by MindBreak Norwich in Norwich
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Murder Mystery" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: Cool theme, we had a great time! Although we didn't make it out, we were so close! The staff were very helpful and it was a great time! We will definitely be back with a group of our friends!

room_title: Escape room "HouDoneIt?" by My Greatest Escape in Ventura
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Escape Plan Georgia in Atlanta
review: Fun and challenging escape rooms! We did Substitute Teacher and Area 51, and were not disappointed with the challenges of either room. I thought it was very creative that they engineered a game suitable for younger kids so the whole family could enjoy (and it was just as enjoyable and challenging for us adults)! Thanks Escape Plan GA for the great time!

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Escape Plan Georgia in Atlanta
review: We went with a group of 3 to check out the Area 51 room. This was our 1st ever escape room experience and it did not disappoint. When we arrived we were greated by Grace (who was also our game master for the room) and asked to sign the typical "dont sue us waiver" . Once that was handled there was a short safety video and away we went. We were lead to our room and presented with a short introduction video which set the theme for the room and the game. After that the clock started and the game was on! I wont spoil anything but we barely made it out...it was super fun. A very good mix of brain teasers and puzzles and red herrings. Once we completed our adventure we were walked out to the photo area to discuss the room and take our victory photo! We will absolutely be returning again soon to try a different room :)

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Escape Plan Georgia in Atlanta
review: We had so much fun doing the Area 51 room! The props were great and the clues kept you on your toes. Would highly recommend this facility!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Apocalypse - Destination Paris" by ALL IN Adventures Lawrenceville in Atlanta
review: This was extremely hard the Zombie room. Won't be back, I need a drink!! Came out with Childrens Healthcare Buisness office department. Great team builder for those that think out the box.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Apocalypse - Destination Paris" by ALL IN Adventures Lawrenceville in Atlanta
review: Really fun and only $20!! Some friends and I from out of town really enjoyed this escape room! We did the Zombie Apocalypse Level 2. It had a 15% success rate and we would have made it through if we weren't just one number off! You have 50 minutes to find clues and get out and it was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Dino Island" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: I love this place! I was visiting a friend in Boca, and when our evening plans went south, I suggested we do an escape room. TMER was amazing on the phone (we called within two hours of closing) and directed us to make an easy reservation on their website. I've done two escape rooms at two other businesses and the Dino escape room was truly outstanding. The puzzles were harder (and a little more temperamental) than some of the other rooms I've done in the past but we made it with a just a couple minutes to spare! A good game master can make or break an escape room, and we were lucky that our game master was following closely and was clued into some of the minor difficulties we were having and was able to help us out when we needed and asked for it.We did Dino with three people (one of whom had a little too much to drink at dinner and possibly made it a little harder at times ) and it was challenging. Go with friends ... I'd say your best bet is to do this room with 4-6 people!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Dino Island" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: I did my second room here. We did the Escape From Dino Island. I absolutely loved it. The room was really cool. The puzzles were fun and challenging. We had the maximum 6 people in the room and finished with only a few minutes to spare. I like that this room has challenging yet fun puzzles but is not impossible to pass. I would go back and do another room with them.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Dino Island" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: We just played their new game Escape from Dino Island. WOW! That's all I can say is WOW. I was floored and amazed!  Simply the best escape room I've ever done! The props, scenery and atmosphere were amazing. I really felt like I was in Jurassic Park!The puzzles were SO clever and unique. They were challenging, yet so rewarding each time a puzzle was solved.

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: A friend of mine really wanted to try The Fortune Teller Room. I've done plenty of escapes rooms and immersive experiences over the last couple years, The Fortune Teller Room was definitely a breath of fresh air. I don't want to spoil too much, but the room was unique in terms of how puzzles and challenges are presented. Everyone had an opportunity to participate. The theme and story of room were spot on and immersive. No random items that feel out of place like directional locks or number locks. There room is challenging in a fun and clever way. If you have done escape rooms before, definitely check this one out with your escape group for a different type of escape room experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: "The Fortune Teller beckons you with a neon sign that reads free group readings.  Mistress Nova welcomed us from behind her velvet to get our tarot card reading.  The signs aren't good.  A mystery with dire consequences is a foot."What is in store is a fun, creepy, camp experience that was exceptionally executed in production with fun lighting, a playful background music, and delightful acting. The games were a lot of mini puzzles with a timed element like any good escape room but broken up with interaction with Mistress Nova to further the story.  The immersive aspect of the room was really amped up having to talk to our fortune teller.If you've been here before, you'll know that this is the same space that was used as the Disrupted Decades room but they've done a phenomenal job making the room its own experience that I couldn't tell at all what the room was before.Great job Level Games team!

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: Paid a wonderful visit to the new Fortune Teller room at Level Games. The fortune teller herself is more of a mediator than a medium. She will guide you through the narrative and provide some hints along the way.The room has great atmosphere. It is like an old penny arcade that has a variety of delightful challenges requiring problem and puzzle solving, dexterity, and creativity. Teamwork was encouraged and rewarded by our live Zoltar.We had a group of 3 and found that there was plenty for each person to do. They recommend 4 people for this max of 5 room. As the cards are dealt, the game design definitely benefits a group of 4.I can see great success for this room and continued success for Level Games in the future. The care and enthusiasm in the creation of this room is truly evident and incorporates all aspects that make an immersive/escape experience unforgettable.

room_title: Escape room "Saloon Showdown" by Try'n Escape in Denver
review: My friends and I love this escape room, Ingrid and her son Logan are so great and have made our experience unforgettable every time. The Sinking Ship is such a fun room where you are split up and have to work together in order to succeed. The Saloon Showdown room was super fun as well and really made us feel like we were trying to steal from the James gang. The rooms are beautiful, the stories are great, and the puzzles are really fun. I hear they are building a new room that will be a subway station scenario and i cant wait to get out there and try it. Try'n Escape is a must go for anyone looking for an all around great escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Saloon Showdown" by Try'n Escape in Denver
review: Saloon room is fun! Took some friends who were on a blind date, great way to interact and get to know one another while having a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Saloon Showdown" by Try'n Escape in Denver
review: This was our first Escape room and it was such a blast. We did the Saloon - one senior, one adult, and one 11 year old. We got stuck on a couple tangents and didn't get out of the room, but we had a blast trying to solve the clues and were so excited when we left we really wanted to try it again. The rooms are creative and full of fun surprises. Definitely worth a visit. We'll be back! I only wish they had more rooms so we'd have more to try. :)

room_title: Escape room "Space Station" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: The Space Station was awesome! Our party of nine, with ages from 7 to 70, had an absolute blast. We couldn't believe the details put into the rooms and the creativity behind the clues. This escape room is much better than others. Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Space Station" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: We had so much fun! Space Station room was a challenge but we made it out with 9 minutes to spare! Can’t wait to conquer the other rooms! Really wonderfully done and a great group activity! Money well spent!

room_title: Escape room "Space Station" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: We were the first group to try out the Space Station and had a great time! Pretty challenging but we made it out in time! We will definitely be back soon to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Timewarp Escape" by Timewarp Escape in Denver
review: This is my 3rd escape room in the Boulder/Denver area. The best thing about Timewarp Escape is the theme. If you love the 80's, you'll love this escape room. It's on par with other high rated escape rooms but with the 80's theme, it makes it all the more fun with the excellent 80's throwbacks. Fun times and highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "Timewarp Escape" by Timewarp Escape in Denver
review: We had so much fun! This room was challenging enough that it took us almost the full hour but was also designed to be fun, engaging and hopefully guide you to success. If you love the 80's or are just looking for a fun group activity, I highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Timewarp Escape" by Timewarp Escape in Denver
review: We do escape rooms regularly and I can honestly say this room was the most fun. We dressed up and everything! It really brought back memories from the 80's! But the best thing was the owner-operator. He made this experience that 5-star level. I would highly definitely recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Sara's Got a Secret" by Try-N-Escape in Miami
review: I highly recommend this activity for your next group event. Have done the Western Room and Sarah's got a Secret room. Both were challenging and fun.

room_title: Escape room "Sara's Got a Secret" by Try-N-Escape in Miami
review: Walk, run, drive, uber, I don't care what you have to do... go 'Try N Escape'!! This escape room was AMAZING. When we arrived, we were welcomed by one of the owners who was amazing and so, so friendly. He took the time to talk to me for a good 15 minutes after we escaped and I have tons of respect for an owner that will stop and talk to their customers. If I could rate it more than 5 stars, I really would. Highly, HIGHLY recommended. I did the "Sarah's got a secret" room with a friend and was blown away by how well put together and thrilling it was. I have been to numerous other escape businesses in the past all over South Florida and very few can even compare to the room I did here. If you are seeking an extraordinary, adrenaline filled, and unique bonding experience that is not just your run of the mill outing then you really need to get over there to 'Try N Escape'!!!

room_title: Escape room "Sara's Got a Secret" by Try-N-Escape in Miami
review: Beyond the best escape room I've ever been to. I'm disappointed to have to go to any other places knowing that this is my new standard. The rooms are designed down to the T. Everything makes sense while still being super challenging and surprising. The owner is the funniest and nicest guy ever. We were so pumped by last night's Sara's Got a Secret (which the description, though amazing, STILL doesn't do the room justice) that we're booking the other room tonight. The owner knows what he's doing and has been to enough escape rooms that he explained "this isn't like other escape rooms" before shutting the door on us. Beyond incredible. I would recommend Sara's Got a Secret to anyone who can handle some creepy plot lines, some scares (nothing too bad but be on guard), and a real challenge with my group's time to beat!

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Haunting of Camp Rutledge" by Escape Plan Georgia in Atlanta
review: My roommate and I went here for the first time a year ago and had an amazing time staff and owners were so friendly. We came back once we found out that the hunting at camp Rutledge was open. Group of 4 and our experience was unforgettable Eric and janelle were perfect hosts and game masters, so much so we came back the next night for bank heist. Perfect experience will definitely be back once hotel nightmares is up and running

room_title: Escape room "The Haunting of Camp Rutledge" by Escape Plan Georgia in Atlanta
review: The escape rooms are well-designed with great ambiance. We have always had a wonderful time here. I would recommend this to anyone, beginner or experienced.

room_title: Escape room "The Haunting of Camp Rutledge" by Escape Plan Georgia in Atlanta
review: We've visited an Escape room in another state and thought we'd introduce our friends to the one here in Loganville, GA.There were four of us and we had such an enjoyable time that after we completed Area 51, we went ahead and asked to try to complete The Haunting at Camp Rutledge if there was availability. There was and we completed that one too!Now our friends are wanting to introduce others to this great sleuthing entertainment.Staff was great and very personable, we highly recommend this location and will return in the near future when new themes are added.

room_title: Escape room "Biohazard" by DeadLocked Escape Rooms in Stamford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: What an amazing adventure!! We attempted 'The Heist' last night and had a blast! We were ready to take on another adventure as soon as we finished! We can't wait to come back again! Thank you for a fun filled night out!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Amazing! This was such a great experience. My friends and I wanted to do something different and fun, and this definitely hit the mark.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: What a great time! Totally worth the time and money! It's a great way to get your mind off of life! Definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Such a great team building exercise! Brought a bachelor party here, and we not only had a great time, but those of us who didn't know each other very well became much better friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: I loved this game so much. I came in by myself and your staff were super accommodating in putting me in a group. And super nice in moving me to another group when my original group didn't show up. Michelle in the lobby was super nice and helpful. Kaylyn (I think) was our guide and did a great job too. The group I was with was awesome and we solved THE HEIST with 9 minutes to spare. The game was super inventive and well thought out. I was so excited to do this and am so glad I did. Well worth the money

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Wow! Such a blast, amazing staff and worth every penny!!! We went for a bday celebration and we thoroughly enjoyed t. I can't wait to go back and do different room! So l, so, so much fun! I HIGHLY recommend it for all around fun!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Tried it for the first time with my family (group of 7) and we all had soooo much fun!! We did the Heist and made it out with a few minutes to spare. I highly recommend it and we are definitely going to come back and take a crack at the Prison room sometime.

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Crown" by Exit 2 Escape in San Jose
review: This was great fun for all ages. Can’t wait to go again. I recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Crown" by Exit 2 Escape in San Jose
review: Fun for our entire family! We can’t wait for more!

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Crown" by Exit 2 Escape in San Jose
review: We had 9 of us trying to escape, including 2 boys under 8. This is a great room and has many different locks and codes! I think you should give it a try! I can’t wait to do another one!

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Crown" by Exit 2 Escape in San Jose
review: You can tell they really love the escape room game. The puzzles were so nicely put together. Theming was great and construction was so high quality. The hosts were awesome too. Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Denver in Denver
review: Really impressed by this place!!First, I really appreciate that they have a bar and food on site. So show up early, have a drink, grab some food. We had a variety of apps and some beer. Ok then we did Under Pressure. This is one of their hardest rooms and we didn't make it out; bring a strong team if you're going to get this one. We have been to several different companies around town and this was one of the best. Two things we really appreciated the most:The room/tasks were well built and clean. There is nothing worse than a run-down room with crapped out locks or letters that have been rubbed off. This room had very good locks and tasks. So you knew that when a lock wasn't opening it was your fault, not just a bad product. Also, the tasks were very creative. Some more than others but we really liked a handful of the tasks. They were hard but still felt solvable. Sometimes you finish a room and realize you NEVER would have solved that. That's disappointing. This place didn't feel like that. The puzzles were certainly tough but with good communication and thinking we're all very doable. Overall this was a high-quality place with well thought out tasks. And they even have beer and food too! Thanks!

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Denver in Denver
review: Some friends and I were visiting Denver for a show at Red Rocks and decided to do an escape room at Escapology the day after. Most of us were still recuperating from the night before when we arrived at 330 PM but that didn't stop us from taking on the hardest room there. We chose "Under Pressure" which was a submarine themed Room. I thought the staff did a great job of explaining things  and the room was designed in a cool way. I hesitate to explain further because I would hate to give anything away for future players. The game was super engaging and really fun! We didn't escape :( but we were on the last puzzle so that's something? Also! They were doing a cross promotion with the Denver Museum of Nature & Science and we found four free tickets in one of our clue boxes. That was an unexpected, yet really great surprise!

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Denver in Denver
review: Went here for a team building event with my company. It was a great experience. Has a bar and food for before or after you escape (or not.) I didn't have any drinks, but we did have the catered taco bar, which was top notch.My group did the Under Pressure room, which is the hardest one at this location. We were told the room has a 9% success rate. We finished it we 10 minutes left on the clock. The initial puzzles were fairly easy, but became more complicated towards the end. This room was really engaging, and had a good story to go along with it. The one thing I didn't like was that you simply "escape" out the same door you come in, which was physically unlocked the whole time in case some needed to get out for an emergency. Overall it was a good experience, and I would definitely go back.

room_title: Escape room "Team Building! Apocalypse!" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Nightingale" by Golden Puzzle Room in Denver
review: Such a great escape room! My wife and I have done 7 escape rooms in various cities across the U.S. and this is one of the best.  We didn't see any spots open online to buy a time so we called and the owner was very accommodating and fit us in. We did the Nightingale room and it was a great challenge even for folks who have done escape rooms before.  All puzzles are very well done and require lots of thought.  Props are high quality and you can tell lots of thought went into creating the room.  We would recommend Golden Puzzle Room to anyone looking for a great time.

room_title: Escape room "The Nightingale" by Golden Puzzle Room in Denver
review: Had a great time here! The Nightingale was a fun and challenging room for two people. We didn't win, but were close (with some hints) and still had a really good time! I like that they give you clues when you're stuck, so you aren't wasting your time on one thing for your hour. Really like that you're not paired with other groups too. Will definitely be back to try the other room!

room_title: Escape room "The Nightingale" by Golden Puzzle Room in Denver
review: My friends and I had so much fun completing The Nightingale experience!  Arwen was such a great cluemaster and her hints were just enough to help us get to the next step!  The puzzles were very creative and we could tell a lot of time and effort went in to putting them all together.  Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: Had so much fun today.  Did the Mystery at Lost Point Lodge room with family and friends.Ok so we were more like a bunch of bumbling fools but we did figure out some clues on our own.   Wow Bobby and Monica were fun, friendly and professional.  Will be coming back again to try different rooms.The Ceniceros and Merlin family.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: My family and I escaped the Mystery at the Lost Point Lodge. When I first walked in, the room felt very authentic, the sounds, the props made me feel like I was in a lodge. The things we had to figure out and find was fun. It was a great experience overall and I hope to go back soon to escape some of their other puzzle rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: We did the Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge room and rented it out just for our group. The room itself was decorated very nicely and we definitely felt instantly immersed in the story provided -- it has a maximum of six people so it's definitely the perfect size for a private room. The gentleman that greeted us and gave us the story, and took us into the room was great as well! We did have a hiccup with the game master with 8 minutes left on the clock. However, the company reached out to us the following day to apologize -- they were training new staff and things just got a little out of order for a moment. We've since returned and attempted The Secrets of the Master. Our faith was definitely restored in them due to their quick and understanding customer service, as well as our great second experience!Regardless of the hiccup, the Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge was actually our favorite room out of the two. If you're a group that's looking for a creepy room that isn't necessarily scary, it's perfect. The puzzles for both rooms are very well put together and as newbie players we didn't stand a chance to escape without clues!

room_title: Escape room "Magic Kingdom" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I highly recommend LA Maze Rooms for anyone who is looking for a good time with friends. This was my first room at this company and it did not disappoint! I went with a group of 6 and I felt like you can definitely do this room with a smaller group because it was a little tight for 6. This is a good room for beginners because the puzzles were not overly difficult. The production value of this room was phenomenal, as this is not your average keys and locks type of escape room. If you're looking for a beginner friendly escape room with high production value, then this is the room for you.

room_title: Escape room "Magic Kingdom" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had a super fun time doing the Magical Kingdom! Really cool puzzles and the room looked amazing. Thanks Jay for being a great game master!

room_title: Escape room "Magic Kingdom" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This escape room was very different from the others I've been to. The Magic Kingdom was very interesting and creatively decorated!

room_title: Escape room "Magic Kingdom" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: It was so much fun. Really well done!! I can't wait to do another of their rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Magic Kingdom" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Highly recommend Maze to anyone who enjoys a fun challenge! Team work is a must, so is common sense, logic and the ability to laugh at yourself! Looking forward to our next visit and the opening of the "crime scene" room!

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Mummy" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Did "The Curse of the Mummy" escape room as a group. Every one had a great time. There is a large meeting area to wait comfortably for your party to arrive and room to be ready. There is a bar serving beer, wine and sodas. Free lockers to store your stuff. Photos not allowed in the escape room itself.

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Mummy" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Our group had an amazing time at this escape room. The facility was nice and our host/guide, Andrisse was funny and welcoming. We did the Mummy room and were able to escape! Tons of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Mummy" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: We did the Mummy room, and had a blast. Definitely needs a little out of the box thinking. I don't want to give away details, but you WILL have fun.

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Mummy" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: I purchased the Georgetown ERL's "Curse of the Mummy" room as a Friendsmas outing for me and my friends. The room was challenging, well themed with sophisticated gadgets and puzzles, and everyone had a great time channeling their inner-Indiana Jones.

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Mummy" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: My 2 cousins and I first time doing an escape room and we had so much fun. The pharaoh theme room we had was awesome. We would definitely do an escape room here again when we're back in DC!

room_title: Escape room "Kingdom of Cats" by Omescape in San Jose
review: Soooo much fun! Small spaces to crawl through and interesting puzzles. My son and I escaped with 5 minutes to spare..phew! I like the theme of the characteristics of cats throughout the room. Highly recommend!!

room_title: Escape room "Kingdom of Cats" by Omescape in San Jose
review: My boyfriend and I came here with our friends and we had a great time! My boyfriend booked the Cat Kingdom in advance which accommodates 6 people and is the least difficult out of all their rooms. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful as well to get us started.The process starts with everyone watching a video and getting a backstory about the room you enter and also the staff provides you guidelines so you can narrow down your search when looking for clues to help stay within the 1 hr time limit. Cat Kingdom is a great starter for anyone new to escape rooms as this one still gave us quite a bit of difficulty. The room is well designed and you really have to look at everything as a whole.Overall, we're definitely planning on coming back again to experience the rest of the rooms as we had lots of fun. We managed to escape just 1 minute before the time limit so hopefully for our next experience we will finish a bit faster.

room_title: Escape room "Kingdom of Cats" by Omescape in San Jose
review: Awesome game！

room_title: Escape room "Kingdom of Cats" by Omescape in San Jose
review: Lots of fun. Cash only.

room_title: Escape room "Kingdom of Cats" by Omescape in San Jose
review: This place is awesome! I will be going back to check out all the rooms!I was definitely scratching my head and racing against the clock to find my way out!

room_title: Escape room "Kingdom of Cats" by Omescape in San Jose
review: So much fun! Great team building! Can't wait to do it again

room_title: Escape room "Kingdom of Cats" by Omescape in San Jose
review: Awesome experience with friends! Can't wait to come back and try other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Bomb" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: We had a blast! We defused the bomb with 13 minutes to spare! Will definitely return to do this again. So much fun using logic to figure out the clues and escape. Go!

room_title: Escape room "The Bomb" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: Had a little trouble booking, but once we got there this was a blast! So ready to come back and do the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Bomb" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: Had an amazing time in Orlando at this place MindQuest Live. If you're ever near Universal and looking for a challenge, please visit this attraction...it's so much fun for a group (of any age). We finished our mission in a nick of time!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Bomb" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: Wicked place!!!! Loved it!!! Going back to complete other games asap - I'm hooked

room_title: Escape room "The Bomb" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: Absolutely awesome experience!!!! My family really enjoyed this experience. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Bomb" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: Another GREAT experience!!! Will be back for sure. The staff really make the experience seamless and fun!! Thanks MindQuest!

room_title: Escape room "The Bomb" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: This place is super fun! I've been twice now and we beat both puzzles but with only minutes to spare! It's a great way to spend an evening.

room_title: Escape room "Son of the Zodiac" by Quandary in New Haven
review: Son of Zodiac was a fun and challenging room. We made it out with 47 seconds to go!

room_title: Escape room "Son of the Zodiac" by Quandary in New Haven
review: The family wanted to try an escape room since a few of them have never done one so we went with the Zodiac Killer themed room. The puzzles and clues were very well done, the room was laid out great, and the atmosphere of the game was a lot of fun and very exciting. We didn’t beat the room but we had a blast and will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Son of the Zodiac" by Quandary in New Haven
review: What a fantastic time! Staff are the friendliest people you ever want to meet, and they put so much creativity to their Son of the Zodiac room. I would recommend this to anyone looking to have a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Son of the Zodiac" by Quandary in New Haven
review: We had 6 people in the Son of Zodiac, and each one of us partnered up to solve several puzzles. It was a lot of fun! We were able to escape with our lives with only 1 minute left. I would definitely come back to do the robbers one.

room_title: Escape room "Son of the Zodiac" by Quandary in New Haven
review: Such a fun time! Better go with some previous experience though. We all had a great time and can't wait to do again. The owners are amazing, the place was amazing and if you are back and forth debating if you will like it....trust me you will!!

room_title: Escape room "Alien Abduction" by The Ultimate Escape in Norwich
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz 1962" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: It was a lot of fun. We did Alcatraz and we barely escaped. Thanks for other folks in the group.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz 1962" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Sophia was awesome!! We had a great time escaping Alcatraz!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz 1962" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Easily the most fun thing we did all weekend. I cannot explain how great the staff was and how great the Alcatraz Room was. It was a little weird being in a room for 8 strangers at first, but it was really cool how quickly we were all laughing and cracking jokes with each other. I LOVED this experience!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz 1962" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Our 7, 8, and 15 year old all enjoyed it. They worked together and my husband and I worked together, and then we all worked together, it was awesome. Minimal arguing among the brothers as we stayed focused on the overall goal. We did the tomb experience (I picked it over Alcatrez, before I knew all my boys wanted the challenge of escaping Alcatrez, lol), but they still had fun and were engaged. This is one of the few places you can bring kids under 12. My youngest who will soon be 8 wasn't engaged for the full time, but he was captivated exploring the room for more than half of the experience, so I'd call that a win.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz 1962" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: If you're looking for a great escape room experience, I would highly recommend Time to Escape! My friends and I went to celebrate a birthday. We arrived 15 minutes early as recommended to complete our waiver forms. The waiver forms were super simple and it only took us 30 seconds to fill it out. There was only one lady working that evening and she was super friendly! Also, the waiting area and restrooms were neat and clean. We did Escape From Alcatraz with a group of 10 people and had a great time! The room set up is really awesome and it will definitely force you to work together. We completed the room with the help of a few clues from the staff when we were stuck and we made it out with only 1 minute left! We had a great time and we will definitely be returning to try King Tut's Tomb.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Plan" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: Came here for my daughter's 12th birthday. She went into the jail escape room with five of her friends and they ALL had blast! They can't wait to get back to see if they can finally escape the prison.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Plan" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: We did the Escape Room at the Buford location and it was the most fun any of us has had in a long time! It was great that all of us had a part in solving the many clues and eventually busting out of that jail! Can't wait to come back and try another one of the rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Plan" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: We did the prison cell room and man, was it a blast! So many pieces that were needed to complete the puzzle and so many pieces that just threw you off the trail of what you needed to do. Russell was our game master and he made it awesome from before we even got in the room! We had a great time and we will most definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Ringmaster's Den" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: My family and I had a great time! The Ringmasters Den was quite challenging, but fun to figure out. We can't wait to do another escape room with Breakout Escape Rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Ringmaster's Den" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: Our group just finished (well not really, lol) the Ringmaster room! It was so much fun! Jeremey, our faithful ringmaster assistant was amazing! We highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Ringmaster's Den" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: We did the Ringmaster den and had a ball! We're going back to do another room!

room_title: Escape room "Ringmaster's Den" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: Me and my fiance's family went to the Ringmasters Room, very fun experience, managed to solve the puzzles with 7 mins to spare, pretty challenging but a great experience, definitely want to come back and try the Zombie Roadhouse!

room_title: Escape room "Ringmaster's Den" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: We found Breakout Orlando on Groupon and decided to take a stab at the Ringmaster's Den. This room was unlike any other we have done. They did an amazing job and we really had to think out of the box. I'll definitely go back to try out the other rooms soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery in Room 23" by Time to Escape in Okeechobee
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Castaway" by Padlocked Inc. in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Specimen" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Specimen and the Curse at this location are just AWFUL. Wish they would trade these rooms out. Try M.A.S.K and Hive Mind here and skip these two.

room_title: Escape room "Specimen" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Went here last minute. We did Specimen which is not typical of escape rooms that we have done in the past. No locks or areas where small groups work alone. This is all or nothing. We would go back for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Specimen" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: I would recommend the SPECIMEN room for all around family fun. The combination of cleanliness and new technology really gave off a Disney-like feel. The room was challenging and beautifully built!! Great job Puzzah!! Looking forward to trying the next two rooms planned to open at the new location!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: By far the best escape room venue in the valley. We did the Mad Hatter room and it was so gorgeously decorated. It was challenging and the puzzles were so creative. I can't wait to try out all their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Excellent staff- excellent service- excellent experience. Our group of ten did The Mad Hatter and we had a blast!  The rooms are super fun!! If you like escape rooms - you'll love Eludsions!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: The four of us did the mad hatter and escaped in 45 min! It was definitely challenging but very fast paced and fun. Loved the decor. We loved it so much we did the runestones one right after. That one was fun too, but we preferred the mad hatter because it was more exciting.

room_title: Escape room "Scooby-Doo" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: First time playing! Cuban Missile Crises was tough, but a lot of fun. What an adrenaline rush!

room_title: Escape room "Scooby-Doo" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: We had such an awesome time. Exceeded my expectations! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Scooby-Doo" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Wow super cool went with our two 14yo's and our 10yo and we all had a blast. It's not easy but is possible if your very observent and think especially with the hints offered by the game master that watches your game from outside. Staff is super friendly and can't wait to do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Scooby-Doo" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: This was an amazingly fun time! We did Cuban Crisis and Shanghaied and loved our time! Staff provided EXCELLENT customer service and kept it upbeat and positive even if we got stuck. We will definitely be back!!!

room_title: Escape room "Scooby-Doo" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Is super fun and interactive game Inside room looking clue and try complete the puzzle to get out the room before one hour .

room_title: Escape room "Scooby-Doo" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: What a great experience....well worth the money.

room_title: Escape room "Scooby-Doo" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Just exactly difficult enough. We finished Cuban Crisis in fifty-four minutes. Frankly, I don't want a room that only 1.5% of people can solve. These are great.

room_title: Escape room "The Backstage" by Forbidden Escape in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Operation BRAVO" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: Our family had a great experience today in the Operation Bravo escape room. It was intriguing and entertaining. Justin did a great job of sharing his knowledge and enthusiasm to make it a successful, fun time! We would highly recommend it. We escaped which made it even better!

room_title: Escape room "Operation BRAVO" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: T.J. - Operation BravoThe best EVER! Will definitely be returning because of T.J.’s awesome spirit and ability to create such a fun experience for our team.

room_title: Escape room "Operation BRAVO" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: After a disastrous experience in another escape room in the area.. Big Escape Rooms, to be exact, we were somewhat nervous going in to this one. We had great experiences in other escape rooms, but that one previous room was such a disappointment, we didn't know how this one would turn out.We did the Operation Bravo room. There was a minor issue with a monitor, so our room monitor came in, took care of it, and added time back to account for the issue. The entire rest of the room worked perfectly and we were able to escape with room to spare.When you have a team taking care to ensure a positive customer experience, you get five stars out of me.

room_title: Escape room "Nature Ninja" by Escape Woods in Atlanta
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Egyptian Tomb Escape" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: We went as a family (ages 8, 15, 17 and parents) for my daughter's 15th b-day. She wanted to try the Egyptian room and we were blown away by the intricacies and level of puzzles. We escaped (my daughter and husband are gamers) with 15 seconds left! It was so much fun we can't wait to go back. So much happened in the hour we were trying to recall everything and what was in all the rooms. The puzzles and decor were so professional that we are now spoiled by this company. Don't waste your money at other places. The staff was very professional and friendly too!

room_title: Escape room "The Egyptian Tomb Escape" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: This is my second time coming here I had previously been here last year. I went with a group of friends for my wife's birthday celebration and we had a great time. We barely made it out of the Egyptian Tomb with just 40 secs left but we had a blast figuring it all out. We definitely had to work together and do our part to get it solved. By the time the hour was up we were exhausted but relieved to have walked out victorious.The staff was very helpful in explaining the rules to those playing for the first time. I will definitely be back again. Just waiting for them to open up the Dinosaur one.

room_title: Escape room "The Egyptian Tomb Escape" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: The best escape room in town! I think this was the 11th escape room we have done so far. We did the Egyptian game and it surpassed all our expectations. The puzzles were fresh and interesting. It was one of the most challenging rooms I have done but still great fun.The rooms were easy to navigate, and at no point did we feel trapped or anything and there was even a fan inside to help keep us cool.Sadly, we didn't escape. I will definitely come back to play the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Egyptian Tomb Escape" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: This place did not disappoint! My friends and I had a great time! It was 8 of us in the Egyptian burial site room. We were so clueless at first. I had no idea what i was doing in the first 10mins maybe, but along the way, our combined brains (and a few free hints!) figured it all out. We had 4 minutes to spare when we got out. I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "The Egyptian Tomb Escape" by Master Escape Room in Miami
review: Went with the fam and we had a great time! Very well thought out; the creativity and organization surpassed my expectations. My best escape room experience by far. Can't wait til they open the new room. Staff was phenomenal.

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Super fun! We did the agency room and it was so cool! It had three different rooms you could work your way towards after solving each step. We were one minute away from escaping it! I'm addicted for sure.

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Loved the spy room about the secret agent. Fun and challenging and we worked as a team with another family that we didn't know. That made the experience all the more fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: This place is loads of fun. Great team building opportunity and to work together with co-workers on solving clues. Definitely coming back.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum: Ward 5" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape In Space" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: Best escape room I have done. I have been to dozens of escape rooms across several states and this one takes the cake. There is unique rooms and creative puzzles. You won't find another escape room like this. The staff made you feel like you were family. Not a single complaint, still on the adrenaline rush.

room_title: Escape room "Escape In Space" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: Super awesome experience! I came with a group of 3 others and we did the Space themed room and I have to say it is one of my all time favorite rooms. Very well decorated and immersive and a very challenging game. The staff is very friendly and welcoming and overall we had a wonderful time. Will absolutely be back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Escape In Space" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: Came and played the space room with 3 of my friends and I have to say, this is probably the best escape room I have ever played. The theme was incredible and I felt like I was actually in space. This room was challenging, but we managed to make it out! The staff was super friendly and welcoming, and the location was awesome as well. Will definitely be coming back to try some of the other rooms. Thanks for all the help Tammy!

room_title: Escape room "Escape In Space" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: We had a blast. We were short a few steps from escaping the meteor shower, but had a great time! My husband and I and our 10 and 12 year old daughters had to work together to get to the emergency pod to escape the giant meteor headed for our space lab. Good family fun without the cell phones was really nice! The staff there was kind and helpful! We will be back with success next time!

room_title: Escape room "Escape In Space" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: We booked the Space room. What a fun, fabulous time we had! It's very creative and challenging! We highly recommend this for a fun experience!

room_title: Escape room "Operation Counterpart" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Really enjoyed this experience. The host Jeremy was helpful when we needed a nudge in the right direction. I would recommend this escape the room experience.

room_title: Escape room "Operation Counterpart" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Awesome! Had a lot of fun

room_title: Escape room "Operation Counterpart" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: It was an awesome day!!! Family and friends gathered here for our bachelor/bachelorette party!!! Lots of fun!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Journey to the Surface of the Earth" by Clueology Rooms in Fort Collins
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Blind Tiger" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: I went to EscapeSF with 4 other friends to do the Blind Tiger room. I've done about 15-20 escape rooms total at this point and it solidly lands in the middle in terms of enjoyment. We escaped with a little over 10 minutes left.The setup was pretty cool but I felt that the puzzles were a little rudimentary and seemingly a little random at times. They also did not really tie together all that well in my honest opinion. We also had quite a few components of the room that were broken when we went which further detracted from the quality of the experience. All in all, I still enjoyed the room, but I don't feel that it is as good as other reviews would lead you to think it is.

room_title: Escape room "Blind Tiger" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Went again to try Blind Tiger and it was amazing! Was able to see Leo for a bit and also a fantastic game master, forgot her name but she had beautiful rainbow dyed hair :) so fun! And we escaped with a few minutes to spare

room_title: Escape room "Blind Tiger" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: So fun! They have that new room "Blind Tiger," which based on prohibition era rum running. Enjoyed this as a work team building event.

room_title: Escape room "Blind Tiger" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Went again to try Blind Tiger and it was amazing! Was able to see Leo for a bit and also a fantastic game master, forgot her name but she had beautiful rainbow dyed hair :) so fun! And we escaped with a few minutes to spare

room_title: Escape room "Blind Tiger" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: My second time ever doing an Escape room and I would say EscapeSF is AMAZING! Hands down. The location doesn't stick out too much but you can't really miss it on Kearny! You can take public transportation or even drive and park at that underground parking lot of the play ground if you'd like.I got a LivingSocial deal and thought, why not! $80 is a steal. Especially since the weekend evening price was $139 or something. But hence the fact when you purchase the deal that they have restricting days for certain pricing! Following the instructions of booking your reservation is super easy, but I was a little confused if Antique room was the only option for booking or if the link provided to book had Antique's page as default trying to book a time with EscapeSF. So we ended up doing the Antique room and LOVED IT! Though my friends (3 others) and I didn't succeed, I had tons of fun!The main reason why I give this place 4 stars instead of 5 is because there was a few times where my friends and I had no idea what triggered us to solving some of the puzzles... Sometimes they would just happen. I guess I'm just comparing my first experience of doing an escape room and they had where you had to unlock a bunch of stuff so I was expecting that but nonetheless, this concept was SICK. P.S.: Tiffany and Allison were awesome employees! Getting us started and answered our questions in the end. AND they're coming out with a third room - Blind Tiger - coming out in August!!! I can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Blind Tiger" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: blind tiger- 12th escape gamewe loved the other 2 rooms so much that the owner brought us in to beta test their newest room, blind tiger. the premise was really cool and our group liked the game a lot.. ranking the rooms here -antique-blind tiger-alcatrazevery game is awesome so be sure to try them all.. now off to sj for back to back escape games..

room_title: Escape room "The Painter's Collection" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: So, I did not escape this room :(. However, despite my failure I have to rate this 5/5 because it was phenomenal. This is the hardest room they have and by FAR the hardest room I've ever done. I truly felt that I lost this room fairly and squarely (and I don't say this often lol). Before starting this room, you have a choice of picking it in difficult mode and of course being with fellow avid players, they chose the HARDEST MODE. That was our first mistake. I probably wouldn't pick the hard mode unless you had at least 5 people all of whom have done 20-30+ rooms. This was a true v4 room with little to no keys/locks. Lots of puzzles to solve and definitely a lot of puzzles that I have NEVER SEEN and was WOW'd once clue master explained it to us. This room put lots of different skills to the test and made us quickly realize our weaknesses. I highly recommend this room!

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: I came with my crew from work and it was a fun time. It was tough at first, but Rosa, our awesome guide helped us with good clues! Rosa took good care of us.

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: even though we failed to escape we had a great time. our game master was very helpful and made the experience very enjoyable. the only drawback was actually finding the building! But hey all part of the fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: We went for my bestfriends birthday to Atlanta and decided to go to breakout games, it was fun! Don't underestimate the challenge!

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: So much fun! This was our second breakout game at this location and I will definitely be coming back for more.

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: My husband and I had a great time! Even though we did not escape from 'Do Not Disturb', we had a great time! It was difficult for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Deadwood Mansion VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: We tried the "Deadwood Mansion" with a party of 3 and had a really good time. Will be definitely going back a few more times with more friends,Staff were very friendly and amenable. Recommend trying the pirate adventure if you don't like horror.

room_title: Escape room "Deadwood Mansion VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: Omg this place and the people and the experience were amazing! Customer service is spot on, they are always ready to make your experience one of a kind. The explanations were detailed on to what to expect. We played deadwood mansion and thrilled with fun.Great recommend for team building activities,corporate event or plain ole fun

room_title: Escape room "Deadwood Mansion VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: Did the Deadwood Mansion, super intensive! I'll try the curse of Davy Jones next time! Nice staff and services. Recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Special Agent - Destination Langley" by ALL IN Adventures Waterbury in Southington
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: This was an awesome escape room!  Very well done, no red herrings, and an appropriate amount of encouragement from the Game Master (Dillion).  The puzzles were great and plentiful.  The room was very professional and functioned as designed.  There were no cheesy puzzles or tricks that were stupid, as sometimes happen.  Just a Grade-A experience.  And no, we didn't solve it by the time limit, but they let us continue, and we got out about 10 minutes later.  The first escape room we didn't complete, but probably still the most fun and most challenging.  Also, the room was well-lite, so you can see without straining.  I've been in escape rooms where you can't read the combination locks because it was so dark...very frustrating...but that didn't happen here. You will not be disappointed.  Highly recommended.  A word of caution...don't leave anything in your vehicle while you do the escape room.  Our van was broken into and we lost some stuff.  It was our fault, we had been told earlier in the week in San Francisco not to leave anything visible in your vehicle, or they will smash and grab...and it happened to us.  Live and learn.  Good luck!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: This was my first escape room experience. Holy awesomeness this was one of the most amazing, fun, and catching experiences I have had!!!! The Houdini Escape Room is cleverly thought out and a fantastic puzzling challenge. If you are ever in the San Francisco area, this is a great place to go to!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: The Houdini Room is amazing. We went with a group of friends before dinner (makes a great night!). Chris (the room's creator and operator) is incredibly smart and was kind enough to spend time with us explaining how the room worked, the history of the many innovators represented in the room, etc. This is both an interesting and educational time!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: This escape room was incredible, by far the best I've seen. There was so much detail in every aspect of the puzzles and scenery at large. I definitely hope to solve more of these well-made rooms by Palace Games, but the Houdini Escape will surely stay up for some time. I wait with bated breath!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: We visited the Houdini escape room as a team building exercise for work.This was really an remarkable experience. It was fun, challenging, required team work, and definitely tested our problem solving and collaboration skills.The META analytics provided at the end of the experience were a great conversation starter about what worked and what didn't.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: I'm a big fan of San Francisco history (and turn-of-the-century history in general). Located in the old Exploratorium building at the Palace of Fine Arts, where currently housed is the wonderful Innovation Hangar exhibition of old Panama-Pacific International Expo historic items, you'll find the Palace Games' Great Houdini Escape Room. This is the same room that Houdini presented to his notable friends 100 years prior. With a team of friends, you'll use your wits and teamworking skills to solve your way out of the room. It's challenging and very, very fun. Not sure when the Houdini room ends, but from what they've told us, we can expect a spy-themed room coming in the future.Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: Houdini Escape was a great experience! Went with a group of 11, and we all enjoyed it thoroughly. Puzzles were fun and challenging, the entire room and atmosphere were all very nicely designed. 10/10 would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: The Houdini Escape Room is by far the best escape room I have done. The puzzles were all well thought out and much more creative than the standard combo-lock puzzles I've seen in the other rooms. The puzzles are challenging, but all of them made sense and there no crazy leaps that you had to make to solve it. The room itself is well put together with an underlying theme that pulls everything together and enhances the experience. The only downside of the Houdini Escape Room is that I fear that no other escape room will ever live up to this new standard.I definitely recommend the Houdini Escape Room as it is not only extremely fun and challenging, it is also the best escape room out there.

room_title: Escape room "The Hotel" by Mission: Escape Atlanta in Atlanta
review: My whole family had a ball! It was the perfect day after Christmas activity to do together. Hopefully we can make it a tradition!

room_title: Escape room "The Hotel" by Mission: Escape Atlanta in Atlanta
review: This was a blast! Definitely a must for anyone looking for a group activity with friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Hotel" by Mission: Escape Atlanta in Atlanta
review: So damn fun! Highly recommend and so doing this again. Didn't fully solve our puzzle, but got really close. These puzzles are a decent level of difficulty without being frustrating. Each solved puzzle experience was satisfying and felt genuinely earned. Bring your own group of friends or share with strangers.

room_title: Escape room "The Hotel" by Mission: Escape Atlanta in Atlanta
review: My son and his girlfriend took me and the rest of the family here for my 59th birthday. OMG! What an amazing time we had! The staff was incredible and the "Mission" top notch. By far one of the best birthdays ever. We had so much fun trying to figure out the puzzles and felt so exhilarated when we escaped the room! I highly recommend this place and will be going back when they open the new room. Can't wait! We also made 2 new friends locked in that room for ALMOST an hour. YES WE DID ESCAPE!

room_title: Escape room "The Hotel" by Mission: Escape Atlanta in Atlanta
review: We had such an incredible time! It was great joining the 10% who have managed to escape the Hotel! We finished at the absolute LAST second!! Our only regret is that we forgot to get our picture taken afterwards. Oh well!We will definitely be returning to try the Study as well!  This was my first escape game experience and it was well worth the money!

room_title: Escape room "The Hotel" by Mission: Escape Atlanta in Atlanta
review: This place was a blast!!I had never heard of escape games, and this was one of the most fun things I have ever done. The owners were super personable, friendly, and helpful! They have really created something amazing. What a great way to spend a night!

room_title: Escape room "The Hotel" by Mission: Escape Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Today was my first experience in this type of entertainment place-- I will definitely be back!! We had 5 in our group to work our way out of the HOTEL--- it was loads of fun!! I would recommend this for anyone looking for something fun to do with friends or family.    The staff were well prepared and ready for us to start our adventure and we had a fantastic time.   GO CHECK IT OUT!!!!   You won't regret it !!

room_title: Escape room "Saving Santa" by Escapology Trumbull in Danbury
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Magician’s Audition" by Escape Rooms Unlocked in Fort Myers
review: This was our second visit. The first time my son (17), his friend (16) and I experienced the Magician's room. We had a great time! Today my son brought his girlfriend and we were successful again but with 0 seconds left on the clock! It was down to the wire! Special thanks to the owners! They were polite, helpful and very personable and professional! I highly recommend this place for older kids and adults alike! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "The Magician’s Audition" by Escape Rooms Unlocked in Fort Myers
review: This was amazing! Did the magician room tonight with a group of seven. I will return to do the other room. So much fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Magician’s Audition" by Escape Rooms Unlocked in Fort Myers
review: Our family did the Magician’s Audition on New Years Eve. What a great time! Everyone enjoyed themselves. The room was well thought out and very clever! The establishment was very clean and sleek. Staff is superb! We made it out with almost 12 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Rendezvous" by One Way Out Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: We have done all but two of the rooms at One Way Out. We have thoroughly enjoyed all of them. Our favorite was the Rendezvous room. The staff there are wonderful and and each room is exciting and thought provoking. This is a great family, friend, and team-building activity.

room_title: Escape room "Rendezvous" by One Way Out Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: This is only the second escape room I've done and I'll definitely be back for more. My family and I did the "Rendezvous" room and it was an absolute blast for all of us. Well thought out, well designed, and highly immersive. The staff did an excellent job at getting us situated (each room is a chapter in a whole story, so if starting out of order they make sure you're up to speed) and made it challenging, but it's supposed to be! I'm already looking to come back with friends, coworkers and anyone else who's up for a good time. You won't be disappointed with your visit!

room_title: Escape room "Rendezvous" by One Way Out Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: My fiancé’s family came to visit us and we had the idea to go to an escape room at the last minute. We ended up at One Way Out because they were the only place open at such a late hour. The Rendezvous room wasn’t our first choice, but it was the only available room (again, we got there about 10:45 pm). I cannot even begin to tell you how much fun we had!!! We didn’t even complete the room, but we still had an unbelievable time! It was like being on the set of an action movie! It’s a little more difficult than other escape rooms I’ve heard about, but the experience is totally worth it! I can’t wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Jig" by GR8 Escape Challenge in Sarasota
review: Had a great time doing the Cabin in the Woods. We actually escaped! Will be doing it again in the near future.

room_title: Escape room "Jig" by GR8 Escape Challenge in Sarasota
review: Went to Escape Room Sarasota yesterday. We chose Cabin in the Woods and the four of us were one lock away from escaping. It was a blast and we want to try this again sometime.

room_title: Escape room "Jig" by GR8 Escape Challenge in Sarasota
review: Took my girlfriend here and we had a great time! We did the “Cabin in the woods”. Definitely will be coming back for the other one. Thanks again!

room_title: Escape room "Spoopy's Ghoulish Graveyard Gameshow" by Doldrick's Escape Room in Orlando
review: Such a fun experience! This was my first escape room and it was so much fun! Definitely would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Spoopy's Ghoulish Graveyard Gameshow" by Doldrick's Escape Room in Orlando
review: This place is amazing. 4 rooms and more replace to expand. The owners are top notch as well as their games are. Very friendly, welcoming, and over all want the best experience for their customers as they can do. Worth every cent of a full priced game as an escape room can get.

room_title: Escape room "Spoopy's Ghoulish Graveyard Gameshow" by Doldrick's Escape Room in Orlando
review: We played both Captn Spoopy Bones and the Graveyard Gameshow games.When we travel we hit escape rooms all around the country. These rooms came highly rated for fun and puzzles and did not disappoint at all. But what took them to an even higher level was the staff who did their best to let us play as long as it took to finish (we were a team of 2 and that was a bit light for the Capn). Even late, late at night after a day of amusement parks, they made sure we had a great time.If you are going to Orlando, Doldrick's should not be missed - so much pirate fun!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Symbology Escape Rooms in San Jose
review: Wonderland is an escape room with creative puzzles and generic lock & key mechanics. It's low tech, but I had a lot of fun here. The multiple, nonlinear puzzles was probably the best part. The decor was definitely immersive and a treat to see.

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Symbology Escape Rooms in San Jose
review: The Paradox Escape Room for the Wonderland puzzle room was a really great interactive escape room with lots of puzzles to solve! Many locks, keys, and puzzles are involved which were very well themed to Alice in Wonderland.  The room was definitely a good amount of puzzles for even a large group of people, and it would likely be needed to have at least 5 or 6 people to succeed the room with good probability- I saw some pictures that two people could do this but wow I am amazed at that :)

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Symbology Escape Rooms in San Jose
review: A hole through the walls, an escape from the maddening reality, and back into wonderland we go! I adored this place with its adorable story line and personable host.Our team consisted of four close friends (including myself) and two strangers (whom we got to know throughout the game), so six in total! Everyone played a crucial role in solving the puzzle.Tip for advanced players: This is a good challenge to do without any hints and about 4 players.Tip for beginners: They give 5 hints maximum, so use them wisely. I would recommend 8 people: the more brain power, the better!I would recommend this place to everyone.

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Symbology Escape Rooms in San Jose
review: This was my first time doing an escape room, and It was probably the most fun experience I've had in my life being locked in a room for an hour.Also, thanks to Alex for being such a wonderful host and guiding us in going down the rabbit hole

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Symbology Escape Rooms in San Jose
review: The rooms were well decorated and the puzzles were fun and a little challenging. Our group worked great to get the puzzles solved we ended up with the top time!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Symbology Escape Rooms in San Jose
review: Such a fun experience! The rooms are so well decorated and it feels so real when you are solving the puzzles. I would recommend this for anyone looking for fun new things to do in the area!

room_title: Escape room "Diner" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Awesome escape rooms! We did both The Diner and Speakeasy - both incredible rooms, though my favorite was The Diner (and has now become my favorite room I've ever done). You can't go wrong with either room though. Creative puzzles to solve, lots of fun and unique twists - truly the most enjoyable escape room I've done as compared to several others around the nation. Owners/designers were fun to visit with afterwards. Definitely visit this place if you are ever in the San Diego area!

room_title: Escape room "Diner" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Super fun! I've done a handful of escape rooms, and I don't want to be told answers. We got out with 6 minutes left and only needed one clue, and it wasn't an answer, just a gentle nudge in the right direction. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Diner" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: I've done over 60 escape rooms, and the Diner ranks very well. The puzzles are well designed, with appropriate clues provided. Our solving experience was very logical, and I love how appropriate the decor was! We had a lot of fun and look forward to returning for more!

room_title: Escape room "Diner" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: My girlfriends and I just got back from an escape room weekend in San Diego. We did the Diner room, and it was one of our favorites of the weekend! Production value was high, and we had so much fun escaping this room! I look forward to coming back and trying the Speakeasy room soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: This was my first escape room. I had an absolute blast. The puzzles were fun, varied, and some were quite tough! Our Game Master was super friendly, even letting us go back into the room afterwards to talk about the design a bit more, and catch up on puzzles we'd missed (since we divided & conquered our way through most). Loved the setting and theme -- and learned a bit about some historical figures along the way.

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: My friends and I have done both the Houdini and Roosevelt rooms by Palace Games. They're incredible, challenging, and so much fun! The production quality is spectacular. The staff is amazing. Check them out!

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: Wow! Every experience I have had with Palace Games so far has been exceptional! The staff is amazing, the stories behind the puzzles are fun, and most of all, the puzzles are challenging! I have been here twice, once for the Houdini Room and once for the Roosevelt Room. Both times were fun, but I preferred the Roosevelt Room slightly more than the Houdini Room. I might also add that we escaped both times! We didn't need any hints in the Roosevelt Room and we still managed to escape in 72 minutes. One thing that was exceptional about our run in the Roosevelt Room was our host, Alan. He was funny and very helpful. If you are into escape rooms, I would definitely check out Palace Games. Their rooms are elaborate and very fun! They are making a an Edison room, so stay tuned.

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: We came here on New Year's Eve to submit ourselves to one last challenge for the year, and we sure got it! We skipped right to the Roosevelt Room and were impressed with the design, intricacy and overall production quality. It was cool that the story was also designed with the history of the Palace of Fine Arts in mind. Will be back to try out the Houdini Room!

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: I had a great time. The attention to detail is awesome and the puzzles are very thoughtfully set up. Also got a little bit of a history lesson and got to know about all the wonderful people that this room pays tribute to.Also from what my friends tell me this is the best escape room they've been to.

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: I have been to a few other escape rooms around the bay but this one stands a head above the rest. The detail and sophiscation of the room is ridiculous! I would highly recommend it to anyone, even if you don't fancy yourself a puzzle person (I'm not!) there is something for everyone.

room_title: Escape room "Movie Mayhem" by Codeword Escape in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: After doing 50+ rooms, this is one of my all-time favorite rooms. Unique puzzles that fit the themes nicely. The cleanest design I have ever seen and was esthetically beautiful. A mix of modern and traditional elements. I highly recommend any of the Lock Down rooms. The staff was friendly and very accommodating with the booking process. I am usually not a fan of walkie-talkies for hints. However, the walkie-talkies used were simple, worked well, and hints were given quickly demonstrating that the game master was tracking our progress carefully. Lock Down delivers a solid A+ escape room experience which can be a rare find these days.

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Very fun! We did Chem lab and Samurai tonight (beat the Samurai record!). Clean location. Great employees. Great rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Did Theft and Samurai yesterday. It was defiantly on our top list of escape rooms. The rooms are fairly spacious so large groups can fit very comfortably. Staff was fun to talk too. Definitely coming back to try out Chem Lab.

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We have gone to many escape rooms and really enjoy a good challenge. The rooms here are fun, challenging, too notch. Great place for date night, team building or even the whole family( we brought our 14, 13 & 9 years old kids). I can't say enough about how nice the staff there is, friendly, helpful and very professional! We will be back for a third time soon!
