room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: There are a wealth of great room escape options in the East Valley and Lockdown rates among or at the top of the list.  Our team completed the Theft and Samurai rooms and were thoroughly impressed by each of them.  The puzzles are clever, engaging, and challenging.  Better yet, they truly feel as if they are organic and belong in their environments.  What sets Lockdown apart from other escape rooms is their commitment and attention to a particular aesthetic.  They have realized that challenge does not have to detract from the overall immersion of a room escape experience.  Their design principles are a welcome change from the many rooms where escaping the zombie apocalypse, a fallout shelter, or an alien research facility requires the unlocking of a half dozen bike locks.Lockdown is a challenging, affordable, and engaging option for a group room escape.  Their staff is friendly, enthusiastic, and welcoming.  We will surely be back to enjoy their other experiences.

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Today was our first visit to an escape room. We did Samurai and had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Flashover!" by The Crooked Key in Steamboat Springs
review: We had a great time. We got out in 50:30. Very clever setup and everyone had to work together to solve it. X was a great game master. We will definitely be coming back.

room_title: Escape room "Flashover!" by The Crooked Key in Steamboat Springs
review: The staff was great and we had so much fun trying to figure out the Flashover! room. It was challenging, but not too hard. We had a group of 4 and we solved it.

room_title: Escape room "Flashover!" by The Crooked Key in Steamboat Springs
review: We did the flashover! game and it was the best escape game we have ever done. Fun, unique puzzles and great clues from Olivia! Amazing experience all around from the props to the photos at the end! We highly recommend this escape game!

room_title: Escape room "Flashover!" by The Crooked Key in Steamboat Springs
review: Had a great time in the fire rescue themed room! Great way to spend some family time in Steamboat. Special thanks to Ben and Rob. Will definitely be back to try the Wild West room on our next trip back.

room_title: Escape room "Flashover!" by The Crooked Key in Steamboat Springs
review: Our group did the Flashover game - for most of us, it was our first time at an escape room. I'd recommend to anyone that hasn't tried this before. You will definitely want to try the other game. We had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Flashover!" by The Crooked Key in Steamboat Springs
review: We had the absolute best tome! We booked quite randomly and it turned out to be even more fun then we expected! And we learned how well we work together as a family team. We rescued all the pets in Flashover with only 1 hint in 44 minutes. Would definitely recommend this!

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned Basement" by The Hour Room in San Diego
review: First escape room I've ever done and it was excellent! Plenty of different variety of clues and challenges. All of the puzzles and clues were rational and I never felt cheated when they were solved.I was afraid there would be random scary things popping out because I hate haunted mazes, but safe to say even if you hate scary movies you'll be fine here. Would recommend to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned Basement" by The Hour Room in San Diego
review: This was my fourth escape room, and it was super fun! Really well thought out puzzles. You have to work fast and work well together as a team to escape! Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned Basement" by The Hour Room in San Diego
review: Fantastic gameplay and the theme was solid! You felt immersed the moment you stepped in. Perfect amount of creepy without being scary. Great for all ages and abilities. Everyone in town should be checking this out!

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned Basement" by The Hour Room in San Diego
review: Awesome room! Super creepy with clever clues! I highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned Basement" by The Hour Room in San Diego
review: Some friends and I went to The Hour Room tonight to celebrate a birthday, and we all had so much fun! The story was really well thought out and really fun! My team got out with 13 minutes to spare. The space was really big, much bigger than other escape rooms I’ve done! I would definitely recommend The Hour Room!

room_title: Escape room "Return of Bootlegger Warehouse" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: I've done around 15 escape rooms and this one is my least favorite so far. Without giving anything away, there were about 100 keys in this room, if not more... The room didn't require much skill, most of the time we were just trying every key on every lock until we got the right one.... It was pretty annoying.

room_title: Escape room "Return of Bootlegger Warehouse" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: so much fun. We did both rooms available in one day and both were very different and challenging. Will definetly be back to try the new rooms when they come up!!

room_title: Escape room "Return of Bootlegger Warehouse" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: This was my first time doing one of these rooms so I don't have much to compare with, that being said I had a blast. It was challenging and forces you to work together with your team, so pick people you like and work well with. My team rocked, we only used two clues and made it out with 20 minutes to spare � we all had a great time and can't wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: Visited this place for a corporate event and loved it. I've been to several of these escape rooms and this was by far the cleanest one. The game was well organized and challenging. Everything about this location was top notch. Highly recommend. We did the bank heist theme and everyone loved it.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: This was an awesome experience with family and friends. We escaped! But we did ask for some hints! Nathan was our game master and he gave us good hints that pointed us in the right direction but still allowed us to think and solve the puzzles. We did the Bank Heist which is supposed to be the easiest of the three rooms by Limitless Escape Games. We have to come back and try the others!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: I had so much fun, and received a completely unexpected surprise! Ryan worked with my now-fiancé to set up one amazing proposal in the Diamond Heist room. Thank you for the wonderful memories!

room_title: Escape room "The Egyptian Tomb" by Greeley's Great Escape in Fort Collins
review: We had so much fun! It was definitely challenging and had a nice mix of puzzles. Definitely worth trying one of their rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Egyptian Tomb" by Greeley's Great Escape in Fort Collins
review: We loved this place. We just finished. It's the first one that we failed, but we were one member short of out 4 person team. So we're not taking it too hard. Great experience and a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Egyptian Tomb" by Greeley's Great Escape in Fort Collins
review: This was our 16th escape room! We loved it even though we didn't escape. There was something for everyone when it came to the puzzles. Some very unique elements too! You should try this one for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned House" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: My first time doing an escape room last night and Brainstorm did not disappoint. Our guide was very helpful and friendly. I really enjoyed myself and will be back .. we did the abandoned house which was a hard level but really fun.. we didn't make it out but for our first time did pretty well.. I'd like to go back and finish that room and do another the same night. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned House" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: Great experience - lots of fun and quite challenging. The staff provided just enough clues to make the game enjoyable without being frustrating.

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned House" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: Brainstorm Escape Room was so much fun! Very well run and organized. We will definitely be returning clients!

room_title: Escape room "Planet Express" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: Project: Escape has quality games and friendly, accommodating staff! We’ve only escaped one of the three games in time, but look forward to visiting the other two in the future.If you’re in the Marietta+ area, you owe it to yourself to get a group of family or friends together to solve one of these fun adventures. Great for holiday get togethers, team building or just a fun visit with friends. The new Planet Express is top notch and now my current favorite (because it’s the only one we’ve beat!).

room_title: Escape room "Planet Express" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: Love this place. Project Escape is tons of fun and the escape rooms are great.Tonight was our second trip there and once again, it did not disappoint. Escaped the new room, Planet Express - tons of fun. Did the Vault 2nd and unfortunately, did not escape in time.We will be going back again and again to hopefully conquer the other rooms.The staff is super awesome and super friendly.Definitely a 5 star experience!

room_title: Escape room "Planet Express" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: The new Planet Express room is so much fun. Lots of puzzles and rooms to explore. Would highly recommend bringing a group and giving it a try!

room_title: Escape room "The Hurricane Room" by Escape House Waterville in Orange Beach
review: Enjoyed my time everyone was able to contribute. My 10-year-old son was hooked! I did wish there was more of a wind aspect to the hurricane room.

room_title: Escape room "The Hurricane Room" by Escape House Waterville in Orange Beach
review: We did the hurricane room while on vacation and had a blast. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to have fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Hurricane Room" by Escape House Waterville in Orange Beach
review: Did the Hurricane room and it was SO MUCH FUN! Super challenging!

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Subway" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Went there last week and it was fantastic. Had an excellent host, Captain K, and the experience was intriguing and fun. Puzzles were interesting, room design/decor was fabulous and the general place seemed very organized and efficiently run. My group was paired with another but everyone still had a role in solving the puzzles and the atmosphere was very friendly. I did the Runway Subway puzzle, and am hoping to go back to try more of them.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Subway" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Really fun! Went here for a team building event. Did the runaway subway escape room. Only thing a bit disappointing was I feel like our host missed a couple of details when setting the scene for our adventure. Still a really great experience. Loved the atmosphere!

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Subway" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: I took my boyfriend on his birthday to check it out. We met with our group and began the fun challenge based on the TMNT story. Although we did not manage to make it out on time, we all had a great evening and made some new friends! Cannot wait to try out another room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Haunted Room" by Escape Savannah in Savannah
review: We had a great time here. We even had a friendly ghost that floated around the room with us. I can't wait until their new one comes out. I highly recommend this if you have some time to kill.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Haunted Room" by Escape Savannah in Savannah
review: My girlfriend and I attended Escape Savannah to try and escape from the Ghost Room on a Saturday afternoon in February. Overall, the experience was top notch. The overall theme was really cool for Savannah and the good news is that we escaped - but only with like 3 minutes remaining (and we only had to use one small hint)! It was a lot of fun and the escape was a perfect balance of being difficult, but not impossible. We were placed with another random group because there was only two of us, but it was kind of fun being forced to work with strangers. This was one of the highlights of our trip! Thanks!!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Haunted Room" by Escape Savannah in Savannah
review: We had so much fun! The Haunted House was difficult and we did not actually escape, but made progress. The *creepy* ghost component was really special. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Haunted Room" by Escape Savannah in Savannah
review: We had so much fun in the Haunted Escape Room. The staff was very helpful, the room was challenging, and our group had a lot of fun. We highly recommend this to anybody staying in Savannah! Thanks so much for the awesome escape experience.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Haunted Room" by Escape Savannah in Savannah
review: We had a great time with Escape Savannah in Savannah, GA. Currently (as of May 2017) they have two different themes that you can do, and we did the Escape the Haunted Room theme. It was very entertaining, and we would definitely go back to do the Escape the Pirates theme or a new escape room in the future! High recommended.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Haunted Room" by Escape Savannah in Savannah
review: I took my father to Escape Savannah while he was in town visiting. This was the first time any of us had done an escape room. We did the haunted ghost room and had a blast. The room was challenging and scary all at the same time. I'm already planning my next trip down to do the pirate room. I would definitely recommend this activity.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Phony Art Studio" by Code To Escape in Daytona Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Moonshine Cabin" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Awesome time with group outing from work. Moonshine room is difficult or we must be a bunch of dummies. Great customer service. Keep it up! Will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Moonshine Cabin" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Eight friends had a wonderful time even though we didn’t get out. Great place we are all going back.

room_title: Escape room "Moonshine Cabin" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: I have been to several escape rooms in a few different locations and I like this one best. From the friendly staff to the selection of challenges this escape room is first class! I brought my family and a few friends. We did the Moonshine Cabin Escape room and it was great. I look forward to bringing my family and others to try the other escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Creighton House Attic" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: We went and escaped the Attic Room and it was SO much fun! The puzzles were challenging and exciting and the owners were very friendly and helpful! We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Creighton House Attic" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: We had a fantastic time figuring out the Creighton House attic room and can't wait to do Graybeard's Treasure!

room_title: Escape room "The Creighton House Attic" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: We did the attic and it was a blast! We will definetly come back to do the greybeard one!

room_title: Escape room "The Creighton House Attic" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: We did the Attic room last night and had a blast! We made it out with only 2 minutes to spare. I played with 2 other adults and an 11-year-old. Fun for all ages. And, a great addition to Fernandina Beach!

room_title: Escape room "The Creighton House Attic" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: We had a blast for my birthday! Our team beat the high score for the Attic Room! We can't wait to come back and do our free game hopefully in the new room! Thanks for a fun day/night!

room_title: Escape room "Red Alert" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: 60Out did it again!! Im truly amazed by what they can do!! We just played PUTIN Bunker and we had a great time! The room had an fun theme and it felt like we were in a real bunker. The puzzles were creative and not to hard to solve. This is a great room if you are a beginner in Escape rooms! Our game master Ryan was fantastic! He was super friendly, patient, and continued to theme with us the whole time we were in the room! I recommend 60Out to everyone! I can't wait to play more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Red Alert" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had an awesome time in the Red Alert room at this location. Initially we were supposed to play Da Vinci, but when we arrived the game masters warned us that it has about a 10% escape rate. Wish we would have known that before we booked! (The website just lists it as "hard" so we had no idea). We were nervous since we've done a couple dozen rooms but didn't feel like we were "experts" in any sense, so game master Jess suggested we play Red Alert instead and we were so glad she did. The room was a perfect mix of physical puzzles, lock and key, and technology, and we never felt stressed or stuck. Jess was awesome with giving the right amount of hint without just telling you how to solve the puzzle, and we escaped with a few minutes to spare. We also talked to her for a while afterwards and got some recommendations for more 60out rooms to play. Can't wait to try them out next time I'm in LA!!

room_title: Escape room "Red Alert" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This place was awesome!! We did the Putin bunker or "red alert". It was definitely not easy but we did make it out with a minute to spare. We asked for about 5-6 clues throughout our time because we were getting stumped at certain parts. We are definitely coming back...it was so fun to use our brains and teamwork. The employees were super nice too. Highly recommend!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Loved the Asylum great room and Chris was awesome!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Super fun time with family while in town for a wedding! Staff was very fun, nice, and helpful. Even though we didn’t quite make it through Asylum, we were told what needed to be solved in our last room...we were so close! Definitely recommend this experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Highly recommend the Asylum room! It was put together very well and challenging for a great escape room experience!

room_title: Escape room "Tiger's Eye" by ConTRAPtions Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: This was the first time for us all. We were successful in heisting the Tiger's Eye. Staff was very friendly and helpful. It was a fun experience for our three-generation family of 10. We all said we're interested in doing another one.

room_title: Escape room "Tiger's Eye" by ConTRAPtions Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: We had a group of five escape room enthusiasts in the Tiger's Eye room and had a great time. The room itself had really interesting and state-of-the-art technology and was filled with many puzzles, difficult enough to keep us entertained but not impossible to solve. A great room for experienced players. The staff was also very friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Tiger's Eye" by ConTRAPtions Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: The Tiger's Eye room was super fun. Finished it with 3 people which was especially gratifying, even with only a remaining 38 seconds.

room_title: Escape room "Tiger's Eye" by ConTRAPtions Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: Very well done!!! We escaped the Tiger's Eye room literally at the last second! Definitely would do this again and highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Tiger's Eye" by ConTRAPtions Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: Tigers Eye was a neat room full of high tech logic! We enjoyed that it was different from many of the other rooms, and still quite a challenge.

room_title: Escape room "Ruins of the Mystic Temple" by Rabbit Hole Recreation Services in Denver
review: Ruins of the Mystic Temple is an escape room adventure that doesn't disappoint. Temple's production design is the clear highlight. Scenic elements, lighting, sound, and electronic effects combine to create the immersive experience of exploring a pre-Columbian complex of chambers. The mission is straightforward: find the treasure before your ex-partner does. The objective is more mercenary than the typical tomb adventure but it leads to a fun "payoff." Puzzles include logic and translation challenges presented with thoughtful design, interesting props, and technological flair. Puzzle difficulty ranged quite a bit, and I could imagine solvers of all levels of experience finding ways to contribute. Temple is among the best escapes I've played in Colorado!

room_title: Escape room "Ruins of the Mystic Temple" by Rabbit Hole Recreation Services in Denver
review: I've done over 110 escape rooms all over the United States and Mystic Temple is among my top 10. I went to 5 different escape room companies in the Denver area over the weekend, and Rabbit Hole Recreation Services is by far the best in the area. Do yourself a favor and take my advice and come to their escape room. The staff was super friendly, the room was high tech and non-linear. Did I also mention their price was very fair for the amount of work they put into their room. I will make a special trip to come back just do their other rooms when they open.

room_title: Escape room "Ruins of the Mystic Temple" by Rabbit Hole Recreation Services in Denver
review: Awesome experience. The mystic temple is legit and difficult. The amount of detail is amazing and really took a lot of time. Great job..

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Yesterday was my first time, and it was amazing! I didn't manage to escape the island, but got really close. Our game master was very helpful to us. I will definitely be going back! It was a great experience

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: me and my family did the island escape,even though we didnt make it (4 steps away though lol) we had a great time! we def plan on coming back to do the hostage! awesome game for the whole family!!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: We went to the Island Escape room. They had a really fun theme and room design and a lot of new and novel puzzles that were well engineered. The staff was friendly, engaging and on top of monitoring our progress. The communication was clear and easy to understand.Cons:Some of the puzzles were huge leaps of logic. One of the first ones took us about 15 minutes to figure out and we had to use one of our three clues. A few tweaks on it would have made it much more understandable. After we won, the room leader came in and told us that a lot of people get caught up on it. If that's the case, then it's probably the puzzle that needs fixing. I don't like the feeling of being stuck on the first puzzle! I wish they had given me a few more wins before a big stall.This experience puts this room at the middle of the pack of my escape room experiences, but I do hope they continue to refine the puzzles because the room could be great!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Great adventure for the whole family!! We have a 9-year-old and 2 older teens. We did the island escape and they were all able to participate and all enjoyed it so much!!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Went tonight with a group of 8 as a belated birthday celebration. We had so much fun with Island Escape that we turned right around and booked Operation Casino right after it! Our game masters were both amazing and I can't wait to try the other rooms!!!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Mastermind Escape Games in Jacksonville
review: Awesome staff, and experience! The complexity of the Bank Heist room was so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Mastermind Escape Games in Jacksonville
review: This was a lot of fun. We did the Bank Heist and made it out with barely a second to spare. It really gets your adrenaline pumping.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Mastermind Escape Games in Jacksonville
review: We did the Bank Heist and had the best time! We were paired with another couple we didn't know, but we had fun with them. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Tut’s Rut" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Amazing family run game! Our group had the best time and can't wait to return to play the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Tut’s Rut" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: I visited Tut's Rut with 5 of my friends. I've done a few other rooms, but nothing like this one. We put on our pith helmets and escaped the space ship into the tomb only to discover we had to keep going back into the space ship. All of the rooms work together, and you have to split your group into small teams and work on the puzzles, and just keep building on puzzles until the very end. We were overwhelmed by the whole atmosphere created by this room. It was incredible with Hollywood style special effects, but I don't want to give too much away. You feel like you're in a tomb!! After we escaped, we had to all hang around and check out the technology in this room. It's mind-blowing to see how this whole thing works together. My friend's birthday is coming up and I know where we'll be having his party!

room_title: Escape room "Tut’s Rut" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: It was a very good time. The room was very detailed and immersed you into the world. The father/daughter duo were very nice and helped a lot. It was tough but we did make it out within the hour and a half time period. Will be going back again.

room_title: Escape room "Clinic" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum 2" by Locked In Stuart in West Palm Beach
review: This was part of our annual holiday leadership gathering. it was really a lot of fun and even though both groups didn’t escape we had fun. And I want to go back.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum 2" by Locked In Stuart in West Palm Beach
review: Super fun time! Great staff!

room_title: Escape room "Private Detective Agency: Knight & Rook Investigations" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: My friends and I tried (and failed) Knight and Rook last weekend, it was difficult but fun. I have done escape rooms in other locations and this was a bit different. We were very close to making it out, on the last step, but ran out of time. Disappointing, but the room was definitely doable if we hadn't missed a couple of easy clues. The owner was very nice and took time after we were done to talk about where we went wrong, what recommendations we had for him, etc. Great customer service. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Private Detective Agency: Knight & Rook Investigations" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: Had a blast here! It's clean and the employees are very welcoming. I would definitely recommend getting a group together and making a night of it. The more people you have the more fun it is.

room_title: Escape room "Private Detective Agency: Knight & Rook Investigations" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: It blew my expectations out of the water... interactive.. challenging.. and so much fun!! I highly recommend these guys!! I went into it thinking it might be cheesy.. it wasn't At All! I can't wait to do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Apocalypse - Destination Paris" by ALL IN Adventures Waterbury in Southington
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Sword of Hattori Hanzo" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Myself and 4 other adults just did Wanted: Dead or Alive at the Del Amo site tonight and my husband and I with our 3 teens did The Sword of Hattori a month ago and had a blast. Tonight was my 5th escape room and I have to say the rooms at Back in Time have been my favorite, having so many details and clever surprises. I like that escape rooms are such a great bonding activity that allow us to think together through and talk about what happened after over dinner. My favorite room so far is The Sword of Hattori Hanzo. I'm looking forward to the next birthday or special event as an excuse to go to another room at Back in Time!

room_title: Escape room "The Sword of Hattori Hanzo" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had such an amazing time at Back in Time Escape Rooms.  First off, I didn't know there was an escape room in the South Bay!  So, in planning for a fun activity for our group, I was able to find this place so close to work.  We had an amazing time!  We did the room where we had to find the sword.  That room was challenging but fun!  Our group loved it.  We were sooooooo close, that we even got bonus time!  Sadly, we still didn't get out.  In any case, it really brought our team together, and we are looking to come back soon to experience Area 51 =)

room_title: Escape room "The Sword of Hattori Hanzo" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had my daughter's Birthday Party there yesterday and the kids (more like teenagers) had an amazing time!  The games were fun, the party room was great and the staff was fantastic! For this age group, I would suggest the Witches of Salem, though they really enjoyed "the Sword of Hattori Hanzo" very much as well, they just needed a bit more time to complete it.  We will soon be back to try the "Inside Area 51".  Did I already mention the staff? :)  They were amazing, friendly, caring and on top of everything.  I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Lost in the Ozarks" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Myth Room" by San Jose Room Escape in San Jose
review: I've done about 10 escape rooms around the Bay Area and this was one of the best and most memorable. The theme is a ghost pirate ship, and the decorations are some of the best I've seen for an escape room, and really make you feel like you could be on a ship. You can tell the owners spent considerable time and effort to build a great immersive experience. In terms of the puzzles, I won't give anything away but they are logical and are well-intergrated with the room elements. My group ended up getting stuck on one puzzle for too long (due to not figuring out the wording properly on one clue), and just barely escaped on time.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Myth Room" by San Jose Room Escape in San Jose
review: This was our first escape room experience.  We were ten of us and all of us had a great time.  The game was so much fun and competitive for the group and glad we were able to escape out of the room !!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Myth Room" by San Jose Room Escape in San Jose
review: The ghost ship escape room was ok. What it lacked in tech it tried to make up for with the "you must interact with the ghost" to make it through. Not as great as the other escape rooms I've been to given the need to interact with the ghost and the low tech puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Myth Room" by San Jose Room Escape in San Jose
review: Had a great time. If you're bringing a group, I'd say that the optimal number of people is 6-7, but there's plenty of room for more if you have a larger crowd.

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I have been to probably about a dozen escape rooms so I was really excited to finally have one in Thousand Oaks! We did the Study Room and it did not disappoint. We definitely needed to use my sister for quite a few puzzles but between all us, we only needed one clue and we escaped - I think that's a win! At the end of the room, the theme definitely came full circle so I appreciated the attention to the detail and I would highly recommend this to anyone.However, it doesn't beat my favorite room of all time which is the Great Houdini Escape Room which is actually in San Francisco, so if you're ever in SF you definitely need to go there!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've done several escape rooms now, and the two things that really make a good escape game for me are puzzles that connect to the theme, and a room that "feels" right. The Study definitely hit it out of the park. There were some easier puzzles and some harder ones, and it was a clear flow. The guy working there was super friendly and I liked that the room had a story. Can't wait for the new one!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: What a great and unexpected treat this was! We all thoroughly enjoyed the challenge and really pulled together to escape from the Study with only 37 seconds to spare. A great bonding exercise.

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: A really great escape room! The puzzles are intelligent and challenging. Alex is amazing - smart, chill, with a real knack for terrific customer service. I love the fact that they built escape games right here in Thousand Oaks. We did The Study and we got out with only 4 minutes to spare! To me, that's perfect - when you think you might not make it because the puzzles are so challenging but you are still able to if you hustle and focus. This is a great room and I would definitely recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Cuckoo's Nest" by Padlocked Inc. in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Such a fun experience! The decor was beautiful in the lobby area and featured really cool pieces of art from a local artist. The Budapest Express was difficult, but very interesting. I went with a group of friends and we had a blast solving the murder mystery together. I want to try all the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Derailed" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escape Manor in Panama City
review: This place was great! I had such a good time. We did the Attic this time. It was fun for the kids too! The host was funny and seemed to have fun with it as well! We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escape Manor in Panama City
review: My family and I had a great time! My kids loved it also we escaped the Attic and the Asylum. We would definitely recommend for the whole family. The staff is AMAZING!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escape Manor in Panama City
review: Highly recommend, this was a really fun experience, different from anything else I've ever done.  We did Attic yesterday and I'm already arranging to go back for Asylum.

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escape Manor in Panama City
review: This was so much fun for our WHOLE family!! We really enjoyed the employee there (which I'm sure thought we were crazier than most) she was very welcoming and helpful! The whole experience was completely worth it and we are already planning our trip back!!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escape Manor in Panama City
review: The ladies I work with booked a private Attic experience for my birthday! I did not know what to expect! We all had a blast! I can't wait to book the Asylum!! I highly recommend this place! We made it out with 4 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: Had a great time! We didn't break out of prison but had a blast anyway. Can't wait to go back and try the rest!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: My friends and I came here to celebrate my 24th birthday weekend! We did the jailbreak escape, the staff was so friendly and fun! We all had an amazing time and we will definitely be coming back again & AGAIN!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: Our group of 7 had so much fun trying to break out of jail! I say trying because we totally failed! We are already planning our next trip. I think we may be addicted to escape rooms now! Haha.

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: Our group booked the Jail experience and was in the same day. Booking online was easy, and the staff is super friendly. We had a ball though we didn't make it out in time. Warning, these are actually intricate and very tricky! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Went here last night to do the Prison Break room with my 2 kids (under 12) and a couple of friends. The staff was very upbeat and helpful. the room was so fun and FULL of puzzles. I believe Sandy (Sandra? SORRY) was our Game master. She did a great job.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Did The prison escape this weekend.  It was rated as moderately difficult.   It was our first attempt at an escape room.  We should have started with "easy"!    With some hints from the Game Master we made it out.   Had a great time.   Next time we'll bring a few more people.  The more brains working on the challenge, the better.   My advice.....  EVERYTHING you see is part of a clue, so don't ignore anything.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Back again!!!  This time we did Prison Break. Such a fun room. Puzzles were fair and the gameplay extremely exhilarating. This is our fourth room here and we can't wait to do the 5th and get our red key. The rewards program is well worth it.

room_title: Escape room "The Sword In The Study" by GasLamp in Pomona
review: One of the most well-designed escape rooms I've visited, in terms of production quality and theme. Our team took on the debut room, The Sword and the Study. The puzzles were challenging and even better, interesting. A good mix of cognitive puzzles, critical thinking puzzles, and technical puzzles; it allowed for all team members to contribute their unique skills. A very, very good "teamwork" room. Highly recommended and I look forward to new future games!

room_title: Escape room "The Sword In The Study" by GasLamp in Pomona
review: We found this gem of a room randomly doing a search for escape rooms. Lots of fun and unique puzzles in a little space. Any room that has swords and wands a must do for us. We didn't expect much since we hadn't heard anything but we were pleasantly surprised. We found the Sword in the Study! Our Game Master was great also!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Newington
review: Friendly staff!! We all enjoyed my niece Bree's birthday party. Who says adults can't have fun too!

room_title: Escape room "Flushed" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: It was so fun my husband had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Flushed" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: super fun!! staff was great!!

room_title: Escape room "Flushed" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: my first escape room already planning the next visit it was so much fun! and the staff is hands down the best

room_title: Escape room "Bazaar Battle" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Manor" by Two Trees Escape in Ventura
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Cold War: Spring of Life" by Mindscape in Atlanta
review: So much fun!! Staff is very nice and the room we did was very fun and challenging. Makes a great date night activity!

room_title: Escape room "Cold War: Spring of Life" by Mindscape in Atlanta
review: What a fun experience...it was well designed, amazing props and use of space, challenging and exciting! Would highly recommend!! Can’t wait to go back and do the other room!

room_title: Escape room "Cold War: Spring of Life" by Mindscape in Atlanta
review: My husband and I have done almost 40 escape rooms. We decided to check out Mindscape and I’m so glad we did. The facilities were nice and I LOVED the room we played. It was called Cold War Spring of Life. It was a well thought out room with a lot of fun puzzles. I definitely want to go back and try the other room!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Gallery" by Stockton Escape in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Pharaoh's Curse" by The Hidden Passage in Los Angeles
review: We have a few escape rooms under our belt now and this Pharaoh room was really fun and clever. Well decorated, puzzles and locks took a minute to figure out, but we always like when the gamekeeper is fun too! Yea Ben! Good for a medium size team.

room_title: Escape room "The Pharaoh's Curse" by The Hidden Passage in Los Angeles
review: Really fun ! Rooms are hugeI love the pharaoh storyline, just make sure it's just your group that's going in with you obviously it's easier to work together but if you don't mind playing with strangers than it should be great

room_title: Escape room "The Pharaoh's Curse" by The Hidden Passage in Los Angeles
review: Wow! Just WOW! This was my 114th escape room, so I am not easily impressed. I've done half the rooms in LA, and this one really holds it's own. The set design and building were amazing. You go to an industrial area not expecting much, and then you walk through their doors and low and behold you are transported to Egypt. The game and puzzles were incredibly fun and my team had a blast escaping The Pharaoh's Curse. The attention to detail and immersive nature of this escape room were impressive. I'd recommend this game to any escape room expert or newb.

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Armory Ambush" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: 10/10 experience, awesome location , big huge shout out to Soncee for all the amazing help (:

room_title: Escape room "Armory Ambush" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: Breakout Waikiki is amazing at its job !! Few options for escape rooms but plenty of hard thinking puzzles, codes are unique , and the escape rooms are so different!! I loved the experience with the help of the employees as well. One great employee was Soncee! She was so kind , loud and great greeting, extremely helpful and knowledge me on what I was going to do. I definitely applaud her for helping out everyone at the lobby as it seems stressful to do so !! 10/10 Place !!!!

room_title: Escape room "Armory Ambush" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: With four breakout room novices, we probably should've started with an easier room. But despite not knowing what to expect and even what to do, we managed to open 4 out of the 5 locks. Our GM was super cool and he gave us pointers when we got too off track. We had an amazing time and since we came so close, we will definitely be back to try our luck in the other rooms! Thanks Breakout Waikiki for making our double date a success!!

room_title: Escape room "The Magician's Secret" by Exit 2 Escape in San Jose
review: 5/5 -Played the Magician Room and it was more than I was expecting! The room offered lots of twists and turns and you def need more than two people to play ( or you just need help from the owner)! Can't wait to check out their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Magician's Secret" by Exit 2 Escape in San Jose
review: Our team booked a private event with Wendy and Roy, and it was as smooth as it can get to organize.  They were very accommodating and made the event very enjoyable.  The Magician's Secret and Wild West Jail Escape rooms were very unique.  Be prepared for a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Magician's Secret" by Exit 2 Escape in San Jose
review: The Escape room bug has got us!  We did the magician room and had a ton of fun.  This was our 6th escape room and so far our favorite. We can't wait to return for the other two rooms. Thanks for the great time!

room_title: Escape room "Castillo De Matanzas" by Escape U in St. Augustine
review: I had a wonderful time at Escape U. Save the Fleet was an awesome hook game. The fort game was my favorite game, the puzzles were a bit more involved and the final scene was something else!

room_title: Escape room "Castillo De Matanzas" by Escape U in St. Augustine
review: Had a great time with our family (ages 10-50). We did the Fort room. Historical as well as entertaining story/puzzle. Was difficult but we escaped! Blake was the best, his enthusiasm and knowledge set the tone for our experience. Would recommend this for anyone looking for something to do in St. Aug/Jax area.

room_title: Escape room "Castillo De Matanzas" by Escape U in St. Augustine
review: Blake and Scotti were amazing and made the experience. We did the Castillo De Matanzas and enjoyed every minute of the puzzle. The tasks were very challenging but after some teamwork, we were able to complete the room. Definitely a must of you are in St. Augustine!

room_title: Escape room "The Dragon Eggs Quest" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: We have done Escape Rooms in the past, we tried the Dragon Egg Room and has an amazing time. The rooms are clean  and more high tech.  The people there are helpful and so nice. We will definitely be back to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Dragon Eggs Quest" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: We did two different rooms over two days. The newest room is The Dragon Eggs Quest. It was so much fun and fairly difficult which is what made it so fun! The next was the VR Space Station Tiberia. We liked them both so much! Escape Room 101 is clean and they are very customer friendly. Great area with restaurants and things to do before or after your escape room experience. Highly recommend them.

room_title: Escape room "The Dragon Eggs Quest" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: We did Chocolate Factory, The Dragon Eggs Quest, and Diplomat's Secret. All were fun with original puzzles. As GOT fans, we really liked Dragon Eggs Quest! Recommend doing all these games!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak: Find the Cure" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Just completed Outbreak with a group of 9 and had a complete blast! Really creative puzzles that utilized everyone's strengths and a very unique hint system. We made it out with time to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak: Find the Cure" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: A groups of us (4 people) went to do Outbreak + 2 more strangers joined. 6 to 8 people, I think, is optimal for the room. More - would be too busy/crowded. We did not escape but had lot's of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak: Find the Cure" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: I had an absolutely amazing time with my team at Mastermind Escape! Thanks for the experience and genuine service.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak: Find the Cure" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Had a blast tonight escaping from the Outbreak room! Definitely challenging but we got it done with some time to spare. Go and check them out!

room_title: Escape room "Excalibur" by Labyrinth Escape Games in Boise
review: Wow! What a fantastic experience. A group of adult friends and I experienced the Excalibur adventure. And an adventure it was! The staff was professional and friendly and even showed us some of their other escape rooms after which only made us want to come back again! The venue is perfect and we made a night of it by having a Mesa Tacos afterwards. Make sure to book your escape adventure in advance. Honestly my favorite part of the night was feeling lost for an hour transported to another world without technology, and work and the craziness of life. Laughing with friends, being a kid again for just one hour...priceless.

room_title: Escape room "Excalibur" by Labyrinth Escape Games in Boise
review: First time at an Escape Room.Loved the staging, the challenge and the group I attended with! Looking forward to future visits!

room_title: Escape room "Excalibur" by Labyrinth Escape Games in Boise
review: Took my family for fun family-friendly experience. My sons loved it and have been asking to go again! The room clues were challenging, thought provoking, and fun! The host was friendly, courtesy, and made the experience memorable. When they call to offer clues they get in character for the room you are escaping! I would recommend Labyrinth Escape Games for an amazing, memorable, fun experience!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock’s Library" by ALL IN Adventures in Tuscaloosa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Morgue" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: We have done all 4 rooms! And all the rooms are awesome. From the suspenseful room of The Morgue to the very realistic rooms of The Garage, Aunt Debbie's Apartment, and The Classroom. They are all great, and whether you win or lose you are guaranteed a great time. The staff is very friendly and thank you to Big Mike for always being so welcoming! Definitely recommend this place for a date night or fun family night.

room_title: Escape room "The Morgue" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: Fun and exciting experience. Will definitely be going back.

room_title: Escape room "Police Station" by Play Live Escape in San Jose
review: Amazing place, Amazing atmosphere, so fucking real!Very much recommended

room_title: Escape room "Police Station" by Play Live Escape in San Jose
review: Omg was one of the most crazy things I've ever experienced!!!

room_title: Escape room "Police Station" by Play Live Escape in San Jose
review: Even skipping clues we managed to make it out in 29 or 30 minutes! Смайлик «grin» Super fun being super 'sluths'!

room_title: Escape room "Police Station" by Play Live Escape in San Jose
review: Fun way to start a friday evening, with friends or family. Time went by really fast, but i am happy we finished at 47 minutes (was hoping to beat 20 mins...i blame the locks lol)

room_title: Escape room "Police Station" by Play Live Escape in San Jose
review: This was a blast! My husband and our 2 boys 8 and 13 played together. It encourages critical thinking, working as a team and problem solving. Great for kids and adults alike! The staff was really enthusiastic and friendly. Can't wait for the next room to solve!

room_title: Escape room "Police Station" by Play Live Escape in San Jose
review: Professional, friendly, Super enthusiastic and helpful staff. Was easy to book my reservation online and they followed up with a confirmation email 15min later. The puzzles in the game were challenging yet doable & if you got stuck the friendly staff was there to point you in the right direction! This was a great experience from beginning to end! Can't wait to do it again soon!

room_title: Escape room "Police Station" by Play Live Escape in San Jose
review: My husband and I went as a date night outing and we had so much fun! Nicely set up, I would rate the difficulty of this room escape as a medium. The clues were not too easy and not too hard either. Definitely doable with just two people. Would definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Police Station" by Play Live Escape in San Jose
review: Very fun and challenging! We had been in January 2015. We had a lot of fun. It was unexpected challenging game. The staff are nice people. No doubting, its equal the money.

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: Escape Hot Springs offers challenging fun for the whole family. Great for team building. The Cold Case room was full of tricks, we loved it. I highly recommend Escape Hot Springs for groups, work teams and families! Great! Great! Great! Plus the staff is amazing too!

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: No one in our group had been to an Escape Room before so the Cold Case room was exceptionally challenging. Thanks to our hostess, we were able to find our way through all the clues, locks and mind benders to finally solve the case and escape the room with 7 seconds left! This is something everyone should try... so much fun! Teamwork and communication required. Take your friends to Escape Hot Springs to have a very unique and interesting time!

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: Great fun for a family with kids old and young! The Cold Case room is definitely a challenge, be prepared to work as a team on perfectly thought out puzzles! The staff were fun and having a great time as well!

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: We did the Cold Case Room. Very challenging. Lots of fun. I look forward to going back and trying the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: My family and I were here on Spring break and my 11-year-old son wanted to do the cold case file. It turned out to be an experience we won't be forgetting. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a new and exciting experience.

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: Great group activity! The crew are very friendly, the atmosphere is clean, and its challenging but FUN FUN FUN!!! We did the cold case room. My youngest is 9 and she really enjoyed it. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: Terrible venue. They start the clock exactly on the hour and end the room exactly on the hour. Get caught in a Florida thunderstorm while driving an hour to visit the venue? Too bad, you lose 10 minutes. The hour is up and you're literally 5 minutes from finishing the room? Too bad, you need to stop playing immediately even if they don't have another group scheduled after you.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: Laughable is a good way to describe this business. I was trying to surprise my girlfriend for a birthday date and was surprised to see that this Escape Room charged $70/person. I thought to myself, that's quite expensive. So I had written a review about how expensive it was and the manager responded saying they NEVER charge $75 a person. The picture I have clearly shows 2 people for $141, I guess it's not $75 but still close. They then had written to me and discussed why it was that expensive. Mind you I'm a paying customer. I had already bought the experience even though it was expensive, I had found a cheaper option. However, they did not care if I paid or not. They just kept saying bring more people and it's cheaper per person. Okay, so bring you more money makes it cheaper, I guess that makes sense.I asked if a refund was possible, they said no all sales are final.So I ask if I can add two more people and to charge my card. They respond saying you booked the room and it fits 7 people, when I get there I can pay for the rest. I said ok. And was just waiting till the day of the experience. Couple days go by and all of a sudden I get an email saying I'm being denied service for my malicious intent. All I did was point out how expensive it was.So I asked for a refund and they say they can't and DEMANDED to have my address to send me a check. There's a couple things wrong with this:1. Were in the 21st century, we've figured out how to refund people's credit cards.2. Asking for my address to send a check? That sounds fishy. Almost like they want to avoid the refund in the system to not look bad.I did not want to provide my address to a business that has taken a paying customers money and has now refused the service. So they said too bad. If you want, there's a check here waiting for you or you can cancel through your bank.Doesn't seem like good customer service to me.I had asked why she was being so unprofessional and she just kept saying I was a liability.I'm a liability for writing a review based off there pricing.As funny and as ridiculous as this story may seem, it's true. I honestly couldn't believe the service received as a paying customer. I knew the prices were high but still took decided to pay it to surprise my girlfriend for her birthday. And instead of the manager thinking of changing my mind and providing a great experience to change my review down the road about price, I'm harassed and denied entry. That's the last time I ever spend a penny at this place. Now I have to dispute through my bank this ridiculous charge because they refuse to refund me the normal way.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: We did the prison one and it was aaaaamazing! We escaped with only few seconds left. I would definitely do it again and again. Best group activity ever!!!! The service was excellent too. I recommend this place 100%.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: Came here for a team building exercise last night, my group did the Prison Break room. I forgot that it was just a game right from the beginning! Prison robes, actual authentic jail bars, music and decorations all add up to making it a great experience. We couldn't stop talking about it for a few days after! And yes, we escaped!! I definitely want to go back and try the others. It was my first time doing this and it certainly won't be my last!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: This is the coolest room ever. The jail cells are real, they were once used in an actual prison! The costumes, decorations and interesting original puzzles all add up to making this my number one escape room. Special thanks to the warm welcome by the staff!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: Me and the husband did the jail escape while visiting Miami. It was a great challenge, pretty tough. We escaped!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: Great team building experience with awesome hosts! We had so much fun in Prison Break, and can't wait to go back for the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Jailbreak" by Escape the Cape in Fort Myers
review: We did the jail break room. 2 adults and 2 kids (11 and 9). It was a little complicated for the kids but we adults helped and escaped with 6 minutes to spare. Staff was friendly and helpful. We can't wait to go back and try the rest.

room_title: Escape room "Jailbreak" by Escape the Cape in Fort Myers
review: We took my 13-year-old nephew for his birthday. It was a lot of fun! We did the Jail Break and will be back to try the other 2 rooms sometime in the near future.

room_title: Escape room "Jailbreak" by Escape the Cape in Fort Myers
review: Four of us did the Jail Cell escape. Way better than expected! Fun!

room_title: Escape room "Shipwrecked" by Escape Room Entertainment in Melbourne
review: We did the Shipwrecked room with just 3 of us. Awesome concept! Won't give it away but you have to follow clues, solve puzzles to find the code to get out of the room. Got hung up on one and staff gave us some help like we asked for or we'd still be there lol! Managed to get out with 4 minutes to spare.

room_title: Escape room "Shipwrecked" by Escape Room Entertainment in Melbourne
review: Amazing! So fun! Loved the Shipwrecked room. Great atmosphere and friendly staff! Highly recommend!!

room_title: Escape room "Shipwrecked" by Escape Room Entertainment in Melbourne
review: Our group had so much fun with the Shipwrecked room! We appreciated Gerald's introduction to everything for all of us newbies, and the challenge itself was great! Everyone in our group was so glad we decided to do this, and I bet we will all come again!

room_title: Escape room "Shipwrecked" by Escape Room Entertainment in Melbourne
review: I highly recommend this for any family and/or group that is looking for something fun and challenging. We completed the ship wreck last night and we are already talking about when we will do the other 2. It really is a lot of fun.The staff is incredible. Very friendly and encouraging.

room_title: Escape room "Mission Improbable" by Sprightly Escapes in Denver
review: We had a blast! The owner was fantastic. The Mission: Improbable game was a perfect difficulty level - with another 5 minutes, we would have made it! The clues via walkie-talkie were spot on - they didn't give too much or too little. Super fun activity to do with a group to "switch things up" a bit! I've done a few escape rooms, and this one is my favorite so far :)

room_title: Escape room "Mission Improbable" by Sprightly Escapes in Denver
review: I was looking for something to do in the Denver area with some family. We've played numerous rooms across the country and were looking for a great one in the area. Sprightly Escapes didn't fail us! We played Mission Improbable and gave our best attempt at stopping an evil time traveler from rewriting history. Our entire group was impressed with the immersive feel of this particular escape room - we often feel like that's missing in other rooms. Clues and puzzles were also aligned to the story which we really appreciated. This kept us immersed in the experience and it kept us on our toes throughout the entire hour! Definitely recommend checking this escape room out if you're looking for something fun to do in the Denver area.

room_title: Escape room "Mission Improbable" by Sprightly Escapes in Denver
review: My 9 year old son and I tried out the Mission Improbable room and had a blast. We did not escape though made a valiant effort with just 2 people. There were lots of challenging puzzles and the environment inside the room was like no other escape room I have been in up to this time. The owners have some real creativity and have put together a great experience. I look forward to returning to try the other room.

room_title: Escape room "Mission Improbable" by Sprightly Escapes in Denver
review: I went there with a small group yesterday and had a great time! We tried the new dinosaur themed room and it was a blast. We'll be back soon to try their original escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Mission Improbable" by Sprightly Escapes in Denver
review: It was awesome! Two of us had done escape rooms before and three had not. The hostess was thoughtful and thorough during the introduction, and made sure we were all comfortable before locking us in the room. We did Mission Improbable and--while we got off to a slow start--the puzzles, clues, and challenges ramped up into a wonderful and exhilarating experience! No spoilers here, but we escaped with some time to spare. We can't wait to come back again for the other room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Best escape room yet! Alcatraz will not disappoint!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This has been my favorite room so far. The puzzles were great, and the experience was amazing. Although we didn't escape, we still had a wonderful time. Everything was just so well done.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We came, we saw and we were amazed! Each of these rooms are a must do. We waited patiently for Escape from Alcatraz and it amazed us with its absolute spot on decor right down to the color of the walls. The flow of the puzzles were great. Room is challenging but we managed to escape with time to spare. If you're in north Phoenix, just head 15 minutes further north as this was awesome! Highly recommended! We have done 42 escape rooms in AZ and this room takes the cake so far! Great Job Team North Valley Escape Room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: The staff were so friendly and helpful with all of the questions we asked. Our group did the Escape from Alcatraz. The rooms are very elaborate and the puzzles were well done. We were so close to getting out but time ended just as we were on the very last puzzle. Our group was made up of mostly first timers to escape rooms. I highly recommend for any skill level. We will definitely be back to try their two other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Escape from Alcatraz was a blast! The room was so much more elaborate and complicated than I ever imagined. Our family (two parents, three kids(17, 17, 15), and two grand parents) had so much fun working together to solve the puzzle and find our way out! We loved all the little surprises along the way too. I must commend your staff of puzzle makers and builders for really creating an immersive experience filled with intrigue and danger, it was perfect!The kids are already asking when we can go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Testament of Tesla" by Novus Escape Room in Dover
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: So much fun! Make sure to have a team when you go. We only had two people in our room and it made things much more difficult. Such a fun activity!

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: We had a fantastic time! Can’t wait to try to beat the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Prohibition room was so much fun! We went with a group of ten for a bridal shower & had a blast.

room_title: Escape room "The Game Show" by Escape New Haven in New Haven
review: None

room_title: Escape room "C.S.I. - Mob Hit" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: This place was an absolute blast!! Went to try out Asylum and ended up doing Wonderland as well because it was so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: Sugar and I had so much fun in the Alice in Wonderland room! We will be back soon!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: We did the Alice in Wonderland room. It was great! So much fun!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Best price point for a ninety minute game anywhere!  $29 bucks!? Comeon, I pay that much and more for shorter sixty minute games.Overall I give it five stars across the board, quality of puzzles, difficulty level, theming, quality of the props and decorations.  And the briefing they give is spot on, the lore of their backstory is so cool, mostly because it has a lot to do with actual history.  Of course I love time travel to start with, but Escapeopolis actually pulls it off and makes it seem authentic.

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: GO. TO. THIS. PLACE!  Hardest puzzles our group have ever been challenged with, yet excitingly delicious at the same time.  Great theming, great mom and pop owners, and absolutely the best customer service we have ever received  at any of the 100 or so games we have played.  We played both of their games - wildly different from one another - yet incredibly well imagineered.  GREAT!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Wow!!! This is a hidden, and soon to be a not so hidden treasure in NWA!!  My husband and I and another couple tried out Escapeopolis and Basinga! we found our new favorite escape room game!!First, the puzzles are phenomenal, all very crafty and unique - especially compared to other escape rooms that seem to depend on way too many padlocks.  My hubby loved it!!!  You really gotta think, you know, use the old brain pan to figure these puzzles out.And the look and feel of this place is awesome!  From the moment we walked in, we felt like we were thrown back in time to some military laboratory where top secret stuff went on.  The look and feel continued from the front door into the game and all the way out the door!!  Very nice.We played their newest escape room, the insurgent attack, where we were sent on a mission as security agents to 1969 to... oops no spoilers here folks - lol!We didn't win initially, but we played again later in the day when they had another time for us to book and killed it.Don't forget to book early for this one, they were pretty busy when we went.  We loved it and are for sure going back to play their other games.  You don't want to miss this one!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: My boyfriend and I played this game a couple of weeks ago with my sister and her husband. It was their first game ever, and I’m afraid we completely spoiled them! This game was by far the best game we ever played! The level of immersion from the time we walked in to the time we escaped the room was the best we’d ever seen! Plus, the way the puzzles were set up made sense, like we were in a real place and not a game! The owners were super nice and made sure we had a great time too!We’ll definitely be back and you should come too!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Best room ever!Not only were the puzzles and the story so much better than the other escapes in NWA, but the price was so much better than everyone else too!Escapeopolis Project, please make some rooms soon so we can come back and play again!!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: So, when I tried to find the insurgent attack game here, I couldn’t. So here’s my review for that room as well.The insurgent attack was nothing like the 1959 game, but boy, was it cool! The story is kicked up a notch and the special effects are super cool too! The game is also 90 minutes, unlike the 60 minute 1959 room. The puzzle were harder than the 1959 room, but they’re still solveable, thanks to the extra 30 minutes. My friends and I didn’t escape, but we’ll definitely be back next weekend to beat this game too! We found our newest favorite escape room today!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: We played the 1959 room and it was like nothing my friends or I had ever played! The story of the game was not only in the game, but also through the rest of the building as well!Once we were in the game, we had to change our normal strategy since there was only one padlock in the entire room! Crazy, I know!We escaped with just seconds left on the clock, but, boy, was it ever so exciting!Definitely give this room a try! My friends and I had such a good time, that we immediately booked the newest room, the insurgent attack, for after lunch!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Unfortunately this was the absolute worst escape room I have ever done. Which is unfortunate because the couple that run it obviously put a lot of time into it. My wife and I have done 20+ escape rooms in several different states across the country and this one was BY FAR THE MOST EXPENSIVE and BY FAR THE WORST! We brought 2 friends that had never done an escape room and I am so sorry that was their first experience. We paid $140 to do their newest room having something to do with time travel. Sadly after having spent over 2 and a half hours there total I still can't even properly explain the room. He talked FOREVER before we even were allowed in. Even though I had asked repeatedly to go to the bathroom. Then serval of there props didn't work. The flashlight we needed to get into the second room wouldn't turn on. The intro video was excessively long. They entire thing was WAY TO COMPLICATED! The clues he gives you aren't even real clues and they were off center so we couldn't even see all of it on the screen. I was so upset with how ridiculous everything was that we told him we were done even before our time ran out. We just wanted to go home. He offered to let us come back for free to do this room again since so much of equipment didnt work correctly but he should have offered us half our money back. I will NEVER go back and I will be sure that none of my friends go either. If you want a fantastic escape room experience go to Bolt NWA! The only reason we tried escapeopolis is because we had done all the other escape rooms in NWA.

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Fantastic place, staff and extremely creative. We had a blast traveling to 1959. We will be back and recommend for sure.

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: I've never been to an escape room experience before, but I really enjoyed it. The back story was really interesting and the room was very detailed. I went with a group of 10 which is probably too many (a little chaotic), but 3 to 5 I think would be perfect. Really nice people too! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: I didn't know what to expect at all before entering Escapeopolis, and wow it was spectacular! You can see the hard work that the owners put into making you feel like you're in 1959! I would highly recommend going because you're not going to get this kind of experience anywhere else!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: What impressed me the most was the attention to detail at Escapeopolis. Not only did the rooms have very creative and intricate puzzles, but even the lobby matched the aesthetic of the adventure at hand. Additionally, the rules, instead of being blandly stated, were presented in the context of the backstory. These smaller, more subtle details really helped create an enjoyable experience.

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: This escape room was unlike any other escape room I have ever done. At a normal escape room you are greeted at the door and led to the room where you solve various puzzles to escape. Escapeopolis is much different than a normal escape room. From the moment you are greeted at the door you feel like you are already immersed in an elaborate storyline. You are led to a room full of intricate details and thought provoking challenges, which truly test your puzzle solving capabilities. I encourage anyone who wants an enjoyable mental challenge to visit escapeopolis!

room_title: Escape room "Jailbreak" by Daytona Escape Games in Daytona Beach
review: Loved it! We did escape from jail theme with only 2 people and it took us 33 minutes.

room_title: Escape room "Jailbreak" by Daytona Escape Games in Daytona Beach
review: Looks are deceiving. Actually is better than one would expect! And if you are a newbie - this is the perfect place to start! Recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Game Room" by Exodus Escape Room in Rehoboth Beach
review: We had so much fun! The challenge was perfect ... we actually go out with seconds to spare.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Redemption" by Adventure Vault in Miami
review: We had so much fun in the Jail Break room! Such a great experience! Very creative!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Redemption" by Adventure Vault in Miami
review: We had so much fun breaking out of prison last night! Great puzzles... very well done. We will definitely be back to try another room. We had a blast! Great fun for the whole family.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Redemption" by Adventure Vault in Miami
review: This was my first time doing an escape room. We had a great time! The prison room was cleverly designed and a lot of fun to figure out. A great way to see how you can all work together as a team. The staff here was helpful and super friendly. Loved the whole experience. A wonderful night out with friends.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Redemption" by Adventure Vault in Miami
review: I went with 4 friends on Friday and had an awesome time. We did the Prison Break. It was our first time ever doing an escape room. We used our three clues available. But once we got the hang of what to look for we cruised on through and we were shocked that we actually escaped. (1 min overtime). We can't wait to go back to try another theme. A fun thing to do for sure.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Redemption" by Adventure Vault in Miami
review: I went last night with my husband and the experience here was beyond amazing. The staff was so friendly and accommodating, the place was very clean and the experience of trying to escape out of the room was so much fun and the perfect amount of challenge. We were in the prison room which is their hardest room. I will definitely be going back with family and friends and would recommend this place to anyone. It's perfect for birthday party's, office party's etc. I am 8 months pregnant and was able to enjoy such an adventure thanks to their accommodations.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Q: The Live Escape Experience in Fort Collins
review: My friends and I did The Asylum. It was challenging and it kept us on our toes. Nicole was our guide, and she was awesome (thanks for putting up with our stupid questions). I had a lot of fun, and the room was reasonably priced. Would go again in a heartbeat.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Q: The Live Escape Experience in Fort Collins
review: I've played over 150 escape rooms nationwide. My husband and I did The Asylum while visiting Colorado last weekend. We had a lot of fun! This is a well thought out room. The design is visually interesting. It is also non-linear for the most part, which we prefer. The puzzles all work well within the storytelling. The owners are very nice. I wish we would've had time to play the other room here as well.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Q: The Live Escape Experience in Fort Collins
review: More fun than expected! We did the Asylum room. The front desk/greeter/ "Doctor" was friendly, informative and helpful throughout the game. Whoever put these rooms together are very smart and creative! I'll admit that it was hard but having a leader, critical thinker(s), creative thinker(s), an organized team and hints from the Doctor helped us succeed. So much fun and would def recommend Q! Hope to go back again!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We played the Island Escape game for my daughter's 14th birthday and it was so much fun! Our game master was the best. We had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
