review: Played Island Escape today with a group of coworkers. Escaped just in time! Everyone had a great time. 2 other groups of coworkers enjoyed their rooms as well. Only 3 of 20 of us had done a breakout before. Several of the first-timers said they'd like to play again. Staff was friendly and helped make the game more enjoyable. Special thanks to Will, who helped us with the Island.

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We did the Island Escape room. It was so much fun! Our group consisted of my husband and I (we're the parents) and all three of our daughters and their husbands. Everyone had a blast and we all contributed to our successful escape. I would recommend Breakout Birmingham to everyone who wants to experience something truly unique and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We went with our four boys, ages 13-21, to celebrate a birthday. We did the Island Eacape and had a great adventure. It's hard to find something we all enjoy but this hit the mark! Our Game Master had perfect timing with her comments. We broke out with 9 minutes to spare. Hope to return for another adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: My husband and I brought our 9 and 6-year-old yesterday. It was our first visit, and we will definitely be back! Island Escape was perfect for them. They loved all the details in the room and unlocking all the locks. Thanks for a great Sunday with the family.

room_title: Escape room "The Path of the Gods" by Q: The Live Escape Experience in Fort Collins
review: Excellent. Just did the Path of the Gods room and finished it in 47 mins. Lots of family fun.

room_title: Escape room "303 Coulrophobia Ln." by Escape the Place in Orange County
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: So much fun!!!! Perfect for small or large groups of friends and family! We broke out of the museum heist and it really lets you feel like you are trying to save the art museum !!!highly recommend!!!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We had a blast! My wife and I went for our anniversary and we couldn’t have had a better experience. Our game master Will couldn’t have been any better. We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Visited Breakout Birmingham tonight as a team building exercise with cohorts from a non-profit. We split into two groups and tackled two different rooms. My group was able to escape the Museum Heist room.The game master was very friendly and clearly explained how the game works. We were allowed three clues if you get stuck but we only used two. I was impressed with the design of the room and the variety of puzzles to solve.Our group had a blast and thrilled we were able break out. Definitely a must-do for friends or team building groups.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Did the Museum Heist today. Crew full of Breakout rookies. Had a blast! Will definitely be back to try the other rooms! Thanks Breakout Birmingham.Oh yeah, we broke out! 44:52!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Museum Heist was well designed with a proper game flow without being too linear. That's "roomer" speak for, it was totes rad. Definitely, one of the better rooms we've done and we've done a few. The staff was great and very welcoming. Our game master (Caitlin) was awesome. Quite impressed with this place. I plan on visiting Birmingham again simply to try more rooms. This gets the Patrick and Amber seal of approval.

room_title: Escape room "Villain's Lair" by ArtHatch Escape in San Marcos (CA)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Air Raid" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Awesome game masters and awesome atmosphere! I've played quite a few games in the Orlando area and I was very impressed with this place! Definitely would recommend! We played Air Raid which we loved because it's unique compared to other themes. If your up for a challenge, this is your place!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Air Raid" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Great experience; was a last minute idea for the family and we absolutely loved the "escape the air raid " room ! Highly recommend this place �

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Air Raid" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: This was my first time doing a room escape and it was a lot of fun. We did the Escape the Air Raid room and it was set up in a WWII theme. A lot of attention to detail is evident in how the room and the clues/puzzles are set. I like that hints are available if you're stuck.The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the maximum number of people who can be in the room is ten. We were a party of four, so there were six other people in the room with us. One girl in particular was very obnoxious. She kept trying to control everything and would interrupt others when she thought they weren't doing something right. But she was wrong most of the time, which wasted precious time for everyone else.With a smaller group (say six or eight at the most), I think that everyone could be involved more and it would be enjoyable for everyone.

room_title: Escape room "Scandal" by The Greatest Escape Games in Colorado Springs
review: I loved this place - a great balance between challenging and fun in the "Scandal" room. Employee was friendly and was fun to interact with us during the escape.

room_title: Escape room "Scandal" by The Greatest Escape Games in Colorado Springs
review: Lots of puzzles happening at once so our group of eight were all continuously engaged.   Very good.

room_title: Escape room "Scandal" by The Greatest Escape Games in Colorado Springs
review: Just finished doing the Scandal Room and it was fantastic! It was everyone's first attempt at an escape room and we all enjoyed it (three adults and two teen girls)! We would definitely recommend it as a fun activity for all ages in the Springs!

room_title: Escape room "Scandal" by The Greatest Escape Games in Colorado Springs
review: My boyfriend and I were visiting in Colorado and decided to give this a try! We did the cabin room first and were so close to escaping! We came back a few days later and we were able to escape the scandal room. It was so much fun and we will definitely be coming back to try new rooms in the future!

room_title: Escape room "Spy Chambers" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: This was our third time visiting the clue room since they opened a few years ago. Their rooms and puzzles never fail to provide us with laughs and provoke thought. Truly well designed experiences. Other live escape rooms tend to have condescending staff members, but this one is quite the exception! The owners are very nice and helpful and always have been. This time, they had a new employee who was kind, helpful, and addded even more to an already outstanding business. Well done, Clue Room, well done!

room_title: Escape room "Spy Chambers" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: Although a bit expensive, this was a great family bonding activity on a snowy afternoon. The themes were appropriate for young kids (a 9-year-old), which is what we were looking for. It was a difficult puzzle, but I guess that is what keeps you coming back. Recommended for a family activity.

room_title: Escape room "Spy Chambers" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: Our group of 5 had a great time solving the easiest room Spy Chamber 1. We missed an obvious clue and needed a hint to make it out in time, but we had a blast! The clues really do require everyone to work together to get them all solved in the hour time limit.

room_title: Escape room "The Kitchen Nightmare" by Unity Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: This room was super fun and well-done. The hosts were great, and it was a well put- together and unique room. Would definitely go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Museum" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: None

room_title: Escape room "USCGC Ingham Escape" by Key West Room Escape in Key West
review: None

room_title: Escape room "CSI: Modesto" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: So fun! I went with my stores management team and we tried the CSI room. It's a hard room, but full of surprises!

room_title: Escape room "CSI: Modesto" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: Tons of fun!!!  We had adults and teenagers...each age group had its own unique strengths to help solve the clues!  Fun for all ages. Absolutely recommend this for anyone who loves a challenge!!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "CSI: Modesto" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: Awesome! We had a group of 11 girls in the CSI room (the hardest room) and had a blast. Interesting, challenging and super fun. We did not escape but we're close!

room_title: Escape room "Ark of the Covenant" by Cinema Escape Rooms in Orange County
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Toys and Tragedy" by Clues and Gumshoes in San Francisco
review: So close, we almost made it within the hour!My friends and I did the "Toys and Tragedy" room. We loved our host, William! It seems like he's super passionate about telling stories. I love creepy story rooms like this because it gives a good thrill. Since all of us have different ways of thinking, we were able to help each other by being creative and finding different solutions. It was a great experience overall and definitely evoked our emotions, creativity, and curiosity!

room_title: Escape room "Toys and Tragedy" by Clues and Gumshoes in San Francisco
review: This place was really fun. Me and my friends came and did the Toys and Tragedy room. This room was tricky enough to get the mind working and we were be able to still have fun doing all the tasks. This place does not aim to profit off of the customers and will actually let you finish the room even after the time limit because they want you to experience the fun of completing the room. Brian, the owner, is such a nice guy and easy to talk to. Would definitely   go again!!

room_title: Escape room "Toys and Tragedy" by Clues and Gumshoes in San Francisco
review: I came here with a group of friends to give this place a try and we had a blast!  There were 4 rooms with different themes but we chose the "Toys and Tragedy" one. You are given 1 hour to solve all the puzzles and unlock of the keys to escape the room.  The room was sufficiently challenging but solvable especially if you utilize the 3 hints wisely!Brian is a really nice person who showed us around.  He seem to enjoy what he does and he really supports his local community!I highly recommend this place for those who are in the Berkeley area who want to hang out or do a fun activity with their friends/family!

room_title: Escape room "Yin & Yang" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Seriously loved the experience and yes...the staff was amazing!!! Didn't think such a good time could exist so close to home!!!

room_title: Escape room "Yin & Yang" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: This was our first time ever trying an escape room. We had a great time. We definitely will be coming back again.

room_title: Escape room "Yin & Yang" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Took my husband here for his birthday, we were joined by my moms. We enjoyed it so much that we went back the same day to try another room. Really fun and great way to work as a team. The owner was friendly and I would recommend this place for any occasion or just something to do. Even if you’re not really a puzzle person this is still a lot of fun. We will be back to play again soon. 😊

room_title: Escape room "Pillow Palace" by Open Door Escape Games in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Best group activity I've done......ever? Best bang for your buck - everyone in the group agreed

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This place is awesome! Came with a few friends and we had a blast. Totally worth the money for the experience you're getting

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Definitely a place to go! Must have experience! Great way to spend quality and memorable times with your friends! Love this place! Can't wait to come back ~

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Jungle Game maze. It was difficult and so much fun. Our game hostess was really friendly. Awesome experience.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loved every minute of it! Don't think twice book it! We played the Jungle Room. Great experience using problem solving skills, math, logic, and reasoning. We can't wait to go back again.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Just my wife and I played but we escaped the Jungle Room and loved it! We own an escape room in another state and would definitely recommend Maze Room.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun! Great staff, the room was more fun than we even expected. We're already planning to go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was a great escape room! We have played a lot of them and the Jungle room was very impressive. It was hard to see and hear in there but otherwise it was great! If you haven't played an escape room do yourself a favor and go and if you have played other escape rooms, this one will not disappoint.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Lost Pyramid VR" by VR Territory in Orlando
review: Amazing experience , highly recommended

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Lost Pyramid VR" by VR Territory in Orlando
review: great staff!! helpful, my son had a blast!!! will be going back next vacation!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Lost Pyramid VR" by VR Territory in Orlando
review: My daughters and their friends had so much at VRTO! They wanted to stay and play longer...so they did! I love how each gamer has their station so one gets punched or bumped! I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: So, Antidote was my first escape room, not just in Escapology, but EVER. I have almost never had so much fun! We had to do the next two rooms right then and there, and spent the rest of the afternoon having a blast.The staff was courteous, the scenarios and equipment-use creative, and our Game Master seemed to be having as much fun as we were.I can't say enough great things about our experience at Escapology!!!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: The employees were so nice and interactive while we waited. Offering us water multiple times. The Budapest room was hard but so much fun! Would definitely recommend! Can't wait to come back and do another.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: As an escape room player, I have played well over 100 games. During my trip to San Diego, this was one of my favorite escape rooms. The attention to detail and immersion was outstanding. More importantly, the staff here delivers some of the best customer service in the industry. The games are great and the puzzles are clearly tied to the theme. If you are a beginner, novice, or expert, this is the place to go for your escape room adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: We had an incredibly fun time. First time that we'd tried something like this and I surprised my bf for his bday by taking him to do the Budapest Express. The game master was helpful and we can't wait to go back and try the other storylines.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: We had a great time and the staff is 100% amazing!!! We did the train scene and it was a blast!!! What a great way to spend my brothers birthday! We love you Javi!!! Let's do this again!!! I wish they had a kid's themed room though!!! That would be so much fun with Dominic!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: First time playing and we had a blast!! Started out with Antidote and game master Augustus was extremely helpful to my group of rookies. We loved his sense of humor and his desire to see us succeed. We enjoyed him and the game so much that we immediately signed up to do Budapest Express. Having just completed Antidote we knew exactly what was necessary to tackle Budapest and we executed our plan flawlessly. We finished that escape with 9 minutes to spare. The "who done it" feel of Budapest was very exciting. I would recommend this to all of my friends and family.

room_title: Escape room "Alien Zoo" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: Great rooms...challenging and creative. Host are in character...adds to the enjoyment.

room_title: Escape room "Alien Zoo" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: The kids are always excited when we do one of their escape rooms. The latest alien zoo was are favorite. We have even brought the grandparents along with another visit. Staff is fun and always in character. We have one last room to try and then we can say we have done them all. But have not successfully completed one. We can only hope one day we can manage our own way out.

room_title: Escape room "Alien Zoo" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: So impressed! We've done other escape rooms and the Alien Zoo at EscapeOut was SUCH a welcome surprise! The staff was outstanding - excellent characters, costumes, and interaction (I was a little creeped out, in a good way!), and the puzzles were so challenging, yet the entire experience was appropriate for kids as well. Can't wait to support this place again!

room_title: Escape room "The Menagerie" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: This review is about two weeks overdue. I can't thank the folks at Level Games enough for helping me pull off a fun 300th escape room surprise for my best friend. They were amazing and very accommodating. I had a plan set in motion to help my friend celebrate his 300th Escape Room and they helped me store the cake and balloons in their party room until after we exited the room. They even decorated the room by writing Happy 300th on their wall. For the room itself, we did The Menagerie. When I tell you that we had a blast, it doesn't even begin to describe it. The room was so well designed and there were lots of things to do for the 8 people in the room. I usually don't like larger groups in general for a room but this was a special occasion and it did NOT disappoint for one minute. We were thoroughly entertained throughout its entirety. I can't wait to see what else Level Games has in store because this room was great! Thank you again for the amazing hospitality!

room_title: Escape room "The Menagerie" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: Played "The Menagerie" when it FIRST opened expecting a clunky "beta" but were pleasantly surprised at how complete and solid it was. Out the gate, this game was amazing. You can tell these people put their heart and souls into these games because of the attention to detail. My girlfriend is such a scaredy-cat and screamed multiple times at inanimate stationary object, which made it that much more exciting. We also played the Doggy Dog and Disrupted Decades rooms in the past and left with big smiles. All REALLY well done and super fun. Will be back if they release new stuff.

room_title: Escape room "The Menagerie" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: Escaped from the new Menagerie Room at Level Games. It is a great experience developed by the creative minds and hands of the designers and owners of Arcane and Escape Chronicles.  All the puzzles and set pieces demonstrate the skilled craftsmanship of Arcane's wooden and mechanical wonders coupled with the originality and innovative puzzle flow that is a hallmark of Escape Chronicles.  This room was more of a cabinet of curiosities than a menagerie, with beautiful and intricate showcases that are interesting to look at and challenging to fully comprehend. There are some thrilling and unsettling moments provided by good production, sound and light effects, and most importantly a sense of timing and pacing that a certain evil genius would be proud of.  This room is a must-do!

room_title: Escape room "Wizards & Warlords" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: So much fun for our family. Brought along our 6 year old and our 11 year old nephew and both loved it. We can’t wait to come back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Wizards & Warlords" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: This was our first time in an escape room. My cousin is visiting from Germany and I thought it would be a fun activity. I had no idea really what to expect and we had an absolute ball!!! We even had my 8 year old son along with us and he was able to participate and have just as much fun as the adults. It's well run. The ladies who greeted us today were friendly, and fun. We had a wonderful time and can't wait to do it again!!!

room_title: Escape room "Wizards & Warlords" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: Great place. The gentleman was very informative and great with us and my 9 year old son! definitely will be going back!!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Infection" by Unity Escape Rooms in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes' Study" by The Great Escape Room in Miami
review: Went there with my husband... Omg I had such a good time. Working with other people to solve the puzzles. The clues, the set up and how friendly the staff was, is sooooooo incredible. I was practically begging the staff to hurry and open another room so I could come again!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes' Study" by The Great Escape Room in Miami
review: Celebrated my daughter's 12th birthday party with a group of girls. Everyone was excited and did not know what to expect. It took a few minutes to get into a rhythm but then they got the hang of it and started finding clues and putting it all together. There were some frustrating moments but they got through it and the group was able to escape with 1 minute 29 secs remaining. Great fun!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes' Study" by The Great Escape Room in Miami
review: My daughter celebrated her sweet 16 with her friends here and it was a total success! It's been days and they are still posting and talking about how much fun they had. The staff is amazing and super friendly . Nelson is great and walked me through the process to book our spot.. If u like puzzles this is the place for u! This is fun for any age .highly recommended that u spend an hour of ur time here u won't be sorry . Can't wait for more rooms!!! Thank u for all your help in making my daughters 16 a memorable one!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes' Study" by The Great Escape Room in Miami
review: The Great Escape Room Miami is an amazing experience! I highly recommend visiting them if you are looking for a fun and challenging experience. If you are tired of the same old Miami vibe and want to try something new, this is the place to go. Warning: This isn't for people who's highest daily mental challenge is deciding what selfie to post on social media. I suggest you go in a large group, the puzzles are difficult and the time limit is constraining for just a couple of people.Great Escape Room Miami we will definitely be back soon to conquer your game room. Keep being awesome!!!-Dayana

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes' Study" by The Great Escape Room in Miami
review: definitely worth the time and drive. By far one of the best to do events/mind puzzles in south Fl...

room_title: Escape room "DEA" by Suite 201 Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had a really good experience here tonight with my family of 5 and my brother included.  My children tagged along ages, 8,9, and 15 and it was very family friendly in the DEA room.  They were easily contacted via phone and easily booked the room online.

room_title: Escape room "DEA" by Suite 201 Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: SUCH A GREAT TIME! We had such a fun time doing this escape room. It was a Saturday when we went and we did the DEA room and loved every minute. This escape room has you so immersed, you feel like a real agent haha! You actually feel at one point that you're it's real life. The owner is so personable, professional and so cool. He answers all your questions and explains everything very thoroughly. Definitely will be coming back to do some of the other rooms. We found this place on Groupon and it was absolutely worth it.Thank you for a great Saturday night!

room_title: Escape room "DEA" by Suite 201 Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This has to be one of the greatest escape rooms I've done so far! I have done over 20 rooms and this one ranges on my top 10! very fun room, gets you thinking and also has a ton of puzzles I've never seen or done before. well done.

room_title: Escape room "The Haunted Mansion" by HD Escape Rooms Denver in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Agents of Influence" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Durango
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Lo$t Vegas" by Lost in Lutz Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "House of Pawns" by Escape Artist DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Sadly we failed to escape the room - but we were close. Went as a group of 7 (4 adults, 3 kids) - none had ever done an escape room before. We were greeted promptly -- and everyone was so super nice and friendly. Had a great time trying to figure out the clues - very well put together - not simple, but not impossible. I would suggest this to anyone that was to try something else.

room_title: Escape room "House of Pawns" by Escape Artist DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Visited Escape Artist on our trip to DC. Had a great time. The rooms were entertaining, well put together and challenging. If you're looking for a little adventure and fun, this is highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "House of Pawns" by Escape Artist DC in Washington, D.C.
review: A 3 generation birthday party for 10 of us. What a blast. We solved it as a family but that was only part of it thrill. Watching grandparent and teenage grandchildren all working alongside was awesome. Highly recommend and then walk around the corner to 8th street for a great meal afterwards.

room_title: Escape room "House of Pawns" by Escape Artist DC in Washington, D.C.
review: I've been to Escape Artist DC on two occasions - once with my family (8 people total) and once with friends (4 people total). In both instances, my group was the only one in the room, which was nice. This is a great team-building, critical thinking, and fun experience - even if we didn't make it out in time from one of the rooms. The owners will be changing the rooms/clues every few months which will allow people to go back for repeat visits to try a new challenge. It's nice to have an option for something different to do on an afternoon or evening out. The location is great as Barrack's Row restaurants/bars are just around the corner. Highly recommend this for families, friends, coworkers, etc.

room_title: Escape room "House of Pawns" by Escape Artist DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Thank you so much for making my engagement possible. I am beyond amazed at how you were able to customize the experience just for us. That truly helped it become a day we shall never forget. It was an honor working with you. The communication and planning efforts was superb. It allowed me to focus on other pieces of the engagement. We will be returning here as now we have an unforgettable memory tied to an unforgettable place. I will keep highly recommending Escape Artist DC to everyone I know. Thank you for everything you have done for us.

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape the Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: We had a great time! This place offers something different to do. If you are looking for fun, this is the adventure for you! Great, energetic staff was on point. Nicely done, Escape Room Live DC! 5 stars!

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape the Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Went with a group of friends and had a total blast. Highly recommend this place for a fun time.

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape the Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Really clever. 8 of us solved room d and had a great time

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape the Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Absolutely great experience. So much fun. Cannot wait to return for the other room(s) and bring more people. Everyone who can should Escape the Room DC!

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape the Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: I went with 2 girlfriends on a mission to find a party venue for a teenaged group. We had a fun time and can't wait for the kids party. Also, excellent customer service!!

room_title: Escape room "Headless Horse Man" by Pikes Peak Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: I did this one a little over a year ago now.  I’ve done 14 different escape rooms, and to be honest this is easily my least favorite one.  The decorations felt low budget, the hint system was terrible, and it realistically was just one puzzle.  I took my in-laws to it, it was their first escape room.  I insisted the next time they visited we do another room so they would get a better impression of escape rooms in general.

room_title: Escape room "Headless Horse Man" by Pikes Peak Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: It was fun even though we lost. We want to come again and do the gas chamber one. It was really fun trying to solve a mystery.

room_title: Escape room "Headless Horse Man" by Pikes Peak Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: I've done multiple Escape Rooms all over Colorado Springs, and while each were fun, none of them were put together, or detailed like Pikes Peak Escape Rooms. Our group had so much fun figuring out the puzzles, and we loved that they had an extra puzzle after you escaped the room for those who had time left. The staff was also very friendly and made the whole experience enjoyable. We're definitely returning to try out the Death Row room.

room_title: Escape room "Wrath of Anubis" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: I went with my husband and son. Wow did we have fun. It was okay at first but it got intense when we was running out of time. but we made it!! We will definitely be back! OH!! AND they took our pics with props!

room_title: Escape room "Wrath of Anubis" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: we had so much fun! definitely would come back. The staff was really friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Wrath of Anubis" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: Really fun experience. Tried their Egyptian theme and it was a really fun room. Got one hint, but completed room in about 41 minutes. Friendly and informative staff, interactive rooms, well put together and totally worth it. Would recommend to any age groups!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Teddy" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: We did it...used the clues to solve our escape!! With 24 seconds to spare!!! intense fun =)

room_title: Escape room "Lost Teddy" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: Great fun! We went for a birthday. We were all challenged. Be prepared, 60 minutes goes fast. The place was very clean. The staff was freinds. We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Lost Teddy" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: We came in a group of 4. This was a challenging and fun place to go with friends. The staff was very friendly and the price was great for what you get! The set and immersion was wonderful! Give this place a try!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound Supper" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: We had such an awesome experience playing "Spellbound Supper" last night. Shoutout to our most excellent game master JONATHAN for being just the best. Very pleasant, welcoming, and how he conducted himself as the host/maître d' from start to finish really made this a top-notch gaming experience for our group.The game itself was very innovative to me. Not sure how they pull it off, but I definitely felt we got our money's worth. For me, personally, Real Escape games have felt very challenging and near-impossible. SS was actually quite solvable -- thanks to Jonathan's gracious assists. We just didn't make it in time, but again, I felt we got our money's worth and got to experience something innovative and fun we'll be talking about for a long, long time.Minus one star for the condition of the game objects. The projector could have been stronger, brighter, sharper, I suppose. And did not project precisely on the plates. And some of the game objects (like felt and colored masking tape) were coming off whatever the objects they're supposed to be sticking to. Other than that, it was a great evening for all!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound Supper" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: My friend recommended to me. I had no idea what is Real Escape game, I have to escape?for what? from what? just many questions in my head. Anyway,I played Spellbound Supper with my 3 friends.We couldn't complete the game. But important thing is we had a great time to solve the mysteries! What a fun activity I recently discovered.I thought nice mixture of modern and classic.At the beginning we had no clue what we had to do. But A kind butler who serve the supper was assist us really nicely:giving us hints. I impressed that they have a real person(actor) to assist and lead the game,wasn't only automated computer system. I thought it was expensive activity when I purchased it, but after the game I felt great,I'm glad I came!! I can see this game works for building teamwork skills and own brain stretch. I should bring my boss and coworkers to here. I even became a fun of puzzles because of them. I would love to try other games they have!! highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound Supper" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: So, so, SO (darned) fun. The Spellbound Supper was a blast for this family of four (kids are 12 and 14).  It was quite challenging and we needed a lot of help on some of the challenges, but the staff was great and we got so, so, SO (darned) close to solving the puzzle. Alas. Without giving anything away, this was unlike any escape room any of us have ever done, so it was a fun new challenge for us. Every moment counted. Even though we weren't successful, it was a fab way to spend an afternoon followed by sushi and ice cream treats in the mall across the street for dinner. The kids even thought it was cool to hang out with their parents all day. Win win!!

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Alcatraz - Destination San Francisco" by ALL IN Adventures Waterbury in Southington
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Burned Out" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This is a seriously fun game for corporate groups. Big enough to fit a larger crowed, with plenty of puzzles for everyone to solve. The humor in the room is a great touch.

room_title: Escape room "Burned Out" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: *I am an internationally experienced Escape Room enthusiast with hundreds of rooms under my belt*Good staff, good location, original themes. Most, if not all, puzzles are unique in their origin and execution. For first timers or enthusiasts looking for a fun, silly theme, play LIT. For those looking for a small-group challenge, play Inventor's Secret. Larger groups will want to play Burned Out. I particularly enjoyed the mini-escape room that they offered in their lobby. This was only the second instance of that idea that I've found in Arizona and I wish more locations offered it as an intro and lobby time-killer.

room_title: Escape room "Burned Out" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: I love this place! I came here twice with my parents and friends to play Lit and Burned Out. Everyone in my group really loved it, even my parents who were unsure what it was or if they'd enjoy it. The puzzles make sense, unlike a lot of other rooms I've played. And the themes of the rooms are more unique than anything I've seen and super entertaining and funny! I'm definitely coming back to play Inventors Secret soon. Also shout out to the staff for being the best :)

room_title: Escape room "Burned Out" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Just played Burned Out and it was a very fun, challenging room! Love the theme and the puzzles are original with a touch of humor throughout. I also appreciated the variety of puzzle styles! This room was a good size and can fit a larger group which was nice.

room_title: Escape room "Missing Attorney" by Ruse Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: Ruse Escape Room is SO FUN! I am officially addicted!!!!! This was my first escape room and it was very clever with some fun surprises! The owner is wonderful and it was an all-around great experience! I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good time!

room_title: Escape room "Missing Attorney" by Ruse Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: The Missing Attorney room was great, lots of clues and a well thought through story. Owners were excellent people, looking forward to see what they come out in the future!

room_title: Escape room "Missing Attorney" by Ruse Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: Great birthday fun! Challenging for all ages. We had never tried an escape room before and we had a great time. Looking forward to coming back to try the new room!

room_title: Escape room "The Abandoned Mine" by Epic Escape Game in Grand Junction
review: Abandoned Mine was amazing! Great staff and Andrew was an awesome clue master! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Sulley’s Sinking Ship" by Escape Zone Oxford in Oxford (AL)
review: My 13 year old daughter went and left smiling. She had fun and was challenged. Good team building exercise.

room_title: Escape room "Chained" by Labyrinth Escape Games in Boise
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Abyss" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Abyss is so much fun! It's very tech related and the puzzles aren't like the other puzzles in other rooms. You have to really think what you would have to do in that situation. Also, the simulations are really cool. You feel that you are truly going under water, because the capsule moves slightly to give you that feel. If you are very claustrophobic I'd advise against this room, as the space is kind of small. Not extremely small, spacious enough for 2 people to move around, but not a lot. Very fun maze room. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Abyss" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Girlfriend I did 'The Abyss' room. The maze was perfect for us being new to escape rooms. It got our brains spinning quite a bit but looking back at it, it wasn't as difficult as it should have been for us. It was good for beginners. Definitely a fun time and left us wanting to come back to try the other rooms out

room_title: Escape room "The Abyss" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I attempted this room with my boyfriend recently when we found out that this opened because we had been wanting to do a room with just us 2 to see how much better we have gotten at escape rooms. This room was immersive, but that's every maze room escape room. It was pretty linear, considering how the room was only designed for 2 people to play. The only issue I had with this room was that there were a few technical issues with the room, such as things opening when they shouldn't, and other parts not working properly. I imagine they probably fixed it now, but those were some issues we had when we were playing this room. We still managed to escape with a few minutes to spare, although I imagine we would have escaped much quicker if we didn't have all those technical difficulties that threw us off.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Survival Run" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: OMG!! it was so fun and scary. We opened the area to the other place and we were terrified  OMG jeez  I definitly want to do it again and not be so scared!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Survival Run" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We had a family outing and the six of us had such a great time and cannot wait to go again. Zombie run was very exciting and fun even though we just fail to get out alive.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Survival Run" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Had an awesome time trying to escape the zombies!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Survival Run" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: My husband and I live in Illinois, we were visiting family. I have always wanted to do this, so I made them participate. We chose the Zombie Run. We all had a blast! My nephew can't wait to go back! I think I got him hooked! They did an awesome job with the game and helped us with a few clues, but we still ended up as zombie chow! Next time we visit we will do a different room! I look forward to returning!

room_title: Escape room "Party in Vegas" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Challenging puzzles and immersive experience! Did the Vegas room and it was lots of fun! I would definitely want to try the insane asylum next.

room_title: Escape room "Party in Vegas" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Our family went to the Las Vegas escape room and we had such a good time. We managed to get out in 50 minutes. Well worth it. The event coordinator was welcoming and funny. Coming back for the asylum room next time we are in town.

room_title: Escape room "Party in Vegas" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Had such a great time. This was my 3rd time going to an escape room in general and this was my favorite so far. We did the Hangover room and had a great time! I can't wait to go back and try the asylum next time.

room_title: Escape room "Party in Vegas" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: If you are a beginner in escape room world, I will definitely suggest to start with this room. It is fun and an easier room to escape, even here we had to ask for a couple clues, thankfully we got out on time. Next time we will go back to try the Asylum room. Good location and pretty assistance working at the front desk.

room_title: Escape room "Party in Vegas" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Came for my 9th and 10th escape room! My friend and I tried both the Asylum and Party in Vegas rooms. They are still pretty new so the tech worked very well. It's not so much of search and find like some other rooms. This is strictly puzzles and solving riddles. Party in Vegas was so much FUN!!! It was a nice pace of change compared to other serious rooms. The decor was great and highly immersive. But I would say it's one of the easier escape rooms. We only had three people and escaped in 53 mins.

room_title: Escape room "The Slasher" by Room With A Clue in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: To Zach, Josh, Courtney, and Brianna, thank you from both Dylan and me!! This staff will bend over backwards to make sure you enjoy your time in their rooms! It is absolutely clear that this group of employees is close knit and well managed. Each personality shines in it's own way, adding to the fun of each visit! These are some of the best rooms available. We've played escape games in at least five major cities and after having played 'Heist, Gold Rush, and Spec Ops' these are some of the best!! The sheer ingenuity of each room is astounding! We were challenged in ways we'd never before seen in a room. If you're seriously considering taking up the escape room challenge, do yourself and a favor and book here! It may be just a bit more expensive than other places, but it is ABSOLUTELY worth it.Again, thank you to Zach, Josh, Courtney, and Brianna for making our experience fantastic! Trust and believe we'll be back with reinforcements to take on Prison Break!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: We played Gold Rush today and out of the over 30 rooms in six states (yeah, we are addicted!), this was tied as our favorite room.Great game play that is very immersive and fun to do. Puzzles are challenging but not to the point of frustration. The game masters do a great job of helping you along but still letting you get the answer yourself. Great staff, awesome props and equipment and great location! Already booked another one for tomorrow!!!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Best. Ever. I've tried several escape rooms in the past. I found that most of them don't make much sense to follow especially in the beginning. You have to be some sort of psychic to get started. This one is clean, logical but also with varying difficulty. It's clean, well organized with great instructions. The people working there are friendly and the scape room is fun! We did the gold rush escape room however there's many more to choose from. They vary in difficulty and next time we're gonna try the hardest one. If you get out in time you can buy a prepaid card for 15% off the next visit! After trying a couple of escape rooms in other locations I was weary of trying this one but they definitely change my mind to how much fun escape rooms can be and I will be going back for sure! I think you should definitely check this place out, it's located near the SunTrust braves stadium. There's tons of places to eat there there's also tons of other fun stuff to do there including shopping. It has a great night see you in the area and I think there's parking available but it's paid. The price per person at the escape room is fairly decent around 35 bucks. Some of the rooms start later like around 1130/11:45 PM and they open around 8am (they rooms run through out the day!) I was impressed and had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: I had some time to kill before catching my flight home from Atlanta. I was walking around the stadium and found this escape room. I've never played before and had the time to kill so I thought I'd check it out. I HAD THE BEST TIME! I played with my boyfriend and we chose the Gold Rush room. We had a blast! We are hooked and will most definitely be back. The staff are very helpful and kind. They sign you up quickly and can get you in the next room available in a snap! Hope to see them again on my next visit!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: So fun! Loved it! We were warmly and enthusiastically greeted and felt welcomed and comfortable. Great lounge area overlooking the Battery while you wait. I wasn't sure what to expect, because each game is unique and everyone's experience is different. I'm not gonna lie, it was not easy. But CHALLENGE ACCEPTED! We had 3 teams of 8. Our room was the Gold Rush. I won't give anything away. I will tell you our room host was Richard and he was really helpful to us first timers. You have an hour to escape the room. I was worried about claustrophobia for some but it wasn't like that at all. Plenty of room. You are given a few clues which are helpful. Adrenaline rush was fantastic! Everyone had a unique contribution to help us solve our way through. Logic, math and common sense. And we did it with over a minute to spare! You get a sticker proving you did it and if you want, you can buy merchandise to further brag about your brilliance. You HAVE to try it. I will go back, for sure! Thanks to the entire staff for a great, fun afternoon!!!  You guys and girls rock!!!

room_title: Escape room "UFO's Are Real" by UFO VIDEO in Gainesville
review: The owner was very nice and super passionate about his games. Had a lot of fun there. Hope there can be more interactive games.

room_title: Escape room "UFO's Are Real" by UFO VIDEO in Gainesville
review: We had such a blast! We love getting together to play games and this was perfect for our bunch. We ranged in ages from 11- 70 and all of us had fun. The owner was super sweet and the clues were right on our level.

room_title: Escape room "The Finding at Christenson Manor" by Bible Treks Christian Escape Room in Denver
review: What a great experience! Collin was an excellent host and his passion and positivity is so contagious~~ the puzzles were great and we really had to put in a whole team effort~ highly recommend :)

room_title: Escape room "The Finding at Christenson Manor" by Bible Treks Christian Escape Room in Denver
review: This room was awesome and the people that put it together were amazing too! Great way to spread the gospel and have some fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Finding at Christenson Manor" by Bible Treks Christian Escape Room in Denver
review: I had an amazing time tonight. Thanks for a wonderful experience!

room_title: Escape room "Vault" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: Great way to spend a birthday with close friends! Vault 202 was awesome! Thank you to Tori for being a great host! We will definitely be back to try another room!

room_title: Escape room "Vault" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: Vault 202 was the very first escape room for 8 out of 10 of our group, and it was a wonderful experience from the waiting room to the exit! The vault was wonderfully atmospheric and challenging; we really felt like we'd accomplished something wonderful when we escaped with minutes to spare! Chandler was a wonderful master of games and we all enjoyed his guidance and camera concealed presence! Many thanks and we hope to visit again soon!!

room_title: Escape room "Vault" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: Went with some friends of ours from out of town and successfully completed Vault 202! We had a blast! It was definitely challenging but not impossible. Super nice decor, friendly staff, and unique challenges made for an overall great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Vault" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: We did Vault with 3 people and didn't finish. The room looked great and had some awesome special effects. The puzzles were tricky but there were unlimited clues, so that was nice. I will definitely be back to try more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "CSI: Conway" by Escape Mystery Rooms in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Cooperative: Episode 1" by Time Trap in Tampa
review: We had an awesome experience! The room was very well thought out. The owners we kind and helpful and we will definitely be back for the other rooms! Thanks

room_title: Escape room "The Cooperative: Episode 1" by Time Trap in Tampa
review: What an awesome experience. Time Trap escape room came to a Rotary function and was an absolute hit!!! My team managed to get out with 2 1/2 minutes to spare. I would recommend Time Trap Escape room to anyone!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Cooperative: Episode 1" by Time Trap in Tampa
review: LOVED The Cooperative! Great room, well thought out puzzles and lots of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Firewall" by Breach Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Went with my husband for a mini date night. We did the Firewall Escape Room, just us two and it was perfect.This escape room is definitely family friendly and was not scary as some other Escape rooms out there & definitely a good challenge.Needless to say, I recommend it and will be coming back with some of our friends to do the other room!

room_title: Escape room "Tesla's Secret Inheritance" by Maui Escape Rooms in Maui
review: Wow, what a great time. Paul was awesome, and he knows how to run a room right! Tesla room design was great. Clean, with great puzzles, and the entire room well-themed. These qualities only come from a solid company. Keep up the great work!

room_title: Escape room "Tesla's Secret Inheritance" by Maui Escape Rooms in Maui
review: We did the Tesla room! It was well thought out, challenging and totally in sync with the theme of the room. Service was excellent!

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by Escape Room 5280 in Longmont
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Virogenix Lab" by Escape Room Vero Beach in Port St. Lucie
review: Played Virogenix last night and it was really cool. Worth every penny and honestly they could be charging more. The computer system they have is amazing and we're really excited for their other rooms to open to go check them out as well!

room_title: Escape room "Submerged" by Ultimate Escape Game in Atlanta
review: I had a great time with some friends in Submerged. The game guide was super helpful and the rooms were incredibly immersive. I hope to get the chance to visit again and try more of the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Submerged" by Ultimate Escape Game in Atlanta
review: Best escape rooms I have seen! We had a large group of colleagues from work and did Submerged and Amnesia. Such a great experience! Excellent team building exercise. We will be back for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Submerged" by Ultimate Escape Game in Atlanta
review: Submerged was the best escape room I have been in!

room_title: Escape room "Mystic Mansion" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: I experienced the Mystic Mansion room and it was fun. The staff were very nice and it is also convenient that there is a restaurant downstairs.

room_title: Escape room "Mystic Mansion" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: My family and I drove out to FWB just to experience the Mystic Mansion and while we failed at being the world's best paranormal investigators we had a great time! Marlee was warm and welcoming and the hints she gave were fantastic! The room was well-designed with surprises galore! We can't wait to go back and try the Mummy room!

room_title: Escape room "Mystic Mansion" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: We did the Mystic Mansion escape with our four sons - age 22 to 13. It was challenging but achievable. With two minutes to spare, we made it out. Great activity for a small group. Teens took point and had a ball.

room_title: Escape room "Mystic Mansion" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: Creepy cool! We did Mystic Manor and it did not disappoint! The puzzles were challenging and the room was full of surprises! Will definitely be going back to try the other room.

room_title: Escape room "Mystic Mansion" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: This is a must do. Highly recommend this activity. Our family of 5 did the mystic manor. It was creepy but lots of fun. The puzzles were challenging but had lots of clues. We didn't make it out, but that only made us want to do more of them. Definitely worth it.

room_title: Escape room "Friday the 13th" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Overall we had fun doing the “Friday the 13th” room. Main lobby was nice to wait it, and they have lockers for jackets and phones to safely be stored in. The room itself looked amazing. The decorations were well done and we were creeped out from the start. We were told we only had 45 minutes to get out of the room, compared to a usual hour at other places. In the first section of the room, there was literally only one set of clues to work on so most of us just stood around and watched, or looked for other clues that didn’t exist. We entered the last part of the room where there were multiple clues to work on. Still seemed extremely easy and we escaped the room in about 13 minutes. Didn’t feel like we got our moneys worth out of it. They said since we set the time record for that room, we would get a 20% discount on our next room. We will see.

room_title: Escape room "Friday the 13th" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: We had an awesome time escaping Jason in Friday the 13th. TJ was awesome letting us know the rules, giving us time checks, and sadly the ONE hint we needed to escape.

room_title: Escape room "Friday the 13th" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: This was a great team building activity for my group of sorority sisters. We had so much fun working together to figure out the clues and escape within the timeframe! This is a great activity for any group, family, work team, etc.

room_title: Escape room "Friday the 13th" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: My friends and I completed the Friday the 13th rooms as part of a birthday celebration. The difficulty level was marked as a 7/10, which was pretty accurate. With a few clues in the second room, we ESCAPED! We had a great time, but would have liked to see one more room as part of the experience. Overall, given the amount of time allotted, I would recommend this activity for anyone looking to try something challenging, fun, and new together.

room_title: Escape room "Game of Espionage" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: We had a GREAT time with family. We did the Espionage Room as we had a young one (6 yo) that didn't like scary things. EVERYONE had fun doing the room. Everyone was able to come up with an answer to one of the challenges or questions.Would highly recommend this to couples, groups or family with people of any age. Just take into consideration the age of the children and whet they can handle.Would definitely do this again! ! ! !

room_title: Escape room "Game of Espionage" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: These people saved our evening! We had an issue with a nearby escape room company yesterday that somehow lost our friend's reservation, so they sent us to Breakout and the ladies at the counter created a later game just so we could all do a game together. We did Espionage and it was the hardest game we've ever done, but there were only 3 of us when it's made for a big group. I definitely want to go back and try one of their hardest rooms with a few more people! Y'all are awesome and we will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Game of Espionage" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: The Espionage room was an hour worth of fun! The eight people in our party were going back and forth trying to understand the riddles. Something that's great for the family and to test your brain!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Autopsy" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Our family had a blast! We did the Zombie Autopsy. It was perfect - not too creepy. Our teenagers liked it. The two young girls working that night were awesome and very helpful. We'll be back for the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Autopsy" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: I took my two 12-year-old grandchildren in the Zombie Autopsy Room. We almost escaped! It was awesome! We will do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Autopsy" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: I can't say enough about this awesome place! First of all, they were actually closed on the day we wanted to do it but the owner opened it up just for us! It was my son's 18th birthday and we wanted to do something different- this was definitely the right choice! We had a blast! There were 6 of us, and we did the Zombie Room - it was really tough, but we did it! In 51 minutes! KUDOS to Gulf Coast Escape Room for a very cool experience that we will never forget!!

room_title: Escape room "Nightmare Hotel" by Fort Smith Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: In terms of aesthetics, this is probably my favorite room ever! I just love how white everything is. I went with a group of 4 and this room was extremely fun, perfect for beginners. We escaped without asking for a single hint. Highly production value, great for beginners, would highly recommend for anyone who wants something on the easier side.

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did the Zen room on Friday night with 3 friends and we really enjoyed it. We didn't think that this room was super difficult but for beginners, it would be a good start. The whole production of the room was really cool, and the room was non-linear so one thing necessarily didn't lead to another. We came late at night so parking wasn't an issue. The workers here are super nice and helpful. I'd come back to try their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This room brought peace and serenity and also frustration and urgency! It was a different kind of room and using all elements were fun and tactical. I loved every aspect of it from the moment I walked in to the moment we escaped. We did this room the day before my birthday and BOY this was a great gift to play. Come with a peaceful mind set.. don't struggle to think too hard..everything you need to know to solve a puzzle is in the room.

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My husband and I escaped the new Zen Room in 47 minutes and we were very impressed! This room is definitely surreal and dreamlike in nature. I would say it's more of an adventure game than solving puzzles and opening locks. I love how the room tells a complete story from beginning to end, which adds a sense of accomplishment.

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We entered the Zen room with great anticipation of getting out before the hour expired. It took a bunch of teamwork, trial and error and goofiness.In 36:49 we exited with a solid nod to Rose who helped us only three times.Go here and do your best!

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Was great fun! We went with a group and we all enjoyed it and participated in figuring out the clues. Will come back again!

room_title: Escape room "The Paranormal Experiment" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Our team did the Paranormal Room! Our host was Elizabeth and she was an excellent guide! I have never participated in a group like this. It was challenging, engaging and fun and zap times scary!!!! I would recommend this Room for others to try. Builds teamwork in a fun way!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Paranormal Experiment" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: I loved this escape room! My friend and I joined another group of six and they came really late so our game master let us start early and they even offered to step in if a puzzle required more than 2 people which was really nice of them! Eventually our team eventually did show up so we didn't end up needing any help.We did the paranormal room and the production value was great! But it is very dark and you're only lit by the flashlights you're given so be prepared for that. Though it is creepy, it isn't too scary so besides from the occasional loud noise, you shouldn't be expecting any jump scares. And also you get unlimited hints, so that's great, our game master was very helpful and we definitely made use of those hints. Some puzzle do require things to be just right when you do them so that did lead to a bit of confusion in different parts. But other than that it was great and a lot of creepy fun! We got out with just a minute to spare!

room_title: Escape room "The Paranormal Experiment" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Pretty solid escape room, we did the Paranormal activity themed room and were able to escape with a group of 8.The price is pretty standard compared to other rooms in the area but I felt like the puzzles were well thought out for the most part here, and the production value of the room was a little better than my other experiences in the city.

room_title: Escape room "Refuge" by Exit Plan in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Escape Room 5280 in Longmont
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Element of Escape in Sarasota
review: If you love puzzles and you enjoy a good challenge, Element of Escape is the place for you!My group of five managed to escape the HEIST room with only a few minutes to spare! I've done a couple of other escape rooms throughout my travels and this one was extremely organized and well thought out. This would be a blast for any group or couple.I will absolutely be back to complete the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Element of Escape in Sarasota
review: Was able to escape the Heist with a group of five! Lots of fun; I'll definitely be back again!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Osiris" by Lara's Labyrinth in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Clown" by Big Escape Rooms in Atlanta
review: It was my birthday and we escaped! We had a great time! Do the clown room and you’ll be in for a fun high energy adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Clown" by Big Escape Rooms in Atlanta
review: We had an amazing time and actually made it out of the Clowns room. Viola was great too!

room_title: Escape room "Clown" by Big Escape Rooms in Atlanta
review: 12 of us from work went today for the first time. Did the Clown room. It was great fun!!!

room_title: Escape room "Clown" by Big Escape Rooms in Atlanta
review: Boris won! We came, we tried, we lost. The puzzles were challenging, the room was full of clues. I would definitely go again!

room_title: Escape room "Clown" by Big Escape Rooms in Atlanta
review: The Clown Room was so exciting ! You'll definitely have a great time and there's other great rooms to choose from.

room_title: Escape room "Bad Girl" by Storm Out in Miami
review: We booked the Night out at the bad girl kind of last minute, and had so much fun! Romelo and his staff were very knowledgeable and helpful to the max. I will definitely be coming back!

room_title: Escape room "Bad Girl" by Storm Out in Miami
review: The owner was super nice and informative. The puzzles were challenging but not impossible. This was a total rush...I felt like running a 5k afterwards!

room_title: Escape room "Bad Girl" by Storm Out in Miami
review: We had a great time here tonight. Excellent for both those looking to try their first escape room, as well as for addicts like us who are looking for something fun and new. We visited 3 different southern Florida escape room locations today and this was the highlight. We played all 3 rooms, and particularly enjoyed the 18+ "Bad Girl" room- would be a blast for a guys or girls night out paired with alcohol and Uber. Kudos to the owners to creating something really clever, unique, intuitive, and fun.

room_title: Escape room "Sanatorium" by Escape Anchorage in Anchorage
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the 7th Stone" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Had the pleasure of doing The Legend Of The 7th Stone and it was amazing!  Really one of the best escape rooms I have had the pleasure of experiencing.  Everything was top notch from the immersive theme to the helpful and energetic staff.  We made it out with a little more than 14 minutes to spare.  I honestly cannot wait to come back and try Great Outdoors!  Thanks for an amazing time!

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the 7th Stone" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This is a great place to go for all ages! I've done 2 of their rooms with my 8 year old son and both were challenging but FUN! We did The Principal's Office and The Legend of the 7th Stone. If you have kids hen you have to book the whole room but the flat rate to book it as a private room is reasonable. The staff has always been kind and friendly. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the 7th Stone" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Ohhhhyaaaasss

room_title: Escape room "Utopia" by Kuma Escape in San Jose
review: This game is technically the hardest level, with only about 5% success rate. I highly recommend a large party to participate in this stage because there are SO MANY PUZZLES. In terms of creativity, the puzzles are more trial and error, instead of methodical reasoning. Just keep trying, move fast, communicate and LISTEN!

room_title: Escape room "Utopia" by Kuma Escape in San Jose
review: We did Stage 2: Utopia and had a good time. I've done a different escape room with another company and it was too easy, Kuma was more challenging! Joseph and Sunny were really great "invisible men" and we enjoyed our experience more because of them.

room_title: Escape room "Utopia" by Kuma Escape in San Jose
review: We have attempted all 3 rooms and loved them all! Just tried Utopia and it was so much fun!! We were very close to finishing! Definitely get a good crew to come with you! We were made up of 4 teens and 3 adults and our varied experiences and skills made it so much fun!! Highly recommended and definitely worth it!

room_title: Escape room "Utopia" by Kuma Escape in San Jose
review: BEST GROUP ACTIVITY IN SAN JOSE SO FAR! If you think there is nothing to do in San Jose anymore, now there is something to do!Escaping a room in 1 hour, finding hints a riddles to figure out clues to escape the room!Great with friends and family! Team building exercise and just to escape!

room_title: Escape room "Utopia" by Kuma Escape in San Jose
review: Party of 8 all newbs and was sooooo close. Definitely has us all hooked and eager to try others! Awesome time for sure!

room_title: Escape room "The King’s Ransom" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: Glad to see others enjoyed this room but we did not. The clues were ambiguous at best and unlike some of the other reviews I’ve read, the “staff” was not helpful in “nudging” us in the right direction. Unless they felt repeatedly telling us to “use teamwork” in the final 5 minutes was supposed to be helpful. Uhh, thanks for the tip...

room_title: Escape room "The King’s Ransom" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: It was so hard and we couldnt get out! The clues didnt help and it wasnt fun. We just gave up!

room_title: Escape room "The King’s Ransom" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: I've been to escape rooms before and this was the best yet! And the ambiance sets the suspenseful tone! And it was great we solved the "King's Ransom", found King Edward's riches and rescued him from kidnapping.

room_title: Escape room "The King’s Ransom" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: It was so much fun. My friends and I did this for my birthday and it didn't disappoint. The Kings Ransom was the jam!

room_title: Escape room "The King’s Ransom" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: We had a 6pm appointment mid-week. Ended up being perfect because we played King's Ransom in our small group of 3 people. The staff was very welcoming. They were also super helpful if a clue didn't help, they would nudge you in the right direction keeping everything fun.

room_title: Escape room "The King’s Ransom" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: Our family had the best time. The six of us were paired with another couple to solve our Kings Ransom. We all worked together and solved it with over 25 minutes to spare. Highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "The King’s Ransom" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: Amazing! A totally different experience from anything we have here in WV, and so much fun! We decided on the Kings Ransom, and it was pretty awesome. I want to come back and do the Black Widow game very soon!!

room_title: Escape room "The Mustache Thief" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Our family had so much fun doing this! We will absolutely be back! Staff is great! Glad we found this little gem!

room_title: Escape room "The Mustache Thief" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: We had a blast, escaped, barely and it was worth every second.

room_title: Escape room "The Mustache Thief" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Excellent change of pace from the monotony of boring group activities. I personally panicked while my group kept it together, but we all had a blast and spent the following three hours talking about how we could've handled the challenges better. Too much fun, just the right level of difficulty without sitting around painfully on one task at a time. We all can't wait til next time.

room_title: Escape room "The Mustache Thief" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: We had a great time doing this. Would recommend to any family. The only thing we were bummed about is one of the locks was not locked so we skipped one door. They did apologize but thought they could give us a coupon for the next time.

room_title: Escape room "The Mustache Thief" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: We went back for a second time for our son's birthday. We had a BLAST with his buddies! They escaped the Mustache Thief room with 14 seconds left. Truly an excellent venue for any sort of celebration --- especially birthdays!! Love it!

room_title: Escape room "The Mustache Thief" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Had an awesome time! Did this with my husband on a date night, and will definitely go back with friends next time. The hour goes by fast!

room_title: Escape room "The Mustache Thief" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Excellent change of pace from the monotony of boring group activities. I personally panicked while my group kept it together, but we all had a blast and spent the following three hours talking about how we could've handled the challenges better. Too much fun, just the right level of difficulty without sitting around painfully on one task at a time. We all can't wait til next time.

room_title: Escape room "V.I.P.E.R's Nest" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Black Hole" by The Escapist Denver in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Raiders of the Lost Room" by AdventurEscape in Hartford
review: The four of us took on the Raiders of the Lost Room challenge as a private event. There was a great mix of puzzles and perception tests that kept us on our toes. While we needed some guidance at times from the man behind the curtain, we were able to find the treasure!

room_title: Escape room "Spy Games" by Ka-Ko Jo's in Fort Collins
review: This place is beyond awesome. The Escape Room was the best I have ever experience! A must try. Bowling was a ton of fun, and my boys loved the laser room. This is our new favorite place!

room_title: Escape room "Spy Games" by Ka-Ko Jo's in Fort Collins
review: We love Ka-Ko Jo's for family fun night and we have also gone with friends without the kids. Nice, clean, safe environment, good games - the escape rooms and glow golf are SO fun - good food, and great staff! Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Dognapped" by Extraordinary Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: Had a great first escape room experience in the "Dognapped" room, would definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Dognapped" by Extraordinary Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: Awesome escape room we had a BLAST!!! We called to see if she could squeeze us in on the same night which she did. We did the Dognapped room. It fits up to 4 people but we were 2 people and we made it out with 6 min left. The room holds many clues and you must find everything in order to move on. Not everything is a clue though. The pressure is on from the beginning so don't waste any time. We were able to ask for clues when we got stuck but she did not deduct time from the clock. Niki who was in charge was a very sweet woman and helped make the experience so much more enjoyable. Thank you for a great night we can't wait to come back with more friends

room_title: Escape room "Dognapped" by Extraordinary Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: This was my first escape room, but I can't imagine any being any better than this! I did the pet detective room which was awesome! I'm definitely sold on trying the two other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: By far the best escape rooms we’ve ever done. The production value is unreal. We did the psych ward and the fun house, both well worth the money.

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: THE BEST! After doing the Psych Ward yesterday I can totally see why they have 5 Stars. We did a family event that my brother had gotten us for a Xmas present and we had a total blast. The "orderly" that helps you totally stays in part through out the whole game and gently assists you when you get stuck which allows you to move along. So many different puzzles and clues and it keeps you on your toes. We are looking forward to going back and doing the Hex Room next. We totally enjoyed ourselves. It's also great for team building and we are thinking of coming here for a company event.

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: This place is great!!! There are 2 escape rooms and a new game called the Psych Ward. Our family has done the hex room escape game twice, and last night took a crack at the Psych ward which creates 2 teams, 1 of the sane and 1 of the insane, and puts them together to collect points and try to win against the other teams. The customer service is hands down great, and everyone sticks to the character so well. The games are some of the most tricky and integrated I've played yet. The atmosphere is just fun!! Honestly if you want to have fun this is place to go.

room_title: Escape room "War of Rogue Machines (W.O.R.M.)" by BreakoutStudios in San Jose
review: None

room_title: Escape room "King Tut's Tomb 1922" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: The King Tut room was very fun. Lots of puzzles, really made you think. Finished with only 2 minutes left!

room_title: Escape room "King Tut's Tomb 1922" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Absolutely fabulous. We had so much fun and Keith was an awesome guide for us. We finished the King Tut room with 2 minutes and 40 seconds to spare. Our whole family loved it.

room_title: Escape room "King Tut's Tomb 1922" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: We Finished the King Tut room with seconds to spare and cant wait to go back for another room!

room_title: Escape room "King Tut's Tomb 1922" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Great time with my grandparents solving the clues as a family.Recommend to all age groups-- Must see and do.

room_title: Escape room "King Tut's Tomb 1922" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Went to the KING TUT Escape Room of theirs with some strangers and it was even better than their Alcatraz room! This room is definitely more challenging, the puzzles are complex and require you to really pay attention, without taking you away from the fun and excitement. I was with a group of very smart girls so we completed it with 6 minutes to spare, you definitely have to be on your toes for this one!The room was very well done, you have to use lamps inside to see which made it so intense and all of the art, the sculptures, the tomb, every singe prop and set piece felt real and authentic, I didn't feel like I was playing a game; I was ready to bust out some Indiana Jones moves to get us out of there!I hear they're adding another room in February and it's a guarantee that we'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Space Sector" by California State Escape in Sacramento
