This is an experience that we would recommend for anyone and everyone. We run a level five organization, and we've never seen anything like this. This is a must do for any company or any group.!

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: This was our first time doing an escape room, and we loved it. Took three children and they were highly involved. The puzzles were challenging, but doable. We didn't escape with the money, but we really enjoyed ourselves. I would recommend this room.

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: This is the most amazing room we have done, everything thing about it is so amazing, the fact that you actually have to go old school for this room is what gives it the 5 stars, If I could give a million I would, thank you so much for the fun experience and staying in character the whole time. Definitely will be back for future rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: This was a solid escape room. It is a small space, but it was efficiently used. The host stays in the room with you, but it wasn't awkward at all, and he stays in character the whole time which cracked our group up several times. There is a creative hint system where you can get a hint by bribing your host with stacks of cash you find in the room, but that will lower your winnings. Very fun night!

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: Great overall experience! Very unique environment you can't find anywhere else! The game master, who is your assistant, has awesome character and diction. The puzzles are so great and unique in its meaning. The game master explained the game afterwards and even makes it more interesting! Definitely recommend to anyone. Kid friendly and gives a great early 1900's vibe.

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: The best escape room I've ever been to. I'm not sure what you're supposed to say about these kinds of things without giving much away, but if you choose to spend your time in this escape room you'll find it well worth it.Rather your average run-of-the-mill employee, those who work in this fine establishment role play the game perfectly and you will sincerely feel like you are in a high-stress, real-life situation rather than just a game.The puzzles were incredibly unique and nothing I had seen before, despite having done several escape games. If you're expecting to play an escape room game with a bunch of locks that ask for word or number combinations, be warned. Your brain will be stretched to the max in this game.

room_title: Escape room "The Mission" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Gem" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: As an escape room enthusiast, Imagine Escape Games is one of the best places I’ve been to. The puzzles are thoughtfully and interestingly designed and the aesthetics inside the room are incredibly immersive. My friends and I did Jungle Gem and ReSEArch. Both rooms were amazing. The staff was also very nice and welcoming. If you like escape rooms, you absolutely have to check out Imagine Escape Games.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Gem" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: We've done many escape rooms and we consider ourselves enthusiasts.We did Jungle Gem and ReSEArch, in that order. The props are great, the puzzles are great, the atmosphere is great. The rooms flow really well. I actually have no complaints. It is so refreshing to do a well thought out and put together escape room.I put these rooms on pair with rooms like The Basement in LA and The Hex Room in OC.So if you're looking for escape rooms in Tampa Bay Area, look now further. These shouldn't be missed.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Gem" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: This place was awesome! The game we did was the Jungle Gem. It was just the two of us but it was an awesome experience. The design of the room was fantastic. There was a lot of thought and engineering that went into the design of the room and it stands out! The owners were super nice and friendly, the lounge was very comfortable and the atmosphere was just great. Clues were very easy to understand from the mediator and the little videos giving you the back story of the Jungle Gem were funny. This is definitely one of our favorite escape rooms now. We can't wait to return and finish our story.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Gem" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Visited from out of town and this company came highly recommended by another company. I tried the Jungle Jem and had a great time! Puzzles were immersive and fun, the owners were very welcoming and really showed they enjoy their creation. Love the fact that the rooms all connect in a larger storyline. Next vacation and I will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Gem" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Imagine Escape Games was, by far, the best Escape Room I've ever done. It was my third escape game, and I loved the experience here. Their games and puzzles are very sophisticated and high tech. There is so much to discover in the Jungle Gem room... I don't want to say too much, but you have to go and play it! They were organized, kind, and fun. The room is just so well thought out and the props are the best I've ever seen. If you've done other escape rooms, you have to give them a try. And if you're looking for somewhere to start, start here!

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Gem" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: If you have not booked Jungle Gem, Go do it NOW! This room is amazing! Totally immersive, well thought out puzzles, and a very intriguing story line that leaves you wanting more. But enough about the room, let's talk about the owners. Mike and Hayley are the true Gems ( little play on words) of Imagine Escape Games. They are so passionate about the business and you can tell in all the little details in everything they do. They have put their Brains, hearts and souls into this business and their excitement about it all is contagious!!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Studies" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: Awesome experience! We played the Sherlock game. It was extremely immersive and made us feel like we were in the time period solving the murder. Very well themed and the entire escape room flowed well with all the puzzles. Challenging yet never overwhelming. Would do again in a heartbeat!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Studies" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: This was my 12th room. I don’t even remember anymore. This was the nicest-looking facility I did an escape room in. The props were high quality. We did the Sherlock room. It was very challenging. This was the only room I have ever done where you are given 75 minutes. It is very detailed and complex. I thought it was a lot of fun. I plan to do another room here next time I visit this area.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Studies" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: Lots of attention to detail and passion put into this place. Met Dan the owner who took the time to show us little fun surprises in the room after our time at Sherlock. Can’t wait to go back and try another room!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Studies" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: Astounding attention to detail, puzzling challenges, and lots of deductive reasoning needed to solve Sherlock, a fun and challenging adventure!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Studies" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: We walked in thinking this would be easy, I mean we had 75 minutes to finish, right? Wrong! Our group has done about 12 escape rooms apiece and still found Sherlock challenging. The clues were unique, puzzles were clever, and the staff was great! Dan did a wonderful job and we will definitely be back next time we are in town!

room_title: Escape room "Cannibal’s Den" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: We did the cannibal room and it was scary and so much fun! Our group worked together to find clues and help each other "escape" from the cannibal room. Everything looked so realistic and detailed. You'll have adrenaline pumping through you the entire time. There was a lot of effort out into production which ultimately helps it all seem realistic.

room_title: Escape room "Cannibal’s Den" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Cannibal room was a very fun and very immersive experience. The puzzles were challenging without being frustrating. I plan on returning for their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Cannibal’s Den" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Amazing escape room! We did the cannibal den and it was great! Ben did a great job at making us feel scared when we entered the escape room! Very great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Rowdy's Gold Claim" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Shipwrecked" by Chamber Escapes in Miami
review: I want to Thank Todd and Sean for and great experience. Had our group of cheer leaders in for some team bonding. They had thd best time talked about ot all day. Will going back for a parent night out. If your looking for a great group bonding this is the place to go.

room_title: Escape room "Shipwrecked" by Chamber Escapes in Miami
review: Went with a group of my friends. We did the pirate room! It was SO much fun! Todd is so welcoming and explains how everything works before you start. The rooms are decorated and the game is so creative! I have not laughed and had this much fun in a long time! Thank you Todd for such a wonderful memory with my friends and I!

room_title: Escape room "Shipwrecked" by Chamber Escapes in Miami
review: Never been to an escape room but this one was an amazing experience. Will definitely go back and try out the murder mystery one and the car one Todd told us about. Owner is a great host. Felt really excited throughout the whole hour. My coworkers and I beat the game with just barely a minute left. Best going away night with my team. Thanks Todd for this awesome memory!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Work Place: Office Party" by Sprightly Escapes in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Zombie" by Great Room Escape Denver in Denver
review: I had a great time in the Zombie Room! Our team was so close to escaping. I can't wait to come back to try the Cabin Room!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie" by Great Room Escape Denver in Denver
review: This was an awesome experience. I was super nervous going in. But it was a blast!! I can't wait to go back and do other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie" by Great Room Escape Denver in Denver
review: This is the best! They have to hurry and make more so we can do this every month! I'm getting excited just thinking about it, but I don't know how to tell anyone how awesome this experience is without giving spoilers... just go, bring your friends and family, you will not be disappointed.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie" by Great Room Escape Denver in Denver
review: I went with a group of ten and it was such a fun experience! I enjoy a good mystery and this puts your detective skills to the test! The venue was a little hard to find at first (remember, building C-2) but the room was well put-together, and the costuming and make-up was on point. The employees were professional, down-to-earth, and made the experience even better. Plus, I have never encountered a zombie before!I highly recommend this adventure and I hope another story/theme unfolds soon!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie" by Great Room Escape Denver in Denver
review: I took my 22 year old son and 16 year old daughter and we all had such a great time. It's hard to find something unique and fun to do as a family and we will definitely be coming back and trying another room.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie" by Great Room Escape Denver in Denver
review: If you need something fun to do with a group of your friends or co-workers, I would highly recommend checking out the Great Room Escape. I booked it for my husband's birthday as a fun, quick -- we were there a little over an hour total - group activity and we were not disappointed. The way they set up the room itself was gave you all of the right thrills and trying to find the puzzles and then work them out was exciting and really fun! We are already planning the next birthday, so we can try the other room!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie" by Great Room Escape Denver in Denver
review: Man was this place awesome!!! Just finished it about 2 hours ago and had my blood pumping the entire time. You're locked in a room with a bunch of people you may or may not have known before tonight and you must use teamwork to solve your way out!!! So many crazy puzzles to try and solve before the killer or zombie get you and only a limited time to do it in. Definitely recommend this to anyone!!! I seriously cant stop thinking about it

room_title: Escape room "The Grand Zeppelin" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Me and my family came to do the great zeppelin room we had our littles with us as well 5mo 7 and 4! We all had an amazing time! As this was our first time doing an escape room!!!! Thank you so much for a great time! We definitely will be back! Tom was phenomenal! I definitely recommend coming here!!! Absolutely love it!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Grand Zeppelin" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Desi, Tom and Megan were an extreme pleasure. The room was captivating intricate . Complety and totally maintain character and theme of the room.Seemed like they really enjoyed their jobs. I’d highly recommend this company and this room (Grand Zeppelin)!!If you do decide to go definitely bring a larger group. We manage to escape with two people . But the room was designed for 10 or more with lots of intricacies and mutilple layers

room_title: Escape room "The Grand Zeppelin" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Grand Zeppelin: Great time, good puzzles, great actor in room, excellent story line, fun, worth the money. I’d do another one of their rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Little Candy Shop Of Horrors" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We were hesitant to try such a newly opened place but boy did they deliver! We did the Candy shop of horrors and it was amazing! The clues were definitely hard and I loved the fact that it wasn’t just find a key and open a box like a lot of them are. The different elements for clues were pretty difficult and so much fun. My favorite room so far out of all the ones I’ve done. Can’t wait to try another at Zescape!

room_title: Escape room "Little Candy Shop Of Horrors" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We did the candy shop room. It was one of the better escape rooms we've done. There were several different kinds of puzzles and not just a bunch of padlock keys. I think we were one of the first groups to do this room and they had a couple of bugs to work out but we'll go back.

room_title: Escape room "Little Candy Shop Of Horrors" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: I did the Little Candy Shop of Horrors with my adult nephew and sister on a Monday afternoon. This was the hardest escape room, and because no one was scheduled after us, they let us continue after our time limit was up if we wanted to. We definitely needed hints and even managed to solve 2 of the puzzles accidentally (thinking we were clever until later). We enjoyed the theme and found the puzzles challenging but had fun. The only issue we had was finding the location in a complex of office buildings. It's worth the effort though! I look forward to going back when I'm in town again to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The King's Treasure" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: This room was amazing and a lot of fun for our kids! We can't wait to try another room! They haven't been open that long and are already our favorite location we've been to in Georgia!

room_title: Escape room "The King's Treasure" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We brought our kids to do this room and it was a lot of fun even for us adults watching the kiddos work together! We had a hard time letting the kids do all the work! In fact, we did end up solving a puzzle or two.. It's hard to just watch them have all the fun!

room_title: Escape room "The King's Treasure" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: This place is fantastic! We did the king room with my 7 year old and 10 year old and they loved it! Can’t wait to try the adult rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The King's Treasure" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: I took four 8/9 year old boys to do the Kings Treasure room, and they loved it so much that we stayed and did another one together! Great time for all of us. I would highly suggest going.

room_title: Escape room "The King's Treasure" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: New place, but already a winner! It was so much fun and our kids loved the kids escape room, The Kings Treasure. Us moms did the Cells room which was amazing and just kept surprising us...biggest escape room I've ever seen! I loved that our kids could do their own room while the moms had their own fun. We will be going back and I plan to have a group outing there soon!

room_title: Escape room "Warlord" by Daytona Escape Games in Daytona Beach
review: Had a great time on Monday! Can't wait for new rooms to open up. Will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Davinci Exhibit" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: We took a group of 20 from our youth group and everyone had a great time. Rooms are very well done and challenging.

room_title: Escape room "The Davinci Exhibit" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: The worker was super helpful and nice, we were having a tough time but the hints really helped! Would recommend, was a great time.

room_title: Escape room "The Davinci Exhibit" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: super fun and cool staff.

room_title: Escape room "Where in the World?" by Beach Escape Game in Tampa
review: We got this as a Christmas Present from our family, so we decided to take them with us. I would highly recommend it! It was challenging yet fun and made us work together the entire time. Everyone was involved and pulled their weight. We did Around the World, apparently the toughest room, and escaped with just 30 seconds to spare. No time was wasted! Great staff too!!!

room_title: Escape room "Where in the World?" by Beach Escape Game in Tampa
review: My husband and I were paired with 4 others on a journey around the world. We all worked great together even though we were strangers. The clues were well thought out, challenging and really exciting! We had a fantastic time ( especially since we made it out with less than 10 seconds left)!! We will be back to try out the other 3 rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Where in the World?" by Beach Escape Game in Tampa
review: We came in to Beach Escape Game as a group of four and did the Caged and Where in the World rooms. We escaped both with very little time to spare, but had a great time. The staff was very friendly and we will definitely be coming back to do the other two rooms on our next trip.

room_title: Escape room "The Medieval Library" by Enter the Room in Colorado Springs
review: Midevil Library was fun. A little tough for us, but we made it out with 3 seconds to spare. I think we were overthinking a few puzzles. Great to see that the 2 new owners are trying their best to turn things around and make the place a good game. We will be back to try 999 Strange Place.

room_title: Escape room "The Medieval Library" by Enter the Room in Colorado Springs
review: Good.    A decent amount of challenge and good theme.

room_title: Escape room "The Medieval Library" by Enter the Room in Colorado Springs
review: They did a great job challenging us and making the experience super fun.

room_title: Escape room "Helter Skelter" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: We did Helter Skelter and were able to escape... Very challenging and super fun... Can't wait to come back to try another room!!

room_title: Escape room "Helter Skelter" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: Fun escape room!  We did Helter Skelter with 8 people ranging in age from 17 to 48. The theme was done well, the puzzles were clever and the game flowed well from clue to clue.  I think 6-8 people is good for this room, and I would say it is about Medium in difficulty. The host Ashley was extremely accommodating, I cannot say enough how pleased I am that she moved us to a different room that would work better for our group.  Nick was the game master, his clues were good maybe a bit too easy even, but he was extremely attentive, he could tell we were lost down a wild goose chase and nudged us along. Which keeps it fun. I will definitely be booking again for one of their many other rooms! Note: if you book Black Site, there are only 4 of you in the room together, if you have more than 4 you will not get to play together, which was why we moved our group of 8 to Helter Skelter.

room_title: Escape room "Helter Skelter" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: We had a great time tonight doing the Helter Skelter room! Staff is friendly, patient, and helpful. They are dedicated to everyone having a fun and challenging experience. Definitely worth checking out for a unique and enjoyable outing.

room_title: Escape room "The Elevator" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: Honestly I'm always a skeptic about these things but I was pleasantly surprised with this place.  My family & I had a FANTASTIC time!!  What a great way to do family game night!!  Elevator A room is perfect for all ages.  Zack is an amazing host & we were SUPER entertained.  He also explained everything very well to us novice players LOL.  Thank y'all, can't wait to try Area 51 room!!

room_title: Escape room "The Elevator" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: Family fun Friday night! Great time in Elevator! Sam was awesome. We are looking forward to returning for another adventure.

room_title: Escape room "The Elevator" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: We had the best time here today! We can with two adults and our 2 daughters (11 years old) and competed against each other in the Elevator rooms. So much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: My friend and I did this as a birthday gift for her. It was our first time to do anything like this. We had a blast at Breakout Birmingham. We did the Museum Heist room. It was challenging and fun. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We had an awesome time at Breakout in Homewood. We were greeted with friendly service and everything was explained to us in depth. We all really enjoyed ourselves. Great family fun-filled outing.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Definitely fun times. We did the Mystery Mansion room and I had a blast. It was very good mental exercise, challenging. You definitely have to pay attention to detail here, but I feel like after doing one room I might be more prepared for the others. Worth checking out with a good group of friends.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: This was my first escape room. The Mystery Mansion was great!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Had a total blast! Our game master, Emma, was so cool and patient! We're already planning on going back and trying the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Cursed Vault" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This was our first time going to an escape room and all I can say is AMAZING! This place rocked! We had a group of 7 and almost finished - maybe next time;) Our just Donnie was great as well! I highly recommend visiting them for your next adventure!

room_title: Escape room "The Cursed Vault" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This was the first time that my cousin and I have done something like this. Jack was very personable and made us feel at ease about that. They truly did a wonderful job of the story line and although we did not escape (but did come very close), the level of difficulty was appropriate. Great team there and very welcoming. We cannot wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Cursed Vault" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Fun and Challenging. Made it to the very end and ran out of time. Will book more in future visits to Denver, CO. and other cities.

room_title: Escape room "Casino Royale" by Escape the Cape in Fort Myers
review: Great time! Have been to a few, their host was definitely most personable which made overall experience better.

room_title: Escape room "Casino Royale" by Escape the Cape in Fort Myers
review: Had a blast in the new Casino room! 🎰 Definitely going again!! Something different to do in Southwest Florida indoors and air conditioned!

room_title: Escape room "Casino Royale" by Escape the Cape in Fort Myers
review: WHAT A GREAT TIME!! I took my family on New Years Eve and we had a blast- we did Casino and it was the perfect combination of challenging puzzles and thrilling time. Would highly recommend this to anyone in the SW Florida area ♥️♥️♥️

room_title: Escape room "The President's Bunker" by The Great Escape Room in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Would definitely come back and do it again! Great time had by all. Very good team building experience strengthening communication skills within the group as well.

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! Made you use your noggin and tested your ability to read between the lines, but wasn't so impossible that you didn't keep figuring things out til you were able to escape. Would definitely go back!

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My friend and I booked a room on a Wednesday afternoon! It was one of the best experiences that we have had in a while! It was so much fun, we can't wait to come back!!

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had a blast at this location!! Definitely challenges you and it was really cool working with strangers toward a common goal. The staff was helpful and nice. Would definitely recommend and will be making another visit!!

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Katie and I had a great time in the Amazing Escape Room...great times and lots of pics with friends... lots of laughs and tears...I would definitely do it again. You guys have to try it out at least once...we are going back

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This place is awesome!!! I was there yesterday, January 31st, and the place was really cool. Had a great time with my family and guess what? Hines Ward, Steelers Great, was there with his family. Double treat for me because I love Escape Rooms and am a lifelong Steelers fan! Never know who might be in your room with you when you go through.

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: First time here on a date and we chose the Roaring 20's room with no idea what was to come. We had THE most amazing time! We made it to the last puzzle, but didn't get out in time. Now we are hooked and ended up staying to do the Desert Storm room. Very challenging but we made it out of this one with minutes to spare! So exciting and brain exercising, perfect place for a second or third date.

room_title: Escape room "Tomb of the Pharaoh" by Unity Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: My friend and I came to do Person of Interest but afterwards we asked if we could do the next two rooms and they were very accommodating. It was lots of fun because we got to meet the owner's parents and son who served as our Game Masters before the owner returned as our Game Master for the other two. As a person who grew up in a family business it was awesome to see dynamics like that still happen. The Tomb of the Pharaoh was our favorite of the three so if you can only do one while you're here, do that one! Can't wait to try their new room opening up soon. Thanks UNITY for the amazing customer service and for a fun night.

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Phoenix
review: Best Birthday party place I’ve found for my sons 9th birthday! I only had to worry about having a good time. Everyone had a blast! Thank you so much for working so hard to have us enjoy his day!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Phoenix
review: My family and I had a great time. The staff was very understanding and awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Phoenix
review: I took my daughter and three friends here for one of their escape rooms last night, and they had a great time. The Detention room was challenging, fun, and a great theme for kids (based on their words, since I didn't go in). Garret and Jesse were just amazing. I waited in the lobby while the girls were in the room, and between customers, the guys kept me company and then let the girls continue the room passed their time limit since no other customers were waiting. They were great with my group and from what I overheard, great with every other group. Super friendly and funny. They treat their customers like friends, which is perfect in that type of environment. Genuinely awesome guys, and even though I don't live in the area, I'll be returning just because of them.

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Island Escape was my 2nd room from Breakout Games - Jacksonville. I was pleased the first time escaping Haunted Mansion with a party of 8 and I was equally as pleased the 2nd time, escaping the Island with 6 people. Island Escape was definitely more challenging = even more fun! My first team wouldn't have made it through the 2nd room. The puzzles were more challenging, but that made it more satisfying. It also would have been too crowded for 8 people. I'd definitely cap off at 6, or do it again with fewer folks.2 out of 2 for Breakout Games. I'm coming back for Kidnapping or Hostage next time!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Did as a Bday Party and had a Great time. Had a group of 8 who all were 1st timers. We didn't make it out in time. My suggestion is with your 1st clue ask where should you start at and have Everyone work on that together. We definitely all will be back. If you like games and puzzles this is a must try.

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Breakout Games was so much fun!  Kassy was an amazing game master and super helpful. Island Escape was an absolute blast. Challenging, fun, and well designed. Will definitely be back to conquer the rest of the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Love that you reserve the entire room! Island Escape was great with a couple of twists we have not previously seen.

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: My friends and I chose the Island Escape room, and had an awesome time! Our moderator was helpful and attentive (even when we accidentally broke a prop!), and the room was pretty well fleshed out. This was a serious challenge and we definitely got our hour's worth out of it. Good for groups small and large. Definitely will go back!

room_title: Escape room "Captain's Quarters" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We did the "Captain's Quarters" and had an absolutely fantastic time. I took my son and his 5 of his 13-year-old friends. We did need to use all our clues and finished with 10 mins to spare. Kids had a great time and said, "best party ever". The staff were very friendly and professional. Thank you, Espace room Mesa.

room_title: Escape room "Captain's Quarters" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: The facility was clean and organized. We did the Captain's quarters. Staff was great. Puzzles were challenging. We scathed by without having to walk the plank. We had a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Captain's Quarters" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: So much fun!! Can't wait to go back!!! Escape Room Mesa had so many experiences to choose from. We ended up walking the plank in the Captains Quarters but had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Captain's Quarters" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Went for the first time today with three family members and this place is awesome! The staff are friendly, the puzzles were interesting and the ambiance very fun! We were able to have the Captian's Quarters room all to ourselves and we finished a minute ahead of the hour. After we were finished, the staff let us use props from the room to take pictures, and gave us souvenir rubber bracelets. Plus, when the staff heard it was my sister's birthday, he gave her a Happy Birthday rubber bracelet!

room_title: Escape room "The Dynaline Incident" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: We had so much fun solving Dynaline that we plan to come back when the sequell is ready (hint, hint) The puzzles were top notch and we were impressed with the hidden rooms, logic puzzles and the technical aspects were very well done.

room_title: Escape room "The Dynaline Incident" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: I did the Dynaline Incident and it was my first escape room. The room was very well put together with a lot of creative puzzles. We escaped with just a few minutes to spare and all had a blast! Look forward to doing another room at Quandary!

room_title: Escape room "The Dynaline Incident" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Had the opportunity to play the Dynaline Incident room. The room is awesome, it immediately makes you start thinking. Time starts and after each puzzle is solved, you will be excited for the next part of the game. I won't provide any more details other than you'll be pleasantly surprised throughout the entire game, and will definitely be challenged and must work as a team! Enjoy. Great room Quandary

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Of The Red Dragon" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Red Dragon- We booked this one in the next time slot right after we got out of The Office. This room is intense. It's not like any of the others they have. I had so much fun in this room. Was stuck on one of the first puzzles in the beginning but just remember everything that you need to solve the riddles is in the room with you, no matter how unimportant you may think it is. This room is also a higher tech room which utilizes more than just the typical lock and key. For sure one of my favorite escape rooms! We escaped with 3 minutes left!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Of The Red Dragon" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I've only experienced one other escape room, and this location definitely takes the cake! We were able to complete the Red Dragon room. Jeremy was an amazing host and made it an enjoyable experience.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Of The Red Dragon" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: A really fun experience! The two of us tried to solve the Mystery of the Red Dragon. We lost but got close. The design was top notch. I would strongly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Of The Red Dragon" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This is such a fun and interesting concept, and it allowed myself and my group to use our minds in other ways than we do in day-to-day life. We made it out of the "Mystery of the Red Dragon" room with just 1:15 to spare! It was an exciting experience and I will definitely be back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Of The Red Dragon" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I went to this Escape room, and did the Red Dragon themed room. What a blast! We have booked another room, but I was unable to attend do to my dog being ill. Steve, not only was extremely apologetic to what was going on, but he honored my Groupon and set me up for another day! I have to say, that this is the best customer service I've ever received at ANY escape room! The rooms are fun, the challenges are there and the owner is a rockstar! Thank you Steve, for being so helpful. Customer service at its best, we will see you soon!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: Best time... ever!!! Honestly, the entire staff at America's Escape Game were fun, energetic and welcoming! Siggy was our "guide" and she was phenomenal! Our group (7 people = 3 adults, 4 teenagers) had such an amazing experience in the Asylum room. The clues were challenging but not impossible. We finished in 42 minutes and are currently 5th on the leader board . We have finally found a new activity our families thoroughly enjoy! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: My team had such a great experience here. We had 15 participants and completed Asylum in two groups. This is a great evening out, where employees enjoy each others company, develop healthy communication skills and work together to solve riddles! A little competition never hurt anyone either.We can't wait to come back. Siggy was fun and helpful too!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: Definitely recommend coming here! The staff was amazing, the puzzles were a blast and the room (The Asylum) was so much fun! Can't wait to return and try out the other rooms! Thanks for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: The exterior had us worried, but the tight, well-crafted escape room (Asylum) relieved any anxiety we had about it being a throw-away experience. I almost took away a star for their dependence on combination locks, but those are merely the end of what's usually a satisfying variability in getting said digits/letters/directions.

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: My daughter and I were testers for Asylum. We absolutely loved it! The room was challenging and we did pretty well considering it was just the two of us. It was set up well and the ambience was fantastic. The employees were very helpful and friendly. It was an excellent experience. We would definitely return, although with a bigger group next time!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Mysterious Room" by Quadra Escape in San Jose
review: A super-fun way to spend an evening! Plan for drinks after because you'll be pretty keyed up when it's over! The puzzles were multi-layered and intriguing. Very creative! Enjoy.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Mysterious Room" by Quadra Escape in San Jose
review: Super fun and challenging and way more exciting than I thought it would be. Seriously a good time. We came soooooo close to getting out, but couldn't quite pull it off.

room_title: Escape room "Riddle Room" by Escape Quest Tampa in Tampa
review: I've done about 15 escape rooms and this ranks among the top 3. Challenging, lots of items to solve and unique puzzles! So much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Riddle Room" by Escape Quest Tampa in Tampa
review: Great times trying to solve the puzzles. The staff is super helpful and friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Yes. It’s pricey. Yes. I’d pay double to do it again and again and AGAIN!!! It is beyond completely worth the price because of the thrill alone! You will NOT regret it! You’ll want to do them all!!

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Staff were excellent and professional, you could tell they cared about your experience. Facility and props were high quality. Would definitely go again.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We went here with family as it was their first time doing anything of this sort and we loved it !! Every one at Breakout was very friendly and informative before our game started , i would defiantly recommend going to see them .

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: I just returned to Breakout again to try out their new room "Runaway Train". As always the staff is super friendly. The game master was non-intrusive but attentive and helpful when needed. Breakout's rooms are always fun and they seem happy to keep things as serious or light as an individual group wants. Runaway Train is a physically small room so 6 or 7 people is plenty. The decor is well suited for the room, and there are some cool puzzles to be had. This room is a little bit math heavy. Breakout remains the best escape experience in Birmingham!

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Our group did the Runaway Train escape room and it was by far the most exciting escape experience I have ever had. The room had a lot of super unique puzzles and challenges that I haven't seen before in any other room. Our game master Christian was extremely helpful and made the game go very smoothly the whole time! I would one hundred and ten percent recommend checking this out.

room_title: Escape room "Erased" by Ultimate Escape Game in Atlanta
review: This was my second time here. The first time I did the Hacker room and this time I did it’s sequel, “Erased”. It was in the same rooms which you wouldn’t know at all. The games felt familiar but also totally different. It was a really great experience. The staff was fun and energetic. The game was difficult but possible. We will definitely do this again soon!

room_title: Escape room "Erased" by Ultimate Escape Game in Atlanta
review: My family and I recently visited this escape room for my brothers 15th birthday. This was our first experience doing an escape room. Our family has always loved puzzles so my brother chose to do the hardest one, Erased. When we got there the crew offered to let us do a less difficult one, but my brother was determined. The room was extremely fun and challenging. We got about halfway through it, but didn’t escape. We enjoyed it and plan to go back there very soon. The crew is extremely friendly, the rooms are fun, and everything thing else in between was simple, clean, inviting, and so much more.

room_title: Escape room "Erased" by Ultimate Escape Game in Atlanta
review: We booked Erased (Hacked 2.0) for a smaller birthday group of 4 adults and 1 teen. This room is so elaborate with an overwhelming amount of tasks. Unfortunately, we did not 'escape' within the allotted time, but had a blast! Highly recommend for more experienced escapees.

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Coven" by HD Escape Rooms Greeley in Fort Collins
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Shanghai Savannah" by Encryption Escape in Savannah
review: During my visit to Savannah, my best friend and I did Pirates of Pembroke escape room. We had a wonderful time. It was challenging, the staff was friendly, and overall a great time. I would recommend this to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "Shanghai Savannah" by Encryption Escape in Savannah
review: Our group did the pirate escape room last night and had an absolute blast! Every single aspect from the tour through the escape and afterwards with taking pictures was just excellent! I highly recommend this to everyone! Was a wonderful experience and I cannot wait to go back for our next adventure!

room_title: Escape room "Shanghai Savannah" by Encryption Escape in Savannah
review: So much fun! The staff was great and the lady that gave us clues was amazing! We did the Pirates of Pembroke and beat it with 9:23 to spare... what a great time we had with our friends for our Marine Corps Reunion in Savannah Georgia!

room_title: Escape room "Shanghai Savannah" by Encryption Escape in Savannah
review: The first escape room I've ever done, I was kind of apprehensive about it but once we got in my friends and I had a BLAST! Staff was super nice and we got to meet precious little pup Biscuit at check in! We made it out with a minute and thirty seconds to spare, would definitely try more escape rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Shanghai Savannah" by Encryption Escape in Savannah
review: First escape room I ever did and I loved it, difficult but really fun to do it. Staff is great and energetic, overall great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Catch 22, the Merge" by Code To Escape in Daytona Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dash For The Cash!" by Escape Room Adventures in Henagar
review: None

room_title: Escape room "A Wizard's Journey" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: Great experience with a grat staff. We did the Wizard Adventure and it was great. I would highly recommend this tk anyone. We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "A Wizard's Journey" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: Super fun! The rooms are amazing love the theming and the Harry Potter Room was a blast! Thanks to Alison for her awesome clues and commentary! She definitely was the extra added cherry on the top of our night tonight!

room_title: Escape room "A Wizard's Journey" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: A group of us (5 people) did the Harry Potter themed room and we had an absolute blast. Alison was really upbeat and personable. We will be going back again and we're going to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "A Wizard's Journey" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: We did the Wizards room and were very impressed with the quality of the room, the props and the puzzles. Have been to five Escape rooms on the East Coast and Florida. Great Escapes-DE was probably the best. The staff was helpful when needed but let us figure a lot out on our own. Will have to come back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Death Alley 1892 Dead or Alive" by Daytona Escape Room Experience in Daytona Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Escape Room 5280 in Tampa
review: Very fun first experience. I would recommend the heist for larger groups. The Sherlock Homes room was a fun and creative challenge. Will come again! 🔎

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Escape Room 5280 in Tampa
review: First of all, we booked the wrong date. We were also late LOL. The service was amazing. They were able to accommodate us (group of 7) and we have a great time trying to figure out all of the clues and puzzles (the heist) . We would definitely do it again.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Escape Room 5280 in Tampa
review: We escaped from The Heist! Great room, great owner! I would highly recommend going to this escape room over lot of the escape rooms in strip malls. They will slide tips under the door if you get stuck rather than stopping the whole room but coming over an intercom system.

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: Conspiracy was the hardest room I have done. My 3rd place to try an escape room. This place didn’t disappoint. There were 3 couples and although we didn’t escape, we will be back for sure.

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: My husband, grown kids and myself went tonight. We were in the”Conspiracy “ room and it was challenging but fun! We’ll definitely do this again!!

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: My family did the Blitzkreig and Conspiracy rooms here. Both were a great immersive experience and an excellent challenge to any group. The Conspiracy room was especially engaging. Our gamemaster also did an excellent job at helping us along when we ran into any issues.

room_title: Escape room "The Crypt" by The Gamers Escape Room in Temecula
review: Had a great time although we didn't escape in time! Very creative clues! Had a blast and we totally recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Crypt" by The Gamers Escape Room in Temecula
review: So it was harder than some of the others we had done. Super nice guy that runs the place. Would go back and recommend to others. Thanks for the entertainment.

room_title: Escape room "The Crypt" by The Gamers Escape Room in Temecula
review: this was my first escape room and it was amazing! we loved it so much. i cant wait to do more escape rooms in the future! had a great time, & the employee was really nice and helpful with clues when we buzzed in and needed one!

room_title: Escape room "Scorched" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: My second visit to Outerlife Studios. This time the six of us tried the new Scorched Escape room and the folks at Outerlife have done a great job again! The room was kind of creepy in a good way and every bit as challenging as their other room Disarm. If anyone in your party is very old or physically challenged I would recommend the Disarm room as it is easier physically. A great way to spend time with friends or family and you will learn how they handle problem solving.

room_title: Escape room "Scorched" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: Our group of 4 did the 'scorched' room and we were absolutely blown away! Other escape rooms we had done before didn't even come close! I won't give away spoilers- but the entire atmosphere of this room was just top notch. You go through so many different areas, it is decorated perfectly, and they even have music/temperature/scents/extras to set the mood! I (unfortunately) typically find escape rooms to be too expensive, but with how much detail (both set up and during the game) went into this room, I feel it was appropriate. GO TO THIS ESCAPE ROOM! Challenging & oh man, we couldn't stop talking about how cool the experience was.

room_title: Escape room "Scorched" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: Scorched is the best room I’ve ever done, while Disarm is amazing too! The theme, puzzles, and progression of the room is something you seriously cannot find anywhere else! Outerlife Studios steps up the bar 10 notches on escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Scorched" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: We went to Outerlife on the recommendations of other enthusiasts to do their room "Scorched" and were VERY impressed! The set was massive and very, very immersive! Our GM was outstanding and we had a blast topping their leaderboard! This was my 160th something room and would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Scorched" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: A group of us took on Scorched and it was such an amazing experience! I have done escape rooms before but nothing like this! State of the art, realistic and totally immersive! Game master Mike was extremely gracious and friendly! I cannot way to try Disarm SOON!

room_title: Escape room "Quarantined Casino" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Her Hideaway" by Clues and Gumshoes in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape Game Iron Gate" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Toymaker" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: I have done both of the rooms by Escape Games Riverside. They are well thought out and extremely fun. I've done over 20 escape rooms and these are by far some of the better ones I've done. The pirate room is extremely challenging but the puzzles are fair and well thought out. The toy maker room is so much fun and is more hands on and tactile.

room_title: Escape room "The Toymaker" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: We did a lot of escape rooms, and this is one of the better ones - we did the Toy Maker room, and it had a lot of original/unique puzzles, which made it a really fun experience. The owners and game master were extremely nice as well!

room_title: Escape room "The Toymaker" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: This place is fantastic. We went to do the pirate room and ended coming back for the toy room. Both were great. Staff was fantastic and might be our favorite escape room we have done. Great experience overall.

room_title: Escape room "The Toymaker" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: We came in to do the pirate themed room and loved it so much we stayed and did the Toyshop too. Both rooms were amazing. Our group had a lot of fun, and our gamemaster was awesome. Creative puzzles! Can't wait until they open their next room!

room_title: Escape room "The Toymaker" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: I loved it! I took my son for his 16th birthday today. There were six of us. We did the toy room. I highly recommend this place. The owner was very nice. I will definitely go back.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Watson’s Infirmary" by The Great Escape Room in Orlando
review: Great experience! I went with my teenage daughter and her friends. We did the Infirmary. It was very challenging. We didn't get out in time, so our patient died. The surgery was cool. I definitely want to come back again. I would like to try the library, I heard it's pretty cool.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Watson’s Infirmary" by The Great Escape Room in Orlando
review: Our group of 8 had a great time in the Infirmary room. Hunter was a great host. He was friendly helpful and supportive. Thank you, Hunter, and we will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Watson’s Infirmary" by The Great Escape Room in Orlando
review: We had such a great time! The Surgery room was super challenging but we had a blast, managing to escape with just about a minute to spare. Eduardo was fantastic! He was very charismatic and helped make our experience extremely enjoyable.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Watson’s Infirmary" by The Great Escape Room in Orlando
review: We recently did the Infirmary room and it was so much fun! We only had four people in the room working on solving the puzzles so it was super challenging. We ended up not escaping in time but were told it was a hard room and it's best done with 8 people. What a cool concept. Clues were hidden in places you never would have looked or places you did look and just past right over them. It was quite the adventure. We solved all the puzzles but one before time ran out. We are hooked and want to do more. A great way to spend a few hours with friends. I would definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Watson’s Infirmary" by The Great Escape Room in Orlando
review: A group of eight of us did The Infirmary last night. It was our first experience in this type of game. In hindsight, we probably shouldn't have chosen a room with only an 18% success rate for our first time! Audrey was our guide and she was awesome. She has a great personality, was funny and helpful, and played the part well.I'm amazed at the level of detail and immense thought that went into designing the room and its puzzles! We didn't escape in time, so our patient died. Whoops! Regardless, I'm hooked and can't wait to go again.

room_title: Escape room "Mad Professor's Asylum" by American Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: Blue was super helpful!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Professor's Asylum" by American Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: We did Mad Professor's Asylum and it was fantastic. I thought the theming was good, the puzzles were a good mix of thought-provoking but not overly difficult. Had I not done a bunch of escape rooms prior it probably would've been more challenging but it didn't take us the whole hour. The super friendly staff and great theming make it a must do anyways.

room_title: Escape room "Mad Professor's Asylum" by American Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: We loved it! Mad Professors Asylum is great and tough! Very well set up! The staff was so fun - great sense of humor and got into their roles to hype up the guest. You guys rock! Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Revolution" by Exodus Escape Games in Columbus (GA)
review: Three of us went and had the best time ever. The puzzles and clues really make you think. The Revolution was very cleverly done, a lot of time, skill and effort went into setting up this room and it shows! Definitely recommend it for something different and challenging to do. Managed to escape with only 9 seconds remaining! Felt very accomplished.

room_title: Escape room "The Revolution" by Exodus Escape Games in Columbus (GA)
review: This was an amazing time! We did two of the rooms. The Revolution was an authentic historical experience that was well designed and challenging. The Study was excellent and full of surprises. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a great time in Columbus/Fort Benning.

room_title: Escape room "The Revolution" by Exodus Escape Games in Columbus (GA)
review: Highly impressed by the creativity and wits put into the making of the Revolution room. Josh was very welcoming and friendly. We had such a great time and everything exceeded expectations! You guys have to check this out!

room_title: Escape room "The Revolution" by Exodus Escape Games in Columbus (GA)
review: The puzzles were very engaging and creative. We did the Revolution room and the clues fit the theme really well! We would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to try an escape room.

room_title: Escape room "The Revolution" by Exodus Escape Games in Columbus (GA)
review: My friends and I chose to do the Revolution themed room and we're so glad we did! Such a fun set of clues to solve, and it was different than any other escape room any of us have ever done. Definitely worth the drive from Auburn! We look forward to coming back soon to do the Study room!

room_title: Escape room "The Revolution" by Exodus Escape Games in Columbus (GA)
review: We did the revolution escape room and it was the best! My husband and I are on a day trip for our anniversary and wanted to do something different and fun. We came across Exodus and let me just say this place was the bomb! We will definitely be back to do the other escape rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape on the High Seas" by Epic Escape Rooms in Valdosta
review: Did the Pirate room with some friends and it was a blast. Lots of fun. All of the puzzles and clues were well thought out. You get very into the game. Can't wait to try the other rooms soon!

room_title: Escape room "Escape on the High Seas" by Epic Escape Rooms in Valdosta
review: We celebrated my son's 13th birthday party today at Epic Escape Rooms, and oh my gosh, it was such a great time. The staff is super friendly and helpful in all aspects of the adventure. We had tons of fun. We tried the Mad Hatter and the High Seas rooms and though we were very close to escaping, we are still trapped. Haha! Thank you for a such a great experience!! I'm sure we will be back soon.

room_title: Escape room "Escape on the High Seas" by Epic Escape Rooms in Valdosta
review: The most fun I've had in a long time! We did the High Seas room, and it was awesome! Very detailed and very challenging. The staff was so nice and welcoming. We cannot wait to go back and try all the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape on the High Seas" by Epic Escape Rooms in Valdosta
review: My wife and I decided on dinner and escape instead of the usual dinner and a movie. We weren’t disappointed. The pirate theme room was fun, super puzzley but we never got to that frustrated stage because the game masters and hints are just enough to keep you moving forward without spoiling the challenge. I definitely recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Escape on the High Seas" by Epic Escape Rooms in Valdosta
review: Had an amazing time trying to escape on the High Seas! We got out but it was a real challenge!

room_title: Escape room "One Way Ticket" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the train escape room called One Way Ticket. It was really a ton of fun. It was the first room for all of us and we're planning on coming back to do the other room very soon.

room_title: Escape room "One Way Ticket" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Our gamemaster was amazing! She ran our room 'One Way Ticket' with subtlety and grace. The room itself is beautifully decorated and SO MUCH FUN! Really looking forward to trying out the other room at this location!

room_title: Escape room "One Way Ticket" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So much fun!Great entertainment. Wait us for the FBI room for sure! Thanks

room_title: Escape room "One Way Ticket" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun! Great staff, the room was more fun than we even expected. We're already planning to go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "S3R1AL" by Exit Plan in Washington, D.C.
review: This place is amazing! I have completed all 3 of their rooms and all were very fun experiences. The newest room S3R1AL really raises the bar for escape games in the DC area. It is easily the best room I have experienced. If you are thinking about trying an Escape Room for the first time or looking for a new one to check out do yourself a favor and go book the S3R1AL room now!

room_title: Escape room "S3R1AL" by Exit Plan in Washington, D.C.
review: We had an amazing time at Exit Plan last night. The staff is super friendly and obviously love working there. They have a beautiful waiting room where you watch a short video before entering your room. We chose Serial, it was awesome! I've been to another escape room in DC and this one definitely was as good without the long drive.

room_title: Escape room "S3R1AL" by Exit Plan in Washington, D.C.
review: My friends surprised me for my birthday and it was a complete blast! I highly recommend this adventure for a great time! We did Serial and it was awesome, we definitely plan to go back!

room_title: Escape room "S3R1AL" by Exit Plan in Washington, D.C.
review: S3R1AL was my whole group's first escape room and it was fantastic.I especially liked how enthusiastic and engaged the staff was afterwards. Made it all the better, and made me a little envious of their job.

room_title: Escape room "S3R1AL" by Exit Plan in Washington, D.C.
review: I've been wanting to try an escape room and Exit Plan was by far the best one to try first. Very welcoming. Serial was awesome. Great times with friends. My husband and I are still talking about it. Definitely planning to come back.

room_title: Escape room "It’s all WIRED!" by Escape on Palafox in Pensacola
review: None

room_title: Escape room "House in the Woods" by Pacifica Escape Zone in San Francisco
review: I'm a first timer and my friends had experienced another escape room before.  We did the House in the Woods and found it very challenging.  There were only 3 of us and did not make it, but I was impressed with the detail of the puzzles.  Recommend it for an hour of angst and realization of one's incompetence...kidding...it was fun!

room_title: Escape room "House in the Woods" by Pacifica Escape Zone in San Francisco
review: We visited Pacific Escape back in April. It was a long drive for us to Pacifica, CA but it was a nice & scenic one near the coastline. There’s plenty of parking outside of Pacifica Escape Zone. When you pull into the complex, you might not be able to see the name Pacifica Escape Zone as it’s named as their parent company “Anime Imports”.In addition to Pacifica Escape Zone, the owner also owns a comic book store in the near vicinity so if you are a comic book fan, make sure you check it out! As we entered the lobby area, there’s really no check in or décor which we thought this could be improved to give the player the whole experience. Today, we are trying their newest room called “House in the Woods”. They currently offer two rooms total with "Murder Scene" being the first. In "House in the Woods", you are playing in the dark for the majority of the time which makes it quite challenging. If you like escape rooms with locks, this is the one for you! Since there is a lot to do in this room for just two people, we were 95% in and didn't escape in time. Pacifica Escape Zone is trying to acquire another space within same complex to create another room! We can't wait to see what they have planned for their future!

room_title: Escape room "The Ransom" by Daytona Escape Room Experience in Daytona Beach
review: We did "The Ransom" with four other people and it was a good group. The game host was very helpful in explaining the concept and the "rules," as none of us had ever done this before. We did get a couple of clues (you can get a maximum of three). We completed the room in a little over 41 minutes, not bad for a first time!There is a second escape room at this location, we can't wait to do that one, too!

room_title: Escape room "The Ransom" by Daytona Escape Room Experience in Daytona Beach
review: We were a party of 6 and had a blast! The hosts were very nice. Very enjoyable experience, highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Ransom" by Daytona Escape Room Experience in Daytona Beach
review: The Ransom room was cleverly created for challenging yet manageable escape tasks. Our group of 8 loved every minute of it and are super happy we completed the escape with minutes to spare! We plan to go back and hopefully be successful at the Black Jewel room. You won't be disappointed in The Daytona Escape Room Experience!!!

room_title: Escape room "Last Supper" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: Our family has been to about 80 escape rooms around the world.  The Last Supper was amazing.  The actor was great.  The clues were interesting (but not ridiculously impossible).  The clues were well designed and sequential, making it an excellent experience.

room_title: Escape room "Last Supper" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: They have my new favorite game! It's been about 6 months since I last played a room. But I've done about 40 now in total. Both games were wonderful. Some seriously genius puzzles that fit the theme and made sense to be there, especially in the witch game. Their other game, The Last Supper, was the amazing! I'd consider it a a thriller/horror game. But the unexpected and best part to me was that I have never laughed so much while playing an escape room. Or maybe in the last few months of my life lol. They set up moments to make us laugh, or for us to make ourselves laugh. The actor was great, the story flowed perfectly. As well as continuously throughout, constantly developing to immerse us further and further. Timing of the puzzles allowed us to finish with only a few minutes to spare. My biggest wish is I want to get amnesia so I can just forget it and play it over and over haha. Thanks for the great evening!

room_title: Escape room "Last Supper" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: I'm a huge enthusiast with escape rooms and let me say that quest tavern escape room didn't disappoint. Last supper was a phenomenal experience as it gave you the adventurous feeling in addition to that hint of fright and jump scares. They have a lot of different selections and I highly recommend for everyone that reads this to try it out.

room_title: Escape room "Last Supper" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: The Last Supper is one of my favorites of all escape rooms I've done. I thought the puzzles were great and I loved the interactive nature of it. There were definitely a few jumps and scares. If I could I would go back and do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Last Supper" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: Hands down the best escape room out there! We did the witch's cauldron a few weeks ago and loved it! We were told another scary room was opening soon so we decided to come back and give it a try! The last supper was the BEST room I've done so far. The actors are amazing and there is the right amount of scare to keep you on the edge of your seat (you'll know what I mean) but not soo much where you can't solve the puzzles. Definitely recommend 100%!!!

room_title: Escape room "Like a Surgeon" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: We had a great time even though we didn't make the escape ! The staff was awesome ! We will definitely be back

room_title: Escape room "Like a Surgeon" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: It was our first time doing escape room and it was super fun!!! That room was full of surprises

room_title: Escape room "Like a Surgeon" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: We did the Like A Surgeon room. It was challenging! We almost did not make it out, and two of us are in the medical field! This was my first experience with an escape room and I would return and try others.The business is clean and well put together. They try to keep it fun, by hinting when you are stuck. I feel the price per person is a little high though. If you have a family of four at $28 each, it is expensive entertainment for only one hour!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Manor" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did this room with 4 people (our other team did it with just 2). The theme is Mystery Manor. Half of our team was running late, and they were nice enough to delayed the game for us. The staff was really nice to us. The room is 3 stars, a-ok, but their customer service brought it up another star. The room wasn't really immersive, but it was definitely decorated nicely. I wish it was bigger and more puzzles though. They didn't have any tech puzzles, and more traditional lock and puzzles. I would like to see them change the room to have more hidden tech, but still keep the same theme.Looking forward to do their Virus Zero room next.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Manor" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The puzzles were very thought out. Some were a bit challenging, but overall had a blast with the whole family!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Manor" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The Mystery Manor was such a fun challenge for me and my friends! We escaped, but just barely! Our gamemaster, Tiffany, was very nice and helpful. We will definitely be back for their next room!

room_title: Escape room "Xternal Forces VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Hideout" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did the Houdini Room (the smallest and most challenging room) and escaped with 1 minute left! It's a fairly low tech room (mostly just spin locks, and keys). The hint system was through walkie talkie and the GM was very attentive and helpful when we were stuck on some of the puzzles. There are no red herrings in this room, which is very useful so that you don't get stuck on something that isn't part of the game. Only negative thing is that there is no countdown in the room so you either have to ask, or just remember the time you started and time yourself on the clock. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We ended up parking outside in the metered parking. I believe it was $1.50 for 1 hour. We will be back for the other 2 rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Hideout" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did Houdini's Hideaway and it was a BLAST! Very challenging but not totally frustrating - kept having successes along the way. Very clever!  We'll be coming back next time we are in the area, for sure! Thanks, Jon!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Hideout" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Just did their Houdini room and LOVED it! Even though it's their smallest room, it was super challenging. We are escape room veterans by now and we had to use all of our 3 hints, but we did escape with about 7 minutes to spare. I love that nothing in these rooms feels like a huge leap. Even when you get stuck and get a clue, you immediately go "Oh! How did I not get that?!" It's also great that in a small room, they have multiple things you can be solving or working on at once so that everyone is always occupied. And this time we got magic tricks AND we got to play with a dog in the lobby. Seriously, the staff here is the best. Definitely recommend! Can't wait to go back and do Bonnie and Clyde!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Hideout" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My family and I decided to check this place out. This was our first time trying an escape room and this one just recently opened up fairly close by. The staff was amazing, very fun and informative. We tried out the Houdini room and beat it with seconds to spare. Overall it was a great experience and I'll definitely be going back to tackle the rest of the rooms they have available!

room_title: Escape room "The Temple" by Unity Escape Rooms in Redlands
review: Unity Escape Rooms was an amazing experience. My group did the Temple and it was unique, challenging, fun, and most importantly, made us uphold a sense of "unity." You have to work together to successfully conquer the rooms challenges. We are so excited to try the "Cabin in the Woods" and "Wizard" rooms. The owners are very creative and obviously at the top of their game. I have done other escape rooms and this one is definitely exceptional. Well played UER!

room_title: Escape room "The Toy Box" by ZScape Games in Livermore
review: None

room_title: Escape room "DaVinci's Secret" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We did the DaVinci room and it was a great experience. We thought the room could have been a little better decorated to give more of a moody feel to it. The clues were great and we liked that there were a few red herrings, it fit with the theme. We found the holy grail with 1:51 left on the clock.

room_title: Escape room "DaVinci's Secret" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: My daughter and her friends did The Da Vinci room for her 15th birthday. This room was great for teenagers who had never tried an escape room before. The staff at Baffled were extremely friendly and helpful. Our group was very pleased and we are happy we chose Baffled for her birthday!

room_title: Escape room "DaVinci's Secret" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This is our first time doing an escape room so we have nothing to compare it to, but our group of 5 had a blast in the DeVinci room. They have a very simple waiting area and small-ish room but it was great for the 5 of us and the puzzles/riddles were fun to solve. We got out of the room with 30 secs to spare. We'll definitely be back again!

room_title: Escape room "DaVinci's Secret" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: THE BEST WEEKEND EVER!!!! Did the Da Vinci room with my daughter (9) and her best friend and family to celebrate 1st Quarter report cards. It was extremely fun and worth every second!!! Age ranges in our group were 6-40 and it everyone was able to participate and contribute to opening the room. We will be back!!! Love our experience, the staff is awesome and friendly!!!!

room_title: Escape room "DaVinci's Secret" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: A very nice experience for an escape room. Vince was amazing, super friendly and helpful the entire way. We completed the DaVinci room and it is highly recommended. Puzzles are tricky. The 8-year-old in our group lost interest about 40 mins in, but the adults were engaged the entire time. Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Treasure Hunt" by Key West Room Escape in Key West
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Madame Lumina" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: Heck of a good time. This place has me hooked. You best believe I'll be heading up to all of these locations and attempting to further our win streak! Madam luminas was such a good time!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Madame Lumina" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: I went with a group of 6 and did the fortune teller room. It was the most fun I've had in a while. I will definitely back to try other rooms in the future!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Madame Lumina" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: We had a wonderful time! The curse of Madame Lamina was challenging! We will be going back!!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Madame Lumina" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: We did this last night as a family and we had an amazing time. Our game keeper was great, kept the game going, let us know when we were totally off on a wrong direction. We had a teen and a child with us, and I they had an awesome time too (make sure to check the policy on bringing kids under 15). Everyone was able to be involved and it was a fun time. And luckily we escaped the Madame Lumina Room!! Would definitely love to do this again!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Madame Lumina" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: It was our first escape room experience and as a group, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! We played with a group of six, which seemed about right for the Madame Lumina room-- any more, it may have been a bit too chaotic for me anyway. But with six players, there seemed to be enough to do to keep us busy and keep the excitement building in the room. The game maker/runner did a good job at keeping us moving along and not letting us get stuck in futile searches. Overall great time!

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Billy Goat" by King's Escape Room Denver in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Undercooked" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Had a great time.  We were a party of 5 and did the Uncooked game.  Person who checked us in explained everything clearly and answered all our questions.  At the end of game she went over how we did and explained some of the puzzles where were stuck on - eye opener!  lol  Everyone enjoyed themselves and would definitely go back and do it again.  Uncooked game was different from other escape room game types which was a nice surprise and change.  Instead of trying to beat the clock to get out of a room, you're fighting the clock to try to make as many recipes/dishes as possible - nice twist.  Good for all ages.

room_title: Escape room "Thomas Edison" by Storm Out in Miami
review: My group of 6 had an amazing time. The Edison room had a few tricks up its sleeve but we were able to escape in the nick of time. Highly recommend taking up the challenge at Code to Escape.

room_title: Escape room "Thomas Edison" by Storm Out in Miami
review: We did the Thomas Edison room, and it was a blast! We escaped with 4 minutes to spare. I can't wait to come back and do the other rooms. Staff is super friendly as well! Best part for us was we didn't have to share the room with another group it was just our party!! 5 stars all around.

room_title: Escape room "Thomas Edison" by Storm Out in Miami
review: Was there this past sat, my group had alot of fun!!! Looking forward to going again and trying each room.

room_title: Escape room "Arctic Asylum" by Escape Room Ak in Fairbanks
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mystery of Sherlock" by Adventure Vault in Miami
review: Definitely recommend this as a team or family bonding activity. Lots of laughs and brainwork!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery of Sherlock" by Adventure Vault in Miami
