room_title: Escape room "The Missing Professor" by ClueMasters Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: Had a ton of fun! Very innovative and clever. You can tell that a lot of effort, thought and passion was put into it. It's a great addition to Fort Smith and I would recommend it to anyone looking for something fun to do in this area. Can't wait to solve the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Think Escape Games in Miami
review: My daughter and I went to Think Escape Games and did the Study. We both loved it and would definitely come back again. It was open to all ages and was a good way to build up teamwork. The staff was extremely nice. I would definitely recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Think Escape Games in Miami
review: Went with a group of girls for a fun night out! So different and so good for teamwork! Can't wait to bring my teenagers here!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Think Escape Games in Miami
review: Want last night for my birthday. We had a group of 13 in my party. We had sooo much fun! We did the study...the clues were hard but super fun to try and solve. This was my first escape game and def not my last. The staff was awesome and very helpful! Can't wait to try the laboratory! TeamDana!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Think Escape Games in Miami
review: I am a huge fan of Escape Games, so I brought a group of 13 friends to help me solve The Study. I brought appetizers and drinks 30 minutes before the game so we could gather and strategize. The reception area was a great hangout while we waited for our game! Edward gave us a warm greeting and a thorough explanation of everything we needed to know before entering the game. The puzzles are difficult and we were able to keep all 14 players busy. I got to meet the owners, Greg and Shannon while I was there and they told me their newest game will be ready soon. I cannot WAIT! They really created an amazing place that surpasses other Escape Game I have enjoyed. This is a fantastic night out.

room_title: Escape room "The Abduction" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: I took my daughter and her friend to do the Abduction. We had so much fun and it was challenging, used team work, and our brains. Such a great time.

room_title: Escape room "The Abduction" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: This was a great experience. We did the Alien Abduction with 6 strangers and made it out with 6 minutes to spare. The staff member was polite and helpful and gave us a great rundown before the start of the game. I'll definitely swing by if I'm ever in the area again. Hope they're all as fun and worthwhile as this one was.

room_title: Escape room "The Abduction" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: This was such a fun and challenging experience! I very much enjoyed it, highly recommend it, and will be back soon!! :) the workers there were very nice, friendly, and funny as well!

room_title: Escape room "The Abduction" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: So much fun! We were able to do the two mysteries :) if you're looking for something new and fun, highly recommended it. Also bring a group of seven - way more fun and efficient!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Bethesda in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Athens Arcade" by Escape the Space in Athens
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My son and I were in the Alice in Wonderland room and had a fabulous time. The owners designed and built the room which was really cool :-).

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: We had never been to an escape room before but decided to try this on vacation. It was so much fun! The owner was so helpful, informative and friendly. We did the Wonderland room. We had to solve puzzles and clues to find Alice's necklace. We would definitely do this again.

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: Just finished WonderLand with family of 6, kids aged 7, 11, 15 and 16 and we all had a blast. The room was perfectly suited for us as beginners and although we had some help along the way, managed to solve the room with time to spare. Kids can't stop talking about it. Highly recommend for families seeking some quality time and memories!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: We are here on spring break with our family, girls ages 10 and 8. We have never been to an Escape room before so we decided to give it a try. We did the Alice in Wonderland room! We had a blast and great family fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Stolen Relic" by Will to Escape in West Palm Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Reactor B" by Back Alley Escape in Temecula
review: We had so much fun. Great escape room! 😃

room_title: Escape room "Reactor B" by Back Alley Escape in Temecula
review: The games are a great level of challenging, and I can't wait to see what they bring to fruition in the future!!

room_title: Escape room "Reactor B" by Back Alley Escape in Temecula
review: Awesome experience, super friendly staff, I did this with my family which includes a 7 and 10 year old.  You'll be surprised of how much they can help!

room_title: Escape room "Dinosaur" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: One of the best escape room I’ve done! We did the dinosaur room and it was a blast. We can’t wait to go back and try another room. Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Dinosaur" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: My kids (13 and 11) and I went to Time Travel Escapes today and did the Dinosaur room! We had sooo much fun! All the way home, and well after, they were saying they couldn't wait to go back! AND I AGREE!! Everyone who works there is super awesome and made it a wonderful experience!! THANK YOU SOOO MUCH TIME TRAVEL ESCAPES!!!

room_title: Escape room "Dinosaur" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: We absolutely LOVE coming here. We have been here 4 times now. They remembered us when we called to book a room. We did the dinosaur room first and almost escaped. (We were out of shape lol) then right after we did the tower of Dragons virtual reality room and man let me tell you, that was SO MUCH FUN!! It was so cool to solve clues in a different way with a headset on and "gloves" so different than a regular escape room but equally fun and exciting. All of their rooms have been so good and we love coming here.

room_title: Escape room "R.A.I.N. Corp - Zombie Escape" by Grande Royal Escape in Jacksonville
review: We had an amazing time! We did the zombie room and it was challenging but a lot of fun. This was my 4th escape room and some of my friends first and we all thought it was amazing. If we're ever back in the area we will definitely be doing the other rooms, especially the train one!

room_title: Escape room "R.A.I.N. Corp - Zombie Escape" by Grande Royal Escape in Jacksonville
review: My boyfriend and I did the Zombie escape room and we had a blast! The puzzles were fun and interesting. We managed to make it out with barely 3 minutes left! The staff was also really kind and very helpful.

room_title: Escape room "The Ramen Shop" by Mystery Maui in Maui
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by MasterMind Escape the Room Game in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sloppy's Hideout" by Key West Room Escape in Key West
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Oblivion" by Insomnia Escape Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Oblivion was pretty terrible. It took us less than 25 minutes to complete it and it was the first escape room for our group. Way too easy and not enough puzzles for the price. Plus, the puzzles weren’t even interesting or challenging. Disappointed.

room_title: Escape room "Oblivion" by Insomnia Escape Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Had a great experience tonight with my sister and boyfriend. We did the newest room and it was a really great experience. Thanks Dan for the fun time, definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Oblivion" by Insomnia Escape Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: The room was great, but the Insomnia team was even better! Very accommodating and patient with our large and raucous group. We had a great time and I can't wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Z-Cape Z-51" by Escape Room Napa in Rohnert Park
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: My husband and I came here on a double date night and it was way more fun than your regular dinner and a movie. We did the Inheritance room and although we didn't escape in time we put a decent amount of clues together and can't wait to try another one! Also the staff was so funny and helpful.

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: I played The Inheritance and Jail Break. This company shines in immersion and storytelling. (I am also a huge fan of their hint systems.) Overall, the puzzles in both games were incredibly creative. I enjoyed the use of both physical and mental tasks. The space and decor were impressive, as well. Escape Zone AZ has created a clever, fun, immersive experience that is fun for all ages. I highly recommend booking your escape room experience with them.

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: It was a lot of fun and a great family bonding experience. Lots of communication and teamwork, escaped with 4 minutes to spare! Very elaborate set up and deco, super realistic feel. Can't wait to try the other rooms next time.

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: This was an early Father's Day gift for my husband! Hubby, kids and I loved it! So much FUN! We did the Inheritance room. Very, very clever and high quality engineering. We almost made it out!!!! Thoroughly enjoyed this experience. We will return to play the Jailbreak room. This is fun activity for families, a group of friends or work colleagues.

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: One of the most inventive and ingenious ways to spend an hour. The inheritance escape room really makes you think and work together. It's exhilarating figuring out puzzle pieces and getting closer to the end. I highly recommend trying this out. Can't wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "King Arthur’s Legacy" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Alexander and Danny were great! We did the King Arthur room and it was so much fun. Support local businesses and have fun doing it

room_title: Escape room "King Arthur’s Legacy" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Their new King Arthur room is amazing!

room_title: Escape room "King Arthur’s Legacy" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Amazing puzzles and lots of surprises. We did the King Arthur room. The decorations were great and the puzzle were pretty cool. Some of them were a bit confusing and we needed some hints. But we enjoyed every second of it.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: Just did this room tonight with my girlfriend. We opted to do the 'hard mode' version which is 5 additional puzzles. It's a really cool room as the whole thing is a bunch of linear puzzles where each set of 5 has their own start. We ended up finishing with 30 something minutes left and the guy was generous enough to reset the remaining 2 rows of puzzles (normally done with large groups) so that we could do the rest of them. I really enjoyed this room as it was full of all sorts of different puzzles from logic, to word, and everything in between. They really make use of every possible type of puzzle as no two are alike. Definitely one of the more enjoyable Gen-1 rooms I have done.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: I have done about 10 escape rooms so far and this one has to be by far, the best one yet. Yes, it did lack a storyline, but made it up with the amazing puzzles! My group had 5 people and we were able to solve 5 rows with about 2 minutes to spare! Lots a fun and one of the funniest escape rooms out there. We would of loved if this place had a second room because we would of definitely came back. Hopefully they open a second one and we will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: This is a very well done escape room game with a couple of cool aha! moments. It's perfect for a large group that works well when broken into in smaller groups. Its multi-path style allows for small groups to play together in a public game and still work mostly with their own players within the larger team. It's a weak on story, but very puzzle heavy.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: Different from the other escape rooms I've done, but in a good way! Great puzzles and set up really well for team building if that is what you're after!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: There were plenty of puzzles to keep a large group of people entertained. It was not easy but not extremely hard. We truly enjoyed ourselves even though we failed! We will be going back and trying again!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: A lot of thought and planning went into this great game. We had a group ranging from 8 - 72 years old. It was great for the whole family. I would go back and try again. Also recommend it to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: Puzzles, puzzles, puzzles! Each puzzle is custom made and there are some cool dexterity, mind, and searching puzzles. There is a high density of puzzles and it's super fun to solve each one.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Temple" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: Enjoyed the unending puzzles with a group of geniuses! We had an outstanding adventure, loads of laughs, and heaps of mental exercise in "The Lost Temple". It was amazing to enjoy this extensive interactive entertainment!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Temple" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: My friends and I had a blast as we tried to escape from The Temple of Doom. We escaped just in time (00:06). We are looking forward to doing it again and this time with less clues.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Temple" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: Booked and changed the reservation for 8 people a couple times and the staff were just wonderful! We did The Lost Temple room. It was fun and interesting! I had a good experience! We finished the room with just 10 mins to spare. I would definitely come back to play The Black Widow!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Temple" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: I went for my birthday with a few other friends for my first escape room - The Lost Temple. We had a lot of fun, it was the perfect level of challenging and we made it with a few minutes to spare. I'm sure I'll be back to do other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Temple" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: My 14-year-old son and I went today and teamed up 4 others we'd never met but had a blast figuring out the clues for each challenge in The Lost Temple. What a fun experience! Can't wait to go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Video Store" by Dare 2 Escape in Orlando
review: Best Escape game ever. The Video Store room is a must!  It was nostalgic, retro, insightful and super Fun. We loved that the room was so intricate and creative !  Wow!  Great for date night, family fun night , girls night out and birthday parties. The owners Sean  and Maureen are super accommodating and have re-modeled the venue beautifully !  I recommend 1000% percent.

room_title: Escape room "Ground Zero" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was my first ever escape room and honestly, it really got me into them. Before I always doubted spending money on doing an escape room because I believed it would be a waste, however this was actually a lot of fun! My group of three did the virus room and you are provided with as many hints as you'd like. The room was amazing in its technology and all the puzzles to solve were very creative. Overall, I'd recommend to go to this escape room and the workers here were very friendly and funny!

room_title: Escape room "Ground Zero" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did Ground Zero and it was awesome! Our group of 4 was entirely novice to escape rooms but we got close to finishing. I couldn't believe how clever some of the puzzles were -- like the stuff out of a movie script plot-twist. Apparently the owners are just a couple of people with day jobs that do this for fun on the side, and their passion really shines through.

room_title: Escape room "Ground Zero" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This place is awesome!!! My Sister booked the Ground Zero room for today. We had 6 family members and we needed every single one of us to complete this room in the 75 minutes we were given. Before we entered the room we were told Ground Zero only had a 20% success rate. That scared us. 3 of us have never done an escape room. The rooms were decorated great. So many combination locks to open. So many things to figure out just to get to the second room. There is a 3rd small room attached to the second room. While in the 2nd/3rd rooms we only had around 18 minutes left. We started to really worry. We were all sweating to figure out that last combination to get the door open. We made it with 1:46 to spare. When that lock clicked open we all let out a huge celebratory scream. I would highly recommend The Prism Escape Rooms. I would recommend having the maximum 6 people if you choose the Ground Zero room. We all had a fun time!!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: This was the last game we played out of the 3 available at Escape the Netherworld. We had an absolute blast! It was immersive and challenging Just like the other 2!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: Our middle school and high school age Girl Scouts had a blast. They were already asking to go back before we even left. Zack was awesome to work with and the ladies we worked with the day of the event were great also. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: My group did the haunted room and we had a blast! Our game master was very friendly and gave helpful directions. We are definitely wanting to come back and do the other two rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: As a true scaredy-cat, I had so much fun! You really have to work together and we were able to escape the curse of the Night Hag with 6 seconds to spare. All of us were new to escape rooms, and we highly recommend doing this!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Heist" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: I️ tried out a Wild West room and I️t was incredible! They spared no expense on making the room look authentic and the puzzles were challenging and fun! This escape room is definitely a premium in the Tampa area!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Heist" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: We did the Wild West Heist. It was my first experience in an escape room and I loved it! The puzzles were challenging, but not so much so that we were frustrated. It was a lot of fun! Can't wait to go back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Heist" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: I am a fellow escape room owner and I have done tons of rooms. This was definitely up there in my favorite rooms that I have done. The Wild West room was well designed and the puzzles all made sense. No crazy logic leaps. I will definitely recommend Legends Escape Rooms to all my friends in the area. They are by far the best in the Brandon area and one of the top in the entire Tampa area. Can't wait to try the rest of their rooms when I am in town again.

room_title: Escape room "The Paradox" by Mystified - Escape Room Adventures in Stonington
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: We took our office staff for a team building exercise- it was excellent! We had a blast, and the rooms required that everyone work together. By the end we were all screaming and jumping up and down, hugging each other! The staff were very helpful and kind.

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Awesome experience. Staff was very friendly and helpful, will go again soon....thanks...

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Had a great time. "Almost escaped". The thrill, the chase, the want to solve it!,.. excellent feeling. Great time.

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Great customer service!! On May 28th I visited this escape game particularly because it was the only place that could accommodate 12 of us in the same room.  I spoke to several employees on different occasions and each time they were patient and very polite! We were originally 8 and grew 4 times, eventually becoming 12. I know it must have been frustrating dealing with our party changing several times & us arriving an hour late on top of everything. The night went perfect! We escaped and had so much fun doing so!! Definitely recommend!!! A MUST!

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: love this place. Perfect place to take kids, friends, family and co-workers. I took some of my employees as a team building exercise and everyone loved it. It is challenging and fun. Staff is always awsome

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: Just escaped the Jewel Heist room, our group had an awesome time! We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: We came to Red Button Escape as one of the adventures for my husband’s birthday and it was the best adventure ever. It was our first time doing an escape room and it was phenomenal! From the moment we walked in we were greeted with happy smiling faces, instructions as well as the staff getting us pumped up for our Jewel Heist Room escape.We had 8 people in our group and we failed lol! We were soooooo close though if we would have had 3 additional minutes we would have escaped. We will definitely be back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: I have done around 15 rooms now. I loved this place. Clean, neat, props were great and room. The Jewel Heist was awesome. Ceiling to wall props and related things. Amazing job! Already booked the second room!

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: This place was awesome. I have done many escape rooms and this was the best by far. My friend and I escaped the Jewel Heist with 2 mins and 40 seconds left with only two people. Great place, can’t wait to try the rest!

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: Had so much fun for my cousin's bday in the Jewel Heist! Definitely hard but we made it!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Captain Judy is so amazing and funny. She is there to help you out when needed when you give her the correct call to request the help. The Titanic room has about 3 rooms you need to break through to end the game. It's so much fun, just remember to talk out loud with your team, this is not a figure out yourself type of game, or you cover that area and I cover that area. It's really a group effort.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Titanic Room with a group of 3 on Sunday. Our little group was pretty new to the escape room scene and we were pretty excited to check it out. The building doesn't look like much from the outside but it's super cute on the inside. Captain Judy explained the scenario and told us how to get hints if we needed them (we needed them!). I don't want to give anything away but all of the rooms were decorated great and we had a fun time figuring out the various puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: What a lot of fun in one hour! My wife and I were first-timers. Our friends had done an escape room before with 60out at a different location. Ivan oriented us with the do's and don'ts of the rooms and then we were off on the Titanic (yes, I had a sinking sensation going in). This is not an activity for someone with claustrophobia. Figuring out the clues is very challenging, and we did need to get an assist from "Captain Ivan" more than once. But we did escape at 59.5 minutes. And we agreed that we would return for another room in the near future!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: LOVE LOVE LOVE these. The rooms are set up sooo well and the puzzles are challenging. Not a lot of locks to unlock, I have nothing against opening a lot of locks, I actually like it but these rooms are so incredibly creative that they are amazing. Also, when they give you hints they are very vague and get you thinking so they don't just give away the answers which I appreciate. They also don't put any other players you don't know in the room with you which is a requirement for us.We've done the Titanic and Zen Room at the Marina Del Ray location and Senator Payne at the West LA location. Judy was our Game Master at the Marina location for both rooms. She was amazing! She was so fun and you could tell she really loves her job. We will be back in a couple weeks to do Outbreak Judy!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We came to 60out Escape Rooms for the Titanic puzzle. The lobby area is cozy, spacious, and even houses a couple of small games. This was our second escape room experience, and the design of the rooms was top-notch! The difficulty was noticeably harder than our first room, but some puzzles were exceptionally clever! Our game master, Judy, did a great job providing useful hints without directly giving the answer away. Thanks for being so patient with us!

room_title: Escape room "The King’s Keep" by Next-Gen Escape in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The staff here is fun,and have a good sense of humor! I'm still buzzing from the rush of our successful teamwork! Sherlock Room, perfect for the educated,artistic Team #thebookcellar! Looking for something New to do with your friends and family? Exodus Escape Room is Waiting for you! Thanks Chad,artistic Trevor, our host,for an Awesome Adventure!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had a blast good timeseven if we were in the dark and handcuffed

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My group did the Sherlock room and it was a lot of fun! We had nine people which was a little bit of a crowd. The only problem that we had was that the finally lock was difficult to open and keep us from getting out in the hour. They did give us more time though because they knew that we had the code. My family is really excited to do this again though!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had such a fantastic fun time! The staff was extremely friendly and courteous ! Great event to do with a good group of friends! We did the Sherlock room, and were able to escape! In "record" time perhaps! We had 25 mins and 44 seconds to spare! Whoot ! Will definitely come back to try the Trap Room next ! Смайлик «grin» dundunn dunnnnn!!!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was my first experience with escape rooms, and I couldn't have asked for a better introduction! I brought a group here yesterday for my birthday party and we ALL had a blast! The staff was wonderful, funny and incredibly sweet. We are definitely coming back for the Sherlock room!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: What an amazing experience!! Loved everything about it! The staff was amazing and the experience was like no other! I highly recommend doing this. I had a huge party of 18 people and they accommodated us. Split us up between the Sherlock room and Escape room. Made it a competition! So much fun! You HAVE to experience this! Going back for more! Thank you!!

room_title: Escape room "Stella Superstar" by Mystery Maui in Maui
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Hunt for the Dead Sea Souls" by Complexity: A Puzzling Adventure in Hartford
review: Super nice people and the puzzles are a lot of fun! We did Cat Burglar and Pirate Ship, both of which had a great variety of puzzles. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Hunt for the Dead Sea Souls" by Complexity: A Puzzling Adventure in Hartford
review: We just did the Pirate Ship with four adults and two kids aged 10 and 8. It was awesome! We needed a couple of clues but in the end, we figured it out! Sara was so helpful and the whole experience we beyond fun! Definitely an experience we will never forget!

room_title: Escape room "Hunt for the Dead Sea Souls" by Complexity: A Puzzling Adventure in Hartford
review: This was so much fun! Michelle was friendly and informative, and the pirate ship room was amazing. We did need to ask for help, but we laughed, high-fived, and had a blast along the way. The clever setup and a few surprises made this worth every bit of the anticipation. Looking forward to another adventure sometime!

room_title: Escape room "Hunt for the Dead Sea Souls" by Complexity: A Puzzling Adventure in Hartford
review: We had a great time this morning in the Pirate room. The place was clean and everything was prepared and ready to for us to have a great adventure. We all left being super impressed and can't wait to return for another puzzle.

room_title: Escape room "Hunt for the Dead Sea Souls" by Complexity: A Puzzling Adventure in Hartford
review: My girlfriend and I did the pirate ship room. I was hoping to not use any clues but the puzzles were more complex than I thought they would be! We had to use a handful. By the end I was sweating and my adrenaline was pumping! What a great time! The staff was SUPER nice and helped put us at ease (my girlfriend was worried about being in an enclosed room). We wish we lived closer so we could do the rest of the rooms. This was our very first puzzle room and it was a blast! But now we feel like no other puzzle room will compare :) Thanks again for the fun!

room_title: Escape room "Fried Chicken" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: This was a really fun experience. The puzzles were challenging without being impossible and the room we did was really neat. we'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Fried Chicken" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: Took my daughter and her friends here for her 12th birthday party today! They were totally pumped to experience the “Fried Chicken” room! They had a blast, and “almost” escaped, lol! The staff was awesome and all the rooms offered at 21 Keys looked both challenging and fun! We will definitely be visiting them again! Thanks for making her day special!!

room_title: Escape room "Fried Chicken" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: My husband and I love doing our date nights at escape rooms and tonight we had a blast doing fried chicken!! We were a little rusty and got frustrated but it was fun ! We will be back next month to try an conquer the speakeasy!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We were a group of five and we did the Agency. We ended up escaping in 35 minutes and that was the fastest time for this week so we were pretty stoked. There were various puzzles and we each seemed to excel in different places. I will definitely be back to try the Hideout soon. On a side note, the Agency is not a scary room so if you get spooked easily this room is perfect for you. It is mysterious but not scary.

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've now experienced both rooms. They are awesome. Absolutely, enjoyed myself each time. I'm now addicted! The staff is super friendly and helpful. I highly recommend Arcane to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I loved how the puzzles are mentally challenging and fun at the same time. You get the clues and it's not a give away. You still have to figure out what they really mean which makes it more exciting. Will definitely come back here once the new room is available! Great job Arcane!

room_title: Escape room "The Whispering Halls" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: I have done multiple escape rooms in the past, but "Whispering Halls" is far and away the best one I've encountered to date. The ambience, detail, and engrossing puzzles definitely kept our group on our feet the entire time. 5 Stars! A masterful job well done. Will definitely be back for more!

room_title: Escape room "The Whispering Halls" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: There was 12+ of us, and we got packed into this super super tiny room for Whispering Halls. Then, a secret door opens, and I was blown away. There were secret passageways, other doors, it was huge, and we beat it with two minutes to spare and I couldn't believe how complex it was. I am already planning a trip back with friends, and let me tell you, after that experience, everyone involved couldn't stop talking about it, and I guarantee we will talk about it later as well. I personally called two friends and told them my whole experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Whispering Halls" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: I am a veteran with escape rooms and this one "whispering halls" surprised even me. The puzzles were new and different and the interaction between the puzzles and the space were terrific. The puzzles themselves were not too hard (ensuring that complex math or problem solving would not be the reason that you cannot escape) but we're connected throughout the room. Take it from an experienced escapee ... visit this place!

room_title: Escape room "The Whispering Halls" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: This was my first experience with escape rooms. I went with a group of friends that never done one either. We tried Whispering Halls and it was Fantastic! We were definitely engrossed in all the puzzles and surprises. We did not escape on time but was on the last puzzle when we ran out of time. Nevertheless we loved the experience. The staff was awesome. The clues, puzzles, decorations, ambiance, etc was great. We couldn't stop talking about how much fun it was and when we want to go back and try the other experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Whispering Halls" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: We had a great time. I have never tried something like this before and now I am addicted! Awesome!

room_title: Escape room "LIT" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Loved all the puzzles, very unique room!

room_title: Escape room "LIT" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This is Inferno's best room for enthusiasts and newbies alike. Bring your friends, there are a lot of puzzles to solve! A room full of humor and fun... this one would be particularly great for birthday parties, bachelorette parties, etc.

room_title: Escape room "LIT" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: My family has done many escape rooms across the Southeast so we decided to try one in Phoenix...and this was one of our favorites! We did LIT and loved it. The room was linear and the clues made sense. It definitely wasn't easy- but not undoable. Great design and fun to play.

room_title: Escape room "LIT" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Lit was a great room! Our group had a fun time playing and laughed quite a bit. Still a challenging room! Love the storyline and added challenge to break INto the room. I would recommend highly recommend this room.

room_title: Escape room "LIT" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Lit is a must play! If you are looking for a fun, but challenging room- this is the one to play. Love the sense of humor throughout the game and the very unique puzzles. Best room!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard Hysteria" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: This is definitely a “ must see” if you love escape rooms! It definitely felt like you were in the Wizarding world of Harry Potter and Ian, our game master, was awesome! As chaotic as it can get at times he was on point with the clues and even cheering us on at times. Will definitely be going back to escape the zombie apocalypse.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard Hysteria" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: Seriously, THE BEST! Heard a lot about escape rooms and this was the first one we actually did. If others are anything like this, I'm all in. We did the Horcrux Hysteria (Harry Potter theme) and it was awesome! Took 5 moderately intelligent adults almost the entire hour to work our way out. So challenging but a ton of fun. The guys that work there are really nice very accommodating, and the location is great. Great with friends tonight and will bring my teams back for work activities. Excited to come back!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard Hysteria" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: This has been one of the best date nights we've had! Horcrux Hysteria was incredibly well done. The room was very immersive and creative. Highly recommended for a group date night!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Machine" by Fort Collins Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: This experience was so much fun!! Each room has fun clues that are just tricky enough to get you to think outside the box. Finding each clue, knowing it led to another clue, and then to another room. Trying to race the clock to complete the mission. It was exciting, and unlike any other activity you'll experience in town! I will definitely bring my friends to try it for themselves.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Machine" by Fort Collins Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: A lot of fun, cool details with great theme that was well executed- an overall great experience even thought my group missed by a minute! Was not impossible, but was challenging enough to be fun and enjoyable!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Machine" by Fort Collins Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: How fun to have something in this town other than beer, bikes and bands? We absolutely loved it! Thanks for the fun night. I'm telling everyone about this.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Machine" by Fort Collins Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: This was one of the most entertaining hours I have had. We did the escape room with 6 other people we didn't know and had an absolute blast! The decor of the rooms is amazing, and I highly recommend this to anyone wanting to have some fun or try something new. I am now addicted to escape rooms and can't wait to see the next creation!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Machine" by Fort Collins Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: Did the Escape Room this evening with family. We had a great time! The staff is friendly and accommodating. The rooms are clean, organized and well thought-out. The clues were challenging but not ridiculously difficult. There are multiple rooms to go from one level to the next. We escaped with one minute to spare! Would highly recommend it and will go again when they start the next round!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Two: Norcross Art Gallery" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: What an excellent experience. It was our first time. The Art Gallery set up was amazing and well thought out. Think Davinci Code. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Two: Norcross Art Gallery" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: First time doing a escape room and it was pretty awesome! The story line was pretty good, it was challenging and fun at the same time! Totally worth it can't wait for the next chapter!!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Two: Norcross Art Gallery" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Amazing! I've done about 15 rooms in LA and this one makes one of the best, original puzzles very well thought out. What I like most is the level of imersion in this game you really do fell like part of the story. You seriously need to try it out regardless if you're and experienced or beginner. Can't wait to try the other chapters !!! MUST TRY

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic" by America's Escape Game Tampa in Tampa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Caretaker" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: My boyfriend surprised me by starting my birthday party here and it was so much fun! Seriously the best birthday event I've ever had!! Everyone got really into it, even people I didn't expect to enjoy it! Brett was an awesome escape artist and we will def be back again!!

room_title: Escape room "The Caretaker" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: Such a fun night out. The Caretaker is true to it's word. I can't wait to go back and try another escape!

room_title: Escape room "The Caretaker" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: Great team building event. The people were a lot of fun and the themes were great! A must do!

room_title: Escape room "The Caretaker" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: We had a blast! We were skeptical of the toughness level of the challenge, but were well in over our heads within the first few minutes of the game. We would LOVE to come back soon, however live in Montana. Next time in the area, we will definitely be visiting this place again, except this time we will be VICTORIOUS!

room_title: Escape room "The Caretaker" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: America's Escape Game was an awesome indoor activity to do on a rainy day in Orlando. My family had a ball playing it. Something new and exciting great for all ages. Thanks Jason Justin

room_title: Escape room "The Caretaker" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: We just did "the caretaker" we got to the very last room. We were sooo close! We highly recommend going! Thanks for taking great care of us for our Anniversary

room_title: Escape room "The Caretaker" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: Highly recommend this! We have the best time, even though we die. Thanks so much to Brett, Max, Heidi, and Shol! Definitely coming back!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard Room" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dauntless Kingdom" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: There were nine of us, so we did the largest and most difficult, Dauntless Kingdom room. I was totally impressed with the quality of and imagination built into the puzzles. While challenging, they were solvable and very creative! The price is very fair, the decor is professionally done, the staff is friendly and supportive and the experience is something you'll not soon forget. We will come back and do another room soon. Thank you Race to Escape.

room_title: Escape room "Dauntless Kingdom" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: So awesome! We did the Dauntless Kingdom room and loved the GOT touch to it!!!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Tower" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: What an incredible experience! The guys running this escape room are so friendly and fun! You can really tell they put a lot of thought into making the escape room fun and memorable. Thanks Alex for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Tower" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My 13-year-old son and I did a new Wizard's room, and we loved it! It's not the hardest room but it's not the easiest either. We are experienced at doing escape rooms and we were able to complete the room in record time with a few hints. I think this is a perfect room for kids. I look forward to their next one.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Tower" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was my first escape room ever, and I loved it so much! My best friends and I were able to escape the Wizard's Tower room with some hints from the friendly staff. Woohoo! Great work on this room! I really felt like I was in another world. We will definitely be coming back and will be spreading the word! Thank you for an amazing time!

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned: The Story of House 901" by Greeley's Great Escape in Fort Collins
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak: Find the Cure" by Mastermind Escape Games in Augusta
review: We did the CDC Outbreak and had an absolute blast! I am dying to get back and do a different room. The staff was super pleasant. My only piece of advice that I would like to have known up front is there is no starting place. You just start compiling clues and go for it. We spent 5 mins trying to figure out the "first" clue but it isn't in number format. So happy we have something new like this to the area and will definitely be back soon!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak: Find the Cure" by Mastermind Escape Games in Augusta
review: We've enjoyed escape rooms before and we were excited to try one in Augusta. Unfortunately, we were infected via the outbreak, but we loved that our lab assistant walked us through it after and showed us what we were missing! I’m sure my family will do the other three rooms soon.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak: Find the Cure" by Mastermind Escape Games in Augusta
review: Did this with my 13-year-old and a bunch of mixed strangers. We all contributed and got out of Outbreak. So much fun and we will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Apocalypse" by Escape Savannah in Savannah
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in a Room with a Zombie" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: Such a fun and memorable experience! From the moment we checked in with Jake's witty banter, to our amazing and hilarious guide Megan, to the most dedicated scary yet somehow also funny at times zombie Rylee; everyone made it a truly enjoyable experience. If we weren't screaming we were laughing. Can't wait to go again!

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in a Room with a Zombie" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: Did the zombie room. Actors were awesome, room was fun.

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in a Room with a Zombie" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: Awesome way to spend an evening with friends. Great staff experience. Zombie room is a must-do!

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in a Room with a Zombie" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: Our team had a great experience in the Zombie room. It's so immersive - you almost forget that it's just a game! Will go back to do the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in a Room with a Zombie" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: Had an amazing time! We will be back! We did the zombie room and it was such an awesome and thrill seeking experience!!!

room_title: Escape room "Demolition Abduction" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: We had a great time solving the puzzles ...a great teamwork event and had lots of laughs. Highly recommend for date nights.

room_title: Escape room "Demolition Abduction" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: We head such a fun time trying to escape and almost head it. This is so addicting, I will definately be back.

room_title: Escape room "Demolition Abduction" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: Awesome room! Very fun and interactive. I've been to a few escape rooms at different places, but this is my favorite one so far. It was challenging, but still doable, which is perfect, and I loved the theme!

room_title: Escape room "The Dimension Gate" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Star Wars" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: This was my first escape room and won't be my last I am hooked on the challenge. Awesome customer service!! Perfect for team building or a fun night out with friends/family.

room_title: Escape room "Star Wars" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: An amazing escape room that's not too far out of the way. The employees are super helpful and all of the rooms are A+. None of the rooms are unfairly hard and all of the puzzles are fun and creative. I have and will continue to recocomend this one to friends. 10/10

room_title: Escape room "Star Wars" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: I have done two of their escape rooms now and both times I've had a great time. They're hard enough that you feel a sense of urgency, but not too hard. Also they are well decorated, though I sometimes wish there were more movable props or props you could touch. The staff has been attentive and friendly. However, the last time I was there it almost seemed as if they were getting impatient with our progress and continued to give us clues even when we hadn't asked. We had no problem getting into the building despite it being after hours. Also there was no waiting around to start, they do a really great job of scheduling.

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: There were 9 of us so we did the Pipeworks room. We split into teams which I highly recommend. It adds to the fun and it would have been a lot of us in 1 room room.

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: Did the Pipe Works room tonight. We chose the competition mode between two teams. it was a great experience. We've played a few rooms here and there and this was a solid contender.

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: We've done two different rooms with the Denver Escape Room so far. Pipe Works was my favorite! The immersion experience is above any other, the storyline is great and the challenge is exhilarating! Return customers all the way!

room_title: Escape room "Black Site" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: Black Site was my fourth escape room in the bay area, first at Make a Break, and I loved it. The game master was awesome and we made it out (through a lot of rewarding effort) with two minutes to spare. It was an awesome challenge. Can't wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Black Site" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: First time doing and escape room and we loved it! So much that we booked another one for the same night! Black Site was the best!!

room_title: Escape room "Black Site" by Make a Break Escape in Tampa
review: Our group of six had our first escape room experience playing Black Site and it was so much fun! The difficulty was just right for us. Would definitely go back and try even harder next time!

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Had a great time at Escape Room Fairfax. We chose The Cure. We used all three hints. I liked that the hints were just enough to get us thinking in a way that moved us in a different direction, and nothing too obvious. It was a blast, and we can’t wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: I recently did "The Cure" room with a group of 8. I had never done one of these escape/mystery rooms before, so I was not sure what to expect, but it ended up being a lot of fun!The clues were definitely challenging to figure out, but we had a really great game master who explained the general idea of how the room would work ahead of time. We ended up making it out with a few minutes to spare! I can't wait to go back and try other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: This place provided such an entertaining experience! A little bit pricey but definitely worth it if you're going with friends or family. The two us played with four other strangers but still had a great time since they were fun to work with. We did the cure and it was supposed to be the hardest room they offered and no doubt we struggled a bit, but the host was indeed very helpful and we had a blast figuring things out. We hope to return again excited for another escape!

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Two of my sons and I went to The Cure! We had so much fun working together and not working together to escape. We know what to do and not to do the next escape room, and there will be a next escape room! I was very impressed with the layout and our host. Thank you for the fun memories!

room_title: Escape room "Cremlocke Manor" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: Cremlocke Manor had a great story line, and it was really entertaining. The puzzles were little hard but we figured it out on time!

room_title: Escape room "Cremlocke Manor" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: Lockbusters was an absolutely amazing experience! Not only was the game beautifully done, the story was cool, the effects were top notch, and I highly recommend! We did Cremlock Manor, and I will be coming back to try all of the other games! The best part of this experience was our game guide, Shane. He was the friendliest and most knowledgeable game host I have ever had, and I’ve done a bunch of escape rooms. He was engaged, fun, hilarious, and very helpful! We were a rowdy group of friends doing the last game of the night, and if he had been there all day, you couldn’t tell it! Give that man a raise and a promotion! Thanks Shane, you are the best!

room_title: Escape room "Cremlocke Manor" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: We did Cremlocke Manor (45 Minute Game). It was challenging enough and there were some startling surprises. It was a great room!

room_title: Escape room "Bear Valley Search and Rescue" by Big Bear Escape Room in Big Bear City
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: What a fantastic, engaging, totally immersive outing! We did Operation: Casino with 5 teen/adult players and escaped with seconds left. The game consists of many number puzzles, clues to find, and locks to open. This was our first escape room experience and it was definitely difficult, but so very fun! It really makes you think and work as a team. The game master was helpful in guiding or redirecting but never gave anything away. Well worth the money! We will be back very soon. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Had so much fun doing the Operation: Casino escape room.  Ashley was an awesome Game Master walking us through the rules and nudging us in the right direction when we asked for a clue.  The room was challenging but not overwhelming - It was amazing how quickly the hour flew by!  If we'd had about 10 seconds more we would have achieved a successful escape!  The defeat just makes me want to try my hand at another room!  Definitely a great way to spend an hour with friends and family!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: First time for my son husband and I. My daughter played before but at a different location. We were in the Casino room. I don't gamble so it was a bit difficult and there was a lot of math involved which isn't my strong point. Preston was great, explained allot and when we asked for clues explained them perfectly. Ready to do a different challenge.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Went to Breakout Games with some friends for my birthday. Had an absolute blast. I decided we would do the Casino room. It was a little difficult at first because none of us were gamblers and we had a hard time getting started. After we asked Elizabeth for a clue she really helped us get rolling! She gave the perfect clues and explained everything to where we understood, but she was not telling us exactly how to play.We broke out with several minutes remaining, and I think if we wouldn’t have wasted so much time in the beginning, we might have gotten out even sooner. We definitely want to play again and try and different room. We would also like to request Elizabeth! Just saying!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Had a lot of fun. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for an outside the box experience. 5 Stars hands down!

room_title: Escape room "The Babysitter" by Reed Between The Lines in Rohnert Park
review: My first escape room visit. Was so much fun! Looking forward to doing it again!

room_title: Escape room "The Babysitter" by Reed Between The Lines in Rohnert Park
review: So much fun! Such a blast with friends and family.

room_title: Escape room "Blackout Gold Mine" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: It was a lot of fun. We’ll do this again for sure.

room_title: Escape room "Blackout Gold Mine" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: What an awesome escape room! I have been to several different companies now but have to say this one was super worth it! As someone who has done a few different styles now I enjoy seeing new and creative takes on escape rooms as well as something with a bit of a challenge. Ariel did a great job welcoming us in and giving us the clues we needed when the time was right. Thanks for a great experience! We will definently be back!

room_title: Escape room "Blackout Gold Mine" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: We had a great time! We finished the Black out and immediately asked if we could do another room. So Amber set up another room and we did the heist! It was great!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Bank Robbery" by Trapped In Decatur in Huntsville
review: So much fun, now I want to do them all! We broke out the bank. My family of four worked together without killing each other. Staff was friendly and helpful when we got stuck too long.

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Mayhem" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: I took five boys, aged 9-13 to Escape Reality last night along with two other adults. This was our first experience with escape rooms, and we all had a lot of fun! We did Mafia Mayhem. It was very clever and kept everyone engaged. The staff was very helpful! We will be back! Can't wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Mayhem" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: I have an addiction to escape games. This was our first time here and we did the Mafia Mayhem room. It was fantastic. The room itself was immersive and challenging. There were plenty of fun mechanisms, not just keys and combos. Oh. And you find booze. Bonus!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Mayhem" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: We had a great time in the Mafia Mayhem room. Staff was very accommodating to our large group. Very helpful as this was our first time doing an escape room. Price was VERY reasonable. Will definitely be coming back!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Mayhem" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: Mafia Mayhem was fantastic. Great attention to detail and staff was very helpful. We look forward to returning for Descent into Madness!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Mayhem" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: This was our first time doing one of these and it we got to try the newest room "Mafia Mayhem Speakeasy" and it was a blast. All the staff were very accommodating and so much fun. Mike was awesome. We will definitely be going back again.

room_title: Escape room "Illusion de Magician" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: We did the magic room and it was amazing! Ed was our host and he was awesome! Ask for hints if you need them... they won't tell you outright but give you enough to steer you the right way. We will be back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Illusion de Magician" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: We did the I'illusion de Magicien room today and had an amazing time. It's only one room but the set up and story were really well put together. We had an amazing time and were able to solve the puzzle. I can't wait to go back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Illusion de Magician" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: We did a team-building event yesterday in the Magician room and had an absolute blast!! The puzzles were challenging but fun, and your excitement just grows each time you figure out a clue! Very well-done, we definitely want to return!!

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Escape" by Escape the Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Swindled" by Extraordinary Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: This was so much fun!!! We did two rooms. The first was the Dog Napped room, it was a very exciting. The clues were great and it really had us thinking. The second room we did was Swindled. It was a bigger room with a lot more clues to find. A bit more of a challenge but it was no problem because we had more players with us. I would highly recommend going. They just had a new room open up. I will review that one too after we get a chance to do it. All in all a wonderful time, and something to talk about for weeks after. You will have a blast.

room_title: Escape room "Swindled" by Extraordinary Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: This was one of my favorite escape rooms! I've done many rooms before and I had a blast trying to figure out all the clues in the swindled room! The service was impeccable and I was really pleased with how the clues were incorporated. Thanks so much for having us tonight! Will come back for the Jewel Heist room!

room_title: Escape room "Swindled" by Extraordinary Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: This was my first time doing an escape room and it was awesome! I did the Swindled room with 6 other people. It was a lot of fun and the puzzles were pretty challenging but we did manage to finish it in under an hour. They have 2 other rooms which look really fun as well! The owner, Nikki, is really great and has a true passion this.I would definitely recommend checking out Extraordinary Escape Rooms!

room_title: Escape room "An Invitation From The Mystery Man" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Almost Famous" by Tropic Escape in Fort Myers
review: Definitely the place to go if you want a mix of challenging puzzles and creative theme rooms. Almost Famous has the best finale of any room you will come across!

room_title: Escape room "Almost Famous" by Tropic Escape in Fort Myers
review: The 7 of us middle-age professional women had a blast. The experience was challenging, engaging, hilarious and tons of pure fun. Highly recommend. We did the “almost famous” room. The final challenge had us all laughing ridiculously.

room_title: Escape room "Almost Famous" by Tropic Escape in Fort Myers
review: My wife and I have played over 60 escape rooms all over the southeast and Tropic Escape's Rooms are definitely in the top tier of games we've played. The place is a 20-30 minute drive from the Naples area but well worth the trip. We first played the "Almost Famous" room and later in the week played the "Castaway" room. Both were fantastic and very well done.Almost Famous had great scenic and state-of-the-art equipment inside the room. One of my favorite parts of this room is that you have to make a decision before you even start the game that leads to one of the most unique final puzzles I've ever seen! The tech in this room is amazing. There were a variety of really fun, immersive, hands on puzzles that lead to a "Wow, how did they make that work?" reaction when solved. Overall, a very, very fun room.Castaway is touted as their most difficult room and they are not kidding. The room is very challenging, but in a fun way, not in a frustrating or tedious way. There are a lot of puzzles to solve, but the solutions to the puzzles are logical, make sense, and can be solved reasonably quick once you figure out what to do. There is not a lot of "busy work" to do just to eat up time. The scenic is also extremely well done. The immersion factor is on point with lightning effects, flickering lights, and the sound of thunder welcoming you as soon as you walk into the room. This room offers several other "wow" factors as well.After we finished, we spent some time speaking to the owner and you could tell he got into the escape game business because he loved it. He told us that he only designs and builds games that he'd want to play and be proud of. He is passionate about the industry and you can see that in the product he's created. I highly recommend giving this place a visit. They are among the best in the area.

room_title: Escape room "Mayan Temple" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: Decided to try out an escape room for the first time over the holiday break. We went with the family in a group of 6. We went during the day so it was not very crowded. We tried the Mayan ruins. The puzzles were fun and required lots of teamwork to solve. It had the typical setup where you can ask for answers to the harder clues. There were multiple rooms to unlock and explore so that kept the excitement up. Defintely going back to try out one of the other 3 rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mayan Temple" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: I have done no less than 10 escape rooms. The quality of these surpasses all of the others tenfold. I went with my siblings and my dad. The rooms are set up brilliantly. We did the Mayan one, very Indiana-Jones esque. We were able to escape with about 8 minutes to spare.This was an excellent experience and I can't wait to return to try the rest of their rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Mayan Temple" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: Loved this place! Did the jewel heist and the mayan temple ones and will definitely return for more!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Great experience! We did the Prison Break room, we did not make it out but we had a great time. Staff were super friendly, helpful, and funny! We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We tried heist and prison break. Both rooms were well thought out and very high quality. The staff was friendly and encouraging. We will definitely be back to try the remaining rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We love riddle escape room! The owners are the nicest. The rooms are high tech and challenging. The prison break room is great.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Great imagination has put this challenging room as one of the best in Arizona! Prison Break has puzzles and games never seen in an escape room before. Real jail bars, toilets and good decor make this room worth it. You and your friends will need to focus and work together to escape before time runs out. High difficulty but Tons of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Blind Tiger Speakeasy" by Camp Adventureland in Dover
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Fallout" by Novus Escape Room in Dover
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by The Ultimate Escape in Norwich
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Lair of the Puzzlemaster" by Trapped! Escape Room Upland in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Island Paradise" by Vector Escape Games in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Room Omega" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: Room Omega is not so hard (though we still failed to escape), but the Penitentiary is way harder and has more traps and information that try to mislead you. Really enjoyed my experience in Omescape today!

room_title: Escape room "Room Omega" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: Omgosh!! It was my first time playing a real-life escape game!! I have played a number of online "escape the room" games a long time ago, but nothing beats bringing something from the virtual world to REAL LIFE! It was so amazing and so much fun. Once you are inside the room, it was like an escape from reality and became one of those characters inside the computer game. The execution is great and the props are well set-up! I highly recommend coming here with a group of friends because it is such a great bonding experience and it is all about teamwork as well. We came as a party of 7 today to celebrate our friend's birthday. We played the Omega Room, which is suppose to be the easier room from the Penitentiary, with a escape success rate of 33%. It was so tense and exciting and we were mind blown when we solved each puzzle. I'm guilty to say that I was getting scared from the music haha. The staff who worked here tonight was super nice and helped us out a bit when we were stuck :)!! We didn't managed to escape within 60 minutes though... dang it! but the staff still let us finish the game! We then proceeded to take numerous pictures in front of their big wall drop with funny props.It was a great experience and we will DEFINITELY be back for The Penitentiary Room!! which currently has a escape success rate of 11%.A MUST TRY. BECAUSE IF YOU HAVE NOT, YOU ARE MISSING OUT. :)

room_title: Escape room "Room Omega" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: Really quite fun. If you like scouring the room for clues and then figuring out the riddles to access a new room to scour for clues... this is the game for you! Having now completed Omega (less than a minute to spare) and the Forgotten Treasure (couldn't get the last clue in time), nothing was impossible but having (at least 6) people has worked well for us. When someone just doesn't understand how to solve a problem, at least one person will stumble upon how to solve it. It's frustrating in the good way! Occasionally something mundane like finding a loose object among 4 rooms will stop you, which is genuinely frustrating. For the most part, people can collaborate on the puzzles however there are a couple of choke points (particularly hard last puzzle of FT) that really don't lend themselves to having more than 1 or 2 people work on the puzzle.The staff is nice and give you one Hint to help you get through if you get stuck. If you just think it doesn't make sense, I recommend radioing in not for a Hint but asking if you understand it correctly, because sometimes you are just missing something and you won't finish even if you think it over for 30 minutes. If they say the answer is a Hint, then you can reconsider if you really want to ask.The FT had some clever new puzzles that I liked but I think the Omega room was generally more fun. They had a groupon that was going that cut the cost in half (only for Omega) that I would highly recommend doing.Omega had a 39% success rate and Penitentiary and Forgotten Treasure were both half as much (was it 13% or 19%?). We were amped up after completion (successful or not) and it's really quite exciting and strenuous (again, in a good way)! The themes are a bit silly but overall tie it together well and it's just darned fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Room Omega" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: This was the first escape room experience for my friends and me and we had a blast. It took a bit of convincing to get everyone to go to Richmond and the discounted deal we purchased definitely helped. Once we got to Omescape, we all became focused on solving the puzzles. There were 7 in our group and we tried the easiest room, "Omega," which has a time travel theme.We found the clues to be very clever and exciting. There was a glitch at the start in which we were actually let into the second room before we solved the puzzles to get to that stage. We quickly backtracked and found the proper way to get into that room. It would have been nice if the staff had checked the rooms before we entered.We got stuck on one clue in the second room and we used our one "lifeline" there. Once we got past that point, we quickly figured out the remaining clues and rushed out of the room in 55 minutes.It was so much fun that I would have loved to do another room on the spot but we had another appointment to go to and we were terribly hungry and that will have to wait until next time.

room_title: Escape room "Room Omega" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: Let me just get it out there that I'm a recent "escape game addict". Our group of 6 tried OMESCAPE - OMEGA ROOM the other day and had a lot of fun. This was the 7th room I've ever done. Six was the perfect # of people for that room. We escaped in 50 minutes and did need 1 hint.Here's my rank from best to worst in terms of escape game rooms:1. ESCAPESF - ANTIQUE ROOM!!! So sophisticated. 2. PANIQ ROOM - PRISON BREAK3. OMESCAPE - OMEGA4. THE BASEMENT (in LA) - THE BASEMENT5. ESCAPESF - ALCATRAZ6. PANIQ ROOM - SICKO7. PANIQ ROOM - GEEKComing back in a couple of weeks to try the Penitentiary and Forgotten Treasure!

room_title: Escape room "Room Omega" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: Super awesome!!!! I've been telling everyone in Los Angeles (where I live) that they have to drive up to Northern California and DO IT!!! I went alone and got out of one room, but not the second one I played though. (I've done 40 escape games, so I am an addict. I would recommend taking people with you!)Room design, puzzles, themes are all great. Staff is nice!

room_title: Escape room "Beyond the Wardrobe" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: My boyfriend and I love doing escape rooms for a date night activity. We recently chose Beyond the Wardrobe and were blown away!! The creativity that it takes to come up with the ideas for some of the clues is outstanding!!! This was our 3rd room and we Escaped with 9 min remaining!

room_title: Escape room "Pandorum" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: Our first escape room experience. It was perfect! The scenario, environment, puzzles, etc. The topping on the cake is the staff and social environment. Everything was great! Well worth the money. No regrets. We didn't even figure it out before time was up, but will spend our hard earnes money again w the Escape Company in Orlando. loved it! Still thinking about it w a smiles on our face. You must try it!

room_title: Escape room "Bio-Hazard Bunker" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Workshop" by The Greatest Escape Games in Colorado Springs
review: We did the Inventor's Workshop and barely beat the clock. We had to work together to get the answers. Solving the clues took everyone; and even our 11 year old got one big piece. The props were very professionally made. They had spent a lot of time setting the scene. The 15 year old also got into it as we all did but she led the team. We were breathless as we revealed the answer and cheered loudly. We would go again!!!! Worth it!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Workshop" by The Greatest Escape Games in Colorado Springs
review: We had a large group, half of us did the Inventors room and half did the Cabin room. I was in the inventors room and it was very fun! Be prepared to seriously strategically think though, it was very challenging and we needed a few clues. Everyone who was in the Cabin said they had lots of fun too! This was a great team building exercise and I would definitely recommend this Escape Room. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and accommodating!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Workshop" by The Greatest Escape Games in Colorado Springs
review: We took our teen and 11year old to the Inventor’s Room. The whole family enjoyed this challenge and the set up of this room. We didn’t solve it, but had loads of fun figuring out a lot of the puzzles. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We can’t wait to return and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape Earth" by Epic Escape Game in Grand Junction
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Underground" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: It was FREAKING AWESOME!!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Underground" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: We had a total blast saving the world - it’s an exciting puzzle-solving time. The staff was great and the tech is amazing! Give it a try and I guarantee you’ll come back for more!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Underground" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: So much fun. Had a group of 6 people and it was a blast! Definitely recommend it, we did the zombie apocalypse room!

room_title: Escape room "The ClassRoom Adventure" by West Palm Beach Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: We have had a great time every visit! Thus far, our favorite room is "The Classroom", although I may be biased being a teacher! Just as important, the owner Randi is very friendly and willing to work with her customers..we will continue to come back and bring our friends!

room_title: Escape room "The ClassRoom Adventure" by West Palm Beach Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: 6 of us did the Classroom of Doom in West Palm Beach. We were all first-time escape room people. We had a phenomenal time. We all developed a rhythm slowly finding our way through the clues. It was amazing. The staff was incredible. Randy made the Escape that much more fun. We intend to return each week and hit another room each time. We're all really looking forward to it. My highest recommendation.

room_title: Escape room "The ClassRoom Adventure" by West Palm Beach Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: Took my family there for the first time yesterday. Did the Classroom of Doom. Was an awesome experience. The people running the show are great. Michael did a great job as the controller. We had so much fun we went back again today. Did the Halloween special called Soul Ripper. Another good time.

room_title: Escape room "The ClassRoom Adventure" by West Palm Beach Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: We had never done an escape room before and were a bit skeptical but decided to try it out because Groupon offered a discount. We booked a whole room and had 3 generations of our family doing the Classroom escape -- ages ranging from from 85 to 15 years old -- and everyone had a great time (the staff were kind enough to bring in a comfortable chair for the older members of our family). Everyone loved it and we plan to go back and try some of the other rooms. Was a great family activity and afterwards we went out to dinner and had a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: My daughter had a small birthday party with some of her friends here today in the Hostage room, coinciding with a special event they were having where they took the main lights out of the room and have them flashlights to make it even more of a challenge.
