They didn’t make it out but she had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: This was excellent! It was by far the most challenging game room I've ever done (Hostage room for people reading) and it was so much fun. We would not have accomplished it without our awesome game master Gabriel! Many thanks for a great night!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: I came here with some friends on a Sunday evening, and had a blast! We had the nicest Gamemaster.  One member of our party was running late, so we weren't able to start on time. Normally, that means they would take away playing time, but since nobody was after us, the Gamemaster allowed us to start late, and still gave us the full 60 minutes to breakout, which was great because we needed every single minute of it!We did the Hostage room. I loved figuring out all the clues.  It was also a unique experience as it was my first time being blindfolded and handcuffed, so be prepared for that if you are doing this room.  I also really loved the amount of technology that was used in this room.  All in all a good time!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: I've done several escape rooms and Breakout was one of the best quality rooms I've seen. Very well done and I loved how interactive the rooms were. Our game master was great and I plan on visiting other locations!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: This was a great opportunity for our team to work together using our creative, outside of the box skills.

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Rise" by Minervium in Sacramento
review: So fun, really well thought out, and an affordable and local option for an evening out in Davis!

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Rise" by Minervium in Sacramento
review: This is a well thought out and executed room, a perfect combination of puzzles and tech made the experience flow really well. Our game master was awesome and made the experience that much better.

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Rise" by Minervium in Sacramento
review: The best escape room I’ve been to by far. The game master we had was really nice and helpful as well! I’d recommend coming to this escape over any other any day.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Peril" by Escape LOL in Pensacola
review: One of my birthday presents was an escape room. We chose the Pirate Peril. We solved the mystery, but didn't make it under the required hour timeframe. Missed it by eight minutes. The four of us did extremely well considering the room can hold up to ten people. So, we'll take it. Lol!Recommend Escape LOL to everyone! Great clues, excellent guides, and tons of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Peril" by Escape LOL in Pensacola
review: Just succeeded in the Pirate's Peril, but it was tough. 2 of us were sailors (we had total of 8 in our group). I've been thru several of these and each time just barely missed the timeline. This time whether due to the team-mates or luck, (I like to think it was the players) we made it out. So Argh and shiver me timbers - I'd recommend this one to anyone who enjoys solving problems.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Peril" by Escape LOL in Pensacola
review: Yesterday myself and 8 teenagers went and did the Pirate Peril escape for my daughter's 15th birthday. Only one of the children had done an escape room before, so this was a new experience for most of us. We had a blast! We were able to escape but with not much time to spare. The kids loved it and were begging to do the Prison Break room afterward! We will for sure be back! Highly recommend this adventure to all!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Professor's Study" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: One of the best experiences my family and I have had!We did the professor's study and it was AWESOME! The puzzles and clues were so well thought out! We were two clues away from finishing and loved every minute of it The staff is so friendly and clearly clever to put on such a great experience.We will all be back for my brother's birthday and cannot wait.Definitely recommend this!

room_title: Escape room "The Professor's Study" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: We absolutely loved this! Definitely coming back for the other two rooms as well! Very friendly and helpful staff as well!

room_title: Escape room "The Professor's Study" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: We had a great time at Bolt. If you are looking for something to do with family or friends I would highly recommend Bolt.

room_title: Escape room "The Professor's Study" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: Had a blast at Bolt. My friends and I escaped the Professor's Study with just 3 minutes left. The staff is great, and the experience is amazing. Can't wait to go back and do the Hacker room!

room_title: Escape room "The Professor's Study" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: We had a great time. The staff is very friendly and the room was challenging! I recommend anyone who likes puzzles and has an hour to spend go try this out!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Aboard the Titanic" by Bible Treks Christian Escape Room in Denver
review: Great fun & challenging room on the Titanic! Would highly recommend for families or groups! Thanks for hosting our family today

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Aboard the Titanic" by Bible Treks Christian Escape Room in Denver
review: What a fun time we had becoming shark bait on the Titanic! Thanks, Collin! Great Escape!!!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Aboard the Titanic" by Bible Treks Christian Escape Room in Denver
review: My first escape room ever and I loved it! So creative yet challenging. But we worked as a team and had a blast doing it. Collin was so passionate and helpful. It was overall a great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Launch" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: We had a great time at Hawaii Escape Challenge! We chose the Nuclear Launch theme and the room was very fun and the clues were tricky but easy at the same time. We highly recommended coming here!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Launch" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: My family and I came here twice in one weekend! That's how fun it was! The first time we did the Nuclear Launch and the second time we did the Cellar. We failed both times but it was so fun we'll definitely come back to retry them. Game Master Hailey was there both times we went and she is very friendly and super detailed about what the rules are. The rooms are so realistic, like you're actually trapped! It's great.

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Launch" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: This place is so much fun! We got out with 2 minutes to spare! Definitely will do this again!

room_title: Escape room "Magician's Workshop" by Escape Room Herndon in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: The Sherlock Holmes room was awesome. All of the clues were so intricate and well thought out. Would definitely go again!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: We went with a group of 5 and 4 of us have never done this before. We did the Sherlock Holmes room and had a blast! Lindsey was a great host. Definitely will be back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: Went here for my 40th! Girls against boys, super fun! Loved the Sherlock room!

room_title: Escape room "Medieval Madness" by PanIQ Room in San Francisco
review: My friends and I visited 2 escape rooms here- Wizard & Medieval. We had a great time as Wizards and enjoyed all the activities in this room. The room has a little wear and tear so some items give themselves away pretty easily but we had a great time! The Medieval room was another story. They do say it is scary and I found that to be very true. But it was more macabre (dead severed heads, creepy sound effects, and torture devices). If that's your thing- enjoy. That room was hard though- so hustle!

room_title: Escape room "The Executioner" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Fun House" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I haven't had this much fun in a long time.

room_title: Escape room "The Fun House" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Had the most amazing time!There is no slacking and letting your friends lead in this game. Everyone must do their own part of the puzzle before you can come together as a group.Room is detailed and immersive. Characterization is unique and adds a fun element.Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Fun House" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: LOVED this escape room!!When I first received the invite to come along, I thought okay, what is going to set this one apart from the rest? I've been to my share of escape rooms, some were great, others needed to mature a little more, but after you've done so many, you want to find a uniqueness about the next one.I read the concept of everyone starting off separated into different rooms, that really caught my eye. The idea of everyone being a different character based on a quirky personality test was also nice. I had my eye set on being the detective (which I was able to be ). I watched as my friends became elected into the other positions - the jock, the rebel, the nerd, the virgin and the prom queen.To conquer this escape room, you really need the right dynamic. Everyone has their own puzzles to conquer, but at the same time, one may have something for someone in another room. I don't want to spoil much, but I will speak from being the detective. If you find yourself in this spot, I hope you don't get overwhelmed easy. You are the glue that bonds everyone and it is your responsibility to make sure everyone is okay and gets what they need.I highly recommend this room and will be speaking nothing but good things about it to anyone interested. What a great team at Crossroads, I can't wait to see what rooms you all come up with next.

room_title: Escape room "The Fun House" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Sets a new standard for an immersive, tense escape room through fantastic lighting, sound, and set design. You can tell the owners took a lot of care into making a professional movie-grade experience. From the moment the briefing starts to our send off at the end, everything was customer centric. Warm and welcoming at the beginning. Chilling and dangerous during the game. Loved this room and company.

room_title: Escape room "The Fun House" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: So amazing! My friends and I couldn't stop talking about it after we left. We were SO CLOSE to escaping and now all we want to do is go back and try it again!It's beautifully designed and with the dramatic lighting and eerie sounds, it seriously felt like we were in a horror movie.It was everyone's first experience in an escape room and we were all nervous about what we were getting into, but the owners we so kind and helpful that they were more than willing to make sure we were all going to have a fun time!I just recommend to book in advance because those time slots fill up fast!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by EXIT Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: We did the jail break room and got out with 2.5 minutes to spare. It was so much fun and more challenging than I thought it would be. Can't wait to go back and do the other room!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by EXIT Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: I LOVE this place, the owner is so sweet and really appreciates feedback about how to make the rooms better but unfortunately I didn't have anything to tell her because they were perfect! I did the 407 room a few weeks ago and the Jail break one today and both were very intellectually challenging unlike most rooms I've been to across the country. I loved how realistic everything was and how helpful the staff was, I can't wait to come back when the new room comes out.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets in the Attic VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: This is our second trip to Beat the Lock. The first time we did the Spy Room, this time we did the Secrets in the Attic. Both are equally challenging and fun. The puzzles are amazing. We really got immersed in the story. The staff are friendly. I can't wait until they add new rooms. I highly recommend this escape room for beginners and pros alike.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets in the Attic VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: This was my first escape room experience. We were celebrating my 40th and it was me and 9 of my friends. It was a great challenge and the host was amazing. Especially dealing with our crazy group. Can't wait to do the spy room next time and hope they set up other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets in the Attic VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: I went with my colleagues for a team event. It was simply amazing !! Theme was good and the clues were placed very well. We had so much fun solving the puzzles and moving to the next one !! Best place for team events !

room_title: Escape room "Secrets in the Attic VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: We had so much fun! We beat the lock, but just barely. It was challenging and fun, and kept all 10 of us working the entire time. I liked that everyone in our group, from the 13 yr old to Grandpa were involved and able to solve clues! We definitely want to come back!

room_title: Escape room "The Jesse James Heist" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Durango
review: Jesse James Heist was challenging and creative. Great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Jesse James Heist" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Durango
review: We went for our first escape room at Conundrum and did the Jesse James Heist. It was really cool! The store was amazing, too, with tons of brain teasers, puzzles, and games! It was a blast and I can't wait to come back and do another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Jesse James Heist" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Durango
review: What a great time! Unfortunately, we let Jesse James down... First by robbing the bank before he got back in town, and second, by not escaping in time. The crew was awesome and there are puzzles for purchase as well as sharpening your skills while waiting for your escape. A fun time!

room_title: Escape room "The Jesse James Heist" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Durango
review: I took our staff here for an end of the season night of fun and Conundrum didn't disappoint! The hour we were in the Jesse James Room flew by. The room was well put together and the clues were wonderfully difficult. Although we didn't escape, we will be coming back again and again! Our game master was friendly and made the experience all the more enjoyable. Thank you Conundrum Escape Rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "The Jesse James Heist" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Durango
review: We had a very fun girls night out to the escape room. We did the Jesse James room and made it out. I will definitely go back.

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic Zero" by Omescape in San Jose
review: My first time was the Pandemic Zero. Without spoiling anything, I have to say that this room was really fantastic. It has really awesome production value and you really feel like you are in the environment. The puzzles were the perfect amount of difficulty for my group. We escaped with a couple minutes to spare, but still felt the urgency at the end. It was the first time my friends were doing an escape room and it was the perfect intro into the world of escape rooms. They loved it.

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic Zero" by Omescape in San Jose
review: After having done two escape rooms prior, I decided to give the Pandemic Room a try here with my family. There were 6 of us total which fills up the max capacity.I have to admit that this escape room by far has the highest production value that I've experienced. Everything was fully functional and interactive. The room was quite challenging, so we were given an extra 10 minutes since we were so close, and finished only 3 minutes over! I have to admit, it was extremely kind of our host to give us the extra time and we left super satisfied.We will definitely be back again!

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic Zero" by Omescape in San Jose
review: I've done three escape rooms here so far: Dark Altar, Pandemic Zero, and Sorcerer's Sanctum. All of these rooms were beautifully put together. The production value was high, the puzzles were interesting and well-integrated into the rooms such that they didn't just seem random and forced, and the entire experience is fun for both beginners and veterans alike.I highly recommend Omescape - they have never failed to provide an exciting time and impress the friends that I bring with me.

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic Zero" by Omescape in San Jose
review: I've done a lot of escape rooms and the one we did at OMescape was both challenging and had incredible technology to it. Really fun and difficult. I would recommend you do the easier rooms before working up to the harder ones as they are seriously difficult.

room_title: Escape room "Pandemic Zero" by Omescape in San Jose
review: It's hard to review this place while not spoiling the puzzles, but it was truly a blast. The production value of the two rooms I've tried were pretty amazing. It kind of felt like being in a movie! It averages at about 30 bucks a person, but trust me - it's worth it. Shout out to the staff for being so amazing as well. The first time my group was late (don't recommend showing up late to anyone though), but they still let us have a full hour. The guy also took the time to walk us through what we missed after not escaping! I can't wait to go back and try the third room.

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by PanIQ Escape Room Miami in Miami
review: Please don’t waste ur money. Very dull. Some locks were left unlocked by the staff.. go to another room

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by PanIQ Escape Room Miami in Miami
review: A really fun experience for my first time for my 25th birthday! Lots of fun clues to figure out, plus the staff did an amazing job helping my family and I providing guidance. A MUST-TRY if you are in the Wynnwood area. Will definitely be coming back in the future to tackle the other themes.

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by PanIQ Escape Room Miami in Miami
review: I absolutely loved it!!! An amazing way to celebrate Halloween!!

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by PanIQ Escape Room Miami in Miami
review: It was an awesome experience, but super difficult lol you have to think out the box if not you will never make it out!! Looking forward to trying the other rooms

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by PanIQ Escape Room Miami in Miami
review: Awesome new way to have fun! I will be definitely returning and bringing my friends!

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by PanIQ Escape Room Miami in Miami
review: We had an amazing time! It was challenging but fun. Kelly and Alejandro were amazing and made the experience a blast! A must if you're in the Wynwood area!

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by PanIQ Escape Room Miami in Miami
review: We took the kids and did the Pirate's Den. Super fun, not scary at all. Teamwork!

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by PanIQ Escape Room Miami in Miami
review: This was amazingly fun and interesting. We did everything with 10 minutes to spare, maybe the best of the night! Definitely will ce back and do it again!

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by PanIQ Escape Room Miami in Miami
review: Paniq room was amazing! Our "game master" was always in character and amazingly supportive when we had any questions. This type of challenge is amazing for all types of people and really tests your ability to think on your feet.The first room was so good that we immediately booked our next visit for a second room!

room_title: Escape room "Gallery Heist" by Escape Artist DC in Washington, D.C.
review: After having a ball in the Gallery Heist room with my fiancé, I went back the same week with my grandmother and babysitter! Not only are the prices more fair than other escape rooms in the city, the staff is helpful/personable and the themes are unique!

room_title: Escape room "Gallery Heist" by Escape Artist DC in Washington, D.C.
review: This was a interesting experience. My girlfriend and I had a blast solving the Gallery Heist. Just try to avoid going during rush hour. The surrounding neighborhood is a nightmare to get out off.

room_title: Escape room "Gallery Heist" by Escape Artist DC in Washington, D.C.
review: This place is awesome. I came with my co-workers and we were blown away by how much thought had gone into the Gallery Heist. This is the greatest  activity we've done as an office, hands down. We are already talking about when we can come back. Thanks to all for making this a terrific experience!

room_title: Escape room "Gallery Heist" by Escape Artist DC in Washington, D.C.
review: So much fun. Creative and inventive. Loved it. Would go back again 100%.

room_title: Escape room "Gallery Heist" by Escape Artist DC in Washington, D.C.
review: After having a ball in the Gallery Heist room with my fiancé, I went back the same week with my grandmother and babysitter!Not only are the prices more fair than other escape rooms in the city, the staff is helpful/personable and the scenarios are unique!

room_title: Escape room "Secret Sabotage" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Skinned Alive" by Escape Thrill in Tampa
review: Great experience, cool staff, awesomely designed room, we did 'Skinned Alive' and failed! We weren't witty enough! We were so close, will for sure go again!

room_title: Escape room "Skinned Alive" by Escape Thrill in Tampa
review: We did the "Skinned Alive" room. Was challenging and fun. Didn't get out but almost....and had TONS of fun getting there. Recommend and will definitely be doing another room in the future. Thanks for a GREAT time.

room_title: Escape room "Skinned Alive" by Escape Thrill in Tampa
review: Such a great time. Skinned Alive theme was a little difficult but it was still a blast. Loved every second of it. The staff there is awesome as well. Hoped to go back and do more rooms in the future.

room_title: Escape room "Skinned Alive" by Escape Thrill in Tampa
review: We had our second experience at Escape Thrill in Clearwater. It was, again, an awesome time. We did the newer Skinned Alive room, and it was a blast. It was very tough, but the technology and puzzles used in the room were really good. I would highly recommend going here and doing this room!

room_title: Escape room "The Voodoo Cabin" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: I would not suggest this room, there was 6 in our group all related but one got sick and wasn’t able to come.   We ask for a refund and was told they couldn’t do that because they had no control over what was done over the internet.   Just a few of us had ever been before and we got no where solving the clues.   We had to ask for help in every step and then ask how it was solved and we weren’t even 1/16th through it before our hour was up.   Told them that half of us just sat on the floor and we were so disappoint.   Then they told us it was difficult that they created it and they even had trouble solving it.   Maybe they should tell you this when you are checking in.  I could of found a much better way to spend my $170.  The ones who never had done this before will probably never go to another one.   I want, what a waste.

room_title: Escape room "The Voodoo Cabin" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Need to get with the program a lot of stuff to do in Destin Fl to not even act like you care if customers walk in your place of business, stood and waited 3 minutes to be greeted by one of three girls sitting behind the desk 2 witch had headphones in and all on the phones so me and my party of seven went and spent our money where we had better customer service

room_title: Escape room "The Voodoo Cabin" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: We had so much fun finding all the clues in the voodoo cabin. We will be coming back to do the other rooms very soon.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Friendly and accommodating staff - I had messed up the booking process and Nivaldo took care of us and made sure we got to play anyway! Everyone we encountered was super nice and very helpful. The game itself was fun, challenging (but not impossible) and tested our team work. We will definitely be back to try another room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: We love it!!!! Will go back with more families and friends!!!!! Staff super friendly and they treat us wonderful !!! Place clean and the game was awesome!!!!! We can't stop talking about it!!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: We are already planning to go back. We had a 14 year old and 18 year old with us and we had a blast. The Budapest Express was difficult but very thrilling. Very well run.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: We were the first group to escape the Budapest Express at the expert level, and I loved it! It was like a giant game of Clue Definitely will recommend this place to friends.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Awesome experience with my girlfriend and friends! Victoria the master super cool! We escaped!!!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Massive 5/5 stars. We had never done anything like this before and it was a great experience. We liked it so much we did 3 games. 100% Would recommend to anyone who is nearby. Great day out!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Escapology, which holds a special place in my heart for being my first escape room experience, recently opened their latest game - Budapest Express. After successfully defeating it last night, I believe they saved the best for last (or at least, for most recent).Budapest Express was the absolute perfect blend of fun and challenge. The kinds of puzzles found in the room were excellently varied. While some required us to find keys in unexpected places, others required us to put together several different clues and work out a logical puzzle, while still others necessitated a calm demeanor and focused concentration.The best aspect of Budapest Express, for me, was that it's one of the very few rooms we've experienced in which the storyline *matters*. Every escape room has a story line, whether it's a gun fight at the OK Corral, stealing a diamond from a vault, or curing a plague. But most of the time, that story is irrelevant to the puzzles you have to find and solve. Not so at Budapest Express - our roles as detectives onboard a train which had become the scene of a murder was instrumental in solving the puzzles and "escaping" the room. It added a very welcome layer of excitement and realism to our escape room experience.I've been impressed with Escapology since my first experience with them last year. Having now done all five of their rooms, plus 12 others at competing locations in Orlando and Tampa, I can safely say that Escapology is in the running for the most enjoyable escape room company I've visited. And it is by far the most professional. The well themed lobby and the employees with whom I've interacted create a sense that Escapology is serious business, rather than a hobby or part-time job. The game masters truly care about creating rooms that will give their customers a fantastic experience, and it shows.Another excellent quality of Escapology is that it is one of only 2 Orlando-area escape games (out of 7, at last count) that allows your party to book a room exclusive to yourselves, without the possibility of any strangers joining you. For those who want an experience with just your family and friends, Escapology is for you. Even just two of you can book the entire room for yourselves. That Escapology does this, to increase the guest experience, at the sacrifice of making more money off a room's time slot, goes to show how much they care about their customers, more than just trying to pad their bottom line.I've loved every game I've played at Escapology, and am anxiously looking forward to their 6th game, which I'm told may in fact be opening in the next couple months!

room_title: Escape room "Materia Medica" by Novus Escape Room in Dover
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Playroom" by Escape Room Ft Myers in Fort Myers
review: we do escape rooms everywhere we travel. we loved this one. the playroom was entertaining and challenging . our monitor was great as well. we really felt cheered on. highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Playroom" by Escape Room Ft Myers in Fort Myers
review: Great place!! We did the playroom with our kids - ages 12, 10, and 6, and there was really something for everyone and the kids had an awesome time! We did the game master room with just the adults, and it was awesome - lots of locks and puzzles!! We have done several escape rooms and we thought these were challenging and a lot of fun. Highly recommend for all ages!!

room_title: Escape room "The Playroom" by Escape Room Ft Myers in Fort Myers
review: What an incredible experience with an escape room. My (edit, ex) fiancé, her brother, and I booked the Game Master room while looking for something fun to do in town (he's visiting, and we already did most the escape rooms in town). We found this place and booked the room, and I must say, of the 15 or so rooms I've done, this one ranks top 3, maybe even number 1 or 2. It was a simple set up (very horror themed, like Saw) with a great mix of challenging puzzles, electronic locks, and electronic switches. Just when you think you've seen every part of the room, something happens. We were so happy with the first room, we actually booked the second room right after and did The Playroom as well. That one is great for kids, as it's reminiscent of an elementary classroom, with very clever puzzles, motif, and style. Overall, a 10/10 experience. They have a new room opening at the end of the month, and we cannot wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Meltdown" by Escapism LLC in Southington
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Forgotten Pharaoh" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: So much fun! We did the Pharaoh's challenge, I can't remember the exact name, but it was a lot of fun and very challenging. My family and friends, all nine of us, made it out of the room in 53 minutes while using for clues. I feel like we are closer as a group then we were before. It was a great team building exercise.

room_title: Escape room "The Forgotten Pharaoh" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: Best escape room we've been to. It's slightly more expensive than Los Angeles, but you get a very high quality experience. We finished the Pharaoh game with 30 seconds to spare with 6 people and it was the perfect amount of difficulty. I would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Forgotten Pharaoh" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: Our family came in for Thanksgiving, I booked The Forgotten Pharaoh escape game. What a blast we all had, very challenging and lots of fun. We came out realizing the importance of working together.Charlie and his team are absolutely wonderful. We will be back and have already mentioned to our friends that they need to check it out.Thank you all for a great experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Forgotten Pharaoh" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: This was our first time ever in an Escape Game and I guarantee we will be back here! We did Pharaoh's Tomb and had a blast. Charlie and Cullen were so helpful and made our experience a great one! The Christmas Room is about to open and looks AWESOME! I highly recommend this to all - from beginners like us to pros!

room_title: Escape room "The Forgotten Pharaoh" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: AMAZING!! I was new to escape rooms before I found this place, and now I'm hooked. The owners (Charlie and Mia) are very friendly, the location is perfect and the entire experience is very well organized. The best part is that the puzzles were quite tough but fun! Specifically, the Forgotten Pharaoh -- which was my first room ever -- was a BLAST! Overall Escape Games at the River delivered an experience that has me wanting more!!

room_title: Escape room "The Medieval Breakout" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Durango

review: What a fun time. The drinks and food are good, the escape was exciting, and the decor is very cool. It was fun to do something different.

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology Denver in Denver
review: This place is awesome!  I've been several times with both my family, date night, and friends.  The food and cocktails are top notch, service is fantastic, and the games are well thought out.  Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology Denver in Denver
review: We did The Code - it was a great time! Drinks were tasty, too. Looking forward to going back to try the other escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Curse of The Jade Skull" by Camp Adventureland in Dover

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: Absolutely love coming here. I have completed the Prison Escape and Bank Robbery. It is super fun and a great way to bond with your friends and family.  Groups of 4 or more would be ideal. It's also great to disconnect from the world for the hour and focus on the game. The key to success for this is communication. Everyone needs to work together! Highly highly recommend. So much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: Amazing experience!!!!! We did the bank robbery and managed to get it done with only 1 minute and 21 seconds to spare. I would definitely recommend this place. So much fun and our guide was amazing! Teamwork is key!!! Can't wait to go back and try the other rooms!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: Our firm did this as a team building opportunity. It was an amazing and fun thing to do. It was challenging but not over the top. I would recommend this for couples and families alike no with employers doing this for team building for employees. It's great for all ages! The staff was as amazing as the game! I would do it again in a heartbeat. Need one on the other coast of Florida!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: Had such a great time! Our Game supervisor, Lucas, was super nice and helpful! We chose the bank robery and finished it in 48min! Not too bad for a first time! :) Can't wait to try another room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Neutrino 42" by Boss-Play Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "C'thulhu Awakens" by Sly Fox Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: Everything about these guys is amazing! Awesome staff and seriously amazing rooms! We were the first two beat Cthulhu and have been begging for it to open for months and let me be the first to say, it was well worth the wait!

room_title: Escape room "C'thulhu Awakens" by Sly Fox Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: We did 'Cthulhu Awakens' with three adults. We were very impressed with our first escape room experience! The puzzles were varied and played to different strengths, the room and prop design were excellent, and the story well told! We will certainly be back!

room_title: Escape room "Skull and Scepter" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: First Time at an Escape Room and we had a wonderful time. We did the Skull And Scepter room on expert mode. Very challenging but so much fun. We will be back for sure.

room_title: Escape room "Skull and Scepter" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: There was four of us that did the Skull and Scepter room and had a great time! Larry was an awesome Game Master!! He made sure our hints where not to obvious but helpful and really made it a great experience since two of us have never done an Escape Room before. We had one Vet, a second timer and two newbies and we escaped with 2mins left out of an hour and had a blast the whole time. We WILL be back for more!

room_title: Escape room "Skull and Scepter" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: I did the Skull and Scepter Escape Room and it was a lot of fun. Larry was our Game master and he was awsome. Way more attentive than most Game masters. Also he never directly gave us an answer to a clue, he just guided us to our conclusion. All in all I'd rate this one more than 5 stars and I will definitely be back for Vipers Nest.

room_title: Escape room "Rob The Bookie" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Very fun experience. Our guides were also entertaining and helpful. We did the mad tea party room and the bookie room. Both were equally challenging and I would love to try new rooms in the future!

room_title: Escape room "Rob The Bookie" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This was our first time doing an escape room and it was awesome. The girl working was very helpful and friendly. We did the Rob The Bookie Room and got out with almost 9 minutes left. We will definitely be back to do it again. Thanks for a great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Rob The Bookie" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This was the most fun I've had in a long time. The puzzles were very engaging. Can't wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Big Escape Rooms in Washington, D.C.
review: Just escaped “Outbreak!” So much fun and an amazing experience overall!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Big Escape Rooms in Washington, D.C.
review: This is our first time we failed. But that shows how difficult the 9% success challenge is. Great job!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Big Escape Rooms in Washington, D.C.
review: I came with a big group of friends to do Outbreak! It was so much fun and the people working here were so nice and helpful! The team building was fun and it was a great way to exercise my brain. We escaped!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Big Escape Rooms in Washington, D.C.
review: So much fun! The outbreak room was really challenging but we had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Big Escape Rooms in Washington, D.C.
review: We had such a great time in the Outbreak room! The clues were very helpful and we escaped with ten minutes to go. Would definitely return!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Senator Payne" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Addicted!Jerred and Tommy are great hosts!Mystery of Senator Payne is my personal favorite at this location, though I also highly recommend Casino Heist as well!This is a great location for an escape room. We finished the Casino heist and had to come back the next week and take on the Senator Payne room.Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Senator Payne" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Always the best!! Had so much fun doing the Mystery of Senator Payne  not as easy as you think but we were able to escape!!! TOMMY our game master is super awesome!! Super cool!! Thanks so much man you made our escaping more exciting!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Senator Payne" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Amazing! My friends and I tried this out as our first escape room and we had a blast.Service was great! Even though I had booked for 6 people, one person didn't show up but it wasn't a problem. Angelique was a funny, friendly, and overall fantastic game master. She helped make the experience as good as it was.The actual escape room itself (we tried "The Mystery of Senator Payne") was so so so much fun. We worked as a team and really got into the game. Finished with only 8 minutes to spare!We'll definitely be back to try out "Casino Heist"!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Senator Payne" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Mak was an amazing game host! She did a great job at engaging with us during our experience and was very helpful whenever we needed a clue or hint.My group tried the Senator Payne room and it was such a great experience. Very fun and a decent challenge as well! Highly recommend that room! My group did 7 people, but I highly suggest trying to keep the group at 5 people or less. Anything more it gets kinda messy and there's too many people trying to figure out the clues, which causes delay.Can't wait to go back and try another room! Great thing to do with a group of friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Senator Payne" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Such a fun Escape room!! One of the best ones I've ever done. I did the Senator Payne one and the set was really perfect and detailed. All the puzzles were very different, some were more complicated and some were deceptively simple, but it kept the pace and suspense building and building and building.

room_title: Escape room "The Awakening" by Time to Escape in Okeechobee
review: Extremely well thought out and constructed . I would highly recommend it. We live in the UK and were in Okeechobee for a few days- so pleased we managed to find an amazing Escape Room  .The clues were imaginative and the set well constructed reflecting the theme.

room_title: Escape room "The Awakening" by Time to Escape in Okeechobee
review: Thank you so much for helping to make my wedding shower an amazing day. My group of 8 with all ages was challenged and engaged the entire time. We LOVED The Madness! We also loved the amazing staff who provided extras knowing it was a special day for us. You are all amazing and we will definitely be back to try all the rooms! Thank you again for a fun filled awesome time!

room_title: Escape room "The Awakening" by Time to Escape in Okeechobee
review: The staff is friendly and courteous. The place is well ran and so much fun. Solving puzzles while racing the clock is a blast. Go with friends and have a good time, but be prepared to think. These aren't easy and you'll have to work together to solve the mysteries. The clues are challenging, but manageable with some deduction. The rooms are set up to make you feel like you are in the story and are the detectives. I highly recommend this place. Where else can you go for this much fun at this low of a price? You won't regret it.

room_title: Escape room "Thwarted" by Exit Strategies in Redding
review: We almost made it out in Thwarted Escape room, so much fun. I got to see how smart my family really was. If you want an hour of extreme fun than get to Oasis Fun Center and try one of their escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Thwarted" by Exit Strategies in Redding
review: We did the Thwarted escape room here at Oasis Fun Center. We had a family team of four. We solved it, but barely. It was very well done! Not an easy solve. Lots of challenges and a few cool surprises. I highly recommend it. We have done rooms in Boise and Reno. This was my favorite!

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: So my friend, her father, and I decided that we wanted to go on a fun escape room on a Friday night right? The service and general idea of the room was supposed to be "not scary" and we supposedly played a kids version. Late into the game, we got stuck. We asked for a clue and the guide gave us false information and then said "my bad" at the end when we couldn't escape. If that wasn't enough, my friend was horrified even though it wasn't supposed to be scary at all. There were mangled dolls draped across the ceiling and eerie sound played in the background. You had to undress a Barbie to find one of the clues, which I personally find extremely disturbing. It was said that we played the kids version, however, many elements of it seemed more mature. We were really bummed at the end since we weren't offered a refund for the mistake that was made. They acted like the issue wasn't a big deal, but the "customer is always right". Please note before exposing this to your kids.

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Just recently I get lucky because I stumbled upon this place by accident when I was reading an article “15 Best Places to Meet Singles in Los Angeles” – https://www.flirt.com/ and this place was among those 15. Out of sheer curiosity, I decided to make a visit and I was hooked right away. Since then it's my favourite escape room in Los Angeles, where we always have a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: This game is really fun and unique. I've done many escape games and this one had creative and unique puzzles I hadn't seen in the 30+ previous games I've played. It feels like a game, but there is still the pressure to beat the clock. I love the set up prior to entering the game. The staff is great and so is the experience. Definitely check this out if you want to have a fun time.

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Great experience with this escape rooms. No doubt one of the op escape rooms. So many clever puzzles integrating incredibly well with the technology. The hosts were incredibly warm and friendly. Any fan of escape rooms must visit this room.

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: We did another escape room two hours before...and needed more. Our group of 4 showed up with no expectations and were pleasantly surprised. The puzzles are very well put together and required a thinking. Our group likes to power through things when we get stuck, but the hosts know when is the right time to offer advice! They are opening up two other rooms in the same location...I will be going asap once they are available!

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Recently a group of friends and I gave Escapedom escape rooms in Westwood a try. We didn't know exactly what to expect but ended up thoroughly enjoying it. I'd recommend it to groups of friends/colleagues who want to do something fun for a solid hour with no distractions except the mysteries you're trying to solve. The hosts were fun and entertaining and even spent time with us after to get our feedback.

room_title: Escape room "Cold War Crisis" by American Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: My friends surprised me with an escape room for my birthday and this place was a great choice for this. Because they mentioned that it was my birthday, the game master included an extra clue in our room as a birthday present to me. We did the Cold War Crisis. Fantastic room and with great clues. It definitely tested us well. We got out with about four minutes to spare and at times we were definitely concerned that we weren't going to make it out. The timer that they have in the room also includes a counter at the bottom that helps you track how many clues you get and the standard amount of clues that you get is 5. This room was rated 5/5 for difficulty which I think is aptly earned. Our game master Alexa was great. Super friendly and helpful before and after the room. Overall, great experience and I would definitely go back again.

room_title: Escape room "Cold War Crisis" by American Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: We did the Cold War Crisis for my son's 16th birthday. So much fun! We are definitely coming here again.

room_title: Escape room "Cold War Crisis" by American Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Great time. Great game master, Amanda. Too bad we failed to defuse the bomb and destroyed the US. I guess we were not the men for the job but we’ll try again!

room_title: Escape room "Captive Chamber" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! Our host was amazing! We did the Captive Chamber and it wasn't super creepy. We will definitely go back to check out their next location.

room_title: Escape room "Captive Chamber" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: This was only my second attempt at an escape room, and I loved it! We escaped from the Chamber and it's definitely a great beginners intro to escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Captive Chamber" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: I had such a good time!!! So much fun!! The team did such a good job!! Can't wait to do it again

room_title: Escape room "Warehouse 13" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Creature of the Year" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Went last night for my nephew's birthday, and we had a blast! Loved the theme and creative puzzles. We will definitely be back to try the new room when it's ready. Thanks!

room_title: Escape room "Creature of the Year" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: I had a blast doing to Creature of the Year escape room with my family for my birthday. The room is a lot of fun and has some really cool surprises. The room had just the right level of difficulty. I will definitely be returning!

room_title: Escape room "Creature of the Year" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This was one of the better escape rooms we've done. They asked us how difficult we liked it, and customized the room to fit our group of 9 people (mostly kids). We asked for a difficult room, and we definitely got one! We were able to escape with only 5 minutes to spare, which is far more enjoyable than escaping too early. The ambiance was great, and there was a good mix of puzzle types. We will be back when the Shawshank room opens!

room_title: Escape room "Creature of the Year" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Cluemaster was a FABULOUS escape room! Michael was so thorough explaining the locks, how to get "hints" and story behind the room. Although this was my first experience in an escape room, I was with others who had done several. We all agreed that this was the best escape room ever! I plan to return and would highly recommend Cluemaster Escape Rooms to anyone looking for a great, entertaining way to spend an evening.. Thanks Michael!

room_title: Escape room "Creature of the Year" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Went as a family for my husband's birthday and had a great time! It was the first escape room any of us had done, and I will admit some of us were a little skeptical about it going in. But we all got really into it and had a blast! We're looking forward to going back when the next room opens. Thanks for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Simon's Room II" by Escape Room PSL in Port St. Lucie
review: I brought my wife and teenage sons to complete Simon's Room and we all had a great time!  The room was very immersive and our host was amazing!  Definitely a fun time, would recommend to both puzzle enthusiasts and/or people looking to escape reality for an hour.

room_title: Escape room "Simon's Room II" by Escape Room PSL in Port St. Lucie
review: Awesome!  Tons of fun.  I did all three rooms (finished two) and had a blast.  Simon's room was my favorite... mostly because the interaction with the clue giver enhanced the experience instead of detracting from my Escape time -which is my pet peeve for this form of entertainment.

room_title: Escape room "Simon's Room II" by Escape Room PSL in Port St. Lucie
review: We had a great time. We did Simons room 2, really really well done. That staff and narrator was fantastic. 100% recommend. We finished it in 42:00

room_title: Escape room "Wrongfully Accused" by DeadLocked Escape Rooms in Stamford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy" by MindTrap Escape Room in Temecula
review: My group completed the Conspiracy room and we all had such a great time! This is the third escape room that I have done and it was by far the best. The owners were super friendly and welcoming. I would highly recommend going! Can't wait to go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy" by MindTrap Escape Room in Temecula
review: Absolutely loved this! My first time doing an escape room. Our group had such a blast doing the Conspiracy room. Definitely looking forward to go back and doing the Gold Rush room. The owners were very friendly. I would highly recommend this to friends and family.

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy" by MindTrap Escape Room in Temecula
review: Did the Conspiracy room tonight with a group of 4. It was sooo fun! Staff were super friendly and helpful. We had such a great time and would say this is one of the highest quality escape rooms we’ve been too! Can’t wait to try out their gold rush!

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy" by MindTrap Escape Room in Temecula
review: I played the Conspiracy room. It was so much! Great detail and high-quality puzzles! I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy" by MindTrap Escape Room in Temecula
review: Such a great escape room! I took my employees here for a team building game and we had a blast! Both The Conspiracy Theory room and the Gold Rush room have great aesthetics, great story and great puzzles! I would definitely recommend them!

room_title: Escape room "Black Beard's Brig" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Had my son's birthday party here and they were very accommodating to everyone in the group. They completed the pirate room and had a great time.We can't wait to go back with friends.

room_title: Escape room "Black Beard's Brig" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: My first escape room was the Pirate room and it absolutely got me hooked. Even as a new player, I was able to contribute and we successfully escaped the room. When I had gained more experience, we came back for the cabin room and it was a blast. The decor and immersive story really enhance the experience overall and it is my favorite room so far.

room_title: Escape room "Black Beard's Brig" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: My co-workers and I had a great time at Auburn Escape Zones! The rooms were challenging, yet still fun for both beginners and puzzle experts. This is a great way to spend an hour or two with a group in Auburn. The staff was very friendly and I can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Black Beard's Brig" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: This was such a fun surprise for my husband's 30th birthday! We enjoyed the pirate room, and it was perfect for people with a variety of puzzle experience! Will definitely be coming back!!!

room_title: Escape room "Black Beard's Brig" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Went with a work group for a team building event. Our group of 8 escaped the Blackbeard room! It seems like the ideal number of people is 5-6 - 8 was a bit chaotic and crowded, but we all had a great time and everyone contributed to the escape. The staff was terrific, very friendly and encouraging. I will definitely go back! Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Brainwashed" by UFO VIDEO in Gainesville
review: If you love movies then this game is for you! My family and I had a great time. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Puzzah at Flatirons is AWFUL.  Puzzles aren’t reset, it is a mall atmosphere and the puzzles themselves are HORRIBLE. The Curse room is the single worst room of over 40 I have done

room_title: Escape room "The Curse" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: I have done rooms at both the Downtown and Broomfield locations, and wow, these guys bring something very special to the escape room business! The rooms are automated like nothing I've ever seen! It's a great experience start to finish, the staff is delightful as well. I will definitely be back for more!!

room_title: Escape room "Jumanji" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did this room with a group of 6 adults, cleared all three portions of this in 45 minutes.  Very immersive with good detail.  The puzzles are all excellently thematic and genuinely fun to solve.  My only issue with this room is when you are assigned character roles there is no way to reference what your "specialties" are.  If we had a prop of some kind that we could have referenced would have made things quite a bit smoother... maybe that's the point?

room_title: Escape room "Jumanji" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Rooms are fun, challenging and very immersive. Fun for the family!

room_title: Escape room "Jumanji" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Best escape room HANDS DOWN!! The puzzles were very creative--you won't find locks and combinations here! The game masters really know what they're doing, and it shows because they have a total of 16 rooms! Because my experience here was so amazing, I'm definitely going to try the rest of their rooms! Rose was an amazing host and game master, and she was very kind and helpful. PS their ice cream is delicious!

room_title: Escape room "Jumanji" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My kids (ages 9,11 and 21) and I have done three 60Out escape rooms: Jumanji, Alice in Wonderland, and Fire & Ice. Jumanji is one of our two favorite escape rooms in LA, and Fire & Ice is our third favorite. These are high-quality escape rooms with strong production design and story. They are high-tech escape rooms with lots of magnetic-opens and pretty much no combination or key locks. If you like escape rooms that require you to find combination and keys to open locks, these are not your rooms. But if you like "OH! THAT'S COOL!" moments in your escape rooms, 60Out rooms are for you. All of the rooms we did were impressive and amazing, but HANDS DOWN, the Jumanji room will blow your mind with its production value, set design, script, and puzzles. Unlike linear puzzle rooms, several different puzzles can be done simultaneously in this room, which makes it fun for groups. We look forward to doing more 60Out rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Soul" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: Our group has done a few escape rooms before. We did The Lost Soul room and it was pretty fantastic - very immersive, which is what we want from an escape room. The decor was spot on, down to the scent of the rooms. It wasn’t the hardest escape room we’ve encountered, but it definitely wasn’t easy by any means. We are looking forward to trying our hand at the We’re All Mad Here room fairly soon. Highly recommend Escaped in Time!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Soul" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: So much fun, challenging and really makes you think. Didn't make it out lol. The pirate theme was cool and I'm definitely excited to try the others! Thank you so much!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Soul" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: If you are into escape rooms, this is a must try. We have done a number of escape rooms in Colorado and South Dakota, and this has been our favorite thus far. The staff is especially friendly and fun. The puzzles were well thought out and challenging. We escaped from the Lost Souls room which was very well put together and created an authentic experience.This is a well-run establishment that is guaranteed to provide a fun time for anyone who visits. We are definitely going back to try to escape from the other rooms that are offered.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Soul" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: Friendly staff and lots of fun! We did the pirate theme and were so close to figuring out the last clue. But the staff came in after our time was up and didn’t make us leave right away. They helped us through the last clue to figure out how to escape. It was a great experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Soul" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: We were in the Lost Souls room. Had a blast solving the puzzles and finding the clues. Recommending this to families with kids over 14.

room_title: Escape room "Monkey Business" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: My family and I came to play on a Monday afternoon and had a blast. I recommend it to anybody.

room_title: Escape room "Monkey Business" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Great family night for our young teens! Keeps everyone engaged!

room_title: Escape room "Monkey Business" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: My 10 year old son and his friends did the Monkey Business room and had a blast!! They had so much fun that after they finished they wanted to do another one!!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Pirate Escape" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: We did the Great Pirate Escape in Temecula. It was a unique and interesting experience. I've never done anything like it before. I definitely think it's a fun group activity and would recommend going with at least 6 people total. It would be perfect for throwing your husband or boyfriend a birthday evening out. The location is great! It's right across the street from Ballast Point. Perfect for grabbing a drink after. The Great Pirate Escape was a neat theme, I don't want to give too much away. I can't wait to try out the Jungle theme.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Pirate Escape" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: Just go check it out. We had a great time as a family!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Pirate Escape" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: We had an amazing time!!! Can't wait to come back again!!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Pirate Escape" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: Super fun outings with the family solving puzzles to get out of the room! Can't wait to come back and try their other themes!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Pirate Escape" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: Great great great fun experience! Highly recommend with 4 to 5 people! Lots of thinking and teamwork! Felt great to escape and beat the clock

room_title: Escape room "The Great Pirate Escape" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: My husband and I had a blast! We were paired up with a total of 4 other couples. Our group all worked together well. The obstacle was well thought out. We would highly recommend it to anyone looking for something fun and adventurous to do!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Pirate Escape" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: The most exhilarating, rewarding, satisfying experience. As my first conquered escape room, I have to say this was the best first experience and would definitely recommend it to anyone. It may be a little pricey, but it's so worth it. It was just me and my boyfriend and it was just absolutely perfect. Must go go go!!

room_title: Escape room "The President's Bunker" by The Great Escape Room in Miami
review: So fun! We did the president's bunker.  Bring a few people who are good at putting clues together! Great and helpful staff!

room_title: Escape room "The President's Bunker" by The Great Escape Room in Miami
review: An exciting and great way to spend time with friends and family or colleagues. This clues can be tricky and you really got to think. The staff are excellent and can be helpful. It's a wonderful creation. :-) Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "The President's Bunker" by The Great Escape Room in Miami
review: My group of 4 escaped the President's Bunker in 41 minutes! It was a lot of fun, great puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Oceanside Casino" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: Today we did the Oceanside Casino. Our game master William was very helpful and always pointed/redirected us in the right direction. We made it out with a second to spare (literally - may have been less than that). It was probably one of the best rooms I did at Breakout Waikiki. Can't wait to go back to finish up my last two rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Oceanside Casino" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: First time and we went to the Oceanside Casino! Super fun and definitely need more than 4 people who can make things run.

room_title: Escape room "Oceanside Casino" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: I have done a few escape rooms and Breakout Waikiki is by far the best, well put together escape room. Me and my family did the Oceanside Casino room (unfortunately, we did not escape). The staff is very friendly and try to help you out as much as possible. The clues and game itself were nicely challenging. I loved the layout of the room and the detail.If you love solving puzzles you won't be disappointed.

room_title: Escape room "Oceanside Casino" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: Decided to tackle Oceanside Casino last night. So much fun and the room was awesome! STEVE is the best,  hands down! He is energetic, funny, helpful, and wants to see every group succeed. He's been our room runner for all of the rooms we've done and each time only gets better because of him.

room_title: Escape room "Oceanside Casino" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: We had a blast in the Oceanside Casino! Was our first time ever doing an escape room and we thoroughly enjoyed it! A great time with family and friends!! I would highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Clue Me In!" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Honest to goodness this was so fun! We did the Clue one as a family and it was perfect! Just tough enough to make us think, but we were still able to solve it! (We are a detective type family though). I would seriously recommend this place to anyone!!! It's perfect for all occasions. Thank you so much NWA Escape Rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Clue Me In!" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Lots of fun, and just challenging enough to make you work for it! But not so hard that it's frustrating. Staff was great. We did the Clue room and loved it. The room was made for 8 people, but just 4 in our group were getting in each others way, so I'm glad it was just us. Would have been a little claustrophobic with 8! Will definitely be going back.

room_title: Escape room "Clue Me In!" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: The person who helped us set up was awesome! He picked the characters for us and from what we heard from our other group members, pinned all of our personalities down! We had a great time and will definitely be back for more adventures!

room_title: Escape room "Clue Me In!" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Fun!!!!! Put your thinking caps on and challenge your detective skills. Great time for everyone. We are coming back. Great staff and they make sure you have a great time. Great for family time or any group. We completed our challenge and escaped. If you are looking for a great unique party or time give them a call.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak!" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Fun time! We did the Outbreak Room with our kids 7, 11, 13, 15. It was a little difficult for us, but we had a great time! We will be back someday! The staff was nice and the room was really cool!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak!" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We just celebrated our son's 11th birthday with a group of his friends in the "Outbreak" room! They had fun, and it was very tricky. We got some helpful clues but did not make it out in time! The building is nicely decorated and very cool on a hot summer day! Staff was great too. We would go back and recommend to others.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak!" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: A great night out! Well done. Can't wait to try another one.

room_title: Escape room "The Exhibit" by Daytona Escape Room Experience in Daytona Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Try-Wizard Tournament" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Did the Wizarding Room - very well thought, although you should bring someone who loves traditional newspaper puzzles. Will definitely go back with more friends.

room_title: Escape room "Try-Wizard Tournament" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! Awesome staff! We did the Wizard escape & made it out with 5 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Try-Wizard Tournament" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Square Room Escapes is a decent escape room (nothing crazy elaborate set wise) but they have some fun puzzles.  We did the "wizard" room a couple years back and it was quite enjoyable.  We managed to escape with a few seconds to spare.  Nice time, very professional, and I was happy that it was a private room.

room_title: Escape room "The Shady Tavern" by Think Escape Games in Miami
review: I recently went to Think Escape and played both the Study and Shady Tavern rooms while on vacation in Ft. Lauderdale with a couple of friends. I've played around a dozen Escape Rooms in total and I would definitely recommend these rooms for those who like to test their wits and perception skills!Both rooms were very themstic which helped with immersion. I also appreciated the mechanical, dexterity-based puzzles in both rooms (especially Shady Tavern) which I haven't really seen in other rooms before. I'm also a sucker for hidden doors and extravagant locking mechanisms, and I was not disappointed here.Overall I would definitely recommend Think Escape to anyone passing through the area, especially those looking for something fun to do with friends or those who have previously enjoyed an escape attempt!

room_title: Escape room "The Shady Tavern" by Think Escape Games in Miami
review: I am so glad I gave this place a try. It was so much fun and exciting can't wait to go back and try the new rooms when they open! Must try!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Shady Tavern" by Think Escape Games in Miami
review: This was our first time doing an escape room and it was awesome. This is a thinking game and it's really cool to see how everything comes together. We tried everything we thought of, often times laughing at our ideas, but we figured it out and cant wait to go back for the other room.

room_title: Escape room "Wizards and Spells" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Escape rooms are fun teambuilding or date activity, and EscapeGameSD does a fantastic job engaging the participants and the rooms are very fun, especially the wizards challenge. Headmaster Paolo did an amazing job creating the room.

room_title: Escape room "Wizards and Spells" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: My friend and I did the Wizard room for our birthdays (our first escape room ever). We were both thoroughly impressed and captivated by the fun and intrigue that was had. Will definitely be back for more!

room_title: Escape room "Wizards and Spells" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Brought my son and his friends for his 15th birthday party today to the wizards & spells room. They loved it and had a great time. They really had to work together to get through the puzzles and they did it with 11 minutes to spare! Fun props and very Harry Potter like. Highly recommend for all ages.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets in Suburbia" by Breach Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Located in an anonymous industrial park off Lambert Street near Lake Forest Drive, The Scene Escape Rooms is a little hard to find but definitely worth the effort. If you’ve never experienced an escape room, the way it works is that your group (in our case, a family of five) is locked in a room and is given 60 minutes to find the way out by solving different puzzles and finding related clues that eventually lead to the key that will open the door to freedom and victory.The reception area is attractive, and the staff is friendly and helpful. We tackled the “Secrets in Suburbia” room, a murder mystery set in a suburban neighborhood circa 1962. The room was well-designed and nicely themed, and the puzzles were detailed and logical. NOTE that there is some math involved in one puzzle, so it may be helpful to bring a calculator – fortunately, my son is an engineer and easily handled the math problems.This was my fourth experience with an escape room, and “Secrets in Suburbia” was probably the room I’ve enjoyed the most so far. I would certainly recommend The Scene!

room_title: Escape room "Secrets in Suburbia" by Breach Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We had a blast! Very challenging and super fun. The room was amazing and the staff were very friendly. Such a great idea. We will definitely do this again. I definitely recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets in Suburbia" by Breach Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My family and I went to The Scene Escape room today for my husbands birthday and we all had such a blast. I was a little worried how we would handle trying to solve the puzzles together but we all did great. The staff is awesome as well. They were very kind and friendly which made our time there even better. If you haven't tried an Escape room before, you have to try The Scene Escape Rooms. I cannot wait for their next room to open.

room_title: Escape room "FBI Mafia Investigation" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: This was my first escape room and I had a blast! Our group did the FBI Mafia room - so fun! The game was exciting yet challenging. Staff was wonderful. Great team building experience. I highly recommend and will definitely be coming back for another room soon!

room_title: Escape room "FBI Mafia Investigation" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: So much fun! We became FBI agents and we achieved our goal. We ESCAPED! So impressed with the intricacy of the game. We went as a small group and bonded even more with each other. I would highly recommend this experience and the staff was so friendly and helpful. Great time.

room_title: Escape room "FBI Mafia Investigation" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We went to Urban Escape as a farewell get together and had the best time!! I play escape games online ALL the time so I thought that this would be a piece of cake, not so much! Lol it helped but the room was much harder!! A great challenge and we will DEFINITELY be back!!

room_title: Escape room "FBI Mafia Investigation" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Had a great time with my family! Game was innovative and challenging. The staff was professional, friendly and sincere in their efforts to make sure we got the most out of our visit. I will definitely be going back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Odditorium Emporium Shopping Spree" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Book of the Dragons" by Clever Fox in Temecula
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Shack" by Escape Enterprise in Daleville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Edison Puzzle Labs" by Edison Puzzle Labs LLC in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! It was set up in my living room and I did it with three of my young adult friends. It was challenging and I enjoyed the theme of it. Not creepy at all, and you felt like you were a part of the time period of Edison. It was cool to see how even though it only happened in one room, there were some awesome surprises along the way. I would definitely recommend this to do for a party or even a staff team-building event day!

room_title: Escape room "Lab Rat" by Hatch Escapes in Los Angeles
review: Lab Rat was a very unique and entertaining escape room. The story and room were very well done. The room is challenging but flows well with one of the most unique layouts I've seen. The staff was great and friendly. We did the room with 8, and I think 6 would have been more ideal but all of us had an equal amount of fun. And that's not to say the room can't be done with a wide range of group sizes. I'm looking forward to the next Hatch Escapes room that's designed.

room_title: Escape room "Lab Rat" by Hatch Escapes in Los Angeles
review: This is not an escape room. This is the Disneyland-of-puzzle-adventures for adults. We have done dozens of escape rooms -- including some really great ones-- and by far, Lab Rats is beyond the best, and creates a whole new category of escape rooms. This is a totally different experience, and it will spoil all other escape room experiences for you. To call it "immersive" is a gross understatement. There are endless surprises and loads of fun gags. We can't wait for your next room, Hatch Escapes!

room_title: Escape room "Lab Rat" by Hatch Escapes in Los Angeles
review: Between my husband and I, we have tried more than 10 escape rooms and Lab Rat was by far the best experience we've had. It is a totally immersive game, the props and puzzles were clever and intuitive. It had our whole group yelling and back and forth - amazing concept and production! Can't wait for their next room!

room_title: Escape room "Egyptian Tomb" by EscapeWorks Denver in Denver
review: Successfully completed the Egyptian Tomb.  The complexity was excellent and the mental challenge was good.  I would gladly attempt another one of their rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Egyptian Tomb" by EscapeWorks Denver in Denver
review: I did Egyptian Tomb with a friend, and we really enjoyed it! It was a bit dark, but that added to the atmosphere. The puzzles were challenging. We managed to make it out with just a few minutes to spare. This is definitely one of the best escape rooms we've done.

room_title: Escape room "Egyptian Tomb" by EscapeWorks Denver in Denver
review: We had a blast! There were three of us and we escaped with 6 minutes to go. We did the Egyptian room. I would highly recommend it! The scenario does tax your problem-solving skills and we needed several hints but I felt a great sense of accomplishment on solving the riddle. We plan to do another one.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: What an amazing experience! This is one of the few activities you can do that makes you not even think about your phone or social media. You are bonding, talking, laughing, and working together with your friends! We did The Kidnapping and it was so much fun! Jake was our game master and he was the best I’ve ever had! You must go try this out!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: Went to the Kidnapping room with a group of friends. I especially appreciated this room because I'm a horror fan and it was like being part of a scary movie (without, like, the actual terrifying abduction and possible murder part, of course).Our guide Emily was awesome and you could tell that she has a theatre background because she was lively and helpful. She also wasn't annoying and patronizing. Would attempt an escape again for sure.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: I was a bit nervous at first (being handcuffed and blindfolded) but that quickly changed as the “game” played out. Great team building and problem-solving adventure. Definitely doing this again!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: There was 5 of us in the Kidnapping room and it was great. Definitely a challenge but not to hard. Highly recommend people going. Great time with family and friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Tallahassee in Tallahassee
