review: None

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: Ryan was our game master and he was very helpful (I was in Operation Casino with my 6 year old). We didn’t make it out but had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: Our first escape room encounter and we are sold! We did the Casino Night and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Lots of different solving techniques involved and engaged everyone in our group. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: Had a great time in the casino room! We had 5 kids and 4 adults and got out in the nick of time! Paco made it so much fun for the kids. Highly suggest for a fun night out with the whole family.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: The guide was very friendly and helpful, and after we were able to get out, he was very excited for us. We did the casino, and the clues were very creative. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: Booked online and ahead of time for Casino Heist for 7 teen boys. The process was easy. The clues in the room were difficult since we did not know much of Casino, but it was fun. Staff was helpful and provided clues when asked. It took all of us working as a team to be able to escape. All the boys were happy and said they wanted to come back.

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: The bank heist room was nice because it involved more props and physical activity than just writing down numbers and opening locks. The decorations were also great. Way too small for 12 people though, and a bit hot inside the room.

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Meets the excellent standard of a great escape room. We did the Western Bank Heist with a group of 8. Apparently their hardest room! We had a good flow going, but for anyone you needs it you can get hints - of course their eyes and ears are on you the entire hour. Really cool system - one of the mirrors actually doubled as a TV for typed hints. With a little boost on the most embarrassing ones to miss, we were able to get out with less than five minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: We had our own group of 12 and chose the Bank Heist room. It was a blast!!! We all had so much fun that we can't wait to book another adventure here. I highly recommend it for something fun and different to do.

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: So fun, we did the Western Bank Heist room and it was a blast. Excited to try the other rooms too. For sure recommend this as a fun date night with friends or other couples!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Huntsville in Huntsville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: Best escape room in Tucson!After we finished the Zombie room, we immediately reserved the Bank room. The difficulty was just right and it did not require too much math to solve. We had so much fun there and we will definitely come back !

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: My pals and I had a great time at FITB. We went twice in out weeklong trip, completing both rooms. Personally we thought the bank was more fun, but the Zombie room was great too. The two owners are extremely nice, and created a creative atmosphere that we were all mesmerized by. Props to you Mr. Fox.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: Such a fun experience to do with friends!!! We had an amazing time and got to the diamonds with about 3 minutes to go! Highly recommending and looking forward to going back!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: My boyfriend and I came out for a date night and it was so much fun! The owners are a lovely couple that are passionate about what they have created. Would highly recommend this for a date night or fun night out with friends!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: What fantastic game rooms they have! We really enjoyed doing both rooms this weekend. What we especially like about them is that they were 100% different and had a great variation of puzzles and clues. These were out 20th and 21st escape rooms and we will recommend it to everyone we know!

room_title: Escape room "Servants of Sleight" by The Exit Games FL in Tampa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Chocolate Factory" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: My husband and I recently did Escape Room 101's newest room-The Chocolate Factory. This was our first game since doing 3 lackluster rooms in Socal. We were not disappointed. Lots of puzzles and games to stimulate the "little grey cells". Our gamemaster was Sean who, as always, was a great clue giver. He made our visit fun and worthwhile. (Thx, Sean!) The room was family friendly, bright, colorful and fun. After the experience, we signed up to do the VR escape room for my husband's birthday next month. We can't wait! We highly recommend this business as "must-do" to locals and travelers alike.

room_title: Escape room "When Worlds Collide" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: I have now completed all the rooms they have at 3rd Day (for now!!) and I have to say that I love the new rooms. The asymmetrical racing room When Worlds Collide is such a fun competition. Be sure to get enough people to split into two groups because the racing component is incredibly enticing. But make sure to double book so the teams can switch rooms and do it again! I seriously loved both "worlds" so much that I would have been disappointed had we not done both in one day. Cool theming. Clever puzzles. Fun competition. The owner and all the staff are incredibly kind and welcoming.

room_title: Escape room "When Worlds Collide" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: 4.5 starsWe had a smaller group this time (4) compared to to our usual escape group but that wasn't going to stop us! The fates of two realms hung in the balance! We also happened to have two 13 year olds with us and one of them had no experience in escape rooms so we wanted a place that would be a good introduction. I was intrigued by the asymmetrical set up of the When Worlds Collide room. So much that it overcame my worries that it would be too much for an inexperienced player and such a small group. Without giving anything away, this particular game is set up so that two groups can play against each other! One in the "Fantasy realm" and one in "Reality". Its essentially the same story, and the groups don't really interact with each other except for the fact that only one realm can be triumphant. Other escape rooms I've played with two separate groups I'd consider a parallel setup because both groups play two copies of the same room, and whichever group finishes first wins. Here, whoever finishes first wins but the two rooms are completely different so if you are so inclined, you can come back and play the other side so try to avoid spoilers after your post game sharing! All this makes When World's collide a great option for a large group. Up to twelve people can play (6 in each realm). Or even as small a group as ours with some experienced players (2 in each realm). Or take your normal group and play each side on different occasions, that's an option as well! Thanks to our game master Chris for explaining and giving us our clues. We had a great time! The only thing that we noticed is that the temp could get a bit hot in the rooms so dress appropriately! I found that we were concentrating on our mission so intently that it wasn't all that of an inconvenience but I'm sure some would like to know.

room_title: Escape room "When Worlds Collide" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: I was in a group of 6 who did the When Worlds Collide room. We split into two groups of 3 and competed against each other - one group in fantasy and one in reality. We had so much fun that we went back the next night to compete again, with the teams switching rooms. I did the reality room the first night, which I thought was a bit more challenging than the fantasy room. We were on the last puzzle when the time ran out. The group in the fantasy room still had several puzzles left to get through. The 2nd night I did the reality room and we made it out with 12 minutes to spare. We had such a great time in both rooms, and the girls who worked there were fantastic. I don't want to say too much and give anything away, but if you have a large group I highly recommend checking out When Worlds Collide!

room_title: Escape room "The Interview" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: We went with a group of six people to celebrate my birthday and did the Interview. The puzzle was well designed and we had a great time solving it. I liked that we got to take home our magnet ID badge from the escape room. I can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Interview" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: Our whole family worked together on The Interview. Great fun, and so exciting each time you solve a puzzle!

room_title: Escape room "The Interview" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: The first tale in the Dr. X Story, the interview, had enough puzzles and room for 4 to 6 people to have something for everyone. There was a good blend of easy to hard puzzles and if you get stuck staff can provide a clue or hint to help you. If you are looking for something new to do with friends or looking for something to build team work then check out Puzzle Theory. I have done quite a few escape rooms and this one was the best.

room_title: Escape room "The Interview" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: We decided to do an escape room at the request of my stepson. He had seen one done on a TV show and liked the idea. So we dragged my sister and brother-in-law along with us and completed "The Interview". We had an absolute blast and were so excited to solve the puzzle with 28 seconds left. We will definitely return to complete the other rooms. A great activity for when the weather isn't the greatest.

room_title: Escape room "The Interview" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: My Boyfriend and I went with another couple and we had such an amazing time! We completed "The Interview" with just about a minute to spare and only used 2 clues! I cannot wait to go back to try the second room in the Dr.X series! It's a great way to really put your heads together and I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a night out away from the norm! Team "Meow" for the win!

room_title: Escape room "The Curiosity Shop" by Wizards & Wires Studios in Redlands
review: This is an incredible escape room. A bit creepy with great ambiance. A room full of antiques and mysterious artifacts. Some have meanings and others are for show. No hints or clues here. Just a great hour of enjoyment and surprises!

room_title: Escape room "The Curiosity Shop" by Wizards & Wires Studios in Redlands
review: Just got done with this escape room. It was an awesome experience and highly recommend it. None of us have been before and had a blast. This was our first time and we are excited to do more!

room_title: Escape room "The Curiosity Shop" by Wizards & Wires Studios in Redlands
review: Soooo amazing!!! We had the best time and cant wait to come back! Well worth the money and not far!! Totally creeped us out and was just hard enough to make it amazing!!!! THANK YOU!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Curiosity Shop" by Wizards & Wires Studios in Redlands
review: This place is PHENOMENAL! Our group of 4 had a blast! It was our first time doing an escape room, and we are now hooked. Very interactive and a lot of clues to look for. We finished with just under 8 minutes to spare. Staff was awesome and friendly. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Hartford
review: There are only positive things that can be said about this place! The clues were challenging but not overwhelming to the point where we wanted to give up. The staff are excited about each room and how they get to contribute to the overall experience of our group. The owner was very friendly and answered all of our questions. This is a great place for a team building exercise or even as a date night. Fantastic experience overall!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Hartford
review: This was amazing! Loved Escape the Hydeout. The setting is just awesome - a perfect blend of eerie and historical. The puzzles here were unique and hard but not impossible. It was so much fun and we are ready for whatever they do next!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Hartford
review: Absolutely awesome! Creepy setting but not scary, great period environment, and incredibly complex but fun puzzles. So excited to have this site in our area!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Hartford
review: This place is fantastic! Our game host was so helpful and just as excited for us as we were to play the game! The room is challenging but has a ton of exciting features. It's a must if you are in the area!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Hartford
review: Escape the Hideout was a great game! We loved Escape the Nemesis at their NYC location and were so excited to try this one. Worth it! Can't wait for their next rooms!

room_title: Escape room "We're All Mad Here" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: We had a lot of fun. We did the pirate themed one last night and the "We're All Mad" today. Both were up there in difficulty, which is great for those who do escape rooms regularly and need a challenge. We're definitely going to come back to do the last room.

room_title: Escape room "We're All Mad Here" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: This was our first escape room and we specifically chose to do this room due to our love and enjoyment of Alice in Wonderland. Loved all the great details of the room. We definitely felt like we'd been transported to Wonderland.

room_title: Escape room "We're All Mad Here" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: This was an awesome experience! I love challenges that require cognitive function and problem-solving. The whole family seemed to have a great time even though we didn't quite make it out in time but we came extremely close! We chose the "Everyone's Mad Here" challenge room and it was nothing short of entertaining. Thank you Escaped in Time for the experience and we will definitely be back before heading home from our vaction!

room_title: Escape room "We're All Mad Here" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: We had such a great time! This was my husband and my sixth escape room. This room didn't disappoint. Every escape room we go to offers new puzzles we've never seen before. If you've done an escape room or if you haven't, you will totally enjoy this room. The details are amazing, and hand painted by one of the owners. Give her props when you go because I don't even know how she did it. We did the Mad room, middle of the road on difficulty and there were certainly times where we were just dumbfounded, until we got that clue.

room_title: Escape room "We're All Mad Here" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: My husband and I came with a bigger group of our friends the first time and did "We're All Mad Here" and enjoyed it so much we booked our next room just two days later! The rooms are well thought out and challenging, yet very fun and exciting! We are self proclaimed "escape room junkies" and would highly recommend Escaped In Time! �

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Escapism LLC in Southington
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Dame Disappears" by Great Scott Mystery Rooms in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum II" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: The Insane Asylum is their hardest room - we were told that only 1 group in 9 makes it out. With a few last-minute hints from our very helpful host through the provided walkie-talkie, we were able to escape! The room was pretty creepy, as you'd expect a good insane asylum themed room to be. We love PanIQ and will be coming back sometime to attempt their third room!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum II" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: The "Insane Asylum" room is extremely difficult but it was still a lot of fun. The ambiance in there is actually pretty scary with a track playing screams the whole time. But it was still a lot of fun and honestly, we would go back to try and escape the "Insane Asylum" again.

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum II" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: Great time had even though we did not make it out of Insane Asylum!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum II" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: I took my kids there (who think they know everything) went into the Insane Asylum II and wow I was impressed. This room keeps you thinking and definitely makes you have to work together as a team! Recommend it to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum II" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: My husband and I had to escape from the asylum. We had a lot of fun! The staff was great and helpful especially when we needed hints. We plan on coming back to do the prehistoric room very soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Games Room" by Code Stat Escape Rooms in Ventura
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: This is a must try if you are on or near south beach! You have so much fun you almost don't want to escape because you want it to keep going, and once you do escape it makes you want to try the other room! Book the room now, you won't regret it!!-Team kiss our 6*Completed Diamond room With 6 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: If you have a brain, or even if you don't and want to develope yours, check this place out! It's an awesome live puzzle where your locked in and the only way to escape is by thinking your way out. Think the Saw movies minus the violence. The puzzles are hard but not impossible. Check these guys out everyone is so friendly, we had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Perfect for a date!!! Really loved working as a team to figure out our escape! So much fun... We're going back asap

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Had an amazing time with our team, can't wait to go back and try out another room All good fun!

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Had a great time today with our cousins/aunts/uncles Papacostas/Berio LeBeau team! Recommended for families with teens/young adults--mature tweens would be OK too. Our team of 10 escaped in 47 minutes!

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Serious mental challenge and lots of fun. I recommend it to anyone who likes puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: My friends and I wanted to do something different in Miami and had heard of Qquest.  We decided to check it out and were very happy that we did. We did the Diamond Heist room and had soo much fun.  We had to put our minds together, work as a team and bounce ideas off each other to make it out on time.  It was great and we plan to go back to check out the panic room.

room_title: Escape room "The Psycho Killer" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: Dress warmly, show up a few minutes early for paperwork, and other than that, communication within your team is key! Cannot wait to go back and try out the new rooms and themes once they are up. A well spent hour

room_title: Escape room "The Psycho Killer" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: What a fun experience!! The people were polite and friendly. The room was a challenge and we didn't escape, but we were close!! The facility was clean and we were treated as guests. Highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "The Psycho Killer" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: So much fun and a pretty big challenge for sure, but that just adds to the fun of it for sure! There's even some surprises too which made it that much more realistic. I definitely want to come back for future renditions and the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "The Psycho Killer" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: My son and I had such a great time that we want to do it again! Made it to working on the last clue...if we only had five more minutes. We intend on coming back when they expand and have a few more game rooms to attempt to break on through. I recommend this to anyone who wants to have a lot of fun! Awesome time Mystery Box!

room_title: Escape room "The Psycho Killer" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: Super fun!! This was my second escape room experience (the other was a different location,) and it was a blast. I enjoyed the added element of the "psycho killer."Though we did not escape (bummer,) we all had a fantastic time. Would do another one again!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Psycho Killer" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: We had a great time! We can't wait to try your other escape rooms when they r ready!

room_title: Escape room "The Psycho Killer" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: Incredible experience for our family of 4! Will definitely sign up for another one!

room_title: Escape room "The Submarine" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: My husband and I did the Submarine themed room and we won! We have done escape rooms in the past and this one was by far the most challenging. No one else booked this room so it was just my husband and I alone. It would have been MUCH easier with a couple more people and because of this I think they had to give us more clues. I also think that some of the puzzles were not logical and without a clue, I have no idea how anyone could have figured out what to do. All in all the rooms are well designed and it’s definitely an immersive experience. We had fun too! I just think some of the puzzles didn’t make a lot of sense.

room_title: Escape room "The Submarine" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: This is our second time to Escape the Room, and won’t be our last! What a fun experience with the kids and stressful at the same time! The submarine is my favorite ... so far!

room_title: Escape room "The Submarine" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: I came to escape the room out of the blue and wasn't disappointed! The first room I did here was the submarine and it was so cool! I loved that the puzzles were hands on locks and littles games throughout the rooms! I loved this place so much that my boyfriend and I came back to do all the rooms with in a week and some of the rooms more than once!! This places is super fun and worth the money we spent here! I highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: We did playground and had a great time. We had ages 3 to 69, with ten of us total and we all enjoyed our experience.

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: I went with a group of 8 people to the “playground” escape game. All the puzzles were really neat and not super obvious. We ended up using a lot more clues than we thought we would. All of us had a good time and I would definitely go again

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: The Escape Game (Playground Room) was so challenging and so fun! It was a blast getting to know our group better and the experience really put our minds to the test. Can’t wait til my next escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: I would definitely recommend this place for groups of ALL ages! My kids are 8 and 11 and we all loved it! Playground was by far the favorite for family! We stayed in Orlando for vacation, and completed all of the rooms here because they're so much fun! Highly suggest you try this! You will not be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: We had a group of 8 that included 2 toddlers. We did the playground and it was so much fun for everyone. I would recommend for families of all ages!

room_title: Escape room "A Fisherman's Tale" by Escape Goat in Orlando
review: So fun! Puzzles are challenging and creative, we’ve done 2 rooms and there are some really unique elements in both. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "A Fisherman's Tale" by Escape Goat in Orlando
review: I cannot say enough great things about this room and this company. They are a family-owned and -run company with a strong theater background, and their love and passion for the Escape Room industry shines through in every room they've created. Their latest room, "Fisherman's Tale", is no exception - it was such a great room with so many different kinds of puzzles and effects. Even over a hundred rooms in, this room still managed to surprise us with puzzle types that we had never before encountered.If you only wanted to visit one company in the Orlando area and play multiple rooms at that one location, there is no question in my mind that I'd tell you to visit Escape Goat. Every single one of their rooms we've played has been a wonderful experience.

room_title: Escape room "A Fisherman's Tale" by Escape Goat in Orlando
review: We played a Fisherman's Tale today and it was awesome!The people who run/own this Escape Game clearly put a lot of effort into making each clue and puzzle feel different and dynamic with the air of a family run and built passion project.The room was decorated beautifully with props and immersive items that only enhanced the experience. It wasn't overblown or overdone- it was a solidly well put together scenic landscape that I really appreciated while also trying to figure out all the different sorts of puzzles and challenges.Truly a great place with some fantastic workers!

room_title: Escape room "The Quest for the Sword" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Source Code Escape Games in Augusta
review: So much fun! We did Asylum and it was the best part of our weekend. Can’t wait for the next room to come out!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Source Code Escape Games in Augusta
review: Great time at a unique escape room. I have been to probably 20 escape rooms, and their Asylum is definitely in my top 3 I have done. It was creative and not just a bunch of lock and keys, but had a cool quirky fun theme with some neat little twists.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Source Code Escape Games in Augusta
review: Such a fun place! Got to help cure the haunting in the asylum, and then threw axes for a bit. Staff was friendly and great, can't wait to come back for their future events.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Source Code Escape Games in Augusta
review: Had an amazing time! Done quite a few different ones and this is definitely one of my favorites. They have plenty of little intricacies that immerse you in the game. Will definitely be back when the next one opens!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Source Code Escape Games in Augusta
review: I have done a handful of escape rooms and this one is by far my favorite. I can't wait for the new puzzle to open!

room_title: Escape room "The Row" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: We had a great time you would not believe where the clues were the staff was great very nice and helpful and  Iris was my new found friend she was great a played along

room_title: Escape room "The Row" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: Such a fun-filled time with my friends! The staff was so friendly and attentive! I had the best time and can’t wait to come back again!

room_title: Escape room "The Row" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: Really clever puzzles and wonderful staff!

room_title: Escape room "The Row" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: High quality rooms provide the top of the line escape room experience!!! The staff are super friendly and professional!!! Definitely put this on your to do list if you're looking for a unique and thrilling experience!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Spy Room VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: WE WILL BE BACK TO EVERY NEW ROOM THIS COMPANY MAKES!!!Decided to check it out with a group of friends on Star Wars premier night. It was 100 times better than the other escape the room games we've played. The puzzles were hard, the atmosphere and props were amazing, great support when we needed it. They asked for feedback and were super warm. These guys are just starting up and I can't wait to see what they do next. Most room games feel super cookie cutter and similar, but not here, the puzzles where varied and fun. very creative minds obviously put a lot of work in to setting this room up and letting us solve their riddle of a game.I'd recommend going with a group for maximum fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Spy Room VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: We had a great time. My family of four along with a dad and his daughter worked together to find clues and find the key. Great activity for the family. My 16 year old and 19 year old had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "The Spy Room VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: We had an awesome time. There were only 4 of us so we didn't make it all the way through but still had a great time. I willdefinitely do this again when they have a new room. The two women running it were also very fun and friendly.

room_title: Escape room "The Spy Room VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: This was soooooo much fun! There were only 5 of us, including a teenager and a 6-year-old. And every single person contributed and found some of the clues. I would HIGHLY recommend for anybody that likes games, activities, puzzles, etc. Great work ladies -- can't wait for the next room to be available.

room_title: Escape room "The Spy Room VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: 10 of us Tuesday night! Great time by all, the event had some great surprises, and the event manager Renae was really awesome to work with and very enthusiastic. We had some scheduling issues with our group (people who said they were going weren't able to) right up until an hour before the event, and Beat The Lock was very accommodating and understanding. Everything ended up working out perfect!

room_title: Escape room "The Spy Room VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: First time in an escape room.The puzzles were great, and there were a lot of clues and things to find and sort out. We beat it with just a bit of time to spare, and really felt the pressure to get out in the last few minutes.The ladies who run it are friendly, and helped make the experience even better with their enthusiasm.It was awesome, and I look forward to having a new room to figure out.

room_title: Escape room "The Spy Room VR" by Beat the Lock in San Jose
review: Great room... nicest hosts I've ever encountered which makes a big difference. It's a tough room...

room_title: Escape room "Al Capone" by The Experience Escape Rooms in Centerton
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Science Fair: Spells & Potions" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape Mars" by Escape Mars in Denver
review: Room was very cool in concept and design, but the puzzles/challenges fall very short. There was a very specific radio puzzle in the room that was insanely difficult and the margin for error was ridiculous. Two of the puzzles in the room weren't reset so once the door locked we ended up having 2 boxes open that weren't suppose to be. When this was brought the employee briefly apologized and that was the end of the conversation. There are very cool visual effects and hollywood effects that are placed in the room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Mars" by Escape Mars in Denver
review: Great time, challenging but fun puzzles! This escape room is definitely one of my favorite.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Mars" by Escape Mars in Denver
review: This is well put together and the puzzles are clever and original. We had tons of run and highly recommend it! I was replaying it in my head for days after we tried Escape Mars!

room_title: Escape room "Escape Mars" by Escape Mars in Denver
review: Escape Mars was a solid escape room with a good mix of tech elements and challenging puzzles. So much love for what these guys put together!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from London" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: It was awesome. Had never done an escape room before. Wasn't let down. Will definitely be back to try out the other scenarios. Just a great, fun time.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from London" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: This was SO much fun! My husband and I joined another group and all I have to say is thank goodness those teenagers and their dad were with us! Smart cookies! The room was filled with excitement and curiosity while playing the game. The staff were very friendly and made it a great time after we were finished and escaped!! Celebrations all around!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from London" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: Great fun for family, friends or a bonding company outing. The clues are sensible and not overly complicated. I would highly recommend this location over others.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from London" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: I went for the first time last night and it was awesome! I highly recommend this place if you are looking for something new to try. Make sure you check out the Medieval room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from London" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: What a great experience! We brought our oldest kids for a family bonding day. It was so much fun to see the dynamic and just to watch everyone working together for a common goal. We are excited for the new rooms:).

room_title: Escape room "Escape from London" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: Had a great time with my group of friends. The place looks a little sketchy from the parking lot but it's fine. Would definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: This is only the second escape room ive done but it I've definitely got the bug now. A friend and I did the Mystery Lodge room. It was certainly a challenge with just two of us, but our guide, Adam, did a great job of laying out the scenario and giving us hints that were juuust enough to keep us going without feeling like we were having our hands held. He definitely helped draw us into the experience with his intro.I was very surprised by the quality of the room as well. Wherever I expected something go be a bit 'low budget', I was pleasantly wrong. There is a lot of thought and effort to making a lot of these secret hatches cool and surprising. Just when I thought something was only another decoration, a puzzle would pop it open.The whole place was clean and professional too. A definite thumbs up, and ill be back for sure with more people to try one of the larger rooms.Thanks again Adam!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: Had so much fun today.  Did the Mystery at Lost Point Lodge room with family and friends.Ok so we were more like a bunch of bumbling fools but we did figure out some clues on our own.   Wow Bobby and Monica were fun, friendly and professional.  Will be coming back again to try different rooms.The Ceniceros and Merlin family.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: My family and I escaped the Mystery at the Lost Point Lodge. When I first walked in, the room felt very authentic, the sounds, the props made me feel like I was in a lodge. The things we had to figure out and find was fun. It was a great experience overall and I hope to go back soon to escape some of their other puzzle rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: The Breakout Games franchise in Gulf Shores met the same expectations of quality and fun as the St. Louis location. The staff was great and the Hostage Room (which was on our list for our next visit in St. Louis) was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: We played Hostage last night while on vacation and had an awesome time. It was definitely challenging and we almost made it out of the room! Customer service was excellent. I would definitely recommend doing this to a group of people looking for something different and fun to do besides the normal Mini Gulf/Go-Cart scene. Thanks for the great time!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: So much fun and quite challenging! We "broke out" of Hostage with 45 seconds remaining!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: We loved this adrenaline pumping experience! It was very difficult but we Broke Out with only 45 seconds to spare. We did the hostage room and truly enjoyed it! Would definitely go again! Jessica was great!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: I highly recommend this to anyone visiting the area. Wow this was a blast. My family did Hostage and was within a minute from solving the puzzle and breaking out. Great staff and very helpful!!!! I would definitely do this again went in Orange Beach

room_title: Escape room "Clancey's Lodge" by Next-Gen Escape in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Containment Breach" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: This place is very well done! Super awesome experience! Our team was able to Escape the Containment Breach with quite a few minutes to spare, but don't let this fool you into thinking that it was in any way easy! Puzzles were great and stayed on theme, ambiance was cool and well manufactured, and the people were fun and just as excited as we were when we completed it! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Containment Breach" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Planned a family fun night here with our kids 18yrs to 26yrs old. We had an absolute blast!!! This was the first escape room experience for all of us, and we had so much fun...... And we were able to successfully complete the Containment Room. Will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Containment Breach" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Decided to book last minute with my boyfriend. The staff was friendly and the place was clean (and the mood lighting was the perfect touch). We escaped the Containment Breech room. It is honestly all about the puzzles but the storyline and theatrics/special effects were what put this location over the Top.

room_title: Escape room "Containment Breach" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: This was my first escape room ever (Containment Breach). My friends and I had a blast. It was a great time, puzzle difficulties were perfextly balanced for our group, ambiance was great. Can't wait to come back and try Whispering Halls.

room_title: Escape room "Containment Breach" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: I have done many escape rooms, and this was by far one of the most well crafted. The physical puzzles were custom made and high quality. I did this room with 7 of my middle school gifted students, and one other teacher. We were able to escape, but don't be fooled - this room is challenging, but the right kind of challenging, and creepy, but not too scary. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Chamber" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: This was our first escape room and we had a great time. Did The Chamber with our group of three and had a blast! The only piece we didn't like were the malfunctioning locks that weren't opening with the right combination entered. Otherwise, a must play, challenging and fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Chamber" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: We did the Chamber as a family event and found it very entertaining. The problems were challenging but solvable. Even our seven and nine year old contributed to the solution. We will definitely return!

room_title: Escape room "The Chamber" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: Booked it for my daughter's 16th birthday and her friends had an incredible time!! They did the Chamber and they loved the challenge... they can't wait to do it again!!

room_title: Escape room "The Chamber" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: We had so much fun at Escape the Place today! The puzzles were tricky and challenging. Even though we were not able to get out in time, it was a terrific experience. Thanks to the great staff. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Happy Hour" by The Escapist Denver in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Knight's Quest" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: So much fun! Challenging, rewarding experience for sure. We did the Knight’s Quest tonight & it was awesome. The room was so cool and I loved the decor and puzzles. I can’t wait to go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Knight's Quest" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: Had a phenomenal time in the Knight’s Quest room! Steven and the other staff members turned an already exciting and challenging activity into the hour of a lifetime!

room_title: Escape room "Knight's Quest" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: This was our first time and it was great! Did the artifact room with family members, and we didn't kill each other! Brandy was a fantastic "guide" and helped us just enough to point us in the right direction if we went off course. We got out with 11 seconds to spare and one hint left!

room_title: Escape room "Knight's Quest" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: We had a group of 8 and we completed the artifact room. Everything about our experience was incredible, from booking the room, to getting good instruction, having a great game master, just the entire experience as a whole. Half of our group had never attempted an escape room before, and those that had did it elsewhere (and thoroughly enjoyed this one more). We all had a blast and are currently planning our next trip back!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: How fun can finding your way out of a locked room be? Turns out, a lot funner than expected. Went with a group of 7 for a girls night out and we had a blast. We chose the jail break room and finding our way out was challenging and exciting.  First escape room for me, so I was pleasantly surprised at how much fun we had.  Staff was awesome to be around. They were funny and helpful. To top it all off, the facility was clean and comfortable. I'll be back again to check out the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: There were just two of us, we tried the Rocket Science and Black Dahlia. Both were well thought out, had easy to follow instructions and Jo was a great help when needed! Highly recommend going here!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: Great idea for a party after dinner. We had a group of 6 tweens and they had a great time. The owner is very nice and accommodating. Would go there again and do another escape challenge. They did Jail Break and were out in 38 mins.

room_title: Escape room "Beta Labs" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: These rooms are fantastic. They are well thought out, challenging, and rewarding. Captain Lockjaw, Madame Lumina, and the Pearled Pachyderm are really great for first timers or experienced puzzle room fans. The Beta Lab room is simply challenging - no antics, no frills, just boxes, locks, and puzzles so I don't recommend it for people looking for the more engaging/ theatrical experience. All in all, we were thrilled with all of these rooms and would gladly revisit if and when a new room is created.

room_title: Escape room "Beta Labs" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: My group and I had a great time! Unfortunately, the Beta Labs room got the best of us and we couldn't get out lol! Well be back soon :) This was my very first escape room and it was amazing, couldn't have asked for a better experience!

room_title: Escape room "Beta Labs" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: We tried the Beta Labs for the nephew's birthday. So much fun, even though we missed escaping by just a couple locks!

room_title: Escape room "Beta Labs" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: So much fun. Four of us took on the Beta Labs room and we had a blast and even made it out alive. It was challenging, rewarding and required a complete team effort. Looking forward to escaping another room again soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Secret" by MPower in San Jose
review: Did The Cabin and The Secret back to back tonight and had a great time! Well thought out clues and fun room design - I especially enjoyed The Secret. Thanks for getting us in tonight!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret" by MPower in San Jose
review: Top notch Escape Room!! Super nice facility. Puzzles are tough but doable. Had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret" by MPower in San Jose
review: Had an amazing time here! Finished The Cabin a few months ago and just finished The Secret. I can't wait for more rooms! Would definitely recommend to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Science Laboratory" by Escape St. Pete in Tampa
review: Excellent! We thoroughly enjoyed the hour which seemed longer and "the Lab" was so much fun! Room was really set up nicely. The staff was very welcoming and helpful! Can't wait to try the other room!

room_title: Escape room "The Science Laboratory" by Escape St. Pete in Tampa
review: We did the Lab room yesterday. Such a fun time! We had four inexperienced players and two who had done different escape rooms. The room was fun and challenging, the game masters were knowledgeable and friendly. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Science Laboratory" by Escape St. Pete in Tampa
review: We did the Lab room with our family of five experienced escapers. This is a nice escape room, well done.

room_title: Escape room "Sound Escape" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: My group did the Sound Escape challenge and it was amazing! Everything was so unique and challenging. It really made you think. The developer/owner was extremely nice and very good at what he does and creates! I highly recommend not just the one escape room but all this place has to offer!

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Quest VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Quest VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: Staff is awesome and great options even for date night!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Quest VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: My son and his friends has such a great time at VR Tech Lounge celebrating his birthday! The staff was so helpful making making sure everyone was playing and having fun! I highly recommend this place for a party or a just a fun place to get together with friends! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Option" by ESC Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: AWESOME escape room!  Great puzzles and art direction.

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Option" by ESC Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So... We did Esc Escape Rooms "Nuclear Option" last night and it was amazing. I haven't seen much discussion about this one in my Facebook escape room groups, but it's in a double wide shipping container in North Hollywood behind a tiny community theater. Room was super fun, creative, and the owner Rick was a hoot. Highly recommended. This one deserves more way attention from the community. I've done more than 100 rooms worldwide, and this is one of the more memorable ones. Superbly well executed and staged. Check it out!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Option" by ESC Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: SO FUN!!!! Its was kinda sketchy at first then we went it and it was AMAZING!! My favorite escape room by far.

room_title: Escape room "Beyond Medusa's Gate VR" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Red Door was a ton of fun! We went for our second escape room there and ended up doing a VR experience this time around. Medusa's gate was one of the COOLEST experiences I've ever been in. Mary was the one that helped us get started and she was the sweetest person ever. So helpful during the game as well. After the fact, Kevin was able to help us wrap up and was super enthusiastic as well. Glad I'm a part of their loyalty program. :)

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Wizarding Academy" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami

My friends and I started with the easiest room (Merlin) and got out with plenty of time to spare so it's probably best for people new to escape games! Can't wait to come back and try the other two rooms :)

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Wizarding Academy" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: Fantastic quality and very original room. Top notch Merlin, will try Pirate soon.

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Wizarding Academy" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: Nice place, clean, people were really nice. We came with our 9 and 12 year old daughters and did the Wizard room.

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Wizarding Academy" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: Probably one of the best rooms I've done in the area. The puzzles are fun, the rooms are super well designed and the ending of the Merlin room literally had me jumping up and down.

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Wizarding Academy" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: Hands down the best room in my opinion; super neat decor and fun puzzle!

room_title: Escape room "Carnival" by Real and Wild Entertainment in Breckenridge
review: This was our 5th and favorite escape room game! Very creative and the rooms tied together nicely!

room_title: Escape room "Carnival" by Real and Wild Entertainment in Breckenridge
review: We had a fun time. Will do it again next time we are in Breckenridge.

room_title: Escape room "Carnival" by Real and Wild Entertainment in Breckenridge
review: This was great fun. Truly enjoyed unlocking all the clues. Great family/bonding time.

room_title: Escape room "Carnival" by Real and Wild Entertainment in Breckenridge
review: Great family friendly escape room! We had a blast with 4 adults and 6 kids ages 4-15.

room_title: Escape room "Haunted" by Escape on Palafox in Pensacola
review: Had a great time doing this with my friends for my birthday. Even though we didn't escape the Haunted Room, we'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted" by Escape on Palafox in Pensacola
review: My husband and I treated my daughter, her husband and their 3 teenage children to the Haunted room. It was SO MUCH FUN! It was truly an adventure that brought us together as a family.It was our first visit to Escape On Palafox and as it turned out we picked one of the hardest rooms. Clues provided along the way from the staff really helped us along and kept us from getting frustrated in this challenging room. We laughed and worked together and at times screamed (Haunted room). The laughter and joy gave way to positive family time the rest of the day. We look forward to trying out every room Escape on Palafox has to offer. Highly recommended! We Almost escaped!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted" by Escape on Palafox in Pensacola
review: Had so much fun doing this with my sister, aunt, and cousins! We did the haunted room and made it about 65% of the way through (our estimate) and still had a blast even though we didn't finish.

room_title: Escape room "Haunted" by Escape on Palafox in Pensacola
review: We did the haunted one and it was so so much fun! I definitely want to do the other 2 rooms now. We also did it with 3 women we didn't know and that made it so much more fun. I highly recommend doing the escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted" by Escape on Palafox in Pensacola
review: Last night me and my friends did the haunted room for my birthday celebration. We had such a great time and got out of the room with 24 seconds to spare. We have all decided that we are going to try the other rooms and see if we can escape from them!

room_title: Escape room "Ms. Ellie’s Sweet Shoppe" by Escape Room Entertainment in Melbourne
review: We did the Sweet Shoppe room and it was really fun. This was my first escape room and I didn't really know what to expect, but our guide was great and helpful. I also appreciate that they had a room themed with something a little lighter and more fun than a lot of the horror/heist themed rooms I see advertised at most places. Given a choice, I'll always take the goofiest option, so this was good for us.

room_title: Escape room "Ms. Ellie’s Sweet Shoppe" by Escape Room Entertainment in Melbourne
review: Had a great time with the Sweet Shoppe room!!! Our guide was Teresa and she was very helpful and friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Ms. Ellie’s Sweet Shoppe" by Escape Room Entertainment in Melbourne
review: We surprised the bride to be with an escape room bachelorette party. Best decision ever. Awesome and friendly staff. An intense and fun game. We will certainly be back.

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: We did the Mad Hatter room. So much fun. This was our first escape experience and there was 7 of us and we all are hooked. The staff was super nice.

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: Our party of 8 had a fabulous time at the "tea party" escape. Love this place, lots of fun! Try it.

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: My niece had told me about this place and my boyfriend and I decided to take her for her birthday. We did the Mad Hatter room because we are Alice in Wonderland fans. It was nothing short of awesome. They stuck to the riddle theme and made things not too hard, but definitely not easy. We successfully escaped the room! It was that something different that Sarasota needed to keep us all occupied, but still using our brains! We look forward to coming back and doing the Jail Break, as well as any additional rooms they open in the future!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: My wife booked the Mad Hatter for my birthday on 3/13. It was the first time we had ever done something like this but what an experience. We may not have finished in time because it was our first time. It definitely will not be our last time. I was hooked after the first 5 minutes or so. I have been telling everyone I know about this place and how they should try it. It was absolutely the best Birthday present ever.

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: Had a blast! We did the Mad Hatter room last night, for my daughter's 14th Birthday, and it was perfect! The staff was great and the whole experience was definitely one to remember. It was our first time and we went in a bit worried because the Jail Break group before us didn't make it out BUT, we escaped with just over 5 minutes to spare. And honestly, even if we hadn't made it out in time, it wouldn't have mattered because it was that fun. We'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Superhero's Adventure - Destination Darkover City" by ALL IN Adventures Lawrenceville in Atlanta
review: We really enjoyed this. We beat Superhero Adventure level 3 with 39 seconds to spare! We'll definitely be back for another room!

room_title: Escape room "Superhero's Adventure - Destination Darkover City" by ALL IN Adventures Lawrenceville in Atlanta
review: We had so much fun at our first ever Escape Room experience today! Thanks for a great time!!!

room_title: Escape room "Superhero's Adventure - Destination Darkover City" by ALL IN Adventures Lawrenceville in Atlanta
review: We had a great time in the Superhero Room!

room_title: Escape room "Vikings: Valhalla - the Age of Axe" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: I took my staff to a Boxroom Escape Game and it was a great way to get them to bond together outside of the work environment.

room_title: Escape room "Vikings: Valhalla - the Age of Axe" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: We went as a family on mothers day and had the BEST time! We have gone to several others and this particular location is by far the best ! From the employees at the desk to our "game master" this location is hands down top notch! Well thought out challenges and decor to match, we just LOVED every minute! And our group picture given the way it was!!! OMG!!! Simply amazing!!!

room_title: Escape room "Vikings: Valhalla - the Age of Axe" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: We were visiting from Texas and just did the Escape room. It was done very well and we had a lot of fun! Thank you Brianna...you are awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: This review comes from a group that has completed about 20 escape rooms across the nation, including in cities such as Orlando, St. Louis, Las Vegas. We have encountered some so-so rooms, some decent rooms, and some amazing rooms. What we LOVE - They don’t mix you with strangers in the rooms! That is awesome! This room, the Zombie Lab, was a little bit of a disappointment for us. We had previously done, over several years, both the Bank Heist and the Western room at this venue. The western themed room has the best theming of them all, as it is the most immersive, though even there you’ll see odds and ends that appear to be incomplete, like a certain ceiling tile installation/work-around that looks sloppy.  First off - TONS of locks. Locks, locks, locks! That is typical of many entry-level rooms. The puzzles ARE fun, but not many of the puzzles relate to the stories! It seems like the rooms are decorated, and then filled with a hodgepodge of random puzzles that don’t actually contribute to the theme or the story. You’re walking around thinking, “How is this puzzle related to the story at all?”  Another aspect that is a bit of a letdown: Having to watch an intro video in the lobby in front of other groups. It’s just awkward standing around a television next to the counter to watch a poorly written (and full of grammatical errors and misspellings!) video before entering the room. Lastly, it would be nice if the employees conveyed some enthusiasm for the job at hand. The instruction segment given to each group by the employee is too long and rushed. It’s a LOT of talking for them, and they talk fast to get through it, which is just annoying for everybody. The instructions should be more concise. Our favorite to least favorite room at his ensue: #1 Wild West (We were told the owners built this one themselves - They’ve obviously learned a lot from running the other two rooms) #2 The Bank Robbery #3 Zombie Lab

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: I took my 18 year old son and niece to the Zombie Lab. We had a great time and can't wait to try another scenario.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: Thank you so much. We had such a good time. The owners really set us up to have the best experience possible. It made my weekend to save the world from Zombies with my smart friends. Your welcome world! I called my buddy who has an events group on my way back to town from Phoenix to tell them have your groups drive 2 hours to this one. Its worth it. Awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: We went for our 1st wedding anniversary and it was PERFECT! We did the zombie lab and it was everything we wanted it to be! My favorite part was all of the special effects... it was really immersive! We can't wait to go back to do the Bank Robbery room! Thanks for an epic experience!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: The most immersive and thrilling experience in town! I have competed in both the rooms (escaped successfully once) and in both cases had an amazing time that I am still talking about with my friends. Cannot recommend enough, whether it be with friends, family, or co-workers, you will love it!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: As someone who has done multiple "Escape the rooms" before, this was the most dynamic and exciting one I've done so far! We did the "find the zombie cure" one and it had so many exciting and interesting aspects that it kept us all on our feet. I can't recommend this place highly enough! It's the most fun when you go with everyone you know so make sure you bring five other people!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: I've never done an escape room before so when my sister and I saw it pop up on Facebook we immediately wanted to do it. We booked 6 people for the Zombie Lab and completed it today at noon and finished the room with 14:15 left! It was very fun, had us working together and the puzzles were great. Definitely want to go back already and try the bank heist room, this place was great! It's even cuter because it's ran by a Husband and his Wife, they were extremely nice.

room_title: Escape room "The Inventor's Workshop" by Mountain Room Escapes in Big Bear City
review: None

review: Had a Blast! Horror Hotel Rocks! Racked my brain, and everybody in our group had a great time. A lot of laughs with great friends.

room_title: Escape room "Horror Hotel" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: My wife and I went today for the first time and tried the horror hotel themed room! Would definitely recommend to anyone who is looking for a fun time! It was worth every penny paid!

room_title: Escape room "Horror Hotel" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: My boyfriend and I went for our 5 year anniversary! We went in the horror hotel with 3 other girls and it was SUCH a blast!!! The room was so carefully planned out and was really a great challenge! I would recommend anyone to go! Such a sweet and caring staff, as well! Thank you breakout for such an amazing experience! So worth the money!!

room_title: Escape room "Horror Hotel" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: This was such a fun interactive activity, so much better than a movie or eating out! I will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Horror Hotel" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: It was a blast!! I can't wait to go back. The staff was extremely friendly!

room_title: Escape room "The Final Kingdom" by Lakeland Escape Room in Lakeland
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Had a great experience! Loved the puzzles & rooms & great staff! Really clean & fun & whimsical! The upsidedown photo at the end was different too!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: This is a cool place.  It is such a unique and creatively decorated space- the details really draw you in.  We arrived the 15 minutes early as you are supposed to and were greeted by the owner.  She was super friendly, energetic and you could tell that this place was a passion project for her and her husband.  She chatted us up about their business and we could tell that a lot of planning went into the whole thing.A few minutes later her husband and our game master walked us through our scenario for "Spellbound".   My hubby and I were the only two slotted for this spot.  That was a good thing since others were supposed to be with us and the room was a small space.  I am glad we didn't have other people in there or we would have been a bit crammed.  The room was neat.  It had a good combination of technology, quirkiness, puzzles and good old need for attention to details.  We have done about 10 escape rooms between us before this one and it was thoughtfully created and a good level of difficulty.  We made it out with 4 minutes to go too!  It is definitely worth the visit.  I can't wait to check out one of their other rooms next time we are in town!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: This is a must-do in Monterey. It is so fun!! The staff is super friendly and funny as well! We went in to do Alice's Dream. Came with 3 others so we played with 4 total. It was big enough where we all could contribute and find clues. We absolutely loved it. So fun, some really good challenges! We loved it so much that when we went outside and got In the car we all decided we didn't want to leave. So we went back in and played Spell Bound. That one is very good as well! Very tricky. Over all we had SO much fun. Would definitely try their other location on our next trip.

room_title: Escape room "Professor's Study" by Enter The Enigma in Colorado Springs
review: Had a fantastic time and can’t wait to go back and solve the other rooms

room_title: Escape room "Professor's Study" by Enter The Enigma in Colorado Springs
review: My wife and I were on our anniversary and this was the first escape room we have ever been to and we had a ton of fun. Highly recommend. The owners are fantastic.

room_title: Escape room "Professor's Study" by Enter The Enigma in Colorado Springs
review: My arranged for a group of my family members to do The Professor's Study Escape Room while we were in the area for our reunion. Don was very responsive to my emails and provided excellent service as well as military discount for my group. My family thoroughly enjoyed themselves and were able to escape the room! We had a blast and would certainly visit again if we're in the area.

room_title: Escape room "Y2K" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: My friends and I went twice, the Y2K room and The Hatch. I personally loved Y2K. It was nostalgic, the flow of the room and clues made sense, etc. My 3 friends and I were able to get out with literally only one sec left on the clock. My group of friends also had great chemistry to figure Y2K out.The staff was great. They were helpful and friendly. I have never done an escape room before Waikiki Breakout so I have no other places to compare it too.My last note is how the location was great. There's a parking garage underneath King Village that I tend to favor parking at over other places in Waikiki. My deal breaker on a lot of places being awesome to hang out is more often than not based on the parking situation.

room_title: Escape room "Y2K" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: Always impressed by businesses who go the extra mile to make up for any mistakes. We're glad to say that the last visit was just a fluke. Tonight's experience was everything that we've come to expect and love about Breakout Waikiki, and to top it off, we successfully broke out! Y2K was a fun room filled with 90's nostalgia and some interesting, unexpected puzzles. Can't wait for more rooms to try.

room_title: Escape room "Y2K" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: This place is super fun! 3 for 3 so far... We've tried the Manoa Marketplace, Ala Moana Stock Exchange, and Y2K rooms. For the thirty somethings, the Y2K room will be a trip down memory lane.

room_title: Escape room "Y2K" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: Our family did the Y2K room. This was a great experience. Very professional, fun loving workers. We're going to try another room soon. So fun!

room_title: Escape room "Y2K" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: We did Y2K! It was tons of fun, with some amazing surprises and well thought out puzzles. This took a lot of teamwork, attention to detail, and critical thinking. At some points we were speechless! The whole room was very nostalgic and entertaining. The staff was friendly and professional. We messed up on the final code, but we still feel like winners. My wife and I were giggly about the experience all evening. We had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Vacation Vandals" by Key Quest in Miami
review: Wayyyyy super fun! Even if you arent 16 years old you will have a blast! Especially if you grab a few drinks before.But be prepared to sweat like crazy! its like being in a real like video game!!

room_title: Escape room "Vacation Vandals" by Key Quest in Miami

room_title: Escape room "Vacation Vandals" by Key Quest in Miami
