room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had a lot of fun with both their rooms, some clever clues and fantastic puzzles they got.

room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So far I have done 6 Escape Rooms, and Enigma provided the best options BY FAR! Can't wait to go back for their third room! A great way to spend time with friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Two months ago I had stopped by enigma and tried the secret temple with a few friends from work and I had a blast going through the room and solving puzzles! Just came back again last weekend to try out their newest room, the Will, and it really showed me how lacking I am on my puzzle skills, lol.The will had so many things right! Not too many puzzles to manage, but that doesn't mean they won't make your brain hurt in a good way. They also incorporated some really flashy tech that made the next moment thrilling! Now all we have left is to tackle Apartment 205 and we are golden. Can't wait to come back for a third time

room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had some friends visiting from out of town who didn't want to do the usual tourist thing so we picked Enigma based on the high Yelp reviews. This was our first time trying escape rooms, and we were not disappointed. We went up the stairs of this old school building and were greeted by a friendly host. After some chatting he told us the back story to 'The Will,' their newest room. We went in having read the prologue, but not really knowing what to expect. We were brought into the room and locked inside this beautiful office. The puzzles inside were beautifully integrated  into the story of this rich tycoon and his last wishes.The tech in this room is just awesome!My friends and I really enjoyed the experience and I can't wait to come back to try Enigma's other rooms

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Madd Steals Christmas" by Sly Fox Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: We had a blast! The Madd Doctor was amazing and I'll definitely be back to try more.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Madd Steals Christmas" by Sly Fox Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: We brought a group of teen girls to the Madd Doctor escape room and had a blast! They loved it!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Madd Steals Christmas" by Sly Fox Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: Made it out and foiled the crazy doctor's plan. We had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Madd Steals Christmas" by Sly Fox Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: We went with a group of 6 and did the Doctor Madd room. We had a blast. The only problem is scheduling a time for us all to come back.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Madd Steals Christmas" by Sly Fox Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: It was really really fun. The puzzles were well thought out and the room was fantastically put together. My friends and I will likely come back soon. The man who greeted us there was funny and nice and helped to make the experience even better. Would reccomend.

room_title: Escape room "Lockdown" by Digital Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: We had a surprise birthday party for my son and his friends. The staff, facilities, games, and escape room were fantastic!

room_title: Escape room "Lockdown" by Digital Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: Incredible! You will not find a more unique escape experience, nor will you meet a group of kinder, more accommodating professionals anywhere. We had an amazing time and can't wait to go back! :)

room_title: Escape room "Lockdown" by Digital Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: Went with a group tonight and escaped successfully! Great set up with mixing hands on puzzles along with digital ones. Wasn't a single dull moment even while waiting for our turn. Lots of fun games to play just around the lobby. Great experience and will definitely be coming back. Would highly recommend for all age groups!

room_title: Escape room "Lost In Time" by Mastermind Escape Games in Jacksonville
review: I went with my coworkers as a team building night out and we all had a blast! We had a group of 7 and did Lost in Time. The puzzle were great and it was interesting seeing each of our strengths outside of work. We worked with Amber and she was sweet and accommodating. They are lucky to have such a nice person working there.Thank you for a fun and brain-bending night out. My team needed this!

room_title: Escape room "Lost In Time" by Mastermind Escape Games in Jacksonville
review: We - my husband, brother, sister-in-law, and I have been several times now and we absolutely love it! My husband and I have escaped two of the four rooms, Lost in Time and Bankheist and had a blast in doing so. We will definitely be back again!

room_title: Escape room "Lost In Time" by Mastermind Escape Games in Jacksonville
review: Absolutely fun. The staff was great and informative. We did "Lost in Time" and will definitely be coming back to do the other rooms. Such a blast.

room_title: Escape room "The Strange Thing" by Cinema Escape Rooms in Orange County
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This was by far (and for the moment) the best escape room we did !We did the Asylum and we had so much fun, but not only ! The story is incredible, the decorations so realistic and the puzzles super AMAZING ! We are a bit sad that it is the only escape room we didn't escape (only for 20 seconds). We don't remember the name of the girl that hosted us, but thank you so much for letting us finish the game despite the time that was over.I don't know if it's because it was our very first escape room, but we really had a blast ! We loved the fact that almost all the pieces in the room were to be used, not too much useless information that could lead you to a false way. The story line is amazing, the mood, EVERYTHING !HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !We look forward coming again to LA to try The Basement.Good job guys !

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Looking for something different? You've arrived. Your first puzzle is finding the place. Second puzzle? Parking. After that? You're on your own!! "Vash" will take very good care of you after he leaves you to rot! We will be back for, "The Bunker". "Asylum" was taken down after 58:30 and we loved and languished every second we were inside!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Thanks Celena! We did the bunker & Asylum & it was so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: (No spoilers) Very fun! I did the insane asylum with my girlfriend's family today and we really enjoyed the clever puzzles, creepy ambiance, and fantastic receptionist. The only thing I would change is the size for the price. I totally understand there's only so much that can be done with the size of the house, and while definitely worth it, I think that a larger place with more puzzles and traveling (inside, outside, roof access, adjacent housing, etc.) would really add to the experience. I could definitely see myself spending a bit more for a couple hours in a mansion solving similar puzzles--but that's just me.All that said, this was a whole lot of fun and I will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Amazing time! Can't wait to do the next room!Loved all the little details that went into everything.

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: WOOHOO! We escaped the Asylum and with an additional 20 minutes to spare too!The concept is simple, you and your group of 5 friends are locked in a dark room and you have 1 hour to find a key to escape. The clock counts down and you are left scrambling through props and items in the room to solve puzzles and quizzes in hopes of finding clues to get out. Prior to starting the game, they will go over the rules and have you sign waivers. I've played several escape room games and this one was challenging yet really fun! I would highly suggest it for a first timer player. Tips:-The best way to solve the clues is to work together. I can't stress enough that team work is vital! Keep track of your clues and communicate with everyone so you don't have 5 people looking for the same clues. -Wear comfortable clothes! It can get really hot/cold in the rooms so wear something you feel comfortable moving around in.-Keep hydrated and use the restroom beforehand. You will be LOCKED in the room for an hour!-Be very observant. There's clues everywhere! Look underneath stuff, in cervices, high above you, move things around...etc-Parking is terrible here! We ended up parking right next to the building because we couldn't fit our car in the tiny driveway. Make sure you tell them where you parked your car so you don't get towed.

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Definitely one of the better run puzzle rooms in LA and there are definitely a lot of pretty good ones in the LA area now.  It's a bit hard to find parking on the busy Barham Blvd, but there is street parking if you look for it.I have done both the Asylum and the Bunker rooms and they are both fun in their own way.  Without giving away too much, I liked the puzzles in the Bunker and the atmosphere in the Asylum.  Everything is pretty well thought out.  The hour flies by.  I love the tension and relief of every puzzle.  It's very satisfying to hear that *click* when a lock is open.They have great customer service and guide you through what you need to know about the experience.  I'm definitely ready for the next room!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This was a crazy crazy experience! I loved trying it once but I'm not sure I can do it again. Haha this kind of experience is aimed toward gamers who like to solve puzzles on the spot. I'm the take my time kind of person so this was so fast paced for me. I came here with a group of 6 to try out the Bunker room. Parking is really crazy with a max of three cars pulling into a narrow lane in front of the place. Carpool if you can! Before the craziness starts you get a lot of info and then of goes the timer.I would suggest bringing as many people as possible because you need all the thinking brains! Video gamers highly recommended haha. We all had a lot of fun and were just running all over the place and we were able to solve it under the given time limit. Pretty cool but not the shortest time ever! We were aiming for that of course but not all dreams get fulfilled. Even though I wasn't the main puzzle solver I still had a lot of fun doing this experience. There's a good mix of puzzle solving and just finding clues that there is a lot to do. It's good to try this at once, and if you like it, there are other rooms too!

room_title: Escape room "Kate's Motel" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: AMAZING!!!! By far the best Escape rooms out there! Great friendly family owned. Any questions you have they always answer for you. I've done all the rooms. The newest "Kate's Motel" Extremely thought out and fun. Totally makes you feel like your in a real Motel. 10 star plus!!! Sending all my friends and family to try their rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Sector X" by Escape Rooms Connecticut in New Haven
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Fort" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: My family and I love doing escape rooms. We hadn't tried this one until December 2019 and man we can't wait to go back. We have done the Candy room which was hard but omg so much fun. We had to go back and try The Fort. WOW! Amazing experience. We also took our daughter who loved hers and is now hooked as well. We have more to do and can't wait to go back. Great for friends night out or if family comes to town. Totally need at least 4 people to do.

room_title: Escape room "The Fort" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Our crew has done many different escape games, and this place was great! We did the Cells and the Fort, and really enjoyed both. The staff was professional and friendly, and also super attentive during the escapes. This has made the difference between ok/poor rooms and good ones: The people! Great job Urban Escape games, and we’ll be back for more.

room_title: Escape room "The Fort" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Family of four with 2 young adult kids, had a great time solving puzzles in The Fort. The host gave hilarious tips and encouragement. We will definitely recommend and will go again!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break Havana" by Key West Room Escape in Key West
review: None

room_title: Escape room "HERO escape room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Had a blast, highly recommend  this place, defiantly coming back to try more of the rooms

room_title: Escape room "HERO escape room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: What a fun time!! Definitely recommend this place, Stanley helped led us through the Escape room and did a great job. We were nervous going in it would be too hard but it was perfect and a fun time!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie War VR" by The House of Clues in Santa Barbara
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Banishing" by Escape USA in Atlanta
review: The Banishing: Very well done! it's complex and immersive. This is an excellent thing to do with friends. I felt very comfortable going through this with my little group of friends. Very important for we introverts! I think it's well worth what they charge and a nice amount of time for the experience. The design was immaculate and everything was seriously well researched! if you love spooky, horror or the paranormal do this. We escaped with 13 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "The Banishing" by Escape USA in Atlanta
review: 10 stars! The Banishing was my second time doing an escape room, and this was my sons first time ever. We had an absolute blast! The puzzles were well thought out and the staff was amazing at making sure the game ran smoothly. My boys haven't stopped talking about it since we got in the car. We are already planning our next escape and I can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Banishing" by Escape USA in Atlanta
review: We had SO MUCH fun at this escape room that we went back later in the day to go again! we dont live in GA (was in atlanta for a comic con) so we wanted to make sure we made time to come again before we left. The banishing room was SO creative and well thought out. we just needed a few more mintues! then we did the speakeasy room which was still very challenging (we needed one or two clues) but we did make it out :) i went with my husband and brother in law so its definitely a good time for all.

room_title: Escape room "Camp Mary Lee" by Nightmare at 3008 in Birmingham
review: A group of us from The Haunt At Camp Liberty came to check it out and had the best time! It was intense and scary and honestly one of the best haunts I've ever been to. They're doing something amazing here. The staff was very friendly and the actors were very skilled! definitely recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Vault" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: We had a blast! Such a nice, friendly staff! Challenging but fun adventure for the whole family!

room_title: Escape room "Vault" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: It was extremely challenging, the perfect birthday gift for my boyfriend!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Vault" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Auburn Escape Zones is so much fun!! Corrie and Sarah T. are so cool and super sweet! The rooms are so much fun and will puzzle you with all the different clues. Me and some friends have done every room and I would recommend every one of them!! Such a cool thing to do whether it’s rain, shine, or snow.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: Loved the vault room.. great experience had fun with my fiance and friends . The Staff was awsome , they where so nice and helpful.  Great experience overall I would go back and try the jail one next ..

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: It was Awesome!!! The Ragole's finished with 3 minutes to spare.When we started I was thinking What the heck are we doing.But as we started to work with our team, it all came together.Can't wait for the next room.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: This escape game was so much fun!! When we got to the place (walking distance from angel city brewery I might add) we were greeted by the owner who was very energetic and excited to get us started. I definitely don't want to give anything away to anyone that hasn't played an escape game, but this was not my first experience with interactive escape puzzles and I can confidently say it was my favorite that I've played.The Alcatraz theme was very well thought out and and after a short briefing of the rules and laying of the settings, our group was in for an intense ride. Our group managed to escape with just minutes to spare only adding to the build up of anxiety of being trapped for life.The owner had mentioned adding another game into the mix in the coming future. He mentioned something about a Bank, so I can't wait until this one opens to play. If you are ever looking for a team building event I would highly recommend this place to any group (or works as a fun date night gentlemen). Had so much fun and it's been the talk at my work for the past week.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: So much fun. First time doing anything like this and I loved it.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: So much fun! It was challenging but just the right amount. More witty and exciting than other room escapes I have done. Can't wait to try the new room when it opens!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: This escape game was so much fun!! When we got to the place (walking distance from angel city brewery I might add) we were greeted by the owner who was very energetic and excited to get us started. I definitely don't want to give anything away to anyone that hasn't played an escape game, but this was not my first experience with interactive escape puzzles and I can confidently say it was my favorite that I've played.The Alcatraz theme was very well thought out and and after a short briefing of the rules and laying of the settings, our group was in for an intense ride. Our group managed to escape with just minutes to spare only adding to the build up of anxiety of being trapped for life.The owner had mentioned adding another game into the mix in the coming future. He mentioned something about a Bank, so I can't wait until this one opens to play. If you are ever looking for a team building event I would highly recommend this place to any group (or works as a fun date night gentlemen). Had so much fun and it's been the talk at my work for the past week.

room_title: Escape room "The Fed" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: We had a blast tonight. We were the first ones to solve the newest room The Fed. It was super challenging but incredibly fun. I encourage everyone to check out Lockdown. You will be hooked and want to do all the rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Fed" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Definitely going again! It's a fun challenge, we did the Federal reserve, next time we are gonna do the Attic. Want to try them all!

room_title: Escape room "The Phantom Soldier" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Phantom Soldier was awesome! Challenging but fair. The room is super decked out compared to other ones I've tried.

room_title: Escape room "The Phantom Soldier" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: The decoration is on point. Staffs are nice. Puzzles are challenging.

room_title: Escape room "The Phantom Soldier" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: This is a great way to have fun with a group of friends! I'm not someone who typically enjoys puzzles, riddles, games, etc., but Square Room Escape has really elevated the experience for me. This is an excellent alternative for when you're looking for something to do and want a different option than going to the movies/bowling/karaoke. The clues are never the same, the rooms are beautifully decorated, and the whole thing from start to finish is very immersive. Definitely go check it out!

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Seven Keys" by Escape Room Adventures in Fort Myers
review: We did the Pirate room, didn't escape but had a fun time trying to figure everything out. Staff was super nice, and even though our group was beyond help they still gave us an additional clue. Would recommend to everyone to try at least once, you'll be hooked.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Seven Keys" by Escape Room Adventures in Fort Myers
review: So fun! The treasure of the 7 keys room is awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Seven Keys" by Escape Room Adventures in Fort Myers
review: Excellent room (Treasure of the Seven Keys). We did have a problem with one of the locks that we had to get technical assistance with but everything else was awesome. One suggestion though: review all the lock types with players before starting so we know exactly how the locks work.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Seven Keys" by Escape Room Adventures in Fort Myers
review: My parents took my husband and I to try the 7 keys room. It was our first time doing an escape room. My parents have gone to plenty so it was nice to have the help. We made it and we were 30 seconds from beating the record time for that room. Had a blast we will have to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Seven Keys" by Escape Room Adventures in Fort Myers
review: We had such an amazing time. We did the 7 key's treasure. Quin was our host he laughed with us and made sure we enjoyed ourselves. This was our first time we went as part of my birthday celebration, and it was well worth it. We made it all the way to the last box but couldn't open it in time lol. We will be returning to try one of the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Bootlegger's Breakout" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: We were visiting family in the Denver area, and we really wanted to do a escape room. We found this place only 5 minutes from our hotel. We were a group of six, and four of us had already done an escape room before. We all loved it and had fun. It was a little pricey, but worth the fun. The lady there was super nice and helpful.

room_title: Escape room "Bootlegger's Breakout" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: First time going to this place and it was great. Family of 6 (our youngest is 16) did the difficult room and had a great time. The owners were very nice, explained a bit about everything then put us in the room. A very good experience for all of us. I would recommend this and would come back again

room_title: Escape room "Bootlegger's Breakout" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: It was our first time and we did Bootleggers Breakout! We had so much fun!!! We didn’t solve it but we had a blast! Helpful and friendly staff! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Protocol Zero" by Escape Artists in Orlando
review: I did the Protocol Zero room with my three teenage boys. We really enjoyed this theme and the puzzles. I think I like it better than Cat Burglar and found it a little easier, despite the company telling that Protocol has a slightly lower escape rate. They did a really good job on the props. A few things are a little startling, but nothing really scary. We escaped with less than two minutes. Give it a go!

room_title: Escape room "Protocol Zero" by Escape Artists in Orlando
review: My boyfriend has been telling me about the awesome reviews Escape Artists has gotten and we finally decided to take the drive and escape here. I am so happy we did because we had such a great time. Even though we got there a little late, the guy that helped us (sorry I forgot names) was super nice and welcoming. He immediately got us in the room and gave us instructions. The room itself, Protocol Zero, was incredible. The technology was super advanced, everything was connected and organized so well. It was a really well thought out room. We were able to escape, but we were not left confused as to how things worked, we knew exactly how everything worked and how everything was connected. I really appreciate the detail and thought that was put into this room. I would definitely recommend coming here! Even if you live in Orlando, it is totally worth the drive!

room_title: Escape room "Protocol Zero" by Escape Artists in Orlando
review: Best space themed game in central Florida. We love Protocol Zero! Very immersive

room_title: Escape room "Biohazard" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: Took six 13-year-old girls to the Biohazard room. They had a blast! Great staff! We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Biohazard" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: Had an amazingly good time in the zombie room!! Will be back soon. Thanks for a great day!!

room_title: Escape room "Biohazard" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: I got to escape from the zombie room for my birthday. I wanted to do something different and I'm glad I chose this place. Our whole group had a great time I can't wait to do another room!

room_title: Escape room "Before Moonrise" by Escape New Haven in New Haven
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Light Room" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Wonderful experience! We did the Light Room and were impressed by the quality and intricacy of the puzzles. It was made to be solved by a group, so it allowed all eight of us to work together. No one was standing around bored. The puzzles felt cohesive and very carefully crafted. It was great to meet and talk with the designer, Alex, as well! So much fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Light Room" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did The Light Room and got out with 6 seconds to spare. It was great to work together and figure out the clues to successfully finish on our first try. Will definitely go back to try the other room and see if we can conquer that one as well.

room_title: Escape room "The Light Room" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: First time at Nodus805 and went for the Light Room. Alex provided us with a great back story and was very helpful when we needed hints. The room itself was very interesting in the setup and how all the puzzles work together. Can't wait to go back and try the other room.

room_title: Escape room "The Light Room" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My coworkers and I (4 total) did the Lightroom. It was quite challenging and we used the whole hour but completed it! The puzzles were challenging but one or two hints in the right direction help A LOT. Alex at Nodus 805 is a great guy and has done a lot of work to balance the room and provides helpful clear hints if necessary.The ambiance is a little low BUT if there were too many false clues or distractions then it might be too difficult. This was my first escape room but my coworkers had done a few before. I recommend going with a team of more experienced people.

room_title: Escape room "The Light Room" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Our family went there and tried the Light Room - a lot of fun and pretty challenging. Cori at Nodus was great and explained everything clearly before putting us in the room - she also helped by providing 15 minutes updates as to the time remaining (yeah, there is a clock in the room but trust me it is the last thing you'll have time to be looking at).  We had a great time. Next stop - The Study!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Final Escape Room" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: We have done three rooms here and always have a great time! We did the Houdini room tonight and it was pretty challenging but lots of fun. Alex was an awesome guide and super sweet. Will definitely be back again!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Final Escape Room" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: I'm so glad I chose Legends of Xscape for my first escape room experience. My friends and I (group of 5) went on a Friday afternoon and chose the Houdini room (level 9/10). Despite being a beginner, the room was a perfect balance of challenging and fun. Our game master was Savannah, and she was so sweet and assisted us as needed. 10/10 would come back, especially to try the Area 51 room.

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Final Escape Room" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: Had so much fun. First time escapee! My first time was spent in the Houdini room. Lot of challenges. Friendly staff. I just can't wait to do it again!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: Awesome room! Great experience of all the rooms I've done (about 15). I can't wait until they open back up from this pandemic so I can try their other room! Unique and the flow really keeps you surprised the whole time.

room_title: Escape room "Time Machine" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: After doing 40+ escape rooms, I can honestly say the rooms at Red Button are easily in my top three favorites from the complexity and variety of the puzzles to the build-outs and vibe of each room! They definitely made the decor as important as the puzzles! I highly recommend!! Can’t wait till Mayan opens!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: Prison Break is so unique from all the different prison-themed escape rooms I’ve done. They’re so well thought and I’m still impressed and think everyone needs to try it. It’s very fun, especially for teens. We escaped with 11 minutes left. Cancel all your plans next weekend and book a room with your family or friends because you won’t regret it.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Red Button Escape in Miami
review: We had so much fun escaping the prison! What an experience. We will definitely go back and do another room. Teamwork is totally essential.

room_title: Escape room "Criminal Capture - the Zodiac Killer" by Axxiom Escape Rooms Wilmington in Wilmington (DE)
review: We had high hopes for this room. We frequent many escape rooms and had recently visited the Newark,DE location and were really impressed with how elaborate their Sorcerer Quest room was. So we were somewhat disappointed with the design and sophistication of the Zodiac room. The premise was not very well laid out by the game master. And yes, the room was very hard. But definitely not "scary." Overall just felt like it could have been done better. At the end of the night, it was just "okay" as far as escape rooms go.

room_title: Escape room "Criminal Capture - the Zodiac Killer" by Axxiom Escape Rooms Wilmington in Wilmington (DE)
review: Ton of fun. We did The Zodiac Killer and it's definitely a challenge but I will absolutely be going again!

room_title: Escape room "Criminal Capture - the Zodiac Killer" by Axxiom Escape Rooms Wilmington in Wilmington (DE)
review: Myself, my dad and two younger brothers were in the Zodiac room and although we did not get out in the allotted time, our experience was still great. Lots of challenging yet exciting mysteries to solve. We will be returning for sure!!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Saloon" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: My daughter wanted to do an escape room for her 14th birthday. .   We were not disappointed.   Excellent customer service.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Saloon" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: Great low tech experience, and everyone got involved. The game showed great creativity and mystery, with a very realistically themed environment.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Saloon" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: We had a party of 13 so we split into two groups girls in the saloon and guys in the pirate room. This was the first time any of us had done this and it was so much fun! Way more difficult than any of us expected, but such clever puzzles. The staff was amazing! When I pulled up it was in a town house type business complex but don't let that put you off --there is a big adventure waiting for you inside!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Saloon" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: We had family and friends in town for our wedding and most of them had not done an escape room before so we did the The Wizard's Final Exam. So much fun and we completed with 7:37 to spare! We'll be back to do the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Saloon" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: Had a great time.  It was something fun to do with friends that was not the same old thing.  It was fun to challenge our minds.  Our 12 year old son had the most fun of all.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Saloon" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: My family has done both the pirate and western theme & both were really fun. My 11yr old couldn't stop talking about how fun the experience was! Management was easy to work with and responsive to questions/concerns. I wouldn't recommend taking kids younger than about 7 or 8 because they won't understand the clues.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Saloon" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: The Western Room was a blast!  The puzzles were challenging and definitely took all 6 brains.  Worth the money, and will look forward to doing the others!  Thank you.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Saloon" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: Loved both escapes, saloon and pirate. Have done others and these are my favorite. I don't consider myself as knowledgeable as those in my group and was surprised to find that I was able to actively participate and had a lot of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Saloon" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: I've been to other escape rooms in the area and I had a much better experience at this one. The staff was very friendly and the escape room itself was really well done. Loved everything about it!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Shout out to our gamemaster Chelsea for The Psych Ward! This our first visit and we had a blast! Will be back to try another!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Truly a blast! Even though I'm still trapped in the Psych Room. I am definitely coming back to do the others. Thanks Chelsea for your guidance.

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: I was amazed the second I stepped in the room (Psych Ward)! It was awesome and every little detail seems to matter. They will also provide hints through out the game if asked so that's a nice component. We did not escape so we're bound to go back and get a win!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: This was SUCH a great experience! We went with a group of 4 to the Psych Ward and got paired up with a family of 3. It felt a little awkward at first since we had never been and weren't expecting to be working with anyone else, but we quickly got past that and worked together to escape with 5 minutes left. Sooo much fun and I would recommend it to ANYONE who enjoys a good challenge. The staff was amazing, super friendly, and very helpful. I am already looking forward to the next opportunity to get a group together to go!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: My boyfriend's mom booked an escape room for the whole family. We got Psych Ward, which they said has the lowest escape rate of all the rooms.We made it out with 1:43 left! I was really nervous, but it's the quickest hour of your life. Such a thrill! We had 6 people and it felt like the perfect amount. I hope we get to go back soon and do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Last Experiment" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: This wonderful outfit will submerge you in the world of a creepy supernatural experience. Pay attention, work together and you might just make it out of there...

room_title: Escape room "The Last Experiment" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: This was a great escape room.  Very scary, great use of live actors.  Puzzles were tricky but very doable.  Staff was very helpful and engaging, gave us great advice for additional escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Last Experiment" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: Me and my friends came to do the experiment and Zoe today! I was too afraid to do Zoe but the experiment room was creepy and fun and had a live actor. It had a couple things I've never seen before in previous escape rooms. I wish I was brave enough to do the Zoe room with my friends, but the room looked REALLY scary and fun! The game master was excellent at giving hints and staying in character and made the experience memorable, and he explained the origin of the Zoe story and the rooms! Thank you so much!! I will be back when I am braver!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Executive Order" by Enter The Enigma in Colorado Springs
review: We had a blast! We are not quite as smart as we thought! LolThe staff are wonderful and funny. We highly recommend !

room_title: Escape room "The Executive Order" by Enter The Enigma in Colorado Springs
review: The owners are passionate and jubilant about their place! I went for the first time with a group of friends who were visiting me from out of town. Everyone had a blast and the room (we tried out Executive Order) was challenging and exciting. 2 out of the 6 of us had done escape rooms before, and it was a good one for those of us who hadn't been through one yet. 10/10 would recommend. Thanks to the staff for making it extra enjoyable.

room_title: Escape room "The Executive Order" by Enter The Enigma in Colorado Springs
review: We did the Executive Order Room, and made it out with 6 minutes to spare! it was a blast, and our family really enjoyed the experience. Very well done. We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Kindergarten" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: Super fun and challenging! Will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Kindergarten" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: I had an awesome time with my friends. We did the escape from kindergarten and it was a blast from beginning to end! The staff was friendly and helpful. The puzzles and clues were challenging, but doable. Every step forward was extremely rewarding and we escaped with under a minute to spare. This was an amazing way to spend an hour with friends and I highly recommend it for families and coworkers as well.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Kindergarten" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: We did the Kindergarten escape room and had a blast! We had 4 people in our group and then they added one additional person. It was pretty challenging but we laughed the whole way through! Hoping they bring back a Halloween room because we would definitely go again!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Escape game was pretty awesome! The playground room was colorful with lots of puzzles that were challenging and rewarding to solve. very fun with a group of friends. highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: I played Special ops and playground and they were the best games I’ve ever done! Really immersive and really felt like I was there! And I got out of both! Definitely go check them out!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: This is a must do while in the Battery Park area. By far a fun and unique experience. We had a group of 8 ranging from ages 7-48, the entire group participated and had a ball. This place is run extremely well, the staff is so helpful, intelligent, and eager to make your experience a great one. Shout out to Zach and Malik for making our experience top notch.

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: We went there with a group of experienced escape room players and we all agreed that this place is by far one of our favorites. Very immersive, well thought out and loads of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Definitely the most professional escape room business in the city. I was impressed and will be back again!

room_title: Escape room "Tesla's Mystery" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: One of the best escape rooms we have done! Well designed - really cool wow factor features. We did the Tesla room, which was challenging, but our great host Neg coached us through with some clues for the extra tricky parts! Didn't make it out, but will go back to try another one soon!

room_title: Escape room "Tesla's Mystery" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: We did our first escape room ever today. It was extremely enjoyable and I believe it will soon be an addiction. Great production. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Tesla's Mystery" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: High quality rooms compared to most I've done, with very unique puzzles. Itching to come back for more!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Outdoors" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Husband and I took 6 grandkids and my daughter and we did the Great Outdoors. We almost made it to the last room. We had so much fun. This year two of the kids are down and the only thing they want to do (besides swimming) is Breaking out of Alcatraz!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Outdoors" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We have done two escape rooms Alcatraz and the great outdoors. Both are amazing the staff is super nice and the rooms are fun and immersive. We will be going back. Thanks guys!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Outdoors" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This was our first escape room experience and we had a great time trying "The Great Outdoors." Some of the challenges came to us quickly and some had us absolutely stumped. You can tell there was a lot of thought put into the scenario.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Outdoors" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Booked this activity for my birthday and had 11 of us playing the Haunted Great Outdoors. Surpassed our expectations as we all were working on various parts of the puzzle to try and get out. It really gets you thinking. In the end, time ran out... but we were soooo close and had a blast! Can't wait to try another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Outdoors" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We had such an amazing time! I loved all the hard work and creativity that went into creating our room. The staff was fun and friendly. We will definitely be back for the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Overgrown" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: Just finished the Overgrown room, it was super fun I highly recommend! The puzzles were fun and the theme was really cool and the time and work that went into making the room you can tell.

room_title: Escape room "The Overgrown" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: This place was incredible! We did The Overgrown and the puzzles were so well thought out and intuitive. It was very well created in that the room was nicely decorated to the theme and you can tell that the employees really care about the experience. Joe was our guide, and he was so enthusiastic and kind! I am definitely looking forward to coming back and trying the other room they offer!

room_title: Escape room "The Overgrown" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: Jacob was awesome! Very friendly staff! The Overgrown escape room was good! Very decorative! I'd recommend this room to any group!

room_title: Escape room "The Penitentiary" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: I've been to all three rooms at Omescape, and each room has a very different theme and feel from the other. For me personally the best one was the Penitentiary! It has a very cool laser tunnel and we were separated into two groups and had to work together to rescue the two that were locked up in a room and escaped together. We didn't solve the last puzzle in time to escape but were very close! Highly recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "The Penitentiary" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: I booked a Sunday evening penitentiary game for a group of my smartest friends and we had so much fun! Very engaging and everyone in my group adored it. The Cons:Finding this place takes time.It's in the middle of nowhere.They charge $15 for cutting a cake in the lobby - even if you cleaned after yourself.The Pros:The game is excellent. Play with complete strangers and you'll become close friends at the end of the 60 minutes.

room_title: Escape room "The Penitentiary" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: Completed the penitentiary room. It was super legit and all the items were of quality. Laser, mirrors, secret keys, the works!!! (I promise I doesn't take anything away!). Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Worth the drive up. Will probably come back for another room. Challenging but definitely able to solve it.

room_title: Escape room "The Penitentiary" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: We came here last Friday for a team building exercise. It was really a lot of fun, even though we didn't escape from the penitentiary room. We actually got to the last stage, but just couldn't cross the finish line. However, the journey was much more enjoyable than the final results.

room_title: Escape room "The Penitentiary" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: Room Omega is not so hard (though we still failed to escape), but the Penitentiary is way harder and has more traps and information that try to confuse you. Really enjoyed my experience in Omescape today.

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Mummy" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Having fun and adventure in one place, Magiq room is what you need. I celebrated my birthday in here and I had so much fun. It was not just an ordinary birthday celebration but also a fun filled adventure time. We tried one of the escape rooms and my friends and I had so much fun escaping out of the room before the time is out. The clues and solving the puzzles made us closer to each other and the team work has unleashed in us. I recommend this place for a great Team Building place, surely your workmates and you will have a great time in here.

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Mummy" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Finally played Pharoah's Legacy! It's now one of my top 10 favorite rooms! (This was my 73rd room) Even though this place is great for kids and families, both times I've gone has been with adults and we've had a blast.The quality and production value in these rooms are amazing. Especially this room. This is the second pharaoh-themed room I've played and it's beautiful inside. The puzzles are fun and logical. There are physical puzzles and a passageway. I highly recommend this room for anyone. Beginners will have a great time and enthusiasts will enjoy what you get to do in this room.Our Gamemaster, Sophie, was amazing as well! Book them today!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Mummy" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Birthday party perfection for adults and children alike!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Mummy" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: SO MUCH FUN! Mixed group from 10 - 48 years old and we all had a blast in Pharoah's Tomb. Cannot wait to return soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate Crates" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Longmont
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Steal" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Even though my wife and I died in the end, we had an absolute blast!! This was the most fun, as well as the most frustrating and rewarding experience I have had since living here in Denver. This is an awesome idea for spicing up a date night. The staff is amazing and extremely friendly! I definitely recommend Puzzah for anyone looking for something fun and different!! #puzzah #datenight #tictoc #brainhurtsnow

room_title: Escape room "The Steal" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Very cool concept! We tried this last night for a friend's Birthday and loved it! Finally something different to do in LoDo (aside from your typical Edge, Crimson Room, etc shenanigans!) Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Steal" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Such a great time! We had 5 people and it was a blast. You have to push your thinking in different ways and trust me...you will be challenged in ways you can't guess. Some innovative creators have come up with a unique experience. Strongly suggest everyone gives it a try! Can't wait to go back again for a different room.

room_title: Escape room "The Steal" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Played "the steal" and had lots of fun! Just the husband and I, but it was great! The rules are easy to understand and the puzzles really make you think. Wish we had one like this closer to where we live in texas. Would Definitely recommend to my friends, absolutely worth the $$

room_title: Escape room "The Steal" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Had a blast in the Steal. Solved the puzzle with time to spare and kept the "alarms" really low. It was really interactive (no paper puzzles here) and well setup. A nice challenge that lets you exercise your brain while having fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Steal" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Fun activity that will either strengthen or end your relationships! Be mindful of who you take with you. In all seriousness we had a great time, thank you!

room_title: Escape room "The Steal" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Loved it! Great backstories on the puzzles, the staff member there was great and passionate about the place, and my group had a blast! Glad we beat Kazam with 4 seconds left

room_title: Escape room "13th Room" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: We really enjoyed our time at the 13th room. We will definitely be back. Dio was a great host to our experience!

room_title: Escape room "13th Room" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: First time doing an escape room and the 13th Room was great! Got us hooked! We will definitely be going back to experience the other two rooms.

room_title: Escape room "13th Room" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: Did the original 13th Room and it was such a fun experience. It's challenging but not to the point you can't get most of the clues. Plus, the staff there is awesome.

room_title: Escape room "13th Room" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: The 13th Room was my first escape room experience and I totally enjoyed it. I was a bit freaked out that it would be too scary but not at all. It was just the right amount of creepy to make it fun and exciting. I highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Curtain Call" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Casino Mob Boss" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Kaneohe
review: We've done a lot of escape rooms elsewhere and this is by far the best one we've done. We did the Casino Mob and though it has a low success rate it is well worth it, it was complex but had a lot of intriguing twists. Definitely give it a try.

room_title: Escape room "Casino Mob Boss" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Kaneohe
review: Highly recommended! I took my whole family to this. We've never done an escape game before and we had a blast! We did the Casino Mob Boss challenge and had such a wonderful time. One of the great highlights of our vacation. We'll definitely be signing up for another one when we come back again next year.

room_title: Escape room "The Bermuda Triangle Escape" by Clueology Rooms in Fort Collins
review: We had SO much fun!!!! What a great place with a great staff.

room_title: Escape room "The Bermuda Triangle Escape" by Clueology Rooms in Fort Collins
review: It was the perfect place for team building. our 6 managers were able to solve clues together. even though we failed to get out on time, it couldn't have worked out any better. We already new we were a great team, but this rewarding experience was a fun way to connect away from the workplace. Had an amazing time!!

room_title: Escape room "The Bermuda Triangle Escape" by Clueology Rooms in Fort Collins
review: It was so fun! Well run, great puzzles, amazing set up, and friendly staff. Will definitely be going back!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by Escape Port Charlotte in Fort Myers
review: My son had a blast with his friends today for his birthday Kidnapped experience. They didn't get out but still had fun and made some great memories!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by Escape Port Charlotte in Fort Myers
review: First time doing something like this. We did Kidnapped and although we did not get out in time, we had a blast! Very challenging!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by Escape Port Charlotte in Fort Myers
review: This was our first attempt at an escape room and we loved it. The Kidnapping was challenging and fun. We escaped with only 2:25 left and the excitement towards the end was exhilarating. We can't wait for the next trip.

room_title: Escape room "The Attraction" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Rendezvous at Dr. Frankenstein's" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Durango
review: This was our favorite activity during our stay in Durango. The kids group were able to escape the Dr. Frankenstein room while the adults ran out of time in the Jesse James room. We had so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Rendezvous at Dr. Frankenstein's" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Durango
review: My teenage boys and I partnered with another group of three and beat the Dr. Frankenstein room! We had a fun time figuring out the challenges. Call ahead to schedule a time.

room_title: Escape room "Rendezvous at Dr. Frankenstein's" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Durango
review: So much fun! Wasn't sure how well it would work with my 11 and 13-year-old kids, but the staff recommended the Frankenstein room and it was perfect! Happy to have stumbled across it.

room_title: Escape room "Mansion Murder" by Escapology Bethesda in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Red Rum Cottage" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: We had much fun doing the Red Rum Room. We had a party if 6 and a party of 2 joined us and together we had so much fun. I highly recommend this adventure. We can't wait to do another one!

room_title: Escape room "Red Rum Cottage" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: We had a really fun time! We laughed, we screamed, we used our brains and we escaped! The room was very well done, seriously impressive (we did the Red Rum Cottage). Our game master Courtney delivered her clues in character using a great spooky voice!

room_title: Escape room "Red Rum Cottage" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: We had an amazing time in the Red Rum Cottage. Unfortunately, we did not get out but looking forward to booking again. Our group of 6 paired well with the other four that booked the room. The room master was amazing! Such an awesome time - will definitely be coming back. If anyone is looking for something to do that is out of the norm I highly recommend the escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Red Rum Cottage" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: A really good time away from the world of electronics to have fun, use your brain and take a break from reality into a world of solving puzzles. A great time for all.

room_title: Escape room "Red Rum Cottage" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: Absolutely awesome experience! Very cleverly thought out room designs. My family went and we all loved it. I would HIGHLY recommend this place! It will not be easy, it will challenge your thinking but is definitely doable with cooperation. We escaped with just 45 secs to go. Will definitely do another!

room_title: Escape room "The Dorm Rooms" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Illusionist" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: Surprised by the glowing reviews of this room. My group of five has done about 20 escape room across the nation, and this was not the worst we've done, but not the best.The decor looked old, dirty, and worn out. It also seemed quite sparse, like someone threw this room together hastily in their garage or something. The puzzles were okay, but one of them seemed completely nonsensical and we're not sure how average folks are intended to guess how it works without assistance. Maybe we're dumb, but there's only one room we didn't completely in our entire history of playing escape games; And we rarely ever ask for clues..So, who's to say?I would recommend the Six Shooter room over this one any day. Also - Locks locks locks galore! Not our favorite escape room attribute.

room_title: Escape room "The Illusionist" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: I did the illusionist room and it was amazing! The rooms were very well thought out and the puzzles were clever. All the puzzles were interactive and involved different mechanics. We had a large group, but there were plenty of puzzles for everyone to participate.

room_title: Escape room "The Illusionist" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: We went for a work outing and did the Illusionist room, the hardest one. It was a great time and the puzzles and clues were very well thought out. Every solve felt like an accomplishment and even all us tech support nerds barely solved it with less than 4 minutes left on the clock. Great time, recommend it for anyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Illusionist" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: We had such a great time. We may not have escaped however as first timers working the Illusionist room and 3 locks away..we're impressed. Thank you ACE of Escape!

room_title: Escape room "The Illusionist" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: We had a great time escaping from The Illusionist room today, with only seconds to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Salem witch" by Storm Out in Miami
review: My boyfriend and I wanted to do an escape room on a Friday, we've done several before, and we found Code to Escape in Hallendale Beach. We had a great time doing the Salem Witch room on Friday with Game Master Oscar. We then decided on Saturday we wanted to try one of the other five rooms there. Oscar recommended our next room to be the Hangover room so that's what we decided to do. We had a great time doing that room as well. The room was very creative and fun. We can't wait to do the other rooms at this establishment. They were challenging rooms and kept us thinking throughout the entire time period.

room_title: Escape room "Salem witch" by Storm Out in Miami
review: Host was the MOST and the rooms were satisfactorily challenging! Been to a handful of "rooms" before but this one added a couple new elements to the experience which I quite appreciated. Strong recommendation!

room_title: Escape room "Salem witch" by Storm Out in Miami
review: Had a really great time at Breakout Florida tonight! The room was set up very well and kept us engaged. Got out with 15 minutes to spare by working together and solving many creative/exciting "puzzles". The staff was welcoming and runs a great game!

room_title: Escape room "The Bomb" by MindQuest Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: I've done around 60 escape rooms, most of which in the south Florida area, and this one was up there with the best, regardless of your experience with escape rooms.While not taking advantage of a ton of technology in "The Bomb" room, the puzzles and theming were done very well. When rating escape rooms, I look for specific characteristics such as difficult and unique puzzles, good theming, a good story, etc. Mindquest's bomb room met all of those expectations.As I have done many escape rooms, it's important to reiterate that I believe this room to be good for people with all types of experience in escape rooms. Whether it's your first or your sixtieth, you'll still enjoy this room.

room_title: Escape room "The Bomb" by MindQuest Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: My office staff and I went to Mind Quest and did the Bomb room and it was a great time. There was 6 of us and we can't wait to go back and try another room.  We got out with 1.5 minutes to spare....  A good time was had by all.

room_title: Escape room "The Bomb" by MindQuest Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: Me and three friends decided to this for a girls night. We had such a great time that we ended up playing a second game. We played both Diamond Heist and The Bomb. Both games were exciting and challenging enough. Can’t wait to go back again. I highly recommend trying out your luck to see if you can escape!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: On yelp this room was listed as easy and not challenging. However, ever since they hired a new game master & revamped the room. it is definitely a more difficult room from before. My wife & I have done 29 room & this  Cabin was great. we did not get out in time & the clues were helpful & followed the story. I believe this room is now a 3-4 key  compared to other room with the same rating. WE Loved the room & great puzzles. we will be back for spaceship!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Just finished the Cabin today. It was a great room, although some of the puzzles were difficult, it wouldn't be fun if it was too easy! Very well done and thought out.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: My first escape room experience was a lot of fun. The puzzles in The Cabin were definitely challenging. Our group had somewhat limited escape room experience overall, but we did escape, with just over 11 minutes left! Looking forward to returning when the Spaceship room opens!

room_title: Escape room "Starship Libra" by 101 Escape Rooms in Ventura
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Path" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: One of the more memorable escape rooms I have done, the design was excellent, both in the room and the puzzles themselves. It was great change of pace to do a room that didn't use any conventional lock puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "The Path" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We had such a great time here on a Thursday night!!! The customer service was great and the room was SO FUN!!

room_title: Escape room "The Path" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This is a really fun place and the staff are really nice and helpful stop in for some unique challenges!

room_title: Escape room "The Path" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: I just finished their two new rooms, The Path and Curse on the Emerald Sea, at their new location and I must say that they were both quite well done and very indicative of the care they put into the business. Both rooms had great set designs, ambiance, and the puzzles were creative and, excluding one that I just wasn't getting for a bit, just the right side of difficult but achievable. I want to also praise the staff, they were all friendly and funny and each had their own unique style that I think really brings an air of friendliness to the business that you don't see in a lot of escape rooms. They clearly care about you having a good time. If you're looking for something to do I really recommend giving these rooms a try, where else can you find yourself in the hold of a ship, a zen garden, search for a magical creature, and help save a city in one day? Go, go do it now.

room_title: Escape room "History Mystery" by Rock Ave Escape Room in Tampa
review: Always have a great experience at this place. Love the technology and love the employees! After doing over a hundred of rooms, so glad to have this so close by.

room_title: Escape room "History Mystery" by Rock Ave Escape Room in Tampa
review: We had a lot of fun. Great place.

room_title: Escape room "History Mystery" by Rock Ave Escape Room in Tampa
review: Great experience! The staff is pleasant and helpful. The room we did was pretty difficult but we came seeking a challenge! We definitely will be back to do the other rooms in the future. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Excalibur" by The Escapist Denver in Denver

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by Escape Room Adventure in Daytona Beach
review: So much fun! I went with a group of 6 people for my birthday and it was a blast! We did the kidnap room. Highly recommend! The staff is super friendly and the place is great.

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by Escape Room Adventure in Daytona Beach
review: We had so much fun in the kidnap room! Can't wait to go back for The Hustle!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by Escape Room Adventure in Daytona Beach
review: It was our very first time doing an escape room. We did it as a family, had an awesome time. Escape the kidnapped room with eight minutes to spare. Highly suggest it!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by Escape Room Adventure in Daytona Beach
review: We did the Kidnapped room with a part of 7. It was an awesome time and definitely makes you think and work as a team. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by Escape Room Adventure in Daytona Beach
review: I was totally surprised! Really clever and fun I would recommend this for any group (couples, coworkers, friends) it was hilarious and full of adrenaline!!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Scene 2.0" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: This place was soooooooooo cool! I went here for my birthday with my sisters and bf we had so much fun! We range in age from 15-27 and everyone was an asset in different areas of finding clues which was cool to see. It's definitely something I would do again. We did the Murder room and it was HARD but I loved it! I want to try the bunker room and the temple which is their newest room. The staff is really good at making this a good experience.

room_title: Escape room "Murder Scene 2.0" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: Perfect group bonding activity to test your problem solving skills and ability to think fast. I highly recommend trying out Xcape Room Fresno. The Murder Room was my favorite because of the unexpected surprise to solve the case. You and your friends definitely won't forget the experience!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Scene 2.0" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: We had such a great time!!!! The Murder Room was so much fun. We went with a very diverse group and everybody loved it. The staff was awesome, great way to spend some quality time together

room_title: Escape room "Murder Scene 2.0" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: Definitely worth every penny!! A lot more tricky than we thought. Murder scene was great! Will be coming back for the other scenes!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Scene 2.0" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: I have never done something like this, but i went for my birthday with my family. It was AMAZING. The staff was very nice friendly, the environment was excellent and puzzles were very cool. The puzzles were challenging and definitely required thought, but not so difficult that it caused frustration. We did the Murder Scene room and even though we didn't get out in the time, tonight's experience would definitely encourage me to recommend it to my friends and go back to try again. Thank you Xcape Room for an awesome experience!!

room_title: Escape room "Temple" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: The Temple room is awesome! I really had fun with my friends.

room_title: Escape room "Temple" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: Did the Temple! Tons of fun! Tyler was awesome, but unfortunately our party did not escape in time!

room_title: Escape room "Temple" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: I took my middle school aged son. We were joined by 4 other people that booked the same time we did. The staff did a great job in making sure we would be a good pairing. We did the Temple room and had an amazing time. We were able to solve all clues and escape the room. I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Temple" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: We had a blast. We had a group of 8 and did the temple room and it was tough and challenging! The staff was awesome and only one of our group had done an escape room before so we were all nervous! I highly recommend this place and highly recommend the temple room!

room_title: Escape room "Temple" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: We had an amazing time escaping the Temple room. It was challenging and the room looked incredible. The staff was friendly too.

room_title: Escape room "Chamber of Hocus" by Novus Escape Room in Dover
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Alice in Wonderland" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Just did Alice in Wonderland and it was amazing! we had a great moderator as well. We did Dracula last time didn't love it as much and our moderator who was a female don't her name was not very friendly. But Alice in Wonderland is great!

room_title: Escape room "Alice in Wonderland" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loved Alice and Wonderland! Super fun and challenging. Victoria was the best game master too!

room_title: Escape room "Alice in Wonderland" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: First time doing an escape room game (Alice in Wonderland room), and it was so much fun! Challenging puzzles, but not difficult to the point of frustration. Seems like a good room for first-timers. And Victoria, the game master, was great!

room_title: Escape room "Alice in Wonderland" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: In terms of the theme, this one is probably my favorite out of all the ones that  I have done. I attempted this room as a group of 2 and I felt like we could have definitely used an extra brain or 2 for this room. Overall we had a blast doing this room as our game master was definitely helpful in pushing us in the right direction. The room was well made, with all the techy and non-techy parts of the room. Overall we had a great experience with this room.

room_title: Escape room "Alice in Wonderland" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We recently escaped the new Alice in Wonderland room at 60out. This room is on the bottom floor and is accessed by their new lobby area. The room had great production value and is definitely the cutest, brightest, and most colorful room there. It is also challenging and has a variety of puzzles, good tech, and some playful challenges that might best be managed by a group of 4 people. We had one mechanical issue, but it didn't affect the flow of the game.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Beast" by Escape-topia in Miami
review: SO much fun!! Nobody in our group of 4 has ever done an escape room before. We loved it and had a blast! Kraig was awesome and made it a really great experience for us! Highly recommend. We did the Beast room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Beast" by Escape-topia in Miami
review: Kraig was the best host ever! We had a group of 10 and escaped the Beast (barely!) family fun but great for all!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Beast" by Escape-topia in Miami
review: This place is fantastic! Right when you walk in you are immersed in the feel of a spooky hotel and it's so well designed and decorated. The warm-up puzzles and the puzzles in the room were very challenging and it was satisfying when you could figure them out! Unfortunately, we couldn't Escape the Beast but we will return to Escape some Zombies!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Beast" by Escape-topia in Miami
review: Very cool room and interesting puzzles! I love the whole haunted/spooky hotel room theme from the Escape the Beast room. One of the best escape rooms I've done so far! Very detailed and challenging. Friendly staff and nice decorations. Will be back to do the zombies!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Bake Off" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: great escape games! all are well themed and fun to do

room_title: Escape room "The Bake Off" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: It was a lot of fun with my family.

room_title: Escape room "The Bake Off" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: It was a lot more fun than I expected it. Our whole group enjoyed it very much. These guys did a great job. thank you.

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Mary" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: Fun and the staff was friendly!!!Great time!

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Mary" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: super nice staff!it was a great way to spend time with the family ❤️

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Mary" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: Looking for something fun to do with friends, family, clients, employees? Got guests at home and it’s a rainy day or too hot? This is the place to go!Went for the 1st time this weekend with my husband. This is the smallest room, which makes sense to do it as it was only 2 of us. We worked well as a team (we have our disagreements very often at home). The staff is excellent, so helpful, the rooms are well done, easy access and no problem with parking. I’m not gonna lie, we failed... we ask for clues, but we couldn’t make. But it was sooooo fun! I can’t wait to go again and try a different room.

room_title: Escape room "Discoveries Through Time" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: We didn't know what to expect and it was definitely a challenge for our group, but what fun. We all want to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Discoveries Through Time" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: I took my 13 year old son and two of his best friends (aged 14) to Hot Springs for spring break. It's a tough age to please. However, Escape Hot Springs was the hit of the vacation! We went to the room of famous scientists/discoveries through the ages. The boys loved their first escape experience and immediately wanted to try a second room. I highly recommend this to anyone with teenagers to entertain. It was cleverly done and the staff were helpful and encouraging...especially with three distraught teens as the time ticked away......

room_title: Escape room "World War II Bunker" by Time Lock Escape Room in Tampa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape Artist" by The Great Escape Room in Tampa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes - Moriarty's Parlor" by Mystery Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Transfiguration" by Unlock Escape Rooms in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Apocalypse" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: The Good:. I booked the alien encounter for my daughters and two friends in Sept 2016. They enjoyed it very much. They had a few "scares" and creepy moments which delighted them, and the puzzles made them think outside the box. They had to work together and really think things out which really was cool. The staff member (only met one) was incredibly nice. We all filled out the liability waiver before arriving but it didn't go through apparently and we had to do it again, this could pose a problem for under aged minors who need parental consent. You may want to call to ensure all is well before bringing kids that don't belong to you. There were two other groups there that said they also filled waiver out online and it didn't "stick".Downside: other escape rooms have monitors in lobby so those not participating can watch their party. I just had to sit there for an hr. would have been nice to watch them. Also, 5pts area is a hell hole. I just wish this wasn't in such a bad part of town. Two of the girls went back to car before starting and were approached by two different men trying to talk to them. No way would I want them down there alone and after hearing this, I wanted to shoot myself for letting them go back to car alone. Once inside Paranoia we felt safe, but walking from car not so much. I did see several APD through window while inside.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Apocalypse" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: I had an excellent time at Area 51's room with several of my friends. 5th best time for the year woo hoo! Also auditable thanks to Tanya James our ST.

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: This is some serious fun. Grab a group of 4-8 people and head over there before they get so popular that you can't get in. This game will spark your creativity as well as challenge you to think. I'm hooked and can't wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: We loved our time here!! Blitzkrieg was so much fun and we already can't wait to go back & try The Cure! We will definitely recommend this place to everyone. The staff is so friendly and it was just an overall great experience! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: Teenage boys had a great time working through Blitzkrieg, and they are determined to give the Cure a shot!

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: We had a group of 8 in the Blitzkrieg room with ages 13 thru 40. Every one of us had a great time and truly enjoyed ourselves. We are already planning our next adventure of finding The Cure.

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: Three of us did the Blitzkrieg escape room and it was tons of fun! We're planning on doing more. The staff was nice and helpful.

room_title: Escape room "The Speakeasy" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: I’m an escape room addict at this point- I’ve done almost 20 of these!  This is my first one at 21 keys, I went with a group of 4 from work.  The atmosphere was really good, and the puzzles were challenging without being frustrating.  I definitely recommend this place.  I’ll be back for some of their other rooms

room_title: Escape room "The Speakeasy" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: This was our first time doing an escape room and we loved it! The Speakeasy room game was challenging but the puzzles were still able to be solved. Everyone in our group had a blast and we all want to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "The Speakeasy" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: Went with a group of 10 and had so much fun! Just hard enough to feel challenging but not so much that it felt frustrating. Will definitely be returning.

room_title: Escape room "The Speakeasy" by 21 Keys Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: This was so much fun. I really liked that they made it really clear what wasn't a clue to avoid wasting time without ruining the challenge of it. We had a group of 10 and everyone got to be involved without feeling like we were standing on top of each other. 100% will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Lancaster Manor" by Way Out Games in Carrollton
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Ripper" by The Escapery in Atlanta
