review: Olivia is rude at this establishment, the rooms are less than mediocre.

room_title: Escape room "Ripper" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: What a fun night with the family. Our first Escape room and we ALMOST made it although we couldn't same the girl, we couldn't name the correct suspect, we will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Ripper" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: We had a great time today catching Jack the Ripper and freeing his final victim! Natalie made every minute a pleasure! Thank you! Can't wait for Silo!

room_title: Escape room "Ripper" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: Tonight was our 2nd time coming to The Escapery with my mom, my brother, and myself and we've loved it both times! The Ripper mystery was fun and creepy and just made for a great night John was a great friendly host from walking through the door, and gave us the perfect amount of advice to let us barely beat the room!Very fun, very challenging, and very rewarding

room_title: Escape room "Ripper" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: An extremely fun experience. If you're looking for a night of fun with friends, I highly recommend The Escapery for a night of mystery solving adventure!The team there were extremely polite and helpful. The mystery (we did The Ripper) was challenging, but all the information was at our fingertips to solve the quandary.

room_title: Escape room "Ripper" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: Highly enjoyed spending a part of my 50th birthday at The Escapery. We escaped our Jack the Ripper room and can't praise the facility and staff enough! All 7 of us had an amazing time and feel sure that we will return again to try our hands at a different room.

room_title: Escape room "Ripper" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: So much fun! An excellent setup. It was like we were actually in the real investigation of Jack the Ripper. The puzzles really challenged us, they sure were tough! But our guide was extremely helpful and very cool. An excellent date night.

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: My group of 7 did the Initiation Room. Great staff, room immersion, and puzzles. Highly recommend this as a group event!

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: So much fun! Did the Initiation. I'd say 5 people is a perfect amount for that room. The other rooms apparently are bigger so maybe more for them. Loved the service and the ambiance. Difficulty was perfect for us 5. Will definitely return for the other rooms. Completed the secret society in 53 minutes. Not bad for the first time!

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: So much fun! We did the initiation room tonight and it was a blast! There were 7 of us, and it took us all but one minute to escape! Definitely a great group activity! I can't wait to go back! Thank you for a fun night!

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Our group did the Initiate Room. At first look it seems like an easy task, until you begin to look at the details. After 52 minutes and 20 seconds, we found the final clue and Beat the Room. What a great time! I highly recommend it if you are looking for something fun to do. Good Luck in there.

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: We did this for my birthday and it was a blast!! The ambience of the location was really neat the put a lot of detail into the business. We did the Secret Society Room and it was well done. There were lots of interesting clues and tricks to each room. They also make sure it's fun for any skill level by helping you if you need it. We wouldn't have finished in time without there help, so even though we didn't get on the leader board we got to complete the room. Great for skilled intellectuals and fun for newbies. I definitely can't wait to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Missing" by Kingdom Keys NWA in Centerton
review: Decided to do the Missing escape room with my four young adult (20s) children during their visit for Christmas. It was definately challenging but so much fun. They were initially concerned that it would be all "Bible stuff." Most clues were very general, with little to no Bible knowledge required. We didn't make it out, but had so much fun and got pretty close to finding the keys. This would be great for a little family bonding, get together with friends, or even team building.

room_title: Escape room "Western Renegades" by Extreme Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: I've done a good number of escape rooms now, and this ranks high on the list! The waiting area is thoughtfully outfitted with some fun little table games, water, and even chocolate kisses. Then a kind and nice guy led us to the Asylum Room. It looks bare at first, but it is absolutely packed with interesting surprises, sensors, puzzles, logic games, and a few special effects. We definitely needed our three clies. Will return to do the Party in Vegas Room for sure!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Appointment on a weeknight was easy to set up for my team of 10. My coworkers and I had a blast escaping the Asylum. It was challenging, and the clues provided were helpful without giving the answers away completely. We dressed in the gowns they had, which was definitely a nice touch. Decor was on point as well. I was very impressed with the amount of technology at this escape room; it's a change from the other escape rooms I've played! Will be back when they introduce a new room!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: The Asylum room was just amazing! It's a step up from all the other escape rooms that I tried in San Francisco. Don't wanna give spoilers, but it was so real.. and creepy lol. Great narrative as well... based on a true story. Hosts are super friendly and funny. Definitely will check out their other rooms!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Two friends and I tried the Asylum. The room was immersive and well-done, and the puzzles were a lot of fun. The staff was friendly and informative.

room_title: Escape room "Closed Quarters" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Save the White House II" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: We did this as a team-building event for work. I thought it was really well-done! The staff was friendly. The puzzles were intriguing and progressively difficult. Some of the stuff was very, very clever, like using blacklights and lasers and cryptology. We were able to "Save the White House" with one minute and 30 seconds to spare! Intense!

room_title: Escape room "Save the White House II" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Had a blast in the White House room! Not scary and lots of great puzzles to solve!

room_title: Escape room "Save the White House II" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Had a group of 5 we did the save the White House escape room and had a great time! Spencer was our guide and he was awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Save the White House II" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: We went with two friends of ours. We did the save the White House room. We had a great time even though some in our party have mobility issues. We were able to solve the room with the hints and a little extra time but while we thought we would enjoy it the was a truly great experience and we are talking about going again!

room_title: Escape room "Save the White House II" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: My son wanted to go here for his 16th bday with the family. I have to admit I wasn't expecting it to be as fun as it turned out to be! We did the Oval office room and although we almost gave up, we found the bomb with 3 mins to spare! I would highly recommend this, it was a wonderful opportunity to work together and appreciate individual strengths! Hope to do it again very soon!

room_title: Escape room "Area 405" by The Escape Little Rock in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Bill and Ted's Excellent Escape Room" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
review: Had an awesome time! Bill and Ted’s most excellent adventure! Highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Bill and Ted's Excellent Escape Room" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
review: Fun impromptu day date! Easy online reservation. Great, helpful staff and fun time escaping the Bill & Ted’s room. So many fun details to the room. We look forward to returning for the other rooms! Perfect location near restaurants and shopping.

room_title: Escape room "Bill and Ted's Excellent Escape Room" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
review: We went through the Bill and Ted's escape, but they have other movie-themed rooms as well. The puzzles were good, but the rooms were way more unique and detailed than other escape games we've been through. Looking forward to heading back to try the Terminator room soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Hollywood Mystery: A Room Noir" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Pen" by Hellscream Room Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: Amazing! First time doing this with kiddos and was fun! Better than expected and a little more difficult than I thought. Really makes you use your brain! Great place, well decorated. Great actors, loved it!

room_title: Escape room "The Pen" by Hellscream Room Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: We joined a group for the pen escape. We selected normal difficulty and scary. There were multiple rooms to navigate through and several actors that came in and out adding to our experience. This was a great experience and I can’t wait to come back again. Now I’m really looking forward to the haunted house for Halloween!

room_title: Escape room "The Pen" by Hellscream Room Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: You will have a great time, just walking into the building was suspenseful! Everything down to details was amazing we opted for the scary version (which it's pretty Erie as it is) we did the Pen Escape room and it was a blast! The actors are amazing and the staff were accommodating! We are so excited to book another room with them! Hands down best escape room

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: This place is a win all around. I’ve never seen such well put together rooms. It was like the props you see at Disneyland. The stories were detailed and fun and the staff add extra icing on the cake for being the nicest people! I highly recommend, especially The Heist game.This place is a win all around. I’ve never seen such well put together rooms. It was like the props you see at Disneyland. The stories were detailed and fun and the staff add extra icing on the cake for being the nicest people! I highly recommend, especially The Heist game.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Our group of 4 did the heist escape room. Very fun with good interactive set, and the right balance of hard but solveable puzzles. The only thing is that I can't imagine having more than 5 or 6 people in that room - we were lucky enough to not get grouped with anyone else and thought 4 was the perfect size.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: All the doors were locked!!My group and I did the heist room. I was nervous at first because this was only my 2nd escape game ever but the staff were really warm and welcoming and room itself was a lot of fun. As we unlocked each door the puzzles got harder and harder. What I really liked was how well themed each room was. Really clean and nicely decorated. Even the mechanics of things opening and closing were really done well. I would definitely go again for another room.I went with a group of 8 total people(the max) and it felt a little too cramped at times so I would suggest to go with no more then 5 people.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Granted, this was our first time participating in an escape room game so we had no expectations, but it was really fun!  We can't wait to do it again. My Baby Boomer husband and I, along with our 22 year old son, joined a group of five young teens and we all had a blast in the "Heist" game which was extremely challenging and well thought out. Only one person in our group had participated in an escape room game before and when we left, all of us said we would highly recommend it. What an intense and exhilarating hour!  You won't be disappointed if the other games were as good as the Heist. The San Francisco location is brand new and the staff is doing a great job.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: This is probably one of my favorite escape room so far! We had a lot of fun in "The Heist" room. The puzzles and clues were very creative and well designed! Highly recommended for team building experience! We will definitely come back!

room_title: Escape room "Chaos in the Galleria" by Omescape in San Jose
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Rush Hour" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: I am a big fan of escape rooms. Did the Rush Hour room with just my boyfriend and I and it was a good mix of simple and complex. I felt that this helped the game progress at a good pace without being discouraging or obvious. The staff was AMAZING and SUPER polite.I am picky about my escape rooms and I can say that this one passed my expectation. Worth every dollar!

room_title: Escape room "Rush Hour" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: We did the Rush hour room. I did like how it's not linear, meaning you can be working on different things at different times. There were 3 of us in the room and I think that was enough. It is a small room, but it's meant to be on a train. They had screens that showed the city of Tempe passing by like you were on the light rail. Very nice touch. We all enjoyed the escape room and made it out with 10 minutes to spare and didn't even use all our clues!! WOOHOO!!Can't wait to try the other rooms there.Well decorated room and the staff was friendly and fun.

room_title: Escape room "Rush Hour" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: Our family of four had a great time at the Escape Zone. We did the Rush hour room and it was a lot of fun! We didn't make it out in time but we got pretty close! Great location in downtown Tempe near ASU!

room_title: Escape room "Rush Hour" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: Went here yesterday with my son and tried Rush Hour. The lady running the game was really nice. She spent time explaining things we had questions about and she answered our questions about upcoming rooms. The room was really fun and it had a lot of unique puzzles. Though we enjoyed the room and I recommend trying it, I would not recommend the room to beginners. We have done around 25 rooms, and this one was pretty tricky. We will definitely be back for their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Rush Hour" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: This is our third visit to this place! Today we did Rush Hour which had less clues and required more brain power. We had a great time and we were SUCCESSFUL!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Lost Workshop" by The Grand Detectives Society in Los Angeles
review: We had a lot of fun. Very challenging setup. The host put on a very entertaining show for everyone. We want to do it again for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Lost Workshop" by The Grand Detectives Society in Los Angeles
review: The smart detective approves. The Grand Detective's Society gives full access to the hottest mysteries, quandries, enigmas, curios, whodunnits, whodidndunnits, conspiracies, secrets and hopscotch.

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Lost Workshop" by The Grand Detectives Society in Los Angeles
review: What a GREAT time! The staff were great, making the whole experience even that much more pleasant. Very high quality puzzles and challenges, some humor, a few thrills and chills, and a wonderful time of teamwork!Great job, can't wait till you've got more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Shawshank v2" by Axxiom Escape Rooms Rehoboth in Rehoboth Beach
review: We had a great time in the Shawshank Room. We escaped with 4 minutes to spare. We definitely will be going back.

room_title: Escape room "Shawshank v2" by Axxiom Escape Rooms Rehoboth in Rehoboth Beach
review: Down to the line with only 3 seconds to spare we loved the Shawshank room! Definitely the best out of the 3 escape rooms we've visited. High quality and very intricate.

room_title: Escape room "Shawshank v2" by Axxiom Escape Rooms Rehoboth in Rehoboth Beach
review: We had an awesome time doing the Shawshank room! We escaped but barely! Definitely want to come back and try more rooms! Staff is great!

room_title: Escape room "Poindexter's Pad" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: Fantastic experience! We did "Mystery Mansion" with four people and were about 90 seconds shy of finishing in time. Meghan was our host and she did a great job making sure we had fun. Highly recommend and we'll definitely return!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: So good! I did the mystery mansion here and I plan to return for the others! The people were nice and they even started the game when we showed up too early.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: I had never been to an escape room before so I was excited about this. They let me in even though I was about 10 minutes late, which I thought was particularly nice. The puzzles are challenging, but I never felt uncomfortable being locked in the room. They have several different rooms. I did the mystery mansion room. I didn't know the people I was with, but they were awesome, and I came out with new friends! I'm so glad I tried this. I would definitely recommend this to my other friends and family. Thank you, Breakout!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: If you are looking for a fun night out this is the place to go. We had a blast doing Mystery Mansion. Our Game Master Oliver was very friendly and over all AMAZING! Having done multiple escape rooms, we really enjoy BreakOut games. When we needed a little help he gave us just enough of a hint to point us in the right detection with out giving to much away. We definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: The room beat us but we still had a blast. Mystery Mansion was tough one. the crew was awesome. Working on plans to do this again. It's a great time with friends can't wait to try out other rooms soon.

room_title: Escape room "Damned" by Labyrinth Escape Games in Boise
review: Amazing experience!!! We will definitely be returning again soon. Would definitely recommend for anybody looking to have an awesome time.

room_title: Escape room "Damned" by Labyrinth Escape Games in Boise
review: We went with a group of friends and went to “damned” which awesome if you love horror. We were surprised at what “personalized” horror experience really meant! We have already been back and have done the WW2 bunker which was also amazing. We can’t wait until we can go back a 3rd time! The staff has also always been awesome and it’s fun how they really get into character to make things more real.

room_title: Escape room "Damned" by Labyrinth Escape Games in Boise
review: Enjoyed 2 amazing escapes, Damned and Operation Longbow, last night with my crazy group of 8 friends! I cannot express enough how wonderful this escape room is! For starters, all of the staff including the game masters, hostess and co-owner treated us right from the very start. A huge thank you to all of then for making our adventure special!! Then to experience rooms that are well dressed, challenging and incredibly exciting really sealed the deal! We cannot wait to return for more rooms in the future!!!

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Tiki Lounge" by Kauai Escape Room in Kauai
review: Really well done and challenging rooms!  We just had a family vacation in Kauai and did 2 rooms while vacationing. Such a great whole family experience. I loved the Tiki room theme. We've done a lot of escape rooms in a lot of cities and these hold up with the best.

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Tiki Lounge" by Kauai Escape Room in Kauai
review: Amazing. Did the scientist room earlier this year, and just did the new Curse of the Tiki Lounge. Both rooms are incredibly fun with fantastic decor to make the entire experience believable.

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Tiki Lounge" by Kauai Escape Room in Kauai
review: Had a group of 4 for the Tiki room mystery and it was a blast! We barely solved the mystery in time! Highly recommend for great date night, rainy day activity or just fun with friends! We'll definitely be back for the other stories!

room_title: Escape room "Tomb of the Forgotten" by The Markey Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: This place is great for a double date! Reserving an escape room for 4 people ensures you have the room to yourself. We had an AWESOME time adventuring through the Tomb of the Forgotten. We had a few hints along the way, but none were too obvious to where we feel like we were handed the answer to it. Very well designed and operated! We will be coming back.

room_title: Escape room "Tomb of the Forgotten" by The Markey Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: We loved this place! The tomb room was very well made and thought out. I loved how interactive and theatrical it all was. It was a wonderful date night! (:

room_title: Escape room "Tomb of the Forgotten" by The Markey Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: It was just the two us trapped in ancient Egypt, trying to solve the puzzles before the sun went down, unfortunately we are still trapped in the tomb.   This was a great outing, almost solved it utilizing only a few clues.   Variety of puzzles to solve, good props, friendly family business, will be back when the next rooms open!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Quest" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: Amazing! Had a blast in the Sorcerers room. Can't wait to be back to do more.

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Quest" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: We went to the Sorcerers Dragons Lair. The room was so well decorated it was not hard at all to become immersed in the adventure. Some good effects added to the scene and a few surprises as well. We divided and conquered, working on each of our strengths. A very interesting logic puzzle nearly undid us near the end, but we prevailed! An informative discussion with the operator allowed us to learn even more so we can work on more difficult adventures next time... and we will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Quest" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: The Sorcerer's Quest room exceeded all expectations. It was like actually stepping into the Headmaster's office. The puzzles were challenging but not frustrating. It was a magical and fun experience and I want to do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Quest" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: We did two fun rooms at the Newark location. Our family was not able to get out of the Pirates Cove room, but we did get to the last clue so we had a shot. Lots of cool tech in the room, only a few manual locks. Good for a smaller group.The second room was Sorcerer’s Quest - The Dragon’s Lair. Our two young children loved it. We were able to get out with about four minutes to go. This room was all tech locks and actions, and had some interesting concepts we’ve not seen before (and I have done 53 rooms).Bill the owner is very personable and the staff is friendly. Thank you for an enjoyable time.

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Quest" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: My Team and I did the Sorcerers Dragon Room in Newark. It was a great experience. Well worth the trip.

room_title: Escape room "Greybeard's Treasure" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: So much fun! We went with two other couples and it was a really fun group date night. The staff was courteous​ and informative- none of us had ever been to an escape room before. We did Greybeard's Treasure and everyone thought the game was very well executed. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Greybeard's Treasure" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: My husband and I did Graybeards Treasure room today and loved it! There were puzzles at every corner and it was truly a challenge but we managed to escape with 8 minutes left. Staff was very friendly and helpful with clues to subtly steer you in the right direction. Will definitely be back for the attic!

room_title: Escape room "Greybeard's Treasure" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: We had a great time in Greybeards treasure! We had a group of six. Very challenging and fun! Definitely will be back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Mystic Chamber" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: We were visiting family in Denver and decided to do an escape game! After doing some research we all agreed on Conundrum. We had such a great time! The man who greeted us was super friendly and informative. The room itself was really great. We played Mystic Chambers. Without giving away too much about it - I will say I was impressed with the special effects it had. I would definitely go back! Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Mystic Chamber" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: I was skeptical at first. This was my first escape room experience, and I guess I expected it to be cheesy. But it wasn't, it was so well done and we really enjoyed ourselves. We went with four of us (two couples) and it was exactly the right size group for the mystic chambers room. 6 would be okay but 4 is better. We went for my husbands birthday and it was a really great time. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Mystic Chamber" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: The escape room puzzles were challenging, but not frustrating. The setup, story, and rooms were fun and it was great solving a mystery with my friends!

room_title: Escape room "Mystic Chamber" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: We've done a few escape rooms before and this was among the best we've done! If you're looking for a fun group activity, give it a shot - you won't be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "Mystic Chamber" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: Conundrum is great! The puzzles are unique, the theme and decorations well done, and you really feel immersed in the story. We will definitely be back and encourage others to try this escape room-you won't be disappointed.

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in the Bermuda Triangle" by Escape Countdown in Fort Myers
review: We had a great time navigating the Bermuda Triangle! I would definitely recommend going to Escape Countdown.

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in the Bermuda Triangle" by Escape Countdown in Fort Myers
review: The staff were amazing! Super personable and friendly. Enjoyed the Bermuda room and can't wait to try the others soon!

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in the Bermuda Triangle" by Escape Countdown in Fort Myers
review: Awesome experience! Our party of 16 split into two groups for Jail Break and Trapped in the Bermuda Triangle and both were so much fun! The staff was so friendly and made the experience extra special. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in the Bermuda Triangle" by Escape Countdown in Fort Myers
review: My husband and I tried out the Trapped in the Bermuda Triangle room and it was awesome. We loved all the puzzles in the room and the staff was super friendly and they really got into their roles. We are definitely going back and would recommend for anybody that enjoys doing puzzles and want to break free from the everyday monotony for an hour.

room_title: Escape room "Timescape" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: We played TimeScape and had an absolute blast! The staff and cluemaster were excellent and the scenario was well-designed, clever, and filled with surprises. I've done many escape rooms and highly recommend this scenario (even though we were close we didn't beat it... but the clear rate is 12% and it's super fun)!

room_title: Escape room "Timescape" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: After we did the Timescape room last night (we got a new 2nd place record!), I was completely surprised by how much fun I had! Having never done an escape room before, we had no idea what to expect... Epic Escape Rooms delivered a completely engrossing, thrilling, complicated and clever experience that I can't wait to try again. Thanks so much for such a great time!!!

room_title: Escape room "Medieval" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Lots of fun! I can't wait to go back! My friends and I did the Medieval room. Can't wait to try the western room next!

room_title: Escape room "Medieval" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: This was awesome! The Medieval room was an exciting adventure. My husband and I worked as a team trying to beat the clock. We can't wait to go back for another fun date night and couples building. As well as to go back with the kids. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Medieval" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Great addition to the San Diego escape room scene :)Came on a Sunday with a group of 8 (mixed experience levels), to do one of the "easier" rooms - Medieval. Employees were super friendly, and the intro video gives backstory to your experience. I was absolutely wow'd entering the room. Great design and attention to detail. Unfortunately, there were a couple of disappointing things, including one of the puzzle pieces being broken. If you were inexperienced with escape rooms, this might be a blocker. Yet they opened just recently and I'm sure will work out all of the kinks.

room_title: Escape room "Medieval" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Solid escape room experience. We did the "Medieval Room" with a group of 8 on a Sunday. Staff was friendly and accommodating of our group and schedule. We made a reservation in advance, and the entire event ran smoothly. We had the room for an hour, and it took us about 30-minutes to complete all of the puzzles without hints. It felt shorter than other escape rooms I've done, but the size of our group could have easily impacted that.SLOPS: Medieval Room puzzles felt a bit easy. That being said, this WAS labeled as "medium difficulty."

room_title: Escape room "The Office: Race To Erase" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I had the most fun time here today than I had in years. I have never done an escape room and I can't wait to come back again!!!! We chose the Race to Erase and it was challenging. WE all worked together and brought in our own unique talents. When we ran out  of time, and mentioned to the sweet young lady working there that our "hint button" didn't seem to respond in time, she added 10 minutes - as no one was waiting for the room, and  we finished the rest ( with a little help from her too!). I love love love this place. Everyone in the other rooms came out laughing and looked like they did equally.  The help, attitude, and also easy location added even more icing on the cake. thank you for a great time during the  Thanksgiving holiday. We had a multitude of choices of rooms AND times

room_title: Escape room "The Office: Race To Erase" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The Office- Played this as a group of 3 and we loved it! We got through the first clues in no time and the GM even asked "Have you guys done this before?" (We hadn't). Got stuck on two of the puzzles but after asking for a hint we figured it out and noticed that the answer was right under our noses the entire time! This room was higher tech than than the others at Amazing Escape! Looking back at it, this room was one of the easiest (If wouldn't have gotten stuck on the ones we had to ask for hints on. PS read clues throughly!). When we got to the last puzzles we had 3 minutes left and we finally escaped with 0.5 seconds left!!! A very close call!

room_title: Escape room "The Office: Race To Erase" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: A nice room, but not the best I've ever done

room_title: Escape room "The Office: Race To Erase" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We tried our hand at the "Office" with a group of four. The gamemaster was helpful and funny. I can't be too specific about the details of the room, but it was definitely well thought out, complex, and continued to keep us captivated throughout our time limit. I took a star off for the overall appearance of the place; it's a bit run-down.

room_title: Escape room "The Office: Race To Erase" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Came here yesterday as a group of 4 for "The Office" room. Got paired up with another group of 4 and successfully took on the room together with just seconds to spare.  Was a really fun experience and the clues were well designed. Would definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Saving Christmas" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: We just went to celebrate a birthday!!! We had a blast!!!

room_title: Escape room "Saving Christmas" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: very fun! we loved the Christmas themed room.🔎🎅🎄🔐

room_title: Escape room "Saving Christmas" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: We went to Save Christmas. It was awesome! We were there with another family and we had a great time! We will definitely do this again. It was a great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh" by Big Escape Rooms in Washington, D.C.
review: It was a lot of fun! We were trying out a new room, so there were a few things that didn't go as planned. It was challenging, but we finished with 3 minutes to spare yay! Brian was very helpful.

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh" by Big Escape Rooms in Washington, D.C.
review: So much fun! We tried the newest room and although it had the kinks, it was a lot of fun and we still succeeded! I can't wait to try another room here. I highly recommend it. Brian was a great help for the clues to the room and loves our input.I'll be back soon!

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh" by Big Escape Rooms in Washington, D.C.
review: Been to tons of these across the country, but this had a very friendly and relaxed staff which made a chill environment for being locked in a room. We did the Pharaoh room and it was quite challenging but rewarding! Will be coming back!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: Second time here, did the Zombie Lab, extremely fun. Personally I find this one better than the Bank, but others do not share my opinion. We saved the world with 38 seconds to spare.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: The Zombie Lab did not disappoint! The room was very detailed with just enough props to get your mind thinking. The puzzles and clues reflected the storyline. My group of three did escape and only need a few hints. I look forward to returning to try the zodiac killer room.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: The Zombie Lab was my 30th escape room and it was a blast! The room is very immersive, the clues are given through a TV in the room and the game host was amazing. The room itself was very well done, the puzzles were unique to the other 29 escape rooms I have done and they were cohesive to the theme. Now that I have done this room, I can't wait to come back to do their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Bethesda in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "When Words Fail - Spy Escape" by Grande Royal Escape in Jacksonville
review: We had a great time in the British spy room. We'll try another room next year!

room_title: Escape room "When Words Fail - Spy Escape" by Grande Royal Escape in Jacksonville
review: I booked the British spy room for my husband's birthday not expecting much because my husband and I are veteran haunted house type people and big into mystery and puzzles BUT we were pleasantly surprised! The room was small but the puzzle made up for it in every way, we had so much more fun than I expected!The gentleman who worked the building was so friendly and helpful with any questions I had prebooking they deserve five stars just for their customer service itself, they even had no problem with me bringing my 16 month old son when I couldn't get a sitter.

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Mary" by Room Raiders in West Palm Beach
review: I’ve done three different rooms at different places. This one was BY FAR the best! We had a blast in the Bloody Mary room.

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Mary" by Room Raiders in West Palm Beach
review: This was my first time doing an escape room and it was great!  It was challenging and fun to solve the riddles.  We did Bloody Mary and the Asylum and they were both scary and fun!  This is a great team activity and the owners are awesome.  Kim helped guide us how to start and made us feel very welcome.  Can't wait to go back and try other rooms.  They said they are always changing things up to make it a different experience every time.  She was also telling us about the kid friendly room to come back and do with the little ones.  Thank you for giving us an experience we will never forget!

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Mary" by Room Raiders in West Palm Beach
review: I've done both asylum and bloody Mary here. If you have to choose between these 2 rooms I would choose bloody Mary. Both rooms were very well decorated to get you into the theme. The game master we had was great, he helped us just enough to finish with only seconds left to spare. The bloody Mary room had many electromagnetic locks which I always love.

room_title: Escape room "Plantation Mystery" by Escape Hilo in Hilo
review: I'm in love with escape rooms! Escape Hilo - thank you for finally bringing this here! You’re given a little history of the old plantation days and then are sent on a mission to retrieve Jiro’s sword (an old family heirloom). This is definitely not the easiest escape room I’ve done BUT the harder they are the more exciting they are! Can’t wait to see what other rooms will be developed!

room_title: Escape room "Plantation Mystery" by Escape Hilo in Hilo
review: We took our grandchildren, we didn't escape in time but had lots of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Plantation Mystery" by Escape Hilo in Hilo
review: So much fun! I was a like worried as we had no previous knowledge of Japanese history, but it was not required. We had two 9-year-olds with us and they had a blast too! Can’t wait for their next challenge.

room_title: Escape room "Arrested" by Open Door Escape Games in Redlands
review: We went to the STUDY it was hands down a very unique experience we had  a blast we didnt "escape" but it was still super entertaining while fun cant wait to try our luck at Arrested

room_title: Escape room "Arrested" by Open Door Escape Games in Redlands
review: Awesome fun. The clues and room were very interactive and fit the theme. Two thumbs up.

room_title: Escape room "Arrested" by Open Door Escape Games in Redlands
review: Great experience! This was our first time and we are hooked. We were met by a friendly host, everything was explained to us, and we loved every minute. We will definitely be back for more. Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Espionage 2: Under Fire" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: I went with a large group of people, and we really enjoyed this room. We had small groups working on several clues at once. Our only complaint was some of the clues were too difficult, and the hint didn't help us that we spent a majority of the last 20 minutes in the room stuck. It was one of the most detailed escape rooms I've been to, and if you are looking for a challenge, i recommend it!!

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: I was looking for a fun activity to do with my family and came across Escape Quest. We had a blast working together to solve the puzzle of “The Bunker.” I am am definitely going to go back and do the other rooms as well. Also, the staff working there are great which really makes the experience even better!

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: Very fun! The staff was friendly and the room we were in, The Bunker, was very challenging. Creative and a great time with friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: Took my son for his birthday and it was a hit. We had so much fun escaping The Bunker with only 4 seconds left! Definitely going back!

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: I've been twice (Black Widow and The Bunker) and I've had a blast both times! The employees are amazing and the rooms are so good! I plan to return to do the other 3 rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Quest in Washington, D.C.
review: I had so much fun at the bunker room. Yes and we successfully beat the room!

room_title: Escape room "Last Resort" by Panic Room CT in Stamford
review: Great room with a lot of solid clues! Excellent staff! We did the Last Resort. Very clever setup and definitely kept you on your toes!

room_title: Escape room "Last Resort" by Panic Room CT in Stamford
review: We had a really great time in the Last Resort. It was our first time and it was very difficult but through teamwork, we figured it out and escaped with less than 2 minutes to go. The staff was excellent and we would come back again for a different room.

room_title: Escape room "Sector 8 - Area 51" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: Great family fun!!! Customer service was fantastic!!

room_title: Escape room "Sector 8 - Area 51" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: Grandparents treated the teenage grandkids to the escape room -Area 51. We had a great time! The rooms and puzzles are very well done and the staff was funny, friendly, and super with the teenagers. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Sector 8 - Area 51" by Escape Room Clearwater Beach in Tampa
review: We did the Sector 8 (Area 51)  Escape Room. This was my first Escape Room experience and it was awesome. It was three of us in the room and it was very challenging. We didn't make it out in time, but the experience was well worth it. If you get stuck and are or spending too much time at an area where you are not advancing you can ask for a clue. I am looking forward to trying other Escape Room themes. It was fun and exciting. The game controller (can't remember his name) was very welcoming, nice, and helpful especially since this was our first time in an Escape Room.

room_title: Escape room "The Smuggler" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: We had such a great time doing their Smuggler room that we returned the following weekend to experience both their Legacy and Great Pirate Escape rooms.All three rooms were fun-filled, offered intriguing back stories and a great balance of riddles, puzzles, locks, and hidden secret mechanisms.  The attention to detail Brainy Actz puts into their rooms is way above the rest and makes for a fully-immersive and unforgettable experience.  Our game master was Austin, who did an amazing job hosting and guiding us through our games!Being escape roomaholics, we plan to visit all of their other locations and highly recommend their rooms to others in search of an amazing time!

room_title: Escape room "The Smuggler" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: We did the smuggler's room at this location earlier this week and had a great time! The room had a nice aesthetic, has a good layout and fits the needs of the backstory. Austin was very attentive, kind, and gave us clues only when needed. He was great and so we made sure to tip him accordingly! We completed the room with 18 minutes to spare, but it was a challenging room that requires critical thinking and teamwork. We will definitely be booking another room at this location soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Smuggler" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: We had the pleasure of playing the Smuggler room this past weekend.  The design was done very tastefully and the puzzles were challenging without being impossible.  As an added bonus, Austin, our game master, was a great host.  Our whole family had a a really fun time.  We can't wait to go back for another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Laboratory" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: I love escape rooms I've done tons in Los Angeles and came here with my family in Alabama. It's worth it! The puzzles for the lab are challenging and the people are great!

room_title: Escape room "The Laboratory" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: Really enjoyed our game. We did the Laboratory and while we were close, we didn't make it out. Game was fun, and really challenging. Would recommend the Warehouse first then work your way up through the tougher difficulties. We will be back to finish the other two rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Laboratory" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: We were in town for a gymnastics competition and decided to try this. There were 4 adults and 4 teenage girls in our group. We had a blast. So much fun. We did the laboratory room. We escaped with 2 minutes and 10 seconds left!

room_title: Escape room "The Laboratory" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: Came with my friend and her family for her birthday. We did the lab which has a 33% success rate. The timer started and we all went in different directions, each working on something different but ending up helping each other through problems. Finished with 14:41 to spare. It was challenging but totally fun. Can't wait to do the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Laboratory" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: Oh, so close!Visiting from Pennsylvania, and our hosts made reservations for the Laboratory. I'm thinking, "there's an hour of my life I'll never get back." Boy, was I wrong!This was SO much fun! It was a challenge both to get the clues, but also to work cooperatively! Academic intelligence isn't necessarily a necessity to make it through in time, but being able to converse is essential!I'm looking forward to returning and trying to make it out of another room.

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Lake Elsinore in Temecula
review: Had a blast! My group did two of the rooms. They are challenging but so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Lake Elsinore in Temecula
review: Very friendly staff fun environment for the family.

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Lake Elsinore in Temecula
review: Great environment and staff. I definitely recommend anyone to come and see what it's all about.

room_title: Escape room "Paranormal Investigation" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: As a filler of free time we decided to book the Paranormal room. Age range from 14 to 45, we all had a blast. Sharon was absolutely wonderful. If you have an hour of free time, get your family/friends together and book a room. We had so much fun tonight that we are thinking of doing another room tomorrow. Love from the STL.

room_title: Escape room "Wanted: Dead or Alive?" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My group of four decided to do the Wanted: Dead or Alive, the western theme.  The difficulty is listed as a medium, and we barely escaped! Our game master was really patient with us and we enjoyed the game a lot.  I've done 50+ rooms and the quality in the room is there!  My friends and I will continue to do more of your rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Wanted: Dead or Alive?" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We have completed two of their rooms and had a great time in both. We have their third room booked for this weekend and can't wait!

room_title: Escape room "Wanted: Dead or Alive?" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This is my 5th escape room and we did Wanted: Dead or Alive at Del Amo Mall. It is rated beginner- medium, but I found it pretty difficult even though we did escape with 8 minutes to spare using 2 clues. We had a team of 5 adults and we had a blast.  We totally recommend it :)

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Any room that requires multiple, laminated magic number puzzles to be solved is not worth $30

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: My friends took me here for my Bachelor's Party and I ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT. We took the Harry Potter challenge and I was amazed at the level of detail and the sheer brilliance of the clues and their hiding places. I'm scared of revealing too much but my favorite clues were the deceptively easy ones (clues that looked easy but were surprisingly difficult). I have one suggestion: I recommend putting out a poll or suggestion box for different rooms so that you guys can get more ideas for future room themes (My suggestions for a potential theme are a Sherlock Holmes or Clue theme). I can't wait for the next room change and I highly recommend it to people who want to play with friends or clubs who are looking to build teamwork! ORDER OF THE PHOENIX FOR LIFE!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: What an AWESOME an Amazing time We had in the Harry Potter Room! It was fun intense an so much fun! And yes we did escape with 2 minutes left! We kicked Butt! Looking forward to Mario Room Next!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: We had a great time! It was super fun even if we weren't totally successful.

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Wowowowowow! The front desk thought we were scared/shocked because of how loud we were all screaming and cheering. I had no expectations going in but have to say that my teammates and I enjoyed the Harry Potter room in particular to the nth degree! It was absolutely iiiiiiiiincredible! Quit being such a muggle and get over there!!!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Magical experience in the Harry Potter room. Would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: This is a great way to have fun with a group of friends! I'm not someone who typically enjoys puzzles, riddles, games, etc., but Square Room Escape has really elevated the experience for me. This is an excellent alternative for when you're looking for something to do and want a different option than going to the movies/bowling/karaoke. The clues are never the same, the rooms are beautifully decorated, and the whole thing from start to finish is very immersive. Definitely go check it out!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: I had so much fun with the Harry Potter escape room. This was my fourth escape challenge and I had so much difficulty. Without the hints I would not have solved it but I liked how we all could work together. I don't want to give it away bur great theme and design. Thanks for everything!

room_title: Escape room "STAR WARS™: Secrets of the Empire VR" by The Void Orlando in Orlando
review: Absolutely one of the most awesome Star Wars things I've ever experienced! If you love Star Wars, this is a must!!!! It will change your life! Lol $35 on weekdays and $38 on weekends. Will definitely do again and again!

room_title: Escape room "STAR WARS™: Secrets of the Empire VR" by The Void Orlando in Orlando
review: I went there on January 17 th at 12:30 pm 2019,  it was $105.00 for three people,  we did the Star Wars experience,  worth every penny!!!!!  Unreal it was amazing I'm going to do wreck it Ralph next.  I love it,  staff was fantastic, great location, any issues you just stop raise your hand they come in right away to help with anything. I was worried I would fall but you really can't fall,  you can touch walls sit down it's awesome, I went with my brother and sister.  Pictures I bought were $15 for a digital and a hard photo.  Highly recommend,  wish it was longer.  I'd live in it if I could.  Don't hesitate see it,  I get dizzy easy and this did not bother me I have high blood pressure also but no issues.  AAA+++++++**

room_title: Escape room "STAR WARS™: Secrets of the Empire VR" by The Void Orlando in Orlando
review: My husband and I have been lucky enough to do this twice.  We did the Star Wars Secrets of the Empire both times and it is just incredible.  Truly an awesome experience.  Yes, it's 15 min... yes it's nearly $40.  But it's amazing, and those aren't drawbacks to doing it.Highly recommend if you are at Disney Springs, and you like Star Wars, then you should do this!

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Agents" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Your money is worth it. It may look small on the outside but they'll take you to the back where the game is actually at. Puzzles are challenging and some require patience.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Agents" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: This was my third time been to this location. I played the Lost Kingdom and the Treasury of Empire: Allies before. I was here to take the challenge for the Treasury of Empire again. Since I played the Treasury of Empire: Allies, I knew that this time would not be an easy game. Although this time was still for the theme room the Treasury of Empire, the puzzles were totally different due to the different story line. The agent side was differently in the room, puzzles, and clues. On this sides, it had more electronic stuffs. It made the game to be more interesting. Also, I like the idea of the telephone. It made me feel like I was in a real base try to get the secrete code. I love it! Still the great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Agents" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: It was a very great experience. I love puzzles in the room. I played the Treasury of Empire: Agent in a 6-people group. We picked the most difficult one. And we still made it! More people with great team work will definitely higher helpful!Before the game started, the game master introduced the background story to us. In fact, all three rooms in this store are all connected together. I believe we should started with the first part of story to see the whole story. With the brief introduction from the game master, we knew that we have traveled back to WWII time and trying to get out of this military base. With this story introduction, we have had the idea about why we are here and what we are looking for. I believe that introduce is very important. Also, he told us many tips and rules.Generally, this is a great escape room experience. Although the game is not easy, we still enjoy the game very much. I like this type of challenge!

room_title: Escape room "Black Ops" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Loved it! We escaped the Black Ops room. GREAT activity to do on a rainy Miami afternoon. We had a group of 6 and everyone left buzzing about the experience. It's both challenging and fun and the staff was helpful and engaging. We hope to return before we leave the city!

room_title: Escape room "Black Ops" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: This was our first escape room and the bar is now set high! Friendly staff, clean facility (entrance is on James not Lincoln). If you are struggling you can get hints. Challenging for adults and teens - we finished Black Ops with less than a minute to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Black Ops" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Black Ops mission accomplished! I came here with a large group for a friend's birthday and South Beach Room Escape exceeded all expectations! I was designated as the team leader (woot woot) and was given a walkie talkie to ask for hints during our hour long mission. Our room coordinator was extremely helpful with giving clues and the room had a good mix of puzzles so that everyone in our group was able to contribute in some way. We succeeded in our mission of finding a vial in a war bunker in under an hour!Overall, South Beach Room Escape was awesome at being an escape room but also goes above and beyond in making sure that their customers are having a good time before and after their game. I would definitely come back here to try the other rooms and to enjoy a drink on the rooftop patio before the game again!

room_title: Escape room "Black Ops" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: We held our staff party here, and had a BLAST. We brought in food and set up our own little photo booth, and the ladies were so personable and professional!! The puzzles were challenging, and we split the group up and competed against each other for the fastest time! We had a great time- we would do it all over again and would highly recommend this place to friends/colleagues/etc. 5 stars isn't enough!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Black Ops" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: We had an AMAZING time at South Beach Room Escapes today! They were wonderful & accommodated our group of 45 people with ease! Sophia was awesome helping me coordinate lunch for our hungry assocoates. We talked about it all the way home & can't wait to go back! I would highly recommend them for an office party, birthday party, bridal party.. any kind of party or small group! Thanks again you guys were wonderful!

room_title: Escape room "The Woods" by A Narrow Escape in Orlando
review: Today I almost came in with a friend to see if I could do a room. Unfortunately right before I parked, I drove by and heard a few managers or owners yelling at their employee. This poor person was getting yelled at while looking completely miserable. I will NEVER book a game here and suggest people don't either. I would NEVER pay a buisiness that treats their staff like animals. Please never come here and I will recommend that people DON'T come here. Very disgusting to see that people are treated like that.

room_title: Escape room "The Woods" by A Narrow Escape in Orlando
review: A group of friends and I visited A Narrow Escape and did “The Woods” Room. We had a great time at this new venue.The highlight of the trip wasn’t the room, but the fantastic team behind the rooms that we all got to meet. The passion that this family has put into their business is evident throughout their gorgeous scenery in-room, their commitment to keeping their puzzles themed and not just a series of numbers and locks, and their genuine interest in feedback and desire to provide an excellent experience.We were three escape room veterans and three new escapists. My crew has escaped from some pretty tough rooms in the Orlando area, all billed as the “hardest” room at their respective venues, with 10% or lower advertised escape rates. I have to say the Woods was the most challenging Room we ever encountered, by a long shot. I’m not sure how the other rooms at Narrow Escape compare to this one, but definitely go prepared for a tough challenge.I can’t say enough good things about the people behind A Narrow Escape, all of whom worked hard throughout our escape to make sure we had a good time, and ask for genuine feedback. Top notch customer service, and some of the best scenic work I’ve seen. Check them out!

room_title: Escape room "The Woods" by A Narrow Escape in Orlando
review: Did the 'woods' room today. It was a very fun and challenging escape room! The staff and owners were able to give us just enough information and backstory beforehand to figure out how to escape. Very fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Woods" by A Narrow Escape in Orlando
review: A Narrow Escape is an awesome immersive experience. Challenging rooms with interesting puzzles. We did Toxicity and the Woods, we will be back to do Lycan very soon. I highly recommended this local business!

room_title: Escape room "Enter the Jungle" by Escape Rooms FL in Miami
review: Update: We went back and took the grandparents for the Jungle Room and, once again, had a blast!  Highly recommend... so much fun!We did the Santa room with 3 kids, 10-13, and 1 adult and had a great time!  Highly recommend! Family friendly place with very sweet owners. Give it a try, you wont regret it!

room_title: Escape room "Enter the Jungle" by Escape Rooms FL in Miami
review: My daughter wanted to have her birthday at an escape room with friends.  The owner was very accommodating for our large group and offered two rooms at the same time.  We did the Jungle room and Game of Stones.  All the teens had an amazing first time in an escape room.  Amazing lobby and service A+++.  All had fun and laughs even though they did not escape.  Great memories and pictures.  Will return again.

room_title: Escape room "Enter the Jungle" by Escape Rooms FL in Miami
review: An absolutely amazing experience! A full hour of puzzles to solve and escape! The owner and staff were amazing.  Their attention to detail in the room and the well thought out puzzles kept our group energized and entertained for the full hour, escaping the Jungle with only a few minutes remaining.

room_title: Escape room "Enter the Jungle" by Escape Rooms FL in Miami
review: Tried this new escape room in Coconut Creek and they offered the Jungle room.  Entering this room was like walking into a Jungle.  We actually were able to play the board game and so much fun.  Very challenging puzzles and critical thinking with communication skills needed for this room.  Great for all especially enthusiasts.  Highly recommend this room and business which is family owned who offered us VIP service and amazing decor.  Going back to try their Game of Stones room.

room_title: Escape room "A Clinical Trial" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My wife and I tackled the "Clinical Trial" room and had a great time. The owners are onsite and put a lot of time and effort into making this a great attraction. It was our first escape room experience and we will definitely be back to attempt the other room and anymore to come.

room_title: Escape room "A Clinical Trial" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My husband and I did this as a date activity for just the two of us. We had so much fun, we would do this again and again. We did the clinical trial room and it was challenging but not too difficult to take the fun out of it. The owners were super helpful and friendly and it was clear that they put a lot of work and creativity into making this a great experience for everyone. This was such a great way to spend time together and definitely worth the price.

room_title: Escape room "A Clinical Trial" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My wife and I narrowly escaped the Clinical Trial room. It was amazing. So much fun. The puzzle was linear, but not simple. The puzzles were varied and the clues were well thought out. You can tell that a LOT of effort goes into making the rooms and puzzles. We will definitely do this again next time we are in Hot Springs.

room_title: Escape room "A Clinical Trial" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My husband, 12 year old son and I did the room "A Clinical Trial" and had a blast! The clues were challenging, but each of us was able to play on our strengths. We got stumped once or twice, and they gave hints when needed. Other escape rooms I've been to gave a limited number of hints and/or penalized for hints, but A Narrow Escape does not. We solved the puzzle with less than 2 minutes to spare. We will definitely go back when we are in town again to try one of the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "A Clinical Trial" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: I took my husband here as a surprise because he loves a good brain game, and we were not disappointed. Based on the description, I chose to go with "A Clinical Trial" for the simple fact that we weren't a large goup (although the two of us might have been okay doing any of the rooms). After we succeeded in escaping, we immediately wanted to do another!!

room_title: Escape room "Zookeeper" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Had a great time working in the Mad Hatter's Tea Party for my daughter's 14th birthday. We were paired with 4 others that we did not know but worked to have the best time of the week! Returned a week later to testout the Zookeeper for kids which was awesome and my eight-year-old absolutely loved it! Wholesome and engaging fun for every age!

room_title: Escape room "Zookeeper" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This is the first time we went to an escape room and since it was a family outing with younger ones, we went with the zookeeper room - we had a blast and the entire staff was friendly, super helpful in giving us stumped adults clues and polite! We will definitely go back!

room_title: Escape room "Zookeeper" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: What a blast. We did the zookeeper room since we had our 8 year old and 3 year old with us and it was perfect. Our 3 year old was busy with all the animal things in the room and the rest of us were busy solving our mission. Nothing like a room for 6-12 year olds to make an adult feel a little less than though haha Hands down recommend this for anyone who wants to be fully engulfed in a game and have fun. We will absolutely return.

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by Escape Room Entertainment in Melbourne
review: The staff was amazing! We had a personalized experience and felt like valued customers which is rare these days. The Diamond Heist was incredibly challenging, but we did it. We will definitely make the trek back to Melbourne just to experience the other rooms. We will also bring family and friends as it is awesome. Thank you Escape Zone!

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by Escape Room Entertainment in Melbourne
review: This was an amazing first experience. The staff was very friendly. I have been talking about how much fun it was since last night. I'm bringing my daughter to do the diamond heist. My heart was pounding as we entered the room where Oliva was murdered. It was like a real crime scene. Blood and a dead body outline. Lots of neat accessories. Very well crafted and thought out.

room_title: Escape room "Lost in Time" by Mastermind Escape Games in Augusta
review: First escape room I ever did. We had a group of 4. we were with 2 adults and 2 kids. We had a great time. We almost made it it out. The staff was awesome and helpful. If you decide to run lost in time don't over think things. It will cost you valuable time.

room_title: Escape room "Lost in Time" by Mastermind Escape Games in Augusta
review: We went and played Lost in Time yesterday. I don't think we did particularly well, but the loudspeaker helpers were great.You want something fun to do, this is definitely a great option! All the employees we met were very nice, super helpful, and willing to explain everything. We'll be back, it might just take us a little bit because the price is a bit steep.

room_title: Escape room "Lost in Time" by Mastermind Escape Games in Augusta
review: This was our first escape room and it was a blast! We're already planning our next group visit. Our host Ariel did fabulous job explaining everything. The Lost in Time room was a good challenge. Agent 7 presented the room in a fun way and was very helpful. We escaped!

room_title: Escape room "Time Machine" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: By almost any measure, the nautilus and time machine rooms were very good escape rooms. Do they have faults? Yes. The "kraken" you battle in the Nautilus looks like an original Nintendo character, reminding you of a 90s video game as opposed to an immersive experience. And many parts of the Time Machine room feel like an underwhelming museum exhibit. But overall, these are above average escape rooms that in most other cities would be top-of-the-line.I would say these are perfect escape rooms for new participants. They are immersive, and creative, and generally fun. They will deliver solid experiences to establish what escape rooms are all about.For experienced gamers, however, these rooms were let downs. The puzzles were too straightforward and predictable, These rooms were linear to a fault. And the production value does not match the leaders in the city (Questroom and the Basement). That said, 60Out offers reasonable pricing and still very enjoyable experiences. I expect to return for some of their more advanced rooms such as Jumanji.

room_title: Escape room "Suite Escape" by Count:down Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: Tucked away in the corner of a Home Depot shopping plaza, it's easy to miss if you don't see the sign right away. There was a coupon that we decided to use for the game. We went for the Suite Escape room. It's the hardest one come to find out after we got there and we decided to attempt it.The room as well as the other two that are there consists of locks and combos to open by figuring out puzzles and using clues for them in the room.  It's better to have more than less in the group since it helps with the brainstorming and solving of the puzzles. Even though our group lost, we still had fun and we plan to go back to do a different room next time.

room_title: Escape room "Suite Escape" by Count:down Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: The people are awesome and the Suite escape was great!

room_title: Escape room "Suite Escape" by Count:down Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: We did the haunted room with a group of four people and had such a fun time. Definitely recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Person of Interest" by Unity Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: First time doing the escape room and we had a great time. We needed some help but it was still fun to think about what's next. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a fun hour to get away

room_title: Escape room "House Of Voodoo" by Nightmare at 3008 in Birmingham
review: This place was great!!! We had an absolute blast!! Very interactive and a great staff!!! Thanks!!!

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: I have a great time with my friends here. Really helpful hints. Really hope there are more to experience.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: We had no idea what to expect but this was truly a memorable experience!

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Helpful staff. Challenging escape room. Since I can't do it again, it would be cheating, lol, but I'd definitely recommend it

room_title: Escape room "Superhero Training Facility" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Had a fantastic time at the Superhero Training Facility. What a great experience. Definitely coming back for more! Would recommend to anyone who loves puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Superhero Training Facility" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We did the Superhero Training Facility, and it was so fun and creative! It was like the old escape games I used to play online, and the staff was fantastic as well! I would go back in a heartbeat.

room_title: Escape room "Superhero Training Facility" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Oh I just had to write a review.... Because this place is awesome! We had a great time with our group. Very challenging!! We almost got out. I can't wait to go back and try the other rooms. Staff is very nice and friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Superhero Training Facility" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Our family went for my adult son's birthday. We did the Super Hero room. It was a whole lot of fun and very challenging. It took me back to the days when my sons were little super heroes. We really worked together as a team trying to escape. Teamwork t makes for a very happy family. We were so close to escaping. Everyone had a great time and are already talking about doing it again soon.

room_title: Escape room "Mailroom Madness" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: First time going to an escape room, and I must say, this was AWESOME! There were just 2 of us in Mailroom Madness, and even though we needed an extra 8 minutes, we did complete it. Our game master was fun and super helpful and you can tell he really loves his work. The puzzles were so much fun! There weren't any that were over-the-top frustrating, but we did definitely need some help. We will definitely be back for more!

room_title: Escape room "Mailroom Madness" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: The room was perfect for our group of 6. I brought my 18-year-old son, who doesn't get too excited about things these days. Boy was this place a hit! He led the charge in obtaining the first of many clues. It's a great place to reconnect with family.

room_title: Escape room "Mailroom Madness" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: Went here a week ago and it was a ton of fun! I would recommend doing the doll house themed escape room. Ariel, who was working that night was a great storyteller and perfect host.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Escape U in St. Augustine
review: We came in tonight and played The Lighthouse and Asylum. We escaped both and had a great time! We have played several rooms before and these were both really intricate and unique. The Asylum is easily one of my favorite rooms now. We escaped with only 4 minutes left and were told we were only 1 of 4 groups to make it out. It's easy to see how because this one is not for the easily frustrated! We can't wait to come back and try the last room.

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: I love this place! The people are so nice and I had fun! It is expensive but I know that I will be spending more money there in the future! I heard people screaming from the cellar so if you want to get scared then choose the cellar!

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: The Cellar at Pearlridge Mall was so much fun! The entire family had a blast. We got close but didn't escape. If only we had 15 more mins. Think fast, work together, and remember every minute counts. We are addicted and will definitely come back again. I highly recommend The Cellar.

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: It was exciting from beginning to end and our team broke the record for The Cellar! Our game master was awesome and the cast was amazing. I can't recommend highly enough if you're looking for something different to do. Thanks so much, you guys!

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: I was super skeptical but had a blast overall. My heart is still racing. We beat The Cellar with 7 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Hawaii Escape Challenge in Honolulu
review: We had such a GREAT time. Awesome, friendly, helpful staff, very exciting escape rooms, surprises at every turn, a definite must do!

room_title: Escape room "The Shadow Gallery" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: We went for the first time last night and had a blast. The game was tough, but still super fun. The staff was helpful and knowledgeable. This is a really cool idea and we will definitely be back. And next time we will get much further in the game.

room_title: Escape room "The Shadow Gallery" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: It was our first time and we had 3 people, including a 13 y/o. It was SOOO much fun! We came really close to solving the mystery because we wasted a lot of time on the front end, but even that added to the intrigue. The exercise is intellectual, interesting, and has you thinking out of the box (at least the mystery we chose). It was great and we will be back with friends! It's also so reasonably priced that it's easy to go again and again. Totally recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "The Shadow Gallery" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: We have done about half of the rooms at the Clue Room and we love them all. Great staff, clean and fun rooms. Can't wait to go again.

room_title: Escape room "Captive" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: Great first escape room experience! Friendly staff, inventive setup, and such a fun way to spend time with the family!

room_title: Escape room "Captive" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: Fantastic first escape room experience! Highly prefer this location! The staff are amazing as well!

room_title: Escape room "Captive" by Boulder Escape Room in Longmont
review: This was an excellent experience!!!! We booked at the last minute and had the best time. We did the Captive room (20% success rate) - it was quite tricky but we made it!!! We're big escape room fans and went with our friends who had never done an escape room before. They loved it just as much as we did. Our host was excellent and gave us clues at the perfect time. We found the puzzles to be appropriately difficult - sometimes escape rooms have clues that are very obscure and aren't very logical. Highly recommend this one!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Maniac" by Cryptic Rooms in Pensacola
review: Didn't really know what to expect in the beginning. At first I was like this is gonna be cheesy. Turned out to have been an awesome time for my children and I. I think we have found a new addiction. Thanks William for everything! We thuroughly enjoyed it...

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Maniac" by Cryptic Rooms in Pensacola
review: We had a blast in the Maniac room. We didn't escape, but all is well.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Maniac" by Cryptic Rooms in Pensacola
review: We had so much fun escaping the maniac today! The puzzles in the room were great, and the interaction with “Skully” added a unique experience. Overall a great experience! I would highly recommend checking it out!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Maniac" by Cryptic Rooms in Pensacola
review: Thought this was a great experience! My wife and I do a lot of escape rooms and we really enjoyed the maniac room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Maniac" by Cryptic Rooms in Pensacola
review: This is by far the best escape game that my girlfriend and I have done! We visited from Orlando couldn’t have ask for a such memorable time! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Maniac" by Cryptic Rooms in Pensacola
review: Did the manic room today and had a great time. The clues were nicely laid out and made you think. The owners are super nice! Plus they had a cute dog:) we will be coming back to try the music room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Maniac" by Cryptic Rooms in Pensacola
