review: Of the 5 or 6 escape room we have visited this was my favorite! The rooms are much larger than we have experienced in other cities. The owners are a great couple. We originally booked the Magical Musical Mystery room and had such a great time that we returned two days later for Escape the Maniac.

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by America's Escape Game Tampa in Tampa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Christmas at Franklin's" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: We did this with a group of 8 yesterday and despite having done over many, many different rooms, this one had a number of things that pleasantly surprised us. You can tell David takes a great deal of pride in his work, and the way he incorporates historical stuff about Benjamin Franklin into the room was lots of fun. There is a good mix of physical and mind puzzles too. The ending was great! Can't wait to see the new room here. We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Christmas at Franklin's" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: I did this room with the full 8 this weekend. David was so nice and fun and creative. I think the payoff of solving the puzzle was the best I have seen yet! There were also a lot of fun, different puzzles to solve that you don't normally and the whole group was busy at work. Loved this room and the historical Easter eggs. Thanks David! We will be back when you open even more rooms for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Christmas at Franklin's" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: This escape room gets high marks for customer service and puzzle quality. The creator of this room (actually, rooms, since there are about three rooms for the game) put much effort into keeping the story line and its theme running throughout, from the signing of the liability form, to the grand finale. Many of the puzzles were very ingenious. Some really puzzled us, but once we figured them out we all had to say, "Oh, wow!"

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy Theory" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This is one of my favorite escape locations! My family and I did the conspiracy theories room and it was a blast! Eric was our cluemaster and he was super fun and helpful! I will continue coming to this location!

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy Theory" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: It was so much fun and the staff were awesome! Our clue master, Pacific, was fun and very helpful. The Conspiracy Theory room was a challenge but we were able to pull it off (with thanks to Pacific)! Thanks again for the great time and you can bet your buns we will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Conspiracy Theory" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: We had a group of four do the Conspiracy Theory room last week. This was the first escape room for all four of us, so we didn't really know what to expect going in. The scenario, puzzles, and atmosphere were great. We ended up solving the puzzle with about 10 minutes to spare. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. We had an absolute blast and next time we're in the Denver area, we'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Meltdown" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Great time with the team, Vince made sure we all had a good time. It was everyone's first time so no one knew what we were supposed to do, but again, Vince was a lot of help and we escaped!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Meltdown" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We've tried a lot of escape rooms around the Valley. Today was the Nuclear Meltdown Room at Baffled. We did not get out alive. But still had tons of fun. Thanks Baffled, we want to try your da vinci room next.

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Meltdown" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We went as 3 adults and 3 children,6,10 and 11. We did nuclear meltdown and got out with 4 minutes 27 seconds to spare! Had a great time and the staff was friendly and made it enjoyable. The kids did feally good and want to go agon. We also did groupon to save money. My only complaint was it was kinda warm in there. A little A/C wouldn't hurt.

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Meltdown" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We had an amazing time! We did the nuclear room. It took us nearly the full hour, but we saved the world. So, you're welcome. The staff was very engaging and helpful for the clues we needed. I believe the man's name was vince and he was awesome. The room was well put together. Everything worked as it was supposed to work. Their hours are great. We went to the last time slot - and that worked perfectly.Thank you! We will absolutely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Meltdown" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Our group of 6 had a great time in the Nuclear Meltdown room!The room had multiple puzzles to solve at a time, so we were able to split up the work instead of crowding over one area. The room still had a direction, however, so it was fairly easy to stay on track.The staff was present over intercom throughout the experience and provided advice when necessary.This was an engaging team-building experience that I would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Get back on Santa's Good List" by Code To Escape in Daytona Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Miss Jezebel" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So fun! Just finished the escape room with Miss Jezebel and it was great. This was my first time doing an escape room and I'd definitely recommend it. It wasn't too many puzzles to solve- more of a mystery theatre situation. Our "Miss Jezebel," Heather, was fantastic too. 5 stars.

room_title: Escape room "Miss Jezebel" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loved it. Dorothy was great. The Jezebel room was really fun. Would be interested in more rooms with an actor.

room_title: Escape room "Miss Jezebel" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Ms Jezebel was an incredible experience. Love all the rooms I've done for the most part. This company is incredible.

room_title: Escape room "Task Force Agency" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was my first experience with doing an escape room activity and it was AWESOME!!!. Did the TASK FORCE AGENCY ROOM. I felt like I was in Mission Impossible minus Tom Cruise . I can't give away any secrets, but I'm Definitely going to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Task Force Agency" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Took a coworker for her first escape room experience. This place was close to our work and we decided to give it a shot picking the hardest room. Even though we failed the CIA Task Force, it had everything I wanted in a great escape room. The immersion, technology and flow of the room made sense. The owner and his wife were great and accommodating. I'll definitely be back to try their easier rooms in the near future!

room_title: Escape room "Task Force Agency" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had an amazing time here with my friends! We did the TFA room which is high tech and well thought out. Also, the customer service is outstanding. Can't wait to come back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Hangover" by Storm Out in Miami
review: Hangover Room was Fun. I've done 3 of their 4 rooms and each one is challenging. We wanted to try the room with no locks as advertised and it was well worth it. The room was challenging and fun. I'm glad we tried this room.

room_title: Escape room "The Hangover" by Storm Out in Miami
review: Totally cool room....we needed 1 more minute!! Thanks for the adventure!!

room_title: Escape room "The Hangover" by Storm Out in Miami
review: It was a Great experience! So many electronic devices, very interesting game. Looking forward to play again!

room_title: Escape room "1970's Murder Mystery" by Escape the Cape in Fort Myers
review: A Blast from the Past was so much fun. Murder mystery based in the ‘70s.

room_title: Escape room "1970's Murder Mystery" by Escape the Cape in Fort Myers
review: We had a great time. Got out of the 70s murder with 35 seconds to spare. A lot of fun and the staff was great.

room_title: Escape room "1970's Murder Mystery" by Escape the Cape in Fort Myers
review: I travelled back in time with friends Friday evening to solve a murder mystery.  Who knew Cape Coral had a time travel portal?!?  It's right off of Pine Island Road.  The experience was a groovy "Blast From The Past" and we had a great time.  I'm happy to report we identified the killer and solved this cold case from 1972.We were a group of five adult women.  No one in our group had experienced an escape room previously.  The room was clean and decorated nicely for the story/theme.  The puzzles were challenging but solvable.  The reservation process and interaction with the game master, Patrick, was great.  They offer you hints/nudges if you get stuck.  They genuinely want you to have a positive outcome, weather you experience the thrill of victory or the agony of defeat.In my opinion, you don't need any previous experience to enjoy this room.  Their rooms accommodate up to eight people but I felt our group size was perfect.  We had enough people to search for clues and solve puzzles without feeling crowded or that there were too many people trying to do the same thing.  I wouldn't suggest this for a date but a double-date might be a lot of fun.Tips and Suggestions:  Make sure you arrive early so you can get a briefing from the game master and take care of any business before your time begins.  It may seem obvious but USE THE BATHROOM before you go inside.  Once you leave the room, your game is over.Final Assessment:  Great group activity for friends and/or family.  We laughed, had some great "a-ha" moments and made some fun memories.  This was a nice change from a typical Friday evening activity. I'm looking forward to doing this again.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: Very creative room and way different from a couple other places I've been. Asylum was much harder than typical escape room experiences. I loved the challenge. Be ready to think outside the box. I will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: We had an absolute blast! Celebrated our mom's birthday by challenging ourselves with the Asylum room! We were certainly impressed! What an absolute GREAT way to have some incredible fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: First time doing an escape room. We failed but had a great time doing it! I wanted to go big or go home so we did the hardest room which was Asylum, creepy is exactly how it would describe it. Thank you so much Down The Rabit whole we will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: This was so fun. I took two 14-year-olds and we did the asylum room. We had such a great time. The gentleman who helped us was funny and helpful. My cousin and brother were so thrilled they were begging to go back the next day. We will definitely be back. 10/10 would do again

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: I loved this place. The Asylum was challenging but super interesting. I loved the vibe the room gave off. I definitely recommend giving this place a go and trying to solve one of the rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Room Academy" by Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: We planned an adult date night with four couples and completed the Escape Room Academy. Lots and lots of fun. We'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Escape Room Academy" by Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: We did the Escape Room Academy room and we had a blast! Loved it! Definitely worth it.

room_title: Escape room "Inheritance: Tesla's Secret" by Off The Couch Games in San Jose
review: We had a really great time at Off The Couch! We did Inheritance and that was just the right level for our group. The setup and clues were challenging and fun! I highly recommend going with the story mode to ease the stress of escaping. Thanks to the "Off The Couch" crew for there cool fun vibe!

room_title: Escape room "Inheritance: Tesla's Secret" by Off The Couch Games in San Jose
review: We had so much fun! Everyone in our group had done escape rooms, but none of us felt competent. We decided to do the inheritance and they assured us that we would be ok.  They were right. It was so fun, relying on each other to solve clues. It really revealed how clever my friends are. Ha ha ha...we finished in 51 minutes. We will be back!!

room_title: Escape room "Inheritance: Tesla's Secret" by Off The Couch Games in San Jose
review: While not as technologically oriented as escape rooms from omescape, this room is very well themed and the finale was extraordinarily creative. Some of the puzzles are a little straightforward in terms of what you're supposed to do but not in actually solving them. There is a lot of construction in the lobby but it's easily overlooked.

room_title: Escape room "The Hideout" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had an absolute blast! The staff (Scott) was very patient and thorough with all our questions. Our team lived through "The Agency" and beat the record time for the week! Can't wait to return and try "The Hideout".

room_title: Escape room "The Hideout" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The Hideout is really amazing. A bit different than most of the rooms I do, but it was thoroughly engaging and really well done for the space. My group cannot stop raving about this one! It is definitely challenging and fun!!! Their Agent room is also a great, but we did prefer The Hideout unanimously.

room_title: Escape room "The Hideout" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Best experience ever! We had a blast in the Hideout room and we will definitely be back for more. Can't wait for new rooms to be added too!! Staff was amazing (Scott, we loved you!) and the thought that went into this is mind-blowing!

room_title: Escape room "Wanted Dead or Alive" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: This was part of my mother’s day gift!  It was great!!  So much fun!  The fact that we beat it with 9 minutes to spare was fantastic. It was my first time and I loved it!!  Would definitely do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Wanted Dead or Alive" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: Wanted Dead or Alive for date night! We had so much fun. Can't wait to come back.

room_title: Escape room "Wanted Dead or Alive" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: Had a great time in the Wanted Dead or Alive room! Jeremy was great explaining how it is done.

room_title: Escape room "1893" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: Phenomenal room! My friend and I have done a few rooms before and found the "1893" room intensely challenging. Not for beginners for sure :)We will definitely be back to try some of the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "1893" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: Just awesome! We did the "1893" room at S. Yosemite Street location. Never felt better. The staff was extremely courteous and gave us a lot of time to click pics.

room_title: Escape room "1893" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: Went with my husband and our two sons. We had an absolute BLAST! Staff was incredibly friendly and the room we chose (1893) was AWESOME! We will definitely be going again!

room_title: Escape room "1893" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: Had our first escape room experience here, and we were very impressed. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very interesting and well thought out rooms, we did the "1893" room. We did not escape in time, but can't wait to go back and try another room. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Evans & Sontag Jail Cell Escape" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: we had a great time. highly recommend

room_title: Escape room "Evans & Sontag Jail Cell Escape" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: This was my family's first time doing an escape room.  The host couldn't have been much nicer.  He was friendly and inviting.  The ambiance was warm.  They have lockers so you can store your personal belongings while you are in the escape room.  Puzzle are fun.  Even the easier riddles/puzzles can be challenging when out under pressure.  You are given an hour to escape the room.  Definitely coming back to try the other themed rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Evans & Sontag Jail Cell Escape" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: Excellent escape room!  The host was fantastic and kids had great time!

room_title: Escape room "Basketball" by Big Escape Rooms in Atlanta
review: FANTASTIC escape room! We did the basketball room and it’s great for beginners! Josh was a fantastic host! He was very kind and funny! When we were in the room he was very respectful of our efforts and didn’t cut in until we really needed it in order to be respectful! I highly recommend visiting!

room_title: Escape room "Basketball" by Big Escape Rooms in Atlanta
review: Had a great time! Josh was very helpful!! Would recommend it to anyone!! We did the basketball one and it was so fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Basketball" by Big Escape Rooms in Atlanta
review: This was so fun!I would highly recommend coming here!We went to the basketball escape room and it was amazing.I will come back again tomorrow

room_title: Escape room "Vegas" by Amazing Escape in Atlanta
review: We took my cousin here for her 40th birthday and we all had a blast. We were a group of 9 and managed to escape this fun room. Definitely try the Vegas room!

room_title: Escape room "Vegas" by Amazing Escape in Atlanta
review: My family and I had a blast at the Amazing Escape Vegas-themed room. It was our first escape room and I wanted it to be a successful experience, so I chose the Vegas room since folks have the best success rate at it (according to the website). The hints we received while in the room helped make it the success I hoped for. It came down to the wire - 1 second left - and when the door opened we all erupted into a celebration yell and high fives all around. Wonderful experience. Two of our group were initially concerned about feeling trapped in the room, but they didn't have any problem.

room_title: Escape room "Vegas" by Amazing Escape in Atlanta
review: We had a blast!! The staff is very friendly and make the experience that much better! I highly recommend Rush Escape Rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: Just did the Titanic Room and it was so much fun! Did the 80's room here last time, both fun and challenging. Staff super nice.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: We loved the Titanic so much we came back for the 80's room! Such a fun place and a wonderful family owned business! I love that they're so excited with us! We can't wait to do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: We did the Titanic room. Sank but still had a great time. Next room is 80's all the way!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: So fun! We did the Titanic room and I was very impressed. The details are rich and interesting, and we were definitely challenged! I definitely recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Cookery - Who's Hungry?" by Code To Escape in Daytona Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Disarm" by Lock City Escape Games in Carrollton
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Room" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: This was our family’s first time in an escape room and we had so much fun in the zombie room. We had no idea there was a “live” zombie in the room which made it very exciting and challenging. The puzzles and riddles were very challenging. We actually did not complete the escape, but had a blast trying. We will for sure do be back!!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Room" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: I had so much fun! The zombie room was so intense! Loved every minute!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Room" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: My friend wanted to do the zombie room for her sons b-day so we decided to do the mafia room at the same time!! We all had an ABSOLUTE BLAST!! I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TO ANYONE WHO LOVES A CHALLENGE!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Room" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: First time ever doing an escape room... Gotta tell you, was super fun and exhilarating!!! Did the Zombie room for a friends birthday and it literally came down to the last minute!!! Totally recommend it, we all had a blast!!!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Room" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: First time ever doing an escape room... Gotta tell you, was super fun and exhilarating!!! Did the Zombie room for a friends birthday and it literally came down to the last minute!!! Totally recommend it, we all had a blast!!!

room_title: Escape room "Sinking Ship" by Try'n Escape in Denver
review: Great time with 4 adults and 2 kids 12 and 13. Loved it! We have become escape room junkies and are probably going to need some sort of rehab!

room_title: Escape room "Sinking Ship" by Try'n Escape in Denver
review: We had such a great time! We didn't get out. I am writing this from the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean where our ship sunk!I brought 5 teenagers and we had a great time. We can't wait to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Sinking Ship" by Try'n Escape in Denver
review: We really liked this theme. We did the sunken ship. We were in separate rooms and had to work together to get to one main room. The only reason that i can't give this a 5 star is because the room wasn't reset completely. Some of the puzzles were already solved so it threw us off because we kept trying to use clues that were already done, but we wouldn't have known. There was more than just one clue that wasn't reset. Overall was a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Y2K Mystery" by SUBScape Games in San Diego
review: Y2K Virus was the first room we did.  I feel that this was the easiest of the three rooms we did.  I thought the puzzles were challenging, but simple enough to figure out.  I don't think that there was a moment where we didn't know what we were supposed to do in this room.  It's easy to connect the dots and figure out what to do.  I would say this is an easy-intermediate difficulty room, and would recommend this if this is your first time or if you aren't that experienced at escape rooms.  We were told that Stage Call is their easiest room at Subscape, so if you are a beginner, you can start there as well.

room_title: Escape room "Y2K Mystery" by SUBScape Games in San Diego
review: I brought my group to do a team building game at this escape room and we had a blast! really great rooms and great customer service! highly recommend 😊👍

room_title: Escape room "Mission Black and White" by Code To Escape in Daytona Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Hidden Elixir" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: I was with a group of 3 friends in town for a weekend and we decided to do this escape room! We had a lot of fun! The room was designed to be fun and challenging but not stressful, and the employee on duty was very nice and helpful. We had a lot of fun and if we are ever back in the area would definitely return!

room_title: Escape room "The Hidden Elixir" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Our family, including our 7 and 10-year-old kids, had a blast today! Friendly staff, fun puzzles, and just an overall great experience (and we didn't even win)!! Can't wait to go back and try a different room!

room_title: Escape room "The Hidden Elixir" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: We escaped the Hidden Elixir room on a Sunday afternoon. It was set up properly, clean, and so much fun! I'm definitely going back.

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: It was me and my wife's first anniversary together and we both like horror but we had never done a escape room before, we're used to puzzle solving in games and even at work and we're not easily scared by horror attractions eather, but this, hands down was the best, we worked together ad got scared at the same time. Would recommend it to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: I've done most of/only the horror escape rooms in the LA and Anaheim area including the Basement LA (all 4 chapters),  Mission: Darkest Hour Torture Chamber, The Hex Room, Amityville House, The Orphanage, Fright Fest, Horror Nights and even the 17th Door. The "Zoe" room is hands down the scariest room/attraction I've ever been in. I did not know I could even be this scared and honestly fared for my life. Keeping your group small (3 people) will make the experience even more scary. This is my number room as of now!!!

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: Ahhhhhhmazing!!! This has to be the best room my boyfriend and I have ever done. From the moment you sign the waivers till the moment you run out of the house your heart is beating.Coming from another escape room, it is great to find one as amazing as this place. It does not disappoint one bit!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: I'm scaaaarrreeeddd ahhh💃🏽

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: Excellent immersive horror experience. Not for the faint of heart! Definitely recommended for horror enthusiasts. Recommended for escape room enthusiasts who wants to see something different than your typical puzzle rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: Our group of 6 had a lot of fun! It was our first escape room so I have nothing to compare it to but it definitely had our hearts pumping a few times! The puzzles were well done and the actors were committed! Well done.

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: If you love going to scary theme parks, then this is the perfect thing to tide you over during the offseason. This escape room is as challenging as it is terrifying. Even your toughest of friends will scream like little girls.

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: Brilliant. Truly one of the escape rooms that pushes the concept toward the potential of what it can be versus simply doing the umpteenth iteration of "a mad scientist's lab" or "a spy's secret office," etc. This room is smart, well-planned, and forces you to perform under exciting pressure unique to the minds of its creators. I will happily support any future rooms that Escapade dreams up.

room_title: Escape room "Quest For The Lost Continent" by Kauai Escape Room in Kauai
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Panic Room" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Great for all ages! Our group spanned from 10 to 44 y/o and everyone had some contribution to solving the puzzle. Definitively a must do experience in Miami!

room_title: Escape room "Panic Room" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Had a lot of fun with great friends. Can't wait to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Panic Room" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: It was very challenging! A lot of fun! Would definitely go back and try out all the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Panic Room" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Had a fantastic time last night! The Panic Room was one of the best rooms we've ever tried. Definitely worth the experience!

room_title: Escape room "Panic Room" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Honestly, this place is amazing. If you like to use your mind or just want a generally interesting time, you can't beat it. Basically you get locked in a puzzle, similar to Saw (the movies), but without any scares. There are clues hidden all around to help you open the numerous locks, trap doors, and boxes hidden about the rooms. Each puzzle has a goal and I can't wait to get back here and try another room. This is also a really good team building activity as these clues often require more than one person. The only hint I can give you is be observant, from the time you call to book your slot, until you successfully break out of the room ;)What are you waiting for go check these guys out! Oh and by the way, they make you delicious cocktails afterwards for free... Seriously for less than 30 bucks get on it!

room_title: Escape room "Panic Room" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: Looking for something different to do in Miami that doesn't involve clubbing, dinner, or clubbing? Try this place out! Group of 9 friends came late on a Saturday attempting to do something fun and new. Half our party have done escapes before, so we were pro's, but the rest a bunch of rooks.The way this works is you get locked in a room, and you scour every nook and cranny for clues to unlock locks and solve puzzles, until you bust your way straight outta Compton. (You gently unlock the final door).We did the panic room. We owned that ish. Well at first we did, but we got stuck at the end and barely got out in time.  This particular escape place is not scary, but still keeps you on your toes and your heart racing towards the end.Overall, it was a lot of fun and we had a great time. After we escaped we left and celebrated with dinner and clubbing!

room_title: Escape room "Panic Room" by South Beach Room Escape in Miami
review: This place and concept is absolutely amazing. Had the best time. We did the panic room and though we didn't complete it, (came extremely close), the experience was fun and exciting. Basically you get locked inside a room and have to find tools and keys and clues to help get you out within 60 minutes. It's interesting and brain teasing and all in all a fun way to work together w your friends. For only 20-30$, and they offer free cocktails, you can not beat this experience. We will be booking again for a future visit and can't wait to try the other rooms available. I recommend this place for everyone to try at least once!!

room_title: Escape room "Mummy’s Tomb" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: We took a party of four into the Mummy's Tomb. Clues were abundant, but challenging and we managed to locate the last clue just as time ran out. Looking for an indoor activity or something to wrap up the day before heading to dinner? This is the place!

room_title: Escape room "Mummy’s Tomb" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: Went to the FWB location last night and did the Mummy's Tomb. So fun! I've done 10+ escape rooms and felt this was pretty challenging! We had a group of 4 who have all done escape rooms before. Would definitely come back again!

room_title: Escape room "Mummy’s Tomb" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: This was my first experience in an escape room and I had a blast! Even though my group didn't escape the mummy's wrath before our time expired (we were seconds away!), it was so much fun trying to decipher the codes to get to the next clue. This is definitely on my list to do again!

room_title: Escape room "Mummy’s Tomb" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: The Curse of the Mummy was outstanding and by far the most challenging escape room I've done. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Mummy’s Tomb" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: We visited the Mummy room for our first experience and our large group of 10 had a blast! At first, we were a bit confused and lacked direction. The use of the monitor and attendant really helped! We did not escape, also by seconds like several other groups. Thanks for making my birthday memorable!

room_title: Escape room "The Box" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: Such a fun place! Great opportunity to work with friends, family, co-workers to test your skill and have a great time! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Box" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: This escape room was super unique in comparison to all the previous ones I’ve done. I would highly recommend this !!!! Well thought out and tons of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Box" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: I've had the opportunity to play through  "The Box", and I gotta say... I've been to escape rooms when I lived in California, and they just don't stack up to the amount of Love and care that was put into these rooms. They were certainly challenging, and even though I managed to complete the rooms, I only /barely/ made it by.TLDR; If you're in the Boise area, Ada County, heck anywhere in Idaho really, and you're looking for a fun experience, this is the place to be. Hands down.

room_title: Escape room "Below Ground" by Puzzle Room Tahoe in South Lake Tahoe
review: Favorite escape room we played. You have to defuse a bomb at the end. we were really well immersed as FBI agent

room_title: Escape room "Below Ground" by Puzzle Room Tahoe in South Lake Tahoe
review: We had to defuse a bomb before our time run out! :) it was great- we didn't escape but were very close. the bomb exploded on us :) I recommend this escape room in Tahoe. It was great

room_title: Escape room "Below Ground" by Puzzle Room Tahoe in South Lake Tahoe
review: awesome room. perfect for a family night. my kids loved it

room_title: Escape room "Below Ground" by Puzzle Room Tahoe in South Lake Tahoe
review: We played the Egyptian room first and loved it so much that we wanted to take our revenge on this one. We escaped with 1 minute to spare even though it was a more difficult room. We didnt race but they have two rooms next to each other in case folks wanted to compete. looking back, I wish I would have grabbed more friends to race against each other!

room_title: Escape room "Below Ground" by Puzzle Room Tahoe in South Lake Tahoe
review: Amazing escape room. we were racing against another team as they have 3 identical room next to each other. great experience

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We did the Grim Stacks escape room as a team-building exercise, and it was definitely a team effort! Ultimately, we escaped with just a second left! It was difficult, fun, and exhilarating at the same time. I've done about half-a-dozen other escape rooms, and this one was definitely amongst the best.Thanks to Heather, Tucker, and the rest of the staff there. It was a great time, and I recommend it to anyone looking for a fun escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This was SO MUCH FUN! My friends took me to an escape room to start off my bachelorette party! We did the Grim Stacks room. It was challenging and fun. Had some exciting moments during it! Very well put together. We didn't make it out in time, but we were so close!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Phoenix Escape Room was a great time! The group I was in participated in the Grim Stacks challenge. It was so much fun! The challenge was just right and we missed the final clue to solve the puzzle by just a couple minutes but it was still so much fun! Looking forward to visiting again!

room_title: Escape room "Kill Switch" by Endgame Escape Rooms in Redlands
review: Unique escape room with 4 different rooms and multiple possible endings! The 10 of us had enough room to work in and got through with 19 minutes left and didn't use any hints!

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Final Exam" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: Logan did fantastic. My family came here for my brother’s 40th birthday party. We solved the wizard puzzle with just a couple minutes to spare and we had so much fun. Great escape room.

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Final Exam" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: This place is the BEST escape experience in the treasure valley. Rooms are amazing and the puzzles are fun yet challenging. The amazing staff also made this a five star business!!! Can't wait to come back!! Did 2/3 rooms in one day haha

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Final Exam" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: We had a party of 13 so we split into two groups girls in the saloon and guys in the pirate room. This was the first time any of us had done this and it was so much fun! Way more difficult than any of us expected, but such clever puzzles. The staff was amazing! When I pulled up it was in a town house type business complex but don't let that put you off --there is a big adventure waiting for you inside!

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Final Exam" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: Kids loved it! So much fun for the family! Next visit we will definitely do this again!

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Final Exam" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: Excellent. Rooms are high quality, the staff is pleasant and helpful, and the puzzles are challenging yet intuitive. These are among the best escape rooms we've ever tried. We've run the pirate and wizard rooms (both great!) and look forward to running the wild west room soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Final Exam" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: We had family and friends in town for our wedding and most of them had not done an escape room before so we did the The Wizard's Final Exam. So much fun and we completed with 7:37 to spare! We'll be back to do the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Final Exam" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: We had family and friends in town for our wedding and most of them had not done an escape room before so we did the The Wizard's Final Exam. So much fun and we completed with 7:37 to spare! We'll be back to do the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Final Exam" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: I have done both their Ship and Wizard room and they were both awesome! The wizard was more challenging but the special effects and their ability to 'do magic' was great!

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Final Exam" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: We did The Wizard room which is new and had so much fun! There is no way we were in there for a full hour! Felt like only 5 minutes. The time just flew by because we were having such a blast! The atmosphere Clues and puzzles are so clever! Definitely recommend this to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Final Exam" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: Had a blast trying to figure out the clues to get out of the room! The theme and storyline was spectacular! We made it out, but not before time had taken us out. We did however, have an opportunity to finish the puzzles and find the key! (with a little help from our hosts!) Great team building and processing going on, as we all had a strength and some weaknesses! Would recommend everyone try it!

room_title: Escape room "The Alleyway Vigilantes" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: This escape room is incredible! We have played the alleyway and jungle gem. Thee puzzles are very creative, i like that it's not just a bunch of locks/boxes. We went with a group of three for both rooms and were able to escape each of them. We are very excited to try research and any other rooms that they open up!

room_title: Escape room "The Alleyway Vigilantes" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: My buddy and I spent the day going to rooms in Tampa and ended it at Imagine Escape Games after hearing a lot about it. We played “Alleyway Vigilantes” which is Part 1 of their story (that all of their rooms tie into). This was Room 53 for me and it was simply phenomenal and clever both mentally and physically. Our GameMaster was awesome and put up with our bad superhero jokes. If you are in the area and looking for a really fun time, this is the place to go.

room_title: Escape room "The Alleyway Vigilantes" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Great time celebrating a 12th birthday! Very fun, challenging and interactive! Did Alleyway Vigilantes and it was the right balance of brainwork and activity. The kids had a blast! I want to go back with grownups!

room_title: Escape room "The Alleyway Vigilantes" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: First time doing something like this. Was a wonderful experience. Will be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Alleyway Vigilantes" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: AMAZING! This room is absolutely one of the best we've played. We have about 40 or so under our belts and the eye of detail and even the surprise factor to their rooms is fantastic. We had such a great time with Jungle Gem of theirs that we just had to do the Alleyway! Fantastic job guys!!!We will definitely be back to do the rest of them when they open.

room_title: Escape room "The Machine" by The Game Room Adventure Cafe in Sacramento
review: We had a great time!! And we set a new record of 30 min completion time! The puzzles were great! Excited for more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Machine" by The Game Room Adventure Cafe in Sacramento
review: We did the escape room with a group of four people for a birthday and it was awesome! Great puzzles and creativity kept us busy the full hour. Would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Mansion Murder" by Escapology Lake Elsinore in Temecula
review: Had a seriously great night here with my friends! I'd definitely recommend this place. Everything was well decorated which made the atmosphere perfect. We chose the Mansion Murder room and managed to solve the puzzle! However, we wouldn't have been able to do that without Chris and Rayleen, the wonderful people who helped us along the way. Our game master Chris was seriously the best! The clues he gave us and words of encouragement made finding the solution that much more rewarding. I had a lot of fun and I look forward to coming back next time for a different room!

room_title: Escape room "Mansion Murder" by Escapology Lake Elsinore in Temecula
review: Inside is very nicely decorated! Was very impressed when we got there. The lobby is very comfortable, thwre is a table full puzzles and there is a huge bar and additional tables as well. We did Mansion Murder for my daughter's birthday. I waited in the lobby for the full hour and was very comfortable. The girls didnt make it out but had a ton of fun. Definitely will go back!

room_title: Escape room "Mansion Murder" by Escapology Lake Elsinore in Temecula
review: We went here with a group of six and did Mansion Murder! AMAZING!!!!! Shout out to Rayleen and Chris for helping us out throughout the escape room!! Super fun and challenging and they made sure we had enough clues and time for us to finish it!!!! Definitely going back here with friends and the family!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: Had a great experience. We started of "simple" and did the 'Wonderland' room....we quickly realize...not so simple. It was fun and challenging. Can't wait to go again.

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: Mark and I had so much fun!! We completed Wonderland, but not Alcatraz. We had to come back the next day and we did it!! Very creative!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: great time fun and exciting eexperience ! Definitely recomend as a family event we had a blast doing alice and wonderland !

room_title: Escape room "Prison Escape" by Escape LOL in Pensacola
review: We did the Prison room. It was our first escape game ever. We had a blast!! My kids loved it and so did the adults.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Escape" by Escape LOL in Pensacola
review: My family has done more than 50 escape rooms around the country, and in the Pensacola area Escape LOL was by far our favorite. They are very nice and the rooms and puzzles themselves were just awesome!! I would definitely recommend Escape LOL to anyone and everyone!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Escape" by Escape LOL in Pensacola
review: Can't say enough good about this place. The owners and employees are friendly and inviting. The rooms are very well thought out and challenging. My tweens found plenty that they could do making it enjoyable for the whole family. We are not new to breakout rooms and from our experience, Escape LOL has our vote for favorite.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Escape" by Escape LOL in Pensacola
review: I have quickly become an escape room junkie and I was very impressed with Escape LOL. The level of detail and creativity made the prison break room both challenging and interesting. The storyline was great and the staff clearly love what they do. The staff take pride in the experience they have created and are most interested in how much fun their guests have. Without a doubt the best escape room I have visited so far. I am ready to return to try the Pirate Ship room.

room_title: Escape room "Timeline" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: We did Timeline and it was awesome. We had a group of 6 and there was enough going on in the room that everyone got to play their part. The staff was amazing! We have done quite a few escape rooms and this was definitely at the top of our list. We can't wait to go back. Such a fun time!

room_title: Escape room "Timeline" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: We had 5 people in our group and did the timeline escape room. Challenging and fun at the same. Great staff.

room_title: Escape room "Timeline" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: That was an absolute blast. Took 7 friends and myself for my birthday (and first Escape Room), did both rooms, and everyone had a great time. The employees were very professional, the rooms were great, and I'd definitely recommend to everyone. Wish there were more rooms to do so I could do it again and again.

room_title: Escape room "Timeline" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: We loved it. My husband and I did it for the first time and it was awesome. The staff was super friendly and helpful. We did the Timeline room and it was definitely full of surprises and the puzzles where definitely challenging. Can't wait to go again do the CIA room.

room_title: Escape room "Coffee Cartel" by Lakeland Escape Room in Lakeland
review: Awesome room and excellent customer service made this a night my wife won’t forget. I’m so glad we were able to celebrate her birthday here!And yes, WE ESCAPED!!!

room_title: Escape room "Coffee Cartel" by Lakeland Escape Room in Lakeland
review: honestly the best time we had!!! the owners were very professional and they honestly care about their business! you should come try it out! its deff a brain thinker!

room_title: Escape room "Coffee Cartel" by Lakeland Escape Room in Lakeland
review: Joe , Noah & Christina were awesome with us!!! So friendly, they gave us very very helpful clues and explained how to get out when we were out of time. They seriously were awesome and I enjoyed my experience so much there! Definitely try the new Coffee escape room if you’re up for a challenge!!

room_title: Escape room "Mrs. RedRums Classroom" by Escape Room Delaware in Dover
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: It was great!! We all got scared at some point, real fun and entertaining the whole time

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: We just did chapter 2 of the 13th floor. So much fun and it was a great time. My family and I did it and really enjoyed it. Eddie puts on some great rooms and can't wait to see what he does next. Can't recommend these rooms enough. We have done 4 of his and over 15 total and all of his rooms rank at the top of our list.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: Just finished doing the chapter 2 escape room  This is the best escape room hands down! The actors that was part of the experience were very into their roles  We had an amazing time, definitely coming back in the very near future

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: Have now completed all of their escape rooms... All are really good; but just completed Chapter 2 and it's probably the best! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Exodus Escape Adventures in Sacramento
review: GREAT escape room! I've done many rooms and this was one of the most elaborate ones I've done. I was very impressed and had a great time! Looking forward to their next addition.

room_title: Escape room "Ocean's Ten - the Garden heist" by AdventurEscape in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Game of Stones" by Escape Rooms FL in Miami
review: Our family had a lot of fun. This was our first escape room experience. The staff was friendly and gave us hints when we needed them. I would recommend you try Escape Rooms FL.

room_title: Escape room "Game of Stones" by Escape Rooms FL in Miami
review: Visited this amazing GEM in Broward County. We did two rooms, the Game of Stones and Blackbeard's Brig.  Great puzzles, no padlocks, electronics to a new level.  Owners were welcoming and helpful and the lobby was so cool.  Highly recommend.  Can't wait to try out their Jungle room.  Will be back!!

room_title: Escape room "Game of Stones" by Escape Rooms FL in Miami
review: This has got to be the one of the best escape room! It was my son's first escape room and we escaped! I recommend this escape room for people who had atleast 3 escape room experience.

room_title: Escape room "Game of Stones" by Escape Rooms FL in Miami
review: My wife surprised me with going to an escape room.  Having done a few before entering the business I was impressed with the decor and attention to detail.  I thought they were a franchise however family owned business.  My family of 8 entering the Game of Stones was very impressed to the medieval theme.  Very intricate puzzles and we all needed to work together.  We did not escape in time but the memories were well worth it.  Will visit again.

room_title: Escape room "Game of Stones" by Escape Rooms FL in Miami
review: My family had an absolutely memorable and amazing experience! The hour flew by solving puzzles and clues to escape! The owners and staff provided amazing service. The attention to detail and decor throughout is commended.  One of the cleanest escape rooms we have visited.  A fan of medieval themes the room blew me away with surprises.  Will go back to visit their other rooms and a must for all.

room_title: Escape room "Game of Stones" by Escape Rooms FL in Miami
review: Went to this new escape room for our girls night out.  Tried many escape rooms and from beginning to end it was an amazing experience.  Owners and staff provided excellent service.  The room was walking into a medieval castle and theme with technology was one we had not yet experienced with other escape rooms.  A must do for all!  Will be going back next month with our ladies night out to experience the Jungle.  Recommended to all!

room_title: Escape room "Enchanted Forest" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The enchanted forest was full of creative puzzles with a fun atmosphere! Enchanted ER has a talent for creating amazing rooms that immerse you in your adventure. We'll definitely be back to tackle the Task Force escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Enchanted Forest" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Just did the Enchanted Forest this last weekend for a friend's early birthday celebration. The Forest was super awesomely set up, it was gloomy and only mildly creepy if you're faint of heart, and the puzzles themselves were clever and entertaining. I don't like it much if they focus too heavily on math or calculations (simply because it's harder to do as a group activity) but this one had fun puzzles that you could do independently or with someone else.I definitely want to try the other rooms at this location now!

room_title: Escape room "Enchanted Forest" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Did the Enchanted Forest room for friends birthday. Had a lot of fun. Great team building and communication exercise. Short review because I don't want to give any spoilers.

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the Lost Dutchman" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: First timers and we did the lost Dutchman room! So much fun we laughed so hard, and just had an awesome time! The room was challenging but definitely made it more fun and super clean! Staff was very friendly! We will definitely be back to try hopefully all rooms at some point!

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the Lost Dutchman" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Had a blast in the Dutchmans Escape Room, close to finishing but ran out of time. Not easy with only three people highly recommend bringing a group of 5 or more.

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the Lost Dutchman" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We did the Lost Dutchman room with a group of 7. Had such a great time and managed to escape! Definitely want to come back and try another one!

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the Lost Dutchman" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We had a group of 10 and did the lost Dutchman room, we had a great time... we did manage to escape in record setting time... our guy told me so. My ONLY thing I would do to improve our experience is to have a larger sign or lit up because we passed it as it was not easy to see especially at night.

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the Lost Dutchman" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Last night I did the "Lost Dutchman" room with 5 other people(all of us have never done an Escape room before) for a friend's birthday celebration. We worked together, solved puzzles, and had a blast. Definitely planning another trip soon and highly recommend others go as well. We escaped with 2 minutes and 11 seconds left on the clock...

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Colosseum" by The Great Escape Room in Tampa
review: We are Escape Enthusiasts with a lot of experience. We did the Colosseum Room with five people. Great puzzles. Great atmosphere. The staff was super nice. We had a slight malfunction in the room when we played and they handled it very professionally.  We will definitely be back to play the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Colosseum" by The Great Escape Room in Tampa
review: Loved The Colosseum escape room - four total and each had unique, challenging puzzles.  The theme elements were perfect including torches instead of flashlights.  I am close to twenty escape rooms, and this is one of the best! I would highly recommend this escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Colosseum" by The Great Escape Room in Tampa
review: Lots of fun!  We did the Colosseum experience and it was very well done.  Props and scenery were great.  I thought some of the puzzles were really hard to put together, but this is only the second escape room I have done.  The group had a great time.  Would definitely try another of their rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Confinement" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: My girlfriend and I did the "confinement " room for our first escape the room and we are HOOKED!!! Not only was the challenge a blast but the employees we interacted with were amazing!!! Austin was our game master and he was great! He went above and beyond from the moment we got there. There was also a girl working who was just as awesome. We will definitely recommend this to everyone and we will be back soon!!

room_title: Escape room "Confinement" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: We did the confinement room last night. Our game master sandy was amazing! We have done a lot of escape rooms and this is one of the best. The tasks made sense but we're still challenging.  We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Confinement" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: My family and I had a great experience. We did the co confinement room and we were SOOOOOOO close to finishing. The clues were well thought out, great set up and multiple rooms made for a challenging and exciting time. It brought us together and the kids keep talking about it days afterward. Zahara, our host, was amazing, super friendly and helpful. Definitely will go again!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Trumbull in Danbury
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Desperate in the Wild West" by Wolff Escapes in Putnam
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Vampire" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My family and friends have done almost all of the Maze rooms and the Vampire Room is now one of our favorites. It is scary, atmospheric, and features some very unique and clever puzzles. There is excellent use of tech that is smooth, surprising, satisfying, and well-integrated. More than any other escape room we have done, there is a definite cause and effect with things you manipulate. There is good audio and visual confirmation when something is done correctly. Our group produced some genuine squeals, eeks, and a bonafide scream or two. It is not gory, freaky, or bloody and those who are not horror fans should be fine in this room.We escaped with quite a few hints, but I was glad we were able to experience the entire room and all its tricks and treats.

room_title: Escape room "Vampire" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Back again for another game at Maze Rooms! The new Vampire Room was very cool. The theme and immersion was impressive and the puzzles were clever! We took a friend who hadn't played before and he was blown away. I really enjoyed the flow of this game and the difficulty was very high, but we escaped! I really liked how much teamwork was designed into this game, there was always something to do and everyone contributed in a significant way. Loved it!!

room_title: Escape room "Vampire" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Vampire Room and it was very well done. Cool props and neat puzzles. Flowed well.

room_title: Escape room "Black Ops - Destination Classified" by ALL IN Adventures Orange Park in Jacksonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Clue" by Escape This Live: Columbus in Columbus (GA)
review: My husband and I always try to hit the local escape rooms wherever we travel. This one was fun, and they let us play two rooms back to back. The clues were hard enough that it was still challenging. Our favorite room was the Clue room, we had a lot of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Clue" by Escape This Live: Columbus in Columbus (GA)
review: The service was amazing! Also the Mafia and the Clue room was worth the money and time! Awesome experience!

room_title: Escape room "Clue" by Escape This Live: Columbus in Columbus (GA)
review: Got a big group together and went to the "Clue" room. We had a blast! It was very well set up, definitely made you use your brain, and had all of us ready to go back and try the second room. I also love their plans for expanding and growing and changing. We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Clue" by Escape This Live: Columbus in Columbus (GA)
review: 10 people for the Clue room and it was fun! Can't wait to come back and do another escape challenge!

room_title: Escape room "Bunker 77" by Extreme Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Theater" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: A very well organized room. The gamemaster is the best. Me and my team enjoyed the experience a lot. Looking forward to visiting your other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Theater" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: Great addition to the mall! Tons of parking and food options available. Make a night of it! Some of the toughest and coolest looking rooms around!

room_title: Escape room "The Theater" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: My girlfriend and I came here and did the room called "The Theatre." Our cluemaster Asher did an excellent job of letting us go through the room but giving us help when we needed it, allowing for it to be challenging but still really fun so we could finish the room with 7 minutes to spare. We'd love to go back at some point and do the other rooms, as the rest of the staff was great too.

room_title: Escape room "The New Atlantis" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: My son and I played the Atlantis room and had a blast. We didn’t escape but our game host, Luke, was great and took the time to show us the last three puzzles we missed. I have played escape games at other locations and in my opinion this room had difficult but logical clues that clearly led you to the next puzzle - not all rooms are like this. My teenage son can’t wait to play at this location again!

room_title: Escape room "The New Atlantis" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: We recently did the New Atlantis. It is the only room we have done here since we don't live in Huntsville. We love escape rooms, probably having done about 15 in total. I am amazed that this is a local business, because it is as high a quality as many of the larger chain escape rooms. It was a really well thought out room, I would say one of my favorites of all time. It was challenging, one of the tougher rooms I have done, but with some clues and good help we escaped. We will definitely be back to try the other rooms someday. I think our game master's name was Chloe. She was fantastic. Lots of fun.

room_title: Escape room "The New Atlantis" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Had an incredible time at this escape room! Staff was incredibly helpful and friendly, especially Miranda. The room was extremely well put together, sometimes there is just so much going on its hard to stay on track, but I thought the "Atlantis" themed room we completed was well thought out and creative. Would definitely come back again!

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Revenge" by Race60 in Windsor (CA)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Amazon Rainforest" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: This was an amazing experience! My wife and I happened to walk by it and she said jokingly "want to do an escape room?". Without hesitation I said yes and in we went. It is by far the most decorated escape room we've seen to date. The two hosts were incredibly friendly. We choose the amazon plane crash room. The decoration and the detail were incredible! It was mildly difficult. My wife and I completed it with 10 minutes to spare. We can't wait to try the other one!! You will not Be disappointed with this escape room! Well done!

room_title: Escape room "Amazon Rainforest" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: After doing now 60 escape rooms, the Amazon room is definitely one the neatest set designs I have seen so far. You can definitely tell that a lot of work went into it to make it as immersive as possible. Please take note though that I played with 2 other people and some of the puzzles would be easier to achieve with 1 or maybe two more people. Also attention to detail is needed for this room as it is easy to miss items you are needing to find in order to do some of the puzzles. Our game master Aly was fun and refreshingly enthusiastic! Thank you for the fun experience!

room_title: Escape room "Amazon Rainforest" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: *I am an internationally experienced Escape Room enthusiast with hundreds of rooms under my belt*These wonderful owners have created some beautiful rooms here. They are quite deserving of their High Production Value/Immersive award that they won for their Amazon Rainforest room. From start to finish, that room was one of my all-time favorites. So much attention to detail and overall fun. And the price is even lower than other Escape Rooms. Their Gravitational Effect room was a step-down in puzzle quality, though the interior design was still above-average. I especially enjoyed the physical dynamic in the middle room. Gift shops usually put me off, but in the lobby you can buy beautiful flowers hand-made by the owner. It was a nice touch.Games played: Amazon Rainforest, Gravitational Effect

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: The rooms at the PanIQ Escape Room location in San Jose are incredible. The Wild West Room was beautiful and the Insane Asylum had me jumping! The creators did a great job integrating hints and puzzles into the actual build of the room. Can't wait to try the third room!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: This place is awesome! It was our first time ever doing an escape room and we all loved it! Our group of six went into the Asylum room. Romeo helped us through it, he was great! We probably asked for more clues than most people and he was always ready to answer our questions and help us figure out how to get to the next step. The room itself was really cool. The first part is a padded room and the other two were dark and scary. So much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: Let me start this by saying that I AM NOT A FAN OF SCARY SH*T. When my friend said "hey want to do an escape room" I jumped at the chance and said yes before I even knew the theme. I got super excited then she said... "it's called Insane Asylum".We basically got locked into a padded cell that was creepy as hell and had try to find our way out. While I was creeped out the entire time, I had a great time figuring out the puzzles, it definitely got my mind off the blood on the walls.Jonathan the game attendant was super nice, helpful and funny. He gave great hints that were never too revealing which kept it challenging and fun for us.We will definitely be back for their third and most difficult room.

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: We were blown away by the imagination shown in the design of the Bionic Dilemma room. After talking for a while with the designer we understood his passion for originality. They were great fun puzzles with some great surprises. Great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: Bionic room was both fun and rather difficult. Our family experienced many challenges in solving, but with help and extensive guess-and-check, in the end it was extremely fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: Excellent time with our teenage boys....nobody argued! And we all worked well together on their very unique, fun & challenging puzzle! We did the space lab puzzle with Ava. She survived too! Thank you, Narrow Escape!

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: Had a blast and made it out alive!! Thanks the bionic room was the one we did. Fun loads a laughs. Would do it again!!

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My mom took me, my dad, and my sister to this earlier today, and I have to say that I'm deeply impressed and satisfied. We did the story where we tried to break out of an abandoned lab with the help of a Robot named Ada. The story was intriguing, the riddles where clever, and my family had fun over all. Kudos to the guy who put this together.

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My wife and I took our precocious grandkids, ages 13 and 8, to our first "escape room" adventure while on their Spring Break last week. It was the highlight of the whole week. Working as a team, we solved the room's various puzzles, found keys and codes and brain twisting solutions to riddles, problems and posers of all sorts. Ada the trapped Robot became a friend and ally of invaluable worth as we strove to save us all before the power drained out for the "subterranean" lab we had stumbled into. Loads of fun and well worth the modest expense. Triple Wow!

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: My sister and I decided to do the detective room not knowing what to expect and it turned out to be so fun! The puzzles were very challenging but we worked as a team and solved most of the puzzles but ended up running out of time. We are now going to do the cavern next and we are determined to get it of this room. Definitely would recommend!!

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: We had 50 minutes to follow the clues and escape, we did it in 46 minutes. The clues were challenging but logical and it was really fun to work with good friends and people I didn't know well to solve them.

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: This experience was quite fun, at first I was a bit hesitant to try this because the thought of being locked in a room with strangers just didn't appeal to me. After my first escape room, I couldn't wait to try all of others. I've seen 3 of the escape rooms from Escape Room LA and their all very well produced and designed, compared to a few others I've seen that aren't nearly as well produced. Once you step into a room, you feel like you're in the environment of the game. Even though you may be a room with strangers, it's fun to be able to talk and meet with new people even if it is for an hour. It's definitely a good way to spend an hour to an hour and a half in LA if you're visiting LA with some free time.

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: *The Detective*Damn Gina - we didn't escape! :( But overall the entire experience was super fun and a nice alternative to do something different!Diving into the deets:You go into this kinda shady looking building and wonder if you're at the right place, on the outside it looks pretty rundown and nondescript, but trust you're at the right spot. Once you arrive, you'll be waiting in the hallway with others until they call you in. Check in is simple: show your email confirmation on your phone or print out. After, they asked we go around the room and introduce ourselves and give a tiny blurb about yourself, which was a nice icebreaker especially since we didn't know the others that signed up for the same event. Next, they went over the rules and hinted at a couple of things, but nothing that would take away the guesswork from us. The staff waited a couple of minutes past our slotted time for the 2 missing people in our group, but they ended up a no show. There's a last chance to use the restroom, make sure you take it because once you ask to leave the room, you aren't allowed to go back in.Once in the room, they started a clock and we broke into an immediate frenzy. It's good to work in pairs and call out to everyone if you found a clue. Meanwhile, there was a staff member dressed as a detective inside the room and a few times he hinted at something if we half-uncovered a clue and were struggling, in a major way. Without him, I honestly don't think we would have solved 3-5 clues... I could see how some people would be really frustrated if they got stuck.Anyway, the next hour went by REALLY quick! Like a lot of the other reviews say: Teamwork + Communication is KEY to well, find the key! The puzzles overall were fun, some more challenging than others, but clever nonetheless and you had to solve all of them in order to find the key. Time ran out and we didn't escape but had a great time anyway. I'd be interested in trying The Cavern.In the end, the only thing I could think they could improve on is:-Rather than allowing 12 people into a room, I'd say 6-8 max is better.-Allow an additional 10-15 minsThe staff was great in offering to take pictures after the event, even when they were literally given 7 different cameras and took multiple photos on each device. We left with a coupon for their other events, i.e. RaceLA, CityRace.Anyway, last tips:Plan ahead by allotting plenty of time before your scheduled event. Parking is in DTLA where majority of the streets are one-way and if you're trying to save yourself a few dollars, you'll most likely circle around a couple of times before deciding on where to park. The lot right next to building where you do the event was $7 on a Saturday, cash only. HAVE FUN and GOOD LUCK!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: The puzzle was SO HARD in the detective. We got to the last piece and struggled on that for about 20 minutes. This was a perfect challenge. This is the best escape room I've done. The staff is super friendly as well and parking was a breeze. 10/10 would go again.

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: The puzzle was SO HARD in the detective. We got to the last piece and struggled on that for about 20 minutes. This was a perfect challenge. This is the best escape room I've done. The staff is super friendly as well and parking was a breeze. 10/10 would go again.

room_title: Escape room "Rocket Science" by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: My boyfriend and I visited the Cape Canaveral area back in March and saw a flyer for Escape Cocoa Beach when we checked into our hotel, so we decided to give it a try. One of the owners was working that night (Vhilena) and she was so incredibly sweet. We did the "Rocket Science" escape room and it was NOT easy, but we still had a lot of fun. The location is also great and very convenient if you want to visit the Cocoa Beach Pier before or after (it's only about a 5min walk). A great idea for a fun date night or an evening out with friends.

room_title: Escape room "Rocket Science" by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: There were just two of us, we tried the Rocket Science and Black Dahlia. Both were well thought out, had easy to follow instructions and Jo was a great help when needed! Highly recommend going here!

room_title: Escape room "Rocket Science" by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: The time has was so nice we did it twice! Literally. Loved these rooms! The Rocket Science room was a nice introduction into what you're doing and the Black Dahlia was a super fun challenge! We made it out with a minute to spare! I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ghost Ship" by The House of Clues in Santa Barbara
review: The pirate ghost ship was so much fun!  The escape room is very well-designed and quite challenging too. It's actually pretty awesome. The staff is super friendly and we're looking forward to returning.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ghost Ship" by The House of Clues in Santa Barbara
review: By far the best-designed room I have been to. We have done quite a few in Austin and stopped by Santa Barbara on our way home for Thanksgiving and found the House of Clues looking for something to do. The owners are set designers and spent a year building the Pirate Ghost Ship room, on top of building sets for some escape rooms back in Austin! The exit was something we've never seen before and truly unique. If we were here longer we would definitely be back to try their harder rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ghost Ship" by The House of Clues in Santa Barbara
review: My friends and I had so much fun! We did both the pirate ship and the dentist office. Both rooms were engaging, challenging, witty and full of surprises (and a few minor scares!) The staff is great and makes the experience fantastic!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ghost Ship" by The House of Clues in Santa Barbara
review: The Haunted Pirate Ship was my 7th escape room and it was definitely in at least the top 2 of the ones I've done. I think what really makes this one stand out is the attention to detail on props/set decoration. The room was absolutely dripping with atmosphere - tons of fun props used in creative, surprising ways, ambient sound, and a surprisingly spacious building despite the small entrance room.The difficulty was about right, with the moderator willing to give hints when we needed them. I felt like the price was a little high for a 45-minute experience. But on the other hand, real estate in Santa Barbara is very expensive and I didn't feel let down by the experience - I would pay for it again, and am looking to come back and try out the Psycho Dentist soon!

room_title: Escape room "Down the Rabbit Hole" by Anonymous Games in Orlando
review: We accepted the mission to travel Down the Rabbit Hole and definitely did not regret it. The room theming is completely immersive and the attention to detail is evident everywhere. The story is well-chosen and lends itself well to the puzzles, riddles, and game elements. Lots of fun mind teasers and elements not often found in other escape rooms make this a unique and enjoyable experience. A must-do for any real escape room fans. We will absolutely be back to visit the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Down the Rabbit Hole" by Anonymous Games in Orlando
review: Down the rabbit hole is a huge escape room. We had so much fun. The puzzles were well thought out and forced us to work together. Strong addition to the Orlando escape room market

room_title: Escape room "Down the Rabbit Hole" by Anonymous Games in Orlando
review: Their “Down the Rabbit Hole” game is awesome. Fun, challenging and creative.

room_title: Escape room "Super Bomb Squad: Commandos Awesome" by Doldrick's Escape Room in Orlando
review: Amazing experience and super friendly staff! The escape room was challenging, creative and super cool! Thanks Mike for making this experience so fun and filled with laughter! They really want you to have a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Super Bomb Squad: Commandos Awesome" by Doldrick's Escape Room in Orlando
review: Fun afternoon with family! Great balance between difficulty/ease of solving. Mazes are high quality especially the bomb squad!

room_title: Escape room "Super Bomb Squad: Commandos Awesome" by Doldrick's Escape Room in Orlando
review: Super Bomb Squad was a great Escape Room.  We've done several others in a couple other states and this one was one of the most fun.  We had eight people in our group which was a good number for all of the puzzles.

room_title: World of Escapes
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: LOVED Hourglass. We did Alcatraz and Asylum over the same weekend and beat both. I was nervous due to having been worthless in the first escape room I ever did in New Jersey, but this was fun and engaging, even for my 8 year old nephew.

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: We loved the Asylum rooms!! So creative and fun! The staff was super nice and helpful as well. We can’t wait to go back

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: Fun, creative rooms. The Staff was super friendly and helpful. This was our first time, and we can't wait to do another one. If you go - Asylum is the room to go to! So fun!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Just incredible, the immersion alone, Prison Break was by far the best escape room I have ever done!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: We had a wonderful experience with the family escaping a prison cell. It was a beautifully mind-boggling time that promotes family togetherness and quick thinking.
