Although we did not escape, we learned to work as a team and use clues to get the job done. A great trip for anyone. Would most definitely recommend to anyone looking for a fun, challenging adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Had an awesome time with my family! Rooms were smartly staged. Very fun and challenging experience. Thankful for the assistance of staff, particularly, Richard. Will definitely return.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: We chose the prison break only to later find out right before we were starting it was one of the hardest ones. It was a blast! I had the best time ever and will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Wow...! What an Amazing time...! Where do I start? The staff was amazing, knowledgeable, fun, and courteous..! The Prison Break was a daunting task... you will love it...!If you and your family are fun and adventurous, then I recommend this highly...! And if you have Courtney to welcome you and Nathaniel to Guide you, You are Guaranteed a Blast..!You should definitely come and play Playground with Game Guide Richard Boone...!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: I had a awesome first experience at an escape room, so glad we picked this one! The staff was great, attentive, and super friendly. We did 2 rooms, prison break and special ops. The prison break room was the most difficult(we didn't escape) and special ops was pretty difficult as well( we escaped!) Overall it was a great experience and I hope to be returning soon!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: The experience was great. We will gladly recommend it to others. The adventure we were apart of was well thought out.

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: We took our family — a group of seven cousins, siblings and two parents and chose the Gold Rush room. We had a blast and it was the quickest hour spent. It was magic watching the kids work to get us out with 26 seconds to spare

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: This was for a team building exercise. It was so much fun! We had a great team! Everyone worked so well together and we were the first group to ESCAPE! I had so much fun I would recommend not only for team building but family and friends!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: I played the Goldrush room with my two boys (age 10 and 7), and we all loved it. We needed extra clues since it was just the three of us, but the workers were super friendly. There was a lot of variety in the types of puzzles/clues.

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: I've been to a few other escape rooms but this was the absolute best!! I was able to bring 4 other friends so we had 5 people in the room. I think this was a good number for this room.Room: Gold Rush Level: 7/103 free clues, all additional cost you 3 minutes The standard price is $33/person and after understanding how this game works I think it's worth it! It'sVery immersive experience, without being scary. Lots of puzzles and a great introduction to the rules. Justin explained everything clearly and was really nice to our crew.We made it out with 15 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Room 303" by 303 Escape in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes: A Matter of Time" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: If you enjoy puzzles and mysteries than you will love Escape Room Live. We did the Sherlock Holmes room and completed it just in time. We had 9 people, I would recommend 8 or more for this room because it is very difficult with numerous puzzles to solve. Overall very good experience and I highly  recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes: A Matter of Time" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: This place was so much better than I expected. The space was impressively decorated and very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. The event was fun and extremely interactive for my family. It kept my grandmother and my daughter very engaged along with the rest of us. It didn't hurt that we won as well. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to spend a fun filled hour with friends in old town!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes: A Matter of Time" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: So much fun!!! Recommend to everyone looking for something different to do.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes: A Matter of Time" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Challenging and fun, decor was very well done, will do again soon!

room_title: Escape room "Countdown To Terror" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: so much fun! David was our game master and did a fantastic job answering any and all questions that we had. the game we played was countdown to terror, made it out but just barely!

room_title: Escape room "Defenders of the Galaxy" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: Our group had a great time! The Galaxy room was cute fun :). It was my first escape room experience, thank you for making it an enjoyable and successful one!!!

room_title: Escape room "Defenders of the Galaxy" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: We attended the Xscape Pods last night and had a blast.  Three of us did the defenders of the galaxy room and it was Perfect as an intro room since neither of us had ever done any escape rooms.  We will defiantly be back with our hubby's and do the government room.

room_title: Escape room "Defenders of the Galaxy" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: Our group of 4 did the Defenders of the Galaxy room and we had a great time!  I think 4 players is then perfect amount for this room. The decor was really cool and the puzzles were difficult but not too much so. Will definitely be back to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Psycho Dentist" by The House of Clues in Santa Barbara
review: Psycho dentist was a great room!  The decor and storyline were just awesome. I have done 50+ escape rooms and highly recommend this place.  The technology was pretty cool but the twists and turns in the storyline were by far the best attribute of the room. Some of the puzzles didn't exactly fit the theme but nevertheless it was a good room. The management was super friendly and I can't wait to go back and do the Ghost Ship.

room_title: Escape room "Psycho Dentist" by The House of Clues in Santa Barbara
review: This was my second time doing an escape room and it blew the first out of the water. Our group did the "Psycho Dentist" room. We had a large group (9 people) which typically isn't the ideal size for this, but we had a ton of fun and easily made it work.We all left agreeing that we will definitely be recommending this to other teams from our company.

room_title: Escape room "Psycho Dentist" by The House of Clues in Santa Barbara
review: Me and my fiancé were in town for the day and since we are escape room fanatics, we just had to do one before we head back to LA. Our host Asel was super accommodating and friendly with our last-minute booking. She even honored extra time since we were a 2 people team. We were very grateful for that.We did the Psycho Dentist room. We enjoyed every minute although most of the time, we were scratching our heads trying to put together puzzles and clues. We needed countless hints indeed, every time when Asel sees us struggling, she knew we needed help before we even spoke. We can easily say this was one of our favorite escape room out of all that we've done. Definitely come check them out.

room_title: Escape room "Shanghaied" by Escapology Destin in Destin
review: Our family had a fantastic time. A perfect way to begin the New Year. It took all 6 of us to figure our way out of “Shanghaied”, but we made it with 22 seconds to spare! Thanks, Escapology - we’ll be back!

room_title: Escape room "GameEscape" by Fantasy Escapes in Tampa
review: We had a great time, the owner was a great help. Great family experience, we worked as a team and had a blast. That quiz master is a WIZ.. we will be back.

room_title: Escape room "GameEscape" by Fantasy Escapes in Tampa
review: Saturday night my wife and I had our first escape room experience at Fantasy Escapes and WE ARE HOOKED!!! We absolutely chose the right place for our first time.

room_title: Escape room "GameEscape" by Fantasy Escapes in Tampa
review: played one of their rooms thus far. looking forward to playing more

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Pandemic" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: Love coming to Hourglass Escape Rooms! The staff are always so nice & the games fun. Played the Pandemic room with the zombie actor tonight & he was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Hotel" by Great Escape Mystery Rooms in Fort Smith
review: My husband took our daughter and a few friends for her 12th birthday and they had a BLAST! The loved the Haunted Hotel and highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Hotel" by Great Escape Mystery Rooms in Fort Smith
review: Spent our weekend in Ft Smith and Took my wife to the Great Escape for something different on our Anniversary.We had an Absolute Blast and Made it out in the nick of time!!We will definitely be returning and bringing our three Teenage sons with us next time! Would recommend this place to anyone!!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Hotel" by Great Escape Mystery Rooms in Fort Smith
review: What a fun way to get your team together and have fun! The staff was amazing and we really enjoyed the haunted hotel!

room_title: Escape room "Caskwerks & Capone" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: great fun for all 10 of us!!!! good time for our whole group, we had people ranging in age from 10 to 70. everyone enjoyed it.

room_title: Escape room "Caskwerks & Capone" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: It was a great time! I went for a team building event for work and can’t wait to go back with the family!

room_title: Escape room "Caskwerks & Capone" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: I did Caskworks and Capone with a friend. It was my first time only having two people solving the clues. It was fun and I really enjoyed the set up of the room. It looked like a speakeasy. I think we would have solved faster with one more person but we made it out with 19 seconds to spare! The hints are good and we didn't need to use any clues, which cost time. This one was also cool because you start in a dark room and have to figure out how to turn on the lights! Not totally dark, but you definitely need to get the lights figured out first.

room_title: Escape room "Western" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Super friendly and helpful staff with a great setup. We tried the Western room and came *THIS* close to victory, but were thwarted by an oversight on some simpler puzzles. Loved it, definitely coming back to try the Science room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Western" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: My husband and I did the Western room with our two kids (13 & 17) and we had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Western" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Our group of 8 consisted of 5 adults and 3 teens. The Western Room was so funny and just perfect for our first ever escape room. Definitely stimulates teamwork. We were so excited solving each puzzle! We can't wait to book the Voodoo room next.

room_title: Escape room "Western" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Did three out of four rooms at Lockdown. It was a great experience each time, and the Western theme was my favorite. The decorations are really good and authentic and add to the story. Lisa did an awesome job greeting us, getting us ready, and helping us when we got stumped. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Western" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Very nice set up. We had a great time doing voodoo and western!

room_title: Escape room "Arizona Shootout" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: My friend and I had a great time trying to escape Arizona Shootout. We were not successful but had a lot of fun. Our gamemaster Erica Segarra was helpful and tried to point us in the right direction but we got bogged down on the map. This was not an easy game but it makes you think and laugh at yourself.

room_title: Escape room "Arizona Shootout" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: Best escape room we’ve ever done. Very challenging but fair. The staff was very patient and professional. The Wild West themed room was great. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Arizona Shootout" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: Wonderful experience. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Will definitely come back.

room_title: Escape room "Arizona Shootout" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: Great experience! The place is gorgeous and the game is on!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: X-13" by Trapped! Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This is the second location of the original Upland Trapped. Our team of four played the X-13 Room and escaped with 8 min left using only one hint. Very fun, realistically immersive game. Good puzzles and tech. The staff was fun to work with and helped us keep the story going throughout the game. Highly recommend any of their rooms, and can't wait until the new ones open!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: X-13" by Trapped! Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We enjoyed operation x-13, it was a great themed room with awesome puzzles, we recommend it to everyone

room_title: Escape room "Operation: X-13" by Trapped! Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was really cool! Tried the Operation: X-13 room with a couple of my friends and they all had a good time (it was their first escape room). Definitely would want to try the Sector 13 or the Down the Rabbit Hole at their other locations. Overall a good experience, would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Bowl Voyage" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of KV62" by Locked Adventures in San Marcos (CA)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Hexadron" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: We loved it! We did the Hexadron with my son for his 13th birthday! Most fun I've had in a long time! We escaped! Thanks to our guide, Paul! You were awesome! All the staff was really nice!

room_title: Escape room "The Hexadron" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Had an absolute blast! John was our host and he was phenomenal. The interaction between guests and staff was top notch. Escaped from Hexadron with just under ten minutes to spare on a first visit, I can't wait to visit again!

room_title: Escape room "The Hexadron" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Absolutely spectacular fun! Very clever puzzles to keep you on your toes as you move through the room to escape. The Hexadron (Alien Room) was out of this world! I can't wait to come back!

room_title: Escape room "The Hexadron" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: I couldn't believe how much fun I had. My dad and I went back the next night to do a second room, we loved it so much. The people running it were great too, especially Jamie. The new room, Hexadron, was awesome! Thanks for running such a great place to escape to (and from!) !

room_title: Escape room "The Hexadron" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: My family loved our escape experience! We booked the Hexadron room & escaped with 2 minutes left! It was such a fun night working together to figure out the clues! You really have to think outside of the box but our game host gave us great clues without giving it away! The staff was awesome! I would recommend this activity for all ages & groups! Can't wait to go back & try a different room!

room_title: Escape room "Cabin in the Woods" by Tampa Bay Escape Room in Tampa
review: We did The Cabin in the Woods room as our family Christmas together outing and made it out just before time ran out. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The clues in the room were fun and we had several aha moments. The clues we received when we asked for help were just right. We will definitely go again and recommend it to others.

room_title: Escape room "Cabin in the Woods" by Tampa Bay Escape Room in Tampa
review: First time attempting an escape room. 7% success rate and finished with 2mins 9seconds left. My wife, father, stepmother and myself escaped the cabin in the woods. It was a great time and probably started a new thing for us. Great staff, great instructions and a great time. Thanks for making my dad's bday present awesome!!

room_title: Escape room "Cabin in the Woods" by Tampa Bay Escape Room in Tampa
review: Myself and 3 friends picked the Cabin in the Woods room. As soon as it started I realized that this was going to be awesome! We started out on a great pace and even our host said he thought we were going to beat the fastest time, but we got stuck on something so easy that we overlooked. We eventually got out with about 6 or 7 minutes to spare. We all had a great time and were talking about it for the rest of the day. We will definitely be back to try the kidnapped one next!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Book of Spells" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: Did the book of spells room and it was so much fun, very well done. Can't wait to try another! Definitely recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Book of Spells" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: We've done quite a few escape rooms, but Team vs Time Connecticut was by far the best we've played. Immersive and eerie, "The Book of Spells" brought us back to the 1600's where we found ourselves breaking into and sneaking around a witch's house to find her prized possession. The detail is amazing. We finished with 15 minutes to spare. We will definitely be back to conquer their three other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Book of Spells" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: I just did the Lost Book of Spells room with a group of 3 friends and we had a great time! The staff is really nice and the puzzles were challenging and creative but doable. I would definitely go back to try another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Book of Spells" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: Having done many escapes all over the US and Canada, I can say that these two are a great experience. We played the Gangster and The Book of Spells games and were so impressed by the theatrical immersion and the game play. What a great time! They also have a new game mid-build.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Book of Spells" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: This place is amazing! Went with my friend to do the Lost Book of Spells, and there is an incredible amount of attention to detail with extras built in to make it really feel like you've broken into a 17th century witch's kitchen.  Some puzzles were easier than others, and luckily we both had "eureka" moments to move us forward. Yay teamwork! You have to look at everything, and if you don't use something in one room, you may need it in the next.  Or it may be a complete red herring, but you figure that out as you go along.  In the end, we did retrieve the book from the dastardly witch and triumphed in the end. :)

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: A great night with the Collector! It was definitely challenging but also so much fun! We will definitely be coming back soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: Loved it! Went here with my mom, her friend, and my boyfriend. It’s very clean inside, the decor was cool and steampunk-looking to me. The rooms were set up down a hall and you choose which room setup to go into. We went into the Collector's room and once you start your hour time, your blood just starts pumping! The items were in very good hiding spots and I loved our host who can give you clues whenever you ask. They were very nice and polite and it was a lot of family fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: My favorite escape room yet. The Collector was creepy and entertaining. The staff is engaging and our Game Master Cipriano was the best part of the whole experience! Can't wait for our next room.

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: Absolutely beautiful! Our group of five conquered both "The Collector" and "Pirate Adventure" and all I can say is "WOW!" The rooms are spectacular and so beautifully detailed. We cannot wait to come back and tackle the new rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: My family and I had never been to an escape room before and were fairly uncertain of what to expect. From the moment we walked in, it was amazing. The staff is extremely helpful and absolutely passionate about their work. We did the Collector room, and the set design makes you feel like you are really in a serial killer's basement. I am officially hooked.

room_title: Escape room "Popstar's Room of Doom" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: I’ve done several escape the room games and they are always really fun. They’re so different from each other that you can keep going and it’s always a challenge.

room_title: Escape room "Popstar's Room of Doom" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: Did the Pop Star Room of Doom here with a full group of reasonably experienced ppl, and barely made it out. The main draw of the room is that it's very different than traditional escape rooms: the time loop concept was interesting and is why I'm rating this room as high as I am, and I appreciate that they tried something out of the ordinary. Unfortunately, I found the execution somewhat lacking: the actors were all good, but the main puzzles just weren't that interesting, and there was a particular thing you had to keep on doing through the game that felt like it was unnecessarily added to the room as filler. The game is weird in that there isn't really that much to do in the game in general, so an individual person will probably contribute exactly one key insight since most of the puzzles are based on observation. This probably is worth checking out for escape room enthusiasts simply due to the premise and novelty of the room, but I imagine that if the idea catches on and more companies starting doing rooms like this (which is honestly not super likely to happen due to the additional cost needed to make this work) then this will end up being a more average experience.

room_title: Escape room "Popstar's Room of Doom" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: We did the Pop Star's Room of Doom. This is not the escape room for people who love puzzles and the traditional escape room experience. This room is for people who like the sleuthing aspect of escape rooms, can think on their feet, want an interactive experience and want to try a new take on an escape room experience.  I would not do this room with more than 4 people as there is definitely a logjam aspect inherent to the room where you will be doing nothing waiting for something to happen frequently if you have more people. I would rate this room medium to high difficulty level. Bring a lot of people who are super observant with you! MILD SPOILERS:- the actors in the room were so fun and great at improvising as they interacted with us with their snarky responses. I loved this part of the room the most.- the room left a few of us twiddling our thumbs but I don't know a way around this because of the way the puzzle is structured. Nevertheless, we enjoyed wasting time just using our thinking caps in those moments.- I find the structure and planning for this room so creative and intricate, I really admire the planning that must have gone into engineering this experience.- I like how the actors did not try to mislead us with red herrings and drag out the time which some other rooms try to do. - the hinting system may be tough for those who want hints on command, but we found it worked fine.

room_title: Escape room "TEG Unlocked: The Heist - Vol. 1: Chasing Hahn [DIGITAL]" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Went to The Escape Game as a team builder with work peers! What a truly engaged, and fun event!!! Would definitely love to go back!!!

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Jose Gaspar's Pirate Ship" by Can You Escape? in Tampa

room_title: Escape room "Mutiny" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: We did the mutiny room with 3 twenty five year olds and our grandparents! We had so much fun! Highly recommend to anyone! Multi generation fun and laughs! Great puzzles and wonderful staff!

room_title: Escape room "Mutiny" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: Our family group of six had a great time in the Mutiny room. The room was really challenging, and we did not escape, but Brian, the owner, spent time at the end to show us the clues/puzzles we missed! Nice place; will go again when we visit.

room_title: Escape room "Mutiny" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: Love this place! I have done all the rooms except for the newest room, Conspiracy. The Mutiny room is amazing and the staff are so sweet!

room_title: Escape room "Hero League" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: Have done over 20 Escape Rooms in the Tampa Bay area (Because once you've done one you just HAVE to do more, am I right?) and Outerlife Studios is our top pick. All three of their rooms have blown our minds with the brilliant mechanics and completely different ideas. Some escape rooms lead you from lock to lock to lock, but Outerlife has very clever puzzles that make the experience very immersive.Their newest room Hero League DRAT has some very ingenuous use of space. Any hesitation about it being a "mobile" escape room instantly dissipated as soon as my team and I stepped in. This is very well another top notch addition to their other two rooms and can't recommend it enough.Now, what makes outer life even greater is their staff, we have loved geeking out with their team, they are warm, welcoming and engaging, and really make us want to come back for more (hurry up and make more rooms ASAP, please). It doesn't hurt that its also a great location near central ave with fantastic walking distance to plenty of drinking and dining options nearby for you to debrief with your team.TLDR, one of the best escape rooms experiences in Tampa Bay. If you've done their previous two rooms, come do their third one, you will not regret it at all.

room_title: Escape room "Hero League" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: As a huge fan of Outerlife Studios, I was definitely curious about their new mobile escape room, Hero League/D.R.A.T (Destructive Roaming Armored Transport). I’ve done many escape rooms (some even international) and have had a wide range of experiences and each time Outerlife still is at the top of my list.First off, the owners are really cool, chill people who clearly love doing this. They love to debrief after and love seeing people excited after exiting their rooms. Each room has an element you don’t expect, so win or lose you’ll have a blast in each room.So with our prior experience with Outerlife in mind, we were curious to see how this new Hero League D.R.A.T. room would be.Overall, we were over the moon happy and loved the whole experience! If I could erase my brain and do it again I happily would.The story was well thought out and the acting in the videos added to your excitement. The technology was excellent and really immersed you further into the story. I can say one aspect of this room had us absolutely floored had to do with the color green - when you do the room you’ll understand.The puzzles flowed well and added to the story and everything made sense - sometimes a pet peeve of mine is when you have to solve a puzzle for no reason. Not a single key with locker lock in the whole room, which is exciting for anyone tired of endless find-the-key-and-correct-lock of many other escape companies.The puzzles also requires a good bit of teamwork which is really fun and had us giggling with excitement the whole time. We had a team of 6 and we never felt cramped or in each other’s way which I was definitely wondering about when we first got in. It was surprisingly spacious.Overall, I was extremely impressed with this room and would say Outerlife continues to stand as the best escape company in the Tampa Bay Area. I loved Disarm and Scorched and can definitely add the new Hero League D.R.A.T. room to that list. Now I have to wait for the next room to come out ....

room_title: Escape room "Hero League" by Outerlife Studios in Tampa
review: Four generations conquered the Hero League experience! Amazing challenge, fun for all ages, interactive, great escape effects, and tools to unlock/uncover the many clues. Mike, Mark, Zach, Kyle are all awesome! This is the ultimate escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Spy Game" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: We visited on a Saturday night, the staff were so friendly and helpful. The room was challenging and fun! If we were local we would definitely return!

room_title: Escape room "Spy Game" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: This was our first time to do an escape room! We had a blast even though we didn't make it out. We will definitely be back and with more people. Everyone was so nice and helpful!

room_title: Escape room "Crisis at 1600" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: I found this experience to be very well. The staff was nice and kept a good sense of humor. An overall great experience and would recomend it to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "Crisis at 1600" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: Staff was excellent, made us feel welcome, positive first experience. Definitely will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Crisis at 1600" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: Corporate group had a great time! Played Tomb & 1600...both teams escaped just barely. All enjoyed 21 people enjoyed

room_title: Escape room "Crisis at 1600" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: So much fun! We escaped "Crisis at 1600" with a minute to spare. Our escape helper guy, Chandler, was an excellent host! And the rooms were full of challenging and fun puzzles. Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys a challenge.

room_title: Escape room "Crisis at 1600" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: We played Crisis at 1600 on Christmas Day and had so much fun, we booked Tomb! Highly recommend taking the family and playing. We did escape both times, 1st time with 3 seconds left; second time with 13 minutes left second time. Will remember this vacation for a long time!

room_title: Escape room "Crisis at 1600" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: Our first attempt was Pandemic. Having only 3 people on our group made it difficult to spread tasks among the 3 of us. We left and immediately decided to sign up for another room the same day. Luckily we were paired up with 2 other players, and made it out of Crisis at 1600 with only 38 seconds to spare! The staff was highly enthusiastic, helpful, and encouraging. We had a blast! We have yet to stop talking about it. We would definitely return. I wish we had one in Maine! Great job.

room_title: Escape room "Crisis at 1600" by America's Escape Game in Orlando
review: Great experience! This was so much fun, and I would highly recommend it! Charlie was the best. We escaped!

room_title: Escape room "Nautilus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Makes for a very fun evening with friends! Rooms have a creative theme and fun puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Nautilus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've been to three different 60out locations and each as been wonderful. The rooms are decorated to feel realistic and the clues are clever. Staff has been friendly and professional. We just keep going back. One of these days we will finish without assistance! No way.

room_title: Escape room "Nautilus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun! Our host Rose was the best!!! We can't stop talking about this great experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: We did the cabin and had an amazing time! The clues were perfect and the room was so fun! Chad was the best host, make sure you ask for Chad!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: I wasn’t really sure if this would be for my 30+ friend group, but it was a blast! We got out with 13 minutes to spare and it was just awesome.Fun, Challenging, and Interesting! It truly exceeded all of my expectations. Honestly I can’t wait to go back and do another room! We did the cabin, but I look forward to the next one. Literally so fun!Also a super nice facility overall. Not cheesy and the room felt like an immersive experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: Thank you so much! Best people and best escape rooms in Tuscaloosa. We did The Cabin and it was challenging and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Abracadabra" by iPanic Escape Room in Lakeland
review: David was the best, it was my first escape room and it was amazing. Definitely recommend going here.

room_title: Escape room "Abracadabra" by iPanic Escape Room in Lakeland
review: Had a great time , the guy there David is the coolest . Definitely going back to do a longer room !

room_title: Escape room "Abracadabra" by iPanic Escape Room in Lakeland
review: The employees were so amazing and enthusiastic! The rooms were so challenging and engaging! The 20 min room was soooo good! We cant wait to come back for more rooms! :)

review: None

room_title: Escape room "Malice Manor" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: Had a great time with 9 of my friends today! It was our first escape room and we had a blast, although choosing the hardest room (Sorcerer's Shack) was maybe not the best idea! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a fun few hours!

room_title: Escape room "Malice Manor" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: This was my first escape room experience and I loved it!! We went for the sorcerer's shack and had a blast!  I definitely recommend escape out for a fun activity or for team building events.

room_title: Escape room "Malice Manor" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: Took my husband and 7 friends to the Sorcerer's room. It was a real challenge and we all loved it! Can't wait to go again.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Panic" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: Our little group went in with minimal teamwork, however I’m super satisfied how everything turned out. Audrie was a great guide who did a wonderful job at helping us work through. And shoutout to Diego the zombie, hustle on point. Definitely would recommend to others.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Panic" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: This is one of the many escape rooms that I have visited and it is one of the best. My favorite room by far is zombie panic in which zombie Rochelle scared me to death, and my game master Grace was really sassy but fun! Keep up the good work!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Panic" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: This place is amazing! I have been to quite a few escape room places and this one is my favorite. I went there with a group and we did the zombie room. It completely delivered! It was scary (they also have other rooms so don't let the scare-factor turn you away) , and It introduced some puzzle elements I had never seen before. This, combined with numerous object puzzles and a really kind staff made the night very enjoyable. This place is a definite recommend for all escape room enthusiasts.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Panic" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: This room was so fun. Our Zombie Thomas was awesome. This room was on the difficult scale but have plans to do it again with my family!

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape the Space in Athens
review: Such a fun night! A great way to get together with a group for a fun evening out.

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape the Space in Athens
review: Fantastic experience! Friendly staff and challenging puzzles! Definitely want to try again!

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape the Space in Athens
review: We had a ton of fun! This was my first time doing an escape room and same with most or all of our group. We had 11 people in the Tree House Bomb Defusal site. Really recommend this - so many puzzles to solve and a lot going on, everyone got involved.

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: This place is awesome! One of the best escape room companies in the country hands down. If you are looking for something fun, exciting, and new to do while in SLO... CHECK THIS PLACE OUT. Grim Stacks was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: I highly recommend Puzzle Effect -SLO! Our first ever Escape room experience and O!M!G! SO MUCH FUN! It was one of the most fun and exciting things I’ve done on a very long time. We finished “ Grim Stacks” with 24 seconds left. I’m shocked I can even speak today from yelling. Such a great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: with this being my first attempt at an escape room - I completed Grim Stacks yesterday - it was great at being interactive, which was really enjoyable, and had a ton of fun finding things and figuring out the clues!

room_title: Escape room "Insurgent's Lab" by CQ Tactical in Tampa
review: This business is NOT family friendly. After booking a child's birthday party and being told that our children will play against another child's birthday party,we were shocked when our children (9 children all under age 9) were lined up to play against a team of 12 adults. Jeff, the manager, excused this as not having booked exclusive and claimed his staff has a memorized script for booking parties so that this can be explained to persons. But he could not provide the script. Two children were hurt in the games. Several children cried. They lost all except the last game. This is NOT what you want for your child on his/her birthday. If you want family-friendly laser tag, go to the Ice Sports Forum instead.

room_title: Escape room "Insurgent's Lab" by CQ Tactical in Tampa
review: Did the escape room for a birthday. Was great. Great for kids and adults.

room_title: Escape room "World of Illusions" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The world of illusions escape room was awesome! We jumped into a world of carnivals and magicians. This very interactive escape room had more to solve than just locks and combos. Natasha was a great guide and it was awesome to solve this tricky "hard level" room!Featured on Ellen and VH1, this place lived up to the hype!

room_title: Escape room "World of Illusions" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did World of Illusions room. Definitely a tough room, but nothing short of amazing! I'd recommend to anyone!I just wasn't sure what the storyline was. When we got there, the initial employee that introduced us to the waivers and instructional video was great - but then we got passed off to another guy who brought us to the wrong room at first and I don't know if we were explained the whole story when we got to the correct one. Then when we asked for the first clue, they gave us a clue for a wrong room. Luckily I recalled their mix up earlier and clarified if they were giving a clue for World Of Illusions, and they acknowledged that they gave us the wrong walkie (which wasn't even synced to the 1st room they put us in; it was for the 3rd room).When we solved the room - there was no fanfare. And as we left, there's no enthusiasm. We totally forgot to take a photo too for escaping - I wish there was more excitement when we escape and then a reminder to take a photo. Maybe there would be if we didn't use hints.I just can't wait to go back and play the other rooms because the tricks and locks and clues are high tech and wonderful. They missed the mark on creating a seamless experience start to finish though.

room_title: Escape room "World of Illusions" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I attempted this room with a group of 4, but this will definitely accommodate a bigger group. Great room, nice visuals and effects. I would highly recommend this room for those who have a group on the bigger side (6+).

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Very fun and challenging! I did the Kidnapping room, give it a try!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We had such a great time in the kidnapping room. We didn't escape, but we haven't stopped talking about it. The room was very well thought out. You can tell they really took their time with the planning of this. Will was an awesome game master! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: My group of friends and I really enjoyed our experience playing #TheKidnapping. We had to work as a team and it was super creative how we escaped. If we hadn't have had the people we did, we wouldn't have made it out. It was great! Awesome team building exercise!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Today was my first time playing as well as the first time for my family. We rather enjoyed ourselves. We booked the Kidnapping room and finished with 1 min 30 sec left. Thanks Breakout Birmingham for a wonderful time!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: This was our first Escape Room in Boise and we had a great experience. We did the Pirate themed Escape Room and had a lot of fun. It was not as difficult as I had anticipated but the puzzles still required us to think and work together. Each of us was able to contribute in solving different puzzles. Naomi was our lovely host and she was very helpful with her clues. We only needed 2 clues throughout our Escape Room experience but both of the clues given by Naomi were descriptive, clear, concise and ultimately helped us get through the areas where we got stuck. The clues were very well thought out and the room was very clean and organized. I highly recommend this Escape Room to anyone in the Boise and surrounding areas.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: We had an awesome time celebrating a birthday and finding treasure on a pirate ship! Naomi was a great host!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: This place is the BEST escape experience in the treasure valley. Rooms are amazing and the puzzles are fun yet challenging. The amazing staff also made this a five star business!!! Can't wait to come back!! Did 2/3 rooms in one day haha

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: We had so much fun today in the pirate room! I'll definitely come back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: I have done both their Ship and Wizard room and they were both awesome! The wizard was more challenging but the special effects and their ability to 'do magic' was great!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: Super cool experience and would recommend to anyone. I was very impressed by the little details.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: ed the puzzles!  The employee was clear, helpful, and seemed genuinely interested in our experience.  It was fun and challenging.  I wish I had booked a private room or scheduled a group because I think it would be more fun with people you know, but even with others, it was a riot!  Definitely coming back for more!!!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: This was such a cool experience! When you walk into any of the rooms, it feels like you are in a different place. The only thing I wish was that they had is more rooms! It is great for group dates and birthday parties because you get to interact and communicate while trying to figure out the puzzles that are all around the room. The people who work there are really nice too. If you have an issue signing up, or any problems within the room, they are always available and more than willing to help!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: My family has done both the pirate and western theme & both were really fun. My 11yr old couldn't stop talking about how fun the experience was! Management was easy to work with and responsive to questions/concerns. I wouldn't recommend taking kids younger than about 7 or 8 because they won't understand the clues.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: Loved both escapes, saloon and pirate. Have done others and these are my favorite. I don't consider myself as knowledgeable as those in my group and was surprised to find that I was able to actively participate and had a lot of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Ship" by Escape This Boise in Boise
review: As soon as you are in the room you are transported into the pirate ship. Everything seems so real. All the clues come together nicely. It was a lot of fun! I like a good challenge but even better I love solving the hard puzzles!

room_title: Escape room "Train Robbery" by Cyber Raccoon Escape Room in Washington, D.C.
review: Train Robbery game is my favorite game now! It has many puzzles for all players to solve, cool effects with the best story elements. We had to push our wits to come up with clever solutions in order to solve a riddle. Escape rooms are awesome in general and this one is a precious gem among them all!

room_title: Escape room "Train Robbery" by Cyber Raccoon Escape Room in Washington, D.C.
review: We had a team bonding activity with my colleagues and loved it very much! At the beginning you just walk around and explore the gaming room. Once you find your first clue, you just follow the series of puzzles. They are connected to each other and it helps you to understand what is your next step. The game masters watch you during the whole time and will give hints only if you ask for them.  We asked for 2 clues because we did not want to lose our time. If you like brain teasers and mysteries, definitely try this place!

room_title: Escape room "Destiny Origins" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: My family and I are avid escape roomers and we escaped from the Destiny room! Really loved the theme and the puzzle. Ando is who helped us out and he was great! Hopefully be back soon if it to escape the room but to play games!

room_title: Escape room "Destiny Origins" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: We had a great time - took visiting family there - ages 16-80. Had a blast in the Destiny room. Jacob our game master was awesome. We got out... with 1 minute to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Destiny Origins" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: Had my daughter’s 12th birthday party there tonight and the experience was amazing. Destiny is challenging but a lot of fun. Can’t wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Destiny Origins" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: Very well put together.  Looking ahead to the next challenge!

room_title: Escape room "Destiny Origins" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: Awesome!!! Most fun I have had all year. Can't wait for next one!

room_title: Escape room "Circus" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: First experience with an escape room. My group did the "Circus" theme. From the second you walk in the door, this place is a 5 star. The ambiance is top notch. The decor is fantastic! The staff is very engaging and in costume. They seem to really enjoy what they do. The room itself was awesome! My group of 6 failed to beat it. Very challenging and incredibly fun. We can't wait to come back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Circus" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: So much fun! This place really does a great job and gives you a good bang for your buck. I loved it as soon as I walked in. The way everything is decorated, you're immediately in the "zone". I don't want to say too much and give anything away. Just grab some friends and do it!

room_title: Escape room "Circus" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: I walked in to check the venue out while I was doing some sight seeing in LA. I hadn't expected to a) be allowed to attempt a room solo or b) there to be any rooms available when I was there. Sure enough, I could and there was. So, since I was there and was offered a discount by Danny, I took advantage. Sadly, I could not escape Carnival. If I ever get back to LA from the East Coast, I'm coming back for revenge! Decor and costuming was beautiful.

room_title: Escape room "Lost In Space" by MindBreak Norwich in Norwich
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Bunker" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: An amazing escape room option in Miami! We did the Nuclear Bunker and then decided to do a second room right after (The Bank) because they were so fun! And we escaped from BOTH thank you very much. Our room supervisors Emily and Juan were both awesome! Definitely check this place out!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Bunker" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: These escape rooms here are so fun; I wish I could forget the rooms so I could do them over again. Nayib was really great as our helper. He helped, but not so much as to take the experience away from the players. I've done the Prison Break and the Bunker ones so far; both of them were great, and I can't wait for an excuse to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Bunker" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: An amazing escape room option in Miami! We did the Nuclear Bunker and then decided to do a second room right after (The Bank) because they were so fun! And we escaped from BOTH thank you very much. Our room supervisors Emily and Juan were both awesome! Deff check this place out!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Bunker" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: We always have a wonderful time and next we are ready to take on the Zombie room!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Bunker" by Room Escape Miami by Fox in a Box in Miami
review: Experience like no other. I played the nuclear bunker for the first time and it was surreal, we saved the world with 2 minutes to spare. Next, I'm definitely going back for prison break.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Keep" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: Been here three times. A couple friends and I have done most of the rooms here and we always have a blast doing it, even when we get frustrated and lose the game, we still have fun overall. The rooms are really well thought out with awesome props and themes that by-far exceed any other escape rooms the Fresno/Clovis area has to offer. Wizards Keep was my personal favorite. It used very imaginative puzzles that had us doing some silly things to try and solve them. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who doesn't take themselves too seriously and is willing to have some fun, I know I can't wait til we go back.

room_title: Escape room "reSEArch" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Impressive escape rooms! Imagine Escape Games is the place to be! We did all three rooms in a row and truly enjoyed every detail. Challenging but not impossible.

room_title: Escape room "reSEArch" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: We did reSEArch and it was a blast. Well put together puzzles and a satisfying finish! We would have loved to do another one but we were pressed for time.

room_title: Escape room "reSEArch" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Did the ReSEArch room. Very challenging and a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "reSEArch" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Research was a very fun room! The design  was seamless and the puZale were challenging but not impossible. Our team of four had two advanced players(70+ games), I am a novice(about 20 games) and we had a n00b(2nd game), yet the puzzles challenged all of us pretty equally. Loved the theme and execution . They are in a great location, I will be back to play another room very soon.

room_title: Escape room "reSEArch" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: My wife and I were privileged to be part of a beta test group for the newest room ReSEArch. This was not our first experience, and Imagine Escape Games blew the competition away! We were joined by a family of 5 (ages 10+) for a 7-person group. For a game still in the testing phase, the puzzles were clever and flowed flawlessly in almost every respect. I want to tell you more about some of the awesome stuff they have in there, but I don't want to spoil the experience. Find out for yourself! Having a seven-person group really helped, as we were able to work as a team to divide the puzzles and solve them as efficiently as possible, bringing us to escape with 15 minutes to spare. Beat that! :)

room_title: Escape room "Bonita Winery Room" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: I have done a few rooms now, and believe me - this is harder than it looks. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the level of difficulty ranges depending on which room you do. I was able to complete the Winery by myself, but you need as many extra minds as you can get. I tried Dinner party with my family and Mirror Mirror with my sisters and it didn't end well. The rooms definitely require critical thinking skills, attention to detail and trying not to over think the clues. Overall it is such a great experience, I know that I will be back in the future to try all of the other rooms and to hopefully complete the Dinner party and Mirror Mirror. Bring your whole family! It's so much fun and even if you don't escape you take a cool picture at the end.

room_title: Escape room "Bonita Winery Room" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: We could not have had more fun! The owner and the associate Danielle were wonderful! Even though we didn't escape the wine room (as much as we tried with no help!), it was a blast and we will definitely be going back! You won't be disappointed! Thanks again ladies for a fun-filled afternoon!

room_title: Escape room "Bonita Winery Room" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: Visiting from New Jersey and looking for something fun to do. We had a great time in the Wine Cellar room, but we were unsuccessful at breaking out! We will definitely come back and try again. The owners were awesome! Thanks for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Bonita Winery Room" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: We did the hardest room there (winery) and it was absolutely amazing. For our first escape room we were only two minutes away from making it out! The staff was amazing and very informative. We will all be back to do more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Went with my friends and we were all first timers. We lucked up by being paired up with of a group who had some experience. We did have to use a few clues but we managed to escape! We had an absolute wonderful time and look forward to doing it again!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Awesome escape room!! Puzzles are great and not overtly hard...unless you over think some things (like I did). Their first room has a great setup and definitely gives you a museum feel. Can't wait for the second room!!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Had a great time. We have done other Escape rooms and this one is really fun. Challenging, but not so advanced that beginners will feel lost. Can't wait to try their next room.

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: 14th Birthday for my son Cole and 7 of his middle school friends. They said it was "Legit". They love it and escaped in 42 minutes. On the way home, the kids were figuring out whose birthday was next so they could go back and try the second room. Great job to Tangerine and staff! We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: We had a great night at escapism SD!  It made for a mysterious, challenging, and fun ladies night out!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: This was amazing!!   This was my first of many escape rooms and it ignited a burning passion in my loins that drives me to discover more escape rooms to escape over and over again.  Love this place, cant wait til they open the next room!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: We had a blast at Escapism! It was my groups first time doing an "escape room" so we didn't know what to expect. You get exactly 1 hour to try and complete your mission. The escape room itself was challenging and full of surprises. There were 8 of us total and it definitely took teamwork! We escaped with only a few minutes to spare. The staff was really friendly, I would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Strange Room" by Kuma Escape in San Jose
review: This room was a great introduction to escape rooms. It's a well done 'basic' escape room that highlights its puzzles. The room doesn't have much story and the focus is on your team working through the puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "The Strange Room" by Kuma Escape in San Jose
review: Had a great time!!! We participated in Stage 1 game - it was hard but it was a lot of thinking and about teamwork. We didn't escape the room in time but we still really enjoyed the experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Strange Room" by Kuma Escape in San Jose
review: Funnnnnmn!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Strange Room" by Kuma Escape in San Jose
review: Very interesting.

room_title: Escape room "The Strange Room" by Kuma Escape in San Jose
review: I RARELY write reviews, but this place is LEGIT!!!! finding clues, solving puzzles, working with your teammates...THE TIME IS TICKING!!This is a GREAT and FUN place to; have fun with your friends, do a leadership activity, do a double/triple date, etc!Nothing, but good things to say about this place! You think there's nothing to do in San Jose? Think again!!! come here! have a blast!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "British" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We loved all the rooms here but the pirate and British were our favorite! Cells very close! Highly recommend and great customer service!

room_title: Escape room "British" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Great attention to detail and puzzle flow. Best competition rooms in the state

room_title: Escape room "British" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: The owners were very engaged and provided an absolutely amazing experience for our group! We will definitely return. The competition rooms are amazing!

room_title: Escape room "British" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We did the competition rooms and switched sides after! We love that you can complete both sides and they are unique! Definitely will return! Kid friendly location

room_title: Escape room "British" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Totally immersive and excellently done! Good variety of rooms, including one for kids. Loved it!!!

room_title: Escape room "Superheroes Adventure" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Had a blast in the Super Hero room celebrating our daughter's 13th b-day with her friends. Challenging and well put together! Using all our hints we made it out with 4 minutes to spare. Highly recommend! Can't wait to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Superheroes Adventure" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Absolutely loved it! We all had so much fun and could not stop laughing our way through the Superhero escape room. Highly recommend for a night out with friends or as a team builder.

room_title: Escape room "Superheroes Adventure" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Did the Superhero theme and it was awesome! It was more fun that I have ever I imagined. Good thing I had a bunch of nerds with me to get it done with 10 minutes left. Thank you Alex and team for the great birthday celebration.

room_title: Escape room "Superheroes Adventure" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: We had a ball. I was a bit anxious as didn't really know what to expect! Did the superhero room with some friends for my husbands birthday. It was such a giggle! Josh was a great moderator, without his hints we would surely never have got out of there! Highly recommend it! We got out with just 32 seconds to spare so it was a close one! Very cleverly put together

room_title: Escape room "Superheroes Adventure" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Best place in San Diego! Their set up is clean and super challenging and fun! I've done the Japanese room and last night we did the Superheroes room! Loved both rooms so much!!! Never made it out of the Japanese room but did make it out of the superheroes room with 22 mins to spare! Can't wait til they get another room going...I will definitely be trying my escape skills to break out

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: This place was great and the owner was super nice. We're planning on trying all of the rooms

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Probably the highest quality escape room we've seen. Every puzzle worked flawlessly and was cohesive with the flow of the room. The detail put into the aesthetic of each room was amazing. We'll definitely be back

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: This is the BEST escape room I have gone to. The rooms were very detailed, high tech, clean, and very thought out. The hints do not cost you time and are very clear without giving away what to do. The game masters were very present and considerate, we never waited very long for a response. My group was small so we were paired with another couple. They ensured that things would be fair and made sure we knew one person from their group (2 people) had to agree to a hint before they gave one. They were very welcoming from start to finish, they don't rush you at any point. I highly recommend visiting them! They have 2 locations. You will not regret it! P.S. photos are of their waiting room with puzzles and some awesome seating. They have intricate brass chandeliers too that are very pretty.

room_title: Escape room "Motel Nightmare" by Escape Plan Georgia in Atlanta
review: It was awesome for our girls!

room_title: Escape room "Motel Nightmare" by Escape Plan Georgia in Atlanta
review: Super challenging yet great time well spent! Not our first time here, but just as fun as the first! Definitely would recommend and will return!

room_title: Escape room "Who Stole Christmas?" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: I went here with some co-workers and we had a fantastic time. Miles was great instructor. I would definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Who Stole Christmas?" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: We were really impressed with the professionalism and customer service of this business. We booked it for our company Christmas party and it couldn't have gone better!! Everyone had a blast! The people that handled our group were really nice and fun and helped keep the excitement and energy going. For anyone looking for GREAT team building experience, this is the perfect thing to do!

room_title: Escape room "Who Stole Christmas?" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: So much fun!!! Ready felt like an adventure. .. the riddles are cool and it's really amazing making it through the course. I would definitely do this again!

room_title: Escape room "The Hidden Cabin" by Adventure Rooms in Hartford
review: Super fun but we had a hard time beating the Cabin! I wouldn't recommend it for beginners. We had two newbies and two who had previously done Swiss original. Maybe a larger group could have solved it in time. Definitely going to go back for another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Hidden Cabin" by Adventure Rooms in Hartford
review: We had a group of seven and finished with a minute on the clock. We had a hard time in the beginning but got the hang of it later. I would recommend the Cabin room to anyone who loves challenging puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "The Hidden Cabin" by Adventure Rooms in Hartford
review: This place is so fun. Me and my boyfriend did the Cabin and were able to solve all of the puzzles and escape.

room_title: Escape room "The Hidden Cabin" by Adventure Rooms in Hartford
review: This was a blast! We did the log cabin and found the puzzles intriguing and creative. Can't wait to go back and try a different room.

room_title: Escape room "Star Trek: Discovery VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: I'm a longtime VR enthusiast and have been following the ups and downs of the industry for years. Unfortunately, VR has been a disappointment and I've been waiting for someone to bring great hardware and content together, and give me a reason to believe again. Enter, Sandbox VR.They call themselves a "holodeck" so, as a Star Trek purist, my expectations are sky high. I better feel like I'm knee deep in a Klingon swamp or spending a weekend in Risa with some lovely green ladies, or else I'll be disappointed.Well, after playing BOTH Sandbox experiences, I can say that my mind is completely BLOWN. It's by far the best VR experience I've had to date, especially if you're used to being a floating head on a disorienting roller coaster demo. This is NOT that. You move in the environment with your pals as perfectly mapped, MOCAP'd characters so there's no sense of feeling dizzy. The haptics make it feel like those zombies are really about to eat my face! It's practically an otherworldly experience that you have to see the believe.While there's currently a limited amount of content that's focused primarily on horror/survival themes, it's only a matter of time before we can take a pilates class or travel beyond the stars in VR. I, for one, came to play. Bring it on Sandbox!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: The puzzles were complex and really made you think, yet nothing felt impossible. The clues are quite solid and it was lot of fun to see how everything was connected. It was a great experience - highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: We had a completely awesome time escaping. The building is a perfect setting and the puzzles were challenging without being impossible.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: I had such a great time escaping the room here! It's a great team bonding event and I highly recommend it to everyone to try it out. The story and puzzles are carefully thought out so you'll definitely be motivated to work together to find all the clues. I have only done one other escape the room before, but this one was definitely my favorite. You won't regret it!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: Went with a group of friends to celebrate my birthday. Everyone had a blast. The gamemaster was timely, friendly, and informative. It escape was challenging enough to be fun but not so challenging to be frustrating. We are planning to return to attempt the second room once it opens.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: We had lots of fun. The Alien escape is a great mental challenge which we weren't able to solve. Our host, Bob, was great! I highly recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: A mixture of hunting and solving skills, along with teamwork. The puzzles were just challenging enough, especially given the time constraint. It was a lot of fun, and definitely worth doing again when new challenges become available.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: This was our 3rd time doing something like this and by far our best experience. Our 'guide' was awesome. He made sure we were all engaged and gave us just the right amount of encouragement. Highly recommend this to anyone who likes puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Oracle Mystery" by SUBScape Games in San Diego
review: The second room we did was Oracle Mystery.  I would say this room is intermediate difficulty.  It's gypsy/supernatural themed, but I wouldn't consider it scary.  This room was definitely more challenging.  I enjoyed this room.  It took us a minute to figure out where to start, and the puzzles in this room required more thinking.  We did require a hint for this room.

room_title: Escape room "Oracle Mystery" by SUBScape Games in San Diego
review: Great time for any age. Did the Oracle room. Challenging, but made it out with 3 minutes to spare! Staff was helpful and knowledgeable. Peter sent us in prepared for our mission! Would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Night Out at the BAD GIRL, Аничка" by Code To Escape in Daytona Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Long Lost Pharaoh" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: The room was decorated amazingly and staff were very friendly

room_title: Escape room "The Long Lost Pharaoh" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: The decor of the room was fantastic. The actors were also great. The theme we did, Nightmare, was wonderful. We felt like the clues weren't very sequential and we spent a majority of the time just searching for items. The front desk ladies were also nice.

room_title: Escape room "The Long Lost Pharaoh" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: We were really surprised on the amount of detail in the rooms and the complexity. The staff were super nice people. My impression was that is would be one room, but we actually had 3 rooms to traverse. You have to solve one part to get to the next part, and so on. It was worth it! We had the room to ourselves with our family. The kids really enjoyed the challenge as well. Just make sure you ask if it's kid friendly if you plan on bringing your kids.

room_title: Escape room "Out of Time" by HD Escape Rooms Greeley in Fort Collins
review: None

room_title: Escape room "ELF" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room " Bates Motel" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: The folks that worked there were very nice and the "Bates Motel" escape room was a lot of fun. The only criricism I have is that the room was very hot.

room_title: Escape room " Bates Motel" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Thank you Holly for an amazing experience! We enjoyed our time so very much! Bates motel was fun and entertaining even our preteen daughters enjoyed it!

room_title: Escape room "“Criminal” Minds" by Clues and Cocktails in Atlanta
review: Attended the Criminal Minds murder mystery and it was a blast! Every single staff member/performer was professional and polite. We did the Gold package and the food was great and cast members stayed in character the entire time. They puzzles they have to solve the mystery were entertaining! Definitely something to do again when they when they change the show!! Absolutely a blast to do for a date night or girls night out.

room_title: Escape room "“Criminal” Minds" by Clues and Cocktails in Atlanta
review: The drinks and the Criminal Minds experience.. Def worth checking out!

room_title: Escape room "“Criminal” Minds" by Clues and Cocktails in Atlanta
review: I had the opportunity to visit Clues and Cocktail (Criminal Minds) during its grand opening and it was so worth it! It's a new type of escape room that's set in a 1940s jail. I won't give too much away because it's an "experience" you have to see for yourself. The monologues and songs performed were great and I was even surprised that the actors stayed in character the whole time. This location turns into an actual bar at a certain hour where patrons can come and be merry without doing an escape room.

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Excellent ! 10 stars This company knows entertainment , the staff treats you  like family  . The clown and his assistant love their jobs and it shows  .  I am so impressed with the attention to detail , the props  are so unique  you become immersed in the room .  Thank you for making our first escape room so memorable.We can't wait to try tuts room! The Converse Clan

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: We had a blast and the clown and the young lady were so fun they made it so exciting. They were so friendly and you can tell they really enjoy their job. This was my first time going to an escape room we will be going back next month for sure. I will  be telling my friends about this  place. They gave us your of the other room we can't wait for the next room.

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: What a great experience! The staff was very friendly and accomodating. My wife and I went for our anniversary with some friends and we had a great time. The owner was respectful and didn't scare my wife with his clown costume. I don't want to give too much away but the Clownatorium escape room was so much fun. Awesome experience, go check this place out. You will not be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: I've done a little under 10 escape rooms in San Diego and this has been one of my favorites. We played the Clownatorium and had a great time! This is by far the best themed and atmospheric escape room I've been to. I'm looking forward to trying the Space Parody and also their upcoming room as well!

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: What a great experience! We went with our family to celebrate my wife's birthday. The staff are so awesome and accommodating! They had a Birthday balloon and candies for her! It was such an awesome experience with live actors and innovative puzzles! We had such a great time! We are definitely coming back! They have various themed escape rooms. We experienced the Clownatorium escape room! We are looking forward to experience their other themed rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Awesome experience! Our group was all newbies except for one. We had a great time. Did the clown room and want to go back to do the mummy room next time! Highly recommend. Leave the kiddos at fun and have a night out with friends... loved the clownatorium. Staff were great, funny and very etertaining!

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: I have only gone to one other escape room before but I know Nightwalker Caverns' Clownatorium is absolutely brilliant! It was so much fun and was so incredibly detailed. I was worried that our party was too big at first, but there was so much to do that it seemed like everyone was doing something at all times. It was also a perfect blend of creepy and hilarious fun. I'm definitely excited to go try out more of their escape rooms soon! If you like pop culture references, make some time to notice the details!

room_title: Escape room "Sanctuary" by Time to Escape in Okeechobee
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dine in at Dusk" by Evolution Escape Rooms in Miami
review: Dine at Dusk was an amazing escape room! You are in an actual diner, jukebox and all. The puzzles were great and we all have a fun time! Can't wait to do the other rooms

room_title: Escape room "Dine in at Dusk" by Evolution Escape Rooms in Miami
review: I've done many escape rooms and these ones are in a league of their own. The storylines, the special effects and the sets are such high tech and high quality. You won't be disappointed. Fun for all ages!

room_title: Escape room "Dine in at Dusk" by Evolution Escape Rooms in Miami
review: Unreal! The sheer complexity of these rooms and the story they all tell are unbelievable! I did the Cabin first and the Diner second and absolutely loved them both. I can't wait to come back for the third room!

room_title: Escape room "Remote Adventures" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Not So Funhouse" by Count:down Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: Amazing time here with my family! Super nice and talkative host! Great room! Crazy decor! Difficult tasks but definitely worth the try! Not-So-Fun House was a blast! And all three parts were decorated from top to bottom! Will be back to try the rest of the rooms! Have been to about 5 other Escape room businesses and this is for sure one of my top favorites so far! Thank you for the great experience !

room_title: Escape room "Not So Funhouse" by Count:down Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: This was so much fun! I had a great time. I recommend everybody try it. I did it for my birthday with my family we had so much laughs!

room_title: Escape room "Not So Funhouse" by Count:down Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: I thought the clown room was challenging and a lot of fun! The decor was cool. One of my favorites so far.

room_title: Escape room "The Quest" by Escape Goat in Orlando
review: The Quest is an excellent fantasy escape room with the perfect combination magic and analogue that ultimately creates an immensely satisfying experience that should not be missed. The set is a wonderfully earthy abode filled with magical odds and ends waiting to be uncovered and utilized, each serving a very realistic magical experience. The puzzles are equally brilliant and have multiple tracks running at once, with enough variety and challenge to keep everyone engaged. The workers, one of which functioning as an in-game and in-character gamemaster, are kind, helpful, and obviously very devoted to the wondrous game they have created. This is not a game to miss if you are in the area.

room_title: Escape room "The Quest" by Escape Goat in Orlando
review: The Quest is our favorite escape room that we've ever done.
