The beautiful space feels mostly "The Hobbit", but the puzzle-solving made us feel more like Hagrid or Newt Scamander from the Harry Potter world. This was the hardest of the three; I'd recommend trying the others first so you can get to know the minds of the puzzle creators. However, we did this one first and still just made it out, asking for a little more help from the game master than we would have preferred.

room_title: Escape room "The Quest" by Escape Goat in Orlando
review: We came back to play Escape Goat's newest room, The Quest, which replaced their Sherlock-themed 221B game. I loved all of Escape Goat's previous games, and was sad to see 221B go, but The Quest is absolutely phenomenal. While 221B was a very logic puzzle-based escape room, The Quest is less so. There are still plenty of puzzles to solve, but they're a different kind of puzzle.The scenic in this room is incredible and I can't stop thinking about all of the unique and interesting puzzles. There were plenty of "AHA!" moments which can be the most satisfying part of an escape room experience. It's no secret that Escape Goat is one of my favorite escape room businesses of all time.

room_title: Escape room "The Quest" by Escape Goat in Orlando
review: Great staff and environment. "The Quest" room was fun and challenging. Will absolutely return to try more rooms in the future!

room_title: Escape room "The Quest" by Escape Goat in Orlando
review: Great staff! The room was booked as a surprise for my birthday and my group of 5 had a blast. The room (the quest) was extremely well done and challenging. Will definitely return!

room_title: Escape room "The Quest" by Escape Goat in Orlando
review: Loved this authentic escape room! Originally chose it because it’s not a chain and we travel often... We did The Quest since we heard really good reactions from others who had played. Even though we did not make it out in time, we still had a blast and will be recommending to others who are in the area!

room_title: Escape room "Jesse James" by The Experience Escape Rooms in Centerton
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Heroes of the Galaxy" by Action Hero Studios in Phoenix
review: Great concept that works for the whole family! My kids, my husband, and I all really enjoyed it.

room_title: Escape room "Heroes of the Galaxy" by Action Hero Studios in Phoenix
review: Stopped in tonight to try this place. Very accommodating. Great decor and fun atmosphere. Thanks again!

room_title: Escape room "Heroes of the Galaxy" by Action Hero Studios in Phoenix
review: My kids and I had a great time at Action Hero Studios! Very kid friendly, my boys loved the robot and solving all of the puzzles. They're already talking about going back!

room_title: Escape room "The Space Station" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: This was my first escape room experience, and I had a really good time.  I would definitely go back and try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Space Station" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: My sister and 15 yr old niece came up from Los Angeles to visit and we took them here on a Friday night.  Great time for all of us.  We didn't escape but had a blast.  My niece couldn't stop talking about how fun it was and wants to go back as soon as she can.  Thank you to the ladies running the experience. Great times!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Space Station" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: What a great experience we had with a group of others we met at escape room. The challenges we were tasked at solving were age appropriate, anxiety provoking (in a good way) and of course a lot of fun. You have ample opportunity to try to solve problems and help is readily available by phone. Most of all, it's fairly affordable at about $35 a person. Will definitely do this again!

room_title: Escape room "Pixels" by Count:down Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Santa's List" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Solid escape room.  The themes were thoughtful and relatively well done.  I did two here.  The seasonal Christmas theme was good for the kids but you can tell was not as well integrated into the puzzles.  I find the best escape rooms integrate the puzzles into the story or logic of the escape in such a way that one does not feel like one is doing a puzzle just for the puzzles sake or just to get to the next puzzle.  It really does feel like you are solving a mystery and are performing some deductions and detective work.  The Santa Operations felt like one puzzle after another.  Still the kids had fun.  I have done one of the other staple Escape Rooms and felt like it was well done.  Definitely worth doing with friends or the family.  This is a well run escape room company and serves the customers well.  The staff was friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Santa's List" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Santa themed room today at the Del Amo location, 3 adults and 2 kids. It exceeded our expectations. We wanted to do one that wouldn't be too scary but were a little worried it would be simple..it wasn't! Really fun, super tricky, great family fun. The staff were really friendly and professional and it was clean and well organized. We all left wanting to come back. Thanks guys!

room_title: Escape room "The Dynasty - Royal Library" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: This is my first escape room and it was fun! I came here in a group of 6 and we tried the Royal Library room (first room). Everything there had a purpose and required us to be very resourceful! We could work on multiple puzzles at once so if we couldn't figure one out right away, we could always focus on the other. We barely got frustrated/stuck for a long time and used 2 hints in the first room. There are also some pretty cool tech things/mechanics and some things could be deceiving! Also, I really like how the rooms have some sort of storyline - I think it becomes more interesting.Solving the first room led us to the Alley (second room) and we used our remaining time from the 1 hour time limit to explore/solve things. I think the transition from the library to alley was the most frustrating part because only 2 people could work on the puzzle (very clever but took too long and I had nothing to do) to get us all into the second room. But that second room was actually really pretty. I actually came back with a different group of friends to try the 2nd room, but I thought the first room's puzzles were better (2nd room was also crowded).I would suggest using up all your remaining hints to get as far as you can on your second room because we wouldn't have completed the second room given the amount of time we had left - but perhaps we could've gotten farther. Also, don't play with the pocketwatch they lend you because I accidentally stopped it and couldn't tell how much time I had left OOPS :P Finally, a huge thanks to the guy working there. He's super nice and helpful! He also explained the hints really well (and straight to the point so that we didn't waste time) when we needed help. We even got a photo printed at the end for completing the room, hurrah!

room_title: Escape room "The Dynasty - Royal Library" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! This is my first time at an escape room. I had never even heard of the concept before this. My husband and I had so much fun playing the Royal Library. We were the only ones who reserved the 5pm timeslot on Friday evening and we got done solving everything before time ran out. You get 1 hour which is a good amount of time. There were a lot of interesting things to find and the puzzles were really tricky and fun to solve. I loved the special effects and the super powers you need to use to unlock hidden objects to reveal the clues. Cool use of technology! I would highly recommend trying it out. I really appreciate getting a printed team photo at the end. What a cool souvenir to remember the experience by! The staff is super friendly, helpful, and nice!

room_title: Escape room "The Dynasty - Royal Library" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! My husband and I had so much fun playing the Royal Library. We were the only ones who reserved the 5pm timeslot on Friday evening and we got done solving everything before time ran out. You get 1 hour which is a good amount of time. There were a lot of interesting things to find and the puzzles were really tricky and fun to solve. I loved the special effects and the super powers you need to use to unlock hidden objects to reveal the clues. I would highly recommend trying it out. I really appreciate getting a printed team photo at the end. What a cool souvenir to remember the experience by!

room_title: Escape room "It's a Holodeck Mr. Holmes" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: We played the Sherlock Holmes Holodeck game. What is not to like? Sherlock with a twist of Star Trek can never be a bad thing. The puzzles were straightforward but difficult enough. We had a bit of problem at times, but Eric the clue master gave just the right amount of hints. The explanation at the end really made it seem like we were in a whodunnit. This is our second escape room, and in this one the plot was as important and satisfying as the puzzles which I appreciated.  Two of us solved the game in 54 minutes... with a little blind luck:) Do it. I recommend it highly.

room_title: Escape room "It's a Holodeck Mr. Holmes" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: We had a great time!  My 13 and 17-year olds and I had an equally good time as we joined three other adults to solve the holodeck/Sherlock Holmes room.  Our clue master CJ helped us out a couple of times with hints.  I think this is a great deal for the price and I will definitely plan to do more of their rooms.  A bonus was that this is located in a beautiful old home on the historic register and it was just a pleasure to be there.  They also had some puzzles in the lobby to keep us busy while we were waiting for our start time.

room_title: Escape room "It's a Holodeck Mr. Holmes" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Our group enjoyed the locks and puzzles and murder mystery aspect of the Sherlock Holmes themed room.

room_title: Escape room "The Crash" by Escape Key in Tallahassee
review: We did this escape room with a group of 11 for a birthday party and it was absolutely amazing!!! We all loved and had so much fun solving the crash. Justin (the manager) was great and very accommodating! Will definitely recommend this to friends and will return for more puzzles!

room_title: Escape room "The Crash" by Escape Key in Tallahassee
review: Fun for everyone. We had a great time and will do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Slaughter" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: So much fun! My boyfriend and I stumbled across the Hotel when a zombie slammed her face against the window we were casually walking past. Definitely got our attention and we went right on in. We joined two strangers in the Slaughter House. We were blindfolded and handcuffed to the floor and WOW, thankfully we worked well with the other two guys. This is definitely a team effort. No way you could do this on your own. We almost made it to the end but "died" right before the end. All in all it was a great experience. We will be going again.

room_title: Escape room "Slaughter" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Did Slaughter. Succumbed to the room but definitely best escape room experience by far.

room_title: Escape room "Slaughter" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: We did slaughter and it was for my best friends 25 birthday. The beginning felt like a flashback of Saw! I was so excited my heart was beating... The front desk hostess was very hospitalble, and the café hostess was very cool and served us all a very delicious drink to get our energy up while we waited for the serial killer. Overall a great experience we definitely will be back in the upcomong weeks.

room_title: Escape room "Murder at the Mansion" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My crew of 4 did the Murder at the Mansion. We had such a blast! Almost made it. We definitely will return and do more of the rooms! We are still talking about how much fun we had!

room_title: Escape room "Murder at the Mansion" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Tonight was a lot of fun with our group of 8. We did "Murder in the Mansion" and all had a blast. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Murder at the Mansion" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My husband, some of his friends and I did the haunted mansion- it was a blast. We liked it so much we did the other 2 rooms by ourselves. Although we didn't make it, the 13th floor was my favorite.

room_title: Escape room "Murder at the Mansion" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Eight of us did the Murder Mansion room and had a great time! It made our brains work! This was such a unique activity that is great for a girls night out, birthday or even for couples. You will have a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Murder at the Mansion" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My motley crew of 7 friends booked an escape from "Murder at the Mansion". It was what the birthday girl wanted to do on her special day and by golly (yes, that is still cool to say) we had a truly "terrifyingly" wonderful time. Having been the only Escape Room aficionado, I walked into the room with the understanding that...we WOULD escape. It soon came clear that we would all have to put our minds together to get through the clues, puzzles and questions to get out. And we would have done it, if it hadn't been for those meddling kids!

room_title: Escape room "Bates Motel" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Destin
review: It was great. The best except room I have ever experienced!The wardrobe leading into another room was the best!

room_title: Escape room "Bates Motel" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Destin
review: Me and my friends did it today and it was a blast. We worked hard as a team but threw some insults at one another. We survived with 16 seconds left of the clock for the Bates Motel. I definitely recommend this to anyone who wants have fun and feel like their in a horror movie. I'm most definitely going to go back to try all the other rooms they have available to see if we can clutch those the way we did with Bates Motel.

room_title: Escape room "Bates Motel" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Destin
review: Went earlier in the Bates Motel room and loved it!!!

room_title: Escape room "Catalina Pirate Challenge" by Catalina Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: There were 4 adults and 4 children ages 3, 9, 9 and 11 in our group. We had such an amazing time! The people who run the escape room were incredible with the children in showing them how to solve the clues while the children felt like they were solving them on their own the entire time.

room_title: Escape room "Catalina Pirate Challenge" by Catalina Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: A labyrinth of mystery! I had the greatest time with my team of friends, searching for clues, keys and combos to getting out.

room_title: Escape room "Catalina Pirate Challenge" by Catalina Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: This was so much fun! Great theme, followed through methodically and well put together. Jeanette was extremely nice, helpful, and made the experience extremely enjoyable and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Once Upon A Time" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: The room we did here was called Once Upon a Time. We really liked it. We were a group of five. We finished with just about 25 minutes left and thought it was a little quicker than we thought. The mechanics on the room was really impressive too. The doors popping opens were fun to watch. I'm looking forward to going back and trying another room.

room_title: Escape room "Once Upon A Time" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: First time at Red Door : Sunday 3:50p .. Malcom was our Guy.. He did an amazing job, he gave us the best nuggets when needed.  We all felt comfortable and really appreciate the staff (Malcom) at Red Door.  Our Escape Room - Once Upon a Time- .. Thank you !  We will return.  Kelley's and Geyer's !!

room_title: Escape room "Once Upon A Time" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: If you want to do an escape room try The Red Door in Rancho Cordova it was fantastic! We did once upon a time it was so much fun! We will definitely return to do another escape room!  It's a nice location with restaurants surrounding it.

room_title: Escape room "Death Row" by Escape Zone 60 in Panama City
review: This was the first time going to Escape Zone 60 and it was awesome! We got out of the "Death Row" room with 4 minutes to spare! Will definitely be coming back!

room_title: Escape room "Death Row" by Escape Zone 60 in Panama City
review: 60 minutes go quick. We had a lot of fun trying to escape Death Row. Staff was great and got us in right away. Ready for our next escape room adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Cyber Crash" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: I had my mom and brother here from out of town. I surprised them with this. We loved it. What a great time we had. Well done mind quest!!!! I'm coming back soon. I can't wait to see what else you have to offer. We made it out with 5 minutes to spare!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Cyber Crash" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: So much fun! A unique and thrilling adventure!! Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Cyber Crash" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: Most fun we've had in Orlando! Cyber Crash is the hardest to complete. You get one hour, we were able to upload the virus with 4 seconds to spare!!! Extremely nerve racking!!! A for sure must in Orlando!

room_title: Escape room "Cyber Crash" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: Went with a group of guys on the weekend. It was challenging and entertaining. Brooke explained the objective to the group really well!

room_title: Escape room "Cyber Crash" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: Absolutely a blast! Can't wait to do it again! They did a great job of hiding all the clues right in front of you!

room_title: Escape room "Cyber Crash" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: Cyber was awesome! People working the place were down to earth and cool. Made it a good time and room was legit.

room_title: Escape room "Cyber Crash" by MindQuest Escape Games in Orlando
review: We have played all four games offered at Mindquest Live, completing them all for the exception of Cyber Crash which the staff indicate is the hardest one they offer. We enjoyed the Diamond Heist game the most but would highly recommend any of them. Games: Diamond Heist and The Bomb are of a similar difficulty level (the easiest ones they offer), Mad Scientist was much, much harder, and Cyber Crash is the hardest - and we have yet to fully complete it but we keep trying!! Hoping Mindquest Live will off some new games as our family enjoys them so much. Staff are friendly, the games are well organized, appropriately difficult, and fun, and the lobby is decorated with everything steampunk which is a lot of fun to explore if you have to wait a few minutes for your game. Go!

room_title: Escape room "High Roller" by Extreme Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sherlocked" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: This place is awesome!!!! You will have a great time. The staff is friendly and will work hard to give you a great experience. Great for all ages and groups. It will challenge your thinking and sharpen your "dectective" skills. Looking for a unique birthday event or just for fun tou will not be disappointed here.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlocked" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Best escape room experience I've had! The staff was friendly and the room we did was well laid out and challenging! It seems like they put a lot of thought into their design.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlocked" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Great night with family. My first time as it was for most of us. Great enthusiasm! Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Emerald Isles" by Trapped In Decatur in Huntsville
review: This was the first escape room for our group of 4. We had the best time! It was exciting and challenging, and we felt pretty accomplished when we found the treasure with 10 minutes to spare! We will definitely return, multiple times, I'm sure.

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: A group of us did the Jack the Ripper room this week and it was so much fun! For most of us it was our first time participating in any escape room. Our host, Stephanie, was very fun and helpful! She was as excited as we were, ha! We plan on visiting Palm Springs again soon and trying out the Bank Heist room! Thanks for making that part of our vacay memorable!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: We did the Jack the Ripper room. Not only was it really fun and challenging but Stephanie helped us from start to finish even when we told her we only had 2 people and the room required 3. The experience was everything we wanted it to be and Stephanie really helped make it that way. The room itself had the perfect mixture of challenging clues but not so challenging they made you feel like it was impossible. Definitely worth trying!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Challenging and FUN experience for our family group of 8. Ages ranged from 13-52. Everyone had a blast. Our host, T-money was very friendly and helpful. Thanks to her clues we solved the mystery of Jack the Ripper with a minute to spare.

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Soo much fun. We did Jack the Ripper and beat it with 20 minutes left!! I already want to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: It was such a great time! We went for our daughter's 21st birthday. We did the Jack the ripper room! Amazing and so much fun! We definitely will be back! Beth was our game master and she was wonderful! So sweet and helped with clues, Top customer service! Can't wait to go again!

room_title: Escape room "1969 - Insurgent Attack" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Workshop" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The Wizard room was really fun!  This was our second time at an escape room - the first time for Mother's Day and this time for Father's Day!  Since my family and I are mentally challenged at times with puzzle solving, Apprentice "Dan" was awesome and helped us make it out with just 3 seconds to go! I highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Workshop" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I went with a group of 5 to the Wizard's Workshop room. I enjoyed the variety of puzzles that had to be solved and the outcomes of solving each of the puzzles. There were some fun and unexpected surprises that kept things interesting and really motivated us to keep pushing ahead.  I would definitely recommend 60out to anyone that is interested in trying an escape room for the first time. Judy, our game master, was great! She did a fantastic job orienting us on the ground rules, and also was great with giving us hints when we got stuck.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Workshop" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Our wizarding apprentice Judy was super helpful though we took no hints, her briefing and intro got us going. Our experience in the wizarding room went really well for a mixed group that some had escape room experience and some didn't. The room has cool tech and interactive puzzles. We had some really cool moments after solving them.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Workshop" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Wow, this place was awesome! I've done three escape rooms so far at other places, but this is definitely my favorite! On Halloween, we showed up to do the Wizard's Workshop one, and we were running late, but Damien (who was totally awesome, by the way!) was super chill and flexible and set up the room great for us and got us really excited to do it! And man, was it fun! Really great quality puzzles that were solvable and logical, but still very challenging... Awesome design and theming, and Damien was attentive and enthusiastic and made it a great experience! We all agreed this was maybe our most fun Halloween we've ever had. Thanks guys, can't wait to try another one of your rooms soon!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Workshop" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've played around 10 escape rooms now, and the 3 rooms I've done with 60Out were amazing! I've played Titanic and Wizard Workshop at their Marina Del Rey location, and Mystery of Senator Payne at their West LA location. Titanic was a little easy, but a lot of the puzzles were really innovative and impressive. Wizard Workshop was a lot of fun, but it's the hardest of the three of done so far. Definitely save it for when you have a bit more experience with escape rooms. Parking at Marina is easy, there was a lot right next to the building that we were able to use.

room_title: Escape room "Club LOL" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: We went to Legends in March for my husband's birthday and had a blast. We reserved an entire room (LOL CLUB) since we had 8 people in our group. It was almost everyone's first time doing an escape room. We had so much fun and did escape with about 20 seconds to spare. Highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Club LOL" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Took a party of 6 for my son's birthday. We had two adults, two teens and two 'tweens. We did Club LOL. Booking online was easy. The person who explained the room and rules did so very well. The room was rated a three and we did manage to escape. We didn't use clues, although we were tempted during the last 15 minutes - but we made it. This was our second escape room experience, but our first at Legends. We will be coming back.

room_title: Escape room "Club LOL" by Legends Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Our new favorite! We did the LOL Club and had an awesome time. Can't wait to come back for more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was a lot of fun! Definitely want to come back for the Crime Scene Room.

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Great time with visiting Family from Oklahoma. We did good.

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Done a number of Escape Rooms in LA & this one beat them all! We did The Temple and the room was clean, everything worked properly, clues were HIGH QUALITY and the story was fun! Even more so, the lady who sets up the group for the room was a great storyteller and did a great job of setting the atmosphere before we even started. We are going back again this weekend to try their next room!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I did the Secret Temple room with 7 other people for a friends bday party.  It was $25 each.  It was definitely a fun activity, but it wasn't as logic, puzzle-solving centered as I expected.  There was more trial and error and a little randomness involved.The man and woman that greeted us were fun, nice and engaging.  The guy continued on to monitor us in the room and was helpful (with clues) when we needed it.  Obviously this whole operation was set up and is run by some fun & creative people.  I see in some of the other reviews people mentioning an actress, but maybe we didn't get that far?!  I would definitely try a different room or other escape activity but didn't love this one.  It was a little more frustrating than it was fun in retrospect because I think that specific puzzle needed a main clue to bind all the random stuff together (maybe as a hint, they could reveal another framed clue that would give you an idea of what move you need first instead of the monitor giving verbal clues).  I'm not going into any detail so as not to give anything away.I also think a few details would make the room aesthetically a lot more cooler and make you feel like you are actually in a secret temple room.  There was laminating (which I get makes things last longer but just printing out new little papers seems worth it to heighten the experience) and labels/stickers that kind of took you right out of the secret temple and into Staples. lol.  I'd rate this experience a 3.5 but since everyone else's reviews are so high and it was worth trying, I don't want to lowball!  I'm curious to try the Apt. 205 room since people seem to love that one!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Writing this review after our second visit to this amazing escape room! It all starts with the awesome staff! They really have gone the extra mile to intelligently design the rooms. Loved the exciting twists and turns while keeping to the theme from start to finish. On our first visit we were not able to solve The Secret Temple - it left us scratching our heads and more determined to complete a room. We came back to try Apartment 205 and solved it. We had so much fun we had to try the Temple again... Second time was a charm and we were able to solve it too... with clues from the secret society of course ;-) we can't wait for room three. We will be back again! Enigma Escape Rooms makes for a fun night with friends! Six thumbs up!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience! I think it's very unique although i've only been to the Exit game. But reading all the reviews, this would be one of the top.This experience is for sure worth it. Me and my co-workers have tried the Secret Temple, and Boy, our mind was boggled! They really put a lot of effort and thought with the puzzles and combinations. Lots and lots of surprises.I love how they have a narrator with you who's a really good actress. You can ask for a hint which i suggest, would be really helpful to get out.Online booking was great, they have a really good website, easy to navigate and great price! Parking is not bad, you have a few parking space at the back of the building. Great Area, and i love the interior setting. Can't wait to try Apartment 205!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We experienced the Secret Temple...such an awesome experience!  A great way to spend family time!  Would love to do it over and over again!  Great times!DO IT...you won't regret it!  :)

room_title: Escape room "The Bathhouse & Gambler" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: I loved the Bathhouse/Gambler room. The props were great, the staff was freindly and helpful. Can't wait to try one of the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Bathhouse & Gambler" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: We held our annual company Christmas party on December 19th in the Bathhouse Gambler escape room and it was SO MUCH FUN!! This was the first escape room experience for the majority of the group and they were nervous about getting started. But the room was very engaging and interesting, so they got into it right away. The puzzles/problems were a great combination of difficulty and cleverness that picked the brains of even the seasoned escape room participants. Everyone loved the Hot Springs theme and were talking about it for days after we played. Everyone agrees we will return soon to play the two other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "The Bathhouse & Gambler" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: My boyfriend and I escaped Bath House and Gambling! We were yelling at each other and laughing the entire time. The room was super challenging & great staff.

room_title: Escape room "The Bathhouse & Gambler" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: We had a blast solving the Bathhouse and Gambler room with Heather as our guide! Tons of challenging fun for the whole family, no matter the age. Thanks Escape Hot Springs!

room_title: Escape room "The Bathhouse & Gambler" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: A great experience!! Took two grandsons and they loved it!! First time they have escaped. We have been to other escape rooms, but really enjoyed the Bathhouse and Gambler room. All our family loves escape rooms and this one is great fun!!

room_title: Escape room "The Gift" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: We had an awesome time at Red Door! It was my first escape room, and we did "The Gift" which was challenging and clever. Unfortunately, we didn't escape, but we had a blast! Our Gamemaster was great; he was always ready to give hints when we needed them, and even walked us through the rest of the puzzle in the last room when time was up (we were so close!) Overall, we had a great experience and I can't wait to return sometime in the near future!

room_title: Escape room "The Gift" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: I've been to several across the country. They have nice props and great atmosphere. Staff was great and super friendly. Eugene our game master was very nice and supportive during our game of family v family with The Gift. Interesting loyalty program that makes you want to come back for more.

room_title: Escape room "The Gift" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: My team and I have frequented many escape rooms in Northern California. This one had to be one of the best yet. The puzzles were challenging but with some head-scratching and brain power, they were a fun and welcome challenge. Friendly and efficient Game Master. Accomplished "The Gift" and look forward to attempting another room in the future! I would give more info, but anyone who has participated in game rooms know the mystery is the best part.

room_title: Escape room "The Reporter" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: BEST escape room !! Highly recommend. Great people and the rooms are Great quality makes the escape more fun!! Loved it! My team wasn’t the brightest 💡 but we had a great time 😂

room_title: Escape room "The Reporter" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: they were very accommodating and understanding for us first timers. thanks brainstorm for a fun hour!

room_title: Escape room "The Reporter" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: Well designed and fun rooms. As avid escape room enthusiasts, we played The Reporter at expert level this week. We were warned ahead of time of its difficulty... and it did not disappoint (they beat us, for our 2nd loss ever). I highly recommend this company for a SW Florida escape room experience.

room_title: Escape room "Chemical Lab" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Probably the hardest of the Lock Down rooms as of Nov. 2018. My wife and I have done 50+ rooms and solved this room with only 2 minutes to spare. Better played with 3-5 players. The immersion was realistic. Perfect mix of modern and unique traditional elements nicely themed. I highly recommend any of the Lock Down rooms. The staff was friendly and polite. They were very accommodating with the booking process. The game master was tracking our progress carefully and gave hints promptly. Can’t say enough about this company and their rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Chemical Lab" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This is a well-done room. The puzzles were somewhat challenging but very creative, and the room's décor was really spot on for the theme. Everything worked well and it was a very enjoyable experience for myself and my husband.

room_title: Escape room "Chemical Lab" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This place rocks! We barely made it out of the chemical lab in time. What fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Chemical Lab" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: I went with my husband and teenage girls and did the chemical lab. It was challenging and fun! I would recommend this to anyone who wants to be challenged.

room_title: Escape room "The Triton" by Escape This in Hesperia
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Raising Atlantis" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Primal Quest" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: My least favorite panic room i’ve ever done. We got stuck on an early puzzle, and did not understand it even after the lady in the room was trying to show us. There was no way to move forward, and so we were stuck for 40 minutes (as all puzzles are sequential). We got told the answer only 3 minutes before the end, and so had no way to see the rest of the room. Also, the puzzles were not really related to the theme.

room_title: Escape room "Primal Quest" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: We just did the Primal Quest room and loved it. We had very little experience with doing escape rooms but were able to figure out most of the clues with only a little help. We really enjoyed our experience and will be coming back. One major advantage is that you can book a room for only two people and not have to be combined with another group. We did fine with just the two of us.

room_title: Escape room "Primal Quest" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: I was part of a group of 6 where none of us have done a puzzle room like these before. We did the perfect crime room and had an absolute blast! Made it out with seconds to spare.

room_title: Escape room "Primal Quest" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: Ryan was great and Prehistoric was SO CLEVER and 4 rooms of puzzling to work with. Loved it so much! We were 3 people and worked well; one experienced his first time with us and was an awesome puzzler himself! Wish we had more time! I'd have loved for us to try the other 2 rooms. We succeeded in 36 minutes and 53 seconds. I highly recommend it and love that any booking was for your own group, no extras. I highly 5 stars recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard’s Academy" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Highly entertaining, fun time!! We brought a group of 13 year-old boys here for a birthday party (7 kids and 2 adults). The kids escaped but the Wizard's Academy wasn't designed just for kids. The puzzles were weren't overly easy nor were they too challenging to figure out with a little time, teamwork or a hint. The kids finished with only 40 seconds to spare and the adults weren't feeding them advice! We were right there with them playing along! Andrew was our Clue Master and helped make it a great experience! He was on call to move us along when needed it and was enthusiastic about making sure we would have a great time! We're looking forward to going back with a group of friends to see how we'd fare without the assistance of a pack of 13 year-old boys!!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard’s Academy" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Family + grandpa did the Wizard game and while we didn't escape, it was very clever and entertaining. We will be back!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard’s Academy" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Outstanding room, tied for my favorite of all time. I've done probably 25-30 escape rooms. This is absolutely top knotch. We did the Wizard Academy. The puzzles are unique, many of them part if the environment itself, and the decoration puts you immediately into the mindset of a wizard. Unlike other escape rooms the premise was relevant and informed the storyline of the game. It wasn't just opening random locks for no reason, it made sense. Eric was an epic cluemaster! Helpful hints at the right times. Made for a great game.

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Heist" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Mafia Heist was a totally immersive experience with the Speak Easy decor and inventive puzzles and clues!! Our team has completed almost 50 escape games and we absolutely loved this one! A must do!!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Heist" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My three friends and I did the Mafia Heist escape room. Two were escape room rookies, but everyone did fine. The employee (I forget their name) was really nice and helpful explaining the rules to us. We're planning on going back to try and escape from The Attic.

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Heist" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Went here for my friends birthday (group of 10) and we all made it through Mafia Heist with 8 minutes to spare. This was my first escape room experience and I had a really fun time. I think Mafia Heist is a great start for first timers like me!

room_title: Escape room "A Colorado Slaycation" by Planet Deadline Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: What a great way to spend a night with friends when you're looking for something different! We went through the Slaycation room at Planet Deadline and although we didn't escape we were close. Can't wait to come back and try a new room!

room_title: Escape room "A Colorado Slaycation" by Planet Deadline Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: This was an awesome experience. Took all the kids. We chose the Colorado Slaycation. Way fun, challenging, exciting and we are planning the next one.

room_title: Escape room "A Colorado Slaycation" by Planet Deadline Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: "A Colorado Slaycation" was the best escape room I've ever done! All the puzzles actually go with the theme of the room... and the decorations and props were amazing. I really felt like I was in a cabin in the woods/murder house.

room_title: Escape room "A Colorado Slaycation" by Planet Deadline Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: We played Staycation. Definitely one of better escape rooms around town!

room_title: Escape room "A Colorado Slaycation" by Planet Deadline Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: This place is amazing! Very suspenseful, hard puzzles, and well put together. Will be going back there soon!

room_title: Escape room "A Colorado Slaycation" by Planet Deadline Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: First time doing an escape room and we loved it! We did Slaycation for a birthday and it was challenging and fun.

room_title: Escape room "Mysteries of Egypt" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: Great attention to detail, and wonderful storylines. Highly recommend. Every aspect of the building is immersed in mystery. Really great!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Went Friday night for my friend's birthday. It was a group of 6 of us. We didn't complete the Alchemist room but it was super fun. I want to do every room now. Great group of people we were paired with also. Good team effort. Fun evening.

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: We were a group of ten for my friend's birthday and everyone really enjoyed themselves. We did the Alchemist and enjoyed the puzzles and the room setup, staff, and easy parking. It is downtown, but it was fine. Definitely worth the money for the uniqueness, creativity, and knowledgeable staff. Everyone agreed it was worth it for something special.

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Did the Alchemist room. It was awesome. I have done escape rooms before and they were cheesy. This was one awesome. I highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Dragonborne" by Lara's Labyrinth in Hartford
review: The best escape room I’ve ever done. So immersive. A must do. Some unexpected things will happen when you step inside.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: The room was pretty well done although I thought it was a little too dark. We did have a flashlight and a lantern, though. The puzzles were a little too easy (all of us had only done one or two rooms before). I wish the timer appeared in all of the rooms, but it was only visible in the first room. We could only communicate to the game master through a walkie talkie, which was unexpected. Sometimes it was a little challenging to understand them. I think the room used its space well, and we only ever felt too crowded in the first room (with 6 people). We did end up finishing with over 20 minutes. I think everyone still had a good time.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We did the Wild West room on a double date and it was so much fun! We were talking about it the rest of the weekend. We can't wait to go back and try another challenge.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: THIS WAS AWESOME! My husband, mom (visiting from out of town) and I did this on a free evening we had together because we had all heard of escape the rooms and wanted to do one. We wanted to do this as a bonding activity but also because all three of us enjoy good challenges. Typically, my mom and my husband are competitive and I'm the one telling everyone "it's only a game, calm down!" However, by the end, I was cursing (I don't curse) and getting frustrated as a completive side I never see in myself was coming out. We failed the room, going over our 60 minute time by 3 minutes or so. It IS challenging doing the room with only 3 people (as it says on their website) partially because there were times when my husband and mother were solving a clue in one part of the room and meanwhile I was trying to solve a clue on my own in the other corner. Time is of the essence and the more minds working together, the better. However, it is by no means impossible to do this with only two or three people.We did the Wild West room and we felt like this was a good challenge level for us since this is our first escape room (we've heard that at PanIQ, the Kidnapping room is the most challenging with the Alien room being a close second). We would have finished the room in time (I imagine) but we didn't realize it was "okay" to ask for hints. Although the lovely woman working there told us we could, we figured that a) that was "cheating" and b) we were going to escape this room ourselves, gosh dernit! In the future, we will phone in a few times and ask for hints...! So again, this location is not "too tough" to complete as some other puzzle rooms I've seen reviews of in the Phoenix area. They want you to have fun! We will definitely be coming back with more family and friends in the future. It was SUCH a blast! We will be talking about this for a long time afterward.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Sooooo much fun. Got locked up in the Wild West room with my brothers and dad (all adults) and it was challenging enough to make it entertaining but not so challenging that we were frustrated. Can't wait to go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: What a unique experience. My brother got locked up with his wife (a great idea, btw), and I got to save her (and him). Da da da da! We were the heroes! We asked if we could leave him, but just like the forest: "Pack it in, pack it out...don't litter". The staff was friendly and considerate. We needed a LOT of clues! It really requires community and communiction-which the world needs more of. It was good, wholesome, and great fun. Thanks, PANIQ Room Phx!!!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: It was our first time doing this and it was a blast! It was myself (adult) and four teenagers and it was challenging enough for all of us but tons of fun!! We can't wait to come back and try the other rooms! Plus, the staff was awesome! Thank you for a fun experience!!!!! Hope to see you guys again soon!!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Have done 2 of the 3 rooms, Kidnapping and Wild West. Went thru the Kidnapping room with my family and friends (5 of us) and came out with a few minutes to spare. Wild West one went thru with my coworkers (6) for team building and we end up going way over our time. Everyone had a blast and was talking about how they wanted to do the other rooms with their other friends and family. I will most definitely be going back to do the Alien room.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: First time doing a panic room. We went with a group of 6 friends. At first I wasn't sure how I felt about being locked in a room for an hour, but it was a lot of fun working together to escape with only our own ingenuity. The time seem to pass quickly as we were racing the against the clock to solve the series of puzzles that would enable us to escape. I thought it was great! Especially with friends. Would be fun to do with a group of friends, family or team building for work. Grab a coupon and go check it out. Now I want to try all the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: Awesome time at the asylum. Thank you for the great time and memories Mike

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: Great experience with 3 kids 11-13 in the asylum room - a tough challenge but we all had a great time. Highly recommend and will be returning!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: This was our first Escape room experience. Everyone loved it and can't wait to go back. In fact, we reserved another room already! The staff was exceptional.

room_title: Escape room "M.A.S.K." by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Stopped by with a bunch of friends! We had four of us in the room for MASK and it was such a blast!! I can't wait to go and try out other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "M.A.S.K." by Puzzah! in Denver
review: Very unique escape room!   We have played hundreds and have never played any like THE MASK.  I would recommend it for players who want to try all automation! Staff was super wonderful!  They definitely enjoy there work.

room_title: Escape room "M.A.S.K." by Puzzah! in Denver
review: I actually visited Puzzah! as a field trip for an architecture class, the Architecture of Fun! The class divided into groups and we each got to experience an escape room. My team did M.A.S.K. and we completed the room with 2.5 minutes remaining! It was a lot of fun and well made. I've done a couple other escape rooms in Denver and Portland, and this one was my favorite so far. Plus the staff is really nice and we got a chance to talk to them after. Highly recommend!!

room_title: Escape room "Cure of the Alchemist" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: I have played Queen and Alchemist at Team vs Time. The set design is gorgeous. Our game master Michelle was excellent and we were lucky to have her both times. I would say that having more than 4 people in Alchemist would have been too many for the set design/space. I highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Cure of the Alchemist" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: What a fun place. We had our first adventure room experience with Team vs Time with the Cure of the Alchemist. It was such a fun adventure we came back for a second puzzle. The staff was great!

room_title: Escape room "Mom’s Diner" by Epic Escape Rooms in Valdosta
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Manor" by Hellscream Room Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: There were 8 of us friends for an adult night out and wanted to try something different. Did Hel's Manor and it was a blast. Fun to see how we all worked together (or didn't work together). :) cannot wait to go again.

room_title: Escape room "The Manor" by Hellscream Room Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: This was so much fun. We laughed the whole time - I went with my mom and it was such a great time for us! The owner was super awesome and made the experience for us! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "The Manor" by Hellscream Room Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: This was really so much fun! I can't wait to do the other room!!

room_title: Escape room "Magic School for Kids" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Booty" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: Had a blast. I’m not good at solving puzzles but working with the other ladies in my group gave me some confidence! We did the Pirates Booty. Enjoyed every minute of it. Sam was amazing! I hope to return again soon!

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: Lots of room choices, will have to go back for sure! Staff was nice and they don’t make you lock up your stuff, which is a plus.

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: We went for my mother's belated birthday and had a blast! The staff was friendly and informative! You're also allowed to leave the room if needed. Although they don't provide clues upon request like others, I believe it makes it all the more challenging! We may go back for my birthday as well!

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: My family took me for my birthday and we had a blast! Staff was great!

room_title: Escape room "The Toy Room" by Escape Thrill in Tampa
review: Came to the escape thrill while on a recent vacation to Clearwater Beach. Found it on Groupon or another coupon site. We were in the toy room, which I thought would be too easy, but it was not. The staff was very friendly and was willing to help when we got stuck on a couple of issues. I feel like the price was reasonable by buying the coupon, but not sure I would want to pay full price.

room_title: Escape room "The Toy Room" by Escape Thrill in Tampa
review: This was our first escape room and we had a great time - would really recommend The Toy Room - very family friendly. We will definitely return to do another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Toy Room" by Escape Thrill in Tampa
review: We are here on vacation and this was our first escape room. The Toy Room was perfect for us (2 adults, a teenager, and a 10, 7, and 5 year old). We had a blast and all of us worked together, even the youngest was able to contribute, yet the room was challenging enough to keep us busy the entire time. We beat it with a couple minutes to spare. It was great to watch everyone get excited and help each other solve the puzzles. So fun!

room_title: Escape room "Day of the Dead" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Had a blast with family and other group. We escaped with about 4mins left. The special ops room was awesome. But all their rooms are very good. Staff is always nice and friendly. Thanks Escape game Orlando.

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Great atmosphere and the crew working was very nice! The escape room we dod was Special Ops and it was a lot of fun. We were able to escape and used almost all of the hour to solve the incident which was a fair amount of time given the difficulty was an 8 out of 10. Looking forward to doing another escape room as this was a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Spent a great day at the Escape Game Orlando. Went for fathers day 2019 for the special ops game and had a very good time. Employees were very helpful and good at giving those little hints to help keep the game moving when we got stalled.

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: i absolutely loved going to the escape game. their rooms are super fun and challenging and their employees are a 10/10. specifically stacy. her customer service was so amazing and she was so funny and sweet. she even offered to take pictures for us at the end and everyone in my group absolutely adored her. i've been to multiple escape rooms in mulptiple different states, and she was by far the greatest employee that's helped me. love my girl stacy (if she's reading this i'm apart of that volleyball group that did prison break and special ops hehe)

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Super friendly staff! We came to Orlando for vacation, and decided to take a detour away from the hordes of people in the amusement parks. We're big fans of escape rooms, so this wasn't our first experience, and I have to say this company has the best rooms. We've done all of them. Special Ops and Mission: Mars are my favorites.

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: We LOVE Escape Games AZ! The staff are so friendly and personable, we've come back to do all of their rooms. We've talked to our other friends to bring different groups to try out their rooms, too.Specifically reviewing Blaine's Basement: You should definitely go in the evening when it's darker out. It definitely adds to the creepiness of the room. Unfortunately, our group did not escape Blaine's Basement (because we were so terrified of the darkness in the room). But when we told our other friends to do it, they escaped and loved it. One of our favorites rooms in all of Arizona.Definitely recommend their "Quest for the Throne" and "Condo" rooms also. Very fun puzzles and a good blend of "locks" and more "technical" triggers.

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: I had a BLAST! For my first escape room - Blaine's Basement was a great way to start! It was innovative, creepy, thrilling and ultimately very well done! I would recommend this to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: We've done two escape rooms here and I have to say we love it! Blaine's basement was soooooo much fun! Loved everything about that room! Definitely recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Escaped from Blaine's Basement. Probably our favorite room so far. Very engaging. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: It was a blast, Blaine's Basement was ultra realistic and real suspenseful!

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Braved 'Blaine's Basement' last night. Hate to say it, but he got us! We almost escaped!

room_title: Escape room "TEG Unlocked: The Heist - Vol. 1: Chasing Hahn [DIGITAL]" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Doctor" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: Had a great time today at Puzzle Theory. Our puzzle room, The Missing Doctor, had multiple rooms and was challenging. We had fun and finished with a few minutes to spare. Would recommend to friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Doctor" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: We had visitors from out of state who wanted to try this so we went. We did the Missing Doctor room and it was really tough. The clues weren't nearly as easy as I thought they would be, you really had to think hard about each one and the fact that multiple clues were broken up into pieces made it that much more difficult. Great time by all. Definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Doctor" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: We did Interview first and it was full of puzzles, but for some reason, it was an off day all around. So we came back for Missing Doctor - and it was amazing!!!! Nick is so friendly, the puzzles are intense and extensive, and the story has great humor running throughout. Truly a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Doctor" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: My girlfriend and I went with a group of friends of ours and couldn't have had a better time working together to beat the clock and solve the puzzles of The Missing Doctor. Can't wait to try The Interview and The Experiment in future!

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Doctor" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: I highly recommend Puzzle Theory if you're looking for a more challenging room! We will definitely be coming back as they add new ones.Four of us did the Missing Doctor room. The room itself was not as interesting of a setting as other puzzle rooms we've done, but the puzzles were better and more challenging. They required thought and there was enough things going on that you could all be doing something different and not crawling on top of each other. Because of this I enjoyed this place more then the others we have gone to.

room_title: Escape room "Alice and The White Rabbit" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Destin
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Locked In Dead" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: We did the zombie room and it was awesome! The place was easy to find it's a super clean and the people running were super cool. Unfortunately, we did not escape but we had a great time and will come back again to do the train room.

room_title: Escape room "The Locked In Dead" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Great way to celebrate an 18th birthday with friends and family. While the group did not set any records they did not get eaten by the zombies - thankfully. Watching and listening to the action inside the room was fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Locked In Dead" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Just did the zombie apocalypse room and won! It was so fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Locked In Dead" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: I had such a fun time! This escape room is awesome and is a really good challenge. The zombie room is very fun and brilliantly designed. This makes a great team building exercise or just if you want to have fun with your friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Locked In Dead" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Very clever, well done, entertaining and challenging. Other than being eaten by zombies, we had a great time! The staff was fantastic. The puzzles were challenging, but doable. If we had five more minute, those zombies could never have gotten us!

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Escape Blue Ridge in Atlanta
review: The Prohibition room here was my first escape room ever, but I've done more since. The staff's very friendly, and we got to meet their adorable dog Bailey. Unfortunately, we could not take Bailey into the escape room. Presumably, because he knew all the answers already. ;) But this was truly a great first escape room experience. The friend I was with had done other escape rooms, and he found this just as challenging and enjoyable, so I'd say good for newbies and vets alike. Definitely want to try their other escape room next time I'm in Blue Ridge!

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Escape Blue Ridge in Atlanta
review: My husband, our 3 teenage kids, my dad and I did the speakeasy-themed room last week. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was fun and challenging. Meeting Bailey the pup was a bonus! Thanks for a fun family adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Escape Blue Ridge in Atlanta
review: This was an epic adventure! If you are in the area outs a must do! And if you were not in the area, go anyway!

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Escape Blue Ridge in Atlanta
review: Great family owned and operated business. As far as escape rooms go this is very well planned and challenging. I would highly recommend visiting this establishment while in town. It's a great addition to a great community. The owners are very sweet and entertaining!We definitely will return next visit to Blue Ridge!

room_title: Escape room "Towering Inferno - Race the Flames" by Odyssey Escape Game in Atlanta
review: We had a great time doing this! It was fun to learn so much from Mike about the business and then try our hand at solving the problems (Towering Inferno). The ideas for the rooms were very creative. This was our first time doing an escape room challenge (at least for us 2 older folks), so we were not quite successful, but it was super fun regardless. The challenges were well thought out. The suspenseful music was something I could have lived without, however. ;-)

room_title: Escape room "Towering Inferno - Race the Flames" by Odyssey Escape Game in Atlanta
review: Yes you read that correctly, this is just like the 1970's movie where you are stuck on a tower that is burning and will crumble if you don't get off the roof in time. (our personal favorite of the four). This escape room has elements that i have never experienced before in a room and a finale that has such a great completion. Just to note there are some dry ice effects in the latter part of the game (and may be able to be disabled upon request). This game would be great for new players and I think there are elements that younger players will appreciate/enjoy a lot.

room_title: Escape room "Towering Inferno - Race the Flames" by Odyssey Escape Game in Atlanta
review: I was excited to try an Escape room. And what a fun time it was for the family!! So glad to say that we are ones that Survived the Towering Inferno!! There were 4 in our family along with 4 others. It did get my blood pressure up just a little, but well worth it. Great to know that 4 people that knew each other well could work together with 4 complete strangers to escape!!

room_title: Escape room "Cuban Crisis" by Escapology Augusta in Augusta
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Quest" by Southside Escape Room in Atlanta
review: We had a blast doing the pirate room. The owner is super sweet. If we were in town longer we would happily do another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Quest" by Southside Escape Room in Atlanta
review: We had such a wonderful experience with southside! The pirate room was fun for the kids and adults both. The kind lady helped us and was so generous. Best prices and kindest staff in town! We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Quest" by Southside Escape Room in Atlanta
review: My family had a wonderful time in the escape room.  We did the shipwreck themed room.  It was great afternoon fun and the employee was very helpful when we needed "hints".  This is an awesome way to spend some family time!  Teamwork!!  I would recommend to everyone!!

room_title: Escape room "Beyond Medusa’s Gate VR" by VR Territory in Orlando
review: This was soooooo much fun for my sons 7th Birthday. It was 10 of us, and we all had a blast. Some of us played together as groups and then left into our own games. The staff are awesome and super helpful. I LOVE that they have played the games and can help you out. It’s kind of addictive! LOL

room_title: Escape room "Beyond Medusa’s Gate VR" by VR Territory in Orlando
review: Highend equipment and excellent service. Mutliple setups including HTC Vive Pro. Knowledgable staff and great games. Never felt rushed and the workers seemed passionate about VR! Definitely recommend

room_title: Escape room "Beyond Medusa’s Gate VR" by VR Territory in Orlando
review: My son always wanted to try VR and in NYC it's always crowded there so we decided to try it her in Orlando since we're here celebrating his birthday. We came yesterday afternoon and my boys including my boyfriend were able to play right away. Nick was awesome and helped a lot. The place is located in a small strip mall. Guess what, we're back again today. The boys are having fun. Will recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Mission Impossible" by My Greatest Escape in Ventura
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Queen Anne's Revenge" by Victor Valley Escape in Hesperia
review: This was our 5th and best escape room experience. Our group really enjoyed the whole adventure.  It was really well done.  The puzzles were fun and challenging. There were some clever and surprising ideas that we were still talking about on the way home. We liked the props and professionally done room design.  The staff were helpful and friendly, especially Chelsea. :) We are looking forward to going back when they open their second room.  Great work Victor Valley Escape!

room_title: Escape room "Bio Lab" by Brain Busters Escape Rooms in Daleville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: Breakout Games in Falls Church was absolutely amazing. My date and I did the "Runaway Train" game with our game master being James. The game was so much fun, and honestly, I recommended a lot of people to go to Breakout Games to experience the same game we tried. James was an amazing game master and truly helped us when we needed it. He gave us hints that were still mysterious, so it left you confused but they were helpful nonetheless. The hints made the game more exciting and throughout the entire time, I never lost that excitement factor that the game provided. Shout out to James for being an amazing game master/host. Give James a promotion or something because he killed it. Thank You for the great experience, and to anyone who is unsure if you should go or not, DEFINITELY GO! I had such an amazing time, I cannot explain it in words. I will definitely be coming back again.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: Miguel was such a gracious host. We did the runaway train with 4 people one of which was my teen daughter. We found it challenging and fun. Tip get your 3 free clues ASAP so u can move forward faster.

room_title: Escape room "Saloon" by EXIT Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: Exit Tallahassee is a great place! Played the Saloon today. Will definitely go back and try out other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Saloon" by EXIT Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: We did the Saloon test today! It was so much fun! We can't wait to come back and try all the rooms. I loved everything about our experience and meeting new people to work with to solve the clues.

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: This is the 3rd time I have played with Breakout Games - Birmingham. All experiences have been great. Can't wait for a 4th attempt.

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: What a fun place in Birmingham. I had a great first experience here with co-workers as a team building activity one afternoon. The staff is super friendly and accommodating, and also very helpful.Our group of 12 split in two groups, one doing the Mystery Mansion and the other called Do Not Disturb, which I was a part of.  We had so much fun with this in a "hotel room" theme trying to track down a kidnapper who had us trapped in the room. Trying to find clues and get out of there in one hour is a challenge but we had a blast. We didn't quite breakout, but were very close! The staff even helped along the way. They gave us 3 free clues we could ask for at any time if we were stumped. After we finished, we even went next door to get pictures taken, which is always fun.All in all, a super cool venue in Birmingham. I highly recommend coming here and hope to be back soon bringing some friends! A big thanks to Jeremy for arranging and helping make it a fun day.

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Me and my wife love Escape Rooms and today we had an opportunity to play both the "Do Not Disturb" room and the "Kidnapped" Room and both were a ton of fun! James was an excellent game master for both rooms. Unfortunately we do not live in Birmingham, but I highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys Escape Rooms. We will definitely be coming back when we stay in Birmingham again and will bring more people with us! Thank you so much for the wonderful experience!

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Went here for a team building at work. It was very enjoyable. I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Went with my husband for our anniversary. We were the only two people in the room so it was difficult. Luckily our game master Emily was nice enough to help us out a few times. We had a blast. Will definitely be back but will bring more people with us lol. Also the lobby staff was so nice and friendly. Love this place.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: Oh my God just got done doing Spellbound had such a great time set is unbelievably amazing pretty hard but all of it makes sense. I don't think we would have gotten as far as we did without our GM. Wish they had more rooms can't wait to do another one.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: Our group have completed around 15-20 escape rooms in Arizona and "Spellbound" is our consensus favorite room. The attention to detail and the design of the room is amazing. They definitely spent money creating this room.It was very challenging and we escaped with less than 3 minutes on the clock. But we have a pretty great group of six that work together really well. Wouldn't recommend this room for beginners, but once you've done a couple, you have to check out this room. Since completing "Spellbound", we compare every room we do to this one, and unfortunately, nothing compares to this room. Very friendly staff at Mind Spark, too.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: The Spellbound room was amazing! The quality of the room and props were superb.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: We had an absolute blast. We did the most challenging room, Spellbound, and almost completed the challenge. We will definitely be back again, thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: First time here. 14-year-old girls in the Spellbound room. SO FUN!!! The room is very decorated and the theme is great. Make friends with Alyssa and you can get extra clues if you request them. Clues are totally personalized and helpful. We had so much fun we booked the Zombie room on our way out! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: I did the Spellbound room this last weekend with some of my favorite people, and it was a wonderful experience. Everything was well-organized, well-made, and very challenging. The production quality and staff are top notch!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: We just did Spellbound and it was amazing! The clues were all super clever and let me say as someone with a few escape rooms under my belt, it was very different and more difficult than most, but in a fun way! Thanks so much to the amazing staff - you guys were awesome and we are definitely going to come back again! We drove all the way from Tucson to try it out and it was totally worth it!! Thanks for the great escape experience, Mind Spark!

room_title: Escape room "Hang ‘Em High" by Try-N-Escape in Miami
review: We had an amazing experience yesterday. We did the Hang 'em High room. It was challenging, fun and full of surprises! The four of us escaped just in time and cannot wait to go back to try Sara's Got a Secret. Jason was a fantastic host and made us feel welcome. Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Hang ‘Em High" by Try-N-Escape in Miami
review: I have been to several escape rooms in the past few months with my family. We have been enjoying each and every escape room. This room 'hang em high' was very challenging. Jason explained the instructions to us and set our 60 minutes. We were off. This was one of the best rooms ever. Really had to put on our thinking caps. We finished with 16 minutes on the clock. It was awesome. Can't wait to go back for the next challenging room. Thanks Jason!!

room_title: Escape room "Hang ‘Em High" by Try-N-Escape in Miami
review: So much fun!! The owners are great. We did the Hang em High room and ALMOST got out in time. We should have brought more people for brain power. This place is a must if you're in Boca Raton.

room_title: Escape room "Distress Call" by Unity Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Vault" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: The best experience I've ever had! Puzzles were witty and fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Vault" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: Put away your smart phones/tablets/laptops and exercise your brain power. What a fun place to spend an hour team building. Will definitely come back to try the other rooms! Thank you Spencer!

room_title: Escape room "The Vault" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: So much fun! It was challenging but just the right amount. More witty and exciting than other room escapes I have done. Can't wait to try the new room when it opens!

room_title: Escape room "The Vault" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: It was Awesome!!! The Ragole's finished with 3 minutes to spare.When we started I was thinking What the heck are we doing.But as we started to work with our team, it all came together.Can't wait for the next room.

room_title: Escape room "The Vault" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: Put away your smart phones/tablets/laptops and exercise your brain power. What a fun place to spend an hour team building. Will definitely come back to try the other rooms! Thank you Spencer!

room_title: Escape room "The Cell Block" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This is an amazing place! Great for everyone. We did the cell block. It was really fun. We had four people and barely made it out in time. A lot of good puzzles. Some really simple and some difficult. The customer service here is top notch. I love hay they say we want y'all to have fun. It's not like other escape rooms where they take pride in you not finishing. They want you to succeed.

room_title: Escape room "The Cell Block" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: The cell was so fun and creative - my 3rd escape room and the best yet! The hosts were fantastic- we will go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Cell Block" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We just finished doing "The Cell Block". Well done! Very difficult, but the challenge was worth it! Make sure that you ask for clues. I love it when rooms are not just lock and key. This room included more "reactive" than items when certain puzzles were solved. Right up my alley!

room_title: Escape room "Hollywood Premiere - Destination Los Angeles" by ALL IN Adventures Waterbury in Southington
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Riddler's Lab" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We have gone to several different escape rooms in Phoenix. This one was by far the best. The staff was friendly and the room was challenging. We did the Lab and made it out in time. The puzzles were creative and there are some neat effects and surprises.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Riddler's Lab" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Had so much fun doing Dr Riddlers lab! We will be back if we come back to Phoenix area!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Riddler's Lab" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
