I would never feel the need to write this but I do feel that, as business owners, we live in a world where customers are able to review us but we, as business owners, are not given the opportunity to respond. While I am grateful to have customers play and avidly try to make it through the game, I also need to ensure that my prop decor, investments in making the rooms authentic and detailed, and game pieces do not get damaged- so that other players can play the game as well. During the game, it was clear that there was not a lot of respect for the facility or objects in the game room. (NOTE: some of the books in the rooms are antiques that were gifted to us with the intent of us caring for them; I intend to uphold that responsibility. As well, if a game piece is damaged, it can impact the game experience of people who are scheduled to play following that game). During game play, I observed the two of them dropping and damaging items in the room, kicking gaming pieces with their feet to move them after they'd dropped them on the floor and walking on top of materials. This is not how many of our participants and visitors play. While it may have appeared that I was ushering them out of the room with the intent of going to lunch; I did not go to lunch (despite the fact that I'm quite sure many other humans do)- I just didn't want to have them play any other games especially not our Gold Rush room which is stocked with many items that are over 110 years old. Regarding the difficulty of the game, while experienced gamers may make it out with time on the clock, there are still a lot of players in our area that have never played a game before and we work to ensure that all gamers escape. Our escape games are different (we note that 'everyone escapes' on our website) and we think that people enjoy the positive experience. While we can't please everyone, we do think preservation of the experience for other players is more important than allowing our games to be damaged for solely two people. While input is always appreciated, as business owners, we weigh out cost and benefit on a regular basis. It was my decision that it was potentially more costly to have the two of them play another game than it was beneficial. As well, if our experience was so bad, I'm not sure why the two of them asked to play another game.

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: The game itself was enjoyable, if shorter than we were used to. My sister and I got out with 20 minutes to spare and we looked through every inch of space in the room (which, for anyone that’s done a hard escape room before, is the trademark of an experienced team. You have to go through everything to avoid missing an “obvious” clue). The woman running the show was the reason for the bad review. She had her boyfriend stop in before we entered the room and told him that after she was finished here that they could grab food. She’s allowed to have a personal life, sure, but shooing customers out the door after they beat the game saying she has “a thing to do” is just unprofessional. We told her that we had an interest in doing another game (there were no bookings after us) and she told us that she it was doable with 2 people, but she “would rather not have [us] in that room because *this* (gestures around to the scattered items of the room) can’t happen in that room”...it was extremely rude. Then she went on to complain about how LONG it’s going to take her to clean up and that she’s never seen this level of “disaster” in the room before. The staff was unprofessional and I’ve never felt the need to leave a scathing review for anyone. Ever. Feel free to enjoy the game itself, but don’t get in the way of the employee’s free time...

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: Our family  Christmas gift from son was a trip to do the escape room. Nikki was really fun and patient. A great time had by all.

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: Our family did the Espionage room the day after Thanksgiving and had a great time. All ages had fun - we had 3 generations participating. Staff was friendly, encouraging and helpful, but did not spoil the experience. There was no shortage of clues to find, but we did find some red herrings along the way. We enjoyed ourselves and would recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets of the Illuminati" by Puzzle Workshop in Orange County
review: My family and I completed their CSI: Hollywood room and we LOVED it! Awesome decorations, well-designed puzzles. I hear their owners make games at Blizzard Entertainment, so that explains why the puzzles are so well done. The staff was really friendly and made sure we had the right amount of hints so we felt challenged but not stuck. I can't wait to check out their Illuminati room - I hear that has some cool moments too.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets of the Illuminati" by Puzzle Workshop in Orange County
review: My group of friends have grown a love for escape rooms and the Puzzle Workshop: Illuminati room was the third one we've done together. I liked the variety of puzzles that we had to solve and the overall flow from one puzzle to the next seemed very intuitive and linear. The tech in the rooms were also very cool and think those always add a very neat "wow" factor! I actually think the Illuminati room was fairly easy compared to the ones we've done in the past. The waiting area is very clean and nicer than most of the other escape rooms I've done. The manager, Stephanie, was very kind and friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets of the Illuminati" by Puzzle Workshop in Orange County
review: My inner Robert Langdon and Indiana Jones would be proud. The Illuminati Escape Room was really straightforward and needless to say, the four of us escaped. PLOT: you are trapped in an office trying to steal a valuable Egyptian statuette and you need to escape before the Illuminati overlords come back.The clues, puzzles, tech, storyline were all so much fun and very well done. They were diverse, challenging and more importantly a lot of fun to solve. We were constantly busy! There is a staff member monitoring your progress, who gives out hints (unlimited) if you really need them. When we arrived, we were greeted by Stephanie who was really kind, helpful, and super sweet! Overall, this is probably the funnest escape room that I've ever encountered and I can't wait to try out their second room!

room_title: Escape room "Missing from the Speakeasy" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: The headline dancer from an illegal speakeasy has vanished, and it’s up to you to find her!We really enjoyed this room. The quest to find a person lent itself to some creative twists and turns with an engaging story line. Unlike Blackbeard, this room was very linear and we always had a very clear sense of what we should do next and why we were doing. Great production design, clear and fun puzzles, and we’re of course always suckers for a good speakeasy.The one thing against the room is that it may be almost too easy for experienced escape room players. We blew through it in about 30 minutes, but they told us that most people don’t. Don’t discount it though if you’re an old hand at this. We still had fun, and we think it would be a great room for a group starting out on escape puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Missing from the Speakeasy" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: Probably one of the best Escape Hunts in town and a cool way to beat the Miami heat. So much fun escaping the Speakeasy room. We'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Missing from the Speakeasy" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: We loved this place. A charming Victorian lounge like Sherlock Holmes apartment and the room itself - we did the Speakeasy - was very fun and challenging. We had a fantastic time with my family.

room_title: Escape room "Missing from the Speakeasy" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: We had to find the missing cabaret dancer in the Speakeasy room. Went with a group of four experienced players. The room was well organized and designed. We escaped feeling like the puzzles make sense, but were challenging enough to be entertaining.When you walk inside, the decor is really nice. You feel like you are inside Sherlock Holmes sitting room. The staff is professional and welcoming. They offered us something to drink and took time to make conversation.I really enjoyed this escape room experience and would highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Missing from the Speakeasy" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: What a great establishment. The speakeasy setting was amazing. This is a family owned and operated business. Incredibly nice people, they offer drinks before and after you enter the room and make you feel at home. If you haven’t already been here I suggest you try it out!

room_title: Escape room "In Hot Water" by Escape Rehoboth in Rehoboth Beach
review: What a great adventure! Challenging and fun! We had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "In Hot Water" by Escape Rehoboth in Rehoboth Beach
review: Great option for rainy days, evenings, or just a break from the heat. Staff was awesome, the room was cool, the puzzles were fun. We went with two kids, 10 and 12 and six adults, 25-50. Everybody contributed to solving the room and we can't wait to go back and try another one!

room_title: Escape room "Shipwrecked" by Element of Escape in Sarasota
review: Had a lot of fun here tonight! This is my 6th game in various locations and I enjoyed this one immensely! My cousin and I did the Shipwrecked room. It was challenging but really good! I was surprised it was only one room as all that I've done before have led to another room, but considering the story it made sense.The woman who gave us clues was great. Super friendly and helpful at the right times.I totally recommend this place if you're in the area.

room_title: Escape room "World War II - 10th Mountain Division" by Mystery Quests in Colorado Springs
review: We did our team building event with Mystery-Quests. We were in the WWII room. Not only did we have a great time, but we learned a little something about ourselves as a team. Thank you!! I can't wait to see what the other rooms are like!

room_title: Escape room "World War II - 10th Mountain Division" by Mystery Quests in Colorado Springs
review: We did this as a sibling and sibling-in-law night out and LOVED it! We had no idea what to expect going into it, but we loved it so much we all left saying we wanted to stay and do another room or come back the next day. We did the WWII room and would recommend it to anyone. Even though we didn't "escape" and solve the clues in time we still had a blast. This is totally worth the money for a fun night out with friends, family, or co-workers. They even let us walk through the rest of the clues after time ran out so we could still see what we would have gotten to if we didn't run out of time. We really liked that aspect.

room_title: Escape room "World War II - 10th Mountain Division" by Mystery Quests in Colorado Springs
review: My grandson and I did the WWII room and we were captured. It was still a lot of fun and challenging. We plan to do it again when we come back to Colorado Springs to visit.

room_title: Escape room "World War II - 10th Mountain Division" by Mystery Quests in Colorado Springs
review: We had a BLAST!!! This was our first room escape. There were 3 people in our group and the WW ll room was a real challenge. Needless to say, we were captured. We had an awesome experience and can't wait for our next adventure.I wasn't sure I would be any help to the team as I didn't possess the logical reasoning like my team did.Debi assured me "No matter what your skill set, everyone is an asset in your team.

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Island" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was very amusing! We tried two rooms the first one being awakening. The second one we tried the Jurassic one and it was definitely one of the better rescale rooms that we have done

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Island" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Lots of fun. Come with your family! You even get a chance to win a free game. Try the Jurassic Room. You won't regret it.

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Island" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Yes! Just did jurassic island it was fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by MindTrap Escape Room in Temecula
review: We did the Gold Rush room today and had a blast! We will definitely be back soon!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by MindTrap Escape Room in Temecula
review: What a fun time! We completed the Gold rush room. Two adults and two kiddos and we all had a blast. Just the right amount of mystery and excitement.

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by MindTrap Escape Room in Temecula
review: This was our first escape room and I can honestly say it was fantastic! Gold Rush is an exceptionally well-designed room. Every single detail of the room speaks to the theme! The owners' attention to detail exudes from the walls. You receive the 5D experience where all of your senses convince you that you are in Jacks cabin. From temperature to sounds, smells and more.Six adults and 3 children played their hearts out and are now hooked to this kind of entertainment! There were plenty of things to keep us all occupied but not too many to overwhelm us (we were all first timers). The kids contributed to a lot. We used a few hints and we escaped with 2 seconds to spare. The staff was so customer focused! Can't wait to go back for Conspiracy!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by MindTrap Escape Room in Temecula
review: Our family and friends had a fantastic first escape experience at Gold Rush. The room is very well designed making it entertaining for adults and children. The puzzles are neither too hard nor too easy but just right. Customer service is impeccable. My son can't wait to go back to experience their 2nd room -Conspiracy.

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by MindTrap Escape Room in Temecula
review: Our family had so much fun finding the gold! We literally had ten seconds left. We had a group with ages 6-62 and we all had a blast. Thank you to our host - she was amazing! My kids can’t stop talking about it and we can’t wait to do another one. We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Submarine" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: So much fun to do. This was our second time here and it was as much if not more fun this time around. I highly recommend this place for a group of friends to do for a night out! Try the Submarine or the Agency. Both are awesome.

room_title: Escape room "The Submarine" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: There were 5 of us - a perfect group size for this specific game. We had a blast while solving the riddles and working together. We managed to beat the clock with about 4 minutes to spare. I really enjoyed the challenging atmosphere and having the opportunity to work with my boyfriend's family in the tense situation. The employees at the Scottsdale location were incredibly friendly. They were professional and made our group feel comfortable too. I would highly recommend trying an Escape The Room experience to anyone. It is the perfect setting for team building, but also family bonding and plenty of laughs.

room_title: Escape room "The Submarine" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Our first escape room experience was here. My husband and I did it to celebrate our 13th anniversary for something different to do. We were placed with a family of 4 that we didn't know but it was fine. We did the submarine room and it was so much fun! Definitely looking forward to trying other rooms at Escape the room AZ with a group of friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Plundering" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Lots of fun! Challenging but super exciting! Kids and adults loved it!

room_title: Escape room "The Blizzard" by Complexity: A Puzzling Adventure in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Escape Rooms Connecticut in New Haven
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: I have been a couple times. Each time was an incredible time. The staff is amazing. They explain everything very well, and are professional and personable. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: We did the newest room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" and this room was AWESOME! Only done 2 rooms and this one is by far my favorite (and I'm not just saying that cause we were able to escape lol) you will definitely be in for a surprise! So try out this room!!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: This place is so much fun!! I was initially somewhat skeptical as I'm not great at puzzle solving, but it was surprisingly awesome. We did the Grim Stacks room, such a fun room. We did have 7 adults in the room and I think that it would probably be even more fun with a slightly smaller group. I can't wait to come back again with my kids next time!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Highly recommended! The staff here are very friendly. We did the Cabin room and had a blast.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: We had a spectacular time in the Cabin and saved our friend. The facility was very nice and is adding rooms that we're excited to visit. We'll be back up that way. Definitely worth an hour and a half drive.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Escaped The Cabin and Blackbeard's Brig. Both really well done rooms. I would highly recommend The Cabin! Very friendly staff and excellent facilities!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Auburn Escape Zone is awesome!! I have completed the Cabin, Imprisoned, and tested the new Puzzle master room. All are unique and come with their own challenges. The staff are friendly and are interested in your opinions of the rooms and are constantly thinking of new and creative rooms. If you want a challenge and a fun time I HIGHLY suggest you give one of the rooms a try.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: I now have played all of the rooms at Auburn Escape Zones. As a huge fan of escape rooms, I can tell you this is top notch. Their puzzles and tasks are certainly challenging but not so overwhelming as to intimidate those new to escape rooms.  The Cabin room was a blast. The decor and immersive story really enhance the experience overall and it is my favorite room so far. So if you haven't tried Auburn Escape Zones, grab some friends and sign up for an hour of some of the best and most intense team building challenges you have ever faced!

room_title: Escape room "Ghostbusters!" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Great escape room, lots of fun. We did Ghost Busters, very challenging! Classy place with lots of seating and a great bar. And Chris F was a terrific guide.

room_title: Escape room "Ghostbusters!" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: With two teen boys we scheduled an escape from the Ghostbusters room. Our first time and to be honest: for about 15 minutes, none of us had a clue as to what to do! Once we started to figure it out, then we were finally rolling. The room was done well, some of the challenges were not at all clear (most of us couldn't read one clue) our guide did a good job. We were short just one task to finish it. I would go again, it was fun and a nice/well decorated place to go.

room_title: Escape room "Ghostbusters!" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: I really enjoyed myself! I went for my birthday with a group of friends and family. The atmosphere was nice! The staff was excellent! The bar was nice! We did the ghostbusters room which was super fun! They even had a card hidden in the room that said happy birthday. Awesome experience and most of all we mad it out!

room_title: Escape room "Ghostbusters!" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: This was the best escape room I've been to so far. From the decor to the bar and lastly the rooms. We did "The Ghost buster"room and it was challenging but fun. If you choose that don't hesitate to ask for clues. Trust me you'll need them. You definitely must come with your thinking cap on. I would return whenever in DC. The staff was awesome as well such a great night!

room_title: Escape room "Ghostbusters!" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: The setting and facility are fantastic. The Ghostbuster room was challenging but doable. I don't recommend mixing parties.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Captain" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: My son and I did the pirate room and had a lot of fun. Intelligent puzzles and a great group to solve them with! The staff was awesome. Such a fun place, definitely doing it again!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Captain" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: Absolutely loved it! Took my parents and we all had a blast. Great puzzles, great setup, great atmosphere. Go! You will love it!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Captain" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: My family and I have played many different escape rooms, and this is one of the best. Well balanced and a good amount of challenging but not over the top puzzles. The room is very well themed and well thought out. A rare room that will play well for beginners as well as experienced players. Can't wait to see the Toy room.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Captain" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: We went here for my daughter's 14th birthday. She and her friends had a ton of fun. The room was decorated really great and the puzzles were a ton of fun. We escaped with the treasure with 5 min to spare. Can't wait to try their other room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Captain" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: I took my family to do the Pirate Room, to celebrate a birthday - they added a time slot for us! Two of our group had never done an escape room and the other two of us were doing our second. We had so much fun - definitely going back to do the other room. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Escape Manor in Panama City
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes Final Case" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: Did this for first time with my mom - Sherlock Holmes! Loved it! Can't wait to come back and do it with bigger groups as well!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes Final Case" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: We had a lot of fun trying to break the code in the Sherlock Holmes room! We would definitely go again to try other rooms and bring some friends too! Our host was very helpful and welcoming!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes Final Case" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: We had a lot of fun trying to break the code in the Sherlock Holmes room! We would definitely go again to try other rooms and bring some friends too! Our host was very helpful and welcoming!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: We had a blast and so close which means we'll have to go back so we can ESCAPE. To get a "W" in our box.

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: We had the greatest time. Friends and Family with us team work was amazing. Until next escape. Very very awesome time. Thanks for a great night. Staff was amazing!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: The best escape room i have ever been to. Staff was very friendly and game was very fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: I've never even attempted something like this before but it was absolutely worth the price of admission. I want to say so much but I will not spoil anything for anyone. It's foolish to not give this place a try. Thank you for the great experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: The staff was great. The waiting room was excellent (I didn't find any clues there. I think I failed at waiting.). We were all so excited when we figured out the last puzzle that we were jumping all around, and several of the staff were just as excited as we were. It made the whole experience amazing.

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: My wife and I just got back from doing our first escape here. It was so much fun! The suite is around at the back of the lot, but its not too difficult to find. The staff is super friendly and greets you with a smile when you walk in. After you sign in they brief you on all of the rules and give you the story set up for your room. Then they walk you to your room and its time to escape. Actually "escape" is a bit of a misnomer, its not really about escaping, its about solving the puzzle. I didn't feel "trapped" and there was nothing scary, which is a good thing for a claustrophobic haunted house baby like me. I don't want to spoil anything about the puzzle but I will say that it was just difficult enough that it never felt overly frustrating and that my wife and I had an absolute blast solving it along with the other couple in our group. We finished with 20 minutes to spare! We will definitely be back again to try out more escapes. I just hope they will keep more new escapes coming so that we can come back more often!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: This was so much fun! We failed, but had the best time with our friends! I would highly recommend this place, and the staff was so friendly and fun! We will be going back soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Prison" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: We had so much fun on the Cabin we came back and did the Prison. It was really well done and the staff was friendly and helpful

room_title: Escape room "The Prison" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: We came to visit my daughter as she was in school and couldn’t come home. We looked for something new to do so the four of us me my wife son “22” and daughter “20” have this a try. What a gem Tuscaloosa has here!!! Very much a great treat for all of us!! The amazing thing is the team work that goes into it. We did the prison room and will be back to do all 4 , thanks for a great day!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Prison" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: Our school staff spent some professional learning time escaping the prison. There were 10 of us and each of us was able to participate in the escape. It was a great way for us to get to know each other, learn to work together, and have fun while building relationships. It was really cool to see the leadership styles and problem solving skills that emerged. Best first day of school ever!!

room_title: Escape room "Baby Gangster" by That Escape Room in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Crystal Casino" by Crystal River Room Escape in Crystal River
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Puzzler vs Superheroes" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: We were in Auburn for a Travel Softball tournament and looking for something different to do! Did we find it at Auburn Escape Zones! It was fun, entertaining and full of laughs! Great family evening or team event! The staff really tried to make it enjoyable for us! If we are ever in Auburn again, we will be back!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Puzzler vs Superheroes" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: We've completed Imprisoned, The Cabin and the Superheroes vs Puzzler escape rooms and have had so much fun with each one. Imprisoned was our favorite, Superheroes was a close 2nd. Can't wait for the next theme! We've been twice with our Girl Scout Troop and once has a family. Fun, great way to work on communication and teamwork. I highly recommend Auburn Escape Zones. Well worth the trip (we drive 45 minutes to visit). The staff is friendly and courteous.

room_title: Escape room "The Puzzler vs Superheroes" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: I've been too Auburn Escape Zones twice! We did the Cabin Room first and last week we tried out the Super Hero Room. Both are very challenging but very fun. I highly recommend you to check out this cool place!

room_title: Escape room "Hors D'oeuvres & Obituaries" by The Escape Little Rock in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Tower" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: We had such an amazing time doing the escape room. These people are so innovative and have created such a cool experience. Seriously. Wow. I can't wait to go back and try the next room!

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Tower" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: Dragon tower Origin. Oh my god. It's so hard. Extra extra teamwork needed. This is probably the hardest escape room I've ever done. Everyone will do something to contribute to the escape. Everyone are locked in different rooms with different puzzles, but you're not the key to your room..you'll need your kins. Sooo many puzzles (A LOT) and technology. 6186382 hints needed (mirror mirror on the wall PLEASE HELP US). We have to add extra time (30minutes) to get out lol. Have to pay for the extra time though. If you want to challenge yourself and your teammate I recommend this place. Love the costumes and the production value. And the weapons! Use them! Game master is amazing. Thank you, you're our savior.One tip..escape :)!By the way, they got restroom now!

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Tower" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: The Dragon Tower Room was a fun experience!  Definitely takes teamwork and paying attention to detail!  Asking for clues was easier and more clear than other rooms.  Wayne (the owner) was a great game master. You do start separated, but thankfully not for long.  I recommend checking out this room!

room_title: Escape room "Gangster's Gamble" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: What a blast! I absolutely loved the Gangster's Gamble. Thought-provoking puzzles and great set design. Had fun while exercising the brain and bonding with my family.

room_title: Escape room "Gangster's Gamble" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: Loved Gangsters Gamble. The puzzles are unique and the rooms are very immersive. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Gangster's Gamble" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: Team vs Time's escape room, Gangster's Gamble, is excellent. The puzzles are clever and challenging, but not frustrating. The design of the room, and all of the props and clues fit very well with the gangster theme. It is very immersive and thrusts you into the past to take down a crime boss. I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Gangster's Gamble" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: First time doing this type of thing and it was AWESOME! The workers were great and the theme was awesome too. I will be going back!

room_title: Escape room "Gangster's Gamble" by Team vs Time in Hartford
review: My girlfriend and I made the trip to check out Team vs. Time's Gangster's Gamble earlier today... and we can't stop talking about it.  It wasn't our first escape room (more like our 15th..), but Gangster's Gamble absolutely blew us away. It was definitely one of the more challenging rooms we have done, so first timers may want to check out some other escape rooms first.  But for those with a few escape rooms under their belt, Gangster's Gamble is a must.

room_title: Escape room "The Bird Box" by Room Escape Atlanta in Atlanta
review: We had a great time in The Lost Sense Escape Room. Alex was awesome!!!

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Huntsville in Huntsville
review: We did Under Pressure. It was fun, although we didn’t finish! Our screen went black during our time so that was kind of an inconvenience, and we weren’t offered anything for it. It also would have been nice to start with a clue. We wasted over 15 minutes of our time trying to figure out where to start, and most escape rooms start you out with a clue. Overall it was fun! A little pricey Versus others, but fun!

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Huntsville in Huntsville
review: We just finished the Under Pressure room as a family. It was awesome and we set a record!! Thanks for having a great family fun experience for us

room_title: Escape room "DreamWeaver" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: We make at least one trip a year from NC to FL and ALWAYS visit Imagine. We were excited to try their newest foray into their serial unfolding storyline: Dreamweaver. We also had not done the prelude, Alleyway Vigilantes, so did that one 1st. They were both amazing! AV, being their "introductory" room was impressive, full of great surprises and puzzles, and a really FUN room! Dreamweaver, being their newest, and hardest, was also excellently executed. Everyone had something to do, and you really felt the time crunch in this one. They had two amazing logic puzzles I ended up working on myself and just had a blast. Our GM, Aaron, provided excellent help and subtle hints when we needed one. He was fun, quirky, and obviously loved working there. Can't wait to the next chapter and our next visit!!

room_title: Escape room "DreamWeaver" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: We had an absolute blast. The room flowed well and the puzzles were very fun to do. Our game guide was hilarious and awesome to work with. We will be back to do the other three rooms. :)

room_title: Escape room "DreamWeaver" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Played 2 fantastic rooms today! I had a great experience!

room_title: Escape room "DreamWeaver" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: Had an awesome experience today in the Dreamweaver room with Haley today!! An excellent room facilitator from start to finish, maybe the best I've ever had in several years of doing escape rooms! The room itself was super fun and very well designed. We were lucky enough to take the 3rd place spot on the winners wall too 🙌🏻 Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "DreamWeaver" by Breakout's Imagine Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: DreamWeaver is amazing. The Aladdin-esque environment really encapsulates you and provides a tough challenge for even an avid escape

room_title: Escape room "​​​Yin & Yang" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: They have the best rooms! They are well maintained, great balance of hard and easier puzzles and great variety of types of puzzles. I've 2 of their rooms now and looking forward to doing more!

room_title: Escape room "​​​Yin & Yang" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: so fun! first time doing and will definitely do it again!

room_title: Escape room "​​​Yin & Yang" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Camry was a great game master. Very fun Ying Yang room. Great for beginners. Family fun time.

room_title: Escape room "Pandorum. Chapter 4: The Morgue" by Off The Couch Games in San Jose
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Head Trip" by ArtHatch Escape in San Marcos (CA)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Black Jewel" by Daytona Escape Room Experience in Daytona Beach
review: First escape room. The Black Jewel was a blast! Kids loved it too!

room_title: Escape room "The Black Jewel" by Daytona Escape Room Experience in Daytona Beach
review: Our group of nine took on The Black Jewel room and had a great time! Extremely friendly staff added to the awesome experience... even making it extra special for our niece who was celebrating her 13th birthday! Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a fun (and challenging) group activity! Great job, Daytona Escape Room Experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Black Jewel" by Daytona Escape Room Experience in Daytona Beach
review: We visited Daytona Escape Room Experience to celebrate my nephew's 14th birthday. Six of us took on the challenge of The Black Jewel, and we had a marvelous time. From the minute we walked through the door through the end of our experience, Mike and his team did a fabulous job. Can't wait to go back and try some of their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Black Jewel" by Daytona Escape Room Experience in Daytona Beach
review: My husband and I had a great time at Daytona Escape Room! My adrenaline is still pumping from the excitement! We highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "The Black Jewel" by Daytona Escape Room Experience in Daytona Beach
review: What a great place!!! So much fun. Owners were super nice, personable, and helpful!! We can't wait to try the other rooms!!!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Office" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: I took my husband here for a birthday gift and we had a great time we were put together with four other very nice people and we escaped with four and a half minutes to spare I enjoy playing mystery games on computer so to be part of a mystery was very exciting a must do for friends and family staff is very nice and helpful

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Office" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: We checked this place out while on vacation in Tampa. There were 6 people total (4 we didn't know) in our group. What a blast! Our team worked well together. It was so fun figuring out the clues! Highly recommended. We used a Groupon but will go back at full price to check out the new Medieval room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Office" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: If you're looking for something that's unique and lots of fun, you need to come here! An hour goes by fast, so assemble your team accordingly. We escaped with 2 minutes to spare! Can't wait to go back when they open the other room

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Office" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: This was so much fun!!! I highly recommend this place and we can't wait to try the new ones!!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Office" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: I must say this location for escape rooms has been by far the best I've done the office and last night the mid evil room and both experience were A1 can't wait for LONDON I'll be back

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Office" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: What an awesome experience!! This was something so different than I have ever done. It's challenging and really forces you to think and work as a team. The staff was really friendly and very good at their job. I highly recommend doing this at least once. I can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Office" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: Yes, the entrance of the building and the cleanliness of the stairs of the building can be better. We did not care and had a blast. The staff made our experience even better. This was our first time and we loved every second of it. Highly recommend it for a group of friends who enjoy puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "The Game Show" by ClueMasters Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: Had a great experience there with some friends. We did the Game Show escape room and it was really fun.We did well through most of the puzzles but got hung up on the last one. Didn't use hints though and made it out with a little time to spare.The hosts were very kind and the experience was solid. Highly recommend for a fun group activity.

room_title: Escape room "The Game Show" by ClueMasters Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: My friends and I enjoyed ourselves so much in The Game Show room, we came back two hours later for Murder in the Manor! Most fun I've had in a long time!

room_title: Escape room "The Game Show" by ClueMasters Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: The escape room was so much fun. We went for my 30th birthday & had a blast! We ended up having the fastest time which was icing on the cake. The staff was awesome & helpful & made the whole experience even more worth it! Definitely recommend trying your hand at one of their rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Mayan Curse" by Wolff Escapes in Putnam
review: Had so much fun in the Mayan Curse room. Challenging and creative puzzles with plenty of space to move around. Looking forward to going back and trying other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Mayan Curse" by Wolff Escapes in Putnam
review: This was my first escape room experience and it was awesome! The Mayan room was prefaced with an interesting story, the clues were very creatively implemented with some high-tech electronic effects, and the owner is very friendly and welcomes feedback for continuous improvement. I would recommend Wolff Escape Rooms to anyone! Definitely coming back when the new rooms are open!

room_title: Escape room "Mayan Curse" by Wolff Escapes in Putnam
review: We just escaped from the Mayan room. What a cool room! The clues are really creative and definitely make you think. I loved the layout and the flow of the game. Definitely will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Cove Escape" by Solve It Escape Games in Grand Junction
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Escape the Room Atlanta in Atlanta
review: This was such a fun activity to do with friends. We laughed a lot and are still talking about it. We will come back for sure!

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Escape the Room Atlanta in Atlanta
review: This was fun! I so would do it again! You have to really go when your mind is right! Lol... It can be hard and is a mind game for sure!

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Escape the Room Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Had so much fun! Will definitely be returning! I wasn't expecting to have so much fun but it makes for a good group activity and team building exercise. You must bring your A game though because it is not easy at all. Wish there were more places like this in ATL!

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Escape the Room Atlanta in Atlanta
review: We had so much fun! The shouts of joy when we discovered each little piece of the puzzle were amazing. Getting the door open with 1min30sec to spare was even better.

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Escape the Room Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Enjoyed myself! Plan on definitely returning to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Escape the Room Atlanta in Atlanta
review: This was our first time doing an Escape Room. The setup was good overall, but I felt like too many times we had to "start from scratch" by finding some obscurely hidden thing, rather than a linear(ish) sequence of logical or related steps. There are some exceptions, like one or two threads in particular that I am thinking of, but overall I felt like it was more "find random stuff" than intellectually challenging puzzles. Also, one of the devices had major issues (or our randomly partnered people who were using it all had major issues), which complicated things significantly. I have also gone to Mission Escape, and I would definitely go back there first on the strength of their puzzles and the construction/ordering of the challenges, but I would also certainly come back to Escape the Room as well. Solid, very good, but not the best of what we've been to.

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Escape the Room Atlanta in Atlanta
review: We went to Escape The Room as part of a Team Outing and we had so much fun! I think this is a great office team building idea. You get to pick one of three themed rooms to participate in. You are locked in the room for 60 minutes, during which time you have to solve the clues that are strategically placed all over the room. The clues are designed to help you "escape the room". If you don't solve the puzzle after the 60 minutes is over, you can still exit the room :)You don't get a prize if you get out within 60 minutes, but you do get bragging rights :)This is my first time to try this sort of place though, so I have no comparison with other "Escape the Room" places. But it was great nonetheless.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Showdown" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: The owners were very accommodating and extremely nice with helping us get everyone in and taken care of. Even if anyone is nervous about being in a closed room, she will walk you and show you the key and make your worries go away! We did the Wild West and the men did One if by land. If you need reading glasses don't forget them, cause you will need them to read things. All in all the rooms were very well put together and cleverly done!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Showdown" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: Went with my daughters and sister for a fun birthday event. We had a blast. The owners are terrific and did everything to ensure we had a great time. Will definitely go back to try the other two rooms. We did the Wild West. Definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Showdown" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: Hubby got me the Wild West Room as a Christmas gift.  Just left here. Had an amazing time. When went 8 minutes over but we really enjoyed it and can't wait to go back and try the other rooms. Highly recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Lost Cabin" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: My husband and I did the The Lost Cabin together and had a blast! It was a great mind game! Can't wait to come back to Florence and do another room! The people were so helpful and great!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Cabin" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: Our whole group really enjoyed our time at the Escape Room! The atmosphere there is really great, super friendly staff & beautiful building! We escaped from the Lost Cabin and we can't wait to go back and try the other room!!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Cabin" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: Took my daughter and her friends here and we had a blast! We did the cabin and it was very well put together and realistic. Really made us think! Can't wait to go back! Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for something fun to do in the Shoals area!!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Cabin" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: My family and I had a blast this past Friday night. We did the Cabin room! If your looking for something to do with the family that's fun and challenging..this is the place to go! Awesome staff as well!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Cabin" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: This is such a unique and fun place in Florence! We went last night and did the lost cabin room and had a blast figuring out the clues! Bobby and the staff are so friendly and nice and made sure we had the best experience possible!! I can't wait to come back!

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Scientist: Part II" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Longmont
review: Great idea for this escape room. It was extremely challenging but tons of fun regardless. Everyone was super helpful before and throughout our time spent in the room. I would definitely come back here again!

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Scientist: Part II" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Longmont
review: We have gone multiple times and it makes an exciting and enjoyable date night. Took us two times to beat part 2 and the man who works there was rooting for us. I highly recommend this facility. The puzzles are hard but engaging and you will leave feeling very proud of yourself if you do escape.

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Scientist: Part II" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Longmont
review: Went with my colleagues to Missing Scientist Part 11 and escaped in 28 minutes. Super fun team building activity! I was somewhat surprised by how good some of my team members were at some of the puzzles (not that they were good, but who was good at what) and it was awesome for all of us to shine in our own way!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Hour" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: We did the zombie apocalypse room, and were very impressed. The room was well put-together, the clues made you problem solve but WERE solvable with the information in front of you, and TJ was a great host. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Hour" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: Loved this place! Zombie room was cool, but kinda hard, but hey that's the purpose right? Fun place, definitely will be returning.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Hour" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: We had a lot of fun in the zombie apocalypse room! Very challenging, yet very entertaining. Sasha was a great game master. Would definitely recommend to anyone

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks" by Puzzle Effect Boise in Boise
review: Our family loves this place, we have experienced two of their rooms and both times we have had a great time. Staff is wonderful and takes time to walk through the unfinished puzzles. It is a great place for children to explore and try new things because the staff caters to their inquisitive minds.

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks" by Puzzle Effect Boise in Boise
review: We really enjoyed this company! We've completed over 60 escape rooms and have done most of our rooms in Southern California and the set design here definitely stacked up to what we're used to at home! We completed The Path and Grim Stacks Books and Bindings. Out of the two we preferred Grim Stacks because we really enjoyed the puzzles in there a lot more and it had a better overall story. Our two hosts were really nice (sorry I forgot your names!) but they did a great job with their clue system and were kind enough to offer us a same day discount to book a second room which is why we ended up doing Grim Stacks! I would definitely come back to check out there other room just based on set design and our game masters alone. Thanks for hosting us and we will see you next time we're in Boise!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks" by Puzzle Effect Boise in Boise
review: Had a lot of fun! Logan was really friendly and nice! He had great energy and was super helpful. Super entertaining and engaging! Really made you think!

room_title: Escape room "Perfect Crime" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: My family of four - son and daughter, husband, and myself - had a great time in the Perfect Crime room! The puzzles were varied and fun to complete. I wish we were in town longer so we could go back and do the other rooms as well! Big hit with our young teens!

room_title: Escape room "Perfect Crime" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: It was amazing! We did a team-building event here and it was just great. We had the "Perfect Crime" room and it was really challenging, but we made it of the room in time. The puzzles are fun and diverse and the Game Master was very friendly. Surely an experience to repeat.

room_title: Escape room "Perfect Crime" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: Our group did the Perfect Crime room and we had a blast! The theme was very cool and the puzzles were well thought out. The only complaint is how we were given a walkie-talkie to ask questions and hints. We were able to get out, however, we lost time due to the room monitor being busy with another group.Bottom line though, I definitely recommend this place and will try to come back next time I'm in DC.

room_title: Escape room "Perfect Crime" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: Loved it! The Perfect crime was a great team building activity for our group. Definitely will do again!

room_title: Escape room "Perfect Crime" by PanIQ Room in Washington, D.C.
review: My group did the Perfect crime room. I was a little skeptical when we first walked in but the game master (sorry can't remember name) quickly made us feel welcome. This was my seventh room so I already knew what to expect. All my expectations were quickly blown away, the diversity of puzzles was unlike any I've seen before. The story could have been better but because of how great the GM and room were I'm not taking a star away. I highly recommend this to anyone, it was a great time.

room_title: Escape room "The Frightful Feast" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: We just did the Frightful Feast room with a group as a team building activity for our work group. This place did not disappoint! It was adequately ranked with a higher difficulty level and the host, Kevin, did an awesome job in giving us (the allotted amount of) hints and prepping us prior to going in the room. I will definitely be doing this again!

room_title: Escape room "The Frightful Feast" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: We did the Frightful Feast escape - it was challenging, fun and with just the right amount of scary. Kevin made the experience even better!

room_title: Escape room "The Frightful Feast" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Did two rooms - Molly's room and the Feast, and they were great, as well as our game master Kevin. Very hard but fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Frightful Feast" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Coworkers and I participated in the Frightful Feast. We had to escape a poorly lit cell before being "eaten by three monsters." Like you would imagine from any escape room, there were numerous amounts of puzzles, riddles, and locks to solve. Solving everything can be difficult, but if your team needs help, you can use the walky talky provided to ask up to three hints.Overall, Room Escape DC provides exciting plots for their rooms with carefully thought out puzzles and riddles. There is no doubt that you will have a gerat time cooperating with your team to escape the room under-pressure.

room_title: Escape room "Dinner at the Manor" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This is a little gem in the city. This experience was amazing right from the start. Eric was a great host and helped us when we needed it but also encouraged us to keep going! This was a lot of fun can't wait to try another one!

room_title: Escape room "Dinner at the Manor" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This place was INCREDIBLE. The staff was friendly and helpful, the game was so much fun! Our game master, Emma was so great and gave the perfect hints to help us without giving anything away. This was an excellent date to share with my partner and I have no doubt that I will return to share it with my friends!

room_title: Escape room "Dinner at the Manor" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: My mom and I visited over the weekend and I decided to take her to her first escape room. I had only ever been to one but this was pretty fun. It was tough but Kyle, or guide was super helpful. I'm sure it would have been more exciting if we had more people in our group to help out.

room_title: Escape room "Houdini's Magic Cell - Destination Budapest" by ALL IN Adventures Lawrenceville in Atlanta
review: My son and myself decided to have dad/son day at the Mystery Room for Father's day. We chose the Houdini room since no one else had completed it. They made sure that we were aware that it was the hardest room. We did it with 3:47 to spare. It was a great time and bonding experience.

room_title: Escape room "Submersion" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: Both my girls wanted to celebrate their birthdays with an escape room. A friend suggested going to Conundrum and I am so thankful we went! It was amazing! My girls and their friends had a blast! We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Submersion" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: My husband ‘& family took me to Conundrum for my birthday ‘& we had a blast! We ALL HIGHLY recommend this place to everyone. We will MOST DEFINITELY be coming back Often! 😊😊

room_title: Escape room "Submersion" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: Great place to have fun! really cool puzzles!

room_title: Escape room "Chinatown" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Truly a blast! I have only had experience with one escape room before - my office did the whole "team bonding" thing. Anywhoo! This time I got a group of friend together and the room/experience by far exceeded the first. A few points to highlight...The room - the room itself was very well done. The decor and space. Something I didn't love about the first escape room was how small and crowded it felt. We did the "Chinatown" theme and they did a great job giving a restaurant feel.The clues/ puzzle pieces - what really set this place apart was the clues! Again, comparing it to my last experience, there were far less obvious clues which really made us think and work as a team. More importantly the type of puzzle pieces they engineered were phenomenal and extremely creative. Not to give anything away, but you really have to exercise all options with everything in the room touching, aligning, and pushing. Nothing came too easy with this room! Customer service - the girl who assisted us was polite and sweet. Plus, the few times we did have to ask for hints, she gave us the perfect nudge in the right direction. All in all a great experience. I will defiantly be forming a new team and heading back soon!

room_title: Escape room "Chinatown" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Such a great time!  3 of us did the Chinatown Room and it was so much fun! We barely escaped but I think it would have been better if we had a couple more people.  The 3 of us had done a few escape rooms before, but this was by far the most fun. The room was decorated in a way that made you feel like you were really in a restaurant in Chinatown. The owner Greg was also super accommodating as the same afternoon of our reservation we were going to run late. He was really nice and put us in at a later spot, which was still open. He didn't have to do that, so we really appreciate it. Staff was also very nice. The clues were also really helpful when we needed them. Can't wait to come back to do the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Chinatown" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: We escaped Chinatown and had so much fun with the challenge! Thank you Mango for an amazing game!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This room had the perfect flow and was heavy puzzle-based. Soundtrack was awesome and as you progress through the room it just gets better and better. The last part was probably the best thing ever. It starts off with an FBI kind of vibe and turns into a detective like situation and then you walk into a scary movie right after that. The game master Curtis will give you candy!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Had a really fun timeDid the "Jack the Ripper" room and found it to be very historically accurate. The puzzles were hard but solvable. Not crazy scary but quite macabre which was great. Strongly recommended!!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: These rooms are the real deal! Strongly recommended! The Culver City branch let my fiancee and I play their new "Jack the Ripper" room early, and good golly, it was amazing. A wide variety of clever puzzles that are integrated with a full, 3-Act narrative. No puzzles exist "Just because". They are all either literally riddles/challenges Jack left behind or direct metaphors for the investigative process. Not only are the puzzles thematically enthralling, they are entirely challenging and creative. Each of them is very different than the others while also containing different thought processes. Some are riddles that require abstract thought, whereas another puzzle may be a straight-forward scavenger hunt that requires a keen eye, curiosity, and thorough investigation. My fiancee and I work together well but also have very different thought processes. To this end, it felt entirely rewarding to split up and apply this, with my interpreting coded messages and her noticing the clues and items I would have never caught onto. So rewarding!As well, the room's hosts are beyond kind and generous. We were provided a walkie talkie that was intended to be used for a limited amount of clues, as well as emergencies.  I can't say enough nice things about this room. It's the real deal. Rooms like this are textbook examples of why Escape Rooms are big and what a unique experience they can provide.Please go try it as soon as you can!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: We loved it! The guys working there were so nice and informative! The Psych Ward was so creative and fun. We can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: We busted out of the asylum and had so much fun. We had a group of 5 and everyone had something to do at all times. Can't wait to go again and check out more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: I did an escape room here for the first time. We went on a double date in the Psych Ward and it was so fun! The staff is nice and the rooms are great. They were very busy, so if that doesn’t tell you this place is great, I don’t know what will!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: We had a blast going through the Psych Ward! We made it out with just seconds to spare! We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Three: The Morgue" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Wow, these guys did it again! We came back to see the Evil Genius once again but this time we faced his challenges in their new room The Morgue. From the start, I knew this was a gonna be a good time. The room is such a new concept that it was truly a breath of fresh air! I am a big scaredy cat but this room is not supposed to scare you but it does get the adrenaline pumping. Take a chance and try their bonus room, you will be SO GLAD you did. So gooooood:)

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Three: The Morgue" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Came here to do Chapter 3: The Morgue and we were very impressed.I have always heard great things about Evil Genius but never got around to trying them. Well we finally got around to it and are so glad we did. The Morgue Room had great elements of tech and involved puzzles that we had never seen before! The theme of the room was consistent through out and the decor was high quality and visually appealing. We were kept on our toes the whole time and enjoyed all the puzzles. Customer service was great as well and we look forward to coming back and trying their first 2 chapters!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Three: The Morgue" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did Chapter 3 last night and it was AMAZING. Legitimately the BEST escape room I've ever done. The details, the theme, everything. You MUST do the Morgue!

room_title: Escape room "The Law Office" by Time Trap in Tampa
review: We did the Christmas edition of the Law room, it was amazing! The clues were fun & detailed, not too easy but also not too hard. Definitely will be back for another room! Also it was my birthday & we didn’t mention it but they figured we were celebrating something...so they gave us cupcakes! Seriously a great small business to support!!! 🙌🏻🙌🏻🙌🏻

room_title: Escape room "The Law Office" by Time Trap in Tampa
review: We had a BLAST in the Law Office! As first timers we were unsure what to expect but the staff was Super helpful in preparing us on what we may encounter. Thanks Time Trap for a Great night! I would defiantly Recommend this not just for fun but also as a team building exercise.

room_title: Escape room "The Law Office" by Time Trap in Tampa
review: New Escape Room close to home! Family had a great time!! My 14 year old was the best clue finder in the group! The owner was super friendly and helpful. We did the law office. Would definitely like to try out the other rooms and the RV. Fun for the whole family!

room_title: Escape room "Christmas Room" by Escape Port Charlotte in Fort Myers
review: Great place! We did the Christmas room and were very pleasantly surprised at the quality and challange of the room. We had a blast, will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Christmas Room" by Escape Port Charlotte in Fort Myers
review: The Keys to Christmas room was a blast! There were some super unique elements and puzzles in the room with plenty to keep you working but not too much to get overwhelmed with. The owner Kayla is extremely friendly and passionate about Escape Rooms and it shows! Overall a great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Carnival Macabre" by Escape-topia in Miami
review: We did all 3 of their rooms and enjoyed them all! Carnival was our favorite. Kraig was a great game master! Still stumped on the waiting room puzzle though!

room_title: Escape room "Carnival Macabre" by Escape-topia in Miami
review: First time for all of us at Escape-topia and we had such a good time that we came back the next night and did the clown room! The game masters were very friendly and we're looking forward to doing the zombie room next!

room_title: Escape room "Carnival Macabre" by Escape-topia in Miami
review: We were in town for work and decided to hit some escape rooms. We did the Beast on May 11th and ran out of time solving the last clue to the puzzle. Returned on May 12th for redemption in the Carnival Macabre, we made it out in 44 minutes. Even solved the puzzles in the lobby for some extra prizes!! Both games masters were awesome and engaging.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: Had a great time escaping the Heist room, challenging but lots of fun. Looking forward to trying their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: The Western/Bank Heist room was great. A true challenge but well worth it!! The room decor and activities were top notch. A great time and looking forward to attending more 321 Escape Rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: Had a great time in The Heist room. Challenging but fun with friends. Can't wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: We did the Hijacked at Sea and The Heist. I enjoyed both, but The Heist is by far the best escape room I've done, it was challenging, but not impossible. Also, the decor is awesome and all of the details fit with the theme so well, even if you can't escape, you'll have a pretty cool view for an hour!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by 321 Escape Rooms in Melbourne
review: My friends and I had a great time and experience. We did "The Heist" room. The room looked very nice the whole concept of the story was laid out wonderfully. Christine was very helpful in getting us on track when we needed it. We will be back again for "Space".

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate Ship" by Escape Room Extreme in Tampa
review: We went a few weeks ago while on vacation, and it was our first escape room. We did the pirate room and it was so much fun! A great experience and definitely recommend this.

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate Ship" by Escape Room Extreme in Tampa
review: Just had the best time in the Pirate room. We were an hour early and they still completely accommodated us, giving us a private booking. Well thought-out clues and the staff was super helpful!

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate Ship" by Escape Room Extreme in Tampa
review: This was my fifth escape room and I have nothing but good things to say about this place. Very well done, very friendly staff, and definitely recommended. We went with our family to do the Pirate adventure. Got a peek at the Dracula-themed room afterwards and would love to give that one a try next time!

room_title: Escape room "Moriarty's Madness" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: The staff are very friendly and accommodating. We made it out of the Moriarty room, but with very little time to spare. The staff called to provide clues and answered questions to help us along. I highly recommend this fun and creative way to engage with friends and colleagues.

room_title: Escape room "Moriarty's Madness" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Definitely I place to have a good time with a group or friends or family. Don't underestimate your room and think outside the box

room_title: Escape room "Moriarty's Madness" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Tons of fun! We just barely made it out. 18 seconds to spare. Can't wait to go back and do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Moriarty's Madness" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Totally awesome! Very challenging finding clues, but some serious fun! Will definitely try the other story lines they offer.

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: I just did their new "The Experiment" escape room last night with a date, and it was so much fun! Bob was perfectly in character from beginning to end, fun to work with, and clear on instructions.The room itself was interesting and had an amazing storyline and never-before-seen challenges. I highly recommend it for first timers and escape room enthusiasts alike!!

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: I had a great time at The Experiment Room. Not gonna lie I was a bit scared haha but the room was well thought out and we escaped right at the buzzer! I liked how the room had a back story and the owner took his time to walk us through everything. You can see he really has a passion to create escape rooms. Can't wait to try The Virus!

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: Amazing amazing amazing!Loved the escape experience and I loved it 10 times more when Our game master cane inside to explain the whole game and to explain how everything links with the story. MIND BLOWNWe tried The Experiment and we will definitely be back to try The Virus.

room_title: Escape room "A Paper Company in Scranton" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: None

room_title: Escape room "1950's Insane Asylum" by Time Lock Escape Room in Tampa
review: This escape room was so much fun! My family and I did the Asylum and it was challenging but not so much that we weren't able to complete it. The rooms were realistic and the story behind the room was great!

room_title: Escape room "1950's Insane Asylum" by Time Lock Escape Room in Tampa
review: Great time! Ken was amazing. It can be difficult with a group of nine, but we ended up making it out (with clues, for sure). It was evident a lot of work has gone into making these rooms unique, and the ambiance definitely contributed to the theme of the room. We did the Asylum and had a blast. Will definitely be back to try out the others.

room_title: Escape room "1950's Insane Asylum" by Time Lock Escape Room in Tampa
review: Great time! Ken was amazing. It can be difficult with a group of nine, but we ended up making it out (with clues, for sure). It was evident a lot of work has gone into making these rooms unique, and the ambience definitely contributed to the theme of the room. We did the Asylum, and had a blast. room_title: Escape room "1950's Insane Asylum" by Time Lock Escape Room in Tampa
review: It was my first time at a place like this and I had such a great time! Ken was very kind. We did the Asylum room. We are definitely coming back to do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Elevator" by Hellscream Room Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: Went last night for the first time, and I absolutely loved it! We did the elevator, and I've never had so much fun! The people who work there are great, the rooms are amazing, and I'm going to go back as often as I can!

room_title: Escape room "The Elevator" by Hellscream Room Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: This is the best escape room I have ever done! We picked the Elevator and did it with scary mode on where the actors can touch you! It was so amazing! Like seriously it was the very best escape room I have ever done and I have done 14 now!The staff is very accommodating and friendly and they do an excellent job making the whole experience fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Elevator" by Hellscream Room Escapes in Colorado Springs
review: I've heard great things from all of my friends and decided to try out The Elevator at Hellscream. It was awesome, took a lot of thought and observance. We just barely didn't make it through but had a blast anyway! I'll definitely be trying their other escape rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Genie Ransom" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I brought my daughter and three of her friends (all smart 14 year olds - only two of which had done an escape room before) to this location, and we had a great time. The man who helped us was fun and kind, and we were able to escape the Genie room with 4 minutes to spare. Whew! Challenging but not impossible, that room was perfect for the girls. Note: since the girls were under 16, I had to purchase a ticket and be in the room as well. This was actually a good thing because they needed a bit of help here and there. Thanks so much for a great memory!

room_title: Escape room "Genie Ransom" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We wanted to try this room for months after randomly driving by. I, finally, had a chance to take my husband as a surprise for his birthday. The owner was so friendly and understanding when we showed up late! (We called first and he was so nice.) The coded door to get in is very fun. The waiting area is on the roof of the building and was genuinely stunning to walk into. We did the Genie room because it was the easiest room and there was only the two of us. We ended up making the Top 10 wall. He offered us a promo for a second room and ended up doing The Enchanted Forest immediately after. The Enchanted Forest is beautiful/creepy ambience and a total immersion experience. I loved this room so much. Even the scary features that I did not want to go near. We didn't make the Top 10 wall in this room but that's okay. We talked to the owner about creating the rooms and he was so personable. I can only say good things about this experience. We will definitely be back to try the other two rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Genie Ransom" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My Group and I loved it!! had so much fun and great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience! Highly recommend. It was well thought out and provided a different experience than other room escapes. The story was great! Can't wait to do the other room!

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loads of fun! It's a challenging puzzle with live actors. We finished with only a minute to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Last day in LA , me and my film friends decided to be random and do the escape room. We underestimated the experience and it turned out to be great. The actor was great and the escape room was definitely challenging. We achieved it with 2 seconds left. Will definitely do this again. We did APT 205

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Nice birthday adventure! The staff was amazing!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had a lot of fun with both their rooms, some clever clues and fantastic puzzles they got.

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Celebrated my birthday by doing the Secret Temple room. Amazing. Very fun. Without any spoilers, I can say they made my birthday very special. Can't wait to come back for the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So far I have done 6 Escape Rooms, and Enigma provided the best options BY FAR! Can't wait to go back for their third room! A great way to spend time with friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "Survive the Joker’s Trap" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: I did my first escape room here and had a blast. The staff was friendly and the puzzle appropriately challenging. We escaped the Joker room with 20 seconds to spare. I would go back again and recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Survive the Joker’s Trap" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: Birthday party for my 14-year-old they had a great time and escaped the joker!

room_title: Escape room "Survive the Joker’s Trap" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
