room_title: Escape room "The Hex Room" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: LOVED this escape room!!When I first received the invite to come along, I thought okay, what is going to set this one apart from the rest? I've been to my share of escape rooms, some were great, others needed to mature a little more, but after you've done so many, you want to find a uniqueness about the next one.I read the concept of everyone starting off separated into different rooms, that really caught my eye. The idea of everyone being a different character based on a quirky personality test was also nice. I had my eye set on being the detective (which I was able to be ). I watched as my friends became elected into the other positions - the jock, the rebel, the nerd, the virgin and the prom queen.To conquer this escape room, you really need the right dynamic. Everyone has their own puzzles to conquer, but at the same time, one may have something for someone in another room. I don't want to spoil much, but I will speak from being the detective. If you find yourself in this spot, I hope you don't get overwhelmed easy. You are the glue that bonds everyone and it is your responsibility to make sure everyone is okay and gets what they need.I highly recommend this room and will be speaking nothing but good things about it to anyone interested. What a great team at Crossroads, I can't wait to see what rooms you all come up with next.

room_title: Escape room "The Hex Room" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I haven't had this much fun in a long time.

room_title: Escape room "The Hex Room" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Had the most amazing time!There is no slacking and letting your friends lead in this game. Everyone must do their own part of the puzzle before you can come together as a group.Room is detailed and immersive. Characterization is unique and adds a fun element.Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Hex Room" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: It was my 24th escape room overall and we set a record with their Hex room! It was one of the most unique experiences from most escape rooms I've played that wasn't as scary as I thought it would be (so don't fret, if you hate haunted houses, it's nothing like that).I'll definitely want to come back for their funhouse room coming in March! If you win, you're in for a special treat! The owners know what they are doing with look, feel, immersion, puzzles, and your overall experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Hex Room" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: So amazing! My friends and I couldn't stop talking about it after we left. We were SO CLOSE to escaping and now all we want to do is go back and try it again!It's beautifully designed and with the dramatic lighting and eerie sounds, it seriously felt like we were in a horror movie.It was everyone's first experience in an escape room and we were all nervous about what we were getting into, but the owners we so kind and helpful that they were more than willing to make sure we were all going to have a fun time!I just recommend to book in advance because those time slots fill up fast!

room_title: Escape room "The Witching Hour" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
review: My favorite room in Tucson! The staff here is attentive and friendly, the Witching Hour has a spooky vibe and bewitching puzzles. I loved the secret reveal!

room_title: Escape room "Potion Master's Apprentice" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dead Presidents 2" by Gone In 60 Minutes in Longmont
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Startup" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Longmont
review: Highly recommend this place; we escaped The Startup with 3:30 minutes left on the clock (with only four of us in the room). This was my 18th escape room and I can guarantee I'll be back for more.

room_title: Escape room "The Startup" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Longmont
review: I had my doubts about escape rooms and my first experience at Enigma really changed my perspective of what escape rooms are all about. We did "The Startup" challenge and had a really great time. It was really well put together and I am still amazed at the level of detail and thought that went into creating the experience. I HIGHLY recommend doing one of the enigma escape rooms. You won't be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "The Startup" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Longmont
review: I went to Enigma with my team from work. We were in the startup room. It was very challenging but a lot of fun. I think we divided up tasks pretty well. We managed to finish only 5 minutes before the hour time limit but a least we finished.

room_title: Escape room "X-Child" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: We've done a lot of escape rooms around the valley, but Dare to Escape's rooms are by far the best! Cult of Mithras and X-Child (which we broke the records on!) utilized the most creative puzzles, riddles, and devices that our group has encountered in AZ. Some of the secrets in the rooms actually left us with a sense of awe and wonder! I'd say the rooms strike the perfect balance between making you think outside the box and communicate with your team while avoiding frustrating, ridiculously-hard and obscure problems that are impossible to solve. Loved the themes of the rooms as well and can't wait to return for The Cell! These are the best escape rooms in AZ that we've encountered and I would definitely recommend them to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "X-Child" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: If you've never done an escape room, do it! This was my first one. We had such a great time we came back later that night. And then booked the third room two days later. Recommend starting with Mithras and then X Child. Haven't done the cell yet. That's tomorrow!! Nice to talk to one of the owners -- local boys and their own ideas. Love that!! Great customer service and fantastic experience.

room_title: Escape room "X-Child" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: My friends and I have done many escape rooms around the valley and the x-child room is definitely one of my favorites! It was so much fun! Definitely requires a lot of communication between group members which is part of the reason I liked it so much. We'll definitely be coming back to check out the other room(s).

room_title: Escape room "Cinema" by Lakeland Escape Room in Lakeland
review: We had four rooms filled with people and my group is the only one that escaped. The staff was very nice and treated our group of 25 very professionally. We escaped the cinema room with 18 minutes and one clue left to go. Sat outside and kept waiting on the others groups to escape. This was a fun adventure to do in Lakeland.

room_title: Escape room "Cinema" by Lakeland Escape Room in Lakeland
review: This was my first time visiting. My friends and I did the Cinema escape room. Although we didn't escape, we had a blast trying. The staff was extremely nice. I'll definitely be returning.

room_title: Escape room "Cinema" by Lakeland Escape Room in Lakeland
review: We did the Cinema room as a group of 5. What a wonderful time! The attention to detail was amazing! The staff are all well trained and very helpful. This family-owned business treats their customers with much appreciation. They developed their own rooms, clues and storylines so you will not find these rooms anywhere else! Great job Lakeland Escape Room!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: Loved this room! Initially, being separated from my boyfriend freaked me out. But we were able to quickly jump into the clues and start working on the puzzles! This was our 2nd escape room and we Escaped with seconds.

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: Took my husband and our friends for a birthday celebration, had a great time, super fun! We did the Jail Break room and escaped. Will definitely plan to go back to try the other room.

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: We went as a group of four and did the jail room. Two of us had never done an escape room before, but we made it out! Granted, we needed a few hints, but we had a blast trying to figure everything out! Sometimes we had to step back and try another strategy to solve a puzzle, but that's what makes it fun! I would highly recommend the jail room, and I can't wait to try the apartment!

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: I love these escape room games! The Phoenix escape room was super fun. Unlike others I have been to this one is hard but still so much fun. We did the Pipe Works room and loved it. I look forward to trying their other ones!

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: I've done their Knight and Rook and Pipeworks, escaped both and now I'm an addict. :) The rooms are a lot of fun, the clues are pretty clever and well executed. Awesome place to go do something fun with your date or friends. Can't wait for the new room to open!

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: The Phoenix Escape Room has been remodeled and games improved significantly over the past 6 months. The first thing we noticed was how clean the facility is (it even smells good). We played the Pipes game and it was both challenging and a lot of fun. It's now one of the best escape rooms in the valley and highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: Went with a group and it was so much fun. Very challenging and well done. We did the Pipeworks Room. I highly recommend and will definitely go back and try another room.As a side note, if you are over 40 make sure you bring your reading glasses. There are a lot of tiny numbers on combination locks. I forgot mine but luckily I had some younger people in my group who could see!

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: I took 3 teenage girls and my 11-year-old daughter. We had a blast! I can't wait to do this with a group of adults. It was really challenging and exciting as we figured out clues. We can't wait to go again. The room was so authentic looking! Pipe works was def worth the hour...which flew by.

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Extraordinary Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: We were advised The Jewel Heist would be a challenge for just the 3 of us. All of us had experience in escape games so we decided to go for it. We escaped with 2 minutes to spare!! The room was definitely a challenge but the clues were presented in a logical way so that we never felt hopeless. Awesome room!

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Extraordinary Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: Our group of four did the "Jewel Heist" escape room last evening. It was amazing to see how we needed each other to work through the puzzles! The owner has created such a neat experience for anyone who walks through the door! If you are "puzzled" about the concept, just give it a try!!! 😁

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Extraordinary Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: We were advised The Jewel Heist would be a challenge for just the 3 of us. All of us had experience in escape games so we decided to go for it. We escaped with 2 minutes to spare! The room was definitely a challenge but the clues were presented in a logical way so that we never felt hopeless. Awesome room!

room_title: Escape room "Booty Battle" by Brain Busters Escape Rooms in Daleville
review: We had three adults and four kids, ages 7, 9, 10, 11. We participated in The Grove and it was fun even with the kids. The prices were reasonable and it was a great time with child rainy weather! While the wwe decided to participate in the Booty Battle and it was soooo much fun! We split up kids verse adults and it was a great time!!Highly recommend if you are looking for something to do!!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci’s Office" by Escape Room Yuma in Yuma
review: Great room and well-done puzzles. Very friendly and accommodating staff. My Mom uses a cane and they brought a bench in for her to sit down. The room's hardest physical demand was to bend down/crouch down to open a combo lock. The Da Vinci room was very well themed.

room_title: Escape room "Treasury Take Down" by Coral Springs Escape Rooms in Miami
review: We had an awesome time, both groups loved the Treasury Takedown, it was challenging and exciting. Highly recommended to all!!!

room_title: Escape room "Treasury Take Down" by Coral Springs Escape Rooms in Miami
review: Great experience! We had a large group and were able to all be together in one room which was very hard to find with other escape rooms. We had so much fun and it really made us think. We did "the Vault" and would definitely recommend this for a team-building!

room_title: Escape room "Treasury Take Down" by Coral Springs Escape Rooms in Miami
review: The Vault was a great challenge! Definitely worth the money.

room_title: Escape room "Project Delta" by Cubic Escape Room in San Jose
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Rogue Agent" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: It was a lot of fun!!! There were definitely some challenges and some fun surprises! Our clue master was great! We will absolutely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Rogue Agent" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: We had an awesome time even though we also should have started with an easier room for our first time. We had eight people and in our case we probably would have done better with 6.

room_title: Escape room "Rogue Agent" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: The staff are really friendly and our Clue Master Amber was helpful with hints and feedback. Rogue Agent was incredibly challenging but really fun. This was a fun date! If we lived here, we'd be back to check out the other rooms. Super fun time!

room_title: Escape room "Motive for Malice" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: I played this with 7 of my friends and it was AMAZING! We all loved it and were surprised to find out who the murderer was. I will definitely be going back again with a new group to experience that fun again!

room_title: Escape room "Al Capone’s Speakeasy 1929" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Our bartender, Alex, in the 1920 speakeasy escape room, did a phenomenal job of making it so much more immersive! He was wonderful!!

room_title: Escape room "Al Capone’s Speakeasy 1929" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: An all around a great time. We did Al Capone's Speakeasy. The addition of an outside character (the bartender) we needed to haggle and negotiate with really differentiated this escape room from others we've done. I would highly recommend anyone looking for a personal and challenging game.

room_title: Escape room "Al Capone’s Speakeasy 1929" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Had a great time at the Al Capone Speakeasy today! Definitely a worthwhile and fun outing for a group. The room was really decorated well and you felt like you were back in a 1929 speakeasy.

room_title: Escape room "Al Capone’s Speakeasy 1929" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Great customer service; our group of 8 was incredibly impressed by how flexible the owner and staff were. We went through the Al Capone room, which was unlike any other escape room I've been to. All of us had an awesome time, and we'll definitely be back this summer to try the other two rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Al Capone’s Speakeasy 1929" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: The Speakeasy was 1 of the best escape rooms I've ever done. I have done over 30 at this point and the in-character person "James" was incredible. Had so much fun.

room_title: Escape room "Al Capone’s Speakeasy 1929" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: My office did the Al Capone room tonight and had a great time. It's a little awkward at first but once you understand the system of finding/hearing clues and figuring out what to do next, it's a blast! The actor/"bartender" was fantastic and really made the experience. Will definitely be back for other themes!

room_title: Escape room "The Bayou: Legend of the Midnight Raven" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: My group of four did both Fogmore Manor and the bayou rooms. These rooms are done really well! We've done a bunch of escape rooms in San Diego and this one is definitely in our top 3 favorite places.  The tech in these rooms are really awesome! They are very challenging which we like but doable. We got trapped in both rooms but we're about a minute away from solving them so the owner let's us finish. The owner is really passionate about his rooms which is really cool. He designed and programmed everything himself which is very impressive. I wouldn't attempt this room with any less than 4 people because it is challenging. Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to do an escape room.

room_title: Escape room "The Bayou: Legend of the Midnight Raven" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: We read somewhere that the Entrapment (Bayou Room) was a Top 5 Escape Room in San Diego so we decided to give it a try. We usually have 5 in our group but were missing our 5th this night. We were a tad skeptical upon arrival as their location shares a main entrance way with a car sales & sketchy massage parlor. It also had a strong smell of pets or the bad smell of a public bathroom. Then their guest waiting room was nothing to brag about when compared to the 20+ other escape rooms we've visited...That's where the negative observations stop. Upon entering The Bayou room, it was well designed/decorated, very interactive, and had a lot of variety involved to keep you interested the entire time! It wasn't a typical escape room where you have to open 20 locks to complete the game. Our game master had to inform us we were doing the right thing but gave hints if say something we're doing wasn't lining up quite right to obtain the desired result but this didn't detract from the overall experience. Teamwork is definitely needed as there's lots to do in there! In the end, it turned out to be a very fun yet challenging experience. Give The Bayou room a try if you want something a little different than you're accustomed to! You won't be disappointed.

room_title: Escape room "The Bayou: Legend of the Midnight Raven" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: I did this room when I was on a trip to San Diego last year.It's the best escape room I've ever done. We did the 90 minute Bayou room, and it was AWESOME! I loved how items could be reused and the puzzles were not like not typical and formulaic. You definitely had to think outside the box.

room_title: Escape room "Pele’s Stone Room" by Submerged Maui in Maui
review: We have done a lot of escape rooms and this was a ton of fun. A lot of interesting effects and many things to keep multiple people busy.

room_title: Escape room "Pele’s Stone Room" by Submerged Maui in Maui
review: My family and I have been to various escape rooms in many different states in the U.S. (at least 10), including one in Wailuku on Maui. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS "ESCAPE ROOM."   The best escape for you is to escape the temptation to spend any time or money at this location.  The price of $50 pp is you paying for their rent at the Wailea Beach Resort.  Go to Ramen Shop escape room at Mystery Maui.  The Submerged Maui room had some potential and some cool elements but it is clear that they don't know how to properly organize, run and facilitate a successful escape room. Overall, they had a unique concept (i.e. submarine, laser beams, etc.), but unfortunately their clues were shouted through the walls or delivered in person, which we found was extremely unprofessional. Also, the rooms were very dark, not to mention the countdown clock was only present in the briefing room. Sorry to write such a bad review but I wouldn't suggest choosing this particular escape room (especially at that cost).

room_title: Escape room "Pele’s Stone Room" by Submerged Maui in Maui
review: Three-room escape room with superb special effects. Our family enjoyed it.

room_title: Escape room "Find Casey Peace" by Escape Strategy in Tampa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape Earth" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Had a blast, really enjoyed it! It wasn't too hard and I wasn't bored during it. I recommend it for team building, enjoying a birthday, or just killing some time or a boring day!

room_title: Escape room "Galaxy Quest" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We've done a lot of 60out rooms and let me tell you, this place is something SPECIAL. Galaxy Quest: more challenging than Krampus. LOVED Cosmo, who gave me as much sass as I gave him. And the little friendly alien, who distracted us for longer than we probably should have been- but he was just so cute! If you like more tech-heavy effects do this one. I recommend at least 3 people if you're just casual escape room fans.

room_title: Escape room "Galaxy Quest" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We loved playing Galaxy Quest!!! My 10 year old daughter and I enjoyed the high immersion, the sense of humor, and the sci-fi nature of the room. The puzzles were quirky and fun. I found myself repeating some of the directions because they were useful. It was also important to listen to directions given. We enjoyed ourselves immensely and found we had a lot to do and were fully engaged in either saving the world or destroying it. We did have a couple of tech issues, which honestly, happens in escape rooms in Los Angeles. I've come to expect them, but they didn't take away the joy we had in playing this room. (The only place where we've played escape rooms that have a lot of high tech and did not have any tech issues was in Israel, but the puzzles were not that interesting in the rooms we've played there.) We both enjoyed the puzzles at Galaxy Quest because of the mix and uniqueness.I would highly recommend this room to families of tweens, couples who want to laugh and work together and get to know each other better, and groups of friends looking for a fun, challenging time.There is a parking lot in the back and clean restrooms. The GM and owner, Brian was stellar.

room_title: Escape room "Galaxy Quest" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I love the 60out Escape Rooms! I've been to the Marina Del Rey location a few times and was very impressed. This was my first time at this location, and it did not disappoint either.First off parking is very easy. There's a huge free attached parking lot. They have a few different rooms of varying difficulty. We chose the Galaxy Quest room which is by far the hardest room I've ever done. It is very different from many of the other rooms that I've done. 60out is great, and I can't wait to do some of their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Wood Shed" by Mind Bender Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: The Wood Shed was such a blast! We didn't escape, but came super close! It was a great Girl's Night Out.

room_title: Escape room "The Wood Shed" by Mind Bender Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: Incredibly engaging rooms, friendly staff, and just an awesome experience. My wife and I have done Woodshed and Jack the Ripper and escaped from both. We're excited for the new rooms so we'll be checking those out as well! Keep up the great work!

room_title: Escape room "The Wood Shed" by Mind Bender Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: I was invited to experience this with coworkers for a team building experience and I absolutely loved it. We did the Wood Shed room and it was both thrilling and quite difficult. We ended up finishing with 4 mins to spare. We are already making plans to go back and do another room.

room_title: Escape room "Party Hard" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: My first time at the Quest room, had an amazing time. Very clean facility. Totally recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Party Hard" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: I loved the storylines, the decorations and the way how puzzles were created! Very great job! We had a lot of fun and definitely coming back!

room_title: Escape room "Party Hard" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Quest Room always has great customer service.  We have done two rooms at this location and look forward to doing the third.

room_title: Escape room "Doomsday" by Escape 101 in Danbury
review: Best experience ever! We did the Doomsday room tonight and it was definitely worth the money and very well organized. Our team worked so well together and escaped with just a second left! We will definitely tell everyone we know to try it out at least once. Best birthday ever thanks to Escape 101.

room_title: Escape room "Doomsday" by Escape 101 in Danbury
review: This was our second time at Escape 101. Everyone there made us feel welcome and guided us nicely through the experience. The two different rooms we did (Jet Set and Doomsday) were very different from each other in theme, types of puzzles offered, and difficulty. It's really an exciting experience for all ages and a wonderful opportunity to do something out of the ordinary with friends. I would highly recommend going here, whether you're a beginner or an experienced player. You'll have an exhilarating time!

room_title: Escape room "Doomsday" by Escape 101 in Danbury
review: Had a fantastic time with my kids tonight escaping the Doomsday room. The staff couldn't be nicer! The room was full of detail and the clues were not easy, which provided a very entertaining hour. We will definitely be back for more rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure Hunt" by Mission Escapes in Denver
review: We had an amazing time! My husband and I have done a handful of escape rooms and loved how immersive and clue-/puzzle-based the Treasure Hunt room was. We're looking forward to going back and doing the lunar room soon. Thank you for such an exciting 60 minutes (57 to be exact ;) )

room_title: Escape room "Treasure Hunt" by Mission Escapes in Denver
review: This was our families first experience at an escape room. There were four of us ranging from age 20 to 49. We went on Christmas eve and had an amazing time solving the Treasure room. Our excitement grew with each puzzle we solved. It was so much fun! We enjoyed working as a family and each of us had skills that helped solve puzzles with only one hint and 13 minutes to spare! We can't wait to go back and try the Lunar Escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure Hunt" by Mission Escapes in Denver
review: Easy to book, easy to find. Lots of fun in the escape room "treasure hunt" and we couldn't have had a better time!!!

room_title: Escape room "Coma" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: The escape room was very well put together with a good theme. We had a great time solving all the clues. Though it took us a little longer then an hour to solve they allowed us to stay and finish without kicking us out of the room. Definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Coma" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Had a great time with my 3 daughters tonight!! The staff was helpful but not to much where they give away the rides. It challenged our intellect and pushed our minds to really think about the clues! Had a blast we shall enjoy back again. Thank you!!

room_title: Escape room "Coma" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: First time doing the escape room thing.  6 girls celebrating a birthday.  We had a blast! Will definitely come back  -  thanks JC!

room_title: Escape room "The Royal Jackpot" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: My family and I had such a fun time at Escape Room Salinas! Awesome customer service, and a place you can go multiple times!! Can’t wait to try another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Royal Jackpot" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: SO much fun. I visited a friend in Salinas for a weekend and she took me here. I would totally recommend it - unique entertainment and really fun for a group. The staff there really knows the rooms which makes it a great experience for the guests. We ALMOST made it out. Cant wait to go back for a rematch! Thanks again for a great experience Escape Room Salinas!

room_title: Escape room "The Royal Jackpot" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Super fun times! We needed the clues, and they were soooo obvious that we felt kinda lame afterward! The only critique? Give a 'clue' to the clue, not just the out-and-out answer. Even so, it was a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Ralph Breaks VR" by The Void Orlando in Orlando
review: The void was such an awesome and unique experience, got the chance to try both Starwars  and wreck it ralph. By far the coolest virtual reality experience i ever have done. Didnt feel cheesy and weird like most, it  felt very real , made me excited for things to come in the future. Id most most defiantly recommend wreck it Ralph tho it felt flawless and so clean with the VR id easily give it 5 Stars as for Starwars id give maybe 3 and a half it felt much shorter with some  left to be desired, plus much more glitchy . Was worth it tho

room_title: Escape room "Ralph Breaks VR" by The Void Orlando in Orlando
review: We decided to give VR a try since my kids are thrill seekers and hey, we're on Spring Break! Why not? Go big or go home! Located in Disney Springs across from Earl of Sandwich adjacent to World of Disney store. Reservations are recommended as there are only a number of spots. They do take walk ins but we chose to book online for Wreck It Ralph at 5:15pm on a Friday. We heard Ralph was better than StarWars so we went with it. Check in was easy, staff awesome. It isn't cheap at $29.95. a pop but it is what it is. Once we checked in we saw a tutorial and suited up! All four of us ready to rock. Oh and we picked our avatars. We were all together playing but we had individual scores so we weren't working together per say as a team. It is a trip! So much fun, wish it was longer! We all got a great photo afterwards and even got a short video clip emailed to us. Photo was $15 plus tax and a copy sent to email. Overall the experience was great and the kids had an absolute blast! Must be 10+. We got to keep our avatar card as well as a keepsake. Will definitely do again!

room_title: Escape room "Ralph Breaks VR" by The Void Orlando in Orlando
review: Me and my husband did the Ralph breaks Internet experience and wow, it was awesome!! What a wonderfully original concept! Employees were friendly and efficient & I would totally go back! My one issue is the cost: $35 for what ends up being 15 minutes of game play is steep. I also didn't appreciate being charged nearly $3 "per ticket processing fee" when I paid in store at the cash register. I hate these sneaky ads-on fees, it seems really dishonest not to just raise the price of the ticket so people know exactly how much it's going to cost.

room_title: Escape room "The Rabbit Hole: Welcome to 221B!" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: We played the escape rooms this weekend, Ante Up! It was amazing and great team building. So if your looking for a great time and something to do this is the place to go. Next time we will try the Central Intelligence and the Asylum.

room_title: Escape room "The Rabbit Hole: Welcome to 221B!" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: Went for a date night with our adult kids and we had a terrific time! We started with Ante Up and 'escaped' in 45 minutes. We are all hooked and will definitely be back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Rabbit Hole: Welcome to 221B!" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: For our group, 3 out of 4, this was the 1st time trying an escape room and for the 4th, only the 2nd time and we definitely will do it again! Just Elfing Around was a hoot and we managed to solve! It was fun, exciting and makes your brain work! Can't wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Rabbit Hole: Welcome to 221B!" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: I had such a blast tonight! The room was full of lots of fun tricks! It really made me think hard and focus on all the details in the room. I enjoyed every minute of it, literally! I Will definitely be visiting again and will try my best to beat the room next time! Can't wait to see the rest of the rooms and try them out!

review: This was fun. We picked kids against the adults in the Titanic Room and neither team made it out. Lots of fun finding keys, unlocking the clues and solving the riddles. The staff was great. Great for team building or family fun.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic Room" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Never did an escape room before. We did the titanic room. It was an absolute blast. Will definitely go again. Caitlyn was our moderator she was fantastic.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic Room" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Our bachelorette group had an amazing time today in the Titanic Room! It was unlike anything we've ever done before. As a party of 3, we were expecting to be paired up with another group, but were pleasantly surprised to have a room all to ourselves. Our game master was great and explained everything well starting off. I thought it was really helpful being able to get hints from him, though we never took advantage of that. The clues/puzzles were challenging but not impossible, though I will say the very last one was pretty tough! The room was superbly decorated, the sound and light effects really added to the overall atmosphere and it was one of the highlights of our day. We ended up freeing ourselves, take that 28% success rate! Can't wait to come back again!

review: We had a group of five women a.k.a. The Pussy Cat Dolls that went to escape the room in Palm Springs. Three were rookies, so they had no idea what to expect. Two of us had done this before. room_title: Escape room "Amityville" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Amityville and Cartel - Silverlake locationOur first escape room experience in LA, and it was so much fun.  The difficulty level was perfect.  We started with Amityville, and although we needed a few clues along the way from Andrew (our GM), he was very careful not to make it too easy.  We had such a good time escaping Amityville, we stayed to escape the Cartel.  Location was easy to find.  Parking lot holds 4-5 cars/plenty of street parking.  No lockers, so anything you bring along comes with you into the rooms.  Nice clean bathrooms.  Filtered water in the lobby.  Both rooms are great for your first escape room experience or your first escape room as a team.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando

review: Such an incredible experience for everybody. Maybe not for little kids. But a great place to go with your family or friends to really build your relationship with them. room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: It was the most amazing experience we recommend it we did the prision beak we were 4 it's hectic and you have to think but it was worth it so much fun. We escape wooohhoooo

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: Well what a brilliant evening! This was my first experience and I'm hooked! We escaped the prison and then went on and escaped heist too! All staff were helpful, polite and enthusiastic. I would highly recommend to everyone who's thinking of doing it! Great value too!!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Orlando in Orlando
review: The Escape Game Orlando is the fourth escape-room company I've visited, and after my first experience there yesterday, it's absolutely vying for the top position. We had an amazing time doing the Prison Break room. It's hard to write a review of such a place, because it's absolutely vital that it remain spoiler-free, so that everyone has a chance to have such a great experience. I can tell you that there were several features of the room that were completely unique, not found in any of the other escape rooms I've visited so far. Each of these was a complete surprise, and added immeasurably to the overall experience. We had a team of 5, and it was one of the few rooms I've played that I think we really needed a good sized group. Usually my girlfriend and I do these rooms just the two of us, but this time, I don't think we could have solved it without at least 2 other teammates. The clues and devices were well hidden throughout the game, and the mechanisms for obtaining some of them were simultaneously logical and innovative. There was, quite literally, a surprise around every corner, and every victory led to more and more puzzles to solve, right up to the very end. We had an absolutely fantastic time, and I can't wait to go back and experience the other rooms at The Escape Game Orlando.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Secret" by Escape Port Charlotte in Fort Myers
review: We had a great time visiting Port Charlotte and Escape Port Charlotte. We conquered all of the rooms but needed some help with Sherlock Holmes. The owner and her staff were awesome. They helped us when we needed it and let us figure out the riddles on our own when we showed signs of progress. I would recommend this room to anyone new to the game or those who have done other rooms. They have a perfect amount of puzzles for each room. Thanks for a great time!!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Secret" by Escape Port Charlotte in Fort Myers
review: We had a blast trying to figure our way out of the “Sherlock’s Secret” room!! The staff is so friendly. Great time:)

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Secret" by Escape Port Charlotte in Fort Myers
review: What a fun outing for a 3-generation group — 2 teens, a middle-aged parent and a grandparent. We didn’t solve sherlock’s Riddle but had a great time trying. We are already planning our strategy for our next attempt!

review: We had a team building activity here and it was great! The room I was in was Hansel and Gretel and it is very difficult. We got out with 8 seconds to spare! I will definitely go again. Thank you!

Interesting mix of sheer physical activity and brainpower. We escaped with very little time to spare and had an awesome time!

review: These rooms are fantastic. They are well thought out, challenging, and rewarding. Captain Lockjaw, Madame Lumina, and the Pearled Pachyderm are really great for first timers or experienced puzzle room fans. The Beta Lab room is simply challenging - no antics, no frills, just boxes, locks, and puzzles so I don't recommend it for people looking for the more engaging/ theatrical experience. All in all, we were thrilled with all of these rooms and would gladly revisit if and when a new room is created.

room_title: Escape room "Dreamscape" by ArtHatch Escape in San Marcos (CA)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Pet Snatched" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: We did the Pet Snatched game for our 10 year old's birthday and it was great! The story was fun, puzzles were challenging, and our gamemaster was very helpful and friendly. It was a super fun activity!!

room_title: Escape room "Pet Snatched" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: Had a wonderful experience at this escape room company. The game master was very welcoming and was also very helpful. We played pet snatched and we had such a wonderful time. Can't wait to go back for the other rooms that they have. Thanks for a fun and amazing experience. See you soon!

room_title: Escape room "Pet Snatched" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: I took group of kids 10-13 and we did the pet game.  We had a blast.  All the kids want to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Zeta Eta Zeta: The Cursed Bridal Veil" by Encryption Escape in Savannah
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Vikings" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: they have great escape rooms. highly recommend them if you are looking for escape rooms to do. they have great ownership, great game Masters and have plenty of rooms. if you are in Jupiter Florida or don't mind going for drive, they are totally worth it. I can't say enough good things about them.

room_title: Escape room "Vikings" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: We had a great time! Customer service is exceptional. The room was well done and creative. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Vikings" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: The owners of this place are very friendly and bring a great place for teens/friends/families to hang out for a fun hour. I like how they have a green room to take a picture of your group after you have played that will go along with your games theme. This is one of the better escape rooms I have been to.

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Alcatraz" by ALL IN Adventures in Tuscaloosa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: The facility was so meticulously maintained. So much fun for my daughter, grandson and I to use clues to solve a mystery. The employees were cordial and enthusiastic. If all other The Mystery Game facilities are as impressive I will look forward my next fun experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: We had an amazing time!!! I highly recommend with family or friends! We were there with our family and my daughter’s boyfriend. They went above and beyond when I wrote them and email and told them it was my daughter’s 16th birthday! It was challenging but not frustrating as our guide helped us when we got pretty “close” on a few things! The best part is.... YOU PUT YOUR PHONES DOWN! It was nice to have that uninterrupted time with my family on my daughter’s birthday. We can’t wait to go back and my 12 year old son now wants to do this for his birthday! Thank you Escape Room!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Played with my wife and two sons. Most fun we have had together in some time. I will recommend to anyone looking for a different kind of experience. Great staff. Very helpful. Facilities were top notch. Thank you for a great time.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Had a GREAT family time! The staff was very helpful and made it allot of fun! You have to work together to figure out the many clues presented and to solve the various challenges presented.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Went through the Heist room. The room itself was good, with an impressive design. The puzzles varied with some being interesting, some kind of easy and one in particular being a lot of trial and error. The game master, Gabe, was very helpful, though the store uses screens to communicate which I wasn't a huge fan of. Overall not bad.

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loads of fun! I personally felt that there should have been a bit more theatrics with the introductions.

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This place is awesome! Came with a few friends and we had a blast. Totally worth the money for the experience you're getting

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Definitely a place to go! Must have experience! Great way to spend quality and memorable times with your friends! Love this place! Can't wait to come back ~

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had a wonderful time here! It's great to have something different to do and each member of our family truly helped "get us out"! Great for families and friends!!!

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Although the parking was a bit strange and finding the place a bit difficult, this was the most fun thing I've ever done. Challenging but fun and will definitely be going back to do other mazes.

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: After much anticipation, the actual experience completely exceeded our expectations. Tons of fun, lovely staff, would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The idea of coming here at first was exciting, but the actual experience is much greater than what you could anticipate. The staff was really friendly and interactive with us, not only were they nice, but they are quick in resetting the rooms so that others may enjoy the thrill of escaping as well. This combination allowed for my group to decide that we will be trying to solve all other that are available and further encourage anyone to come and try your luck in defeating these puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Captain Steelhook's Treasure" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: Great fun! We were with 5 other people we didn't know and it worked out well. Beware though - the Captain's room is not easy!

room_title: Escape room "Captain Steelhook's Treasure" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: We did the pirate room and it was great! One of the harder ones we've done, it was designed well, interesting, and required very different solutions for different puzzles, not just the same kind of thing multiple times in the room.

room_title: Escape room "Captain Steelhook's Treasure" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: The Pirate room was very challenging. We had 4 in our group and it was cool to see the family working as a team. We had so much fun we booked the Hollywood room the next day! Highly recommended for those who like to figure out puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Captain Steelhook's Treasure" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: We did the pirate themed room and it was awesome! We got paired up with three strangers who were all about solving it and together, we conquered (with the help of an extra few minutes). The mystery was great yet challenging. I definitely recommend trying it out!

room_title: Escape room "Captain Steelhook's Treasure" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: We did the captain steelhook room. It was moderately challenging-the puzzles were more involved than just finding combinations, we actually had to solve different kinds of puzzles that were very different and it took multiple people helping out for some of them. It was a fun room and the owner was very nice!

room_title: Escape room "Room Amnesia" by QQuest Escape Games in Miami
review: Had an awesome birthday experience here with my friends! Very helpful and accomodating with planning for a big group. Tons of fun and we all agree we want to come back for the second room experience. Team work and logic help you big time in this place!

room_title: Escape room "Room Amnesia" by QQuest Escape Games in Miami
review: SO much fun!!!! Did this with complete strangers and had a blast. Def will be coming to try the next room!!

room_title: Escape room "Room Amnesia" by QQuest Escape Games in Miami
review: Super fun and makes you really use your noggin! Great idea and the host Bianka was amazing! Thank you for the wonderful time!

room_title: Escape room "Room Amnesia" by QQuest Escape Games in Miami
review: I cannot believe how challenging and fun this experience was I love this so much that I just might have to come back

room_title: Escape room "Room Amnesia" by QQuest Escape Games in Miami
review: I'm going to assume that the two people who didn't rate this as a five are sore losers. Excellent atmosphere, great staff, fantastic puzzles. We're coming back.

room_title: Escape room "Room Amnesia" by QQuest Escape Games in Miami
review: What a great time we had. Great challenges and the rooms are well put together. It was very fun working as teams to solve the puzzles. We will be back for another. Highly recommend, a great night out.

room_title: Escape room "Room Amnesia" by QQuest Escape Games in Miami
review: It is the most the most magical thing in the whole wide world I love it so much. The puzzles are always interesting and it's so funny the the simple things u will over think that solve the puzzles. The people who work there are also very nice and I've already tried 3 of their rooms and just want to do all of them. I think they r better than other escape the rooms I've seen and I love how they have more than one room. Altogether an amazing escape the room!

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: More difficult for our group than the Shelter was, but had good flow and beautiful scenery. All of us had to work together on many of the puzzles and we really liked it!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: This was awesome! I can't wait to go back and breakout of the other rooms. The staff was great too!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: I love Breakout Atlanta!Our team had a blast breaking out of the Museum Heist Room which was super hard but definitely worth it when we broke the record (challenge accepted, folks). The staff was friendly, encouraging, and made the whole experience even better.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: These guys are AWESOME!!. This was my first adventure like this and I'm glad it was with BREAKOUT.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Super fun time! Had a blast! The staff (Ben) was great and helpful when needed. Can't wait to do another room! Will definetely be back soon!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Redefines what it means to have fun in Atlanta as a group !

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Such a dope experience lol I felt like an investigator and got the job done! With o my a minute left too!! Haha gotta try the other games soon!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: This was the best team builder ever! Jake was a great Game Master!

room_title: Escape room "R.E.S.C.U.E." by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: SO FUN! GO DO IT! Well, if you like puzzles. I honestly have not had that much fun in a long time. I felt like a kid again! Except for the fact that I would not have been much help as a kid.We got there and the place was a little difficult to find. They had signs posted everywhere but we went at night and the signs are black. We did see it though so we got there! The staff was very nice and answered all of my random, obnoxious questions because I always have some. While we were waiting, we were messing around with some brain teasers. I heard lots of yelling and banging so I was kind of freaking out but it wasn't scary.We did RESCUE which has a 3.3% success rate. We thought we were smart and were going to get out just fine. Even if it was our first one. NOPE! We technically did escape and saved the girl. Just 20 seconds after the bomb went off...as ghosts. This is definitely a fun puzzle game and I can't wait to do another one! Our whole groups loves thinking outside the box so I think that helped up out and hindered us as we were thinking too outside the box sometimes!

room_title: Escape room "R.E.S.C.U.E." by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: We attempted the "RESCUE" Escape Room. The puzzles were well thought-out and challenging. The rooms and office were tidy and the staff were very friendly and professional. I would highly recommend Denver Escape Room!

room_title: Escape room "R.E.S.C.U.E." by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: Really this place has the kindest people who are all very excited about their jobs! They have been kind and accommodating both of our times. We look forward to coming back again and again! Thank you so much Denver Escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: Don't judge this building from the looks at all! Great service and the jewel heist room was challenging and fun! Highly recommend this place! We will be back to try other rooms soon!

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: Brought my son and his friend today for my son's birthday. We did the Jewel Heist with a great group of people. So much fun. And we got out with 15 seconds to spare!! We will definitely be back! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Jewel Heist" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: There were a total of 10 of us we all had a great time. The puzzles were challenging and it def was not what any of us was expecting. We will certainly be back.

room_title: Escape room "Murder at Mystery Manor" by Escape from Mystery Manor in Boise
review: Had a very fun experience the event kept us engaged the whole time, would recommend to anyone who wants a good time.

room_title: Escape room "Murder at Mystery Manor" by Escape from Mystery Manor in Boise
review: The hosts were great and the team building event was a lot of fun. Very well organized and planned out.

room_title: Escape room "Murder at Mystery Manor" by Escape from Mystery Manor in Boise
review: My husband and I have done several escape rooms before, but this was our first attempt at trying one by ourselves. While we didn’t quite make it out (we were one clue away) we still really enjoyed the experience. The puzzles were really clever and the room was well designed. The owners were also really friendly and we enjoyed talking escape rooms after we were done.

room_title: Escape room "Fort Ord Lockdown" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: I've gone multiple times. It's challenging but a wonderful experience! It's definitely worth a visit or multiple. Friendly staff and a fantastic time.

room_title: Escape room "Fort Ord Lockdown" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Escape Room Salinas is awesome. The owners are super cool people and all the rooms are really fun to do even if you don’t escape. Rooms are all super family oriented so kids can help out as well. Thanks for bringing this to Salinas!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Fort Ord Lockdown" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: We had a great time! Super fun activity for everyone.

room_title: Escape room "The Mafia" by Insomnia Escape Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: My best friend and I had a blast. We did the Mafia Room, it was our first time. The guy helping us was great. Definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Mafia" by Insomnia Escape Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: My girlfriends and I escaped the Mafia room just in time. It was difficult, but not so difficult that we didn't have fun - perfect! We can't wait to take our spouses and do it again!

room_title: Escape room "The Mafia" by Insomnia Escape Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: We had a great time in the Cosa Nostra room. The puzzles and mechanics were unique and made the room more fun than other rooms we've been to. Can't wait to do the Alchemist room later.

room_title: Escape room "The Mafia" by Insomnia Escape Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: This was my second escape room. I really had a great time with my 3 coworkers. There was plenty of clues and some really cool props. We were in the speakeasy. The clues were not to hard but not too easy. Great for people who have never done an escape room before and challenging enough for someone who has done an escape room. I would definitely recommend this company. The staffer was very helpful and attentive. She asked if we needed help and even made some suggestions when our progress slowed.

room_title: Escape room "Sister's Secret" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: My previous review was for The Escape (a great room). Now that I've done Sister's Secret, I have to say it's my favorite room I've ever done. Out of 54 rooms, this one was the most immersive I've experienced. Edwin, the owner, has an attention to detail, high quality puzzles, and intriguing story line that all come together perfectly in this room. I was scared, but not to the point where puzzles couldn't be completed. There's just the right amount of cool tech in the room, and it all added to the spooky theme. I'm also a sucker for a story - if you pay attention you will be carried through a movie like storyline from beginning to end. A cool bonus is the lobby has a mini escape room practice game. I highly recommend The Unlockables!

room_title: Escape room "Sister's Secret" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: It was my first time trying an Escape Room, and it was a pleasant experience! Staff was super friendly and great at moderating the experience. We tried Sister's Secret- we didn't succeed, but the room was really detailed and well done!I would recommend not doing this room if it's your first time, since it's a little more complicated than The Escape or Informant. I'm going back to try an easier room for the ego boost :)

room_title: Escape room "Sister's Secret" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: Came in on a Saturday afternoon.  My crew and I love escape rooms so this is not our first rodeo.  Place has 3 room, two of them sister secret and the escape are a bit more advanced and technologically involved.  The last one is more of your traditional escape room.  We did sister's secret and it was one of the better escape rooms in terms of atmosphere, challenge and puzzle flow.  For this room you need atleast 3 people and i'd recommend more if some of the people aren't that experienced.  Puzzle complexity is average and they all make sense.  Its perfect for larger groups since it is non-linear (something they tell you at the beginning) so you can all work of different things at the same time.  There are a lot of things to do in this room so its going to be hard if your team doesn't have multiple competent people.The atmosphere of the room is great.  Nice spooky ambience with a few things that go bump in the night.  Really a nice immersive experience with a bunch of fun puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Our work group did the Runaway Train room. It was a fun experience with some clever clues. I've done escape rooms with several different companies, and this one was as good as any. I recommend a visit.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Josh was a great gamemaster - not giving away too much - just enough to keep the fun going. Runaway Train was a challenge but doable.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Had a great time team building with my organization. Josiah was great! Make sure to ask for clues early!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Last Saturday, my now fiance proposed to me at Breakout Games! This place was special to us because we have been here many times before playing the fabulous games...the proposal went off so smoothly I was just in shock! Courtney assisted my fiance in every aspect to make sure the proposal came out perfect. I couldn't thank Breakout Games enough for making this such a once in a lifetime proposal moment!!

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: We had an amazing time at Breakout Jacksonville! Elizabeth and Josh were our game masters. They were very friendly and helped us whenever we were really stuck! The building was clean and neat, and the rooms were cleverly designed, making every challenge stimulating and -of course- fun! It really made us use our brains! Breakout was fun for people of all ages, and we will definitely come again!

room_title: Escape room "Dorm Room Daze" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: Such a fun place! We did the Dorm Room Daze and made it out! Jackson was a wonderful host!

room_title: Escape room "Dorm Room Daze" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: Did the dorm daze room and it took us the full time limit to figure it out. It was a blast and definitely a challenge.

room_title: Escape room "Dorm Room Daze" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: Excellent job with the Dorm room. Had an amazing time and the puzzle was challenging yet engaging. 5 Stars and 2 thumbs up. Would highly recommend to everyone. The future rooms sound wonderful.

room_title: Escape room "Dorm Room Daze" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: Excellent job with the Dorm room. Had an amazing time and the puzzle was challenging yet engaging. 5 Stars and 2 thumbs up. Would highly recommend to everyone. The future rooms sound wonderful.

room_title: Escape room "Dorm Room Daze" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: Very fun! We did Dorm Room with kids from age 8-14. They did most of the work, had a great time and escaped the room. Friendly, helpful staff!

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire: Axis Vs. Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: It was good fun. Very challenging. Would definitely recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire: Axis Vs. Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Soooo much fun!!! Can't wait to go back and try the next room

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire: Axis Vs. Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Great place. Rooms are well designed and really makes you think. Would go again

room_title: Escape room "Two Thirty Nine" by Evolution Escape Rooms in Miami
review: I have done many escape room and this is the best one I have done. The puzzles hit the perfect spot for difficulty and the rooms looked beautiful. Would recommend this over any other escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Two Thirty Nine" by Evolution Escape Rooms in Miami
review: We had a great experience, Shanika, Ryan and Rajib were very very helpful. Everyone is very friendly. We are definitely coming back!

room_title: Escape room "Two Thirty Nine" by Evolution Escape Rooms in Miami
review: I had an absolute blast doing Two Thirty Nine with my friends!  I liked how it only allowed up to 6 people, so my friends and I were able to fill it without worrying about getting stuck with strangers (hate that).The room had great puzzles with clever clues.  It definitely felt like we were trying to escape and with a sense of urgency.  VERY realistic!  I've done several escape rooms that felt too fake, not this one!They did something I had never done before.  They take you to the room blindfolded!  You start in the main area where they go over the "rules" (standard escape room protocol) and then they give you blindfolds to wear.  You then walk in a line with your hand on each other's back to the room (employee leads of course).  Then you are sat down, door is shut, sounds start, and you take your blindfold off and... ESCAPE!  Sounds silly but this made it all the more mysterious and "real."Highly recommend.  I loved it!

room_title: Escape room "Cabin" by Amazing Escape in Atlanta
review: So much fun! My friends and I did the Cabin for my husbands birthday. We had to ask for one clue (out of three) but made it out with about 8 minutes to spare! We had 5 in our group and I fit in the rooms just fine. It was fun and took teamwork to finish. We are hoping to come back soon and do the virus room!

room_title: Escape room "Cabin" by Amazing Escape in Atlanta
review: This our first time ever doing an escape room. We played the Cabin room and we had no idea how challenging it was going to be! We had the best time and will be back to play the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Cabin" by Amazing Escape in Atlanta
review: Staff was really awesome and the concept of these rooms are excellent. Highly recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Cabin" by Amazing Escape in Atlanta
review: We went for a friend's birthday and had a BLAST! They were so friendly from start to finish and I know we will be back soon. I would recommend this escape room to all of my friends.

room_title: Escape room "Behind Bars" by Locked Inside Room Escape in Melbourne
review: My group of friends and I had a blast in their Behind Bars escape room! The room was challenging, but not impossible if you all work together to figure out the clues. We all had a great time, and escaped with 11 minutes to spare! Our team will definitely come back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Behind Bars" by Locked Inside Room Escape in Melbourne
review: That was a ton of fun. We escaped the prison cells!

room_title: Escape room "Behind Bars" by Locked Inside Room Escape in Melbourne
review: We did the jail break room. It was fantastic!!! The clues were well thought out and the room design was amazing! It truly promotes teamwork! Never had so much fun NOT getting out!! The staff were the friendliest people! And they love what they do! They were our cheerleaders!! Can't wait to come and try another room!

room_title: Escape room "Behind Bars" by Locked Inside Room Escape in Melbourne
review: We had a great time in the Behind Bars room today. For our first time, we were worried we were going to feel really stupid and just run out of time but everything is pretty straight forward and great for people on all levels of the puzzle solving scale!

room_title: Escape room "Death’s Dimension" by Quadra Escape in San Jose
review: Yesterday I attempted the Death's Dimension room. It was by far the best experience I've had in an escape room so far. It also helped that we managed to be the first team to escape this brand new room. The theme was great, the feedback mechanisms were fun, and the puzzles were innovative and more interactive than I'd seen before.The staff are super friendly and helpful, and the other games available have been good experiences as well, giving me and my group plenty of reasons to return for more fun challenges.

room_title: Escape room "A Tale of Two Forts" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Great time in this Xescape Room. Lovely people operating the game. Enthusiastic, welcoming, with the right customer service attitude.

room_title: Escape room "Ex Machina" by Stockton Escape in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Orphanage" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was our first escape room experience we planned as a girls night fun for something new and exciting. And I must admit we were impressed!!! The puzzles kept us challenged without losing the idea of just having fun. The gamemaster was awesome and the elements of their room was very impressive and on point. All I can say is... we... will... be... back!

room_title: Escape room "The Orphanage" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did The Orphanage last Friday and it was absolutely amazing! One of the best escape rooms I've ever done (roughly 50 escape rooms give or take). The atmosphere was perfectly creepy and kind of kept you on your toes, very different and fun puzzles, great game master (we only knew him as our Dark Lord) and just a great time overall. I can't recommend this game enough!

room_title: Escape room "The Orphanage" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My group and I are Escape RoomEnthusiasts and really enjoyed the experience at this location for the Orphanage. To start off the staff is very nice and informative if it is your first time, but we didn't need any explaining, so they asked us about our previous experiences doing escape rooms. The puzzles were well thought out and some were elaborate especially from the very beginning, you have to use your head and pay attention to all clues around you. We did use 3 clues to only find out we were already on the right track we just needed reassurance. We escaped with 15 minutes to spare ! They do have one other room at this location called Nautical (remember I'm talking about the one on western). The location might be a little hard to find at first but the sign is on their door. Street parking only, they have meters, or you can park down the side street during certain times around the corner. Highly recommend for a small birthday party, company outing for 6 employees, or even something to do when bored or looking for more things to do in LA aside from the common tourist things .

room_title: Escape room "Incantation" by Time to Escape in Okeechobee
review: Fantastic fun with friends! "Incantation" is very interactive and very immersive. Will definitely come again.

room_title: Escape room "Incantation" by Time to Escape in Okeechobee
review: My wife and I did our very first escape room with our daughter who had done a few before. We escaped the "Incanation" room in a good time. Highly recommend this activity.

room_title: Escape room "Outlawed" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: Played 'Outlawed' last night with my boyfriend! LOVED the game it was so fun! The puzzles were tricky but really fun and it was so exciting when you solved them. We had 4 hints we could use during the game, the only frustrating thing about the experience was sometimes the hints were very helpful but then sometimes the hint just told us what we were already doing. Maybe work on better hints but overall it was great! We escaped with a minute left! Last thing, we were placed with a group without knowing. The group was supposed to do an earlier room but missed their time so ended up going in with us. It would've been nice to be asked if that was okay or even just a heads up. Especially when a couple from the group vigorously made out the entire time and were in our way when trying to escape the room. It was uncomfortable and the management watching from the camera didn't even say anything when they visibly saw we were uncomfortable. I know thats a hard situation i just wish it could've been handled somewhat better. Anyways will definitely be back! Loved the game overall!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Outlawed" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: We had a great time. We had never played and decided it would be a fun way to celebrate my sons 18th birthday with his friends. We did the outlawed room. What fun. We didn't escape but we were only 2 clues away. We will definitely be doing another room in the future.

room_title: Escape room "Outlawed" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: My family came to visit from Iowa and we've heard a lot of great things about this place so we decided to try it. I'm so glad we did! Matt was awesome and the Outlawed room definitely keeps your wheels turning! Can't wait to go back and try out the other rooms!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: Had a great time at Escape Oakland! If you're looking for a fun and unusual experience in the Bay area, this is the place the check out. The room was challenging but very interesting, and got our creative juices flowing as a team! Owners were warm and friendly (and helped us when we needed some clues ). Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: Incredible fun! Clever puzzles.  Kind staff.  Just the best experience! The whole family enjoyed our night!

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: What an adventure! We had a blast, and I can't wait to go back! "The Bunker" was full of surprises, and it was perfect for our group of friends. We were able to escape from the room with a few clues. The location is perfect with a lot of street parking and walking distance to the bart station. The host was awesome! She explained all rules to us as for some of us it was first escape room. Thanks a lot!!!

room_title: Escape room "Island Missile Crisis: This is not a drill" by Room With a Clue in Honolulu
review: It was easy to book. A lot of fun for the whole family. And a great team building activity. Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "Island Missile Crisis: This is not a drill" by Room With a Clue in Honolulu
review: Went with a group of friends and did the lost in paradise room. As soon as we entered the place we were greeted and asked to sign some waiver forms. After we got the waiver forms done we waited in the lobby and played with all the puzzles until our room was ready. The room itself was really fun and i like all of the puzzles. You get 60 minutes to try and complete all the puzzles to escape, you also get three free clues you can ask for help. Overall, we had a great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Island Missile Crisis: This is not a drill" by Room With a Clue in Honolulu
review: I've been doing escape rooms all my life back home in California and this was one of the first rooms that I completed when I came out to Oahu for college. I am pleased to say that completing Lost in Paradise with my boyfriend and we were quite stumped and the puzzles are quite unconventional. However, it was a very nice change of pace and I enjoyed it very much! My boyfriend and I had an amazing time communicating with each other and even though we did not get to escape, we had a good time! Our game master, Bryan, had such a good attitude and helped us immensely. I have come back and completed A Stranger Case and that room is just nostalgia central! I really enjoy the themes and hope to see more rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Watson's Revenge" by Escape Room Delaware in Dover
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Teddy Bear Workshop" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Super fun game. Best cooperation between all of my kids I've ever seen. Josh really stepped up helped out with a scheduling glitch. We'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Teddy Bear Workshop" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: We had a great time doing to kiddo room with a 6 and 8-year-old.

room_title: Escape room "The Teddy Bear Workshop" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: We absolutely loved our experience at Epic Escape games. We came as a family and did the Teddy Bear Room. It was awesome to find something we could all do and enjoy some good family time together. It was cool, something different, made us work as a team, and perfect for every age. Our group ranged in age from 7-39 years old and no one ever felt left out or unable to participate. Highly recommend this memorable experience and can't wait to go try out another!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: We have gone to this location twice and it was excellent. The staff if friendly and super helpful. Both of the rooms we have done were wonderfully executed and challenging and fun.

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: Had a great time. The room flowed really well. Challenging puzzles. Staff was great and very helpful. We had an absolute blast. I would definitely recommend to others.

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: It was our first time. The staff was very friendly. We will definitely be back. Had a great time!!

room_title: Escape room "A Night in the Fashion Store" by That Escape Room in San Francisco
review: I played the fashion store one with my friends, I have to give it a wow. Since the manager beg me don't tells the detail, I have to tell you that this one is so cool and so different. The light effects are awesome!

room_title: Escape room "A Night in the Fashion Store" by That Escape Room in San Francisco
review: I went to the fashion room yesterday and that was fun and scary to me. The story of that room told it should be haunted. Well~ I think it does! Definitely recommend it

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by MindQuest Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: What a blast!! It was our first time as a couple so much fun navigating our skills together!! We made it out in just under an hour. Staff made it an awesome experience.

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by MindQuest Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: I've been here twice. Once with my wife, brother-in-law, and sister. We made it through the diamond one. And then my wife and I went through the bomb for my birthday today as they sent us a coupon for a free game for me. We made it out. The rooms are very fun and clever. Super well thought out. Especially the diamond heist. I love going to this place. The game host Cody is very personable and makes the game enjoyable. I would highly recommend this place especially if you have a coupon or groupon.

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by MindQuest Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: I've gone to a couple of these, typically when visiting places as the concept is very intriguing. Decided to check this one out with four other people and we were lucky enough to have a whole room to ourselves. We did the Diamond Heist and wow it was phenomenal! We got out in 47 minutes and (what seemed to be the owner and his wife) were both so friendly and great! Absolutely recommend and cannot wait to go back to check out their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: My daughter and husband wanted to play a game, and I had never played before but was so impressed with everyone from the front desk to our game guide Nathaniel. He was so personable and made us feel great when we escaped (with a little help, ha!). Thank you all for the wonderful time!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: From the front desk, booking with Nathaniel, was a breeze and very informative of what to expect. We chose Spec Ops, even though there were only two of us, because we wanted a challenge. Boy did we get one. Val was an awesome guide and we had an absolute blast. We played before heading into the Braves game..let’s just say the only winners that day were the Braves because we did not get out in time. Close..but missed it by one clue set. Regardless, it was an amazing time and my girlfriend and I absolutely loved every second of it. Great bonding and awesome time together. Josh, Val, and Nathaniel knocked it out of the park..so did Freeman and Swanson that day, too! Definitely a must do in the Battery.

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: I played Special ops and playground and they were the best games I’ve ever done! Really immersive and really felt like I was there! And I got out of both! Definitely go check them out!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: To Zach, Josh, Courtney, and Brianna, thank you from both Dylan and me!! This staff will bend over backwards to make sure you enjoy your time in their rooms! It is absolutely clear that this group of employees is close knit and well managed. Each personality shines in it's own way, adding to the fun of each visit! These are some of the best rooms available. We've played escape games in at least five major cities and after having played 'Heist, Gold Rush, and Spec Ops' these are some of the best!! The sheer ingenuity of each room is astounding! We were challenged in ways we'd never before seen in a room. If you're seriously considering taking up the escape room challenge, do yourself and a favor and book here! It may be just a bit more expensive than other places, but it is ABSOLUTELY worth it.Again, thank you to Zach, Josh, Courtney, and Brianna for making our experience fantastic! Trust and believe we'll be back with reinforcements to take on Prison Break!
