room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game Atlanta in Atlanta
review: I had a awesome first experience at an escape room, so glad we picked this one! The staff was great, attentive, and super friendly. We did 2 rooms, prison break and special ops. The prison break room was the most difficult(we didn't escape) and special ops was pretty difficult as well( we escaped!) Overall it was a great experience and I hope to be returning soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Tomb of Monthu" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: The Last Tomb of Monthu was amazing and we escaped with 17 minutes left. Noely was a fantastic team leader!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Tomb of Monthu" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: Didn't escape the tomb, but my brother and I had a great time, all of the staff were great. One staff member was even an anime fan, I had a great time talking to her. Thanks again guys!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Tomb of Monthu" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: The staff was polite and accommodating. The location was clean and all rules and expectations were explained prior to us playing. The tasks were challenging but very fun and entertaining! I can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Tomb of Monthu" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: First time at America's Escape Game and we had a great time! We came close but we didn't "escape". We did the Lost Tomb of Monthu. I had no idea what to expect and it was very challenging. Can't wait to go back and try another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Tomb of Monthu" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: We had a great time. Siggy and Clarissa were super nice, and very helpful. The puzzles were challenging, but still accessible. Can't wait to come back for the new room when it opens.

room_title: World of Escapes
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Element Z" by Escape Port Charlotte in Fort Myers
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Dungeon" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Had a great day with the kids solving the puzzles. We escaped!

room_title: Escape room "The Dungeon" by Escapism in San Diego
review: What an awesome team building experience! Tap into the creative side of your brain while getting a nice dose of adrenaline

room_title: Escape room "The Dungeon" by Escapism in San Diego
review: A fun, yet challenging group activity! Highly recommended!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Dungeon" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Great experience! We went with kids (11 YO and 13 YO) and had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Dungeon" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Had a great time. Working together is the key! Everyone should try this atleast once.

room_title: Escape room "Takeover" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: This is one the BEST escape rooms in all of San Diego. I've done this 6 other times and I am impressed on how elaborate their rooms are. I took 2 different youth girl basketball teams and we all had a blast. This was great for team building and can accommodate all age levels. The staff is very professional as well. Denzel was very good in facilitating the groups and I can't thank him enough.

room_title: Escape room "Takeover" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: I love how the games are immersive and require unique character traits for solving each puzzle. Definitely a great way to spend a Saturday night.

room_title: Escape room "Takeover" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: Such a great first time experience! Went in with friends as a group of 5 which was a good size for the escape room we did. The tasks weren’t too complex but involved just the right amount of brain power and at the end of it we felt pretty accomplished and happy! We escaped! 🔓🕵️‍♀️

room_title: Escape room "Sasquatch" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: This game was my absolute favorite! The set decoration and story line really draw you in and keep you engaged! And the game play is top notch! YOU MUST PLAY THIS GAME!

room_title: Escape room "Sasquatch" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: This was the first escape room experience me and my friends have ever tried and we were very happy that Netherworld was our first escape room. Our room was the Sasquatch and it was awesome. The set design, the puzzles, and the scares were very well done. We felt as if we were actually in a horror movie with a Sasquatch trying to break into the cabin. If you are looking for a fun time for you and your friends then this is a must. I can not wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Sasquatch" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: We had so much fun last night, and we survived the Sasquatch! I would totally do it again. We all really had to work together. The game was challenging and fun.

room_title: Escape room "Sasquatch" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: We survived the Sasquatch and had an absolute blast doing so!The crew was so friendly and enthusiastic and made sure we had a good time.We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Sasquatch" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: I've played all three games by the Netherworld and they were all fantastic. So much more than the usual simple escape room experience! I personally liked the Sasquatch room best, but they all have their charms. You must check them out!

room_title: Escape room "The Mad Scientist Lab" by Locked Adventures in San Marcos (CA)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: 8 friends went to All Locked Up last Saturday night. Some had tried escape rooms before but the majority had never been. Most of us didn't know what to expect. This place is AMAZING!! We had the GREATEST time escaping from The Classroom! I can't wait to go back and try all of the other rooms that are available. The location is creatively decorated, realistic and you really have to see it to believe it. They did a FANTASTIC job designing The Classroom. It's so easy to get lost in its reality and play the game to win. The owners are so friendly and so supportive and the customer service we received makes this our #1 Escape Room! We highly recommend this place for a fun night out with friends or family.

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: So happy to have a great escape room right here SCV! My group and I have played 100+ rooms and we loved it here! The decor in the rooms are spot on! We loved to be challenged and these guys def do that with their puzzles! We did the garage and the classroom! Both a great time I def loved the classroom there are 3 diff levels to this room junior high, high school, and now college (def expert level) the garage had that creepy vibe but nothing to scary (I'm a scary cat). Can't wait for their next room... the owners are what really makes this place... their passion for escape rooms shows...

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: The "Classroom" was spot on. My kids loves it and we actually got the record time-as of March 15 :) ! Will come back to do garage.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Library - Destination London" by ALL IN Adventures Orange Park in Jacksonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape Your Nightmares" by Nexus Escape Room in Miami
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Adventure" by Limitless Escape Games in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The List" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: We love making memories with our family, especially during the holidays. This year we tried Chico Escape Rooms and had a fantastic time. With 1:38 left, the six of us were able to solve all of the clues and write our names on Santa’s Nice List! A great way to spend a solid hour problem solving, laughing, and working together. Our family ranges in age from 18 to 65 and we ALL had a great time. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: I went here on my birthday as a family teambuilding event. We did "The Experiment". It was well put together, and the staff was friendly and helpful. I'll definitely go back and try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Rendyth's Revenge" by Kingdom Escape Games in Key Largo
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Da Vinci Code" by Xcape Flagstaff in Flagstaff
review: We loved the DaVinci Code room. It was a great time with my friends. We can't wait to come back and try the 20 minute room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Trump's America" by Tales From The Cryptex in Sacramento
review: So much fun with interactive help and clues if needed to solve problems. Each puzzle made logical sense with the theme. Person at the front desk was great and excited to help. Thanks.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Trump's America" by Tales From The Cryptex in Sacramento
review: Went with 5 family members, and none of us had ever done anything like this before so I was apprehensive. But we loved the theme so wanted to try it out. We ended up having a blast! It was definitely challenging but not impossible. We solved it with 3 extra clues. It was very exciting to figure out the puzzles together. I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Escape Trump's America" by Tales From The Cryptex in Sacramento
review: Puzzles were just hard enough, amazing how many components you can fit into one small room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape Trump's America" by Tales From The Cryptex in Sacramento
review: I really enjoyed myself and it was very challenging. It was a very small room and maybe one couple too many, I felt a little overcrowded. It was still a fun time.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Trump's America" by Tales From The Cryptex in Sacramento
review: My family took me here as a birthday surprise and it was fantastic! We solved the puzzle with one other family, and it turned out that we really needed every member to solve this in the nick of time. It was like living in a Mission Impossible scenario for an hour. I want to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin of Mr. Smith" by Mindscape in Atlanta
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Lost Treasure of Captain Lawrence" by DeadLocked Escape Rooms in Stamford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Gravitational Effect" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Great time! Staff was very helpful and engaged. Definitely worth trusting your next event with these very capable professionals.

room_title: Escape room "Gravitational Effect" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Awesome experience, very fun game! Thank you! We can't wait to come back for Amazon rainforest!

room_title: Escape room "Gravitational Effect" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Gravitational Effect - I think I liked this room better than Amazon Rainforest. They tried to make the room 4D by giving you 3D glasses to enhance the experience but, let's be honest, they're not going to do anything other than make you trip and/or make the puzzles difficult because you can't see them straight. They are not needed to play the game so they are pretty pointless, in my opinion. We didn't even put them on. For the most part, the puzzles made sense and a few were challenging but not overly difficult. There were a couple of puzzles I felt that if they were improved upon they would make the experience more immersive. One of the puzzles involved "jackets" which, at first, we thought were just plastic bags. This made the puzzle seem kinda cheesy because they were just cheap rain ponchos that didn't really fit with the room. Perhaps investing in some actual jackets to make it more themed would help spruce up this puzzle some. The other puzzle was the final puzzle. I don't want to give anything away so I won't say anything about it other than it had absolutely nothing to do with the theme of the room. But even with that being said, I do want to say that there was one "puzzle" that was more of a physical challenge and that was a lot of fun. It caught us off guard when we saw it (which is almost always a good thing in the world of escape rooms) and we laughed a lot through it. I thought it was great for them to have this in the room and really added a lot to the experience.

room_title: Escape room "Murder Mystery" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: I did the murder mystery Room a couple weeks ago and it was the bomb. I've also completed the zombie apocalypse Quest paranoia Quest and a couple rooms at Breakout. So far paranoia Quest has by far been my favorite. Right now they have a great special going that makes them comprable to other vendors comma and you get a lot in the rooms at paranoia Quest more challenges more tasks and you also get a little good even if you don't complete it. Highly rated gotta try it out.

room_title: Escape room "Murder Mystery" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: It was really fun! I loved how me and my friend were paired up with different people, it brought us all together even though we just met each other 5 minutes before. I can't wait go back!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Mystery" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: I truly enjoyed my experience! It was challenging and right up my alley. I purchased a Groupon for four for the Zombie room. We were paired with four others. I think it was a little too crowded. 8 people seems like enough. I told staff it was my boyfriend birthday at the time of booking and they made it a point to wish him a happy birthday and make him out "leader". I was really nice of them. I suggest you arrived 5-10 mins early, the game starts at your booked time. Parking was easy to get to. Staff was friendly. I will be returning. I will stay alive next time!!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Mystery" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: Loved this room. Definitely wasn't easy but I love a good challenge. The staff is super friendly. The location makes it pretty easy to find. I loved the way the room was set up...all the different clues I'll stop before I say to much. If you haven't already definitely try this room out!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Mystery" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: I've recently booked the "Murder Mystery" room @ the Broad street location in Atlanta for my dept holiday outing. Though we didn't make it out the room (insert sad face) we had a great time and still talking about it in the office. In fact a few other depts heard how much fun we had and are looking to take the challenge as well as one of our company principals is looking to book a room for her family. Looking forward to trying the other rooms soon!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Mystery" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: We had a great time! We didn't make it all the way thru but we are so excited to go back! You really have to use your brain! Great team building exercise!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Mystery" by Paranoia Quest in Atlanta
review: Great time! guidelines given at the beginning were too fast though Now I understand what to expect and what not to do. It was hard having NO clue the first time through (for example, the fact that we had to backtrack we never realized that was an option).

room_title: Escape room "Red vs Blue" by Situation Room in Macon
review: Had such a fun time we did another room the same day.

room_title: Escape room "Red vs Blue" by Situation Room in Macon
review: Went for a group activity. This was my first escape room experience. Our helper was very nice and gave us clues but didn't give it away. We did Red vs Blue and it was hard! It wasn't so hard that it wasn't fun but we didn't finish in time. We definitely needed to work together. We were soooo close but fell short. I still had a great time and would do it again. The restroom was clean and I parked in the garage. Staff was super friendly and the rules were explained well.

room_title: Escape room "Red vs Blue" by Situation Room in Macon
review: I really had a great time playing Red vs Blue. The staff are very nice and the game was very entertaining. I will definitely come back to play the other game.

room_title: Escape room "Red vs Blue" by Situation Room in Macon
review: We really enjoyed our time at the Situation Room! Our group, which consisted of 4 adults and 6 kids (ages 8 to 17) tried Red vs Blue. We didn't end up escaping, but everyone was able to contribute in some way and we all had fun. I would definitely recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Red vs Blue" by Situation Room in Macon
review: Played Red vs. Blue with my almost 70-year-old parents, sister and brother-in-law, and 11 year old niece. We didn't make it out in time but came very close. Everyone had a blast! It was more impressive than I thought it would be, and I would highly recommend it to anyone! Can't wait to try out Stellar.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Had an awesome time at Breakout Games. The rooms were awesome! We've done three different rooms here, Kidnaping, Hostage and Mystery Mansion, all were challenging and so much fun. The guys at Breakout were awesome as well, celebrating with us like they had broken out too. If you are looking for a fun group activity, this is the place to go, I would recommend going on days when it won't be too busy, or having enough in your group to take up all the spots. Definitely well worth it though!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Fun! Brought my dad and family for Father's Day and he really enjoyed it! He had never done anything like this before. We did the new Mystery Mansion room. It was a little hard, but fun nonetheless! I will bring him back to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: This was a multi-generational family event and we had a blast! Our game-master was first rate and made the experience challenging and still fun. We did the "Mystery Mansion" room and recommend it. Have fun!

room_title: Escape room "Home Alone" by Padlocked Inc. in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by Locked Adventures in San Marcos (CA)
review: Highly anticipated the opening of Locked Adventures and we were not disappointed! Quest for the Throne is legit! The room is quite immersive, has good puzzles and a good amount of them, and a nice soundtrack while playing the game! Puzzles are primarily Gen1, but well put together. The props are also high quality.We did the room with a group of 8 and finished with 22 minutes to go.There is plenty to do in the room and the owners Jim and Christine are very nice! If you're in the San Marcos area this is a worthy room to try out!

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by Locked Adventures in San Marcos (CA)
review: I have done over 40 escape rooms. This is an excellent room! A very cool medieval theme that really challenges your mind and your patience.  We had a team of 5 and it took all of us to figure this room out. Be prepared to think outside the box. Looking forward to coming back for future rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Tiki Time!" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So much fun. Experienced Krampus and Tiki room. Can't wait to go again.

room_title: Escape room "Tiki Time!" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loved this experience! Did all 3 with my team and escaped all of them! The Krampus room was by far my favorite, some great theming and excellent spooks. The Tiki Palace and Spaceship were challenging but lots of fun. Staff was welcoming and very accommodating. Cheers to Countdown Live!

room_title: Escape room "Tiki Time!" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My teen son had a group of friends in the Tiki Room last night. 9 kids ages 11-15. To be honest, they're a very gifted bunch and my 3 kids had done multiple other rooms in the past. They actually escaped with 38 seconds to spare (took 3 hints). They all had such a great time and the host Brian is a really great guy. Can't wait to work up my courage to come back with my husband and some friends to try out the Krampus room. We'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: So me and a group of friends went yesterday to the new escape room, words cannot begin to describe the experience. We did the insane asylum and the other group did tale of two forts, and every single person was amazed. We are already planning our next visit, zombie room here we come!!!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: This was our first time doing an Escape Room and it was awesome! We did the Asylum and it was challenging, but Cristol gave us helpful hints and we got out with 6 minutes to spare! It was so much fun and it’s a place that I will recommend to anyone I know coming down to Gulf Shores.

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Our group of 5 ladies aged 20 to 58 chose the Insane Asylum. All of us except one had done an escape room before, but this was our first time at this location. The lady at the front desk was very nice and helpful. The room was challenging, but not ridiculous. We had a great time, we escaped with time to spare, and if we are in the area again, would love to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the X Corporation" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This place is so much fun! There was a group of 8 of us that did Escape the X Corporation room, this was definitely challenging! We did escape though! So we decided to do another room and did Starlight Lounge, but this was only with 6 people. This room was much easier than the first, but still made you think a lot. My tip is to not have everyone work on one thing, split up but communicate with each other very well, no matter which room you decide to do. I believe that 6 is the perfect amount of people to escape. We escaped the second room, breaking the record and becoming second on the leader board! #dinner2go  I will definitely be back to do other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the X Corporation" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My first escape room ever! Played it with 4 randoms and had a blast. It is a fairly medium-tech room (meaning theres is more to it than just finding keys and combinations) with great puzzles. I didn't find it too difficult at all. We escaped with 4 minutes left!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the X Corporation" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We did the Corporation X room tonight. It was really fun even though we didn't escape in the end. Our host Frank was great, really funny. Parking is easy and there is a lot of it. The building is a little hard to see from the street, but we found it just fine.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the X Corporation" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Great room design, clever puzzles, and interesting plot for the Escape from X Corporation room. I was in a group of 6, and were so jubilant when we escaped with 26 seconds to spare! Hints are helpful, use them wisely. Overall, it was a brain-pumping, adrenaline-rushing experience.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the X Corporation" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Way more involved, creative, fun and nerve wracking than I thought it would be! We had a GREAT time and can't wait to do the other rooms! It allowed us to work together as well as use our individual strengths to conquer each task! Also, the guy who greeted us was very welcoming and extremely friendly. I HIGHLY suggest trying this place out!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Denver in Denver
review: What a great place! Fantastic steampunk decor. We started with lunch and the menu is simple but good. Service was attentive and friendly. Our games host was lovely, friendly and fun. We did the “Antidote” game, which was challenging but not exasperating or impossible. There were six of us, ages ranging from 15 to 50.All in all a really fun afternoon, we had a great time, I would highly recommend it and I can’t wait to return next time we are in Denver.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Denver in Denver
review: My girlfriends and I visited Escapology to celebrate my birthday. The experience was amazing. The staff are very friendly and the game master Devon was hilarious. We played Antidote, and the game was exciting and challenging. Afterward, we grabbed a drink themed to the game we played and grabbed a bite. Their drinks are fun and food is delicious! We will definitely be back soon.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Denver in Denver
review: We escaped Antidote and had such a fun time! The puzzles and riddles in the room were unique compared to a lot of other rooms we've done. Plus, we had drinks before which were also awesome (not to mention the GORGEOUS steampunk decor). I mean, who can say no to a cocktail with tequila and prosecco? We will definitely be back - this is a must for escape room addicts!!

room_title: Escape room "Dracula's Castle" by Mystery Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Wynwood Terror" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Terminal" by Will to Escape in West Palm Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Order of Illusionists" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: Order of Illusionists was challenging and entertaining. We had a fantastic time. Our group ranged in age from 14 to 52 with three teenagers - 14,18, and 19. Everyone was engaged and enjoyed the process. Can’t wait to do another one!

room_title: Escape room "Order of Illusionists" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: We had a great time in the Illusionist room- really intriguing clues- great for all kids 10 and up and groups of folks!

room_title: Escape room "Order of Illusionists" by Lockbox Escape Room in Miami
review: We went to The Illusionist room. This was a very exciting room. There were a lot of different puzzles to solve. There were also many surprises! My teenagers also thought this was a great escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Inception" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The staff was nice and funny even though my party was 15 minutes late. The Inception escape room was tough but our group of 8 had a blast. We highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Inception" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: **NON-SPOILER REVIEW** This is only my second escape room and was the first for the other 5 friends I did this with. I chose this one over the other because the premise seemed more technical and the other room was rated as scary, which was a no-go for one of our members. The puzzles were very technical in nature rather than relying heavily on math or word puzzles, which was a huge positive for the room as it fit the theme and every time we solved one we were blown away with the amount of technology that had to have gone into creating the puzzle. Comparing this to my first escape room experience, this escape was far more satisfying and we all can't stop talking about each puzzle and the creativity behind them. I can't wait to try out future rooms that they have in construction.

room_title: Escape room "Inception" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My sister in law was in town for her birthday and we decided, spur of the moment, to do an escape room. I wanted to do the inception room because it was rated harder than their other room. The puzzles were a fun mix of physical and more traditional. Some of the physical puzzles were difficult for our group, but I expect that if you or someone in your group is more of a spacial thinker then you probably won't have the problems we did.Inception is a rather tech heavy room, which often feels gimmicky to me. However in the Inception room they used the tech to their advantage really well. It fits the theme and feel of the room superbly.Overall, Inception is an excellent room and is one of the few rooms I've done that actually gets better in my mind the more I analyze it.

room_title: Escape room "Game of Swords" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My dad gifted my family the Game of Swords escape room for Christmas.  It was a lot of fun!  Challenging enough for the five of us to work together and manage to get through the entire thing.  Hunter was very enthusiastic and a great game master.  He made the next few rooms that will be opening soon sound really fun so we might have to be back!

room_title: Escape room "Game of Swords" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We ha great time with our data faction team today.with both rooms game of swords and wise guys.the team at escape room were very nice and helpful throughout the day and special thanks to them.when our turn came for wise guys guys the person by name of Hunter was very helpful

room_title: Escape room "Game of Swords" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We've been here twice with two different groups. Once to their mob room and once to the game of swords. We really enjoyed it both times. The staff is super attentive, offering just the right amount of help at just the right times for you to feel successful and still be challenged. We can't wait for them to open more rooms so we can return.

room_title: Escape room "Suspects" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: I've been to this place twice and love it! I recently did suspects and boy was there a twist on that room, but also did bookie! Fantastic place and one of the best escape rooms that I've been to. Def worth the money and I highly recommend seeing if there is a groupon, then call and ask them for the same deal and they will give it to you! More money in their pockets and you still get a great deal. Jack was our control master and he had fun with us as well, sending celebratory messages on the screen when we would get the next clue unlocked. Can't wait to go back, already scheduled my next adventure 3/2... doing captains quarters :)

room_title: Escape room "Suspects" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Escape Rooms Mesa was a great experience. My girlfriend and I tried the Suspects room and had a fun time. Shawn was a great game master. I'll certainly be back!

room_title: Escape room "Suspects" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Thoughtful scenario and enjoyed,  immersive and glad we went to introduce 2 more people to this concept

room_title: Escape room "Yakuza" by Top Tier Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "A Diamond Dilemma" by Escape Room 104 in Pine Bluff
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Pyramid" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: I had so much fun my first escape room and I can't wait to go again! I tried the pyramid room and our group made it out with about a few minutes to spare it was a great experience!i loved being put in the room with people we didn't know and working together as a teams!

room_title: Escape room "The Pyramid" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: My group of 8 loved, loved, loved The Pyramid (which is Mayan, not Egyptian).  My first Escape Room and we made it out.  Super colorful and multi-sensorial.  Staff Guide Theresa was all that to assist if needed.  It was so much more stimulating and challenging than I thought it would be.  Cool to see friend's skills come out.  Can't wait for the next one!

room_title: Escape room "The Pyramid" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Just did the newest one of the four choices, The Pyramid, and it's really good. Pretty difficult and we didn't quite finish in time to escape, but it's so well planned and interesting that no one really minded. The design is great and even better than the other rooms - just sorry that we were rushing to finish the clues and I didn't get adequate time to admire the workmanship. Highly recommended! (And if you haven't done one of these before, teamwork is a must - sharing things you've figured out with the others in the group. Don't worry, you'll all quickly become friends if you don't have a full group of your own.

room_title: Escape room "The Runic Ritual" by Two Trees Escape in Ventura
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Hive Mind" by Puzzah! in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Lenny Thompkins Sold His Soul to Play the Blues" by Pursue the Clues in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Hatch" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: Fun theme, mostly traditional puzzles, some a bit cliche if you have done many escape rooms. The final puzzle is a geek-fest!

room_title: Escape room "The Hatch" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: I usually don't write reviews too often but we really loved it! The staff is super friendly and we had tons of fun! We can't wait to go back again. We talked about it the whole car ride home.We didn't know what to expect either. But honestly, that's the BEST part! Thank you Breakout Waikiki! Hawaii needed something like this

room_title: Escape room "The Hatch" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: Great experience!! Definitely going back to do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Hatch" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: Met these guys from kc also. Awesome people, great concept! !!

room_title: Escape room "The Hatch" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: Completed the room with six of my co-workers. The Hatch room was a great time! Would definitely like to come back for another challenge.

room_title: Escape room "The Hatch" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: Super intense yet super fun!!! I would definitely recommend Breakout Waikiki to anyone looking for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Hatch" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: This place is absolutely amazing! We didn't really know what to expect but had very high hopes for this place and it exceeding everything we thought it would be. The staff is super friendly and the room "hatch" was puzzling but so much fun. I will definitely be returning again. Ahhhh we were so close to breaking out haha

room_title: Escape room "The Hatch" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: My husband and I did a Breakout tonight and we absolutely loved it - I would highly recommend it to anyone with a sense of adventure who likes to figure things out. The mental stimulation and adrenalin from 57 minutes of solving the puzzles left us buzzing for hours afterward (and feeling ecstatic that we had actually broken out!) - we still can't stop talking about it. The staff was super cool and the experience had all kinds of ingenious, clever, and unexpected turns. Would definitely do it again!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: This was my first escape room. I went with 3 friends and we were able to finish with 9 minutes left! (And we are minors) We had so much fun, and there were a lot of ‘aha’ moments. Overall, this was an amazing experience and I would love to come back!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: This was the first time I have ever done an escape room, so I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. Two friends and I went and had the best time. It was nice to do something different. It was also nice to challenge yourself and really use your brain. The entire setup was very realistic and not janky. I have heard a lot of these types of escape rooms tend be cheap looking and use cheap props and this one was very nice. The owners have definitely put a lot of time and effort into making this a really awesome, organized experience that you can enjoy with friends, family and even coworkers. I will for sure be back to do more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: Such a fun but yet challenging experience! I went with two close friends of mine. We completed it with about 10 seconds to spare. GO US! The owners put a lot of work into the room to make it a realistic, fun experience. I had never done an escape room before and I walked away so excited to come back and do another one. For days I was talking about it and telling all my close friends and family about it. I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: Amazing story and room, the owner and staff were very friendly. Had a blast with my friends and solved the room, with only 1 minute and 50 seconds left. A great and fun thing you can do with your friends. Worth it! Everyone should check it out. They have a new room opening soon, will so be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: My friends and I were not sure what to expect going in to solve this mystery, but it was fantastically constructed with twists and turns; great clues and just a really fun experience. You HAVE to try it!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: This was the 4th escape room I have been two (the others being in Vancouver) and I was really impressed. The level of interaction inside the room was a great change of pace and the subtle aid system made sure we didn't leave feeling disappointed like we did at many of the others. I'd definitely recommend this place for first timers or anybody wanting to check out escape games but even someone who has done quite a few of them like myself really loved it as well. 5/5 for sure.

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: I'm a pretty avid gamer but I had never done an escape room before. So during a family trip to San Diego (after a half day at the Zoo), we brought a team of 5 Corleys intent on cracking this code. As we joked and stumbled our way through the riddles and lore, we chased a few too many red herrings on our exciting journey toward eventual defeat. Even the insights of my six year old (who was sometimes helpful!) did not allow us to 'defuse the bomb and save the world' in time.While frustrating, no game worth playing lets everyone win. Would I recommend it? Hell yeah! If you have a couple of clever friends and want something fun to do . . . or maybe even looking for the perfect double date activity to go along with dinner then absolutely: go for it.Can you prevail where 5 Corleys came up short? There's only one way to find out . .

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: After reviewing other posts in TA, my husband and I decided to give Enigma HQ a call to see if there was any availability for the same evening. They made availability! Without giving away any of the plot line, we were forced to work together to solve a mystery and it had some great twists and turns! Solved it with one second left on the clock. Whew! Tons of fun and a great memory to share. Thank you, Enigma HQ, for a wonderful evening full of laughter and problem solving!

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Carnival" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: We had a group of 8 in the Big Top room and had a lot of fun. We definitely plan on going back. The staff is really friendly. And they design the rooms, challenges and clues themselves. Pretty awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Carnival" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: We had a great time. We went into the Big Top room, didn't make it out, but had fun trying. We'll be back to try another room. Clues were well done. Thanks.

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Carnival" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: Myself and my two daughters did the Big Top Carnival room and really had a lot of fun! The clues were very clever and, even though we did not manage to escape, we were pretty happy with how far we were able to get (since there were only 3 of us). Already planning to go back and try another room with a bigger group!

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Carnival" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: Had a blast in the carnival room. 9 first timers didn't get out but we were so close! Would go again! Don't let the appearance of the place worry you... it's a good time.

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Carnival" by Lock'd Escape Adventures in Putnam
review: Awesome time!!!!!! The staff is great and made sure we knew what we needed to do and that we had a fun time. We can't wait to go back. Escape games are the next big thing!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: We did the bank escaoe with 6 total and had a blast. It was very challenging but not to the point of being frustrating. We have done 2 rooms here now and are going to make aure to come back and try all of them!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: Love love love Lockbusters great rooms. We have done 2 rooms and they are awesome recommend then both Chopper Down and the Bank Heist.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Lockbusters Escape Game in Orlando
review: My wife and our friend FREQUENT escape rooms. We have been to multiple rooms in Orlando and this one blew me away with detail, friendliness and the puzzles. Great place, great customer service. Gabe and Jesse were awesome. We will come back and finish all rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Excalibur" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: What a great experience!   Awesome people at Epic who are friendly, informative and totally understand customer service.   Visited today with two 14 year olds (boy and girl) and five adults.  Great to do as a group.  Andrew as our clue master was very patient and provided helpful hints.  A great event!

room_title: Escape room "Excalibur" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This is one of the most creative escape game places I have ever been to. Sadly I am only visiting in Denver, otherwise I would be trying all of their different escapes. The staff was also super friendly. Great time!

room_title: Escape room "Excalibur" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This was our third visit to Epic Escape Game, so our review is a little overdue. We have been to a few escape rooms in the Denver area, and this is our favorite. We like the "private house" setting, all three games that we have played so far, and the staff has always been friendly and helpful. On this most recent visit we played Excalibur and our game master was Eric. He was very knowledgeable and gave lots of great information on past, present and future escape rooms. One of those being that the current Dorm of the Dead game will be replaced soon with a type of sequel to it. As a result, we will be returning soon to play it before the sequel is introduced.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: It's a beautiful setting with a friendly staff. My group played the Antidote game and we had a blast! There was one surprise after another. I can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Had so much fun in Antidote. The game master was awesome! From my 10-year-old to us adults was worth the cost. Lots of fun can't wait to come back!

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: This is honestly the best experience I could have! Best escape room! uwu

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: My husband and I reserved the Voodoo Room. We didn't realize they were private rooms (no grouping with strangers). That was an awesome surprise. This place was top notch. All the puzzles were challenging and Mark and Alyssa were fabulous hosts. The room itself felt authentic and all of the props were cool. We loved the tactical feel of everything, having to use your eyes, ears, nose, and brain! We agreed we are doing the Western Room next and dragging some friends along next time!

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Loved it! My buddies and I were in for San Diego Comic Con and stopped to do the Voodoo Room. Not only did we play the Voodoo Room, we did the Western Room after that!The staff is great and fun to work with, the puzzles complex and insightful, and a blast all around! I'm definitely planning on returning, as well as recommending Lock Down to all my friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Took the family there for son's birthday and we had a blast solving the Voodoo room. We will be back to solve the other rooms for sure.

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: So much fun! Had an absolute blast playing the voodoo room with a group of four friends. Will be back to try other rooms! Make sure to give yourself a little extra time to find parking if you have a reservation.

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: A fun time at Lockdown Escape Rooms! Did two rooms with my in-laws, Voodoo was great, challenging but not impossible, and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Mission is a Gogh!" by Pursue the Clues in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Monica’s Apartment" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: Very good escape room that’s well run. Hard enough to definitely make you think but solvable enough to make it possible.

room_title: Escape room "Monica’s Apartment" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: Went with our 14 year old, 6 year old and 4 year old today and everyone had a blast! Jackie was our game master and she was wonderful. It’s so nice to find something that entertains the whole family! We escaped Monica’s apartment with just 10 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Monica’s Apartment" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: I went tonight with my boyfriend because I'm a huge friends fan and found out I could escape Monica's apartment. Jackie was super helpful and made our experience even more enjoyable! Wish I lived in the area so I could go back and do another room!

room_title: Escape room "Cartman's Escape Room" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: SO much fun!! Employees were super friendly and overall just a top notch experience 😊 Btw did Cartman's escape room

room_title: Escape room "Cartman's Escape Room" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: The room in Escape the Room was well run. All of the props worked as they were meant too. The teens declared the Southpark room as the most fun one we have done.

room_title: Escape room "Cartman's Escape Room" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: We chose to Cartman's escape room.  Puzzles were challenging and fun.  We didn't escape but many giggles were had along the way.  Room was wheelchair accessible and was able to be easily maneuvered around the room.  It was definitely a fun way to spend an afternoon with friends.  Knowledge of the show wasn't necessary for the puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "LeRoy's Garage" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Retro" by Urban Enigmas in Athens
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Knights of Norwich" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: Amazing! I have a done a couple of different escape rooms and this place is definitely one of my faves! The Pandorum was pretty hard, and we didn't expect it to be scary but it was a blast! The outlaw room was super fun and unexpected! One of the best parts is that you can have wine or beer while you're in the rooms and if you need any more, just ask for some and they will deliver it to your room. I mean what??! They also have some fun board games in the lobby you can play before or after. Also, this spot is right next to Player One, a video game bar! Me and my friends really did have the time of our lives and it's all thanks to the manager Alix, our awesome host! She gave great clues without giving too much away which is what we wanted. Thanks for everything Alix, we had so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Knights of Norwich" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: We came from Spain and decided to try an American escape room. We made Pandorum, 100% recommended. Very good thematic, tests and very original games. And a game master that thanks to knowing our language helped us to have a great time. Thanks for everything!

room_title: Escape room "The Knights of Norwich" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: Was fantastic. Did suburban serial killer first and was one of the best escape rooms I've ever done. Then we did the Pandorum game. It was too hard! Don't go into the game expecting to win. But it was SUPER fun! Just attempting it was a lot of fun. Love the crew there as well. Can't recommend this place enough.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: I was initially abrasive when it came to escape rooms. The idea of being trapped in a room with friends with only our wits about us to help us escape shook me a bit. But instantly when I walked in I was very warmly greeted by the excellent GES at the counter. I do believe her name was Ashley Stephenson? Anyway she prepared me for some of the most fun I’ve had in a long time. What an excellent way to spend the afternoon!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Such a clever and challenging room. There were multiple rooms to get into and it was very nicely staged. We all thought that the prison was one of the best rooms we have done and we have done about 15 rooms throughout Jacksonville! Can't wait to do them all!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Was able to score a free room for their opening Grand day on March 8th with 7 other friends! General Price: $35/Book online or walk-in Room capacity: 2-8 People Escape Room: Prison Break (Company Level:9/10, my scale 8/10) Probably the best decorated room I've ever been too, mind you, I've done over 15+ games. You literally felt as if you were in a jail cell (no further details to share, :) ) . Creative puzzles that really tested our minds and problem solving abilities. Our "helper" was great explaining the process and helping us with clues when the team got stuck. We escaped with three minutes to go and everyone was excited! Glad this came to the Jacksonville Town Center. General notes:- You are allowed 3 free clues, but every one after is a +3 minutes to your overall score. - Use restroom before hand but you can leave by pushing the green "Exit button"

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: We successfully escaped special ops: mysterious market and dared to do prison break the next day! The staff was very friendly and considerate and helped us from the time we checked in to the time we checked out. After our first escape game they offered to take our picture and we also were offered a discount for our next game which made us more inclined to come the next morning. If I ever stop by again I'm definitely going to try out their new playground room!!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: We did Prison Break and I screamed like a little girl when we made it out, with 6 minutes left. I was so excited. The room was very well done and I felt like I was in a cell for real. We lucked out and had Justin again though I think I scared him with my screaming  Can't wait to make my friends go back!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Nemesis" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Had an awesome time here for a team building event. Really have to work together. The clues and rooms are very well thought out! Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Nemesis" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Our family has been to many escape rooms in the area and this was great. Very accommodating with time availability and easy to book it as private, which we prefer. Also great for adults and kids, we brought our 7 year old and she had fun too. Very fun!!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Nemesis" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: I brought a group of my employees to Dynamic to have a team building session and to check it all out. We absolutely had a blast! I will definitely be back and will do more group events in the future!You guys did a great job building the scene and making the escape a little harder than we thought we’d experience.Thanks for having us!

room_title: Escape room "Hyde Away" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: Great atmospherics/decoration. Nice staff.

room_title: Escape room "Hyde Away" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: The games were challenging and different and consistent with the theme of the room. I want to go back and do a different one.

room_title: Escape room "Hyde Away" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: Lots of fun, great design and very friendly staff! 😊

room_title: Escape room "Timebomb" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: We went as a team building activity with coworkers. We had a good turnout and an even greater time! We saved the day in Timebomb! It was a little difficult to get started on the puzzles but we realized (with Christina's helpful hints) that the better we worked together, the better we were at solving the puzzles. We did not know what to expect but we had a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Timebomb" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: Solved Timebomb with a group of coworkers and escaped with 3 minutes to spare! The puzzle had some electronic components that actually fizzled out halfway through the game, so the host had to time us on his smartphone. That took away a little of the excitement, but it was still fun! Would do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Timebomb" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: Our group of 7 had a great time despite being obliterated by the nuclear bomb! Definitely worth it!

room_title: Escape room "Timebomb" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: We went here for a team-building event with a group of twelve. With 42 seconds left, we won and deactivated the bomb. Go team!

room_title: Escape room "Timebomb" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: Great puzzles, friendly staff, and inventive story. Definitely worth it.

room_title: Escape room "2233: Fighting for the Future" by Room Escape DC in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Vegas Hangover" by Escape FLA in Tampa
review: We had a blast! I would recommend this to anyone looking to have fun! We did the Hangover Vegas room. Go do it!

room_title: Escape room "Vegas Hangover" by Escape FLA in Tampa
review: Sooooooooooo much fun!! We brought our staff (group of 31) for team building and they were very accommodating! They opened early for us so we could get the groups through and we had a blast! The Hangover room was very well put together! We will definitely be back again!!!!! Thank you for a great time!!

room_title: Escape room "Vegas Hangover" by Escape FLA in Tampa
review: Super nice host, and what a challenge! and we did it! but barely. We got a few hints, the hints weren't too obvious, just enough to keep us going. One or two of the clues are super hard so don't be shy to get a hint! Cute "hangover" theme made us laugh a few times. Recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: We played Mystery Mansion, hosted by Dharma, and had a GREAT TIME!We "finished" in 60:05...which is to say we solved the final puzzle AT THE BUZZER but didn't have time to run the last object to its destination & break out. ;)We played with 6 smart people and didn't use any hints, so overall the challenge is probably perfectly calibrated.WELL DONE, BREAKOUT!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: This is so fun! We wholly enjoyed the game! We highly recommend the Mansion game. Also-Jake and Lindsey were amazing game masters! They weren't quick to give hints and allowed for us to play the game genuinely!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: I had a lot of fun doing the mystery mansion room as a team building experience! Our game master, Jake, was attentive and communicated really effectively -- he was great. I'd definitely love to go back to breakout and check out the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: Our team thoroughly enjoyed our Mystery Mansion challenge at Breakout Games, Tallahassee. We were definitely challenged, but made our escape! Jordan was fabulous and assisted when needed. She was also very accommodating for our somewhat rowdy group! I'd recommend to anyone wanting to take friends, family or working teammates!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: My husband, 16y old son and I had a great time doing the haunted mansion! We will definitely be back the next time we’re in Tally!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break! 2017" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dungeon Things" by Insomnia Escape Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Bait Shop" by Crystal River Room Escape in Crystal River
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dreadnought" by Novus Escape Room in Dover
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dream Extraction" by Bet You Can't Escape in Tampa
review: is my first time doing this and I had so much fun! Even the rest of my family that they have been in others they said this was the best!

room_title: Escape room "Dream Extraction" by Bet You Can't Escape in Tampa
review: We came here for my husband's birthday and had a great time! The staff were all great and really helpful. We did the Arcadia room and Dream Extraction and thought the rooms were fun and challenging! Thanks for a fun night

room_title: Escape room "Dream Extraction" by Bet You Can't Escape in Tampa
review: We did the Dream Extraction room the other day and it was phenomenal! The room was pretty challenging, but we were able to get out with about one minute left with two people using only three clues. It was extremely fun! The owners were really nice and welcoming. We look forward to coming back with the rest of our group!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Nursery" by Lights Out Escape Rooms in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Bunker" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: This was probably the best escape room experience I've had. I've been to 5 different companies and this was by far the most engaging! It's not your typical room with some decorations and puzzles, it truly feels like you're in an underground bunker trying to escape what's coming after you.We had 4 people and completed the Chapter 1 experience. The puzzles were creative and challenging. The atmosphere, story, live actors, and overall experience was incredible. We could feel the pressure of trying to escape and the fear of losing. This made the puzzles more difficult and definitely had our hearts racing. We're definitely going back to complete Chapter 2!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Bunker" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: I brought my work team here to today for a fun team building exercise. It was OUTSTANDING. The actors and all the staff were amazing, the set design and production value top notch, the story was great, and was just scary enough to be so. Much. FUN. We completed Chapter One with about 10 minutes to spare, and we will DEFINITELY be coming back for Chapter 2.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Bunker" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: The Bunker Experience helped me have a great birthday celebration with my friends! We thoroughly enjoyed Chapter 1.

room_title: Escape room "Haunting of Worthington House" by MindQuest Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: I have done escape rooms all over the East Coast and this is the one you need to go to in West Palm. We (2 players) did both the diamond heist and haunted room. Haunting room would be the most immersive in my opinion. Can accommodate a larger group than 2 people, for sure. However, I loved the puzzles in Diamond Heist. Game master was super friendly and helpful. I love rooms being realistic, intuitive puzzles, and great themes. This had all of it. Great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Haunting of Worthington House" by MindQuest Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: **Not recommended for children, the faint of heart, or those new to escape games**The Haunting was one of the best escape rooms I've ever done! My team and I didn't get out in time but in my defense we were hesitant to try anything out because we were scared of stuff jumping out at us. Besides the spookiness of it, it was a great challenge! Very creative and well-done. The game masters were also super helpful along the way. Would definitely go back to try the other (less scary) rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Haunting of Worthington House" by MindQuest Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: Our Company celebrated one of our goals by coming to mind quest for a team building/goal celebration. They allowed us to rent out all three rooms and do a cheese platter, etc. IT WAS SUCH A BLAST! My group was in the haunting room. It was soooo fun! it was a little tricky and difficult at times but all that did was make us even happier and more proud when we finally made it out. Thank you David and your entire team for making this such a great time for all of us! I will be back and we will be recommending this to many!

room_title: Escape room "Deuces Wild" by Frisco Escape Room in Breckenridge
review: My husband and I did the Deuces Wild room by ourselves and finished with 2:20 to spare. This was so engaging and so much fun. We both got things the other didn't and worked together on nearly everything. Would recommend to anyone who likes puzzles and is looking for something different!

room_title: Escape room "Deuces Wild" by Frisco Escape Room in Breckenridge
review: We did the Deuces Wild room and had fun! Great immersive room design for the theme. Enjoyed that the puzzles were challenging, but not illogical. Plus some clever mechanisms and executions that were fun reveals when you discovered them. Glad we chose to do this on our rainy day!

room_title: Escape room "Deuces Wild" by Frisco Escape Room in Breckenridge
review: A couple of my co-workers and I have never done an escape room before so this was our first experience. We had so much fun it should have been illegal! I cannot recommend this place higher. We played Deuces Wild and cannot wait to try more of the rooms Frisco Escape Room has to offer.

room_title: Escape room "Hyde Circus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The set decor is mind blowing. The puzzles are intuitive and fun. Highly recommended. My friend runs an escape room of her own and she had a blast as well.

room_title: Escape room "Hyde Circus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Was really fun and challenging. Great price for an hour of fun. Definitely will visit again very soon.

room_title: Escape room "Hyde Circus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Definitely one of the best escape rooms in town. Clean. Challenging but also not impossible to solve!

room_title: Escape room "Walkers" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: We had a great time in the "Walkers" room! Party of 6 and we did pretty good. Escaped with only 55 seconds left. Good work by our team and some helpful clues from the man behind the computer screen. Very cool experience.

room_title: Escape room "Walkers" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: Had a great time! The staff was excellent and knew exactly when to help us out with a little hint. Kids a blast. We did The Walkers room tonight but will definitely go back to do another.

room_title: Escape room "Walkers" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: We had a great time in the Walkers room! The safety video was funny, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The theming was impressive and the puzzles were varied and creative. We will definitely come back for new challenges!

room_title: Escape room "Walkers" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: Tried the Zombies room and it was an extremely fun challenge. Definitely go check out the escape rooms here! Shout out to Jill who was the clue giver to our room for making it a fantastic experience!

room_title: Escape room "Walkers" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: Absolutely loved the Walkers Room! We had so much fun, and even the hints made us laugh and cry at the same time! This was the best hr locked in a room with others ever!! The customer service was excellent and the room was super hard but soooo much fun!!! I will definitely be back for another room!!!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by San Jose Room Escape in San Jose
review: Great family fun!! Can't wait to try the Alcatraz room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by San Jose Room Escape in San Jose
review: Awesome night! Already ready to go and do the other room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by San Jose Room Escape in San Jose
review: Just went this past weekend with the family (including 15 & 16 yr old). Had a blast and both want to go again! Have refereed a half of dozen people already. You really need to give it a try.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by San Jose Room Escape in San Jose
review: Great puzzle game...the Alcatraz room is very challenging we needed a couple of extra minutes to solve it

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by San Jose Room Escape in San Jose
review: Had fun A very good place to enjoy with friends. A place to know friends talent which I never know before

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by San Jose Room Escape in San Jose
review: It was a great experience! We had a private game for our party. All puzzles were challenging! We didn't make it out but we were soooo close!! I would definitely recommend this to everyone!!!

room_title: Escape room "Catacombs" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We have previously done the Area 51 room, and now went back with a group of six 12-year-olds for a birthday and did the Catacombs. It was just as fun as Area 51, maybe a little more challenging but the set up was so creative.  Everyone enjoyed it, and they made it out (with a little help from our game master!).

room_title: Escape room "Catacombs" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Challenging and a real brain thinker but overall a great way to spend a fun night!

room_title: Escape room "Catacombs" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: My husband and I had a grown-up's night out! It was great playing with friends. Also the beginning video was funny. I had so much fun, I look forward to going back again soon!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Blackout" by Escape Room Ak in Fairbanks
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Tomb" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was one of the best experiences ever! My first time going here. The Pharaoh's Tomb was epic. I honestly didn't know what to expect. Time flew by and it was so much fun. We did escape with just a few minutes left. I definitely will be back to experience the other rooms. It is definitely a team effort to get through. Everyone brought their 'A' game.

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Tomb" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I went in last Thursday and played the Pharaoh's Tomb and One Way Ticket. Loved my experience with both rooms. Both rooms had great themes and fun puzzles. Natasha and Natalie were both great as well. Definitely check them out! The location has its own parking lot as well so it's super convenient. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Tomb" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: 8 of us did Pharaoh's Tomb. The room was so well decorated, the game was challenging, but still fun, and the operator was very helpful with clues. We had a great time, and finished with 4 minutes left. It was so much fun! I plan to come back and do other rooms, and would definitely recommend this as a group activity. Very cool!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard School" by Escape Room Vail in Avon
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: This was the best room I've ever tried in San Francisco! I liked the style and the puzzles. I and my friend spent there a great time! Highly recommended, you will not regret!

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: This room is so immersive! This is definitely in my top 5 of escape rooms in San Francisco.  The room is big enough for lots of people and has tons of puzzles.  I never felt like I had nothing to do.  There are also a few puzzles that I haven't seen anywhere else!Also without any spoilers, the ending has got to be ONE OF THE BEST!  It is such a big payoff for completing the room.

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Incredible Machine was truly an incredible game! Visited this escape room with 3 of my friends during our trip to SF, we were hooked by the unusual theme and story of the game. Decided to give it a try and didn't regret it! Puzzles were highly interactive and unique, they used some technology that I've never seen before (no spoilers=). Clues and puzzles made sense and were well though out. Heads up, this room uses a lot of audio clues, so make sure to listen carefully. We missed one of them, but our host played the audio clue for us again. And they give unlimited clues! Definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Amazing!! My husband and I tried this escape room company out based mostly on the high reviews and it 100% lived up to and exceeded our expectations.The rooms are extremely fun, challenging (in a good way) and are created with really high quality fixtures and puzzles that let you truly interact with the environment. The owners are wonderful to deal with and the pride and effort they have put into each room is clearly evident. We had to come back and do the other one it was that great - definitely definitely give this place a go, you won't regret it!

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Fun puzzles, great decoration, interesting stories... as an escape room owner myself, I'd definitely recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: On Saturday, the 24th, my friends and I went to play the Incredible machine. It was great with enough puzzles for everyone to keep busy. The puzzles were quite interactive and well thought out. Elizabeth was nice and helpful when we needed hints. :) Definitely check this place out. :)

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: We did that with our kids and cousins - We did Budapest Express and the Shanghai room. Our favorite was Budapest, but both were good. Would definitely go back.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: This place is great! Bring your significant other or family and friends. A must!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: This was my first time doing an escape room ever and even though we didn't make it out in time, we had a great time. We did the Budapest Express room and it was pretty difficult. However, our game master Francesca was really helpful and engaging, and we definitely won't forget her lol. The place itself is nice and seems fairly new and the staff there were very nice. After failing to get out, Oren explained the whole room to us, he was really patient and answered/explained everything very clearly. I will be going again and would highly recommend them to everyone.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: Loved this place! I'm an escape room junkie and I absolutely loved this location. Budapest Express was my favorite game. They had awesome puzzles and a fun atmosphere. They do a fantastic job of immersing you in the story. Very friendly staff and Erica was an awesome game master. I also liked their system for giving clues; it's very efficient compared to other places I've been.  Overall, 10 stars in my book!

room_title: Escape room "Death Row" by Pikes Peak Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: Loved the clues, so much to do and even harder to find the clues...the program gamers are out of this world with bizarre ideas and clues...we’ll definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Death Row" by Pikes Peak Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: We had a blast here! Had never done an escape room, but would highly recommend it. This was a team-building event for the office. We reserved two rooms and split into groups of six for each room. The "Death Row" room, considered intermediate, was a challenge. We thoroughly enjoyed it and completed it in 48 minutes. What a fun way to spend some time with friends, coworkers, family members, and really use your brain. You'll enjoy this!

room_title: Escape room "Death Row" by Pikes Peak Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: Staff was very friendly, puzzles were fun to figure out. And when we got stuck, they gave us just enough assistance to help figure out the puzzle. Such a fun time!

room_title: Escape room "Death Row" by Pikes Peak Escape Rooms in Colorado Springs
review: Our entire group had a fantastic time and the clues were tough enough to keep us working hard but solvable, for us to be successful. We did the Death Row Room, amazingly well done!! Every detail was great. We will for sure all be returning to solve another room's mysteries. Suggestion .. only that it'd be fun to have a small champagne toast at the end for a celebration, even non alcoholic would be great, just a Toast to Team Work Well done!! Thank you for a fun evening!!

room_title: Escape room "The Cube" by Padlocked Inc. in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Smart Escape in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Time Bender" by Adventure Rooms in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Escape This Live: Columbus in Columbus (GA)
review: We went to Escape This Live to try out Asylum last night. There were three of us and we were happily included in a group of 6 others. The 9 of us without ever meeting worked really well together to figure out the room and escape in time! We even set a new monthly record! We had a blast - the workers were both great throughout the whole time and answered any questions we had. We will absolutely be back!

room_title: World of Escapes
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2: The Hive" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: This was a fun experience. Highly interactive and pull you immediately into the story plot. There is a scare factor so come prepared. Also try to wear closed toe shoes since it's pretty dark in there. I'd definitely enjoyed this escape room and recommend everyone to give it a try!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2: The Hive" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: This was our 20th escape room and we were very impressed. I would definitely recommend doing it. We did chapter 1 and 2 back to back. If you have the time, definitely the way to go!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2: The Hive" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: We had such a blast tonight! I've always wanted to do an Escape Room and I'm so happy that we chose The Bunker Experience. We had a private event and we also elected catering by Pop Champagne, both were amazing! The 50-minute escape room was more challenging than expected but our group had loads of fun solving each puzzle and moving on to the next one. The whole experience was top-notch, highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Glad that one of our friends suggested that we try this new game room in the city and we weren't disappointed! We had an awesome time and the room was well thought out and was well made. We've tried different escape rooms in the city and so far, I would say, theirs are the best in terms of props/production. I really liked and highly recommend it. Check them out!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Great escape room experience ! Loved it, lots of fun. Highly recommended. Very experienced escape roomers. This was at the top.

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Gold Rush was a fantastic escape room. Highly recommend for a group of teen boys. And if you book 7 people they give you the room to your self which was great. Room was challenging but do-able, and bonus if you do it on your bday you get a special sticker and pin!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Found this place just walking past. Great to find. Staff are amazingly helpful. We played 1 game (don’t know the name of the gentleman who helped us), the staff member who walked us through everything and gave us unlimited clues (we were terrible). He even gave us an extra 3 minutes to help us complete the last puzzle. The game we played was called gold rush and was challenging but again the man who helped was great - hopefully can visit again soon!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: The Escape Game has some of the most amazing escape room experiences! We completed the Gold Rush room and the decor and design of the room was fantastic. There were puzzles that I had never seen before and the detail that went into the tools/clues were awesome! The puzzles were challenging while also able to be completed with common sense. We did not need to use any clues to solve the room and that made the experience all the more immersive. Highly recommend and we'll be back to solve the other rooms soon! Tip for those visiting, 7/10 is not so challenging. My teammates and I have about 5 rooms experience on average and we completed the room in about 25min out of the hour provided. If you and your party have experience with escape rooms, you may want to aim for one of the rooms that are ranked 8-9/10 for a harder challenge.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Apocalypse - Destination Paris" by ALL IN Adventures Milford in New Haven
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: We escaped! We did The Code with a group of 5 people and had a blast! The best escape room I’ve done!! Definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: This place was awesome! We had a lot of fun and it was very challenging. Definitely want to go again and try out the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
