review: Honestly, I was ready to do another one immediately. "Hostage" was a great room and Harley was an awesome game master. He let us fail, but was able to help at key times so that we still made it out.

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: We did Hostage but unfortunately didn't escape in time. It was a lot of fun though. There were 4 in our party and we got paired with 2 other couples. We all worked well together and had a great time trying to figure out the clues. My tip...don't overthink!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Booked the hostage game for my husband's birthday and invited three other couples... We had a blast! Our gamemaster, Parker, was fabulous!

room_title: Escape room "Castaway" by Tropic Escape in Fort Myers
review: Sooo much fun! Hard as heck, but so much fun! We’ll be back to do a different room. We did Castaway.

room_title: Escape room "Castaway" by Tropic Escape in Fort Myers
review: We have done a lot of escape rooms across the Southeast, and Tropic Escape Rooms is our favorite of Southwest Florida - Naples, Ft. Myers, Bonita Springs, Estero. We have made three visits to Tropic, and played their Museum, Finals and Castaway rooms. All of the rooms told an interesting story and the game masters were very helpful and welcoming. I'd recommend their rooms to both enthusiasts in the area and new players. This venue is clearly run and designed by people who also love escape games, and they built rooms they'd want to play. And most of all, they've built their rooms to be fun from start to finish. Their most recently built room Castaway really stands out in its overall story and complexity. The designs of the multiple rooms within this experience were extremely detailed. For Southwest Florida, this is perhaps the most highly immersive escape game with so many spaces, and a tight storyline. As Tropic continues to grow, we will definitely return.

room_title: Escape room "Castaway" by Tropic Escape in Fort Myers
review: My wife and I have played over 60 escape rooms all over the southeast and Tropic Escape's Rooms are definitely in the top tier of games we've played. The place is a 20-30 minute drive from the Naples area but well worth the trip. We first played the "Almost Famous" room and later in the week played the "Castaway" room. Both were fantastic and very well done.Almost Famous had great scenic and state-of-the-art equipment inside the room. One of my favorite parts of this room is that you have to make a decision before you even start the game that leads to one of the most unique final puzzles I've ever seen! The tech in this room is amazing. There were a variety of really fun, immersive, hands on puzzles that lead to a "Wow, how did they make that work?" reaction when solved. Overall, a very, very fun room.Castaway is touted as their most difficult room and they are not kidding. The room is very challenging, but in a fun way, not in a frustrating or tedious way. There are a lot of puzzles to solve, but the solutions to the puzzles are logical, make sense, and can be solved reasonably quick once you figure out what to do. There is not a lot of "busy work" to do just to eat up time. The scenic is also extremely well done. The immersion factor is on point with lightning effects, flickering lights, and the sound of thunder welcoming you as soon as you walk into the room. This room offers several other "wow" factors as well.After we finished, we spent some time speaking to the owner and you could tell he got into the escape game business because he loved it. He told us that he only designs and builds games that he'd want to play and be proud of. He is passionate about the industry and you can see that in the product he's created. I highly recommend giving this place a visit. They are among the best in the area.

room_title: Escape room "Taphophobia" by The Crooked Key in Steamboat Springs
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Return of the Paranormal Investigator" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: First off, I want to thank the staff for accommodating us without a reservation! This was our first escape room, and we had a blast! We wanted to start another room immediately after finishing The Return of The Paranormal Investigator. So... needless to say, my friends & I will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Return of the Paranormal Investigator" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: If you are looking for a fun, out-of-the-ordinary experience that is perfect for a family, work group, church, fraternity or sorority, ANY group that would have fun working together, Central Arkansas Escape Room is it! The problems were inventive and worked together well in reaching the final solution (Very clever writing!) We already have plans to bring another family group back at Christmas and this has got us anxious for the Escape Room's next story/escape in the spring!

room_title: Escape room "Tesla’s Secret" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Lots of fun. Staff was great and helpful. Room was challenging and interesting. I went with my grandson and it was fine; probably even more fun with three or four people.

room_title: Escape room "Tesla’s Secret" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I love this Escape room! It was my second time there and can’t wait to go explore the third room soon! Beautifully staged room, game is so much fun and all employees very helpful. Definitely go

room_title: Escape room "Tesla’s Secret" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: It was my first time going to an escape room and it was awesome so much fun.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Plank Escape" by The Mansion Escape Room in Tallahassee
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Out of Order" by Brain Busters Escape Rooms in Daleville
review: Had an awesome time playing Out of Order last night. The most interactive escape room we've done. Staff were wonderful and we had fun enjoying some magic tricks after we escaped the room.

room_title: Escape room "Cartel: DEA Undercover" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Fantastic staff. Easily the best production value in an escape room I've ever seen. Definitely worth your time and money!

room_title: Escape room "Cartel: DEA Undercover" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Game Master J was awesome! Thanks for being patient with us :) Tip: follow the instructions they give you at the beginning!

room_title: Escape room "Cartel: DEA Undercover" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Jacob is THE BEST GAME MASTER EVER! It was my first time doing an escape room and I did it with 5 of my friends on a Sunday afternoon for my friend's bday. We walked into a room after being introduced to the problem we'd have to solve, and at first I was surprised because there was not much in the room, but there ended up being so many puzzles! It made me super hyped after we got a clue and got to go to the other rooms. Would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape the Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Awesome family time fun. Angie was so helpful with hints but not giving it all away. Our family of 5 all enjoyed themselves which is difficult with a 6, 9, and 13.

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape the Room LA in Los Angeles
review: We walked in without a reservation, and were able to join another group of 3. 5 seemed like the perfect amount of people for the western room! The design was beautiful, and all of the clues flowed together so nicely. It was definitely a challenging room, but with all participants having previous escape room experience, we managed to get out with 15 minutes to spare! Highly recommended, and cannot wait to try more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist 2.0" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Nathan is amazing! We made a last minute booking and he stayed overtime just so we can get the chance to do the Bank Heist. Which is an amazing escape room btw! Highly recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist 2.0" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We decided to stop in on our honeymoon and check out Exodus. On the drive over we were nervous and not sure what to expect. When we arrived we signed our waiver and we're locked up in our room. With teamwork and focusing on each others strengths we were able to escape with just 5 mins to spare. We had an incredible time and are definitely coming back to visit and try the other rooms! Thank you for making our honeymoon unique and unforgettable!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist 2.0" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Bank Heist in Rowland Heights was a blast! Connor & Nathan were awesome hosts and we can't wait to try the other rooms. It was just the right amount of difficulty for a group of 3-6. We definitely recommend this experience. So much fun!!!

room_title: Escape room "Welcome to the Afterverse" by Totem Escape in San Jose
review: Three adult children and I visited this escape room. We had been caught up in traffic and were a couple of minutes late and they were very nice to us. We had a great time and barely made it out of there in time.

room_title: Escape room "Welcome to the Afterverse" by Totem Escape in San Jose
review: This place was SO MUCH FUN! We went with a group of 7 to "Welcome to the Afterverse" and love every minute of it. We escaped the room after solving a myriad of various puzzles and would love to do it again. Our game master was awesome and added so much to the experience!

room_title: Escape room "Welcome to the Afterverse" by Totem Escape in San Jose
review: Very pleased with my first escape room experience here at Totem Escape. Our game master, Megan, was a delight and made the whole thing so great for us. We did the Into The Afterverse room. Highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: We escaped from the Basement. Twelve of us. It was exhilarating. We had previously done the Boiler Room. Even though we missed escaping it was still great fun (We subsequently went back and conquered it). The Boiler Room puzzles are sequential; you have to solve puzzle 1 to get to 2 ... The Basement is more of a free-for-all. We went as six couples who were friends; I think it might not be as fun to do with strangers. Not that there's anything wrong with strangers. A tip that we figured out after the fact: Designate one person to be the master of all the clues, etc. That way everything will be kept track of and there won't be a lot of redundant effort. Good luck!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: The Basement was my first ever escape room experience, and I can say it was one of the most amazing things I have ever experienced let alone in Los Angeles.They have made an amazing back story and theme for the entire attraction. My group tried both of the rooms they offer - the Basement and the Boiler Room. We failed both but came within seconds of solving the Boiler Room! The rooms are definitely far from an easy ride which just adds to their attraction. As of writing they are opening a third room next month which will be their longest yet - I am so excited to try it out next time I go to LA!The atmosphere, puzzles and employees make this an unmissable thing to do - you won't be disappointed no matter what kind of person you are. The whole thing is extremely innovative and for replay value they even have three different versions of the Basement which changes things up enough to essentially make it a new game. When they open the third room this means that you could easily visit at least 5 times, and I am sure they will look into adding different versions of the Boiler Room and third room in the future as long as they show continued popularity.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: We played their new room...and it is amazing...like you are really in the movie...still under impression after one day... Just a note, if you are a scary person this might not be the game for you... Of cours recomended :)

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: I've been in a few escape rooms now and I always have fun. The Basement was probably the most atmospheric room I've been in and I'll definitely be going back to do the Boiler Room and the Study.The price is a little high at $35 for 45 minutes but as a one off experience I can accept that. The one issue I had is that I booked with a group of 4 but we were then put in with another group of 6, without being told. I understand the company want to maximize their profit but I feel the more people in the room, the less you each experience and so I would have liked to have been notified before hand.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: This is one of the most unique, awesome experiences ever!!! You really feel like you are on the set of a creepy movie. It is fun if you go with a group of your friends and you reserve all the spots. I went to the Basement- haven't tried the Boiler Room yet, that is next !!!They have a safe spot where you can leave your keys, phone and purse which is nice. Good luck !! My group escaped with only 8 minutes left on the clock ! Worth the money.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: Amazing experience...will definitely be back to try it again! We failed to escape the basement but we are determined to not end up in Edward Tandy's freezer again! A lot of thought and detail went into making this experience very realistic. The props, art work and noises really make you feel like your trapped in a mad man's basement. I brought my gf, who is a big horror movie fan, for her bday and she loved it! She spent the first five minutes of the experience checking out how well the room was decorated. I had to remind her that we were on a time limit and had to start looking for clues to get out. If you haven't tried it yet, I definitely recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: Four of us signed up for the Basement ( not ready for the Boiler) and it definitely was an amazing experience!!! It was worth every dollar and I am definitely going back to try to make it out alive.It was planned out really well and I'm still not over it!!

room_title: Escape room "The Maker’s Morgue" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: We had such a great time tonight! One if by Land was challenging but tons of fun. The owners are incredibly nice and accommodating. Looking forward to trying another room soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Maker’s Morgue" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: Great experience! Family friendly and fun. Put our history-loving kid to the test. We will definitely go again.

room_title: Escape room "The Maker’s Morgue" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: Time Travel Escapes was a fantastic Escape Room experience! Although this was only my second time playing, I had a great time! Three of us tackled the Paul Revere themed puzzle: challenging AND rewarding, and the room setup was super-cool! Rooms within rooms within rooms!The Dawsons have put a ton of time and effort into creating a very enjoyable and rewarding Escape Room experience. I can't wait to go back and try out the rest of the rooms! I'd recommend this to anyone who enjoys mind challenges and mental puzzles and teamwork!P.S. Our team of three crushed the room, finishing in just under an hour as the first team in over 200 who finished the room without any hints. Beat that! ;)

room_title: Escape room "Mission Sigma VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: Great fun! We had my sons 12 year old party here. You can bring your own food. Super chill and great pricing.

room_title: Escape room "Mission Sigma VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: Great place for parties or any other group activities with family or friends ❤️❤️❤️

room_title: Escape room "Mission Sigma VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: We (my twins are 9) have been to the VR Tech Lounge probably 12 times, and have gotten to know the owners, who are very kind, and seem genuinely excited to share their business and the VR experience with you.  Even though I'm 50, I have only been once and NOT joined them.  It's amazing.

room_title: Escape room "The Father of Silicon Valley" by BreakoutStudios in San Jose
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Professor Moriarty’s Gameroom" by The Great Escape Room in Tampa
review: Brandon was fantastic and the Gameroom was challenging! Loved it!

room_title: Escape room "Professor Moriarty’s Gameroom" by The Great Escape Room in Tampa
review: The Game Room and Pierre are great! So much fun with my work peeps!

room_title: Escape room "Professor Moriarty’s Gameroom" by The Great Escape Room in Tampa
review: I went with a group of 7 people for a birthday celebration and we had a blast! We were in the game room and even though we failed we loved it. Diana was our room helper and she did a great job explaining how the room worked and helping us with clues when we were allowed to ask.I definitely want to go back and try another room. Perfect for large parties or even a fun date night. I can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Professor Moriarty’s Gameroom" by The Great Escape Room in Tampa
review: We had a great time with Branden in the Game Room. We had 11 people and it was lots of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Playbook" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: Lots of fun! The young man working the desk was engaging and made the experience great. We did the Playbook with two 12-year-olds. Challenging but fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Playbook" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: First time ever trying one of these. We found Saban's Playbook! More fun than I even expected! We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Playbook" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: Escape Tuscaloosa is fun and challenging! It is very organized and the staff is GREAT! Great activity for small groups! We found the Playbook!

room_title: Escape room "Room 751" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: We had such a good time! The whole experience was great. Looking forward to your next room!

room_title: Escape room "Room 751" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: This is the best escape room we've tried! So much fun. Definitely recommend for team building!

room_title: Escape room "Room 751" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: My fiancé and I were invited to Locked Inn by friends of ours who have been before. It was absolutely amazing!! I was blown away by all of the intricate details, atmosphere, and the puzzles themselves. 100% will recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Room 751" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: We loved our experience! Had so much fun! Can't wait to do another! Would recommend this to all my friends and family! Even if you are unsure, take the leap. It's worth it!

room_title: Escape room "Room 751" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: This was such a blast! I recommend this place... Great staff. It was definitely a bonding experience, working together and communicating... I can't wait until they have more rooms open!

room_title: Escape room "The Slammer!" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Santa's Naughty List" by The Greatest Escape Games in Colorado Springs
review: We had a lot of fun for my daughter's 11th birthday party in the Santa Claus room. The facility was very accommodating, allowing us to use a room afterward for cake and presents. Only bummer was that we figured out the code to get out about 5 seconds after they opened the door. Next time, we'll try a different room and escape!

room_title: Escape room "Black Ops - Destination Classified" by ALL IN Adventures Milford in New Haven
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Great attraction! They really exceeded every expectation we had. Really great and surprising. Highly recommended for groups!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Fun funny smartLove it!!!! Highly recommend!! You guys have to try

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Had so much fun finding clues and solving puzzle made it it right on time !!! Great room great experience wish I could do it again !!!:)

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: We absolutely loved it. Great for a date, ice breaker and teams learning to work together. So much fun. We haven't laughed and smiled so much in a long time. Awesome! Would love to do it again. Must open/find more of these.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun at The Great Redemption Escape Room, Van Nuys! We were able to escape our cell by solving difficult riddles and by unlocking many locks to find 1 million dollars to clear our name and escape our room! From locks, to passwords, to blacklights, and special cameras... The Great Redemption is a definite place to go!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: A very clever room with several twists on puzzles. Good use of red herrings. Enough puzzles to keep a group of six busy. Wish there were a few more as we escaped with about 10 min to spare. I enjoy getting to the last few minutes with the adrenaline pumping. Would be interested on returning if they had additional rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Witching Hour" by Q: The Live Escape Experience in Fort Collins
review: We had a great time and the rooms were awesome. The staff was fun with their characters. Totally recommend the Witching Hour room, it was so much fun and great riddles!! Thank you!!

room_title: Escape room "The Witching Hour" by Q: The Live Escape Experience in Fort Collins
review: Last year we visited the Q: The Live Escape Experience in Loveland and this year we decided to try the one in Greeley. It's in a basement which gives an eerie feeling before you even enter the Escape Room. We chose the Witching Hour. It was a lot of fun and we made it out at 59:59 minutes. Although I think the employee was generous letting us have that last second. We plan to go back every year for team building.

room_title: Escape room "The Witching Hour" by Q: The Live Escape Experience in Fort Collins
review: We brought our team of 5 to the Greeley, CO location and attempted to solve "The Witching Hour". What an experience that was enjoyed by all! I would advise anyone to go and participate.!!! It was a blast!!

room_title: Escape room "Pacific Rim: Shatterdome Defenders" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: We were able to find an open game slot the day of for a group of 6, awesome.  We did Pacific Rim, very cool!!  I personally think it helps to have seen the movie so you get the objective and some of the team requirements (like drifting).  Our group was 6 adults, 4 kids (10-13).  This was my second escape room, and I thought it was a really hard one.  There are a lot of mental puzzles, my kids had a hard time deciphering those.  They did have some physical challenges they could do, but they were out matched with this game, in my opinion.  They advised no less than 13 and I believe that is good advice.  Our MC was perfect, he helped just enough to keep it fun (versus really frustrating) but didn't give anything away, it was still a lot of hard work!  We didn't save the world, but our group still had a really great time!

room_title: Escape room "Pacific Rim: Shatterdome Defenders" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: Awesome first escape room experience! We did the Pacific Rim themed one and you definitely don't need to have seen the movie to participate. We didn't escape but we got really close. If we had about 15 more minutes we would've been okay but I'd say that's a win for the majority of our group being inexperienced with escape rooms. I don't want to spoil any of the layout or specifics but staff was super accommodating and helpful. Definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Pacific Rim: Shatterdome Defenders" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: Looking for a fun activity to do as a family with our two teenage kids (13 & 16), we thought we'd give this a try. We chose the Pacific Rim game as it had an element of technology for our digital natives. It was lots of fun and time flew by. Our game host let us sweat just the right amount, but helped us along the way with a few clues when needed. Not only was it lots of fun and kept us on our toes the whole time, but it was really nice to see the family come together, each one taking on different roles naturally. It gave for a fun conversation afterward too on what we learned and how we can do things differently when we try another one, because we definitely will.

room_title: Escape room "Shadow Detectives" by Crystal River Room Escape in Crystal River
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: My friends wanted to do a girls night here. When you book the room, you have the option of booking it individually for that room. When we arrived, I guess someone else also booked the room, so he joined our girls night. lol. So there was a total of 5 of us. We ended up doing the Collector room. We were definitely advised that it was a very difficult room, which they were definitely right about that. You have to figure out a lot of combinations to open some locks. There is also some math involved, so bring someone who is good at math. I think it was a fun experience, the only thing I didn't like is if you ask for a clue then they take some time off of your clock. I've been to two other Escape rooms and I've never heard of that. They give you pretty good hints, so I don't think you'll need the clues, however we still did. lol. We were able to make it out with 4 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This is the first time we have been to this particular escape room, and we chose to do The Collector room. It was definitely a challenging one, but it was worth trying to do. I've been to other escape rooms, and this one is a little different when it comes to hints. The first hint will cost you 1 minute, the 2nd one 3 minutes, and the third one 5 minutes. They had a television in the room with the timer, and this particular room had some higher-tech type puzzles. We had a good time there and would definitely go back to try the other rooms. Thanks to the staff for your enthusiasm and professionalism.

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We just went to this escape room with 4 people in our group and it was amazing! We went to other escape rooms as well but this one was our favorite. We tried The Collector. I would definitely recommend going with a bigger group because this was the hardest room! We were the first group to try this room(literally finished the room two minutes before we showed up) and although we did not make it, the two guys running the room were very helpful with guiding us. I would 10/10 recommend this place. They are very accommodating and the staff was super friendly!

room_title: Escape room "Hackers Headquarters" by Source Code Escape Games in Augusta
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Search for Sasquatch" by Mountain Time Escape Rooms in Breckenridge
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by ROOM 5280 in Denver
review: Our family was in town and looking for something to do to kill some time.  We did the experiment room and had a great time.  Our host was very good and amusing.  We did escape with a few hints from the host.  It was the first escape room experience for most in our group, and they all loved it.  I would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by ROOM 5280 in Denver
review: I've been to an escape room once before by a different company and did not have a great time and was very hesitant on going to another. I had a lot of friends in town suggesting we do one and found Room 5280. This experience was unforgettable. It had unique and creative puzzles for everyone. We had a group of 6. Many of the puzzles went over my head, but others in the group were able to solve them while the same applied vice versa.We did The Experiment and couldn't have had a better time. It was in a safe part of the city and the staff were very welcoming and friendly.

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by ROOM 5280 in Denver
review: It was our first time at an escape room and we decided to try "The Experiment" room. The staff was very helpful and super friendly. Puzzles were challenging and entertaining, we all had a blast! Great teamwork experience and had a super fun time.

room_title: Escape room "The Museum Robbery" by Escape on Palafox in Pensacola
review: We had such and awesome time! Escaped Museum Robbery with a few mins to spare!

room_title: Escape room "The Museum Robbery" by Escape on Palafox in Pensacola
review: Great rooms and great staff. We did the Museum Art Gallery and it was awesome. Very challenging and extremely creative puzzles and clues. I Highly recommend them.

room_title: Escape room "The Museum Robbery" by Escape on Palafox in Pensacola
review: Took my mom for Mother's Day. When the rest of the group showed up we split into guys vs. girls. We were working on the last clue in the museum when time ran out. Had so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Museum Robbery" by Escape on Palafox in Pensacola
review: We escaped the Museum Room - the laser on the last room was a little weak so it took some time to crack that last code.. apart from that - our group had a great time and we definitely want to come back again and do the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "The Kronos Initiative" by The Spacetime Travel Agency in Sebastopol
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Doggy Dog World" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: I am finally getting around to reviewing this room - I just had to! My husband and I have done about 50 rooms and Doggy Dog World is our favorite so far. At first, we were concerned that it would be too easy (the pictures make it seem a bit kid-oriented). But, I'm glad I didn't let that stop us from checking it out. We had a blast! The puzzles are challenging but not frustratingly so and the overall concept is so unique and creative, we wish there were a ton more like it. If you're looking for a great room, try this one - you won't be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "Doggy Dog World" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: Did the Doggy Room for my husbands birthday and what a treat it was! So much fun and a great idea for date night! The puzzles were super smart too !

room_title: Escape room "Doggy Dog World" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: I just heard that Doggy Dog World will only be around a few more months and could close in summer (2019). This is a wonderful room - lots of fun and really well done. If you haven't done it, I recommend making time to play before the room closes.

room_title: Escape room "Black Site Prison" by Solve the Room Hawaii in Honolulu
review: Our least favoriteroom from this company. Theming was okay, cooperative puzzle design was good. There were too many red herrings that wasted our time rather than having more interesting puzzles to solve. The construction of the room was a bit flimsy. Photos placed on the wall in critical positions were pinned and fell off the wall instead of screwed in place. There were arrows drawn on duck tape that was worn off making a major puzzle difficult to solve. Both caused us to waste time. This room needs maintenance. The one electronic puzzle was frustratingly “finicky” as the game master put it. We knew the solution but had to fiddle with the puzzle components for 5 minutes before the game master came in and make it work. When the gamemaster enters the room it breaks up the immersion of the experience. This really needs to be fixed. The hint system used a radio. Players should have their hands free. The radio had multiple channels and the one correct channel was changed by mistake. The game master never told us what channel we needed so he had to enter the room to help which breaks up the immersion of the game. All of this is unavoidable. A better hint system uses the cameras and audio with hints displayed on the timer monitor. Please fix.

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: I tried 'The Seance' with my co-workers. The room was fun! A creepy overall feel to the room but it was not too scary. I think a team of 4-5 people is good for this room. Overall it was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: I loved the Seance room! It was eerie and creepy but exciting! I remember playing The Study before it retired and the games get better and better! There's so much excitement and I definitely want to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: Great local escape room offering a variety of escape experiences. We played at maximum capacity in one of their scenarios, "The Seance." Even with six people, it did not feel crowded or simple.The owner was very kind and explained the rules well while keeping the tone lighthearted. I will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: We had 12 people, so we split into 2 teams. The room we did was Séance. I can say it's a hard room, with 28% success rate per our host. My team finished the room and we beat our friends. It was challenging, but fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: I tried 'The Seance' with my coworkers. I really liked that they have 2 identical rooms so you can face off with another team. The room was fun! A creepy overall feel to the room but it was not 'scary'. I think a team of 4-5 people is good for this room. Overall it was a blast!!

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: Loved it! So much fun! Great team building experience with co-workers! I'll go back again with friends. Tried the seance room & I say tried because we didn't escape! Very challenging but so fun! Try it you'll love it!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Our family team of 6 ranged in ages from 92 to 14!  Yes, we escaped from the CABIN!!!  Everyone contributed; we were down to the last minute.  What fun, couldn't find a better experience that includes all ages.  It does help if you have done one of these escape rooms before, however, not necessary.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: First time with this company. There were 6 of us: age range 32 to 13 years old. We did The Cabin. Tons of great creative puzzles. We escaped with 6 minutes to spare. Love how they have a countdown timer. Room has a 30% escape rate, so we basically rocked it. We will definitely return to try the other rooms they offer.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This place was a lot of fun! We entered the Excido and the guy working was very nice, explained everything to us very well. There were six of us locked in a room, trying to beat the clock to get out of the cabin. The place is clean and organized. He gave us a radio for us to communicate with him, you can receive a hint. We used that up pretty quick.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Office" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: What a great experience for our first escape room! I would definitely recommend going, especially the Doctor's Office room!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Office" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: It was our first time going. My fiance and I enjoyed ourselves, it was so amazing. Excited to go back again

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Office" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: It was just my friend and me in the Dr. Office. It was challenging but definitely fun! We almost made it out too. It had a great spooky vibe. Thank you again to the people who were working there today - ya'll were super accommodating. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Office" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Wow! We had a blast. This was my 2nd Escape Room ever and our group loved it. It was very immersive and creepy. We did the Doctors Room and made it out with just seconds to spare. Our game master was so sweet and I will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta

review: Had a blast definitely the best escape room I have done. The owner is for sure part of why it is so great. If you haven't tried it yet what are you waiting for go check it out. Thanks for the great memory.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Eureka Springs Bank Heist" by Escape Room 13 in Eureka Springs

room_title: Escape room "The Great Eureka Springs Bank Heist" by Escape Room 13 in Eureka Springs
review: Very well put together escape room. We had an absolute blast. Looking forward to doing it again next time we are in town.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Eureka Springs Bank Heist" by Escape Room 13 in Eureka Springs
review: Have done other escape rooms and this one in Eureka Springs is top notch. Would recommend this game room to anyone looking for a fun time with friends or family.

room_title: Escape room "The Cranial Carnival" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: This was my first escape room and it was awesome! Great team-building exercise. Keep it up guys! Can't wait to do another one!

room_title: Escape room "The Cranial Carnival" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: The Cranial CarnivalBrought a large group of co-workers out to Escapedom, so large that we had to split up and did all 3 of their rooms.  My group went through Cranial Carnival so this review will be about that room specifically.  The idea is that you have to enter a boy's mind and lock up bad memories that have traumatized him and put him into a coma.  Not the most believable of premises but fine.  I'll roll with it.After explaining the backstory, the GM walked us to the "brain" door and in we went.  I thought the entrance into the room was a little disappointing and could have been much more creative an in-line with the story (traveling down a dark passage way, a red slide), really anything more than just a doorway.   The production in the first room was decent but really felt like a square room filled with puzzles.  Other than the occasional pink squiggles on the wall, there was nothing really organic about it.  With a couple of exceptions, the puzzles seemed to mirror the memories that the boy had experienced at the circus.  A healthy dose of scavenging kicked off the room and we wasted time looking through the non-linear puzzles that are unsolvable until you finish the scavenger hunt.  One magnet/coin maze was a difficult frustrating time sync and we had some tech issues with an 8-sided polyhedron puzzle and one "locked" door was open.  That was room 1.  Room 2 was a mixed bag of some clever puzzles, some not so clever puzzles (light clock), and some downright frustrating tasks (fishing).  In hindsight, it was the tech issues that did us in and we came up about 2 minutes short of escaping.  Not the best, not the worst room, I've done and comes in at #112 out of 168 rooms I've done to date.

room_title: Escape room "The Cranial Carnival" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Just successfully escaped from Cranial Carnival, the newest of Escapedom’s rooms. Like their first two rooms, production quality was great, the puzzles were unique, and the puzzles weren’t all linear so it was ideal for our large group of eleven. A lot of great “aha” moments. Chase was a great game master! Definitely recommend this room to newbies as well as experienced players. Thanks for another awesome room, Escapedom! 😊

room_title: Escape room "Doll House" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix

room_title: Escape room "The Office" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: Time Escape was a fantastic experience all around. HIGHLY recommend “Escape the Office” for any avid fans. The staff was very friendly and made the experience even better. Will definitely be returning!

room_title: Escape room "The Office" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins

room_title: Escape room "999 Strange Place" by Enter the Room in Colorado Springs
review: This was our first escape room and we had a blast! I can’t wait to see what the next theme will be!

review: This was the coolest thing ever! We did the 999 Strange Place and it was so much fun. They work hard to put these rooms together and it is definitely worth going. Really challenges the mind in a very exciting way.

room_title: Escape room "Beyond the Flower Shop" by EscapeWorks Denver in Denver
review: We had so much fun. It was challenging, but the clues help. We didn't finish, but came very close. We did the flower shop. Can't wait to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Apothecary" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.

room_title: Escape room "The Wizard's Apothecary" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.

room_title: Escape room "Lunar Escape" by Mission Escapes in Denver
review: My friends and I love doing escape rooms in AZ so when I was visiting a best friend in Denver we absolutely had to do one with her family. review: Lunar Escape was the 7th or 8th escape room I've done.  Hands down my favorite.  The story was interesting, the clues were challenging but made sense, great room.

room_title: Escape room "Lunar Escape" by Mission Escapes in Denver
review: Mission Escapes has the best rooms in the Denver Area! I've done 21 different escape rooms and Lunar Escape is at the top of the list! A few of us went back to do Treasure Hunt and we had a blast doing that one as well. Open up more rooms!

review: So much fun! Great clues if needed. I love that all rooms are private no matter if it’s just 2 people. I have had some experiences with overbearing people that makes it uncomfortable.

room_title: Escape room "The Twisted Curse of Madame Antinori" by Time Trapped Escape Room in Tampa
review: Very good escape room. cool themes and well thought out puzzles. Also good hints. Would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Twisted Curse of Madame Antinori" by Time Trapped Escape Room in Tampa

room_title: Escape room "A Knight To Escape" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: We have played 2 games at The Escape Effect now and can’t say enough great things! The owner is extremely friendly and clearly passionate about escape games! We played the new 2 hour A Knight to Escape and it has been one for the books for sure. Both the design and concept were amazing and have surpassed all others in the area, imho. As a family we have played well over 20 games or so and this has been a favorite by far! Please check this place out and support this local business!!

room_title: Escape room "A Knight To Escape" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: You will not be disappointed!! I went there with my group the evening of 8/4/19. After scouring the Internet looking for an escape room we picked this one because of the 2 hour 'A knight to escape'. It was an absolute blast! We were so impressed we decided to do another one, 'Sherlock Studies'. Again, it was amazing and we had so much fun! I cannot say enough good things about this place! The couple that owns this place is amazing and so friendly- they've put their blood, sweat and tears into this place and it shows. There are so many little details to appreciate in the building and in the rooms. If you want a memorable experience and fun time, this is the place to come! Also, for those wondering, when we booked our party, it was just us- we we weren't paired with strangers (some places do that) which made the experience so much better! They also will give you as much or as little help as you want (other places give you a max of 3 questions). I will alway recommend this place and will be returning for sure!!!! thank you for being Awesome!!

room_title: Escape room "A Knight To Escape" by The Escape Effect in Orlando
review: My husband and I came here with his brother and wife and played A knight to escape, the two hour room. We were separated most of the time working together between rooms to solve clues. It was super involving and puzzles /clues to next puzzle flowed smoothly. Everything in this room was amazing and high quality. We highly recommend The Escape Effect.

room_title: Escape room "The School of Sorcery" by Exit Game in Los Angeles

review: The people who work there are SO FRIENDLY! And I was super impressed by the game exhibits! I had A LOT of fun! I would definitely go again.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Jail Escape" by Exit 2 Escape in San Jose
review: Loved it! We did the wild western jail escape and it was definitely challenging but so fun. I love how it's a family business and they come up with everything. We were a group of 5 and it was the first time for most of us. We were all raving about it when we got out and plan on doing another!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Jail Escape" by Exit 2 Escape in San Jose
review: Such a good time. Took our family members visiting from out of state here and had a blast. Did the Jail Cell Western themed escape adventure and enjoyed the entire thing. We escaped with only 2 seconds remaining. It's great because everyone got involved, we laughed and searched and searched for clues. On the car ride home, already got requests to go again! We will be back for sure!!!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West Jail Escape" by Exit 2 Escape in San Jose
review: Had a great time with the medieval and western jail themed rooms. The employees were courteous and helpful (Sarah... and I can't remember the other girl's name, but they were great!). Great escape room experience and I've been through about 12 of these now.

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Laboratory" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: We did the Alchemist's Lab about a month ago and it was fantastic! The puzzles were challenging, but not impossible, and the clues were well thought out and presented! Our group had a great time! Definitely something we'd recommend to others and WILL be doing again in the future!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Laboratory" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: We did "The Alchemist Lab" late last Friday night and thoroughly enjoyed it! Fun, frustrating, challenging, adrenaline-pumping adventure... Definitely want to do it again. Great way to celebrate our daughter-in-law's 25th birthday, and WE DID IT with a little over 7 minutes to spare!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Laboratory" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: This was so much fun! We did the Alchemist Room. It was definitely challenging! Our group of 6 were age 12-62 and everyone of us had a fantastic time!Christine was amazing!!! She made it even better!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Laboratory" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: So much fun!!! The staff were friendly, welcoming, and helped make our experience even better. The room had puzzles that were appropriately challenging and a lot of fun to work through. We did the Alchemist Lab but will DEFINITELY be back to try out Missile Silo. We loved it!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in San Jose
review: This experience was very disappointing. This takes place in a room that must be 10 feet by 8 feet, door closed, lights out. There was no real point, no rhyme or reason to it, etc. Not at ALL like other escape rooms we have seen/experienced. We had our family of 5 there, ages 16 to 74, and we all agreed that it was a complete waste of time. Laser Quest is clearly just trying to make extra money with one of their unused small rooms, without really providing any "experience" at all. The employee checking us in was super nice, but the experience was terrible.Do NOT waste your money or your time !

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in San Jose
review: Had a fun time with the kids here. Challenging enough, but not too hard and everyone got a chance to participate.

room_title: Escape room "Serial Killer" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
review: The serial killer room was a lot of fun! Creepy, challenging, and creatively put together. The staff were awesome as well - very entertaining and customer service oriented. We also noticed they have a lively game night at Will You Escape. Another reason to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Serial Killer" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
review: I've done quite a few escape rooms around the country in the last year and this one is definitely at the top of my list! Difficult but not impossible. My group escaped with 1 minute 32 seconds to spare. Great for team building or just a fun excursion with friends. A must do whether you live in Tucson or you're just visiting.

room_title: Escape room "Serial Killer" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
review: Such a good time! The serial killer room was a blast! Can't wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Serial Killer" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
review: Did the new serial killer room and it was so fun! Had a great time! Such a fun activity to do with friends. Going to try the pirate room next! Nick was awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Temple of Doom" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: Lots of fun! My group did the Temple of Doom room and was able to escape. Very good, thoughtful challenges. Not as polished as other escape rooms, it definitely worth the trip from FoCo!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Pirate Shipwreck" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: THIS IS SO MUCH FUN! If you have not done an escape room, which I had never done, it's a blast. I got locked in a themed Haunted Pirate Shipwreck room for 60 minutes with my family and friends searching for a treasure and to escape. Amazing immersion makes you feel like you are in another world, challenging puzzles to solve, and you HAVE to work together! Truly an experience like no other. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Pirate Shipwreck" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: Haunted Pirate Shipwreck: quality hi-tech puzzle design and gorgeous sets. The best escape room we have ever played!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Pirate Shipwreck" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: The best one in Florida! Detailed rooms, interesting puzzles and effects! Pirate room is awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Pirate Shipwreck" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: immersive room make you feel like you are truly in another world! Great for couples and parties!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Pirate Shipwreck" by Boxroom Escape Games in Miami
review: Super fun room with few jump scares.

room_title: Escape room "Stuck in the 70’s" by Lost in Lutz Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: We just did the Lost in 70s and had so much fun! We were only 1 clue away from getting out but we'll definitely be back again! So glad this place is close and the guys were awesome. This is definitely a fun activity for parents looking to escape the kids lol

room_title: Escape room "Stuck in the 70’s" by Lost in Lutz Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: We did the 70s room and it was a blast! Highly recommend doing this escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Stuck in the 70’s" by Lost in Lutz Escape Rooms in Tampa
review: In our group of four, two of us had done several escape rooms, and for two of us it was our first escape room experience. We all agreed that the 70's was clever with some fun twists; a good balance between challenging yet not overwhelmingly difficult, nor overly easy to figure out. On our way out, we were already discussing when to go back to do the 2nd (more difficult) room. Great fun all around!

room_title: Escape room "Space Bus" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Booked Space Bus after playing the King Arthur game and it was worth it. To start with it is a GORGEOUS game. I played a few sci-fi themed escape games around the world and this one is the best one yet. The deep rumble of engines and a little bit of movement made it so real! The game puzzles are well done and games allow for many things to be done at the same time. Also, some puzzles could be solved in more than one way. Be sure not to overcomplicate, because in many cases the solution is simpler than you think.

room_title: Escape room "Space Bus" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Space Bus was great! I've never done an escape room so I had no expectations. The staff we interacted with were very friendly. The condition of the bus was excellent, quite new. The level of technology in the bus in regard to the puzzles was also unexpected. I thought the experience would comprise of shaking curtains for hidden keys or looking under loose tile and the like, haha. To finish the bus on time with the amount of puzzles, you should definitely have at least 4 participants.My 5 friends and I did not set any records but we finished with exactly 1 minute to spare! Oh, the drama!

room_title: Escape room "Space Bus" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: This is what the hype is about?  A resounding yes.  First time escaper!  But won't be my last.Came to celebrate my brother in law's birthday, so just finished dinner at Osso up the street and met the rest of our party (18 total) here.  The staff quickly separated the large group into 3 teams and set us on our way.  Preliminary instructions were quick, to the point, and off we were.  I was blessed with the Space Bus, a super detailed designed "school bus" outside of the facility.  At first I looked at he exterior and thought "huh", but once inside and locked it, the lights, sounds, and feeling of immersion was immediate.  And damn we're the puzzles cool and challenging.  No spoilers here, except we got maybe 4 hints, and finished the experience with 3 minutes to spare.  CANNOT WAIT FOR ANOTHER ROOM!  Definitely will be back.  Great job!

room_title: Escape room "Space Bus" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Below are all of the clues to finish Space Bus in record time.  Kidding.  Great time with team of 7 (4 adults and 3 teenagers).  Although we finished with plenty of time, not knowing how close we were (or not) made it a ton of fun.  Our guide Will was fantastic and actually recommended some escape rooms in Los Angeles (where we went next).Actual tips:  Listen during the guide's introduction -- it'll be important.  Read everything (even more important).  Assign the math-y puzzles to the Kumon lovers on your team.

room_title: Escape room "Santa's Workshop Head-to-Head Adventure" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Room 407" by EXIT Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: We had a big group for my husband's birthday and the owner went above and beyond to accommodate us! We were able to split the group and one group did Jailbreak and we did Room 407. I won't give away any details, but it was very well conceived. Room 407 was challenging, but very fun! We can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Room 407" by EXIT Tallahassee in Tallahassee
review: I did Room 407 with my son and my sister. We had such a good time that we decided to come back the next day and do the Jailbreak room. Each room had different challenges, and I don't want to give anything away, but we enjoyed both. The room designs were very well done. We could tell that a lot of thought and care had been taken. Also, I was so happy at how kid-friendly both rooms were. My son had a great time and felt very included. Whenever new rooms are built here, we will definitely come back.

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Curse" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had fun with the group that we got the lady at the front had a great personality and was happy to be there and explained everything and would definitely recommend and go back had a lot of fun

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Curse" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was a corporate event, and the entire team had so much fun. The Exodus team was so easy to work with and get things set up. Our host had a ton of enthusiasm. Thank you for a great event!

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Curse" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Very fun experience and the staff was upbeat and courteous. Multiple escape rooms and multiple sites as well. Will definitely try some of the other escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Pharaoh's Tomb" by The Cube Escape Rooms in Santa Barbara
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Christmas in Germany" by Bible Treks Christian Escape Room in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Patient" by Insomnia Escape Room DC in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Ship" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had the awesome opportunity to experience both The Hangover and Ghost Ship rooms. Happy to say we escaped both. Our favorite was the Ghost Ship. Next time we are in LA we want to give Grandma's Master Plan a try! Highly recommend 60out!

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Ship" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had cousin's visiting from out of town and I was SO glad I booked this room. It was their first escape room and they fell in love! It was great because the story progressed after doing each puzzle. Ghost Ship is my favorite room at the Melrose location. The first puzzle was so fun and it perfectly set the mood for the rest of the room. Some puzzles were high tech and involved things I had never seen before. Even though it had a spooky vibe, I would say it's kid-friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Ship" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: LOVE the beginning of this room because it's definitely a different experience from other rooms. Lots of interesting puzzles involving props that look fairly innocuous. My partner and I did it by ourselves and had a great time (and got out), but struggled a bit just because there were only two bodies to use; I think others would benefit from having a larger group for this room because there's a fair amount of stuff going on.

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Ship" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Went on a date and had a fun time. The room looked professional with great and funny service. For our first time we did good but did not escape. Highly recommend with a group to get the night going.

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Ship" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've Been to two of their rooms and they were both excellent but even better were the game Masters Jarod and Damien. They are efficient, professional and passionate about their rooms. I have done rooms all over the city and these guys are the best! I can't wait to finish there rooms and move on to their new ones next month!

room_title: Escape room "Bird's Movie Zone" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Runaway Train" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: We did the train room. The facility and set up is awesome. The staff are one of a kind. Ryan even humored us in all of our craziness. We escaped and we'll be back to try to zombie room!

room_title: Escape room "The Runaway Train" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Both rooms were well thought out and well designed. Never once did we solve a problem and not have the thing open (a problem we've had at other rooms).The train room was particularly well designed with a separation twist at the beginning. I can't wait for the new one.

room_title: Escape room "The Runaway Train" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Absolutely amazing! The Runaway Train room was super fun and challenging, can't wait to try the rest of the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Runaway Train" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: We did the Runaway Train room and loved it, even though it was our first puzzle room. It was just the right level of challenging, keeping us on our toes but never giving us a dull moment. The staff was very friendly as well. We'll definitely be coming back to try the other puzzle room soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Runaway Train" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: This was the second escape room I have ever done and we did the train room. It was awesome! First of all when you get there the logo on the door is very cool and code breakerish which sets the tone right away. There lobby is comfortable and clean and the owner was great at explaining everything and moving us right into the room quickly. The train room was very different then the other escape room I did in a great way. There were a lot of multi step puzzles and really creative deliveries and room design that made it a blast. We actually escaped with just under 4 minutes to go too which was really fun! I would highly recommend Quandary to anyone wanting to try an escape room and I will certainly be back to try their locked in dead room. Thanks Quandary!

room_title: Escape room "An Hour to Kill" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Really fun room!! One of my favorites Ive ever done. Its not scary at all (I dont do scary rooms)...and I loved the puzzles.  They were really fun to solve and everything was so well thought out

room_title: Escape room "An Hour to Kill" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: When my brother came to visit, one of the items on his list of things to try while here was an escape room. We chose the "An Hour to Kill" room. We had such a great time! The James Bond/spy theme of the room really stands out in all the great details they built into the room's layout. From the moment we started we were laughing and enjoying our race to get out in time. We did it with a team of four people, and we had so much fun we went and did a second escape room, "The Lab," right after.

room_title: Escape room "An Hour to Kill" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Best exit type game we've been to. High variety of puzzles. Very cool. We've played the villains lair and an hour to kill. Both were amazing. Would come back to try the other ones.

room_title: Escape room "An Hour to Kill" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: wow what a great room!! just opened 2 months ago. 6 of us entered, exit game victorious!! no hints!!! a linear puzzle that had us thinking. We have played all the games at exit game & have to say that this is our favorite one!! it was villian's lair, but now its this james bond themed room. Staff was great & video corny but funny!! we will be back when they come up with another room!!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Stillwater Asylum" by Kryptic Tales in Orange County
review: My friends and I had an amazing experience here!  The Stillwater Asylum was challenging and most importantly very fun! There were a lot of different components to this room and many different clues which made it interesting and also exciting! The room was clever and very well done. Our host Adam was awesome!! He was detailed in his introduction and very knowledgeable about every aspect of the room. I highly recommend Kryptic Tales!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Stillwater Asylum" by Kryptic Tales in Orange County
review: Really liked the Asylum escape room. I came with a group of 5, some with more escape room experience and some with none, and we made it out in the nick of time with only two hints. I highly recommend it. Like others are saying, the puzzles were unique and the clues were given in interesting ways. Just the right amount of difficulty for me, and the overall setup was very good for the experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Stillwater Asylum" by Kryptic Tales in Orange County
review: Pretty fun escape room.Solved in 54 minutes.We did the Stillwater asylum. Was fun. Can't wait to try there other one. Guy that GM'd was super nice.Would recommend. Not as hard as some of the rooms We've tried but it was super fun. I would say it's not as "scary" as I anticipated but it was very good.

room_title: Escape room "Flashback " by Time to Escape in Denver
review: Six of us did the 80's room, and we probably had more fun than any room we've played. There was plenty for everybody to do, and the theme was delightful. We beat it with time to spare, but it was definitely a challenge, couldn't have done it without working together.

room_title: Escape room "Flashback " by Time to Escape in Denver
review: This is the 4th location we have gone to and I was very impressed. We did the flashback room and the people before us failed so I went in a little nervous. I was pleasantly surprised with the technology of the room and the clues. The host was very friendly and the space was clean. I thought the room offered a great variety of clues and it was very interesting, I am excited to go back and try their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Flashback " by Time to Escape in Denver
review: Time to Escape offers games that use multiple rooms and stand out for their ability to transcend time through immersive design. The puzzles are challenging but not impossible to crack, they fit the theme well, and they keep you running back and forth between rooms for an active, engaging experience. When I played their time-traveling game"80's Flashback," I stepped into a bedroom with vintage teal and green carpet and realized we'd be using a boombox to play an actual cassette tape for a clue. It felt totally tubular to be sleuthing our way through the 80's. Time To Escape's other game transported me to 15th century Transylvania where I solved my way through the castle of Vlad the Impaler. This was the first time I'd ever used scent to solve a puzzle, or encountered props as authentic and unusual as a life size armor statue and historically accurate map of Romania.

room_title: Escape room "The Ringmaster" by Dare 2 Escape in Orlando
review: The Ring Master was a very good room. Lots of obstacles and very challenging! Staff was very nice as well.

room_title: Escape room "The Ringmaster" by Dare 2 Escape in Orlando
review: Every room is great but the Ringmaster is special. Every escape room player should take the opportunity to play it.

room_title: Escape room "The Ringmaster" by Dare 2 Escape in Orlando
review: You can tell that this place was made by straight up enthusiasts! My favorite was the Ringmaster room but it's really tough to compare to the Dig and the Asylum because they all were a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Runestone" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: My husband and I have done over 20 different escape rooms within Phoenix and Pittsburgh.  Runestone is definitely one of our favorites!  First of all we were blown away by the lobby.  Not at all what I was expecting to find next to the discout movie theater!  It is gorgeous and looks really upscale.  We enjoyed the room itself, Runestone.  It had a nice mixture of different types of puzzles and our clue master was great.  Can't wait to go back and try one of the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Runestone" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Amazing experience! We went tonight as a family and went through Runestone and I was fantastic. We've been to loads of other escape rooms and this was by FAR the best! It can be difficult but it is a challenging and rewarding experience! I can't wait to go to their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Runestone" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Best escape room experience yet!  Very well done guys!  Can't wait to come back again!  So much fun. We did the Runestone room and escaped successfully.

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 408" by Crimson Key in San Jose
review: My friend and I played Apartment 408 last night. Great set design, a nice mix of tech and non-tech puzzles. The room is beatable with just 2 people and I appreciate that they do private bookings. We'll be back to try their other room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 408" by Crimson Key in San Jose
review: We recently completed Apartment 408 with 2 people and had a blast. It was a well designed room with some unique and interesting puzzles. You can tell a lot of time was put into the design and details of the room. We can wait to come back and try the classroom themed one!

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 408" by Crimson Key in San Jose
review: Had an amazing time doing 'Apartment 408' with just 2 people (made it out in time!). The puzzles and the plot were very clever and the atmosphere is set so well! I really recommend doing this one!After we finished we had a nice chat with the owner who told us about some other locations to check out, which are definitely up our alley as well. Thanks again!

room_title: Escape room "Moonshot" by Reason in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Carpet City Scandal" by Escape Dalton in Dalton
review: So I've played several games in several states... this was hard! We played Carpet City Scandal and plan to go back for Mad Scientist in the very near future. I'm still sad we didn't escape. Recommend Escape Dalton for family gatherings or friends. Love that they're local.

room_title: Escape room "Carpet City Scandal" by Escape Dalton in Dalton
review: We played Carpet City Scandal last night and the Mad Scientist Room today and we thoroughly enjoyed it! This was the 24th escape room that I have played and am very impressed. There was so much thought and creativity put into each piece throughout the rooms and the staff are beyond amazing! I would definitely compare quality to one of the better Chattanooga Escape games, so don't waste your gas for the commute!

room_title: Escape room "Carpet City Scandal" by Escape Dalton in Dalton
review: My friends and loved it. We did Carpet City which was very challenging and made it with 47 seconds to spare. Whew! Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "Vortex" by Escape Room PSL in Port St. Lucie
review: Everything was soo convenient, walked over with out 1st group on "The Vortex ", it was soo much fun. We had a group of 7, but more brains work better than one and in this case we did amazing. Great support and team effort. Helped rely on one another for ideas, clues, figuring things out. Our 2nd group did "Simon's Room" and they were ecstatic, loved every minute and was soo much fun. It helps with remembering context clues. Definitely reccomend will not disappoint.

room_title: Escape room "Vortex" by Escape Room PSL in Port St. Lucie
review: My daughter and I did Vortex and had a blast.The effects made the experience that much better. The puzzles were lots of fun. This was definitely one of the better escape rooms we've done. We will return to try another.

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Escape" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: We enjoyed the Jurassic themed room and while we didn't beat the clock and the room was fairly complicated and non linear in terms of clues, I have to give a hugeeeeeeee shoutout to the staff! We did the escape room with a few friends and our 3 MONTH OLD SON!!!! Yeah, we are crazy. The staff was super accommodating with the stroller, they warned us when there would be loud noises and were kind enough to put a chair in the room so I could feed my son and I didn't have to miss out on the fun!! You guys are amazing!! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Escape" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: Bridget and Christian were so amazing! They were super excited when we beat the Jurassic room at 6 seconds left on the clock! Super hard room for just 2 people to beat! This was our 3rd time and we love this place!!! Best escape room in Denver!!!

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Escape" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: We took our boys and did the Jurassic Park room. We loved it, and thought it was very fun. Challenging, but not impossible. Staff was very nice.

room_title: Escape room "The Lab" by Locked In Stuart in West Palm Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Def recommend this place for a fun time.

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Best roon so far we have done.  This id our 16th room so different and fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Fun fun fun!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Went with the family and was fantastic so much fun. Scary and fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: What a great room. So much going on and keeps you busy.

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Such a fun room

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Such a great time with the family, thanks to staff modifying the room for us

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Amazing time with the family will be back soon for new room

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Such an amazing time.  Owner was great and helpfuk will be

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: 7 of us from Wings-n-Things wanted a night out together and chose this Escape room! It was fantastic! The staff, the rooms... Would definitely recommend and will definitely go back in a few months when they change themes! Ty so much for an incredible time!

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: I went here with a group of 8 two times. Had a great time on both occasions. The rooms were really fun and done really creative. The people that work here are also really nice and easy to talk to. Definitely would recommend

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Went with the family. We had a blast. We were on our toes the whole time mot knowing what to expect.   We will be back

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Absolutely FANTASTIC!! From the very beginning, the spooky decor had us prepared to run away (in a very positive way). We were terrified before even walking into the room and it felt amazing. William was extremely attentive to us

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Went with the family what A awesome time. We almost didnt make but clues helped us.  Cant wait to be back there new room. Must try room

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Such a great experience!!! I would definitely recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Such a awesome place been to one other escape room and this was alot different alot going. Fun and scary but difficult we barely made it out on time

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Such an amazing time.  Fun and scary will be back again.

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: Went in a group of four and really enjoyed it. Two of us did an escape room before and two were first timers. All four of us totally loved it! The time flew by as we searched for clues and solved puzzles. We made it out with seconds to spare. The management is awesome - really nice and helpful guy. Definitely recommend checking this escape room out!

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: As an avid escape room fan, I truly enjoyed this experience. My husband and I were teamed up with mom and her adult sons, all of whom were in it to win it...and we did! I am more well-versed in escape rooms that feature puzzles to solve the room and this one relied more on finding codes and keys. The facilities were not as 'polished' as some of the other escape rooms I've been to, but still a bunch of fun! I could tell they might still be working out the kinks and hope to see this venue so well. The team running the room seemed really passionate about it and would like to visit again once they change up the theme!

room_title: Escape room "The Underground Morgue" by Demented Escape Room in Miami
review: They were super cool! I wasn't expecting for it to be the way it did. Definitely deserves a 5 star! We barely made it out, laughed the entire time! I know it has a lot to do with who you go with but the ideas were awesome! They're changing in a couple of months and we're definitely coming back. I recommend it ! 100%.

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Office" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: We had such a great time! We did the Da Vinci room and it was full of such fun puzzles. The best part was the owners who were very fun and excited about their business. Thank you for bringing something new and exciting to do in Humboldt County!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Office" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: my daughter and I did the DaVinci room. what a blast! 😊😊 Very friendly owner, challenging room! will definitely go back for the other room!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Office" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: My husband and I went through DaVinci's office and had the BEST time! It was challenging but a great exercise in team work. We are still talking about how much fun we had and cannot wait to test our skills with Quest for the Throne!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Experienced “special ops” with a group of friends. Had a great time playing solving the puzzles. Staff was very pleasant and informative. Can’t wait to come back!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Had a blast doing the special ops room! It’s an 8/10 difficulty but the staff are very helpful with giving you the clues. Beat the room with three minutes to spare! I would definitely do another room next time I’m in the area. I highly recommend for anyone who is looking for something fun and challenging to do!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: This was so much fun! It was my first time going to an escape room and I would definitely try it again. My friends and I were in the Special Ops: Mystery Market room and we spent the whole time laughing. We mentioned to our host that we were there to celebrate our friends birthday and at the end of the game she gave my friend a birthday card that was signed by the employees. It was such a nice and unexpected gesture. I would totally go back again!
