room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Not wanting to give anything away, I'll simply say that the entire experience was amazing. We did the Special Ops room which has a terrific decor and feel. The clues are very ingenious, going beyond your typical puzzles and interconnected clues. Not that those are not present but there is definitely more. An overall fun immersive way to spend 60 minutes, or less if you escape.

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Wow! Our family had such a great night out playing Special Ops at The Escape Game. We loved the realistic settings and intriguing puzzles.... thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Secret Agent Room" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: We had so much fun being secret agents tonight! Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "Secret Agent Room" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: We had a great time disarming the bomb and solving the puzzle! It was our first escape room and Jake was an excellent guide. Each clue pieced together very nicely. Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Secret Agent Room" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: We loved the Secret Agent room so much that we had to go back to do the Hollywood Room too! Both rooms were so much fun and had us running around so excited when we found another clue. Great experience, thanks Nicolette!

room_title: Escape room "Secret Agent Room" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: This was such a fun family activity. I was the one who had to be persuaded to go and now I can't wait to go again! The detective escape room was a blast! We'd highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Secret Agent Room" by Escape Room Breckenridge in Breckenridge
review: Our family of 7 had SUCH a great time this evening in the Secret Agent room! Even our 8 year old got into it! Thanks so much for the adventure!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer’s Sanctum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: This is our group's 5th escape room and we can say that Omescape's was easily one of our most entertaining, well designed, and beautifully created rooms we faced.We did the Sorcerer's Sanctum room and although we just missed getting out in time, we still enjoyed the journey and loved the attention to detail in creating an atmosphere that made the experience that much better.The technology used and the fully automated nature of the rooms also are top notch and the amazing staff allow you to have extra time to finish all the puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer’s Sanctum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: We did a corporate event here and it was awesome! They were flexible and let us have the place to ourselves on a day they weren't normally open. We got to split up into groups and do any rooms we wanted. Joker's Asylum was extremely difficult and Sorcerer's Sanctum was my favorite. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer’s Sanctum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: This was my first escape room, so I did not know what to expect. But, with a few vets in the group, we were still able to make it out in time. We tried the new escape room called Sorcerer's Sanctum. It had this magic theme that I really like. Challenging but not impossible. We made it out in 57 minutes with 2 VERY small hints. Overall, it was a great experience, everyone in our group had fun. We're all young adults in our late 20's, so it might be different case for younger kids.

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer’s Sanctum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: Amazing production value. I love being immersed in a different world, and the Sorcercer's Sanctum escape room made me feel like I was in a magician's manor. I have high standards, and Omnescape met them easily. The theming is top notch.I like that there were multiple rooms in this "escape room", too. This made solving the puzzles more satisfying and gave the room a maze-like feel versus just being stuck in one room.Sorcerer's Sanctum also has cool tech.On top of that, the room was very neat and clean.If I want to do another escape room in San Jose, I'm going to Omnescape.

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer’s Sanctum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: I've gone through all the rooms in the SJ location, including the new Sorcerer's Sanctum, as of today. They've all been fun. However, I think Sorcerer's Sanctum is evidence that Omescape is still out to improve upon their already excellent rooms, and I can definitely appreciate that as an enthusiast.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: The Kidnapping room was pretty awesome!!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: Went as a group of 7 and had the best time! The staff was so wonderful and accommodating, even when our group was running late and needed to push our start time back. We did the kidnapping theme and barely made it out in time! Love how it was so interactive and challenging. We especially loved working with Rodney. He was there guiding us and cheering us on during the full hour and really helped us when we needed a little hint or two. Overall, such a great group activity and an even better establishment. We will be back very soon to try some of the other themes!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: This was my first escape room experience so I don't have any experience to compare it to - but we had a great time. We did the kidnap room and the puzzles were both tough and fun. The immersion was pretty good as well. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and did a fantastic job of explaining everything. We will definitely return to do a different room!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: I went with my girlfriend for our anniversary. We did the kidnapped room and it was soooo fun. We escaped with less than 10 minutes to spare. The gm was super friendly and nice. We had a blast solving the puzzles and riddles. It was great and I want to do more.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: Breakout Games exceeded all my expectations. There were six of us who went and it was the perfect number. We had much fun and cannot wait to go again!

room_title: Escape room "The Fate of the North Pole" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Cashout" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: To be honest, I had never heard of this concept before they opened this location. I went there with my family and we did the "Cashout" room. (It was difficult but we had a lot of fun).We were welcomed and guided by Nick and Ben, who did a wonderful job. They were both extremely friendly and very helpful. They answered our many questions in a very professional way.It was a great experience and I look forward to going back there and trying another room.

room_title: Escape room "Cashout" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: This was the first time anyone in our group was doing the escape room. The staff member was friendly and filled us in. We did the Cash Out room which was an hour long. I should have known the longer the time, the harder the escape. We ended up getting every lockbox but two and the staff member walked us through the rest of the clues. It got everyone in the group thinking and it was a fun family activity.

room_title: Escape room "Cashout" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: We did the casino room and had a blast! The staff was great! The game was challenging! Definitely worth every penny. We will be back to escape a different room!

room_title: Escape room "Cashout" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: Loved it!!!!!! Staff was awesome! I can't believe the detail put into the rooms and so many fun clues to solve! I can not wait to do the other room and excited for more rooms to become available. I will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Room 2217" by Cubic Escape Room in San Jose
review: Played with 5 other friends in Room 2217. I would say this was by far the best escape room I have experienced. Most escape rooms focused on the puzzle and required a good understanding of American culture, they were kind of too hard for people from non-English speaking countries. While Room 2217 gave us a totally different experience via a story, it was so real. The ending was really out of expectation. Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "Room 2217" by Cubic Escape Room in San Jose
review: VERY well designed themed stories! I went with 6 friends to the "room 2217" and had really good time~ Good for family and friends to solve interesting problems together.

room_title: Escape room "Room 2217" by Cubic Escape Room in San Jose
review: Very good experience. We chose room 2217 and it's well-designed and interesting. We managed to escape in time and had a good time overall. The facilities and service are also very good.

room_title: Escape room "The Panic Room" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: First time ever doing something like this. The staff was great super friendly and made it extremely fun. I will absolutely do this again.

room_title: Escape room "The Panic Room" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: This was an awesome experience from start to finish! My husband and I merged with a group of 8 others, even though we were perfect strangers we worked together and made it out in time! It was funny, suspenseful, entertaining and realistic. A great mental workout and good bonding time.

room_title: Escape room "The Panic Room" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: My friends and family did the "Panic Room" and it was so much fun. There were a lot of puzzles for us all to solve and we broke up in small groups to do this. The room itself was very nicely done and very aesthetically appealing. The gamekeeper gave us clear instructions and hyped us up with the incentive we needed to escape.The different types of puzzles and locks were brilliant. This was my first experience and I am addicted now!

room_title: Escape room "Crematory" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: I never knew that escape room games were this great. Awesome stuff guys, commendable to play. We all had a blast and the group click at the end was just what I needed. Do play the game guys California State Escape has done a wonderful job here.

room_title: Escape room "Crematory" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: By far the biggest and most neat escape venue I've ever been to! No corners were cut in props and room design. Had an immersive experience in the Crematory room.

room_title: Escape room "Crematory" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: The Crematory room was awesome! Had so much fun!! It is a must do!

room_title: Escape room "Crematory" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: This was our first time in an escape room. Crematory was an incredible place! We had an amazing family time! We would definitely recommend this place to people that like riddles, puzzles, mysteries and more!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: So much fun for the kiddos and adults!!! Good place for birthday parties! Highly recommend it and there is a groupon for this too!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: Brought my son here for his 13th birthday and we had a blast. Definitely would come back again.

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: Went with a summer camp I work at. I was blown away at how much fun I had. I wish I lived closer to Fullerton so I could go more often.

room_title: Escape room "Deja Vu" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: This place was so fun we made it out with 50 seconds left!

room_title: Escape room "Deja Vu" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: This was so much fun! Our hostess was really friendly. My group made good progress but occasionally needed a hint. The hints themselves are put to you in a witty way and give you just enough information to help. They have another room in development and I can't wait to try that one!

room_title: Escape room "Deja Vu" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: Great Escape room. Our game master Lauren was amazingly friendly, super helpful, and made the experience great. The room (Deja Vu) can accommodate many size groups and is great for any level experience. Can't wait to try their new room!

room_title: Escape room "Deja Vu" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: We did his as a work team building event. The journey was very intriguing and fun. Highly recommend for any type of group.

room_title: Escape room "Deja Vu" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: Checked it out on a recommendation from an escape room group, and loved it. This was room 28 for us, and it had several unique puzzles and a fantastic flow. No Deja Vu had! I'd definitely recommend it as well.

room_title: Escape room "Dead Man's Secret" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: We had a fantastic experience solving the Dead man’s secret! It was a real conundrum with no shortage of clues and puzzles. John and Sabrina were great, they genuinely want everyone to have the best time possible attempting to escape. I highly recommend giving this a try, you won’t be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "Dead Man's Secret" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: Definitely a good time, although I'm not sure why we decided to do the hardest room for our debut escape. Guess that's what happens when you hang out with a bunch of over-achieving brainiacs. We had an excellent time and would highly recommend Conundrum for your escape room escapades. Everyone was super friendly and informative. Not ever doing an escape room before I wasn't sure what to expect. The helpful people at Conundrum explained everything and we were on our way to finding our way to unlocking the mystery of Deadman's Secret. Conundrum has 4 escape rooms, each with a different theme and difficultly level. The pricing is great and they can accommodate large groups with a bit of notice. Don't be surprised if you don't escape the first time.Pro tip: If you get stuck, don't wait too long to ask for a clue!

room_title: Escape room "Dead Man's Secret" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: We are escape enthusiasts, and to date have played 126 rooms globally. This place is legit! We have played both CABIN IN THE WOODS and DEAD MAN'S SECRET and both productions, tech, puzzles, and flow were amazing. Their price point is fair at $25 per player and I like that they have an option to book a private room for $150. They are normally closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays but I called and they were able to fit us in fortunately. Had a blast! I think having four players is the right number of players for the difficulty level but can possibly be done with just two players but will be tough to do in 60 minutes. As a comparison, we have also played at Denver Escape room and they are great, but this place is awesome. These two companies are the top in the area

room_title: Escape room "Sunday Morning" by Legends of Xscape in West Palm Beach
review: Loved it. Our game master was adorable and sweet as pie. We did another room spontaneously after we loved the first one! The second one (Sunday room) was much harder! Highly recommend for a unique date night or team building.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Jail" by Real Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Tried the Escape from Jail scenario. Their small jail room escape was the best i've tried yet! It comes complete with an enthusiastic and convincing actor and has many many levels of puzzles intertwined!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Jail" by Real Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Real Escape Game on Polk was so fun! I was suprised such a small space could hold such a great game. I have been to the one in San Jose before as well. Came here with a group of friends and we all had a blast. I don't want to give any details away but we all had a great time and want to do another one some time soon!The jail one was a great storyline, and the employees were helpful at times and very committed to staying in character.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Jail" by Real Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Had an awesome time escaping from the jail. This was my first escape room experience and I cannot stop talking about it. Went with a group of friends and was amazed at how much fun I had. The game was challenging and exciting and just a ton of fun to work through with friends. Would highly recommend it to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Jail" by Real Escape Room in San Francisco
review: So my friends and I did Escape the Jail last week, and as fun as the puzzles were, I have to give major kudos to the woman who played our guard. She was spot on, and we keep coming back to here as our favorite element in the entire thing. Props, and thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Jail" by Real Escape Room in San Francisco
review: I went back to SCRAP and did their latest escape room - Escape from the Jail recently. We didn't manage to escape unfortunately, but we all really enjoyed ourselves and loved how they incorporated the theme into the game mechanics.

room_title: Escape room "Dracula's Castle" by Trapped in Tahoe in South Lake Tahoe
review: We had 2 adults and 5 kids with us, and did the Dracula room. It was a blast for all of us! I can't wait to go again!

room_title: Escape room "Dracula's Castle" by Trapped in Tahoe in South Lake Tahoe
review: We did the Dracula room with our family of two adults and two kids and made it through with plenty of time to spare. Lots of good puzzles and a great atmosphere - you're trying to get out before the sun sets, which adds a level of tension as you can see it going down. We will definitely be back to try all the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Dracula's Castle" by Trapped in Tahoe in South Lake Tahoe
review: With the weather killing our snow day, we decided to do the Dracula room and an awesome time! A perfect way that to spend a evening with your friends and family solving puzzles to escape Dracula's lair. This was all our first time doing something like this and now we are hooked. We highly recommend this place

room_title: Escape room "The Basement" by Forbidden Escape in Hartford
review: It was great. We got out with minutes to spare. Some clues were easy and others had us thinking. We have done others in the past. We are addicted to these things. Can't wait till the next room is ready. We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Basement" by Forbidden Escape in Hartford
review: The puzzles were so clever and my group had a great time. Congrats to Dave and Sue on creating a scary and fun escape room. I especially loved the story behind the room!

room_title: Escape room "The Basement" by Forbidden Escape in Hartford
review: I've been to several escape rooms and this one was definitely fun, complex and scary! Cannot wait for the next room to be finished so we can tackle that one. I will be keeping an eye out!! Nice job guys!

room_title: Escape room "The Basement" by Forbidden Escape in Hartford
review: I've been to several escape rooms and this one was definitely fun, complex and scary! Cannot wait for the next room to be finished so we can tackle that one. I will be keeping an eye out!! Nice job guys!

room_title: Escape room "The Basement" by Forbidden Escape in Hartford
review: This was so much fun - but it is super scary if you're a wimp (like me). It's not that scary for most people but I admit I spent a lot of time hiding in a corner. The setup was really neat and it's super engaging, plus the puzzles were a lot of fun. And the clue delivery system they have in place is fantastic.It's probably even more fun if you do have a wimp in your group because I think I provided the Gamemasters as much entertainment as they provided us due to my total state of panic about everything!Will be back when the second room opens!

room_title: Escape room "Kingdom of the Dragon" by Fort Collins Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: Very helpful Game Master. We were very excited to play and she quite enjoyed our enthusiasm. Gave us little nudges because we were overthinking a lot.

room_title: Escape room "Kingdom of the Dragon" by Fort Collins Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: me my brother and my parents went most of the time I was right especially to get us out of there this was so much fun highly recommended

room_title: Escape room "Kingdom of the Dragon" by Fort Collins Escape Room in Fort Collins
review: Went with my husband and two of the kids, 11 & 15. We had so much fun on the kingdom of the dragon escape room. Fun story and good puzzles. Finished with just over 2mins to spare. 👍❤️Also, make sure you listen to ALL the players ideas. Sometimes they'll know what they're talking about. 😉

room_title: Escape room "Zodiac Killer" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: I love Fox In A Box LA. I have done two escape rooms there now. The first was the zombie lab which while fun, was only okay. The second was this one, and I thought it was amazing! We escaped with 5 minutes left. Some of the clues were really difficult and without a hint, we wouldn’t have solved. Somehow, we figured most of it out ourselves. We had so much fun and will definitely come back. This escape room is very nice despite the surroundings looking a bit sketchy (aka the strip club across the street) I would definitely highly recommend this escape room to anyone who enjoys a good time. It was also a bit scary at times.

room_title: Escape room "Zodiac Killer" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: This was our first escape room. It's very challenging. We tried The Zodiac Killer! It was great. The employees are so great and made it an incredible experience. We can't wait to go back. We are going to try every game. My husband and two kids have never tried an escape room before and they were very impressed.

room_title: Escape room "Zodiac Killer" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: Such a fun and entertaining hour!  The workers are super friendly. We had a group of 3 and were at the moment of getting the code to get out of the room when our time was up. I would highly recommend it to any age group. We did the Zodiac room and it was so much fun. Lots of puzzles to solve and clues to find. We will definitely be going back!

room_title: Escape room "Zodiac Killer" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: A great puzzle room.  It was very puzzle-heavy instead of easter egg hunt-esque. Super friendly and helpful staff, especially Matt. I would absolutely recommend for people who have done a puzzle room or two before. The Zodiac Killer room rocks!

room_title: Escape room "Cuban Crisis" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: I enjoyed this place a lot. Soon as we walked in the art and different crafts caught your attention, for some reason it reminded me of a tattoo parlor, haha. But we came for a birthday party and we had a good-sized group, my group chose the Cuban Crisis as our mission. You basically have 60 mins to find clues and crack the codes to finally receive the code to unlock the door. Just know we cracked our code with 9 mins left to spare and we beat the other team by 3 mins.I know we all enjoyed our experience as it was everyone's first time there. I know I enjoyed mine.

room_title: Escape room "Cuban Crisis" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: So much fun and very unique! You gotta try Antidote or Cuban Missile crisis!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Loveeeedddd it! Something different to do rather then your typical friday night of movies, deffinently coming back for the other rooms! Soo much adrenaline & excitement !

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: What an awesome experience. If you're looking for an exciting, riveting, and challenging experience, BREAKOUT is right for you. My girlfriend and I went on a double date with some friends, and it was incredible. I highly recommend it, and I will definitely be back soon! Ps: I challenge you to beat our time from "The Kidnapping": 52:45!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Great experience. One of the best escape room experiences I've had so far. Our game maker, Ben made it an even more enjoyable experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Amazing fun!!! Will so be back! It was great having everybody work together and laughing the entire time

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: This was awesome!!! I would definitely be doing this again! So much fun

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: We were there yesterday to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday with our friends. Our group was of six people, and it was our very first go at a breakout game. It couldn't have been more fun!! The fabulous set-up - the scene, clues, and even some very surprising "special effects" make it an engrossing and fast-paced experience, and the clever puzzles keep you engaged the whole time. The staff is extremely friendly, and you can tell that they have just as much fun setting things up as we do playing it. We are definitely hooked and will most certainly go back for more!! Thanks Breakout Atlanta for an exciting evening!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Had a blast at Breakout Atlanta! Challenging, fun and fantastic staff!!! Our game master was awesome!!

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Key Quest in Miami
review: Laser quest is the best place to go with friends, family, coworkers, etc. The employees are very kind and enthusiastic (shoutout to Alex & Codi). I've been twice definitely will keep visiting! Oh wait, their prices are good too!

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Key Quest in Miami
review: We had a great time at Laser Quest. It's the same friendly atmosphere as a remember from when I was in High School. Excellent time !!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Key Quest in Miami
review: Yeah we went and had a lot of fun and we going to do it again soon

room_title: Escape room "Escape Papa's Study" by Key West Room Escape in Key West
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by ZScape Games in Livermore
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Destin in Destin
review: We booked the Antidote room for a New Year celebration and it was nothing less than amazing. We had so much fun working together to figure out each puzzle. Our family ranges in age from 11 to 40something, and we all had a blast. It's a great family outing and we can't wait to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Fort Smith Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: My husband, myself & our friends visited the spellbound room! Even though we didn’t escape we had a great time! Can’t wait to do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Trouble in Paradise" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: We (3 of us) visited this escape room when we were in Sarasota and decided to do the Jailbreak room. We really enjoyed it - the clues were quite tricky so we had to ask for help a couple of times but we escaped! We enjoyed it so much that the next day we decided to do the Trouble In Paradise room - also really enjoyed this room and escaped. The hosts were great and friendly. Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "Trouble in Paradise" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: What a great time! We had so much fun, we did another immediately. The rooms are themed super fun, lots of interactive stuff, and complex enough to be challenging without being impossible. The staff was also super friendly and upbeat.We did the beach and prison room - while both were fun, we felt like the beach room had more and varied stuff going on for everyone to be actively engaged the whole time, less stuck/thinking time.

room_title: Escape room "Trouble in Paradise" by Escape Countdown in Sarasota
review: Super fun time with some old friends from school. This would be a great team building activity for small groups. We "escaped" in less than an hour, and the whole group was engaged in the process. Fun for families, work groups, team building, etc. Highly recommend

room_title: Escape room "Edison vs. Tesla" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: I’ve been here twice and we have had an amazing time. Great rooms. Really builds communion. We even came in second place on the Edison be Tesla room. Let’s go “The 13%ers”!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Edison vs. Tesla" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: This was a fun way to spend an hour trying to escape from themed rooms. They have 5 different themes. We had to escape by finding Thomas Edison's patent which involved puzzles, locks, clues, hidden objects and movement between 2 rooms. 6 people per theme, so not crowded. Some clues are difficult - we were fortunate to escape right before time expired. Great fun, good for party or team building event.

room_title: Escape room "Edison vs. Tesla" by Brainstorm Escape Room Bonita Springs in Fort Myers
review: The owners were SO great and we had a blast! The rooms are incredibly well decorated and so well thought out. After coming from only 1 experience at a different escape room I was blown away by the intensity and fun this was. The Edison Room is a MUST! Thank you for such a great time, we will most definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: The room itself has great reviews! The customer service is absolutely horrible and so far the worst I have run into at any escape room by far. Definitely will not be returning and really encourage people to go elsewhere. The experience overall was not nearly as good because of the people we had to deal with.

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Had an amazing time in the AI room. The interactions with both the room and the computer interface went seamlessly together. The challenges were well organized and the mechanics varied significantly so that you were kept on your toes the whole time. If you complete the room with at least 15 minutes to spare, an additional challenge is activated, so that added a whole extra level of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Excellent escape room! We did the AI Room, very high tech and unique puzzles that I won't spoil, but trust me, I haven't seen anything like it before. Awesome staff that are enthusiastic about the game, we had an amazing time. Looking forward to trying The Lab!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Just wow! The Exit Game is my favorite escape game company. Their rooms are unlike any other escape games I've played. The AI room has a talking robot. How cool is that?! Do listen to the robot, it actually responds to your actions in the room. The decoration is also top notch. My group definitely will be coming back for their other rooms. I heard the next room is coming out in about a month.

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Just finished AI room with 8 people. It was definitely a room that utilized the most technology out of the escape rooms I have done, which added to the experience. The room was committed to the theme throughout. I was more used to the flip-everything-in-the-room type of escape rooms, so it was definitely a nice change.The staff was extremely patient, friendly, and knowledgeable! So excited for the other rooms to be finished!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: The highest rated escape room in LA on Yelp has come to SD! I was literally about to pee my pants because I was so excited!Our group of 7 came on a Friday night, we had all done escape rooms before except for 1. Our game master was very friendly. We watched the introduction video and began our mission. It was an extremely high tech room! It was definitely difficult but you will have to work with your team and communicate.

room_title: Escape room "Abducted: Escape from the Madman" by trap't Escape Room Adventures in Stamford
review: We loved it! It was both challenging and fun. The rooms are so cleverly designed and there is something for everyone to solve. Our group had 5 people and I think if we had more it would've been harder to solve. We got out of the Abduction Room with 38 seconds to spare! The staff was very helpful and informative. I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Abducted: Escape from the Madman" by trap't Escape Room Adventures in Stamford
review: Loved it! Way more challenging than I expected. Did the Madman escape and had a little less than 3 minutes to spare. Definitely coming back.

room_title: Escape room "Abducted: Escape from the Madman" by trap't Escape Room Adventures in Stamford
review: It was the first one I've done. Went with 3 other couple friends for my birthday. We did the Abducted room. It was so much fun! Each of us contributed something unique and it was a really engaging experience. We ended up finishing with 9 minutes left and all of us felt giddy and amped up afterward. It felt like quite the accomplishment. We did have some hints - but our game master said we needed far fewer clues than most groups. I definitely want to go back and do the other rooms. I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Abducted: Escape from the Madman" by trap't Escape Room Adventures in Stamford
review: We went as a family with two adults and three young teenagers, and we had a blast! The puzzles were challenging and SO much fun to piece together. I really liked that you could request clues if you needed them, and the owners would give you just the right amount of info to help you without giving anything away. The "abduction" rooms were very well put together: amazing settings with so much realistic detail and very cleverly crafted puzzles. The owner was great to work with and went out of his way to make sure we enjoyed the experience. Couldn't recommend this place more highly! A very unique and amazing thing to do with family or friends!

room_title: Escape room "Abducted: Escape from the Madman" by trap't Escape Room Adventures in Stamford
review: Our family spent New Year's Eve at Trapt before going to dinner. We had a ball. A great family night of trying to escape the Madman. Not sure where the hour went. A fun night for family and friends. Highly recommend this adventure and we are looking forward to trying our second room very soon!

room_title: Escape room "King's Gambit" by GR8 Escape Challenge in Sarasota
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: Did both the Fallout Shelter and Initiation with my group of four. We loved both rooms and can't wait to visit Havasu again to see if their other room is open. Good puzzle flow, made us all work together. It was a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: Although we were 2 clues short of solving, the escape we had a great time with our friends and we will do it again soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: Such a great time! Very well put together! From the look and feel of the rooms to the challenges and puzzles themselves! Awesome experience! Can't wait to see the next challenge when it opens!

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: Awesome experience! Clever and suspenseful! We did it with a group of 4 and I wouldn't change a thing!

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: We had a great time in the Fallout shelter! Definitely want to go back and try a new room when it opens up! Thanks Gray Matter Escape Room for the fun family time!

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: My daughter and I had such a fantastic time! Some of the puzzles were easy and some were very difficult. I loved the variety of logic problems and common sense solutions. Great job, Gray Matter!

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: We've been excited to try this, and so happy that we did! It was such a great experience working together as a family. Too bad we died from radioactive poisoning!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Mind Bender Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: Can't go wrong with a good drink. This place is a prime location for a team building dinner follow up. Mind Bender Escape Rooms is a couple of doors down from Engine 15. Just close your eyes as you pass the gym. When you do that you'll find this gem. I did the easy room (Jack the Ripper) and still couldn't get out. Frustrating when you know you're looking at the clue and can't put he pieces together. But so much fun working with each other to try to solve the mystery and escape the room. Truly bends the mind! Can't wait to try the other rooms in the future!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Mind Bender Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: Had an awesome time in the "Jack the Ripper " room! Definitely keeps the mind and imagination going! We will be back for the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Mind Bender Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: We had such a great time today here. I booked the Jack the Ripper room and although we didn't make it in time, it was so much fun! It's harder than you think, and we probably lost a few minutes trying to get started. Would definitely do it again. The people working there were super nice and helpful.

room_title: Escape room "Depths Of Osiris VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: Amazing experience!! First we started with the hangover. Hard but not too hard. It is for 7 people so if you do not have 7 they will fill in the spaces. Something the website didn’t explain clearly. However, we had a great couple that played the game with us and we had a wonderful time. Then we switched to the VR side. I do have to mention it is not in the same building. So do not book these too close together. We did the ocean Osiris. It was fantastic!!!! The staff helps you so you dont feel lost. We ended our night with the hospital horror. This is not an escape room, it was an “experience”. I was so submerged in my experience that I,... kind of forgot it wasn’t real. I screamed and took off my headset. My greatest fear was in that room and it felt too real to deal with it lol when I tapped out the staff was right by my side with smiles. They made me feel comfortable and supported. I came we’re with my husband and 2 older teens. We ABSOLUTELY recommend his location to EVERYONE.

room_title: Escape room "Depths Of Osiris VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: My wife Sherrie and I along with our Scottsdale friends Mike and Lynette had the best time at Escape 101 in Phoenix. If you are searching for fun at a great price, with great service and team/friend building go to Escape 101. We did the Depths of Osirus and the Hospital of Horrors vitual reality rooms. So much fun we will go back for more. You won't be disappointed. Sean was out guide. Have fun

room_title: Escape room "Hotel California" by Element of Escape in Sarasota
review: I tried out the Hotel California escape room and absolutely loved it! The staff was friendly and did an excellent job of explaining the different elements of the game and setting up the story before we went into the room. You can tell they invested a lot of time and thought into the rooms and decor to really enhance the experience. Can't wait to go back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Hotel California" by Element of Escape in Sarasota
review: We escaped Hotel California! Our group of 8 had a great time. The hostess was super-nice. We searched the room and found all the clues. The puzzle was fun to solve.

room_title: Escape room "Hotel California" by Element of Escape in Sarasota
review: We celebrated my niece birthday in the hotel California room. It was awesome. The lady who ran this place was extremely helpful and friendly.  We will be back to do the other rooms soon...

room_title: Escape room "Hotel California" by Element of Escape in Sarasota
review: We had so much fun escaping from Hotel California! The storyline was clever and the clues kept us on our toes! Can't wait to go back and try another room!

room_title: Escape room "Hotel California" by Element of Escape in Sarasota
review: We are Escape Room junkies and the Element of Escape rooms are great. We have done almost 40 rooms and Hotel California is right up there in my favorites list. Good story. Good theme. Good production. Definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Dauntless Prison" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: What a great experience! If you want an hour of fun, this is the place to go! Helpful staff, clean and fun environment! Highly recommend! We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Dauntless Prison" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: We recently did two of their escape rooms! They both were so well planned! The decor was added to the experiences. The staff was so friendly and very helpful. We had so much fun both nights. Next time we’re in town we will definitely try another room!!

room_title: Escape room "Dauntless Prison" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: We had the best time ever testing out the new room The Dauntless Prison... I can very much recomed this place and the owners are super friendly too....LOVED IT

room_title: Escape room "Dead Men at Sea" by Time Lock Escape Room in Tampa
review: Had a great time with the family tonight! Did the Dead Man at Sea room. We will be back to do the Asylum room next. Thanks for the great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Dead Men at Sea" by Time Lock Escape Room in Tampa
review: We just escaped Dead Men At Sea tonight as a family aged 9-40. Fun for all ages. Would definitely do it again. Thank you for some good family bonding time.

room_title: Escape room "The Da Vinci Exhibit" by Source Code Escape Games in Augusta
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Robot Toy Factory" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mansion Murder" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: What a great escape room place!  Easy to book a reservation and a good number of experiences to choose from.  Your group is the only one in your experience, which is great!We chose the Mansion Murder experience and it was fun and well thought out.  I would recommend the children be 10 and above to participate with the clues. The facility is clean and the staff are very nice.  Wristbands and a water at the end of the experience was a nice touch!

room_title: Escape room "Mansion Murder" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Went out on a team outing and we had a great time!! Matt, Zach and Erica were awesome hosts and I'm definitely coming back. My team did the Murder Mansion and it was hard but once you get the riddles the end result is entertaining! Thanks for making our team outing so much fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Mansion Murder" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: It was a great experience, even if we didn't finish in the 60 mins. I hadn't realized that I chose the Murder Mansion which is 2nd hardest room, so that is probably why we didn't finish. John, our Game Master & Escapologist, was very helpful & very thorough in explaining everything afterwards. I wasn't discouraged because we didn't finish & would DEF go back to try another room, maybe the easiest one.

room_title: Escape room "The Genius Test" by Race 2 Escape in Albany (GA)
review: Our group had a great time in the Genius Room today! It was fun and exciting and our host was awesome as well! We’ll be going back for sure!

room_title: Escape room "The Genius Test" by Race 2 Escape in Albany (GA)
review: Great group activity in Albany. We had 9 people and were able to escape the "Genius Test" with a few minutes to spare. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Will definitely be back to try out the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Genius Test" by Race 2 Escape in Albany (GA)
review: The Genius Test was an amazing mind-bender that had the thrill of a timed race, but without the stress of a timed test. I sought to broaden my horizons and I was certainly not disappointed! My compliments to the staff! I highly recommend this activity, especially with friends!

room_title: Escape room "The Genius Test" by Race 2 Escape in Albany (GA)
review: My daughter and her friends had soooo much fun trying to escape the Genius room! Even though they didn’t escape, they will be back for the other room.

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: Working with others my husband and I did The Crimson Storm. We had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: My daughter decided to get kidnapped by pirates for her birthday because, why not? Phoenix Escape Room went way above and way beyond to make her birthday special for us. You guys are seriously amazing. Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: This was such a fun experience and the staff was so fun! Me and my husband tried it out for date night, and we are hooked! Too bad we needed a few more minutes to escape, but we will be back to try all the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Maritime Mutiny" by Escape Room Herndon in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Edison Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: Just escaped the Edison room and escaped with a whole 3 minutes to spare! The puzzles were amazing and really well thought out, the look and decor were great and I would recommend everyone trying them out!

room_title: Escape room "The Edison Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: The Edison room was awesome! My family and I got together for a birthday celebration via the Palace Games escape room. Multiple generations working together to solve puzzles? Needless to say it was a blast. It was incredibly engaging, creative and interactive.

room_title: Escape room "The Edison Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: As of this past Tuesday I finally rounded out my Palace Games escaping skills by completing the Edison Room (my 3rd) and it was BEYOND INCREDIBLE!!! It was a seemingly endless adventure of discovery, technology, puzzles and teamwork. I really can't say enough about how fun and well done all of these room are.  I understand how technically complicated the Edison Room is and how much of a challenge it must have been to create. My hat is off to everyone that was involved in its creation. Wow. Just wow!

room_title: Escape room "The Edison Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: The Edison Room was awesome! It's the first room I've done, so can't compare to the others, but I had a great time. We had the full 8, and didn't feel too crowded even though it was above the "optimal" number. Had high expectations, and I was not disappointed. I look forward to doing more rooms with these guys in the future.

room_title: Escape room "The Edison Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: I've done all three rooms by Palace Games and they're all so much fun. Definitely worth the price. I'd recommend doing them in the order they were developed (Houdini, Roosevelt, Edison) as they just keep getting more and more impressive. We had a group of 9 for the Houdini and Roosevelt rooms and 8 for Edison and there was plenty to do for everyone. I've done escape rooms at 4 other venues but these three rooms are definitely the best 3 I've ever done!

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: What an experience this was. So much tension but yet so fun. I would definitely recommend this to friends and family.

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: Had a great time. Puzzles were intriguing and mind bending. Highly recommend to all.

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: It was a great and very high thinking experience! This is a must stop escape room! Now finally here in Bakersfield! I love it!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: Get ready to be tested psychologically..very well set up maze of puzzles an all out excellent group activity...

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: It was very fun , had a blast. Must try at-least once

room_title: Escape room "Cabin in the Woods" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: The Cabin in the Woods room is INSANE. So many moving parts, things to do. Do NOT attempt this with two people, you won’t get out. We got out by calling the ranger with two SECONDS left on the clock

room_title: Escape room "Cabin in the Woods" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: We had a great time at Conundrum.  Although we didn't escape the Cabin in the Woods, we had a great time.  The staff is very friendly and helpful and the props are pretty cool.  We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Cabin in the Woods" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: The Cabin in the Woods was well designed and had a great narrative. There were many really fun puzzles. We'll return to play more!

room_title: Escape room "Cabin in the Woods" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: Terrific setup! Varied, interesting, and challenging puzzles. Wonderful experience for veterans and novices alike. Looking forward to more rooms here.

room_title: Escape room "Cabin in the Woods" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: We had a blast as a family at Conundrum. Our four kids ages 8-14 thoroughly enjoyed the experience and so did my husband and I. Well done! We will be back for more.

room_title: Escape room "Cabin in the Woods" by Conundrum Escape Rooms in Denver
review: I scheduled a room for my family and the next day found out that my son wouldn't be able to get in town till the day after. I called to see if they would allow us to move the day and time and they were very accommodating. We had so much fun. And the puzzles kept you engaged the whole time. We will be coming back to do other rooms as they become available.

room_title: Escape room "Basketball" by Big Escape Rooms in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Weird Heritage" by ROOM 5280 in Denver
review: This place was awesome! For many in our group, this was our first escape room and it was the perfect amount of challenge. The room we did (Weird Heritage) was extremely well thought out and the puzzles were fun and interactive. The host was funny and gave us a hint only when we really needed it.

room_title: Escape room "Weird Heritage" by ROOM 5280 in Denver
review: We had a GREAT time in the Heritage room! There were six of us, including my nine-year-old daughter, and really I think you need a bare minimum of four to make this work, but the owner said you really need six. The owner is very hospitable and the clues are challenging but not impossible.We escaped with eight minutes to spare and were pretty happy about it!  Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Weird Heritage" by ROOM 5280 in Denver
review: We did "Weird Heritage," and it was great! They had a good variety of puzzles and challenges. Can't wait to try another escape room here!

room_title: Escape room "Weird Heritage" by ROOM 5280 in Denver
review: Had a great time! Escaped The Heritage room. Greet for a larger group! Thanks so much!

room_title: Escape room "Magician's Library" by Skeleton Key Rooms in Sacramento
review: this escape room is HORRIBLE. I have no idea what game others are playing but let me tell you about it without giving the room away. For starters the clues and puzzles make zero sense. It's supposed to themed as a magicians lair but instead it is filled with gibberish as in made up words and symbols and nothing even remotely related to magic. also there is no roof to the room so it feels like you are playing in a small cubical. you can literally hear what is going on in the room right next you to clear as day also THERE IS NO AC so it was super hot in there as well. also the hints that they give you aren't relevant to what you are trying to do. I regret paying my money to go there so PLEASE BOOK ELSEWHERE

room_title: Escape room "Magician's Library" by Skeleton Key Rooms in Sacramento
review: What a great experience! It was quite challenging for just 4 people, but we finished with just under two minutes left! An hour really flies by when your solving multiple puzzles. The puzzles were intricate and entertaining, and force you to pay attention to small details! Owner came in after we finished and she was really sweet, we stayed and talked with her for quite awhile! Glad to help support a local family who genuinely wants their guests to enjoy the game! Will DEFINITELY visit again!

room_title: Escape room "Magician's Library" by Skeleton Key Rooms in Sacramento
review: This place was AWESOME! We had such a blast! Some puzzles were challenging, but the clues they provided were perfect. They didn't give anything away, but guided you if you were stuck. The comments they made were hilarious, too! We absolutely loved it and can't wait for more rooms so we can go back.

room_title: Escape room "Magician's Library" by Skeleton Key Rooms in Sacramento
review: It was a blast going with my colleagues. Definitely recommend doing as a big group. It was challenging and the puzzles are well organized. We couldn't solve the puzzles, but no disappointment. Overall it was a fun activity. Can't wait to go back and solve another mystery.

room_title: Escape room "The Society" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: WOW. I have to say this placed has really stepped it up with their new room! If you haven't I highly recommend the Society room especially if you are new to escape rooms. As someone who has done over 50, this room is very solid.It's a nice room with several varieties of puzzles throughout.  None felt too hard or poorly designed. I played the room with 2 others and it felt very comfortable and nothing felt impossible. Everything went at a smooth pace. We were all experienced, so we all took our time and didn't feel the urge to rush. With that said we still had a out 5 minutes remaining.There were some locks here and there, but it also had its fair share of electronic puzzles as well. (Thankfully nothing glitched). I highly recommend this room if you are a beginner to escape rooms because it contains the basics that most rooms give to you throughout the country.  And if you are an expert still play it because you can't go wrong.The lobby is nice and the staff is nice as well, but overall if you have played a game here before.... YOU NEED TO COME BACK and play Society because this hands down is the best room here. That's a fact. Not an opinion.

room_title: Escape room "The Society" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: Me and my coworkers played their new room "The Society". The puzzles were highly interactive. Very well done room. Challenging puzzles, sophisticated design, good engineering and decor. We really enjoyed our time there! I would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Society" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: Very fun!!!   Our host was very nice and extremely helpful!    Did the society room.   Would def recommend to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: We had a great time doing both the Amnesia and Resurrection rooms. Our wonderful game master Jasmine was enthusiastic and supportive. This Quest Room location is in the South Bay Galleria, so there is ample parking, lighting, and places to eat nearby.  We have done all the other rooms by this company and these rooms have the amazing build quality, story elements, and immersion of those rooms plus an added live actor element.  The actor provides some creepy and funny moments, and helps move the gameplay and story forward.  The structure and design of the game promotes collaboration. There is hardly a moment where you feel like you are alone solving a random puzzle and then reporting back to your group. The suspense and thrill are maximized when everyone is present when there is a scary reveal or jump scare. I never heard "What happened?" or "What did you see?" We all experienced the awesomeness together.  For those apprehensive to do these rooms because of the "horror" element, you will be ok. These rooms have plenty of humorous and engaging moments that perfectly balance out the fear factor.  So take a deep breath and enjoy!

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Wow!! It's so hard to write a review without too many spoilers. But we played Amnesia and it was insanely cool! The way it starts out is super different and makes you think more practical than other escape rooms (I work at one so I LOVE playing others and seeing what works and what doesn't) this one works!! Great staff and AMAZING tech. 10/10 recommend! Our actor Jasmine was great, our game master Matt was also really awesome! I'm hoping to get to see him act in the future. And Katey(Katie?) was one of the nicest bubbliest people I've ever met. Just an overall mind blowing and fun experience. (You May even get some free candy )

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: We had an amazing time! Its a big room. Definitely a must try. They said group of six is the max they can do per game. We did Amnesia and it was funny/ creepy. Our game master was super awesome. I think his name was antoinne. Will definitely be back to try the other room

room_title: Escape room "Daycare" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: I came across this hotel by accident. Had no idea what I was getting myself into. My boyfriend and I did the Daycare Escape room it was creepy! We had a anniversary we will never forget! We will be back again!

room_title: Escape room "Daycare" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: The first time I went, my friends and I did Santorium. We loved it so much, we came back a second time that night and did Slaughter. And then, two weeks later, I came back again to do Daycare! This place is amazing, the staff are so wonderful and in character all the time. Creepy, yet supportive and just absolute fun to be around. As for the rooms, I can't even explain how wonderfully detailed and well thought out everything is. This is probably one of the best experiences I have had in my life.

room_title: Escape room "Daycare" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I did the Daycare room and we had a blast! The passports are a nice touch. We want to come back and get more stamps. The Saturday night staff was fabulous.

room_title: Escape room "Daycare" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: We did the daycare and it was absolutely amazing. Random scares, and very challenging! I highly recommend this place we're booking for four other rooms to try! I can't get enough!!!

room_title: Escape room "Daycare" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: The experience was really fun! When you walk up, the employees are all in character as you "check in" - the check in process is lengthy, so definitely get there as early as they recommend! They need you to fill out waivers and have your photo taken for a fake passport, which you get to keep (and they stamp if you successfully get out of your room). We did the Daycare room, and it was surprisingly tough, but we got out with 12 minutes remaining. We had fun and would do it again.

room_title: Escape room "The Baker Street Five" by Greeley's Great Escape in Fort Collins
review: Loved it, had a great time, we will go back when the new games open! Great family activity, highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Baker Street Five" by Greeley's Great Escape in Fort Collins
review: We loved this place. We just finished. It's the first one that we failed, but we were one member short of out 4 person team. So we're not taking it too hard. Great experience and a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Baker Street Five" by Greeley's Great Escape in Fort Collins
review: We tried Bakers Street today, and had a blast! The girls at the front were super helpful and friendly. Great team work and girls day!

room_title: Escape room "Russian Spy Room" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: We had a great time! My family of seven did the Soviet room. We had never done an escape before but decided to go big or go home and did the expert level. We worked together and made some great memories! We had some blips in the game due to the newness of the room, but we still enjoyed it. We made it out with close to 6 minutes to spare! Will definitely go again!

room_title: Escape room "Russian Spy Room" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: What a great place! The Russian room was challenging and at times intense. If you like being put to the test, this is the place for you and your friends!

room_title: Escape room "Russian Spy Room" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: This was our first time doing an escape room, and my teenage kids were reluctant. We all thoroughly enjoyed the Russian Spy Room and had a great time! Will do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Clue Dunnit?" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: Really great experience. The room was challenging and very well thought out. The host was fun and added to the experience. I highly recommend this adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Clue Dunnit?" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: This was a little bit pricey, and we found out that we are not all team players, but we had fun! A couple of our group had previously done an escape room, so we did an intermediate level room. Bad idea! We used all of our clues plus some! The staff member was very nice and accommodating, though and we did solve it with seconds to spare. This being my first one, I have nothing to compare it to, but the 2 that had done it before said this one was harder but still fun. It definitely put our problem solving and puzzle skills to the test!

room_title: Escape room "Clue Dunnit?" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: Elisa and the team were amazing! We had a corporate event scheduled at The Clue Room and had a fantastic time. Thank you very much!

room_title: Escape room "Quarantine" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: So great! We did the quarantine room! Sober hard! Anthony was great!

room_title: Escape room "Quarantine" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: Awesome. Just beat Quarantine with a record-breaking time. We are #1 on the leaderboard - come see if you can beat us!

room_title: Escape room "Quarantine" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: It was so much fun! Very engaging and we enjoyed working together to solve the puzzles! Definitely will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by Puzzle Effect Boise in Boise
review: Fantastic experience from start to finish. We did the Curse of the Emerald Pearl. It was a great room production-wise and very challenging. Katy was our guide and she was enthusiastic and friendly.  Kyle was at the front desk and he made us feel welcome from when we walked in the door until we left. We even took advantage of their 20% discount if you book another room when you're done.

room_title: Escape room "Revenger's Rescue" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Our family of five (with kids aged 13, 10, and 7) chose the Revengers Rescue challenge, and though we did not solve the room in time, we had such a blast!! We thought the room was very unique and inventive. The place was clean and the staff was super friendly. It was a great hour of quality time together. We would highly recommend it!!

room_title: Escape room "Revenger's Rescue" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: I've been to several escape rooms in this area and NWA Escape has been the best experience yet! Revenger's Rescue was a blast, even when we hit some snafus, we still had a blast! Will definitely return!

room_title: Escape room "Revenger's Rescue" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Had lots of fun with the family. The Revengers Rescue room was awesome. Can't wait to try out the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Reactor Escape" by Reason in San Francisco
review: Our team had a blast solving the puzzles to break out of the escape room! We did this as a team bonding activity to kick off the new year and it was incredibly effective. We were able to play with a drone, a 3D printer, virtual reality, and other technologies as part of the puzzles which only made the experience more fun!

room_title: Escape room "Reactor Escape" by Reason in San Francisco
review: I heard good things about this escape room before coming with my group of nine friends. I was absolutely blown away by the puzzle design, game flow, and hospitality of the room hosts. I've done a lot of escape rooms, and this one stands out with inventive puzzles that required lots of teamwork. Our gamemasters were very patient, encouraging, and provided an excellent customer service experience.

room_title: Escape room "Reactor Escape" by Reason in San Francisco
review: I've played over 80 escape games around the world, and I can say that this was one of the best! We had a group of 10 people (some new to escape games) and we escaped with a few seconds left! It was an awesome and unique experience with the technology that they use. I won't reveal anything here but just try it for yourself!

room_title: Escape room "Reactor Escape" by Reason in San Francisco
review: Extremely fun escape game (themed around future technology) located within an innovation lab. Expect some high-tech toys and a whole lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Reactor Escape" by Reason in San Francisco
review: The Reason team put a huge amount of love and detail into this room. It was fun, exceptionally designed, and clever. We were lucky enough to participate in the beta so learned more about the design and testing process they went through. I look forward to exploring (and escaping) the next Reason room.

room_title: Escape room "2325 Tremont St." by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: Since there were five of us we attempted the 2325 Tremont Street challenge. We were successful in 41 minutes (with two clues). Would definitely do another escape room challenge in the future.

room_title: Escape room "2325 Tremont St." by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: This was my first time going to an escape room, and i had a blast. I love all things investigative and taking the time to figure out what I need to do in order to solve a ‘life-sized puzzle.’ The man there for us was very welcoming and helpful, accommodating us to let us see how the challenge comes together, or let us struggle on our own depending on our wishes.

room_title: Escape room "2325 Tremont St." by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: Our family (grandparents, parents and kids) had SO much fun at Escape Cocoa Beach. Highly recommend Tremont Street. It took a village but we worked together, solved the mystery, and escaped! It was a great alternative to the beach during our vacation.

room_title: Escape room "Aftermath" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Bank Heist" by Escape Zone Oxford in Oxford (AL)
review: We had a great time! The staff was super friendly and the game was challenging. We can't wait to come back and go through another room.

room_title: Escape room " Captive" by Twisted Exit in Lancaster (CA)
review: LOVED THIS!!!! This was my boyfriend and I's first escape room. The lighting/mood and decor were so well done that I had a panic attack in the hallway, hahah no joke. It was great though, once we got in the room and got going on the clues we were okay. We did not Escape, but were told that we were 3 locks from escaping. Overall GREAT ROOM!

room_title: Escape room " Captive" by Twisted Exit in Lancaster (CA)
review: I had a great time in the Saw room! Definitely coming back with some friends.

room_title: Escape room "Holiday Quest" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Mall" by Complexity: A Puzzling Adventure in Hartford
review: This was an amazing experience! My daughter had not been to one of these places before and she said that this was a great first choice. We came here with her friend's family (who had a little bit of experience) and chose the room called "The Mall". The owner, Michele, who was very kind and informative, told us that this was the most challenging room that they have. And I'll tell you that is 100% true! We did not escape but our "game master", Sarah, was very nice and helped us out along the way.

room_title: Escape room "The Mall" by Complexity: A Puzzling Adventure in Hartford
review: What a fantastic time we had Saturday night! My friends were visiting from Europe so myself and other family members all went to conquer “The Mall!” It was definitely a challenge. Thankfully I had a witty crew that would not give up. With only two or so clues we made it out alive. Due to the difficult nature of this escape room and the variety of props it pays to try to keep everything organized, which we did quite well. Very professional. Very clever. Very, VERY exciting! We can’t wait to go back and experience the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape Atlantis" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape Game Iron Gate" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Black Ops - Destination Classified" by ALL IN Adventures Waterbury in Southington
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: My friends and I did the CSI room for a birthday. Matt was very helpful and nice, and even gave us an extra minute so we could make it out.  We will be back for sure to play high school detention and pawn shop.

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: Soooooooo much fun! An hour has never flown by so quickly. The rooms are great and the owners put a lot of thought into the set up and clues. Can't wait to go back!!

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: Challenging, fun, interesting story line and plenty of opportunities to be mislead!Great staff, too!

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: We had a blast going through this scenario. I love adventures that make you think outside the box and utilize those cerebral skills. It's amazing how you react in a situation like this and my team stepped up to the challenge. Mark made an excellent moderator and the whole experience was exhilarating! We must try another one here!

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: I've gone twice now. Both times were great fun. The scenarios were fun and the puzzles were a lot of fun as well. The moderators (we had 2 different ones) were both great. Gave hints only when needed and seemed to enjoy their jobs.

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: It was our first time in an escape room and we had so much fun! We didn't know what to expect but after our host shared the rules of the game we were excited. We made it out just after the plane departed.  We plan to return to try and conquer the CSI room. Can't wait for our next challenge!

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: First time here and had a BLAST!!! Definitely a must try, if you've never done something like this!Iydeen & Matt are the We'll be back to conquer the next case!!!

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: The House of Hints was a truly unique experience! Our group had fun trying to figure out the clues to solve the mystery, but we also learned a lot about each other’s strengths in the different ways we approached clues. We had a great time! Thanks!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Demento" by Room With A Clue in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Airplane Crash" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: This experience may sound like it would be cheesy or tiring to do after work but it was not that at all. The staff is super sweet and friendly and seem to genuinely care that you have a good time. Puzzles are interesting and fun. 60 minutes transport you into another world and allow a chance to learn about your strengths and how you communicate with your team mates.

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: The Escape Game San Francisco is a great spot to hit if you're around the area and looking for something fun and new to do with your group of friends. Test your team building skills and your brain power as you try and escape rooms filled with different puzzles and riddles. A timed adventure that will give you a sense of thrill and excitement. I have done 4 games here already and it never disappoints. The staff is also super friendly and makes the overall experience 10 times better. Lonnie and Joanna did a fantastic job at getting my group started! 10/10 would recommend :)

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: The escape game was so much fun. Marc did an amazing job getting us hype about our game. It really was an incredible experience and a great team building exercise for my company

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Great team building fun. Staff was concise yet thorough and it's easily the best vibe and fun I've had at an escape room

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: I had no desire to ever go to an escape room and when this activity was planned for us, several of the women were nervous about it. But after the experience, we ALL wanted to do it again! It was so much fun! I would definitely do this again!

room_title: Escape room "The Medieval Adventure" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: Excellent! Jenny did a terrific job getting us settled in the "Medieval Room" and making it a very enjoyable experience! It was a blast and we will definitely be back!  The teens wanted to take on another room after! I kind of did too! Great family fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Medieval Adventure" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: I have been there a total of 3 times and have tried 3 different rooms. All of them were totally engrossing, exciting and lots of fun! My favorite one so far is the medieval room. Office had too much math for me and London was hard!!' Haha. First timers should start with medieval! Enjoy guys!

room_title: Escape room "The Medieval Adventure" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: We did the Medieval room tonight and had such an incredible time! We got out with 3 minutes remaining. Great team building exercise and lots of laughs. The staff Adriana and Ian were very helpful and knew just when to offer us some clues. We can’t wait to go again!

room_title: Escape room "The Medieval Adventure" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: Excellent! Jenny did a terrific job getting us settled in the "Medieval Room" and making it a very enjoyable experience! It was a blast and we will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Medieval Adventure" by Can You Escape? in Tampa
review: The Medieval experience is challenging and so much fun. The staff were super friendly. I recommend Can you Escape? for a small or large group. I will be back to visit London or the Zombie (if my daughter can talk me into it). :)

room_title: Escape room "Inheritance" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: Had a great time in the inheritance room. Played with 3 people. Challenging enough to be fun but not so challenging that it is frustrating and not to easy to be boring. Wasn't successful in escaping the room in the allotted time but got very close. Had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Inheritance" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: It was great! From the moment we walked in, the staff was fun and informative. There were eight of us and we found it very challenging. We did the Inheritance room. Definitely a must do!

room_title: Escape room "Inheritance" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: Did the Inheritance room tonight with local friends and family visiting from France! The game was a perfect way to push through language barriers and get everyone engaged! Tons of fun and great staff! Thanks Escape Bradenton!

room_title: Escape room "Inheritance" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: We had a fantastic time as a group of 6 adults and one 11-year-old in the Inheritance room. The scene was set, the props and puzzles were intriguing. We were completely absorbed in the game. This is a great team-building and family-building activity that helps you see the strengths in others. The owner custom creates the rooms, and this makes the experience really authentic. Go do it!

room_title: Escape room "Inheritance" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: Love escape rooms. Done every one in the SRQ area and Escape Bradenton is great. Just did Inheritance, and already booked out for the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: This escape room is a wonderful addition to the OC and is awesome for newbies and veterans alike. The Hydeout room is a wonderful mixture of linear and nonlinear puzzles that definitely challenge the mind. The in-room mechanics gave it the extra nudge into 5 stars along with the friendly staff. Definitely recommending this spot to friends. Can't wait to try their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: The Hydeout room was very extremely fun and of course, challenging. The worker Joe who was working there was very kind, friendly, and funny. If you're in Anaheim as a local or visiting, I'd recommend this to anyone else to do this escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience with great staff, challenging puzzles, and awesome props!! I had so much fun and definitely HIGHLY recommend. Great activity not only for friends and family to work together but also a good team building exercise for co-workers or sports team. Looking forward to the upcoming rooms that are scheduled to open.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
