review: We loved it!! My husband, daughter and I made it out with only 3 minutes to spare! It was fun to spend the time together looking for clues and figuring out how to apply them to the challenge of finding the door key. Can"t wait to try the new rooms when they are ready! Kudos to Joe! He was great!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: This was an awesome experience! This was a first escape game for me and I can't wait to try others! I went with family, a group of 9 and we all had a lot of fun! Very exciting when you figure out the clues and it opens a new door! I encourage everyone to try it! You have to all work together! The staff was very friendly and engaging! We also made it out with 9 seconds to spare, which totally made our night!! Highly recommend!!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini's Final Act" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker: Aftermath" by Escape Woods in Atlanta
review: Very different than the traditional escape room. The bunker rocks. Great set, friendly staff. Clues are well thought out.

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker: Aftermath" by Escape Woods in Atlanta
review: Escape Woods is definitely an off-the-beaten path escape room location. My friends and I did The Bunker room. It was not very difficult intellectually, but a great immersive and fun experience. Our gamemaster was also helpful and engaging.

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker: Aftermath" by Escape Woods in Atlanta
review: Me and a few friends did The Bunker: Aftermath yesterday and had such a good time! It was the first time I had ever done an escape room and it set the bar high!

room_title: Escape room "Orion" by The Hidden Escape in Atlanta
review: There were four of us (adults) on a family weekend trip. We decided to try the Orion escape room and had a great time. The clues were challenging and creative. The facility is new (5 months) and designed well. We would definitely go back to try the second escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Orion" by The Hidden Escape in Atlanta
review: Four of us newbies took on Orion & even though we did NOT get out in time we had a blast! ❤️ Highly recommend it to others in the area!

room_title: Escape room "Orion" by The Hidden Escape in Atlanta
review: We did the Orion Escape room as a family. We had a great time trying to get out, even though we didn't make it. Our host was amazing! We'll definitely be back. It was a great family outing.

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Manor" by Room With a Clue in Honolulu
review: This is one of the most fun group activities I've done in a very long time. Even though we didn't beat the Haunted Mansion, we spent a very engaging, sometimes frantic hour as we nearly escaped. A special shout-out goes to our game master, Precious, who did a great job facilitating!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Manor" by Room With a Clue in Honolulu
review: Challenging but not too hard to work out. The Haunted Manor made us work as a team and used all of our individual strengths. Thanks for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Manor" by Room With a Clue in Honolulu
review: Our family of five (three teenaged sons ages 15 and 13) and my sister tackled the Haunted Mansion. It was a wonderfully creative escape room which we thoroughly enjoyed. The game master was great about offering us hints when he saw us flailing, and even offered to trade time for clues when it was clear we were going to run out of time. We ultimately "escaped" but officially, we didn't. :-) The puzzles were clever and thematic. Double thumbs up for this escape room experience!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Manor" by Room With a Clue in Honolulu
review: Not my favorite room. The puzzles were ok, mostly traditional and a bit cliche if you have done many rooms. The room is not heavily themed, meaning I did not feel like I was in a haunted mansion - more like someones house with a few Halloween decorations.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loads of fun! It's a challenging puzzle with live actors. We finished with only a minute to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Great time with visiting Family from Oklahoma. We did good.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was a lot of fun! Definitely want to come back for the Crime Scene Room.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Celebrated my birthday by doing the Secret Temple room. Amazing. Very fun. Without any spoilers, I can say they made my birthday very special. Can't wait to come back for the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Last day in LA , me and my film friends decided to be random and do the escape room. We underestimated the experience and it turned out to be great. The actor was great and the escape room was definitely challenging. We achieved it with 2 seconds left. Will definitely do this again.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: After hearing about escape rooms from a fellow co-worker I decided to get a few friends together to try one out! I looked around online and eventually came upon Enigma and after looking at all of the reviews we went and booked the Secret Temple. The website was really simple to navigate and we received a confirmation email with all of the details we needed. Once we arrived at the building, we were greeted by our host with a friendly smile and really hyped us up for what was about to come. After all of the rules and backstory, we were then led to our room. The room had a bit of a National Treasure feel and there was a lot of character to the room. The puzzles were well thought out and it really made us rack our brains trying to get everything solved. We did have to use our two hints to escape but the whole adventure was just a great experience all together and we escape with only a minute to spare. We are looking forward to coming back and trying another room in the near future here.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I'm still so pumped from just saving millions of lives! I just got out of Apt. 205 with 2 other friends at Enigma Escape Rooms, and I have to say Bravo! I haven't seen my college friends in a while because we've all been busy with work and never seem to catch some time to hang out. Today we all happen to have a few hours to kill, so we called up Enigma because we've been dying to try it out. Not only was the staff incredibly friendly, but there was also parking (which is a huge plus)!We got there, they greeted us at the top of the stairs very nicely, we were told a little of what to expect, then we waited about 30 seconds and someone came out, and we got started. The storyline is awesome! The actor there was so committed it made our experience so much better! The puzzles were challenging, the adrenaline was pumping, and my friends and I had a killer time! Totally worth the time and money! I can't wait to go back and do The Will!

room_title: Escape room "Space Squad in Space" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: awesome games, clean, safe great staff. Drinks and food was good. will come again

room_title: Escape room "Space Squad in Space" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: First time here and had such a blast

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Countdown in Fort Myers
review: We did the jail break room. It was our first escape room ever. We had 5 in our group (wife, our two sons ages 21 and 23 and nephew aged 22). I loved watching everybody spread out and work the clues that they found. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Countdown in Fort Myers
review: Myself and 7 of my friends did the Jail Break Room and we had a blast! Kim and Sarah were absolutley hilarious and totally patient with all our ADD ridden selves. Thank you guys for making our first escape room experience a memorable one! Can't wait to see your other rooms :)

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Countdown in Fort Myers
review: Had the 1st birthday party here and the girls loved it! We booked the prison cell escape. It was challenging, but not so tough the girls lost interest. Sarah was so helpful and welcoming. My daughter and her friends can't wait to go back. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for adventure, team building, and general fun. Thanks again!!

room_title: Escape room "Bust the Bank" by Count:down Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Detective's Office" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: We took my daughter and friends her for her birthday 12-14 y/os. They absolutely had a blast. We did the Detectives Office and with using all our hints, we escaped right on the dot. The crew there was so fun and helpful. We will definitely go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Detective's Office" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: This was the first time we ever did an escape the room and we had so much fun! The clues are fun to find and make you think outside of the box. We did the detectives room and had a blast... plus we solved it!

room_title: Escape room "The Detective's Office" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: We did the detective room..lots of fun! And the staff is wonderful, can't think of her name..she's blonde, very helpful and sweet :)

room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Fun! I wasn't sure what to expect it it was a fun challenge and I can't wait to try other challenges!

room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: My family visited Phoenix Escape Room at the recommendation of a friend. Our ages varied from 6-46 -- and we all had an amazing time. The whole experience was really well done. I'd recommend them in a second.

room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: I just finished their two new rooms, The Path and Curse on the Emerald Sea, at their new location and I must say that they were both quite well done and very indicative of the care they put into the business. Both rooms had great set designs, ambiance, and the puzzles were creative and, excluding one that I just wasn't getting for a bit, just the right side of difficult but achievable. I want to also praise the staff, they were all friendly and funny and each had their own unique style that I think really brings an air of friendliness to the business that you don't see in a lot of escape rooms. They clearly care about you having a good time. If you're looking for something to do I really recommend giving these rooms a try, where else can you find yourself in the hold of a ship, a zen garden, search for a magical creature, and help save a city in one day? Go, go do it now.

room_title: Escape room "Dystopia" by Locked Adventures in San Marcos (CA)
review: This escape room definitely exceeded my expectations. Me and my best friend spontaneously decided to do an escape room with our younger sisters so it was just us four, but we managed to escape!!! I have done many scary themed escape rooms, but this one really did bring my adrenaline up pretty high. I would definitely recommend this escape room, especially when you’re into the more thrill-seeking escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Count:down Escape Games in West Palm Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mayan Ruins" by Think Escape Games in Miami
review: We had an amazing time in the Mayan escape room. The room was so well done I can't stop taking about it. The puzzles, the room, the decor...all very cool. It's a great option even if your group is on the smaller side, like our team of four. Fun outing for friends, family or work team building.

room_title: Escape room "Mayan Ruins" by Think Escape Games in Miami
review: Me and my wife did the Mayan ruins room and it was one of our favorites to date. Puzzles were great and the visual theme was even better. Would definitely recommend to all.

room_title: Escape room "Mayan Ruins" by Think Escape Games in Miami
review: We all loved the experience,. It was a little challenging for my 11 and 13 year old grandchildren, but with a little support, we made it through to the end. I’d definitely recommend the Mayan experience.

room_title: Escape room "Operation Longbow" by Labyrinth Escape Games in Boise
review: This was my first time at an escape room.  I am almost 50 and went with my husband, my son and his wife.  We did Operation Longbow, and we managed to get out with 13 min to spare.  I didn't know what to expect but we had so much fun solving the puzzles to get out. The staff was super friendly and helpful. There are not many things that I have in common with my son and his wife as they are in their 20's and it is hard to find things to do that we would all enjoy.  Labyrinth was a perfect outing for us and I can't wait to go back and do it again, hard part is choosing which room to do next.

room_title: Escape room "Operation Longbow" by Labyrinth Escape Games in Boise
review: This has been by far my favorite escape room in the treasure valley. The room was challenging, had special effects, codes, puzzles, a good back story and the hosts were amazing! Our group ranged from 12 years to 60ish; from people who have done escape room around the US and newbies. All of us (8 total) loved it!!! This room had space enough for everyone. Way to go on a great room, we will do the other room offered! If you want to have a great memorable time try this out. Another extra--you CAN take photos, if you have been to other escape rooms they do not let you take photos--here they do! Thank you for letting us document these memories!!!

room_title: Escape room "Operation Longbow" by Labyrinth Escape Games in Boise
review: Operation Longbow is a top 20% room and now my #1 favorite in the Treasure Valley...Set design (+ props): the very best currently in the Treasure Valley, and will be hard to top. Mechanics, Tech, & Special Effects: the best and most elaborate currently in the Treasure Valley.  Working tech is very important to the Labyrinth team, and I'm happy to report all tech worked perfectly.Clue Distribution: one of the best I have encountered, very clever and hopefully maintainable.  We didn't need to really use it, but it really fit the WWII theme well.Searching: kept minimal, which is ideal, especially for veterans (thank you).Puzzles: very logical and required little [if any] guessing.  Excellent progression feedback. They were the perfect level of difficulty for beginner/intermediate players, but possibly too simple for veteran players and enthusiasts.  That is a tough balance to strike for an ER, and I understand why they erred towards the easier side for this room.  I'd love to see some development to allow for a quick-to-implement option to increase the difficulty here (my team of 4 got out in under 28 minutes with no clues). Lighting: Dim, but not low enough to need a flashlight.Bottom line is that this group took their vast experience, discovered what they liked and didn't like, and used that knowledge to build a terrific room that offers an excellent experience.  I'd recommend this room as #1 for enthusiasts visiting the area, and would just caution local 1st timers to not expect the exact same level of excellence at most of the other local options.  We also did the 60 minute version of another one of their rooms called Revolution (they typically run this with a 30 min version of the room).  Set design was excellent, use of tech/mechanics were great, clue distribution was unique and fun and fit the period perfectly, puzzles were mostly fun and unique, but their final puzzle I feel could use some more thought as that could definitely be improved upon and still keep the period authenticity they are hoping for.If you're going to do a few rooms in the area, absolutely do Operation Longbow, but save it for last.I'll for sure be back to try their Excalibur room that they expect to open in a couple months.

room_title: Escape room "The Motel" by Escape Mystery Rooms in Little Rock

It was so cool to see how immersive and just overall interactive the room itself was, the puzzles we're challenging but really cool to solve, and Jessica was an awesome game host when it came to helpful hints. room_title: Escape room "The Caretaker" by America's Escape Game in Miami
review: Even though we failed, we had soooo much fun and can't wait to try the next escape rooms!!! And we loved our clue giver Steven. Such a cool experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Caretaker" by America's Escape Game in Miami

room_title: Escape room "The Condo" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Aunt Edna's Condo was so fun! One of the best rooms I've escaped.

review: We had a great time. The added effect of having actors in the escape room made the entire experience very memorable. I have done a fair share of escape rooms and enjoyed the theatrics surrounding this escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 3: The Gatekeeper" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles

review: Our group did the Ravenswood room, and it was super interesting, and really creepy! We had a good team and all worked together to escape. Locksmith Escape Games was awesome! And the game masters were super helpful and friendly. Thank you! Will be back

room_title: Escape room "What Happened in Raven Woods?" by Locksmith Escape Games in Orlando
review: I had such a great time!! We did Ravenwood and curse of the evil genie!! Both were exciting and beautifully done! I can’t wait to do voodoo island The staff there are awesome and make the experience great!

room_title: Escape room "Red Giant" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I did the Red Giant room. It is one of the best rooms we have done. The puzzles were intricate and each room had unique tech that made it a lot of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Red Giant" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Took my 8 year old niece here and we had SO much fun. We did the easiest room (the red giant)and it was just the right amount of challenging for the adults and some simple things that she was able to do. Honestly, she probably figured out more than the adults (she's a smarty like that). It was great for her because it was so interactive and hands on. We've been to many rooms that are just a bunch of locks and keys and that's not what this one was. Props and statues put in the right place would activate a movement. It was well done!! The man at the beginning was great at getting my niece excited. He explained so sweetly about the game and made it sound so fun that she was confident and ready to conquer. That intro made it!

room_title: Escape room "Red Giant" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: This review is for Red Giant only."Red Giant" refers to a ruby in a crypt, not the planet, so leave your space helmets at home.Parking here is super convenient in the back of the building, but the driveway leading to the parking lot is FILLED with potholes, and when we went there, a giant pond was formed b/c of the rain. There is a ring doorbell and the words "QUEST ROOM" in red next to the door. It looks super sketch back there.But once you ring the bell and enter, it is NICE inside. It's obvious that they put a lot of effort in building and maintaining the place. The room itself is VERY well thought out, from where they orient you, to the hints, to the final puzzle. We only needed two hints. The first hint we needed because we weren't patient enough, and the second hint we needed because we weren't as observant when we first entered the tomb as we should have been. There were a couple of times when we received unsolicited hints because we weren't on the right track, which was really nice of them.All in all, I LOVED how this room was designed. Everything really fit well. If I were to change anything, it would be to minimize the Many pages of text in this one book. It's fun, but the book was filled with red herrings, which you don't realize are red herrings until you get to the end and the book explicitly explains which pages are important. I highly recommend this room!

room_title: Escape room "Christmas VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise

room_title: Escape room "Death and Breakfast" by Adventure Vault in Miami
review: Amazing experience trying to solve this crazy Death and Breakfast mystery, collaborating with friends and strangers. The owners were incredibly nice and they definitely made my first escape room experience one for the books.Challenging and fun!HIGHLY recommended!Thanks for an awesome night Adventure Vault, see you soon!

room_title: Escape room "Death and Breakfast" by Adventure Vault in Miami
review: Have done a decent amount of escape rooms and this one is at the top of my list. I've done the Death and Breakfast and the Prison Break, they both are fantastic and I'm coming back to do Sherlock. If your looking for good rooms they are for sure here!

room_title: Escape room "Death and Breakfast" by Adventure Vault in Miami
review: The Death & Breakfast room was challenging without being overly difficult. We had 4 in our group and really had a good experience. We are planning on going to the Prison Redemption room very soon to try it. The Staff is exceptionally helpful and we all had great conversation afterwards. Definitely go check the Adventure Vault out for a fun activity. Thanks Daniel for a wonderful night.

room_title: Escape room "Poisoning at the Palace" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: Enjoyed our time and solved the Palace poisoning! Great theme, staff! Loved it!

room_title: Escape room "Poisoning at the Palace" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: We had a blast yesterday. We made it out and in a new record time!! Poisoning in the palace was awesome!!

room_title: Escape room "Poisoning at the Palace" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: Thank you so much for taking great care of our staff today. You and your family are outstanding and we are lucky to have you in our community.

review: This was so much fun. We had a party of 7 (3 of them were kids 10 and under) and we all enjoyed escaping the CODE room. Some may say it's more for adults but even the little ones had a great time and even solved some of the puzzles. Definitely wanna go back and try all the rooms.

room_title: Escape room "TH3 C0D3" by Escapology Lake Elsinore in Temecula
review: Really cool. I've now done 2 rooms. ANTIDOTE AND THE CODE. . I truly enjoyed myself each time. Can't wait to continue playing the games! Beautiful decor, excellent staff, and great overall experience. This is what Elsinore needs! It's new, exciting and challenging! Date night, girls day, corporate team building. . It's perfect for all!

room_title: Escape room "TH3 C0D3" by Escapology Lake Elsinore in Temecula
review: Just left the code room! It was a lot fun! We are a family of four and had an amazing time. Such friendly and great staff! My kids absolutely loved it as well as my husband and I. It's truly a place for the whole family to enjoy! Everything inside the room was clean which as a mom I always appreciate and look for... nothing sticky or gooey with other people's germs. Thank you escapeology for a great family experience!!!

room_title: Escape room "Hunting Lodge: Wolf Moon Night" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Was very disappointed with this escape room. Despite the wonderful hosts, polite and friendly attitude, the story telling before the room felt rushed and mostly pointless. The room was poorly constructed, offering no immersion into the scenario, the props were lack luster, with many of them being broken or poorly functioning. The puzzles were a madening combination of way to easy, and way to convaluted. The puzzles were often solved out of order, leading to confusion when pointless clues were discovered later. While challenge is to be expected, many aspects were more dumb than challenging, such as a 5 letter combo lock utilizing only 4 letters in the solution, broken props that seem like puzzles, and visual problems that are very counter intuitive. My biggest regret is that I introduced 2 friends to escape rooms here and I can only hope that the poor taste left in their mout from this doesn't stop them from trying others with me in the future.

room_title: Escape room "Hunting Lodge: Wolf Moon Night" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: The quality of the room and the props were poorly constructed. The puzzles were convoluted and not satisfying when solved. One lock with 5 digits had to be opened using a 4 digit code. Puzzles could be solved out of order. Our host was patient and pleasant to have.

room_title: Escape room "Hunting Lodge: Wolf Moon Night" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: So much fun yet challenging. Really makes you work as a team and think outside the box. The hosts are so friendly and encouraging. We had such a great time, we've already booked to come back and do the second room.

room_title: Escape room "Hunting Lodge: Wolf Moon Night" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: The hosts are extremely friendly, very good in story telling, high quality props, challenging yet manageable puzzles, heaps of fun, had a lot of fun solving them with 5 people coming. Host were really nice to honour the scoopon price even though we just came there with one extra person.Highly recommended for everyone, I am coming back next week with the kids and I know they will love it

room_title: Escape room "Hunting Lodge: Wolf Moon Night" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Very friendly host who knew how to set the scene before we entered the room. Maybe a little bit overloaded with information, but it was all very fun and challenging at the same time. I was quite happy with my mathatical skills for the colour box but the rest was tricky and mindbogglingly fun! It was good having 5 people trying to figure it out together. Can't wait to come back and do the second room

room_title: Escape room "Hunting Lodge: Wolf Moon Night" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Loved this place. Wonderful friendly staff were very inviting and set the scene well. Our group consisted of 2 adults and 4 children aged 13-17. Everyone got involved and can't wait to come back and do the next room. The puzzles were great and made us think, unfortunately we couldn't beat the fasten time for the room. Thanks so very much for such a great experience.

room_title: Escape room "They're Coming" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We have now done all 3 rooms at this location, after just completing - and escaping from - They're Coming on Sunday. We have done rooms at 2 of the other Maze Room locations and this one is BY FAR the best!!! The rooms are creative, the puzzles are clever and the staff is fantastic. On Sunday, John made They're Coming a great experience. He gave us tips when we needed but held back when we thought we could figure it out. And when he wasn't sure, he asked! Great concept. (At times I feel like game masters give unwanted help - over-enthusiasm, which I understand, but can be a bit frustrating/annoying.) John was very friendly, positive and genuinely excited for us. He definitely added to the zombie escaping experience. I wish I could say we'd be back, but they need to make a new room first. Please do!

room_title: Escape room "They're Coming" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This is another great Maze Rooms location with quality escape rooms. We played all three games at this location back to back. My husband and I played them, just the 2 of us. We liked all of them. The set design and props are well done. Our favorite was They're Coming. I'm a fan of Evil Dead, so I loved all of nods to it. The puzzles were clever and fun. The set design and props were top notch. The story is clear.

room_title: Escape room "They're Coming" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I have done quite a few escape rooms and the "They're Coming" room has been one of my favorite ones to date. The production value was incredible and the room went through without a hitch. My inexperienced group and I got through the room with 5 minutes to spare using two hints. It had just the right amount of challenge to it, while still being creative, unique, and a little scary. Our game master was Joy and she made the experience immersive and was friendly and funny, making us want to come back to try the other rooms. 10/10

room_title: Escape room "The Secret of Dragon's Spire" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Was a wonderful and fun experience. We had 5 in our group and did the Kidnapped theme. Our guide was awesome. We will be going back and doing every room.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: This evening some friends and I participated in our first escape room game and chose the Kidnapped theme. Had a fantastic time. The staff was great, so was the atmosphere. Will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Had a great time being Kidnapped! We had adults and teens in our group and all had a blast. Alas we were unable to get free before time expired. Will definitely try another time!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: This was the second Escape Room I have been in. We did the Kidnapping. I was very impressed. We had so much fun. We went as a group of 5 which seemed like the perfect amount of people for the small room. We felt like we were in a room that was a dungeon with it being dark and handcuffed. the room was fully decorated in the theme, even the floors and ceiling matched the theme. They even made the sounds in the room match the theme. It was scary and exciting. the clues forced us to work together as a team. everyone in my group had something to do, so no one got left out. I personally feel like an escape room should be more than just shoving people in a room with puzzles, they did a great job of making you immersed int he experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: Absolute best escape rooms in Jacksonville! Very interactive and staff was extremely friendly as well as helpful. Me and my husband were paired up with a group of teenagers that were also super helpful & a ton of fun to team up with.Would definitely recommend the Kidnapping room! Can't wait to go back and do another room!!

room_title: Escape room "Aunt Edna's Condo" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: What a great time! If you haven't been here yet it's definitely a must!!! Aunt Edna's property managers were the best!!!

room_title: Escape room "Aunt Edna's Condo" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: We had a great time with Aunt Edna. Lots of laughs and fun. A must do again. Thank you for a unique experience.

room_title: Escape room "Aunt Edna's Condo" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: We tried both rooms back to back. These rooms are well planned out and executed. They are both challenging yet fair with the appropriate number of hints for both rooms. Our family loves escape rooms and these did not disappoint. Don't miss out, try both rooms! I would suggest starting with Aunt Edna first, then go on to the more challenging Baker Street. Wonderful owner and awesome lobby puzzles!

room_title: Escape room "The Amulet of Time" by Mystic Escape Room in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sweet Dreams" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: Great experience! Loved doing this with my family and some of them were nervous but it was perfect for their first time.

room_title: Escape room "Sweet Dreams" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: We’ve been to a couple and this was the best. They thought of everything. Elaborate set, interesting clues.

room_title: Escape room "Sweet Dreams" by Escaped In Time in Colorado Springs
review: Escaped in Time is fantastic! The staff was kind and thorough in their explanations of the entire escape room experience! Such a fun and unique way to bond with our team while also being challenged! My group of five played the Sweet Dreams room and were able to escape! I'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Continent" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Love this place. I've done the space themed room and The Lost Continent room. Both are fantastic! The Lost Continent room is amazing. Lots of cool puzzles and unexpected twists and turns. Definitely try this place!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Continent" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This was one of the funniest experiences for a group of four first-timers. Our group went in not having a clue what to expect. Who would have thought it would be fun paying to get locked into a room for an hour trying to figure out a bunch of challenging puzzle and riddles just to get back out!Super challenging and thought provoking. Took 53:11 to finish "The Lost Continent" which was one of the moderately challenging rooms.I am amazed by the prep work that is put into this and would recommend everyone to give it a shot especially with the crew here!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Continent" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This was by far one of the coolest things we all have done in a long time! It was a first time for all of us! Not only is it clever, it's fun, and the staff was so friendlyAnd helpful and really helped to just make this a great experience! And..... We escaped with 7 second to spare!

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: One of the most fun, most clever experiences ever! We took my husband here for his birthday and all 8 of us had a great time working together and trying to figure out the way out of the room! Thank you Golden Puzzle Rooms for a unique afternoon and we will definitely be back again!!

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: I took my husband for his birthday and he loved it. It was just the 2 of us in the room so there were just too many puzzles for us to complete. So definitely take more people. We had so much fun and will do this again!

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: Amazing and totally worth the money. Beat it with 5 mins to spare!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: This is the most amazing activity to engage in. You've got something good here, and I hope it continues to grow. My experience was so much fun, even though my group was soooooo frickin close but still soooo far away from completing the whole thing. I'll be back for new rooms & new puzzles. room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: Diane is amazing! My daughter has not only loved learning to play immediately but has used it as her talent for school and pageant shows. We love the studio environment as well. Easy parking in quint downtown Roseville.

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: This is a a fun, challenging experience with numerous sophisticated puzzles to solve.

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: I won't give details; that would ruin the fun! And there was a tremendous amount of fun to be had. I will say that to get there, you need to go to the J St/K St alley on 10th St. The entrance is right next to Pre Flite bar. When it was time to get puzzling, Matthew the Butler came to fetch us and give us the lowdown. We didn't escape, but we were so close it made my heart hurt. Regardless, we had a spectacular time and it was well worth it! When they change it up, we absolutely will be back for more.

room_title: Escape room "The Legacy" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: This escape room is amazing! I did the Pirate one with the Brainy Actz a few months ago and decided to come back for the Legacy. It was so challenging and a blast! My friend and we were the only two in the room. Taylor who is always at the front desk helping with the escape rooms is incredible! She remembered from our time before! It makes me even more excited to keep coming back.

room_title: Escape room "The Legacy" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: As far as escape rooms go, I've been to a few and Brainy Actz is easily my favorite. The Temecula location has a Legacy room that actually integrates story elements from the rooms I've done in Irvine, which was super cool. It really made it seem like the other rooms I've run were still a part of the experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Legacy" by Brainy Actz in Temecula
review: We were very pleased with our fun experience solving the mystery of the Legacy room. From the time making reservations to the finish, the service was great. I think the more people in your group is the better. Thank you, staff, for making our time in the room so enjoyable. Looking forward to our next visit.

room_title: Escape room "The Theater" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: The themes are great and exciting. The two rooms we did were fun yet challenging; we couldn’t wait to find the next clue. I can’t wait to try them all out. The staff is very helpful.

room_title: Escape room "The Theater" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: My team and I did the movie theatre. There were so many fun little clues and puzzles that we as a group had to communicate in order to escape. It brought us as a team closer together. I would recommend this course to build the morale of your team.

room_title: Escape room "The Theater" by Escape the Room Denver in Denver
review: I've been to a couple escape rooms before but this one is very interactive. We did The Theater room and the theme was amazing and everyone working during our time was awesome! Definitely going to try the other rooms!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Smuggler" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Lost City" by Escapology Trumbull in Danbury
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Skeleton Key" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: Our group of 6 (late teens and adults) had a great time with this game. Cleverly arranged, and just a few hints along the way helped us solve the puzzle with 20 seconds to spare.

room_title: Escape room "Skeleton Key" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: Super fun and challenging. Operated by a husband and wife team. Wonderful people. Great addition to Rohnert Park. Definitely check them out!

room_title: Escape room "Skeleton Key" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: Our group of 5 had an awesome time doing the Skeleton Key room today. Three of us had done escape rooms in the past, and two were rookies. All of us had a great time and can't wait to go back and do the other room. The owners were very kind and we enjoyed talking to them prior to doing the room. We are so glad we don't have to drive all the way to San Francisco to experience an escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We did the Spellbound room and it was really fun. No one will be bored at any point as there were a lot of puzzles. There are also a lot of locks but the puzzles to find the codes are varied. The best part was our game master. He was really nice and fun. Amazing energy. Definitely recommend checking it out.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Just did Spellbound tonight and had a great time. I have done 4 other ones, but for the rest of the group, it was their first. We were on the last clue when time ran out, but my friends had such a good time that we'll definitely be back. The clues were very thorough, interactive and seemed to be well thought out. This is a great family-friendly room as well.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We did the Spellbound room and liked a lot of things about it.  The decor/ambiance is really good and the puzzles are both fun and challenging.  It is different than other escape rooms that I've done in the past in that there are several objectives you are trying to complete, it's not the typical solving one puzzle leads to the next, leads to the next until you're free.  Because of the way it is structured, doing it with strangers is fine because they can be working on one puzzle while you work on another and if they find a clue for you or you find one of theirs you can share information, but multiple objectives can be getting done at the same time.  It was easy to get tickets and book through their online system and the guy who co-owns it was really nice and helpful. The building they chose for the location is great because it is on a rooftop and there is EASY parking in the back.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Time Machine 2" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: Our first experience in an escape room...and we loved it.  We really did feel as though we had stepped back in time.  A lot of fun puzzles/clues and the game/room master was very helpful with his hints.  There were four of us...we didn't escape, but we were soooo close!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Time Machine 2" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: The very first escape room my wife and I have ever done. Playing the "Time-Machine" room with just the two of us was challenging. The puzzles are easy enough to get you really going. Some puzzles within the game may seem to be overwhelming, but keep trying. Ask for help when you are really stuck. Their clues are not that vague to where it is confusing.A great place to have friends and family enjoy their time and co-workers to build teamwork! Definitely would return and play with friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Time Machine 2" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: This was my first escape room experience and it was super fun and really utilized our teamwork and collaboration skills! Definitely a brain exercise that makes you think outside the box and what was especially cool was the detail that made you feel like you stepped into a time machine! A must try!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Time Machine 2" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: This was my third escape room game, but I have to say it was a very good one! We were a group of five and had a blast during an hour. The different mysteries we had to solve were very well planned and new to everything I could have seen before. I would definitely recommend that to everyone (English speaking or not) who is ready for an hour of fun and excitement!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Time Machine 2" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: This was my and my boyfriend's first experience with an escape room -- and Codebreakers sets the bar high! Corrine, the owner, was extremely kind, genuine, personal, helpful, and reassuring, and her passion truly shined through in the conversations we had with her. The diner room's theming was super cute, the backstory was quite a bit of fun, and the technology associated within added a layer of fun interactivity. Each puzzle was exciting and fun, and it all seemed to flow together smoothy. Highly recommend for couples, families, business outings, team building, birthday parties, and any opportunity you're looking for to have some fun!

room_title: Escape room "Joker's Asylum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: Went to omescape with my family just for fun. It was our first time ever doing an escape room, and my brother chose 'Jokers Asylum' which is the hardest one to do. We didn't know what to expect. But even though we didn't have any experience, it was so fun. The puzzles were very challenging and fun at the same time. The waiting area was fun filled with games and a couple of practice problem things to get you ready for the rooms. The staff was very nice and helpful. Hoping to come back real soon!

room_title: Escape room "Joker's Asylum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: My first escape room! We did Joker's Asylum. It was definitely difficult - needed a nap after! Would make a unique experience for corporate events or birthday parties. The staff was very nice - they didn't rush us at all when we went overtime and they gave us hints when they saw we were struggling a bit.If you're up for the challenge and you've got a good team, it makes for a fun and new activity!

room_title: Escape room "Joker's Asylum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: So much fucking fun. XD

room_title: Escape room "Joker's Asylum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: This was hands down the coolest thing ever!!!! Felt like I was in a movie. We didn't escape in time because we dropped a clue but we were so close!

room_title: Escape room "Joker's Asylum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: It was really awesome and exciting experience!

room_title: Escape room "Joker's Asylum" by Omescape in San Jose
review: Second time.... Still it's fun to be here...This time it was the hardest though

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by ROOM 5280 in Denver
review: Second escape room I've ever done. Absolutely had a blast with my family and would definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by ROOM 5280 in Denver
review: This was our first escape room experience and we absolutely loved it! Would definitely recommend Room 5280 to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by ROOM 5280 in Denver
review: we chose to do an escape room for our TEEN daughter's birthday. we selected The Heist, and what a fun it was. we had such gala time, it was thoughtfully conceptualised with great clues, and trust me, it wasn't easy. we were completely engrossed, and completely in the zone, and we didn't know when or where did our 60 mins fly. the best part was that we bonded as a family, my son and daughter couldn't stop talking about it the whole day !!its a must do activity with friends, with family.

room_title: Escape room "Sweet Revenge" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Loved this escape room experience.  Kids were mostly 12 and it was a great level for them and super fun experience.

room_title: Escape room "Sweet Revenge" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Went here for my first escape room experience and it was awesome! Sydney was our game master and she was incredible! We did the sweet revenge room. Would definitely recommend and would definitely go again

room_title: Escape room "Sweet Revenge" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: This place is incredible!! Have done Locked In Dead and Sweet Revenge, and their rooms never cease to impress me. The staff is awesome, and the rooms are escape-able while being fun and challenging. Also, the tech inside both rooms blew me away. Highly recommend

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I came here with my family and we did the new room "The Seance". It was beyond amazing, production value was insane! There are some moments in the game that we really freaked out because it felt like the room is haunted.This room is on the scarier side. But we loved it! They have 4 other rooms that are not scary at all so we are also planning on trying them out in the next future.

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Seance room and it was a great time. Barely made it out in time. Def worth a visit. Very well done and immersive.

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was a lot of fun! Definitely want to come back for the Crime Scene Room.

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience!!! Can't wait to go back and try another room!!

room_title: Escape room "Captivated at Sea" by Clues and Gumshoes in San Francisco
review: What a fun way to spend some time with family or friends!  We had so much fun figuring out how to escape from Captivated At Sea. Much better than a couple of hours at a movie or other type of entertainment. We actually needed to work together to solve the clues we were finding and each solved clue led to another clue. The clues were all unique and intriguing. The solutions were a lot of fun.The creators of Clues and Gumshoes are clearly very creative. They put together an interesting room with an interesting story to go with it. Lots of fun things to interact with in the room.This experience has definately got us hooked on Escape Rooms. We want to go back and try the other three rooms at Clues and Gumshoes.

room_title: Escape room "Captivated at Sea" by Clues and Gumshoes in San Francisco
review: We had so much fun at Clues and Gumshoes! Our group did the "At Sea" room and it was one of the most challenging escape rooms I have ever done. They have some very unique puzzles that we had never seen at other places, which made the room fun to solve.I highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: This is probably one of my favorite escape rooms in Orlando. The rooms were very immersive and the game masters were very helpful. We did the Under Pressure room, which is the hardest room, but still escaped with time left on the clock. The rooms are amazing!

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Had a great time! We did Under Pressure and I’ll say this - I felt the pressure! I used parts of my brain I never knew were there. Lots of fun and a great attraction to do with family and friends! We actually booked a second room to do before we leave! Highly recommend to those coming to visit or live in the area.

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Just got out of the "Under Pressure" room with some friends. I have been to 3 other competing companies around the area and done most of the escape rooms they currently offer, and this room was one of the most challenging and fun ones we have completed. The theming was on POINT, there was just enough to do, and there were a few surprises along the way. And our game guide, James, was so much fun. He knew when to drop a hint and when to let us struggle for a bit. Overall, it was a fantastic experience that I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in Time" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Our company had a team building event here. All of the staff members were friendly and helpful. The escape room was fun and challenging. Would highly recommend for team building events, parties, or a fun weekend event with a group of friends.

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in Time" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Well-designed, well-maintained rooms with excellent puzzles and friendly staff. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Trapped in Time" by Urban Escape Games in Atlanta
review: This is by far the most well executed escape room facility we’ve ever been to! We’ve been to several around Atlanta and the rooms at Urban Escape have been our favorite. The puzzles are challenging, and are all correctly correlated to the theme of each room. We’ve tried out two of the four rooms and we can’t wait to try the other two! Great job, Urban Escape!

room_title: Escape room "Corporate Spy" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: My family including 2 teenage boys got to try Escape Reality last night and it was incredible!! They were so welcoming and friendly! Their Corporate Room was awesome! We barely escaped with just 6 minutes to spare and it required actual verbal communication between my wife, my sons and myself in order to conquer the "mission"! Thank you Escape Reality and the owners for reminding us how fun and night out with the kids can be! You are amazing and we are already scheduling our next visit!!

room_title: Escape room "Corporate Spy" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: THIS PLACE IS GREAT. I did my first escape room here with 3 others as a double date night and man did I have the most fun. We did the Corporate Spy room - the theme from the TV show "The Office" was well executed. Had tons of fun, and escaped with 8 minutes to spare!!

room_title: Escape room "The Greatest Murder of Westwood" by Novus Escape Room in West Palm Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Villain's Lair" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: My wife and I as well as another couple had been referred to play here from owners of another escape room. We are so happy we went! The three games were all great. The Lab is a great intro room - tweens/teens would like it as would rookie escapers. We did AI and it was also fun. Villain’s Lair ended up being our favorite despite us not getting out (20 more seconds, so close!!). Sabrina was great as our game master and is definitely an asset to the company. Definitely check this place out if you like good and intuitive rooms with great scenery.

room_title: Escape room "The Villain's Lair" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: This is the 3rd escape room I've done, first two in LA. I thought this one was awesome! We did the villains lair (escaping a North Korean jail) that has a 23% pass rate. Our host was super nice in getting us set up and explaining things. Id recommend for sure and would be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Villain's Lair" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Did both the newest Villain's Lair and the AI escape rooms here. I thought the AI room was more of a room that was rated 4, and the Villain's Lair a 4.5.Both rooms were extremely different, but very engaging. My group of six with varied levels of experience had a lot of fun trying to figure out the puzzles which required some thinking out of the box for both rooms and a lot of running around.I'd recommend at least a group of four for Villain's Lair and no less than four. I think we benefited from having six people because for both AI and Villain's Lair there were a couple puzzles that definitely helped having more people, not less, which is the opposite of what I find for most escape rooms. (I find 4 to be the perfect number). Having spent a lot of time surveying other escapers to find out what rooms would work for a larger group, we settled on Exit Game, and I'm glad we did! Escaping in time definitely relied on teamwork!For Villain's Lair there was a greater level of detail put into the room than in AI, and a lot less button pushing. However, there is one puzzle in Villain's Lair that requires a lot more abstract thinking and may or may not take your group longer to figure out. When we went, the "alarm" was speeding up which made a couple of us think we had lost and didn't escape when we still had 7 minutes left when we escaped! Since it was new to the San Diego space, we figured it was expected that they would still have issues and gave them feedback.For AI the details of the rooms were a lot less immersive than Villain's Lair, and I felt most of the puzzles required button pushing. I liked the use of technology and the use of a computer. A few of the puzzles really forced ourselves to think outside of the box. Once you have "escaped" you can choose to do hard mode, which our group chose to do.Villain's Lair we were told was a mix of traditional locks and technology (a mix of AI and The Lab basically), of which our group enjoyed more personally. AI is more technology and have no real locks that I can think of, and The Lab which we haven't done is more a traditional lock type room.I really liked our game master, who gave us appropriate clues without revealing too much, just the way we like it, via walkie talkies for both rooms.I'd definitely add Exit Games as one of the top Escape Room companies in San Diego. My group will be back to do their last room, The Lab.

room_title: Escape room "The Gold Digger" by Pursue the Clues in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Vector Escape Games in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "UFO Investigation" by Escape Zone 60 in Destin
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Magic Archive" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Seriously the best escape room ever! Area 51 is my favorite. Love this place.

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Great team building experience. Although we failed our mission in Area 51 and were taken over by the aliens, we still had fun! Owners and staff were friendly and accommodating.

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: What a trip!! We loved figuring out our Area 51 escape room! I recommend this experience to a group of friends or a company team building exercise. It's absolutely great fun!

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: OMG. So much fun. Great entertainment. The staff was fantastic from moment one. Helpful in every way. Thank goodness the aliens didn't take us back to the mothership. Can't wait for the catacombs. Great place to do work team building too.

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Came here with a group of 8 friends and we were lucky enough to get in right away. All of us had an amazing time working together to solve Area 51. We escaped with only 24 seconds left! The staff was helpful, informative and the video was a great icebreaker! We will be back again!

room_title: Escape room "Space Quest " by Escape St. Pete in Tampa
review: first time in an escape room and it was so much fun! definitely looking forward to trying out the writers cabin next.

room_title: Escape room "Space Quest " by Escape St. Pete in Tampa
review: we had a blast! great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Space Quest " by Escape St. Pete in Tampa
review: Amazing place!! My friends and I broke the record for Space Quest! It was a blast :)

room_title: Escape room "Traitor" by CQ Tactical in Tampa
review: COMSUMER/BUYER BEWARE!!! If negative stars would be allowed they would recieve it. We called spoke to them about a booking. The employee said it would be fine and work. We made sure we had everything in place, and called back to book it. Now the manager said no. When we explained and even spoke with the employee he said was not allowing it. Customer service must not be a priority. They must not understand that without customers their doors would not be open. I can only hope that the owners of CQ Tactical conduct an internal review so other customer are not out $100.00, because they reneged on their agreement. We will not return, support, encourage, or even consider CQ again. They try to promote the name and experience as being supportive of the military, however when you give your word it is be honored. This is clearly not the same code of ethics here.

room_title: Escape room "Time Warp" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My wife booked us and a few friends for 'The Time Warp' room. Can't think of a better way to spend a night out with friends or a date. Well worth it. We had a great time and hope to be back soon! Thanks!

room_title: Escape room "Time Warp" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: We had a lot of fun tonight! Escaped the time warp room with just a few minutes to spare! Awesome group night out!

room_title: Escape room "Time Warp" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Great time tonight with family. We've done the Murder Mansion and tonight the Time Warp. Thank you Dylan!!! You did a great job and we are looking forward to the 13th Floor. This is a fantastic place to spend time together.

room_title: Escape room "Time Warp" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Went to Escape Room for a friend's birthday, and we had so much fun! We did the 1974 Time Warp room, and we were quite close to solving it! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Time Warp" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: This was the best birthday experience! Can't wait now to visit 13th Floor! Awesome staff! Clean! Safe and so fun!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard’s Redemption" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: I have now done two rooms here. Trespassed and Wizard's Redemption. Both experiences were awesome.The puzzles are fun and the designs of the rooms are well done - very detailed and immersive.  The game play is linear and so easy to follow what needs to be done next.Trespassed definitely has the creepy vibe going. Even the way you got hints was unique and fun. The Wizard's Redemption was even better! It is there newest room. The design was great. I love rooms that have automatic unlocking mechanisms once you solve a puzzle. Makes it more fun and "magical".The game masters are super nice and very helpful. Will definitely be planning more visits to their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard’s Redemption" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: Shout out to California State Escapes!!! We escaped the wizards redemption room. 90 mins and no keypads or locks! It was amazing. Our game master was in character and very professional. We will definitely be back for more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard’s Redemption" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: This place is DOPE!!! Our first room we tried is Wizard's Redemption. I love Harry Potter so it's right up my alley. It is so immersive, and we loved that the puzzles were not just for combination locks. They varied and you use lots of different tools. We will definitely be coming back!!

room_title: Escape room "Golden Ore Bust" by Gambit Room in Denver
review: It was a fun and challenging experience. Loved working through it with my kids and trying to escape the Gold Mine in time.

room_title: Escape room "Golden Ore Bust" by Gambit Room in Denver
review: It was the prefect level of difficulty! Everyone in our group solved a puzzle that moved us along the mine. We almost made it out. Its Golden ties are true to this wonderful historic town. I can’t wait to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Bomb Squad" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: We did it with friends and barely made it out alive. Dismantled the bomb with just 11 seconds left! Sooo much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Bomb Squad" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: This was so much fun! Something "different" to do!! It's so clever and intense trying to beat the clock on the ticking bomb. Will definitely be back!!!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Bomb Squad" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: I never thought I'd fall in love with a room.. But this room had me at poker table. Actually this was our first venture into an escape room and it was a blast. We didn't get out... missed it by () that much. Too fun though.

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Bomb Squad" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: This was awesome! Challenging but VERY fun! You'll see your friends in a whole new light after working to find clues and solve puzzles as a unit. Quite an exciting night out for not much money. We'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Bomb Squad" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: Wow this was awesome!!! Definitely coming back to do the zombie room. We did the mafia bomb squad room and had a blast!!!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Jungle Dimension" by Puzzle Theory in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Russian Bomb Party" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Our family just left. This was our third room. We loved it! This time was difficult for us though. We tried the Russian Bomb Room. We escaped with less than a minute. We were thankful the staff gave us plenty of clues. If you get a chance to go, do! It's a great time for all. A little aggravating but fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Russian Bomb Party" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Went together with friends from work and did the Russian Bomb Party. It was insanely difficult but so much fun! We're already planning our next trip!

room_title: Escape room "The Russian Bomb Party" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Had a BLAST in the Russian Bomb room! Sorry people we failed to save the city but we gave it our best!

room_title: Escape room "The Russian Bomb Party" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Our family went and did the Russian Bomb room! We all had a great time. We did not finish in time so the city blew up and we killed millions... We can't wait to go back and do another one!

room_title: Escape room "The Russian Bomb Party" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Oh my! We came here from Memphis and rocked the Russian Bomb Party! So close, but we didn't make it. We'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: Our family chose to do an escape room as part of our annual birthday celebration. All but one of us were 1st timers and we had a great time. The Heist room was challenging and our guide gave us excellent directions and some helpful hints.It was the only escape venue I could find that was open on a Wednesday and it a great first experience! We'll be back.

room_title: Escape room "Lost in Time" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We had a great time figuring out the Back to the Future themed game. We were successful and had time to spare. I highy recommend taking the challenge!

room_title: Escape room "Lost in Time" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: I celebrated my 34th birthday here with a group of friends and we all had an amazing time. It was definitely a challenge but we managed to escape with 2 seconds left lol. Will definitely do this again and will recommend to others!!

room_title: Escape room "Lost in Time" by Mastermind Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Team work makes the dream work! We took a group of 10, ages 13-42. We did the Lost in Time Room. It was a challenging but so much fun!!! We escaped with 20 minutes left on the clock. Everyone split up and we had people working on multiple clues at once. The benefit of QR scan clues is a brilliant idea, we took advantage of that twice. We will definitely be back!!!

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Coming back for more👍🏻 staff was extremely helpful.

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Great! Disappointed we didn’t get probed in Area 51 tho...

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: This was really fun my husband and I enjoyed it for our Anniversary. I highly recommend you start with couples then expend to groups. It was a great experience with us since we both love gaming and solving puzzles together. We almost made too . It's a small place but it was a great experience and good practice of team work.

room_title: Escape room "Framed" by Room Raiders in West Palm Beach
review: After doing a few other escape rooms in the area, I came to room raiders for my birthday and found it to be very unique and challenging. I completed Framed, came back two nights later and did Asylym. The owners are great at explaining all the rules without giving anything away. Will definitely be back when more rooms are open.

room_title: Escape room "Framed" by Room Raiders in West Palm Beach
review: Recently went to Room Raiders to do their Framed room and we absolutely loved it. We loved it so much in fact that we decided to do the asylum room directly afterward! I have done many escape rooms both in south florida and across the country and I will say that these rooms were very well done. framed had a great set design but what i liked most about it was the puzzle flow, it was interactive and above all else FUN. You didn't get too stumped where it killed momentum but it wasn't too easy that you ran through the room, it was a clever mix of good puzzles. WIth asylum, I loved the immersion. There is something they do thst is very unique,  quite freaky but VERY cool... you will just have to play it to find out but the immersion was great and puzzles were a bit more challenging than framed was. Can't wait to check out their new room as well. Thanks guys, you rock!

room_title: Escape room "Framed" by Room Raiders in West Palm Beach
review: Went with our group of six this afternoon and had an absolute blast! Only two of us had experienced Escape Rooms before and the others had no idea what to expect. James took the time to explain what we needed to do in the "Framed" room in order to escape. Once inside, we received a few clues and were able to complete the game with 17 seconds to spare! We will DEFINITELY be back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Wicked Witch's Castle" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Our group of 6 did the Wicked Witch (Oz) room. This was our first time at Eludesions and we had heard that in Arizona, they probably average the largest sized rooms. It didn't disappoint! The design, props, decoration, and interactive puzzles we're very fun, tricky, and unique. We were definitely helped by our game master, as we got stuck in a couple parts, which after receiving a clue, it all made sense. So if you're used to letter locks and combo locks, you'll be challenged in this room. I would definitely recommend this room! The staff were very laid back and fun. Also, I spoke with a female staff member over the phone regarding a question I had, and she was very helpful in helping me find an answer. Then to my surprise, Bob the owner, calls me back regarding this question, and clarified the answer. He's definitely someone who's business I would like to support. Very generous gentleman, and I appreciate his customer service and business acumen. Our group will definitely come back to try all of the rooms at Eludesions (we learned it's pronounced like "illusions").

room_title: Escape room "Wicked Witch's Castle" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Me and my wife had the pleasure of experiencing not one but two rooms here. We loved the first room so much (Wicked Witches Castle) that we wanted to do another one right after (Runestone). Both rooms had fantastic set designs and the puzzles were unique and definitely generation 3. Both of our game masters, Ahmed and Kyle were great as well. We will definitely be returning to do their other two rooms soon!

room_title: Escape room "Wicked Witch's Castle" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Amazing rooms, interactive props and unique puzzles! Escape room enthusiasts, this is your Phoenix destination. Wonderland and Wicked Witch are my most recommended

room_title: Escape room "Boreas' Revenge - An Avalanche Survival Cabin" by Mountain Time Escape Rooms in Breckenridge
review: I went with a bunch of coworkers for team building and it was so much fun! It was my first escape room and it didn't disappoint. It was very interactive and the room had so many cool surprises that led to clues. I highly recommend that you grab a group of friends and try it out!

room_title: Escape room "Boreas' Revenge - An Avalanche Survival Cabin" by Mountain Time Escape Rooms in Breckenridge
review: We went here with young children and our family had an amazing time! I have gone to other escape rooms, but this exceeded any of them by far! The technology and the secret hiding places were awesome. This is a must try experience!

room_title: Escape room "Boreas' Revenge - An Avalanche Survival Cabin" by Mountain Time Escape Rooms in Breckenridge
review: Great room! A perfect fit for Breckenridge. Can't say enough good things about the team (Reba, Larissa, and Luda) for making us all feel welcome and for making the experience such an enjoyable one.

room_title: Escape room "Boreas' Revenge - An Avalanche Survival Cabin" by Mountain Time Escape Rooms in Breckenridge
review: An absolutely wonderful experience, terrific theme, and fantastic direction/accommodations by the owners. This is unlike any other game rooms I've played elsewhere across the US - highest of recommendations!

room_title: Escape room "Boreas' Revenge - An Avalanche Survival Cabin" by Mountain Time Escape Rooms in Breckenridge
review: Our family of six escaped the cabin before the avalanche cut us off from rescues! A great original escape room created by the owners. Friendly staff set us up for a great escape experience. Fantastic activity when you visit Breckenridge. Easy stop on the shuttle route and free bus.

room_title: Escape room "Secret Society" by Escape Artists in Orlando
review: We did the Secret Society and it was our favorite room so far. The details were so spot on, and it really made us think. We have done a lot of escape rooms in the past and this just stood out from the rest. We did the previous three rooms offered there and the only one we didn't get out of was the Rest Easy Motel (we were new to escape rooms at the time). All the rooms are very well themed and they are a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Secret Society" by Escape Artists in Orlando
review: booked rest Easy hotel and secrete society back to back for my girlfriend and i to do. We traveled an hour to get to sanford and it was worth the trip. We will be back to do the last room.

room_title: Escape room "Secret Society" by Escape Artists in Orlando
review: My wife and I have done 100 escape rooms all throughout the east coast. And I would say this venue is top 5. 100 percent immersion and you really feel like you are in a movie. The puzzles and a mixed search and find, simple mind Bender’s, and electronic. We did secret society room and it was great. I have passed the place up for Orlando several times because I didn’t think Sanford you be at the same level as I Drive. I was definitely wrong and the o my regret I have to not finding this place earlier

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Magic School" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Whole family did the Merlin's Magic School Adventure and escaped without about 8 minutes to spare. We had SO MUCH FUN!!! This room was totally family friendly, though some of the others I would say are more adult themed(ie. Jack the Ripper)

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Magic School" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: This was my first time experience at the escape room. My game master was K2. I must say she was extremely helpful especially when we needed it the most. We did the Merlin’s room and we all loved and enjoyed every moment of it. The very best part is we solved the puzzle! Will definitely repeat! Thank you so much K2 you are the best!

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Magic School" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: We had a great time. The Merlin Magic and Vampire rooms are fantastic!  They were challenging and unique.  Loved the family time spent! Thank you Cody, KC, Queen, and Dominique!

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Magic School" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: We took my sister in law and 7-year-old son through the Merlin's Magic School escape room. Ema was a GREAT host!  She guided us through the story with ease and was patient. It was a first escape room experience for all of us, and it won't be the last!

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Magic School" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Merlin's Magic School ranks as one of my top two favorite escape rooms of all time! We've done countless rooms all over the Denver area back home and in various cities where my family vacations. We were so impressed that we had to do a second room on our final night in town. Highly recommend this place because the puzzles are unique and challenging, and the rooms are wicked cool!

room_title: Escape room "Monkey See" by Try-N-Escape in Miami
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: I came here for my bachelor party and had a blast! The owner Jeff was great and made it very special for us. The escape room was a good balance of being clever, challenging, and fun. Thank you Jeff for making this special time even better! This escape room rocks!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: This place was truly a blast! The owners are really friendly and make it enjoyable. Mentally challenging and exhilarating! Definitely coming back!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: We’ve done a lot of escape rooms. And this Saturday night we did the Heist. It was definitely a good room, made you really think outside of the box.

room_title: Escape room "Narco" by Escapology Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Gate" by Themescape Escape Rooms in Denver
review: Love the rooms! Totally immersive. The Gate was amazing.

room_title: Escape room "The Gate" by Themescape Escape Rooms in Denver
review: Beta tested The Gate. Really cool blending of styles and awesome puzzles with some cool jump scares. Loved it.

room_title: Escape room "The Gate" by Themescape Escape Rooms in Denver
review: Wow!!!! Themescape rooms are so fun!! We just did the newest addition - The Gate - and it did not disappoint!!! Super creative puzzles and surprises!! We felt like we had been transported to another world!! To make it even better - the staff is fantastic! Fun and knowledgeable! We will definitely be going back!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Me and my fiance had a blast! They were all so nice. We figured out some of the riddles on the stairs before starting the game. When we escaped at the end the pictures taken were the result.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Funnest game room we have been in. Great theme and effects. Had a fantastic time with the family and met some new friends too.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: We had so much fun in the Sherlock Holmes room here!! The rooms are beautifully and thoughtfully decorated and the games are perfectly designed to keep you engaged and having fun! Highly recommend signing up for a game or two or three...we can’t wait to return and try another room!!

room_title: Escape room "Flashback to the 80's!" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Rocky Mountain Zephyr" by Golden Puzzle Room in Denver
review: Our group of 4 adults escaped the Rocky Mountain Zephyr in Lakewood in a bit over an hour. The manager went above and beyond the one hour time limit by letting us stay an extra 10 minutes to solve every puzzle. No one was waiting on us so that didn't affect any other customers but he stayed late himself to make sure we were happy. Because of course we wouldn't take any clues! He said that they help manage people's time with clues when he knows they won't escape on time. I loved that he let us have more time to solve it without help. The puzzles ranged in difficulty level widely which I think is great because I don't want anyone to get bored but I also don't want anyone to feel stupid, ha! It was hands on, it was solvable working in one group, multiple small groups or individuals with each puzzle so it's a great time without worrying about personality conflicts.
