The room we played was really cool ,Budapest Express, we didn't make it out but we were one step away from escaping the room. This is a very well thought out setting and I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Lake Elsinore in Temecula
review: My group did the Budapest Express room. I  weren't able to complete it but still had a great time. Our host, Cris, was very friendly and helpful when we were first got into the room and were getting debriefed. Definitely want to play more rooms here

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: Best Escape Room in the Treasure Valley area (Boise)! The titanic room was as unique as I've seen. It was thoughtful and well laid out, but challenging and fun at the same time! Perfect for any gathering, team building event, date night, or just a fun time with friends or family! You won't be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: We had a great time trying to solve the puzzles. We didn't make it to the life rafts but still had fun and laughed tons.  Would highly recommend this.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: We had such a fun time trying to solve the puzzles to escape.  I wanted to stay there and play all of the rooms.  This experience was so much fun.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by Amazing Escapes of Boise in Boise
review: Such a great experience!  Perfect for a group of friends, family, or co-workers!  Very creative room and puzzles, authentic to the time period.  Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Botcher's Minute Medical School" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: Super fun!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Botcher's Minute Medical School" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: We went to celebrate a friends bday. We looked into doing something different and fun and found it. We hit the happy hour deals. They have a variety of drinks that satisfied everyone in our group. The food looked good. Didn't get a chance to try any.We tried a couple of their VR rooms. That was pretty cool. We opt to do the Raft. I believe it was the only one that was offered that night. But we had fun with that. I'm not too much into gaming but it was well worth the experience. We also did the one with the doctor. Now that one was pretty interesting. Since all of our group is involved in the medical field one way or another, it was pretty fun to try and keep the Patient alive. Took a lot of team work and felt like we were in the E.R. trying to keep the dummy alive!!! LOL!The arcade area was fun. Plenty of games to play. From famous arcades to tic tac toe Basketball to skiball. And don't forget to challenge your friends in a game of ice hockey made for 4.They seem to host private parties and have jumbo connect 4 and Jenga. Those are always fun.Will definitely be going back since we still have bits to spend in our cards.

room_title: Escape room "Beach Getaway" by Escape Strategy in Tampa
review: We took our kids today to the Beach Room. The staff was super helpful and friendly. It was the first escape room for the kids and they enjoyed it. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - Black Ops" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: This is a great idea if your looking to have a good time with a small group. Staff is friendly. We did the Sabotage- Black Ops.Don't go in thinking you will breeze through it. It will be a challenge you will enjoy and remember

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - Black Ops" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: I just got home from a night at Breakout and I can honestly say that I will be back! I went with a coworker and played Black Ops. Unfortunately we did not breakout but we still had a lot of fun! We were welcomed with smiles and great personalities and throughout the game enjoyed the interactions that we were given. It is a fun and mind churning experience that I can't wait to experience again!

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - Black Ops" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: Had a blast with my girls here last night. We totally didn't expect it to be as difficult as it was but we made it out in just under 3 minutes. That 60 minutes goes by WAY too fast...hahahaha

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - Black Ops" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: We failed to stop the nuclear launch. Can't wait to go back and try the other games. Much more entertaining than going to a movie.

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - Black Ops" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: Sorry Fresno -- we failed to stop the bomb :( I've had some experience with escape rooms, and Breakout definitely stands out as one of my favorites. The room I played (Sabotage) was the right mixture of entertaining, clever, and challenging. There was definitely a lot of scrambling around and yelling, but that's part of the experience.  If not impressed by the room, you'll love the staff. It's owned by a lovely couple, who are very welcoming and fun to talk to. Our gamekeeper, Brian, seemed really easy-going and did his best to help us out whenever we needed, both before the game and during. I'm definitely coming back -- I'll try not to leave Fresno in a nuclear waste next time.

room_title: Escape room "School of Magic" by The Cube Escape Rooms in Santa Barbara
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Curse" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush 1849" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: We had a blast and got out in the nick of time. 1849 couldn’t hold us down!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush 1849" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: We went there for a birthday party and our group of six was given the Gold Rush room. We had a blast and despite the room being a little warm, it was a fantastic time for all of us who had never done an escape room. While it was a little tough, we had a smart little 12-year old in the room with us to help with the clues! Escaped with 1:43 left and couldn't stop talking about how much fun we had! I love that it's a local, family-run business. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush 1849" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: We've done several escape rooms in Colorado and we really liked Time Escape Loveland. We did Gold Rush and came up just short but still had a terrific time. The clues are well done, and the staff wonderful! Can't wait to come back for their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush 1849" by Time Escape Loveland in Fort Collins
review: Love it!!!!!!! We've don't the 80's room and the gold rush room and they're both challenging yet fun!!! Such a neat experience!!! Thank you!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Remote" by Don't Panic Just Escape in Hartford
review: Great first time experience!  I did  the hide and seek room. I will definitely be going back to try the other room.

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Remote" by Don't Panic Just Escape in Hartford
review: Really great experience. The room is challenging and is one of the most entertaining ones I have been to. Highly recommend! Great staff as well.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Don't be fooled by all the 5 star reviews!!!Just finished the Zombie Lab tonight and let me begin by saying, the pervious reviews hyped the room so much, but when we got there it was a big dissapointment. I am an escape room enthusiast and this was my 19th room. I would rank it 18th out of 19 rooms.  (Spoiler Free Review)Parking/Lobby:First off parking is hard to find but I suggest trying to find it on the street or at the lot at 11th and Olive. If you pass by that it will take to about 10 minutes to circle back around due to the one way streets and traffic. When we got there the host was by the door which was very nice because we were slightly unsure where to go. We entered and were told that there were going to be 6 other people in the room with us (randoms). The lobby was nice; theres a bathroom, lockers, and a bunch of comic books that are for sale. After waiting a few minutes we were shown the safety video, told the backstory of the room and then walked  to the room. The Room:Our first impression for the room was that it was fairly bland and lacking in decor. We got through the room fairly quick but we escape with 8 min to spare because we got hung up on a puzzle and because one of our locks was being finicky (The Game Master(GM) had to come in and help us with it since we had the correct combination in it and it still wasn't working). This room is a Gen 1 room, meaning the there is no technology puzzles in the room, just combos, locks and keys. The Zombie aspect of the room was one of the most hyped in the reviews but when we experienced it was sub par. The whole "encounter" is probably about 3-5 minutes since the zombie ends up leaving through the door (which didn't make sense in the plot line). I had thought that the zombie would be super scary and be with us until the end of the game but I was wrong. The actor playing the zombie did a good job for the time that they were in the room, I just wish they would have stayed in the room instead of leaving. The Hint System: You get 3 hints in this room, if you so close to take them. The are offered at the 30min mark, 15 min mark and 10 minutes mark (if i'm remembering correctly). During these time checks the GM would open the door and say "The doctor will see you in ___ minutes." I did not like that form of hints/ time checks at all, it really takes you out of the zone and pulls you out of the game mode. I think it would be so much better if they either had a screen with the clues and timer on it or a simple walkie talkie system. The Staff: Our GM was very friendly and courteous. She helped us get settled in and described the rooms to us very well. I did not like however that when you call the companies number with a question to ask, that no one picks up and it goes straight to a recorded message. Overall:I give this room 3 out of 5 stars because I felt like they could do so much more. The decor in the room was lacking and I honestly feel as though most of the room was wasted space. There were such few actual puzzles to solve in the room and the atmosphere in the room could have been better. The actor should stay in there room for longer, even stay the until the group escapes as that would add a element of rush and fear to the game. The hint system needs to be improved. Honestly, a $30 pack of walkie talkies would be sufficient enough because without it, every time you need a hint you're taken away from the game and brought back into "reality". I would only recommend this place to people who have never done an escape room before. After doing so many I just wasn't very impressed with this one. I'm hoping that their other rooms will be better. For the price though (we used Groupon) I would like to try to come back and escape there hardest room (The Office).

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: This was so much fun! Did the Zombie Lab and loved it. Can't wait to try another. Thanks for the good scare.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: My co-workers and I booked the zombie lab room not knowing what to expect. After everything was said and done we have to say that we would definitely go again and recommend this location to our friends. We had a blast and it was a great team experience.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Overall this has been one of the better escape rooms and my best friend and I have done over 30+ up and down the west coast. Storyline is great and the surprise guests add a nice touch to the experience! Looking forward to the next two chapters of Dr. X.

room_title: Escape room "The Mermaid's Escape" by Royal Escape Rooms in Panama City
review: None

room_title: Escape room "School Of Magic" by West Palm Beach Escape Rooms in West Palm Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: The only issue I have with Exit Game is that they pair you up with strangers. I went with a group of 3 and they paired us up with a group of 4. The whole time I felt like they didn't really contribute to anything as they had no clue what was going on. All I can say is that you really have to think outside the box in order to escape this room.

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Very pleased with the experience I had at The Exit Game. It's definitely innovative, fun, and going to be the latest trend for game centers. I definitely recommend visiting The Exit Game, make sure you book in advance!!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Our group had so much fun that we played two different rooms in one day. Very impressed with the game design and puzzles. Can't wait to play the new rooms next time!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: A great, well thought out venue. The staff is friendly and helpful. I can hardly wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Went in March and did 2 puzzles with 9 friends and had an absolute blast for my birthday. Would definitely come back again and would recommend for a large group of friends to play. Must go for everyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience! Clever puzzles! Friendly staff. I would fly back in from St Louis to do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Went here on a Saturday for a friend's birthday and did the Lab. It was a lot of fun! The story was that we were marines on a mission to escape an alien lab. You have 60 minutes to go through a series of complex puzzles, locks, clues, many rooms, and it was a great exercise in teamwork! It cost about $30/head and we had 10 people, which was a pretty good size for the challenge. The lab has a physical element to it where you need to crawl and duck your head low. They have alternatives if you cannot crawl or have claustrophobia, but it does take away from the overall experience, so opt for another challenge if that's a limitation of yours.  Especially compared to the Escape Game in Anaheim, this place was much more complex and believable with all the props and game design. It's not cheap, but a fun thing to do with a group of friends if you are looking for something different. It's located on the basement level of the Atlantic Shopping plaza where Empress Harbor Seafood and Half & Half are. Parking is free and head down the escalators to find it.

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Had an AMAZING time!! Went and reserved to do The Lab which was absolutely amazing, from hidden corridors to amazing puzzles it DEFINITELY was best escape room I've been to. Had so much fun We immediately reregistered to do the Vault! This one was much more difficult but still had a blast!Staff was super friendly and helpful! Group there was Jen, Norris, and Brian, and they communicated the rules well and made sure everyone had an amazing time start to finish.

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: We did this escape room with my two sons and my wife it was a super exciting time the room was difficult but not so hard that we were not able to complete the clues. We had a really good time and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly will definitely be back again.

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: Wow what fun! Only one adult in our group had done an escape room before and we escaped! Christina was very helpful from start to finish, she easily accepted our Groupon and got us situated in our room which was Area 51 (the hardest they have). Throughout the process she was attentive with clues, suggestions and hints... while letting us figure it out. She is big on the importance of communication and everyone being on the same page. Everyone has to want a clue before she gives one. We are excited to go back and try to escape some other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: We completed the Area 51 room this weekend and we had a blast! Went with a group of 6 and only one of us has done an escape room before. We had a lot of fun working as a team to figure out all the clues! We ended up making it out with 8 minutes to spare which was pretty exciting. We had a groupon for it so I'm glad we decided to give this place a try. I can't wait to go back and try some of their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Unity Escape Rooms in Redlands
review: Absolutely awesome! Went for everyone's first time, in a group for my husband's b-day and had the best time. The staff is amazing and even though we didnt succeed in The Cabin we are determined to be successful in The Temple. The decorations are fantastic - we felt like we were in a cabin. Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "A Strange Case" by Room With a Clue in Honolulu
review: Awesome fun! Challenging, organized! Great team building! Loved it! Will definitely go back and try another room!

room_title: Escape room "A Strange Case" by Room With a Clue in Honolulu
review: It was an ingenious puzzle that tested out pop-culture knowledge and puzzle solving skills, and also our ability to work together! Alas, we failed... But got plenty of help from the wonderful attendant and the fact that we ALMOST made it makes us all want to go back for more! Thanks for a great evening!

room_title: Escape room "A Strange Case" by Room With a Clue in Honolulu
review: Lots of fun for family visiting the island. Great bonding experience. Hard puzzles. My favorite lol. There are 4 themed rooms there. I wish i had time to do them all.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Cove" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: Had so much fun doing the Pirate's Cove room! Would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Cove" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: I came here with my coworkers for a team building event. We had an amazing time. We were split into three groups and we all succeeded. I did the Pirates Cove room with five coworkers. It was challenging and fun. I'll definitely be back. After coming home and telling my son about it, he has decided that's what he wants to do for his birthday.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Cove" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: Great time. Almost made it through the pirate room. Would definitely do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Cove" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: Just did the Pirates room with 5 minutes to spare with the two of us! Had a blast

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Cove" by Axxiom Escape Rooms in Newark
review: We had an awesome time! So much fun for the family. The themed rooms to escape are really cool and if u like puzzles, you will love this place! They have rooms ranging from easy to hard, so there is a room for everyone's comfort levels!

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Went with a team of 7 and did the fortune teller room! This was my first escape the room and it exceeded my expectations! The puzzles were creative and challenging but totally possible. Everyone on the team got involved and it was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Such a fun night solving the Fortune Teller mystery with friends & our guide Caitlyn was awesome at putting up with our craziness. Can't wait to go back for another

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: I took a team of ten, we split up to two teams and all had a blast! It was a great challenge and really highlighted each person's strengths. Bre was a great clue master! Her enthusiasm and energy made the whole experience that much better!

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: We had a group of 5 - we did the Fortune Teller first and had so much fun we moved up to blood thirst. They were well done and the staff was great to work with. It was a great interactive group activity for friends and I highly recommend it for anyone who enjoys puzzles and thinking.

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Great experience today! The Fortune Teller room was very well crafted, theme and game wise. Really good puzzles and some amazing unexpected surprises! My cluemaster, Dani, was also amazing. I'll definitely be heading back to play the rest of their rooms!! Looking forward to being the first solo player to beat their most difficult room, which is vampire hunter themed!

room_title: Escape room "Suburban Serial Killer" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: One of the best escape room companies! They put a lot of thought into the storyline and puzzles for their rooms which makes it exciting and enjoyable! I’ve done the “Suburban Serial Killer” and “Wanted”, I can’t wait to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Suburban Serial Killer" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: Our group did Suburban Serial Killer and loved it! It was all of our first time doing a room escape game and we got out with just a few minutes to spare. Curtis was very nice and helpful. It was lots of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Suburban Serial Killer" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: Huge shout out to Matt for making my first time doing an escape room such a fun one. Everyone at the facility is very kind and the room itself has a lot of different puzzles so you really feel engaged in what's going on no matter the size of the group (I was in a group of 7). My group and I loved the Silent Tide room and because of Matt, we'll definitely be back to try more of the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Suburban Serial Killer" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: Excellent escape room! We did the Serial Killer and had a blast! Staff was super helpful and the owner was wonderful! The room was well done in both decoration for the theme and the puzzles in the room! We will definitely return with the family!!

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This room is on the easy side so great for players new to escape rooms. The room was nicely themed and nice story progression. This is a traditional lock-style puzzle room. The staff was great and very flexible with the booking process. A bonus with this room is that they let you take a team photo inside the room with a special prop. Makes for a great photo.

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We have been wanting to do something like this for awhile and finally we did, we had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This was my family's first Paniq Room Experience and we loved it! Our host was friendly and helpful. We all had so much fun! We would love to come back again.

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We went to do one room and ended up doing all 3 the same day! Our favorite place so far to escape from!

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Really had no idea how this worked or what to expect. It was the most fun. There were 4 of us and we all worked together to find the clues. Lots of laughs and fun! Cannot wait to try another room!!! Highly recommend this

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: First timer!!! What an amazing and fun experience!!! The neighborhood was a little more run down than I expected and the building looked very small but once inside, the fun began!! We can't wait to get back and try all of the other rooms!! The Alien room was amazing!

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: I've played a few of these rooms in different cities and PanIQ Room is right up there with the best. Challenging, yet achievable, with a flow that matches the puzzles with the scenario. There is a lot of thought put in to the play/stump balance.Our hosts, Chan and Jeff, are my kind of people. They're the right blend of helpful, friendly and smart-ass. The after action talk is as fun as the room. We'll be back soon.

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This was such a great experience. We did the alien room with our family, two adults and four kids. It was such a blast! My daughter was really nervous beforehand about being locked in a room and her ability to contribute. She had the best time! The clues are great and so varied that everyone will be able to add something. Loved loved loved it! We will be back soon to be kidnapped!

room_title: Escape room "The Curious Case of Gillian Grace" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: We did the Curious Case of Gillian Grace room...and we got out! It is touted as the most difficult at The Escapery, and it did not disappoint. The clues and games were so elaborate and fun, my wife and I had a blast. By far the best Escape Room I’ve attempted. So creative, and our host was awesome as well! Thanks for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Curious Case of Gillian Grace" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: We went as a big group and did a private room of The Silo experience. The puzzles were great, and it was just challenging enough without being frustrating. We had so much fun we came back a few hours later and did the Curious Case of Gillian Grace. That one was tough, but our group made it out in the Knick of time. Very professional staff and well-lit and clean areas and rooms. Would highly recommend. Olivia and Katie Mae were our game masters and they were great.

room_title: Escape room "The Curious Case of Gillian Grace" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: We went to the escapery this weekend and it was amazing. Our escape room was called "The Curious Case of Gillian Grace" and the plot to this room was rich, full of details and very immersive. The interactive technology in this room blew my mind. This was our 4th escape room and easily the best and most challenging. The props were intense, from the mirror that allows your to communicate with the past to the time machine you could tell that an incredible amount of work and attention to detail went into this room. Our gamemaster Zak was kind, helpful and really took the time to ensure our experience was far beyond what we have experienced anywhere else. Well worth the price and I can guarantee if your gamemaster is Zak you and your group will have a good time!

room_title: Escape room "Blacksite" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: We did a room for my husband's surprise birthday party and it was a huge hit. All of the adults and teenagers loved it. We did Blacksite. It is definitely something that makes you think and work together as a group. The staff was amazing and we fell in love with the concept and will definitely be back. I am so glad they finally have something fun for adults and teenagers to do together as a group. Amazing!

room_title: Escape room "Blacksite" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: Went there for my birthday and had the best time ever and we are definitely going back again. This place is amazing and I would recommend it for a good time.

room_title: Escape room "Blacksite" by Escape the Place in Colorado Springs
review: Thanks for a fun date night! We will be back and determined to make it out next time!

room_title: Escape room "Bomb" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room Sarasota in Sarasota
review: Went for my birthday and did the Detective room. We loved it so much that we went ahead and booked the second room on the same day! The staff was very friendly and the room was very clean and well done. I can't wait to see what's to come!

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room Sarasota in Sarasota
review: We had our daughter's 13th birthday party here. We did both The Cabin In The Woods and The Dirty Detective. We had so much fun escaping! Great entertainment for all. My husband and I had a blast too! I would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The 13th Floor" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Did 13th floor with several of my coworkers. It was a lot of fun and good team building. Would highly recommend and plan on going back soon to check out the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The 13th Floor" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My boyfriend and I went here for a date night last weekend and we LOVED it! We did the 13th floor but were ultimately unable to escape. Ethan was the one working that night and was exceptionally kind and explained everything very thoroughly after we lost. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The 13th Floor" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Great family fun! My group did the 13th floor room and it was an exciting challenge! Our room advisor, Nick, did a great job explaining the idea of the room and was helpful all along the way. Would recommend it to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "The 13th Floor" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: So we went through the 13th floor. It is very challenging but lots of fun. Cannot wait to try the other room(s).

room_title: Escape room "The 13th Floor" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My husband and I went in today to do the 13th Floor room. We loved it so much that we stayed and did Time Warp right after (there was an open slot). We have done multiple escape rooms in both Hawaii and Mississippi. Escape Dothan is by far the best one we have been to so far. The people that work the rooms allow you to struggle some before they give you hints. They don't make it too easy to get out! We plan on returning in the near future to do Murder at the Mansion and will continue to go as new rooms are opened. We highly recommend that everyone try Escape Dothan!

room_title: Escape room "Spy Game" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: I did Escape Oakland's newest room, The Spy Game, today and it was very challenging but also quite fun. It's their toughest room, with an 8-10% escape rate. (There seems to have been some misinformation on here stemming from another reviewer's description of the room difficulties based on their subjective opinion, but the website posts the % escape rates for each room.)I'd recommend The Spy Game for groups of experienced escape roomers. If your team has first-timers, you might want to consider one of their easier rooms instead. I think first-timers might feel a little frustrated by this one. It's not the flashiest room, but there are a ton of puzzles to chew on and lot of variety in types of puzzles. I think this is a great room to try if you're someone who is really in it for the puzzles and a good challenge. I'm not as into rooms that have Hollywood-movie-set-esque decorations but easy puzzles, so I'm glad I chose this one.I was on the fence about giving them a 4 or a 5, but settled on 5 because they were patient with my team after we didn't escape the room in time. In addition to giving us like 10 minutes extra, they were nice about one of the guys who kept trying to continue to solve stuff when they were explaining the clues to us, etc.My general feeling is that even though they are relatively new and don't have the super fancy bells and whistles of some of the larger and more established escape room companies, they seem dedicated to trying to make solid puzzles/rooms. I think they'll continue to improve their rooms and the experience overall.

room_title: Escape room "Uncle Tick Tock's Circus" by Escape Room Napa in Rohnert Park
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Hero" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: New location!! They are located at the Wyndam Hotel on Lewers street. It is easy to locate them, just look for the Hotel sign and Breakout is on the left! There should be signs. Our group tried The Hero as a beta room on March 10th and we also chose the "public room" which included random people. (2) The prices were half off since it was a beta room and the public room option also made it cheaper. It turned out to be less than $15 a person! If you would like a private room option it is a bit more expensive, and hey! Two heads are better than one!The two people we met up with were super friendly and pleasant to work with. It was nice experiencing a different dynamic beyond our group of friends. The biggest part of escape rooms is communication! Since we were beta testers, there were some complications and it set us back, but our room supervisor? the worker? added on 5 more minutes for us. We escaped! The biggest challenge was actually parking LOL, we weren't sure where to park for the new location. Just follow the directions on Breakout's FAQ about parking. It is at the Embassy Suite and the only option is valet. It $6 with validation, and after parking just go to the right side down the hall and cross the street and go a bit more down and breakout will be towards your right! It's a 2 minute walk. The workers are always welcoming and very nice. They know that the experience can be a bit scary to people (esp. for scaredy cats like me) and always make me feel comfortable. I've done a total of 4 rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Hero" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: I had bought 2 spaces for a friend and I to do the hero. I liked it but i didn't find it to be as challenging as other escape rooms I've done. The staff was very nice and the space was nice. I think they were still doing construction though because the space didn't look completed. We had been put with another group which I didn't mind however it was a bit awkward because when checking in they didn't tell us we were going to be with another group. Because of this, the room was kind of awkward to do especially because we hadn't acquainted ourselves with the other group in the lobby since we didn't know we'd be working with them. I think that this place is good for large groups but I probably wouldn't recommend it for a small group since there's a possibility of being with another random group. I enjoyed it, but with the reviews I expected the room to be more challenging.

room_title: Escape room "The Hero" by Breakout Waikiki in Honolulu
review: When in Waikiki.... this is a MUST! I completed (and barely escaped: The Hero) a room with my husband during our honeymoon and it was definitely AMAZING, one of the highlights of our trip. Our top and most favorite room of all of the 10+ we have completed all over California. They have a high level of technology and the friendliest staff! Do it! You will not regret it!

room_title: Escape room "Art Heist" by Escape Room Delaware in Dover
review: I did the Art Heist yesterday with two other friends and I really enjoyed it. This was our first escape room. After explaining what it's all about I was interested. We got out with a little help from the guide. Bring a bigger group for a better chance to escape. It was very fun overall.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure Island - Destination Bermuda Triangle" by ALL IN Adventures Milford in New Haven
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Welcome to Enigma High" by Enter The Enigma in Colorado Springs
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Smugglers Tunnels" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: We have finally tried their newest room, Smugglers Tunnels! Still as fun as ever. This room has less of a storyline, but plenty of challenging puzzles. Instead of trying time to escape, you and your teammates have to get as much treasure as quickly as possible. This adds a different feel to the adventure and my friends and I had a fantastic time with our individual puzzles, as well as the puzzles we worked on together. Missed out on first place, but we smashed second place! Highly recommend Escape Chronicles to anyone looking for a good night of puzzle solving.

room_title: Escape room "Smugglers Tunnels" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: I've played around 80 other escape rooms before this review. Both of the games at Escape Chronicles are freaking fantastic. Some of the most unique and engaging puzzles out there. If you're a bunch of first-time players, the Smugglers game is the one I recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Smugglers Tunnels" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: Some friends and I went to the Smugglers Tunnels room and LOVED it! I've done a lot of escape rooms, and this was easily one of my favorites, with a solid set of inventive puzzles and a refreshing twist on the usual "escape the room" objective. Very impressive to have a room that can equally satisfy both novices and experienced players!

room_title: Escape room "Saving Christmas" by Great Escape Mystery Rooms in Fort Smith
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Story Room" by Escape Narrative in Phoenix
review: This escape room was much different then others. It required real life thinking and problem solving. It was super fun and interactive. Was definitely well thought out. Would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Story Room" by Escape Narrative in Phoenix
review: First time to do a escape room. Six of us decided to try this for entertainment and it was great. Not just going around a room and finding keys. We had to think, use clues, use a computer, put puzzles together and search as a team. The owner was just great and very nice. Explained everything very well. Exciting and thought provoking.

room_title: Escape room "The Story Room" by Escape Narrative in Phoenix
review: I have done a bunch of escape rooms across the US but this was the best experience! I loved how we were part of the story and used modern technology to solve the mystery!!! Great time was had by all. My 18yr old nephew was a little freaked out but still had fun!!

room_title: Escape room "The Doll Room" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Destin
review: I and some friends stumbled across this escape room while on vacation. We have never done an escape room before and LOVED it! The doll room was super creepy!!!! Would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Nora's Nightmare" by Puzzling Escape in Phoenix
review: Great room and awesome owners! Looking forward to the next ones opening!

room_title: Escape room "Nora's Nightmare" by Puzzling Escape in Phoenix
review: The 4 of us did Nora's Nightmare.  Fun room, really enjoyed it. The room had a good combination of locks, puzzles and electronics. The room flowed really well.  Have done many rooms and this ranks at the top!  We will definitely be back for the Houdini room when it opens!

room_title: Escape room "Nora's Nightmare" by Puzzling Escape in Phoenix
review: Played Nora's Nightmare yesterday and, it turned out, we were the first group to play the room since it officially opened.  As enthusiasts (almost 200 rooms played), we're always hesitant to try a brand new game as we've quickly learned it's much better to give them some time (even after beta testing) to fine tune things and make sure it runs they way they intended. But since we were jonesing for a room, we decided to go for it. From the first point of contact, via FB messenger, their customer service was spot on. The owner (I'm so sorry I don't remember her name) was friendly, very accommodating and responded to my inquiries quickly. As for the room, we enjoyed it quite a bit! I loved the unique theme and really liked the thought and details that were put into the aesthetics of the room. The puzzles are a good mix of lock & key as well as some tech so it should easily appeal to a variety of players. They are not overly difficult but they do still provide a good challenge and make you slow down to think. We are a two-person team and we finished with time to spare.  Afterwards, we spent quite a bit of time talking shop with the owner. She was very personable and didn't make us feel rushed or like she had something better to do. I know I already said it, but the customer service was on point with Puzzling Escape. As much as we love playing rooms, we also love talking with the owners and staff about the experience as well as about escape rooms in general.  We really enjoy hearing about what went into the design and development of their rooms and just learning about how it all started for them. We can't wait for their other rooms to open. Nora's Nightmare is a fun time for anyone looking for something neat to do. Regardless of your level of experience, get out there and play this game.  You'll be glad you did.

room_title: Escape room "The Underground" by Nightmare at 3008 in Birmingham

room_title: Escape room "Spy Room" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: This was intense.  5 of us tried and got close.  Lots of different challenges than you normally find which was good.  Some interesting stuff, but take the max people as you will need the help.

room_title: Escape room "Biohazard" by Amazing Escape in Atlanta
review: Talk about an adrenaline rush! We did the Virus Room and got out with 7 secs to spare. Make sure you take your logically inclined friends lol. I went with a group of 4 and there was another group of 4 and a kid with us but the host reminded us that we were a team. I'm ready to go back and do another one!

room_title: Escape room "Biohazard" by Amazing Escape in Atlanta
review: took my son and two of his friends to escape the VIRUS room. They had a blast and I truly enjoyed just watching the dynamics of the group as they worked together frantically but made it out with 32 seconds left on the clock. What a great time and friendly staff. We will be going back for the new CABIN experience.

room_title: Escape room "Biohazard" by Amazing Escape in Atlanta
review: My friends and I had such a good time! This was my first escape room experience and it was awesome! We did the virus room. room_title: Escape room "Descent Into Madness" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota

room_title: Escape room "Descent Into Madness" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: My team of 6 had a blast in the Descent into Madness room. Effects were well executed. Puzzles were challenging but not impossible. We had a fantastic time and we will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Descent Into Madness" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: We had a great time doing the Decent Into Madness room for my husband's birthday! It was awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Descent Into Madness" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: The owner was extremely nice and explained everything well. The Decent into Madness was designed and decorated authentically. It was a lot of fun. After we were done we got to sit and play a trivia game as well. Definitely worth the money!!

room_title: Escape room "Descent Into Madness" by Escape Reality Games in Sarasota
review: This was the best escape room we've ever done. We did the "Descent into Madness" room, which was just immaculately executed. The minute you step into the room you are transported into another reality. The design perfectly sets the mood, the story is exciting, and there are some very cool elements that will blow you away.Once you're out of the room, there's lots more to do at Escape Reality - they have tons of puzzles to play with, a costume room to take silly photos, games and food.

room_title: Escape room "Sugar Rush" by Legacy Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Super fun for the whole family! We are always looking for family friendly escape rooms and this one is it! Sugar Rush was definitely challenging but super fun-not scary at all!  Our group ranged from a 60 year old to an 11 year old...and everyone loved it.  The room is decorated very nicely and the puzzles are challenging, but not too challenging to the point you get frustrated.  Our game master was Julie and she was very friendly and always ready with our hints (when needed).They have another room, Cabin 13, that we plan on trying next time.  Can't wait to go back!The only downside to doing this escape room is you'll want ice cream after!

room_title: Escape room "Sugar Rush" by Legacy Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was my first time going to an escape room! The Sugar Rush" room was really fun, cute, and just challenging enough for the 8 of us. We were happy to successfully escape in time without any hints! Julie is super sweet and helpful!

room_title: Escape room "Sugar Rush" by Legacy Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Amazing escape room! Very well designed with creative and unique puzzles. Great production quality with incredibly immersive rooms. Sugar Rush was a fun room with great whimsicality while still having challenging puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Forsaken Temple" by Omescape in San Jose
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Launch" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Fun and challenging! We are going back to finish what we started! We can't wait to go back and try all of the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Launch" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: Me and my husband had a awesome time. The staff was so nice. Everything was so organized. We will have to go back soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Launch" by Time to Escape in Atlanta
review: What a great escape room experience. The staff was fantastic.

room_title: Escape room "Alien Spacecraft Invasion" by The House of Clues in Santa Barbara
review: Played Alien scenario tonight for a birthday party - so clever and fun! Can’t wait to come back and try the other puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "The Skull Witch" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: This was our first time experiencing an escape room and it was really fun! The staff was really friendly and helpful (if you wanted help). We did the Skull Witch room which was awesome. Very fun and unique experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Skull Witch" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Amazing and super entertaining! It is evident that a lot of thought and passion went into each and every room. The intrigued details remind me of technology right from a Disney attraction. Definitely TOP NOTCH! The staff is also wonderful! The Skull Witch room is my favorite!

room_title: Escape room "The Skull Witch" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: My first escape room and wow! They outdid themselves! We were thrown into their hardest room Skull Witch... by choice and aaaaalmost finished. They said we only had like two more tiny things to solve, then we would have been out. We were a group of 6, and I'd say that was perfect for that particular room.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Apocalypse" by American Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: If you like a billion locks and keys one after the other, then this is the place for you. Beware of faulty tools. We spent around 10-15 minutes on a single lock. We were extremely confused why it wouldn’t open! Come to find out that the lock was broken!  We did not get our time back And made us question every lock we came across (which were ALOT). The second room we encountered also had a wonky tool that wouldn’t work properly and that also took us around 10-15 minutes to move on. This was to the point we were asked if we needed someone to come in. It is unfortunate because the concepts were cool and interesting and the workers were enthusiastic and friendly. After 2 encounters with a faulty item, it is safe to say we will not be going back here.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Apocalypse" by American Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: The Zombie Apocalypse was a great room! Lots of fun even though we failed! Can’t wait to do the Mad scientist's lab!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Apocalypse" by American Escape Rooms in Orlando
review: We had a lot of fun escaping the Zombie room! 4 adults, 2 kids, 33 seconds to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Mission Egypt" by The One 2 Escape Room in Miami
review: Great stuff members We enjoyed a lot Definitely will come back For other Rooms Thank you 😊 Till next time

room_title: Escape room "Mission Egypt" by The One 2 Escape Room in Miami
review: Our group had an awesome time!! We did the Mission: Egypt escape room. The puzzles got progressively harder, and there were many interactive and creative puzzles. I liked this place more than others because of their unique twists and mix of mechanics and technology within the game. Every detail was thought out down to the elaborate decor, and the staff was very friendly. We will definitely be back for more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Mission Egypt" by The One 2 Escape Room in Miami
review: Just did the Mission: Egypt Room and it was a TON of fun!! Super cool mechanics and would definitely look into doing the other rooms too! Owners are awesome and the staff were great at guiding us through the room to complete it with just minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Clever Fox in Temecula
review: We did the "Outbreak" room first. Great escape room for beginner-novice level groups. This room was a lot of fun, staff was great (Ed and his daughter), set design was great, puzzles were some-what challenging and went with the storyline. I would definitely recommend Outbreak for someone just starting out with escape rooms. More recently we did "Forbidden Temple" which was a little more our speed. Again the room was a blast, the staff was great (had the other owners this time around, Tom and Jennie), set design was beautiful and the puzzles were a little more challenging but went great with the story. Can't wait for them to open another room for us to try out.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Clever Fox in Temecula
review: Team Brown Rice made it out of the Outbreak Room! The staff was very nice and accommodating--I ended up over booking by one person and they refunded me with no hassle. They provide lockers for your belongings and no phones allowed. The room is so cool...great attention to detail and "studio effects". I've been to a few other escape rooms in the Murrieta/Temecula area and this place is HANDS DOWN the best designed! It was so challenging and fun. I went with my teenage kids and nephew and they enjoyed it as well. It's a local small business and I highly recommend that you give them your support.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Clever Fox in Temecula
review: We came to check out Clever Fox and played Outbreak. We had some good conversations with Tom Fox and a great experience in the game itself. Fun puzzles and good concept. If we had time to come back for the Lost Temple we definitely would! Hey Tom, if you need two more for Hex in Anaheim hit us up!

room_title: Escape room "The Cursed" by Immersion in Orange County
review: Came here on my birthday with a group of friends and it was such a fun time! It's in a weird area but don't be fooled by the surroundings. There was only one worker there who was a girl and had a nose piercing and I wish I remembered her name but she was very kind. Definitely recommend this place, especially for birthdays or other celebrations. We did the newest room called "Cursed" and it was very achievable to solve for a group who has never been to an escape room before (go sister squad!) Totally recommend

room_title: Escape room "The Cursed" by Immersion in Orange County
review: One of the best escape rooms in Orange! SO and I tried out "The Curse," and it was very entertaining. They do a wonderful job of making each puzzle unique and fresh, that way you don't go through the motion of just solving through the escape room with just one type of problem. I would definitely recommend! :)

room_title: Escape room "The Cursed" by Immersion in Orange County
review: Did the Cursed escape room at Immersion and this room was on a whole  nother level compared to the other rooms that they own. The room is their latest room and they use modern tech for their cursed room. If you are thinking booking a room at Immersion, might I suggest the Cursed room over their other out-dated rooms. But in case you haven't guessed it from the room's name,  Cursed, expect it to be scary.The room is pretty packed but not overly expansive. A group of 4 seems ideal. Couples will likely experience a difficult time at Cursed while large groups will bump into each a lot in the cramped spaces.I did think the theme and story of the room was by far, the most bizarre plot I've experienced. But hey, that doesn't affect the quality of the room.

review: None

I would say that the production values for this place are above average, and the puzzle flow and style is friendly to large groups. I can't say much more without spoiling something, go!

room_title: Escape room "The School of Sorcery" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: From the lobby, to the staff, to the game itself, everything was of the highest quality and beat my expectations. The story was smart and engaging. The puzzles kept us (our team of two) busy and challenged. The decor was immersive and made sense.I can't wait to play their new games coming on the next months. Exit Games is on my "highly recommended" list!

room_title: Escape room "The School of Sorcery" by Exit Game in San Diego

room_title: Escape room "Red Planet" by Epic Escape Game in Denver

room_title: Escape room "Red Planet" by Epic Escape Game in Denver

review: Had so much fun playing The Cure! Very impressed with the puzzles and the production value of the game. The hosts were super professional and informative. I can't wait to go back. Get a group together and go!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Video Store" by Mission 57 in Salinas

room_title: Escape room "The Darkness" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: Had a great time escaping this room. Scary, but not so much you can't concentrate. Put together nicely.

room_title: Escape room "The Darkness" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: Great experience! We had lots of fun! We did the darkness, super challenging, lots of clues to find and whenever you figure one out it feels so rewarding! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Darkness" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: My husband and I totally enjoyed the Darkness & the best part is we ESCAPED! We definitely recommend everyone to go try it out.

room_title: Escape room "The Darkness" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: We went into The Darkness for my daughter's 13th birthday. It was wonderful getting to do something that got us so involved. Great quality time with good interaction. The puzzles were hard and exciting. We came. We conquered. We can't wait to beat60 again!

room_title: Escape room "The Darkness" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: We had a great time "beating 60" in the serial killer room. The puzzles were challenging and setup very well. I hope to be back soon to do the other rooms you have! Thanks for a fun almost 60 mins!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Basement" by Escape Rooms Unlocked in Sarasota
review: This is the best thing I have ever done in my life, I may have not completed it, but it was SUPER fun, so worth it.

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Basement" by Escape Rooms Unlocked in Sarasota
review: We’ve tried three different adventures at Escape Rooms Unlocked and have had a blast each time. The hosts are unfailingly welcoming and professional, and the challenges are clever and entertaining. We’ll be trying every room they have to offer!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Basement" by Escape Rooms Unlocked in Sarasota
review: Thanks to Lisa for a fantastic time. New to Escape Rooms (I'd done one but none of the other three had) - this one was challenging and so fun.

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Basement" by Escape Rooms Unlocked in Sarasota
review: Visited for my best friends birthday and we had a fabulous time. The three of us used our different skills and and escaped with time to spare! Was a lot of fun! Looking forward to trying a different room.

room_title: Escape room "The Prospect" by Trapped in Tahoe in South Lake Tahoe
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: My girlfriend and I did the Espionage room. We were blindfolded and put in separate rooms to work as a team to get out. We got far in our hour of time but unfortunately, we didn't get out. The whole experience was awesome. most definitely will recommend this place. Recommend to family and friends visiting California.

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Fun! We were walking by and weren't planning on going but after the greeter explained it to us we decided to give it a try. We decided to do the Espionage one since it was the least scariest because we had children with us. We would love to come back and do another room!

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: We did the Espionage room and it was definitely a fun time. If you're a beginner, it's a great room to start with. We escaped with 15 min left! So fun!

room_title: Escape room "Yin Yang" by Twin Peaks Escape Room in Longmont
review: It was a ton of fun to solve those puzzles. I would highly recommend for anyone to go and try Area 51 or Yin Yang

room_title: Escape room "Yin Yang" by Twin Peaks Escape Room in Longmont
review: I went for the first time with my girlfriends and had a blast! Challenging, exciting and fun! They were really great about giving us newbies clues to the next challenge. Fun place--can't wait to try Area 51!

room_title: Escape room "Yin Yang" by Twin Peaks Escape Room in Longmont
review: Great new escape room in Longmont!! Did the YingYang room. Second room opening soon. Give these guys a try.

room_title: Escape room "Plight of the Margo" by ConTRAPtions Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: We had sooooo much fun! I’ve done escape rooms all over the world and this was at least 100x cooler and more complex than anything I’ve ever played before.It took them 3.5 years to build it. It was worth every penny and really well planned out. No boring locks and keys like most escape rooms.I booked the room for my son’s 15th bday party. All of his friends couldn’t stop talking about it. The game masters were amazing! I can’t wait to do part 2!

room_title: Escape room "Plight of the Margo" by ConTRAPtions Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: Plight of the Margo was our favorite escape room ever, even beating the Mission to Mars we did in Pigeon Forge, TN. First, the design was awesome; the thematic content, high-tech set, and multitude of puzzles that could simultaneously engage an entire "crew" of a rescue spaceship was superb. There is one place in the set that is not designed for easy walking access (you have to crawl through a hatch/tunnel), but the set is spacious. We had 11 team mates (4-10 is recommended), several of whom were engineers --and who never got bored, by the way; there was good diversity of puzzle types (high-tech, across-the-room collaboration, creative thinking, etc.). We were only able to do the first of two 90-minute (scored) sessions due to our brief stay in the Denver area, but 90 minutes is a good duration for one session in this room. Your team has to manage concurrent puzzle content, because it is extremely easy to lose track of who's doing what, what clues have already been used, etc. Communication is key. Our team of 3 didn't know the other team of 8, but we rapidly melded into a good crew. It was a fully enjoyable and memorable experience. Hats-off to the designer of this room. (You did a marvelous job, even if we did "cheat" a little with one of your safety devices. ;-) Darned engineers.

room_title: Escape room "Plight of the Margo" by ConTRAPtions Escape Rooms in Fort Collins
review: I played the space room (Find the Margo) over Christmas break and had a great time!  The room was incredibly high tech -- it felt like we were on the deck of the Starship Enterprise in Star Trek!  This is definitely good for large groups; there are plenty of clues to keep everyone occupied.

room_title: Escape room "Cyberpunk VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: Even though my visit here to "play" was short, I know I want to go back for a date night or even maybe a party. Sasa and the crew did a great job explaining and showing all they have to offer. Such fun!

room_title: Escape room "Cyberpunk VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: A great place to virtually-experience your dream trip!

room_title: Escape room "Cyberpunk VR" by VR Tech Lounge in Boise
review: My son had an amazing birthday at VR Tech Lounge. This place is the coolest - and top notch customer service too! Thanks for showing him and his friends such a great time! We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy" by Escape Tactics in Fort Myers
review: So much fun! We did a speakeasy themed escape room for my friend's birthday and had a blast! Staff is super fun and nice! Can't wait to come back! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy" by Escape Tactics in Fort Myers
review: Awesome and addicting. Will totally be back. My group of 6 escaped the Speakeasy. Not an easy feat! Great team building and brain exercise.

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy" by Escape Tactics in Fort Myers
review: 5 stars is an understatement for Escape Tactics! Wish I could give it 10! Speakeasy was a great room and the staff was phenomenal. Very welcoming and soooo much fun!

room_title: Escape room "PROstate Farm" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: Absolutely fantastic! This is similar to an escape room game, but instead, you solve a murder. There are clues you have to find like blood, fingerprints, and a murder weapon. There are small details all over the place and it was actually funny as hell. The owners worked with actual detectives, forensic scientists, and the people who do autopsies! After you make your judgement and give your “verdict”, they go over how the murder transpired. It is split into 3 portions. First you investigate the crime scene, then you go over 3 interrogations with the 3 suspects, then you get all the evidence you found - back from the “lab” and an autopsy report. A really cool aspect, was that you report the evidence you find, so if you miss a clue, it won’t be turned back into you when you piece the mystery together with your group. I highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "PROstate Farm" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: Came here as a double date with a group of 4 of us. We had a blast! I was expecting another escape room which start to have the same repetitive puzzles to solve and was pleasantly surprised that this was different. You're solving a crime rather than trying to escape. We did the PROstate insurance room and there were three parts. First you spend about 20 minutes at the area of the crime scene and then you go to the interrogation room and then you debrief where you try to put together all the evidence to figure out who the murderer was. I really commend them on the way they have this laid out and everything was in great condition. They even gave us a camera to use to take pictures of the crime scene. There was a ton of humor throughout this and we got a lot of good laughs. This was an awesome time and I can't wait to go back and solve the other crime! We ended up solving the crime, but it was difficult and we missed a lot of clues along the way. If you're looking for a fun night out I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "PROstate Farm" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: I planned this activity for my husband and I, customer service was great and the game was fun. We did the Prostate insurance murder.  The only thing is I wish we would have gone with a bigger group but we still did it. Its very difficult to solve but still really fun. Next time I would recommend the coffee shop.  It looked really cool.

room_title: Escape room "PROstate Farm" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: I went here for a date night with my wife and it was fantastic.  Very well put together and surprisingly challenging.

room_title: Escape room "Undercover Alley" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Our adventure was to celebrate a birthday. It was our first time in an Escape Room and we had a blast.

room_title: Escape room "Undercover Alley" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: Awesome experience!   If you're looking for something totally different to do on a weekend night other than watching a movie at the theaters or going to  Dave & Busters then you really need to check this place out.  It's a lot of fun.  You won't regret it.

room_title: Escape room "Undercover Alley" by Breakout Games - Atlanta in Atlanta
review: This is my favorite place to go for escape rooms! They are well taken care of and always a fun group activity.Alex was a great game master!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Emoryville Carnival" by Bakersfield Breakout Zone in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Perfect Crime" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: Awesome escape room! My boyfriend and I checked out "The Perfect Crime" and finished with like 20 seconds to spare. It was challenging. You bring in a walkie-talkie to ask for hints when you need It (we took three). There were some really cool elements to the room and some were so difficult I feel like I wouldn't have gotten It without the hints. It would've helped to have more than two people though! Highly recommend these rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Perfect Crime" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: Played the Perfect Crime as a birthday celebration. We almost solved the crime but we ran out of time... So close! Super fun and nerdy. I would have made a great investigator!

room_title: Escape room "Perfect Crime" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: Super fun rooms, played all 3: Asylum, Wild West and Perfect Crime. Had a lot of fun poking around, solving puzzles and trying to find combinations. Whenever I put code it felt like the code is wrong, but when it works, it feels so good! Even though prices a bit high for small parties, still worth trying, since they give discounts sometimes.

room_title: Escape room "Perfect Crime" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: It was my 23rd escape room I've done. This time we were 5 of us which I feel was a perfect amount of participants. The puzzles are unique, there were a bunch I've never seen before and the set is terrific! Highly Recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Perfect Crime" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: One of the most intellectually challenging rooms I've ever done.In this room, too, the puzzle variety is outstanding. HUGE LIKE: their rooms are not linear! We went with a group of 6, and all of us were doing something the whole time.

room_title: Escape room "Cuban Crisis" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: My husband and I tried this location for the first time last night and we loved it. The lounge is beautiful and clean, the team members Kevin and Joey are super friendly and great and of course the room was super well put together. We did the Cuban Crisis and even though we didn't escape in time we had so much fun! We are 100% going to return to try all of the rooms here. Can't wait to go again soon!

room_title: Escape room "Cuban Crisis" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: This was my first time at an escape room. Tyler was the most amazing attendant at Escapology! We had a party of 5 and he made the experience unforgettable!!! So much so I'm going back with my husband.

room_title: Escape room "Cuban Crisis" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: My team of 4 are escape room junkies. We visited Escapology yesterday and absolutely loved it. We did both Budapest and Cuban Crisis. The rooms were beautifully decorated and the puzzles were well themed to fit the room. The game was challenging enough for experienced escape masters but not too challenging for newbies. Francesca took care of us for the most part during our visit and she was exceptional. I highly recommend this venue.

room_title: Escape room "Cuban Crisis" by Escapology Fort Lauderdale in Miami
review: Enjoyed the night out with my girls, even though we didn't escape Cuban Crisis.

room_title: Escape room "The Temple" by Chambers Escape Games in Honolulu
review: Amazing experience.  Went for our daughters birthday and did the temple room.  We've been to other escape rooms and this was the best one on island. B highly recommend it! Thanks Ron, Kentos, Josh. We'll be back to try the VR room.

room_title: Escape room "The Temple" by Chambers Escape Games in Honolulu
review: I've been to all of the escape rooms in Hawaii and by far this was the best.  Staff was friendly, helpful and enthusiastic which helps the overall experience.  Part of our group did the virtual reality game and the rest of us braved THE TEMPLE...an Indiana Jones meets Goonies theme.  It was a blast!  Our team did manage to get out with 26 minutes to spare...the staff seemed impressed by our speed!  Will definitely recommend to others.

room_title: Escape room "The Temple" by Chambers Escape Games in Honolulu
review: I called an hour before and got me and three other friends in. No wait when we first arrived. We played the Temple room and found it to be very fun and challenging, as this was our very first escape room experience. Lily was awesome and super helpful; even extending our time past a little past an hour to finish because we were doing so badly. Would highly recommend to anyone. Definitely down to try the VR options next time.

room_title: Escape room "Mission's Breakout: the Ultimate Bank Heist" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: My first time doing an escape room and it was awesome! My friends and I did the Bank Heist, its a new room with clever and challenging puzzles. The staff was also great, Bri was our host and she helped to create a fun atmosphere. Would definitely come back here!

room_title: Escape room "Mission's Breakout: the Ultimate Bank Heist" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: We tried the Bank Heist room after a long anticipated wait and it did not disappoint!  We really enjoyed all the fun tech in the room, you really felt like your were in the front of a bank and then eventually in the back house of the bank.  Highly recommend Mission Escape games for al of their rooms, they are amazing!

room_title: Escape room "Mission's Breakout: the Ultimate Bank Heist" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: I had so much fun here! I wanted to do something different to celebrate my friends, and this was perfect.,the fun starts when the clock does and literally doesn't stop. Don't second guess this place, just go lol. We did the bank heist and we'll be going back to do the haunted one.

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: I loved it! Blitzkrieg was a challenging room. We got out with 50 seconds to go with some help. I want to go back and try a different room!

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: What a great escape room! It was innovative and brilliant! We fancy ourselves as experienced escape room artists and really enjoyed our time. Without giving anything away, the Blitzkrieg room has some amazing electro-engineering and puzzles and nothing we have done yet compares. It's a challenging room and has a really great gameplay. We can't wait to do more of their rooms! Thanks guys!

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: Did the Blitzkrieg for our first time. Great as a family of four adults. We didn't escape but the staff was very helpful. The intricacies to detail are a must in this game. Having had no experience in this, would recommend an easier mission for a first timer. Will be back for another adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: Enjoyed ourselves immensely at Escape Bradenton on Halloween! We had previously done Inheritance and this time we did Blitzkrieg. Although both rooms were challenging, we managed to escape both times with a little help from base camp. Highly recommend Escape Bradenton, especially for team building as you need to communicate and work together to accomplish the tasks.

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Escape Bradenton in Sarasota
review: A great time! We did Blitzkrieg and it was challenging! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Outlaws" by Time Travel Escapes in West Palm Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "TH3 C0D3" by Escapology Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Autopsy" by Crystal River Room Escape in Crystal River
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Box" by Time Trap in Tampa
review: Had a great time in the 'BOX'. It was hard enough that the hour went by before we knew it. Lots of fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Box" by Time Trap in Tampa
review: Our family had a blast solving the puzzles in The Box room! It was a fun challenge as our very first Escape Room experience. Our 12 year old, 15 year old, 20 year old and parents all contributed. Great family bonding! Go!

room_title: Escape room "The Box" by Time Trap in Tampa
review: I've had the absolute pleasure of being able to try both the Law Office and The Box. They were both awesome and highly recommend them both. I've done half a dozen escape rooms all over the country and The Box was up there as one of my all time favorites.The Law Office was really cool how they brought in details from the local area. I've grown up in the area and the plot involved the parks and locals. What fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Shadows of the Skunk Ape" by Rabbit Hole Escape Games in Tampa
review: Our group did the Shadows of the Skunk Ape room this weekend, and loved it. This was the first time for my nephews to do an escape room, and they thought it was so cool. My "hardest to please" teenage nephew said he was satisfied. He was so excited to tell his friends about it, and wants to do it again. My other two nephews are eager to do it again, as well. The room is very challenging and impressive. Although, we didn't finish the room in time, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We highly recommend Rabbit Hole Escape Games.

room_title: Escape room "Shadows of the Skunk Ape" by Rabbit Hole Escape Games in Tampa
review: OMG!!! the set and puzzles are amazing. It's 1984 in the cabin and woods. This is an awesome game. Can't say that enough. Awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Shadows of the Skunk Ape" by Rabbit Hole Escape Games in Tampa
review: It was awesome. Being a first-timer, I was nervous and didn't know what to expect. The staff explained all the rules and answered all my questions. You learn to work as a team. Everyone had a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Shadows of the Skunk Ape" by Rabbit Hole Escape Games in Tampa
review: We have done over 25 room escapes, and this one was definitely one of the best we've ever seen. From the mix of puzzles (there was something for everything) to the theming to the mechanics of the way the room worked, we were so impressed and had such a fabulous time! Not to mention our game master Kidany who had us laughing from the moment we first stepped in the door. He only added to the fun and made the whole night that much better :) It was such an amazing experience form start to finish that we couldn't recommend enough! Can't wait to go back and try their newest room!

room_title: Escape room "Shadows of the Skunk Ape" by Rabbit Hole Escape Games in Tampa
review: First escape room for my wife and I. But the kids had done one before. We all had a really good time. The puzzles were challenging, but not impossible. Fun storyline. We really like that it covered multiple rooms. Staff was helpful and friendly. They just opened a second challenge - a sequel to the first storyline. We will definitely be going back for that one!

room_title: Escape room "Space Station Tiberia VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: This was a lot of fun to do virtual escape. The staff was a lot of help and the effects are great. Some people may be a little freaked out at looking down on the world from space, but I found it awesome.

room_title: Escape room "Space Station Tiberia VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: I went back and tried the VR room, the space room. Absolutely incredible. I have done VR before, oculus and Samsung vr, but not like this where you can walk around and see the other people in your group. If you have never tried it, you definitely need to. VR is so futuristic and needs to be supported.The space escape room itself want too hard... It honestly seemed like it was designed for kids. However it was just plain fun! You can pick things up and throw them around the space station, which just doesn't seem to get old. Escaping the room was almost secondary to the fun space elements.We got out pretty quick and they were nice enough to let us see the horror hospital VR walk through, which was... Interesting.Anyway, based on others reviews here for the physical escape rooms, try them at your own risk. But the VR rooms just seem plain fun.

room_title: Escape room "Bayou Mystery" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: Most amazing experience with my group of peers!! Great team building experience and sooooo much fun!!!!!!!! Highly recommend and will be coming again. Super fun! Great thinking puzzles! Love love love!!!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Bayou Mystery" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: Just got done. Didn't finish but was a blast. Definitely coming back. Customer service on point

room_title: Escape room "Bayou Mystery" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: We had a great time at Real Escape! What possibly had the potential of being very disappointing got immediately handled by Eric. He came to the rescue. There was a hiccup with our online reservation. Eric made things happen and we were in! Then the experience itself was ton of fun! THANK YOU Eric and Pauly. You guys were awesome! :)

room_title: Escape room "Nightmare in The Gardens" by The Escape South Florida in West Palm Beach
review: This was the first escape room that I've done, but it was incredible. The room (Nightmare in the Gardens) was super fun but also challenging. Customer service is also wonderful!

room_title: Escape room "Nightmare in The Gardens" by The Escape South Florida in West Palm Beach
review: This visit was not planned at all but I'll remember it for the rest of my life! This was my first time. My girlfriends and I did were victims of a kidnapping, very challenging! I've never felt more blonde in my life! You have an hour to escape... we would never have made it out if not for our kidnapper's friend!

room_title: Escape room "Nightmare in The Gardens" by The Escape South Florida in West Palm Beach
review: Great escape room. Definitely one of the harder ones that I have done so far. Everything was well designed and very well thought out. Kevin is a great guy, stop by and do a room sometime. I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Nightmare in The Gardens" by The Escape South Florida in West Palm Beach
review: Had so much fun! Really works your brain and is a great thrill! We were blindfolded and handcuffed in the beginning which was a little scary but added to the theme.

room_title: Escape room "Captain's Curse" by Extreme Escape Redding in Redding
review: None
