review: The room we had was the Poe-ranormal room. The decor and ambience is superb and immersing from the moment you walk in. Everything you see is meticulously designed to transport you to their world.Almost every puzzle made perfect sense, and the ones we didn't get, our host helped us with clues. Some of the puzzles are pretty hi tech which was great too.Our host was very friendly and stuck to the story very well. He was attentive as we made our way through the puzzles and his hints were crucial to us solving the room in time (with literally one second to spare).When we finished,  they had this really cool area with props and costumes where we could dress up and take pictures to remember this event by.We had a great time and will definitely go back and take friends when we do.

room_title: Escape room "Poe-Ranormal Activity" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: Lurking in the dark we had ravens, cats and paintings with ghastly eyes. Yay! We went here to celebrate a birthday and had such a good time! Fun puzzles and amazing art design. Loved the challenging activities and teamwork! Very cool using these skills to work together to solve a problem without seeming too gimicky or lame. Would definitely go again. The host did a good job of setting the mood. We had the Poe room. I will not divulge anymore because I do not want to spoil your puzzles; so just go!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Poe-Ranormal Activity" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: I went with a group of friends and we completed the Poe-ranormal room. Most of us had never done an escape room before and had no idea what to expect. We had a blast! The room was challenging and a ton of fun. Our room host explained the rules and chimed in with an occasional clarification via walkie-talkie as we bumbled our way through the clues and red herrings. We managed to get out with 9 minutes to spare. From the decor to the layout of the venue, they do a great job of setting the scene and getting guests into the mood while you wait for your challenge to begin. It was an utterly enjoyable event, from beginning to end.

room_title: Escape room "Poe-Ranormal Activity" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: My girlfriend and I went here last night and had a blast. We were in the Poe-anormal Activity Room, which is one of the more advanced rooms. The 45 minutes flew by as my girlfriend and I were in one part of the room solving various puzzles, and the family that was in our group was in the main room. It was a thoroughly enjoyable experience! Hannah was an awesome guide / host! We will certainly try some of the other rooms soon!

room_title: Escape room "Poe-Ranormal Activity" by Escape Room Live in Washington, D.C.
review: My brother and his family are visiting from Southern California. I had heard about this experience from a friend and thought it might be fun for our diverse group. 8 of us participated in the Poe Room. We had such a great time! Can't wait to return andtry another Room.

room_title: Escape room "Sleeper Cell" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: We had an amazing time! We have a large team and they accommodated our team and fit us into the two escape rooms perfectly! Great team building exercise. We loved being “special agents” and trying to figure out the clues to escape on time. The group in the Insanity room loved every moment too. We can’t wait to go again and try opposite rooms. Thank you Nicki!

room_title: Escape room "The Lucky Duck Speakeasy" by Xscape Our Rooms in St. Augustine
review: Went with a group of friends and did the Speakeasy room. The puzzles are really great and they don't heavily rely on scavenger hunts so there was never a dull moment. We're definitely going back to do The Chamber!

room_title: Escape room "The Island" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: Really fun time. We did the island which is a large group room. Had a fun time laughing at each other.

room_title: Escape room "The Island" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: So much fun and easy, but yet so hard. Thanks for the great room!

room_title: Escape room "The Island" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: This room was the bomb. I went with my co-workers as a team event, so we were able to fit 16 of us comfortably in there. None of the teams made it out, but it was super close! I loved how my team was working on one clue for a hot minute and we had read the clue "upside down" and one of the employees told us to take a closer look to make sure we were right....they nudged us enough to understand we had read the clue wrong but never gave the answer away. I would absolutely come back- so fun and it felt exciting to be in volcano *-*

room_title: Escape room "Remedy... 25 Years Later" by Adventure Rooms in Hartford
review: The Remedy... 25 Years Later was awesome! It was challenging and interesting. My little group had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Remedy... 25 Years Later" by Adventure Rooms in Hartford
review: My boyfriend and I booked the Remedy room and it was so much fun! We haven't done anything like this before. We highly recommend it. The puzzles were challenging yet rewarding. We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Remedy... 25 Years Later" by Adventure Rooms in Hartford
review: A group of 8 of us booked The Remedy for last night. Two of us had done an adventure room in Arizona (totally different) but the rest of us had no idea what to expect. We had a great time and worked (surprisingly) really well together - it was clear that each of us had different talents that could be utilized and everyone was in the right frame of mind to get into the challenge. We did the Adventure Room to kick off a birthday celebration weekend and it was a big hit. Would definitely recommend to others...we'll definitely go back to try the other room. And btw - we actually made it out (barely!) with seconds to spare!!!

room_title: Escape room "Remedy... 25 Years Later" by Adventure Rooms in Hartford
review: I am a huge fan of the escape video games and really enjoyed the experience in Middletown. The puzzles are challenging, innovative and fun. I highly recommend it and can't wait to go back and try additional rooms

room_title: Escape room "Remedy... 25 Years Later" by Adventure Rooms in Hartford
review: Had a blast. The staff was super nice and very informative while giving us the directions. If you're looking for a fun afternoon or night out, I strongly suggest doing the Adventure Rooms. We had a group of 4 (you can do larger), and you get to test your strengths and senses. We are already planning our next trip.

room_title: Escape room "Jack's Cabin" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Went in with some skepticism, but actually had a great time doing Jack's Cabin with my mom. We used only 2 clues, and finished with 5 seconds left!I prefer working in smaller groups so I will probably try one of the 4 person rooms next. Definately interested in going again.

room_title: Escape room "Jack's Cabin" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Have done several rooms and have enjoyed them all. Did Uncle Jack's Cabin today and my 9 year old was super excited because he guessed the last clue all by himself!

room_title: Escape room "Jack's Cabin" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Seriously so fun! We're already planning a trip back!! We did Uncle Jacks cabin and got out with 50 seconds left! Would recommend to anyone

room_title: Escape room "Jack's Cabin" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Great experience as a family group of 4 on vacation! Jack's Cabin was a nice challenge for us and the team did a good job of helping us along the way.

room_title: Escape room "Jack's Cabin" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This place was tons of fun. Our family decided to go at the last minute and were able to make reservations for a room all by ourselves in "Uncle Jack's Cabin." This was our first escape the room experience and it has to be one of our favorite family night activities. We were happy to have made it out with 14 min to spare. We were impressed with how well they thought out each clue and left looking forward to going back again. Our daughter would love to do this for her birthday party. We would highly recommend this place. They have many rooms to choose from with different levels and themes. We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard School" by Limitless Escape Games in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Superhero's Adventure - Destination Darkover City" by ALL IN Adventures Orange Park in Jacksonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Remote Adventures" by The Escape Game Jacksonville in Jacksonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Testing Facility" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: This is a fun game! It is very immersive while still being puzzle heavy. We were paired with another couple that also happened to be escape room enthusiasts, so our team worked well together. The hint system keeps with the theme of the game and is very clever. There are puzzles in this game that I hadn't seen before. It's well done!

room_title: Escape room "Testing Facility" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: The Testing Facility was a perfect example of a quality challenging room. I find that most rooms labeled as "expert" are only difficult because they simply don't make sense. This is not the case with this room. The room is non-linear with mini-puzzles are leading to one meta-puzzle, so it's a perfect set-up for larger groups. My husband and I attempted with just the two of us and made it to the last puzzle but we needed a few more minutes. Overall, it a great, logical and just plain fun room and we can't wait to come back and try their other room.

room_title: Escape room "Testing Facility" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: The Testing Facility room is one of my favorite rooms ever! Entertaining theme and the puzzles were clever, logic-based, and needed all hands on deck in order to finish! The owners seem like they really love escape rooms and clearly put a lot of thought and care into creating the room. Awesome room and I recommend you book ASAP!

room_title: Escape room "Testing Facility" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: Great experience! It was my husbands birthday and they included clues about him. So cool! We did not escape in time. It's a difficult room. We've been to a few escape rooms before this and it's one of our favorites! Thanks for a fun time and for the cake! Can't wait for the next room.

room_title: Escape room "Testing Facility" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: I love, LOVE the extremely strong narrative thread throughout the entire experience. Everything, including the hint system, ties into the story experience. The Testing Facility is a puzzle heavy room. There is minimal searching in this room. I really appreciated that we had to use our brains more than our eyes. Lots of unique puzzles in this room. Everything from number puzzles, riddles, and word puzzles. Very inventive use of props and not a whole lot of padlocks. Clever use of tech in this room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: This place is amazing! We did a team building night in both rooms (one scary, one not) by Mission Escape with 8 people per room. The storylines are fantastic and the mechanics they use are like magic. This goes beyond just hunting for codes to open locks (although plenty of those too!), but they use great technology to make the experience completely immersive. They really want you to succeed, so the progressive storyline is enhanced by the tech to guide you where you need to go so you don't feel completely lost and stuck. And even if you do get stuck they give you just enough hint to get you where you need to go.We screamed, we laughed, we loved every minute!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: I have played a handful of escape rooms but this one was my wife's first time. And even though she was terrified of the Horror Theme for The Darkest Hour, she had an amazing experience. The game itself has a lot of unique and interesting puzzles. The whole game makes you think outside the box. It's a little difficult but if you bring a good sized group you all will have a lot of fun figuring out the clues for the escape.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Mission Escape and Joe (Masterful Game Master) have done it again! Brought a mixed group of experienced and inexperienced escapers to try out the new Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber. We were wowed, spooked, tricked, and then escaped. Great take on this kind of horror theme. Very cohesive puzzles and clever guides. Looking forward to more rooms by these guys!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: A friend, my sister, and I did The Darkest Hour escape room. It was very creepy. The puzzles were thematic and we were able to get out with 2:13 seconds left. A few jump scares happened. It was good that my friend was an expert in these types of games cause I honestly felt lost. The workers were definitely impressed at the speed of our puzzle solving. Definitely good times!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: We have done both Hydeout and Darkest Hour by Mission Escapes and I can't say enough about the build quality, puzzle complexity, and amazing staff. Both stories are well thought out and immerse you from minute one. Darkest Hour was a little more simple (in my opinion) but the anticipation and thrilling nature force you to work a littlest more trepidatiously. The puzzles are innovative and unlike some of the puzzles I've seen before, the room is built to change music, lights, and mood of the room as you solve puzzles and progress. Joel was our puzzle master and he was amazing! Very engaging, a great conversationalist, and very supportive. Do yourself a favor and book this room, you'll have a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Tiger Island" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: My family of four really enjoyed this themed escape. We completed it in about 37 minutes. The puzzles were a bit challenging - an easy/medium challenge level room. A great time with an extremely nice staff! Highly recommend 10/10.

room_title: Escape room "Tiger Island" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: We've completed the tiger island and the 80's escape room and both were a blast! The staff is always super friendly and helpful. The puzzles are challenging, fun, and rewarding. Definitely reccomend this to anyone looking for an adventure!

room_title: Escape room "Tiger Island" by Amelia Island Escape Rooms in Jacksonville
review: While visiting Amelia Island for a week we did two escape rooms with our children, ages 7 and 9. We liked “Unlock the 80s” so much we returned to do “Tiger Island.” Both we’re challenging and super fun. We escaped both times! Will definitely come do this again on our next trip to Amelia Island!

room_title: Escape room "Save the Fleet" by Escape U in St. Augustine
review: By far the greatest escape room I've ever been to! Brandon and his partner really know what they're doing. If you want an adrenalin rush of a lifetime, this is the place to be! Perfect combination of suspense and thrill combined with a touch of scare! I cannot wait to try the next room.

room_title: Escape room "Save the Fleet" by Escape U in St. Augustine
review: What an amazing time! We were there for part of a bachelorette weekend. We did the scary room they have and it was a blast! The staff were all very friendly and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Save the Fleet" by Escape U in St. Augustine
review: This was my first ever escape room (half of my group had done them before). We all had an AMAZING time! It was exciting, challenging and at times a bit scary. I highly recommend this place to anyone!! I'm so happy I chose to celebrate my birthday at Escape U! We'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Save the Fleet" by Escape U in St. Augustine
review: Escape U did a great job for my daughter's birthday party. Group of 7 teens did the Save The Fleet room and had a blast. Zoe welcomed us when we arrived and was very nice. This was our second time there and will be back to do the Asylum room soon.

room_title: Escape room "Save the Fleet" by Escape U in St. Augustine
review: Blake was an amazing guide, great interactive creepy voices for the ghost dad and lighthouse daughters. We loved it. I would definitely recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Chamber" by Somewhere Secret in Fort Collins
review: We loved this Escape Room. It seemed more authentic than most with very diverse, ingenious clues, and unexpected turns that kept the game alive and moving. We did the room with 6 people the youngest was 12, and we all stayed busy, and were useful uncovering all the hidden clues. We all loved it! Must check it out!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Chamber" by Somewhere Secret in Fort Collins
review: The people who designed this game are whimsical geniuses, it's totally different from other escape rooms and is definitely worth the visit. Plus there's an awesome prize if you find it!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Chamber" by Somewhere Secret in Fort Collins
review: This was so fun! We decided last minute to do this escape room for our company holiday party and everyone had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Mission Sigma VR" by Parallel Universe VR in Los Angeles
review: My kids (8 and 10) are obsessed with this place. Great introduction into the VR fundamentals with a nice and knowledgable staff that help guide the beginners. Very cool experience.

room_title: Escape room "Mission Sigma VR" by Parallel Universe VR in Los Angeles
review: Unlike anything out there. Here, you feel you are a part of the game universe. Try it!

room_title: Escape room "Mission Sigma VR" by Parallel Universe VR in Los Angeles
review: My son had a 10th birthday party here yesterday and all the kids enjoyed ir, Also all the staff is very helpful and assisting us and all the kids during the party. Will definitely recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Mermaid's Curse" by The Ultimate Escape Rooms in Ventura
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Operation Blackstone" by Escape FLA in Tampa
review: We did the Operation Blackstone room and it was hard but not too hard! It was really fun and there were lots of clues to find. This is a great place for families, birthday parties, even work functions! It is family owned and operated and the owner is super nice and helpful! There are options to have hints during the one hour in the room which is great. All in all this is a super great escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Operation Blackstone" by Escape FLA in Tampa
review: Fantastic experience all around. We did Operation Blackstone. This was my 3rd time doing an escape room and this one really felt like the story of the room drove the puzzles. A nice twist for this room was that you weren’t actually escaping the room, you were completing a mission. Bonus points to the owner who worked with me ahead of time to have a personalized puzzle built in for my wife’s birthday that contained her birthday card. She really thought that was cool.

room_title: Escape room "Operation Blackstone" by Escape FLA in Tampa
review: What. A. Blast. Had family fly down to visit and went here looking to bond and have fun. It ended up being more than we could've imagined. Thanks for hosting the event for us, we will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Way Out Games in Carrollton
review: We had a great time tonight solving the Baker Street Mystery. This room was challenging but fun! I can’t wait to go back and try to escape from the other 2 rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Way Out Games in Carrollton
review: Escaped Baker Street with 20 seconds to spare! We’ve done two of the three. Next is the Houdini room! Justin helped us big time at the end of the Baker Street! Can’t wait to come back for the last one!

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Way Out Games in Carrollton
review: There was a mix up with times but they came and opened the place just for us to play! Zac was awesome and we had the best time. We escaped the Baker Street Five with 16 minutes to go. We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Way Out Games in Carrollton
review: Had an awesome time on Baker Street! Alex was awesome! I totally recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini's Magic Cell - Destination Budapest" by ALL IN Adventures Waterbury in Southington
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sherlocked" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: What an awesome escape room adventure! We definitely got Sherlocked but we were so close to success! This family owned and operated establishment was so welcoming and friendly. And the room was very challenging and fun.

room_title: Escape room "ESC Key" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: The Esc Key was so much fun and I can't wait to do the other room! We got the fastest time, let's see if you can beat us!

room_title: Escape room "ESC Key" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: Amazing! As an escape room veteran, I've probably done at least 10 rooms, both of the rooms here were incredible. Both were extremely well designed in terms of the cleverness of the puzzles. ESC Room's puzzles were harder then Skelaton Key's.

room_title: Escape room "ESC Key" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: Great escape experiences! Started with Skeleton Key and enjoyed it so much, we stayed for ESC Key... Still stuck in the land of C.O.L.I.N., we have to admit. Such nice proprietors, great puzzles and very immersive. We will be sure to send others your way! Thanks much!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Great game! We were a group of 10 newbies and it kept us engaged and having fun the entire time.

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had an AMAZING hour in the Escape Room! Our first time doing an escape room and definitely not our last. You really use your brain and the four of us really worked as a team.

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun doing this with friends and families! Highly recommend Escape X to anyone that is looking for a challenge and great time! Love the theme and storyline, can't wait for what's next!!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Had a great time doing the room. Definitely a challenge and lots of fun. Bring your friends and give it a go.

room_title: Escape room "DeRailed" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: We had such a fun time breaking out! We had a big group of 18 so we split between Hotel Horror and Derailed. The rooms were VERY well done and the people running the rooms do an amazing job! We can't wait to go back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "DeRailed" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: Wonderful experience! Went with a group of 8 for derailed and had a blast! Really makes u think and work as a team. Very well put together and the game masters do a wonderful job. Cool location(1920's house). Will be back again!

room_title: Escape room "DeRailed" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: We had such a fun time breaking out! We had a big group of 18 so we split between Hotel Horror & Derailed. The rooms were VERY well done & the people running the rooms do an amazing job! I enjoyed Derailed a lot!

room_title: Escape room "Black & White" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: My husband took me here for date night and we did the "Black & White" room. Our operator, Hannah, was awesome! She was very personable and made the experience so much fun. We escaped with less than 2 minutes on the clock. Thank you for a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Black & White" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: We had a great time in the Black and White room! Challenging clues, working together as a team, everyone contributed to get us out! Fun for all ages!

room_title: Escape room "Black & White" by Brainstorm Escape Games in Atlanta
review: Did Area 51 and The Black & White room. We've done a lot of escape rooms all over the US and this was one of the best we've ever done. The games were brilliant! The staff was awesome! Highly recommend for anyone looking for a family night out, date night or any kind of team building event. Loved it!!!

room_title: Escape room "Blackbeard's Ghost" by The Game Fort Collins in Fort Collins
review: We played this escape room and we had a blast. I rate it about a 6 to 7 or difficulty.

room_title: Escape room "Blackbeard's Ghost" by The Game Fort Collins in Fort Collins
review: Best game in Fort Collins, it is a great family game also one for any group activity. Challenging and inventive. Great puzzles!

room_title: Escape room "Nautilus" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: Had an awesome time will definitely do it again it was so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Nautilus" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: Our family of 4 completed the Nautilus clue room with 30 seconds to spare. The staff is friendly, and the facilities clean and well-maintained. They want you to succeed. The puzzles are developed in-house, so you never have to worry about booking a room and then finding that you've done the same puzzle elsewhere. We had so much fun that we decided to do the next puzzle right then and there. Finished that one with 4 minutes left. Pay a visit to Clue Room, because it's really fun to be the smartest person in the room!

room_title: Escape room "Nautilus" by The Clue Room in Denver
review: This was an excellent challenge and a great time with family and friends. The Clue Room was absolutely wonderful and really makes everyone work together.

room_title: Escape room "Legend of The Silent Tide" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: The first escape room I’ve ever done and I cannot rave about it enough. Immersive storyline and really cool sets. We didn’t break any records but we had so, so, so much fun. Legend of the Silent Tide is a great room and we’ll most definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Legend of The Silent Tide" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: This escape room is fantastic. We did both their Outlawed room and their Silent Tide room and had a blast in both of them. While you had a variety of standard puzzles, there were a lot of interesting ways to find codes and reveal new information that was clever and fun. I would definitely go back again and look forward to completing some of their more challenging rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Legend of The Silent Tide" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: We had a group of 10 in the Silent Tide room. We couldn't stop smiling and laughing the whole time. Turns out we work really well together. Such a damn good time. All of the employees were amazing! We will definitely be back next time we visit Orlando.

room_title: Escape room "Legend of The Silent Tide" by The Escape Company in Orlando
review: Today I participated in a team-builder in the Silent Tide room. We were so close, but didn't make it out in time needed a few more minutes. Charlie was a fantastic host and the experience and story line was excellent. Highly recommend it and can't wait to try the other rooms they have.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes" by Axxiom Escape Rooms Rehoboth in Rehoboth Beach
review: We had a great time! We chose the Sherlock Holmes room. It definitely makes you think. We will definitely be back soon!

room_title: Escape room "Secrets of the Skunk Ape" by Rabbit Hole Escape Games in Tampa
review: This place was AWESOME! My BF and I did both of the Skunk Ape rooms. We ended up playing with only us 2 in both games and were able to get out before the time!! Each game had multiple rooms that were decorated is such detail. I was so excited to go in to each new room. The puzzles and clues all made sense and went with the flow. In some escape rooms we've been in, lock codes and clues were REALLY REACHING, but everything here had some sort of relevance. Even though both were very good, my personal favorite was the first one (named Part 1)! You don't have to play the rooms in order. I think I would have played Part 2 first and then Part 1 if I knew how awesome and harder Part 1 was. SO FUN!

room_title: Escape room "Secrets of the Skunk Ape" by Rabbit Hole Escape Games in Tampa
review: We did the skunk ape 1.0. Beat it with 2 min left. Andy, our guide was awesome! Medium difficulty level and SO much fun.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets of the Skunk Ape" by Rabbit Hole Escape Games in Tampa
review: Wow!!!  This is around the 15th escape room that I have been to and BY FAR it is the best!  Four of us did Shadows of the Skunk Ape yesterday afternoon and are going back tonight to do Secrets which is part 2, and their new mini golf!  The special effects in the room were amazing! Like no other I have experienced (felt like we were at disney).  Amy is just fabulous and made us feel special.  I highly recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Uncle Thaddius’ Attic" by Get A Clue Room Escape in Temecula
review: The treasure hunt begins in the attic!Your eccentric Uncle Thaddius has passed away and he has left you with an attic full of mystery. You must uncover the truth about your uncle and you might even find some of the treasure he has been collecting throughout the years.Production ValueUncle Thaddius's Attic can be found easily in Temecula, CA. Plenty of parking and at the end of business complex. Nice waiting room and shared bathroom with the rest of the tenants. First of all I just want to say I was really surprised by this room. This is my first room in Temecula and I was not expecting much at all. I just assumed this was going to be your typical cheap looking escape room in a generic office building. I was very wrong.Once you walk into the room it looks like a study.  Full of maps and books and chests. There are hidden compartments and a lot of surprises in this room that I did not expect one bit. Uncle Thaddius's Attic is full of little clues and the attention detail is commendable. The second part of the room is a nice change of tone from the first one and really represents the secret nature of Uncle Thaddius and as a result, the mystery of everything adds so much to the experience.Immersion FactorOnce I started exploring Uncle Thaddius's Attic I was completely in. The secret compartments and hidden clues scattered around the room really gets you into the game.PuzzlesThe puzzles in Uncle Thaddius's Attic are challenging and also satisfying. The clues are clear but it isn't easy. All the puzzles intertwine with each other and push you through the room.Customer ServiceWe met the owner of the escape room and he was nice. We talked about escape rooms and he was very friendly.Uncle Thaddius's Attic explores the mind of your eccentric uncle and takes you through a fun journey as you discover his dark secrets. If you are in Temecula you must check this out.Result: WinHints: 1Final Score: 9/10

room_title: Escape room "Uncle Thaddius’ Attic" by Get A Clue Room Escape in Temecula
review: Thank you guys for a great experience! First escape room in Temecula, and it was fun! The staff was very friendly. Thank you, Pam for being accommodating. We did Uncle Thaddius' Attic, there were a few parts that stumped our team, but we managed to escape. Definitely looking forward to the new room, and trying the Toy Shop.

room_title: Escape room "Uncle Thaddius’ Attic" by Get A Clue Room Escape in Temecula
review: Love these rooms! Uncle Thaddius's attic is top notch. Would highly recommend this place to everyone. The owner Butch definitely knows what he's doing, not to mention how great of a guy he is! Go check it out!!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We completed this room with approx 20-ish minutes on the clock. We are a group of 6 that have completed about 10-15 rooms. We do not think the difficulty rating on this one is appropriate. I would say it's medium difficulty, bordering on easy.It was unique to be split up with your group. It was a fun room and concept even though we felt like it was a little bit easy.Also, finding the spot is a little difficult. It's kind of hidden on the side of the road with a high rolling fence at the entrance to the parking lot.

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This was really fun. You definitely need a diverse group of friends to do the wild west! It's a fun challenge and we has 12 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This our first experience with an escape room. Did it with two other couples on date night. Had a blast! We did the kidnapped room. It was a lot of fun, and we were able to escape from the room with nine minutes left, without any hints. Our wives were taken into a separate room and we had to rescue them and then continue all together. Don't want to give any too many details, but it was fun and challenging. The hardest part was that they didn't really tell us anything from the beginning. We just had to figure out what we needed to do. You get locked in a room with no instructions except to get out. A lot of fun, would totally recommend for groups of friends or team building activities for businesses. I was a little worried that you would have to be a genius puzzle solver. The puzzles/riddles/challenges were clever, but solvable. Thanks for a great evening PanIQ Room staff!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Had a great time! A group of 6 of us went and it was neat that all of us contributed to our escape! I definitely recommend! Can't wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: My sister and her husband took us and we did the alien room. We had a blast! I actually thought we were running out of time any minute, but we finished with 12 minutes to spare! I highly recommend this to one and all, but most especially family.

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We had a great time! There were four of us and each one participated in getting us out with 8 minutes to spare....whew! We did get some helpful hints from our walkie-talkie guide. We're anxious to go back and try to escape another room...makes you really think out of the box!!!Fun time!!!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: It's so much fun! I went with 4 other friends and we had an absolute hoot. So much time and effort has gone into planning these rooms. We did the kidnapped room and got out with 8 minutes to spare. Chan and Jeff were so much fun and helped in whatever way they could. A few of us began dancing after escaping the first room and they commented on the walkie talkies that they enjoyed it. Definitely coming back next time I'm in Phoenix!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This was the most fun we have had in a really long time! It was very well put together - they had really taken a lot of time with all the details. The challenges were very creative.

room_title: Escape room "Tragic Magic" by Tampa Bay Escape Room in Tampa
review: The magic room is great! You will not be disappointed. You will be challenged! Check them out!

room_title: Escape room "Blackbeard's Treasure" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: Based on the legend of Blackbeard the pirate, you are scurrying around an old, abandoned ship searching for…treasure!We loved the atmosphere in this room–we felt like we were trapped on the infamous Queen Anne. Production design was good and the room had some extremely clever ways for activating circuits and opening doors and boxes that had both of us oohing and aahing. Currently clues are asked for through a walkie-talkie, though they are working to upgrade the clue system in that room (which is good because they walkie-talkie did seem to keep picking up someone else’s transmission!).But. We didn’t always feel like we knew what we were supposed to be doing. The flow of the puzzles was a bit scattered and the storyline unclear. It’s wasn’t always clear to us what we were solving or why were solving it that way. Or even how we actually got out of the room. The game seemed to just stop. When talking to Noel and Stephan afterward, they explained the actual escape scenario. We looked at each other and realized…we hadn’t actually done that!They are also very open to feedback–possibly more so than any other company we’ve been to. They sat us down with more tea and biscuits (of course) and had a conversation with us about what we liked, what could be improved, and our general sense of the room. So we feel very confident that this place will continue to improve based on their openness.

room_title: Escape room "Blackbeard's Treasure" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: A must go in Family or with your colleagues.We did the Pirate and the Prohibition rooms. They are great to play and we passed a very good moments.

room_title: Escape room "Blackbeard's Treasure" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: Went to the pirate-themed room with our kids ages 12-17 and had the best time! Fun and challenging at the same time. Certainly the best indoor activity in Miami. We will certainly be back to try another room!

room_title: Escape room "Blackbeard's Treasure" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: Great fun! We did the pirate one and were surprised by the puzzles and production value. Good challenge! Definitely will return to do the other two rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Blackbeard's Treasure" by Escape Hunt in Miami
review: I have been to several escape games before, but the Blackbeard room is the room to visit! It was very challenging but fun. The attention to detail and how some of the clues were triggered were completely new to me, which was refreshing and exciting!The owner is amazing and was very hospitable. The place itself is GORGEOUS. The decoration in the lobby was so impressive we thought we have already stepped inside an escape room! We will definitely be returning to complete the other two themes.

room_title: Escape room "Lost City" by Great Escape Delaware in Newark
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Sanitorium" by Southernmost Escape in Key West
review: Our first escape room experience, but it won’t be our last. Southernmost Escape was extremely accommodating and friendly. Plus, the rooms were impeccably decorated! Each with its own theme. We had a blast escaping the Sanitorium. It was the perfect amount of scary. We will definitely be back! Now, for the tough decision, which room to try next...

room_title: Escape room "The Sanitorium" by Southernmost Escape in Key West
review: We’re tried to escape the Sanitorium. Great customer service. We talked to the owner and he was extremely nice and friendly. We loved the whole thing. Thank you guys again we’ll be back again and try the other games too for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Stash House" by Stash House in Los Angeles
review: Very well crafted puzzles. Great time had by all! Original theme and overall great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Stash House" by Stash House in Los Angeles
review: Ok, I've found a new room that is now in my TOP THREE!Stash House is so, so much more than an "escape room". I felt like I was in a movie and the immersion factor was off the charts. This is a perfect experience for a lot of friends (I tend to cap my group at 4), but I love that this experience gets everyone involved at all times. Everything made sense and flowed beautifully.This was the 117th room I've played and words can't begin to describe this whole experience. They've got an awesome thing going here and I'm sure many more reviews will concur. Escape rooms should follow suit of what this company has got going for them.

room_title: Escape room "Stash House" by Stash House in Los Angeles
review: Stash House is probably my favorite escape room so far!! Instead of escaping, the challenge is to find all the drugs in the house and flush them down the toilet before the cops arrive! The puzzles were very challenging and so well crafted! I’d definitely recommend a bigger group of 6-8 or so.

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: This is a work in progress, but was good for the price.  The "serial killer" theme was well done and the puzzles are as expected for an escape room.  Without spoilers, they include looking for things with black lights, organizing clues, and opening lock boxes using various clues given to you.This is in an empty birthday party room devoted for the escape room experience, and had a creepy vibe, especially given the halloween party decorations that are part of the puzzle.  This location seems geared to kids, although this was slightly too scary and too hard for most children. The organization says that they have been visiting other escape rooms in Orange County, and are tinkering with and changing things here to make it better and better.  It may be worth it to wait a few months until a new experience is announced.  But for the much lower price compared to other escape rooms, this is worth it if you are in the area.

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: We had such a great time at this Escape room.   We were a group of 9 and we were able to finish the quest in under 45 mins. Yes we did use our hints but we still figured it out. We did the room called 'The Cellar'  and it was really fun. We will be doing it again.

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: fun

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: I had the complete opposite experience from Amy. The staff did not seem to care at all that we were struggling.  The Wild West rooms were too dark for 3/4 of our group to see the clues/puzzles. Did not get the sense that they were watching our progress and were willing to help us.   The staff members were like robots in and out of the room.  Didn't adjust their words at all to have a conversation with us/make us feel welcome/seem like they cared about our experience.  One of the clues was not reset properly, wasting our time (we solved a puzzle to open something, and there was nothing there. The "hidden" object was sitting out in the open the whole time. The rooms were dirty and we were looking for clues in amongst dust/hair. I had a much better experience at a smaller business that really seemed to care about our enjoyment of the room and was watching us closely and ready to suggest that we use a clue so we'd finish in time. It would have been lovely if this game master had turned up the lights or allowed us to use our phones' flashlights so that we could see better and have a chance of completing the room.  We also did not know how many rooms the puzzle involved, so we thought we were on track to finish and then discovered there was a whole other larger room with the majority of the work in it.  This room is advertised as good for beginnners, but you need a large group with young eyes to complete this room if you are beginners. Our group was obviously not ready for this room, but I really think that there were issues with our experience separate from our insufficient puzzle-solving abilities.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: Did the Wild West and Perfect Crime escape rooms and both were amazing. The rooms had high production value, and they were well decorated to fit the themes. Rooms were very spacious and had cool automated puzzles. If you do a same day sign up for another room you get 30% off that second room.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: Went here with my coworkers and it was cool. We did the western themed room. The host was cool and nice. The room is no joke! They had real props that worked and it took us out of reality for a while. It was nice to see our team worked together to get through the room. You guys should check it out!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: My friends brought me here as my birthday celebration and we did the Wild West room! There were seven of us. The room had many reasonable puzzles. Some were definitely more challenging than other ones, but that's part of the fun!Jonathan, our guide, was quite friendly and helpful during our time inside the room. His hints were great in that we still had the opportunity to figure the puzzle out on our own (i.e. he did not outright give us the answers).

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: I loved it! This theme amazed me, It really feels like you're in a western movie. It's not too hard but still challenging, recommended for everyone. The staff is awesome, they really know if you need help or not. Don't miss it if you are in San Jose!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room San Jose in San Jose
review: I've done many escape rooms in the Bay Area, and so far this is my favorite!First: the design is top notch. The Paniq team did an amazing job, you actually feel like you're back in the 1800s. Also the puzzles are extremely well thought out! Having done more than 30 rooms myself, I've barely seen any of those puzzles anywhere else.10/10

room_title: Escape room "Mystery of the Black Dahlia" by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: I had a long drive in Florida and was looking for a game to do along the way, I stopped my search at Escape Cocoa Beach. The owners were awesome. I could tell before I started the room it would be a good one (I can usually tell based on the attitude of the person that greets me).      At this point I've done around 40 rooms and I always think I'm going to crush it.... and I am always wrong. The owner Ryan put some real thought into his puzzles and when a puzzle is solved you feel rewarded instead of frustrated. I love when I ask for a hint and it isn't something ridiculous, instead it was a cleverly place clue that I overlooked.    What was really amazing was the actually scenario. All four of his rooms follow an actual historic event. I did the Black Dahlia and I was impressed that the story, puzzles, props and atmosphere all blended together. Nothing was off.  I would definitely love to go back to Cocoa beach to do their other rooms. Once I reached the 20 room mark I stopped trying to rush through them for the best time and started to enjoy the immersion and scenario. This is why Escape Coca Beach is getting 5 - stars from me. The moment you enter the room you can see the passion and hard work that went into creating an amazing event.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery of the Black Dahlia" by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: The building is so unique and clean! I love the decorations as well. We played Black Dahlia and it was definitely a mind twister. I would 100% go back again!!! Also I love how they have unlimited clues!! Would recommend(:

room_title: Escape room "Mystery of the Black Dahlia" by Escape Cocoa Beach in Melbourne
review: Such a great experience, loved the room (Black Dahlia) and our host was very welcoming and informative. He helped us when we needed it and was super friendly. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a fun/challenging activity.

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: Falls Church, Virginia is actually where Breakout Games DC is located.  Falls Church is an independent city in the commonwealth of Virginia.  It is included in the Washington DC metropolitan area.  Since Breakout Games already has a few Virginia locations, they decided to brand their name "Breakout Games DC" to attract more customers. There's plenty of parking right in front of the facility.  The entrance to the lobby is located on the 2nd floor.  Like their other locations, there's plenty of seating with complimentary water and merchandise available.  From a décor aspect, we do feel Timonium, MD feels newer.  There's a total of 6 escape games at this location.  ESCAPETHEROOMers picked "Island Escape" as it's the only one that we were able to fit into our schedule.After a quick debrief, we were sent to an island to enjoy our vacation.  Little did we know, that a volcano is about the explode on this island and of course everyone else evacuated already except for us.  With only one boat left available for departure, we have to find the keys to safely evacuate before the lava covers the land.  This room is pretty linear and you really can't move on until you solve a puzzle which leads to the next one.  The room size is also pretty good for just the two of us.  I would say a max of 4 people would be comfortable for this game as anymore may feel a bit cramped. You also probably won't need that many people on one puzzle.  Although the room's décor stuck to the theme of the island feel with its art and props, we still felt like we were just in a room.  The puzzles did stick with the theme throughout, but it was all within the "classic" types of puzzles.  There was one particular prop that gave the room a bit of a "pop", but it would've been great to see a bit more innovation on the puzzle design.  We were stuck on some puzzles at the beginning as traditionally we would probably didn't think about reusing something, but this was quickly realized after our first hint.  We got out with a minute to spare with just the two of us.  There's definitely a good amount of puzzles in there so I wouldn't waste time. This room would be a fun family room as I could see some kids logically solving most of it.We felt very "refreshed" after this room and had a sudden urge to go on vacation only to realize our next stop is yet, another escape room.  No complaints here! Escapees for life!  Breakout Games also has escape games that can be delivered to the comfort of your own home called "Dispatch".  We recently received our package and we're eager to unbox and share our thoughts with you guys soon!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: We went mid week and tried the island room. It was our first escape room and gave us a run for our money. Angel was our game master and was perfect with his clues and orientation. He spoke a bit quickly that I felt a bit pressured. Overall a great experience and looking forward to going back

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: If I ever were to get stuck on a volcanic island with a group of strangers it would be THIS group! Our game master was amazing as I appreciated all of the clues and good sense of humor. He didn't mislead us and provided just enough clues to enable our team to escape at 53:20. If you want to do a fun team building activity for your group at work or even a non-profit I would highly recommend going to an escape room. You will learn a lot about each other! Luckily we broke out and didn't kill each other as we worked together on a common goal!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: So much fun! I will definitely be back with friends.  My favorite thing about is that each room is yours entirely. My group and I did the room where you were trapped on an island and had to get off before the volcano errupted. We thankfully got out.  What is interesting about this particular escape is that there were no level of difficulty. The staff said each room was basically the same level. If that's the case, I would have never gotten out if it weren't for the numerous clues that they gave whenever we were stuck. My friend that I did it with said she thought the room was really hard. I really appreciated our game master- he was quite humerous in his clues.

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - D.C. in Washington, D.C.
review: The theme of the breakout room that I did was island escape. It was very challenging tons of locks to open but we broke out in time! Our game master, the guy who gives us clues was very energetic which got us more in the spirit for the game!I highly recommend checking Breakout Games out!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Miami
review: Nice place, good stuff and really competitive prices. Thinking outside the box is definitely needed. We've visited Detention and Vacation Vandals. The area of the games is rather small and the interiors could be more sophisticated. Anyway, I recommend Key Quest escape rooms. Creative and logical riddles and interesting plots can be found there. Gifts for winners have been a nice surprise for us. :) Also, we've enjoyed laser games.

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Miami
review: Fun times, love this place!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Miami
review: I love this place!! The setup & glow is awesome & it's huge inside! Big enough to go with a big group of people. Good enough time for one round at a time & its a lot of fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Rampancy" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: I went with a group of three friends and joined another couple for the hardest room, "Rampancy". Our minds were put to the test as we conquered patterns and solved logic puzzles. The clues were helpful but not obvious, the puzzles all made sense, and we almost finished which we were extremely proud of. 10 more minutes would have resulted in an ever so satisfying victory. I will definitely be bringing friends again to tackle another task. Highly recommended for anyone with a sense of adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Rampancy" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: Had so much fun and this was the first time ever doing this! It was a blast and would certainly do it again! Must try it at least once! You won't regret it...Staff here were awesome and scenario was planned well...

room_title: Escape room "Rampancy" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: This was one of the most fun things I have done in a while, and for such a decent price as well!! I would reccommend it to anyone, and will be coming back to try the rest of the rooms soon!

room_title: Escape room "Rampancy" by Denver Escape Room in Denver
review: So much fun!! I was a little skeptical at first since I had never been to one of these before, but we will definitely be back. We did white lie and it was challenging but also really fun. The guys that did the room with us were great considering we did not meet them until yesterday. I recommend it to any couple or friends who are looking for something unique and fun

room_title: Escape room "Mafia" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We came to 60out for our yearly team building day and we had so much fun! We got the Hangover room and escaped. It was awesome! Our team consisted of five and none of us have ever done an escape room so we considered this a win! Highly recommend and Victoria was great!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The Hangover was my 38th room. This room was decorative and set the scene up for the story. It made me feel like I was immersed in the story quite well. The puzzles were actually fun to do and were quick and on a whim type of solving. No real scavenger hunt in here which was nice and towards the end waa my favorite part because of the props we had to use in order to get out. Loved all of it.

room_title: Escape room "Mafia" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had some minor tech hiccups in this room, but our game master was able to fix things for us quickly. We had to do something physical in this room that we've never done before, which was super cool! It's a pretty tech-heavy room and uses almost all your senses. I don't think there were any traditional lock-key puzzles (though I could be wrong). The end is incredibly clever!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The set decor is mind blowing. The puzzles are intuitive and fun. Highly recommended. My friend runs an escape room of her own and she had a blast as well.

room_title: Escape room "Mafia" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the new Hangover room. It was lots of fun and we really enjoyed it.At first, I was a reluctant Escape Room virgin but I am so glad I gave this a try. The reason I was initially hesitant is because I don't like places where I can't get out, and I don't like being scared. Haunted houses and being mid row in any arena is my nightmare.These games are terrific because they help you work together as a team while tapping into out of the box thinking and communication skills. I look forward to an opportunity to try another escape room.My friends said this was one of the better ones they have been to in LA and Phoenix.

room_title: Escape room "The Inventor's Garage" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: Inventors Garage is so much fun and easily achievable with just two people. The Rube Goldberg machine is a blast. Our group of made it out with 1:42 left

room_title: Escape room "The Inventor's Garage" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This was my first escape room experience ever - and it was amazing! We tried the Inventor's Garage as a group of six. The puzzles were really fun and creative. The staff was super friendly, well organized, and accommodating. Can't wait to go back and try the other 3 rooms! Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "The Inventor's Garage" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This is the third room we've escaped from at Epic Escape Game Englewood and this one was just as terrific as the last two. So far we've done The Inventor's Garage, Sweet Dreams and the Lost Continent, all with a different mix of people. I'm thoroughly impressed with the thoughtful design of each of the rooms and all of the puzzles are unique. The decorations in the room match the story lines perfectly. I've met both owners now and they're equally friendly and helpful. I highly recommend the escape room experience and Epic Escape Game in particular.

room_title: Escape room "The Inventor's Garage" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: This place is great! I had never done an escape room before and my sister suggested we do it for our dad's birthday the other day. We did the Inventor's Garage and got out within approximately 40 minutes. It was a great way to get those gears in our brains moving all while having fun. It was much more intricate of a set up than I thought it would be and I will definitely be going back.

room_title: Escape room "The Inventor's Garage" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: My friend & I had never done an escape room but this was a blast! Plus, the owners/staff were so friendly & answered all of our questions before & after. We will definitely go back again!

room_title: Escape room "The Inventor's Garage" by Epic Escape Game in Denver
review: So fun! Just had girls night out here! We had a blast! These guys did an awesome job making everything flow. The story was cute. The clues were perfect. It was fun to work together and bust out with 1:22 to spare! Will be back to try the other rooms! Thanks for the great time!

room_title: Escape room "Imprisoned" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: This was so fun! We took our kids and we did the "Imprisoned" room. It was a surprise for all 5 of our kids, ranging from 10-15. We really had to work as a team and managed to escape with just a minute to spare! There were smiles the rest of the day and continual praise for the experience!The staff could not be more amazing! I already want to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Imprisoned" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: My husband and I just did the imprisoned challenge, and we will definitely be repeat customers. The staff was cheerful and helpful, and the clues they gave were great as well. We were floored by the details that went into our room, and we had a blast trying to keep track of all the clues. The puzzles were the right amount of challenging, and they throw in some fantastic twists that made it even better. We hadn't even left the parking lot before we started planning our next trip back. I can't recommend it enough!

room_title: Escape room "Imprisoned" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: We had a group of seven, which included five 13-year-olds, solving the "Imprisoned" room, and it was so great! The staff was very helpful and friendly, from the booking of the room and the party space to the end of the game and clean up. I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Imprisoned" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: I had the chance to visit Auburn Escape Zones with my coworkers. We had a large group so we broke into 2 teams. My team escaped the Prison room. It was so much fun and a great way to work together. They will be changing a few of the rooms soon so there will be new rooms to escape!I highly recommend fir families or friends looking for something to do in Auburn/Opelika!

room_title: Escape room "Imprisoned" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: They said the difficulty of the Imprisoned room was "medium," but it was definitely a hard medium. Looking forward to going back and trying another room! Had a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Awesomeness seriously worth it go do this ...you will love it!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: This is something I can't wait to introduce to other friends. So fun! Very challenging.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Great experience, highly recommend for unique & entertaining fun!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: Attempted Shanghaied as our first Escapology experience! We had a blast! We weren't used to multiple rooms for the escape room but it was awesome that we were forced to really think! Already planning a return trip!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: A friend and I did the "Antidote" room and we had such a great time! Ambyr (sorry if I spelled her name incorrectly) was our game master and she was awesome! I will definitely be coming back to try the rest of the rooms! So much fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: This was an AMAZING experience. I highly suggest you and your friends/family make it a point to come and do this amazing experience!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Orlando in Orlando
review: This was an awesome experience !!! So glad we went during our trip to Orlando! It really tested everyone in my group and we all were able to contribute to our escapeWould defiantly recommend this to anyone !

room_title: Escape room "Humana Festum" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: I did the new Humana Experience two days ago, which includes 4 mini escapes + 2 tacos and 2 cocktails with each ticket (more can be purchased). I've done two other rooms in the past (which are AMAZING), but the new Humana Experience was so much fun...and less stressful due to the drinks and social time. Have a drink, solve a room...eat a taco and have another drink...try another room, etc. etc. etc. Best of all, on Humana night, you can keep trying until you solve! Also, as always the actors are phenomenal! My boyfriend and I beat all the mini-rooms, so in addition to winning little trinkets, you get 20% off your next booking, which has to be purchased on the spot...and we did! I think we'll go for the Elevator Shaft next!You ROCK The Basement, and best of all you're only 7 minutes from my house!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Great for our party of 6! So much more than I expected! We did the Attic themed room! They did a really good job on the puzzles, clues, and tricky locks! We loved it!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: We did The Attic. It was great! The best time I've had in a while!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Finally got to do a room out here! We did The Attic. Fantastic room. We escaped (probably with a little help :) ) but we did escape. The detail was amazing and puzzles were very fun. If you haven't done The Attic yet, you need to before it gets replaced with something else!

room_title: Escape room "Old West Heist" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: We did this to celebrate my son's 30th birthday and had so much fun. The only comment I have is that it was a little confusing to find because it is in a commercial building and we weren't sure which one. Once we found the place, though, the staff was very good.

room_title: Escape room "Old West Heist" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: The gamemaster was great!!!! She did an outstanding job. The room was set up nicely. Wasn't too hard, but wasn't overly complicated. You must go to this room.

room_title: Escape room "Old West Heist" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: all of the rooms have been great!

room_title: Escape room "1889 Butch Cassidy's Bank Robbery" by Mystery Quests in Colorado Springs
review: We have done a lot of these room escapes and the effort and thought that were put into the room is top notch. We drove a hour to do this room and I can say it was well worth the drive. We will be driving back to do the rest of there rooms.

room_title: Escape room "1889 Butch Cassidy's Bank Robbery" by Mystery Quests in Colorado Springs
review: It was fun to go as a group and work through the challenges. They were friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go again and crack the code! :)

room_title: Escape room "Santa’s Workshop" by Element of Escape in Sarasota
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Submarine Survival" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Holy cow! This was the most fun I have ever had! We tested the new Submarine escape and you could tell that a lot of blood, sweat, and tears was put into this game. I didn't think I'd be as excited when we beat it, but I was thrilled! Thanks Breakout Birmingham, we loved it!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: We were held hostage after a plane crash. Alexis was such a sweet guide. She blindfolded and handcuffed us, and helped anytime we asked. Lol. She was all smiles. Great time!!! I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: A group of 6 of us did the Hostage room, it was a lot of fun and challenging but we escaped! The staff were friendly, I'd like to go back and try another room!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Did my first game with 6 buddies and it was a blast! We did the hostage room and barely finished in 56 minutes. The young lady at the counter was super nice and helpful and our game master was super helpful without ruining the experience by giving too much info! We’ll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Absolutely loved our experience!! We broke out of Operation: Casino and Hostage. Our two game masters, Alexa and Kristin, were wonderful! They added to our experience and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: My mom, my sister and I went for our first time over Christmas break. We had a blast! We broke out of the Hostage game. It was one of the more difficult ones, but we had so much fun working together to try to escape. I would recommend going to Breakout for any event!

room_title: Escape room "White House Down" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: Our group had a phenomenal time escaping White House Down. We can’t wait to try another room. Thanks guys!

room_title: Escape room "White House Down" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: My boyfriend and I came here for date night and it was awesome! We both had so much fun and can proudly say we escaped White House Down! My boyfriend is ready to go back to do another. The staff was very friendly and provided excellent customer service.

room_title: Escape room "White House Down" by Race to Escape in Tampa
review: It was our first time doing an escape room and we had a blast, we weren't very good at it and needed quite a few clues but it was a great time! The staff was awesome, very enthusiastic and helpful, they are a really great group of people! We did the White House down room, and we plan on coming back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "1920’s Speakeasy Murder Mystery" by Escape USA in Atlanta
review: My daughter Shae and I just attempted the 1920s Murder Mystery and although we didn’t solve the case, we had an absolute blast! What great way to spend quality time with your teenager! The staff was very warm and welcoming. We will definitely be back next month for her birthday.

room_title: Escape room "1920’s Speakeasy Murder Mystery" by Escape USA in Atlanta
review: This was our third time doing an escape game but first time at Escape USA. We did the 1920's room. So much fun! The person at the desk when we came in was great and very helpful! We will for sure be back and hopefully will escape next time! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "1920’s Speakeasy Murder Mystery" by Escape USA in Atlanta
review: This was our first escape room and we did the Speakeasy. We failed to solve the murder but had a blast trying. We were skeptical but now we are sold and will be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Pink Panther" by Mystic Escape Room in Denver
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Disco Fever!" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This is an AWESOME way to spend an evening!  Played the time travel room first and had so much fun with Braden as our game master that we came back the next night to play the boogie room!  This as with any escape room, some things in the room didn't always work as planned and Braden did such a good job making sure it didn't trip us up.  Plus, when we got stuck and asked for one of our 3 "free" clues, he was great at giving us just the right push to get past what was blocking us.  Disco was super challenging, with clues that weren't logical to find, we definitely needed all 3 freebies plus our extra 10 minutes & clues.  But loved the multi-room adventure!

room_title: Escape room "Curse of the Golden Touch" by Codeword Escape in Hartford
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Pearled Pachyderm" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: Such a fun activity with family and friends! Normally I'm not a lover of trying to figure out puzzles, but the Pearled Pachyderm was a great time with my kids. Would HIGHLY recommend to anyone. Can't wait to go again.

room_title: Escape room "The Pearled Pachyderm" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: I have been to 3 escape the room-type establishments, and while the other 2 have been good, this one is leagues above the rest. My partner and I did The Pearled Pachyderm. It was just the two of us. The room was set up in such a way that flowed and felt like it made sense, rather than just collecting random letters, numbers and keys. The story, while minimal, made all the puzzle solving feel a little cooler. I liked the hint system as well. We only used one but they gave us a perfect hint that didn't tell us too much but got us out of our mental block. I can't wait to come back and do another!

room_title: Escape room "The Pearled Pachyderm" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: This was amazingly fun! I went with a group of 8 friends and we conquered the Pearled Pachyderm with 11 minutes to spare! I'm happy to say that it was challenging mentally even with 8 adults working on the clues together. If you like problem-solving then this is definitely a must try. Can't wait to go back and do the second room!

room_title: Escape room "The Pearled Pachyderm" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: Amazing experience. Loads of fun.The pearled pachyderm is what we solved and it was really well written.Thanks for a fun afternoon!

room_title: Escape room "The Pearled Pachyderm" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: I love escape rooms. We did the pearled pachyderm. It was fun. We had 5 people and managed to solve it with one or two hints.

room_title: Escape room "The Dark Wizard’s Curse" by Escape from Mystery Manor in Boise
review: The wizards curse room is awesome, I loved the themed room. it was very well done.

room_title: Escape room "The Dark Wizard’s Curse" by Escape from Mystery Manor in Boise
review: This is a new venue for Meridian, Idaho and it's a keeper. A group of 6 women who felt we were pretty smart and capable solved several problems but failed at the given task of escaping. This was a first attempt by 5 of us, the 6th had done one in another state. We had an absolute ball learning we know less than we dreamed. It's a great escape for a group to play, interact and try to figure things out. Make this one of your events when you are in the area. It's time well spent.

room_title: Escape room "The Dark Wizard’s Curse" by Escape from Mystery Manor in Boise
review: I played The Dark Wizard's Curse with a group of 5. Four of us were veterans, having played over 100 different rooms. The hosts were very nice, seemed to really appreciate escape rooms, and were pleasant to talk with. Owners are newer to the business, maybe haven't been to many top rooms, and that seems to have shown through slightly in the game design and puzzles. That doesn't take a lot away from my rating, since that is typical of a smaller market independent locations. We enjoyed ourselves throughout, we came into this expecting a certain experience and that was delivered. We will definitely be back for the other room, but that is mostly because it is the only room in the whole Treasure Valley we haven't yet tried.The rest of this review is mostly for other veterans, since 95% of reviews tend to not be truly helpful when needing to choose between multiple escape room options:The set clearly took a lot of work, and gives a grand first impression, but I question if that effort was placed in the right areas. I'd have liked for the themed decor to be more purposeful and integrated into the puzzles more than it was, the result was just more red herrings. Puzzles were not as intuitive or satisfying as I would hope (more than once did we say a variation of the following: "I guess try this answer...oh, that worked!?"); and the ending was slightly anti-climactic. I'd put The Dark Wizard's Curse at about the 40th percentile for the rooms in Treasure Valley.

room_title: Escape room "Le Feu" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: We have been 2 times now to the Escapery and each time has been a delight. Full of challenging clues and twists. Would 100% recommend going if you haven’t visited. Our group is planning another outing there very soon!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Le Feu" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: My family of five and a friend went for my husband's birthday and it was the first room for all of us but one. We had a great time and really enjoyed the interesting puzzles. We had a little help when we needed it and we were able to escape in time. I would definitely recommend the Escapery!

room_title: Escape room "Le Feu" by The Escapery in Atlanta
review: Really fun, employees have a ton of energy and puzzles are very unique and challenging

room_title: Escape room "The Show Must Go On" by Clues and Gumshoes in San Francisco
review: Awesome place! My husband and I started with The Show Must Go On; it seriously felt like we had just walked backstage in an actual theatre when we entered the room (and I'm a stage manager IRL). It was a blast! The four rooms' storylines are all interconnected, which is a fantastic element; we're definitely looking forward to going back and doing the rest! Plus the owner, Brian, is SUPER nice.

room_title: Escape room "Nosferatu" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: Out of all the games at Escape the Netherworld this on was the most challenging. Without giving away too much I just say that there are many layers to this game. Also, it's vampire themed!!!

room_title: Escape room "Nosferatu" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: My friends and I were in the Nosferatu room. It was complicated, but interesting. And we definetly want to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Nosferatu" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: Just got done doing the Nosferatu room. It’s was so much fun. My group had a blast. Can’t wait to come back and try the other rooms! Thanks Netherworld!

room_title: Escape room "Nosferatu" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: Absolutely amazing! My fiancé and I did the Nosferatu room last night and we had a blast. We can't wait to do the other two rooms. Trust me you won't be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "Nosferatu" by Escape The Netherworld in Atlanta
review: Our group of 6 had a great time! The room we were in (Nosferatu) was beautifully decorated, very dark and mysterious! It was more difficult than other escape rooms we've done in Atlanta and visually superior to them as well. We're already planning to go back and do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped!" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: We didn't escape Kidnapped!, but the experience was a lot of fun. Looking forward to our next visit.

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped!" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: I can't wait to do it again! It was fun, exciting, a tiny bit scary (Kidnapped), and definitely great family time!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped!" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: The Kidnapping room was so much fun! Such a fun challenge and the staff is the best!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped!" by Colorado Escape in Denver
review: Amazing, a fun challenge for friends and family. We had a blast solving clues and finding keys to escape the kidnapper. Very well thought out scenario kudos to the creators. Can't wait to go back and try again.

room_title: Escape room "Murder Express" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: We did the Murder Express last night and had a great time. Hannah was wonderful to work with. We managed to escape with just the four of us. We will return.

room_title: Escape room "Murder Express" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: Had a great experience here! 5 of us did the Murder Express room and did not escape. The room was well-designed and decorated and the puzzles were pretty challenging! Our game master Chandler was great and we loved that the clues came through on the video screen. We will definitely be back to try more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Express" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
review: Great time escaping Murder Express room. Our family of 4 had a great time at Project Escape. It was very fun and challenging. I would highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Murder Express" by Project: Escape in Atlanta
